LQl9u5PmEDu6VdMFUvBh5w.text: First, I want to give a big thanks to Vegas Yelpers for recommending Capo's.  Good Italian is hard to come by in San Diego, so when I took my first vacation in over 3 years with the wife, and without the kids, I bolted to Capo's like a fat man to the Paris buffett, and I wasn't disappointed.  The Host was warm and funny.  The server, I believe his name is Chad, was both friendly and patient.  The calamari appetizer and the Cesar salad were my favorite, and the eggplant canolli was probably the best I ever had.  With all that said, the best part of Capo's is the ambiance, I felt like I was eating in Capone's dining room.  Tip:  The mix drinks costs less than a glass of wine, in my opinion this was the better way to go.  I ordered the "Watermelon" martini drink, and it was both refreshing and potent.

aifzR4oyJ3QQ5ZHwv7SC2w.text: I love this place. The first time I came here, it was with my mom and I immediately thought this would be perfect for a date.  This place is so cool. You walk into the main entrance and you are in a room that looks like you got to be apart of an exclusive club to get anywhere else but where you came in. Ring the bell and a slide bursts open and a man asks you what you want and then they'll open the wall from the other side. BADASS.   This place is mafia style which is neat because I know of nowhere else to feel this way. They have pretty good Italian food not 5 stars but the atmosphere makes up for it. They have a singer who does Frank Sinatra all night and overall I have left satisfied every time.   I recommend this to everyone who likes to eat Italian because this is one place you can not refuse to visit.

expH-YP9TlMVgPwSirbq9g.text: Great theme. Very dark and romantic. Unfortunately, the food wasnt all that good. The Caprese appetizer was amazing. The rissotto had no flavor. The veal marsala substandard. The veal didnt taste like veal. The chicken angelo was fair at best. I like garlic but the salad dressing was all garlic. Sadly dissappointed to pay 75.00 for this meal

y6OYGo8QiAfJJgqlRPKGEA.text: A real Las Vegas treat is a visit to Capo's, this is one place you may have passed a thousand times before noticing, and even though you may have you weren't sure. This is my testimony to Capo's great tastes.   I've been a handful of times, each dish is very special, perfectly cooked and flavors brought out perfectly.   Their marinara sauce is to die for. :)

IxzLFHrVVZI94ZM2IfA69Q.text: My wife and I went there for our anniversary because we had heard it was a unique mob-themed Italian restaurant. When you first walk in, you're in a small room where you need to ring a buzzer to get in. A host opens a opens a small hatch to see who you are, then opens a hidden door behind the pay phone to let you in. We thought this was pretty neat because it gave it a real speakeasy feel to it.   You walk through the hidden door and you'r in the restaurant. The lights are kept very dim, which adds to the mystic of the place. After allowing our eyes to adjust, you'll see old mob photos on the wall and the chefs cooking in the open kitchen next to the bar.   The level of cheese elevated to a whole new level when we saw the music was coming from a gentleman singing from his karaoke set up. I can't make this up. He appeared to be a regular "attraction" because all the staff knew him. At one point his CD started skipping while he was singing "Quando, Quando, Quando". I told my wife he must be singing the remix version! He started the song over. I can only assume because he didn't want his artistic integrity compromised. This amused me on so many levels... who hires a karaoke singer as their entertainment? And more importantly... who uses CD's anymore???  Once we were seated at our table, the staff seemed very responsive and courteous. They did a good job of keeping our glasses full of water and clearing plates as we emptied them. The quality of food left a lot to be desired. The marinara sauce on my wife's pasta was cold, the picatta sauce was just so-so. The real laugher came with the side of risotto. Rather than taking the time needed to properly make it using arborio rice and slow cooking it, they steamed long-grain white rice, added some cheese and mushrooms, and called it "risotto".   If you're looking for good Italian food, I'd rate this place somewhere below Sbarro's. If you're looking for a novelty restaurant with a so-so mob theme, then this is the place for you! Otherwise, save yourself the drive.

JHjqNlREwU5m4g1bu8Ii0w.text: Same food and concept as the location on Sahara but I like the vibe of this location better - the booths feel more private.  Good food - plenty to share but there is a split plate fee.

xh2funmtXIKsLXcaSBV-wA.text: Dark, Moody, and the mob! Fun place. Old Vegas. Piano player rocks. Food good. Great service. I would go every night if I could. Hint - there is no password to get in.  :-)

K4yoZs4lT4TRuIPHOviocQ.text: Its setup like a speakeasy. That's a cool gimmick. I have to say, the food was pretty terrible. The tomato sauce is the oddest tasting tomato sauce I have ever had. The sangria was good.  I'll never go again.

knXfSWO5FxNeFkjv3HOaow.text: Excellent dining experience. Okay Italian food.  I researched the restaurant way too much and was prepared for the front door scare....so I brought my sister with me who's completely unaware of who awaited her at the doorway. She was so startled by the "greeter," and he felt terrible that my sister had such a strong reaction. My sister got a kick out of it though after she said her heart stopped racing.   I was really hoping to be serenaded as some previous reviewers mentioned, but no tableside singing on a Tuesday night (maybe?). Oh well, it was still great! Our waiter had a fake Italian accent. The Godfather II was playing on the TV. Crime scene tape was on the floor. I loved the place!   Unfortunately the food was no different from that of Applebee's quality. How disappointing.

B8wQ8f589uX9_bq_tILAlA.text: Very bad service, waitress and busboy never around - and it's a very small place.  Wanted to charge us extra for more bread while waiting forever for our salads. Took over 45 mins to get our food (on a Tuesday night). Food was very ver average (even Olive Garden is better) and way over priced for what you get.  Nothing like bad service and average food to make you never go there again.  Try Brio instead (great food and service) for less.

L7Vxnn3m5FKNDE5zgkYnmw.text: I actually havent been to this Capos but the other one on Tropicana is the same business just different location. I think the concept is wonderful. It has  a old school hide out feel from when you just walk up to the entrance. The food has always been good here and if you catch it on a nice weekend night usually they have Bobby singing old dean martin, frank Sinatra songs. Hes very good. Definitely check out the one on Tropicana.

Ogs0eOEr2e1Km9hHW_7qWA.text: Not only is this an awesome theme restaurant, it's also one of the Best Italian food in the Country. The entire atmosphere is a great place to take friends or even on a romantic date. The singer who does Frank Sinatra is FANTASTIC!!!!!  Order the Meatballs to start and you will be hooked. The bread, Butter, Pasta, Drinks, I could go on and on. You should be privileged to even get to eat at Capo's. This is a Legit Wise guy place. If your stuffy or have a stick up your ass or drink your wine with your pinkie finger out, or  you don't like the Italian attitude stay home or go to Wolfgang pucks. hahahaha

lbG8c0IIhXGEGACf1iqsEA.text: One of our favorite all-time Italian restaurants bar none. This mafia-chic speakeasy has it all baby; good food, quality service and even a lounge singer who's actually really good. I'm a fan of the piccata, parm and scampi. Hell even the bread is good, perfect for any sauce that happens to still be on your plate. And for the guys, Capo's is a great place to bring a date. No matter what your reason for going is, this restaurant provides a memorable and unique experience you won't forget.

89RbVScUUYK9NLRCjmsMFA.text: after seeing this place on mystery diners, i think the owner is a terrible business man. family or not, your brother should have been fired, he is terrible for the business, i am suprised you have not been sued for sexual harassment yet, or that you brother has not been severely beaten by a patron. next time i am in vegas i will avoid this place.

LtztoDwFxdY-T56hHiqXHA.text: Food was really good. Prices were a bit high. It was dark inside; hard to read the menu. Things were going great until the bill came. They wanted to take my Dad's ID with them to swipe the credit card. We disputed this strange policy because of identify theft dangers. The manager gave us a hard time, but really do they NEED to take the ID and the CC? It felt a little shady; I have never had this happen before while dining out. It took a little arguing but the management conceded. They should change this policy, it rubs customers the wrong way. Not sure if I would go back.

lTVSZIB5-8nbMmlr-bmR2g.text: I visited the Tropicana location w/ my family and about 2 yrs ago. I remember not being too impressed, but did like the atmosphere.   Fastforward to tonight... my birthday... I can choose ANYWHERE! However, you know how it is. For us locals, I know every single place there is. I was feeling like Italian and didn't want to hit the strip. I've been to Maggiano's and Amore's a billion times already. So I picked Capo's to get a bit of "atmosphere".  First, it seems that the Sahara location is a little smaller and MAYBE not as dark. Its also a little more open. Second, the place was basically empty at 9pm on a Friday night... kinda sad really.   All that said, my wife had the 'ala vodka' and I had the lasagna (cuz I'm crazy like that!). The food was very good; better than I remember. The service was excellent (it better be for it being so empty). The downside and a BIG reason why this isn't 5-stars... THE PRICES! Is a standard spaghetti or angel hair pasta w/ marinara sauce really worth $20? My lasagna was good, but not $18 good.   All in all, good service, good food, good atmosphere, not so good prices.  (P.S. if you like a similar 'old vegas italian' atmosphere that isn't so forced, check out "Casa di Amore" on the east side)

MiWOJvu2KvpOHZnYpAIXjQ.text: Great food! Fun atmosphere. Wish the waiters stuck with the theme.... The waiters were nice and helpful but I kinda wanted them to give us some Italian mafia attitude.

s5G1N6trqRpWtZ7OOd_Pvg.text: Capo's on Sahara is delish! The pastas are yummy and service was great. The meat is cooked to perfection and seasoned very well. The ambiance is perfect for friends or a date.

bzVud_ae1JGRNvWvOPh-uw.text: I really enjoy the mob inspired menu descriptions and of course the back door where they let you in. It's a fun place to go once for the novelty of it. The food is ok and so is the service. A little price forthw quality of the food but fun when they play the old movies in the background and have the great singer in the tuxedo walking around. Good place to go on a date if you are looking for a different kind of experience :-)

pnHFdshdSRPJ_djV59lmmw.text: Make reservations!!! The atmosphere was dark and completely themed as a speak easy. The food is American Italian and everything was delicious. I got a salad and they used way too much dressing.  I had to send back and ask for dressing on the side. The server was so nice and knew exactly when to come over to the table. The "pink sauce" (as they call it) was great with the meal and we even dipped the bread in it. Tried the cheesecake dessert and its not exactly what I'm used to but was also good. Reason not a 5 star: the restaurant opens at 5 and the piano player, which I think it a huge part of the atmosphere, didn't start playing until after 6. The food was a little over priced. Once you are seated the theme gets forgotten. No one is in character or there's not much going on besides a muted movie with the closed caption and the late piano player which we didn't get to enjoy much of.

xiNtt6iQHNHfwZQ1h13bHw.text: Atmosphere was awesome. Came in with no reservation and was told to wait about 10 mins, By the hostess, for a table. Fast forward two sangrias and one martini (which were reallly good... first day for the bartender--) and an hour +, we had to flag down a worker to see if tables were available.... which they clearly were. We came in around 815-820 ish, restaurant closes at 10, and were seated at 952. Trying to be patient, we were hurried to order before 10. By 958 we were walking out as the waiter noted that what we wanted to eat was not available. Total waste of time. Horrible service!!! The hostess was horrible. We communicated more than once about us being seated and was left at the bar. We overheard him with speaking with another worker regarding personal stuff. I wish he had put more effort in seating us than talking about getting more hours of work .

oa42YQmMy8eVsVd5_1_QwQ.text: All time ranking - 5 This trip - 3  Usually, Capo's on our "must-eat" list of places when we come to Vegas. I have taken so many friends here and we always have a great time. Not this time. Our server was so absent that it made the experience terrible. She claimed to work there for 18 years, but she looked like she was so overwhelmed with our party of 6. She never came to ask us if we wanted more drinks, or any more water. We asked her for a couple of things (oil and vinegar, silverware) and she never returned. We wound up asking one of the nice guys that was refilling water. We brought a new couple and another couple that had visited in the past, so we explained that it wasn't always like this. We will be back, but this experience really missed the mark :(

MRZqwbMvc7Nq2NWIhJ21Sw.text: Awesome authentic Italian restaurant. One of the best spots for pasta I have been to in Vegas. Fun for locals or for tourists. Portions were absolutely perfect for dinner as well as taking some home for later. Chicken Parm knocked it out of the park. Highly recommend.

BJ4oXCaAyeWavuRa3N8_Hg.text: This restaurant ROCKS!!!  Celebrated my NY Italian dad's 80th birthday yesterday and this incredible Speakeasy and let me tell you - they did not disappoint. From drinks to appetizers to entrees to dessert.....there was not one item our table of 8 had that no one loved!!  The lasagna is incredible - I highly recommend. The meatballs, can't say enough about them. The creme brulee - best I've ever tasted.   The ambiance, the secret door and password you need to enter, the entertainment, and the personal attention is just another reason to visit!!  Don't miss this hidden gem off the Strip!!!

iOj7FqT5U_puivB3WwXAqQ.text: This is a wonderful place.  It's got a great italian old world ambiance. Plus the drinks and service are great.  They always check up on you.  The food has never disappointed me, i would recommend anyone including gordon ramsay to try it and i bet even he won't leave unhappy.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamy carbonara with shrimp was outstanding.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad

NJdfpIcAYs0-4wKqYROy8w.text: Seriously the BEST Italian food I've ever had. I'm a foodie and cannot believe what a treasure this place is!!!! It's a must visit, and I will make sure to come back every Vegas trip!!! Chicken Marsala was excellent, but my kids spaghetti with meatball and fettuccini was a must have!

D-pE0MEtjqWQRhZkQx5Fkw.text: Came here for Father's Day lunch. I really liked the secret entrance door and Italian Mafia themed decor inside. It's fun! I liked the live music here. The singer guy was funny and entertaining. I ordered shrimp scampi and seafood pasta. The shrimp scampi tasted bland and oily. The shrimp in my seafood pasta was very very tough. The only thing I liked about their food was creamy garlic dressing on the salad. I was disappointed with the food but I enjoyed everything else.  Check in and get $10 off of your bill over $75!! Fun place to have a drink or two!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chef sleeps with fishes
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The gallows with clams
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad

HeE79GOdk1IZ9dI1nW0cFA.text: What an experience!! I've always been curious about this place. I am delighted I got to try out Capos. If you are looking for no "frills" authentic Italian food that tastes fresh and homemade, then this is your place!   The Food: I highly recommend the meatball. One of their signature dishes. 3 types of meat rolled up sitting in a hearty tomato sauce. The stuffed mushrooms topped with mozzarella cheese is simply delish!! The gooey cheese stretches just like a freshly baked cheese pizza when being served. Calamari is crisp with a nice golden brown hue. They are not too oily or greasy tasting at all. Even the complimentary Italian style bread served is fantastic!!   The Ambiance: Dark but lively place with a mafia memorabilia decor in good taste. Live music daily with a piano bar and Sinatra tunes sung with True heart! If you are lucky, you might get to hear the manager belt out a few tunes on the piano. Very talented player!!   The bar hosts daily regulars who are staples of the establishment since the early days of Capo's existence. They are warm, friendly and are from the era that will buy a lady a drink out of pure etiquette. :)  Excellent service, great drinks (try the red wine Sangria) and even the coffee is darn good because they use Lavazza. I will definitely come back!! Grazie Capo's molto buona!!

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavazza Italian Coffee Served

fU_Gm9aHy30fnUvDJr8vLg.text: Best recommendation! Lunch specials with dinner size servings!! Atmosphere, service, house salad, and THE BREAD BASKET ! Oh the bread basket  pastas were savoring to the very last bite but stop and be certain to leave room for dessert

t9JvFUkEv5iidNh7aCtSJA.text: 3 of our party of 6 got sick (no alcohol involved).  We loved the atmosphere and the service but I think they got some bad shrimp.  Really bummed about the experience.

3I7bmUoy7qSK8AsH41lofA.text: Such a nice place and friendly service for an underground illegal operation, it's genius they use the restraunt as a front for a speakeasy and what's even better is the food is delicious. Meatballs, sauces, and drinks as stiff as a corpse who could ask for more?

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meatballs didn&#39;t last long enough to get the photo. Pick up two orders so they last long enough for a good snap for yelp. One word sauce

8invTSYhtbSkDi2cNsSZcA.text: The atmosphere was very cool but the food not so much very pricey and not disgusting but not delicious at all ... but the magician that came to our table was amazingggggg

wBekALCnL_CAlUHsivznOQ.text: Came here for lunch and ordered the 4 items in the picture - the spaghetti with Italian sausage was excellent, so was the Caesar salad and the bread.  The Italian beef sandwich was good but the au jus dip was very salty.  The flavor for the carbonara was good but as other people have commented, just too runny and soupy for my tastes.  Service was excellent - attentive, courteous and responsive.  Loved the atmosphere and the music playing throughout the meal, from Sinatra to Frankie Vallie.  Overall a great choice and we will be coming back - maybe for dinner and definitely not with the kids.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Mwa31afNjHNGPB_K0IWL6g.text: Had a Travel Zoo deal for lunch, and we wanted to check them out. Nothing fancy, but when you enter the place, If you are like me, you will be thrown for a loop. (I won't say more on this, except it's pretty cool). It's set up like the mob-days of Vegas, and it's really dark inside. Red walls, dark lighting, Sinatra playing over the speakers, mob movies on the TV, and it's just like walking backwards in time.   Hubs had the meatball sandwich, which he enjoyed. The sauce was really good too. I had the carbonara, which blew me away! I really enjoyed it with chunks of prosciutto in the sauce. Oh, heaven!   If you are in Vegas, this is one place that will take you back to old Vegas, and It's really yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is dark! Sinatra singing and secret entry. Pretty cool

pMNzTxYCRRtT-NYVB6ya9A.text: The best Italian food off the strip & possibly in Vegas! Such a cool awesome speakeasy vibe with an awesome fun entrance. The server Sara was very attentive & helpful with the menu. The four cheese ravioli was amazing along with the chicken Parm. Also a fan of the cheese garlic bread. Great restaurant for dates.

3CfgQRLMSK5wI72BItsxrA.text: Large Groups Beware!  Visited Capo's today for a work lunch, we were a group of 14. We arrived by 11:40 but our orders were not taken until just before noon. We had to ask to order. By 12:30 we noticed all tables (who had arrived after us) were getting their orders. We had to be back at work and started getting nervous that we were not receive our orders in time. My co-worker who had made the reservation the week prior, went to ask at 12:45 where our orders were. The server was not apologetic and rudely replied 'it's a big Table'. Completely unacceptable. We are a large company who frequents this restaurant regularly, and large groups are not uncommon. This is me eating at my desk.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i6ikdrmFOEiVwmdW4yx7xA.text: Capo's is a swingin' place for cool cats.  This is not your ordinary dining establishment, because it's a speakeasy.  I've lived in Las Vegas for over 25 years and my only regret is not finding this place sooner.    Our server and busser were very gracious hosts.  They were prompt, courteous and genuinely helpful.    The spaghetti and meatballs (vegetarian meatballs are available too) were  Scrumdiddlyumptious.  Their chicken Parmesan and Italian beef sandwiches are not to be missed.  My favorite are their chocolate dipped cannolis.

jZgoLy4dOUq_Ms4jmmXM0w.text: I am so sad. This place isn't anything like it used to be. The food tasted so cheap. And the man scream singing in my ear gave me a horrific headache by the time my meal was finished. Over priced food. We will not be back. Now it all makes sense. All the friends we send there lately don't have much to say about it.

BctUgvShpxh2X_RfhoKjNQ.text: Great food, cool atmosphere. My husband and I definitely plan to be back to try out more of the food options. The calamari was spectacular!

lYiWX_mrNYi2UQDZ-lfePQ.text: I came here because I had read reviews that this was a nice quiet place to relax and enjoy the scenery and mob shtick. The shtick part was True. Insanely packed, which I understand the restaurant definitely likes,and I definitely hate. Place was so crowded and loud you couldn't have anything resembling a good conversation. The place was kept so dark the waiter literally tells you not to trip over people walking you to your table, and I was appalled at the 'entertainment' consisting of some mook butchering Sinatra's songs. I was ashamed bringing someone here who thought this was a real Italian joint. I'll never live it down, nor will I return. I will say though that the staff were very friendly, and the food was decent, though saying this is authentic Italian food is like calling Panda Express authentic Chinese cuisine. It's an insult to the food. The total crapshoot of an atmosphere sunk the evening. Not fun, not a good memory, just a cringe-worthy regret.

U87sSVZyx5cmK7qB-SOOew.text: This is a fun place to come to. Doesn't look like much outside & when you go in the door you wonder if you maybe the right choice. You ring the doorbell, then someone opens a small window and asked if we were here for lunch. Then they open the telephone booth for the door.   The house salad with the garlic dressing was delish! Had the Capone Carbonara with shrimp. Oh my this tantalized my taste buds for sure.   Definitely want to come back for dinner the next time we're in town. Frank Sinatra frequent this place & I can see why.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is a dim lit, romantic ambiance.

jrY7MMzaLDEd37duZoaNXg.text: This is the best Italian food Ever!!! I visited while on a weekend getaway with my hubby. Service was great! The piano singer is amazing!! This is a must go place if you're in Vegas. Must try the scar face shrimp scampi and sleep with the fishes!! You will love it I guarantee it!!!

Y5EYXCwZo3fH7LRUaFuZww.text: Went here for my husbands b/day dinner on 9/19/17 based on all the 5 star reviews. It's in a little plaza tucked away off the strip .  You walk in and ring the bell, the owner lets you in and then you are met with the most delicious smells ever!!  Our food was wonderful tasting, service was great and the place was packed! (we had 6/30 reservations and by 7 you could barely move, remember, this was a Tuesday night).  Prices were reasonable, not cheap but you got a lot of food for the dollar.  The mushroom appetizer was wonderful as well.  Lots to choose from.  There was a male "Sinatra" like singer which just added to the mood of the place.  It's very dark in there though.  Even with the $28. Uber ride from Treasure Island, it still was a reasonable night. (Think $100. for 2, 1 drink each, appetizer, entree.)   Loved the place and would go back again if ever back in Vegas.

2J4vaHo2r0D9zPoVBZ69Ew.text: We went here last night for dinner and the service was terrible .  Our waiter was edo Our food took forever from beginning to end.  Appetizer took 25 min for bruschetta ( don't have to cook it ) dinner took forever and as soon as the server delivered our food he said " well we have big parties right now so you understand why it took so long , well I'm heading out so I'm transferring your bill to another server " we were confused because that server stayed by the back door and was messing around not going anywhere . No one came to ask how the food was ( my Alfredo was watery ) no refills on drinks , and when I came time to pay we had to ask the busser , he had no idea who was taking care of us but was trying to get our check for us . Some one dropped it off and then our original server who didn't care to wait on us came back and said "oh yeah I didn't know you guys were leaving so fast so yeah I'll Be taking and running that back under my name . " I felt as if he didn't want to wait on us because he didn't think he was going to get tipped , I work in the industry , I will always tip but to treat us so poorly made me think twice about tipping him . Yes I left a 18% tip . But I sure wish the tip went to the busser who was the only one helping us out . He deserves the tip .  I will never be back again .

tyICom-Ypb6A-PPYoJtoXQ.text: My wife and I had a great dinner here last night. The food was amazing starting with the meatballs that are the size of baseballs with amazing flavor, my veal parm, my wife's carbonara it was all so good we both left so full. The service is great so friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball app.

uD09CvIIamn-kRwLapwKow.text: Took our 12-year-old son here but didn't tell him what to expect.  He was very surprised by the greeting and entrance.  Really a great environment, decorated so perfectly for the 1920's speakeasy theme.  Made me want to pull out my flapper dress for our next visit. The food was great - creamy garlic salad dressing was heavenly - good tomato-based soup - ravioli, pesto linguine, and alfredo pastas all excellent and the meatball was great!  Big portions - no room for dessert. Good entertainment- singer and magician both wonderful.  What a fun, entertaining and delicious dining experience.  Expect us back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DqZE5CNYOuBNQo-MtsJgEw.text: This place is awesome! The outside looks like a very ran down place and the inside is beautiful! The staff is excellent and so is the service! Our food was outstanding! Make sure you get a reservation ahead of time. Don't miss out on this one!

4YrgnfR0Jsjhsk79ra9H6A.text: Dark, comfy and delicious!  This is a fantastic place that is worthy of a trip off the strip. The portions are HUGE, the drinks perfect and the entertainment amazing. I really enjoyed the ambiance and depth with which this place operates.   Enjoy a table side magician, classic lounge singer or some snappy wait staff.   Make sure you budget time but not a pile of money because the value here is off the charts.

E0W72kekHffLhjv2AGNUwg.text: Meatballs were great !! STEAK WAS TERRIBLE .  Have eaten at some of the best steakhouses in the US . Wolfgang / Maestros / CUT / BOA / Peter Lugar's. For $80 I feel like the ribeye should taste better then DENNY's .. AND THEY STILL CHARGED ME !! Other then that food was nice atmosphere was fun .

xg43Pz3S2BHBaj_4ofUr5w.text: This place has phenomenal food to go with a great atmosphere and ambience. The entrance in back is quite unique and once you step inside it is like you are going back in time to the 1930's or 40's. The red booths, low lighting and lounge singer really adds to the atmosphere but what seals the deal is the outstanding food of which the portions are so large you will likely not finish it.  We had the Scarface Shrimp Scampi Pasta and this dish was so delicious I will make this my go-to again and again. The service was outstanding as well. For a different (in a positive way) and fun dining experience, this place is a must-try!

6QHFAeeOr_gJgdSvSuZ4BQ.text: Came here on a Thursday afternoon for lunch with my husband. We both ordered from the lunch menu which was fairly priced and came with huge portions. My carbonara pasta was amazing and his meatball sandwich was really good, everything tasted homemade.

LaSXETuy0RfyunkxgO8WHA.text: This place was "so Joel V." it was incredible! I'll go to CAPO'S every time from now on when I'm in Vegas. What not to like?? A mobster themed restaurant... Sign me up!  There is a little surprise waiting for you when you knock on the door, but I won't ruin any surprises...  The restaurant is dark with red leather big booths, with dark red velvet walls. They had a Sinatra styled singer performing, and we even had a magician stop by our tables and BLOW OUR MINDS!!  Seriously, one of the trippiest and straight-up scary performances I've ever seen. This dude was the son of satan.  Now on to the food... We started with a few appetizers. Ma's Meatballs, Calamari, and Bust a Cap Mushroom Caps. All were great, but the very spicy meatballs were my favorite. The warm breadsticks served with garlic butter were bomb as well. I ordered the Chicken Parm with Spaghetti con Suga and a creamy garlic salad. The salad was so tasty! The spaghetti fantastic! And the chicken parm so on point, it was perfection! The salad was one of my favorite salads I've ever had, and the chicken parm was possibly my favorite ever.  Now, onto the dessert... The chocolate covered cannoli was the best cannoli I've ever had. This place was a clean sweep! Awesome ambiance, cool theme and schtick, good entertainment, and fantastic food.  5 stars and a must stop for me next time I'm in Sin City. Highest possible recommendation.

Q0uC87YXYxGGD6bp12p1fg.text: From the moment we walked in till the moment we left service was amazing, not to mention the food was amazing we will be coming back realy soon.

rZ9IYVmSGo7pi9GVVqh0XA.text: The service was horrible, our waitress didn't seem to care about us. She ignored us on multiple occasions. Took my food while I was in the restroom even after my wife told her not to. She would walk past our table as someone in our party was calling her. She disappeared on us for like 30 minutes. Then when it came time to cash out she added charges of about $49 additional to our party. She was given multiple cards and told to charge $40.70 to each, but she charged $47 to each card. We were already charged gratuity on our bill so our horrible waitress just doubled her tip. That she didn't deserve

vMEde1sOp4SxFrZnaT1OSA.text: This is a must if your in Vegas. First the food is spot on Italian and probably the best I have ever had. The music was great. And the best of all was the magic of V. He performs right at your table and was fantastic. Make sure you stop at this place but before you do make sure you know the password

BAa5SdaRudpsmWEHvNObgQ.text: I soooo want to give five stars because I loved this place.  This recent visit was disappointing.  The restaurant needs a good cleaning.  Menus were sticky and chandeliers need to be cleaned.  They are right over the booths so you look right at it.  So first impression.  Waiter was nice.  Took an hour to get our food once ordered!   Then when we did get it, side mashed potatoes were ice cold.  But they quickly replaced with piping hot ones once brought to their attention.  Lettuce was wilted in salad.  Ordered chicken franchese and it was a very small portion.  They asked me what kind of pasta I wanted with it and I ordered angel hair.  So pasta came on the side but with red sauce on it! The meals has this fabulous lemon butter white wine sauce that is so yummy, but why put red sauce on the pasta instead of that yummy lemon butter sauce?!  Cannolis were awesome.  I have been coming here for a while.  Love the old school feel.  Unfortunately I brought people with me that had never been here before on my recommendation and was disappointed.  If the owner is reading this, PLEASE give the restaurant a thorough cleaning and bring back the bigger portions. After spending $150, I didn't want to be hungry an hour later.

MYP_N9ftEVZThC2tVS5VPQ.text: Capos came from a recommendation of my friend, she raved about how delicious this place is and about the dining experience.  Reservations were made and I was super excited to try it based on my fellow yelpers reviews. I definitely liked the " mobster" type of scene inside, the pictures and ambiance drew me in even more. For an appetizer  we shared the Peppers and meatballs - it was delicious.  To drink I had a sangria, which was both refreshing and tasty. So the set up was great, I was ready to indulge in my entree. I ordered the chicken parmesan. It was humongous, very generous sized serving but it lacked flavor and the chicken itself was super dry. I couldn't even finish half of it. I'm not opposed to coming back and trying something else on the menu because the sangria itself makes me eager to return.

hf7jMPWQk4C03XB2dIiYmA.text: Capo's Speakeasy is a fun place to take a group of friends! You have to ring the bell for access, but before they let you in they open the little window door and ask who you are....you know, like a Speakeasy....cute idea! Prerty dark inside (reason for the 4 not 5 stars). I like to see my food a little more. They have a Frank Sinatra type singer who makes the rounds to all the tables thru out the night. They also have a magician who was AWESOME!! Everyone really enjoyed their dinners!  The pasta is fresh made which is always a plus! I'm a picky vegitarian and my Linguini Ariabatti was excellent with just the right amount of spice. Angels with Dirty Faces (movie title) Angel Hair pasta w/peas,mushrooms, pepperoni w/a vodka type sauce. The chicken dish our friend had was also a winner!!! We'll definitely be returning to Capo's Speakeasy!

YMyngWK7e7vdYIySx4BDtw.text: Amaaaaaaaaaazing. Go go go. One of the best experiences I've ever had. Get off the stupid strip and go here. Wish I lived in the area, I'd probably work here or become a serious regular, LOVE this restaurant!!

u2SsZdVLDchr3PDu0RYQEg.text: Had reservation,went on double date w friends.door man/greeter whatever he might call himself was a complete douchebag!was on cellphone the whole time.we were told we couldn't be sat till whole party had arrive.then a group walk in behind us and was sat incomplete!!! Food was horrible,my entree was ice cold.two other entree were completely burnt.food is over priced.NO flavor,horrible service! only part that was okay, were drinks!and set up of restaurant (mob theme)!place is a joke!!!! don't bother nor waste your $

oSVTPWYyWrDtgo8anh4X1A.text: all i can say is wow what a place from the front door to the matrade it was a great night-- the food was five star and the service was ten star--everything was such a great flavor my husband who is very pickey with all food was so impressed with his special pasta dish he loves spicy and with chicken it was a pink sauce it rated a 10 plus---if anyone is looking for a great place to eat italian food try this place u will love it and make a reservation please---it helps

Uk73cEN277KEDOS32uSJlA.text: Nice speakeasy feel. Went for lunch. Be patient when ringing the bell to enter.  Enjoyed their lunch menu. Auntie G's antipasto sandwich was amazing! Great atmosphere!

q9UoU2yXr58YTcbNpAH8nQ.text: The place outside is just plan but  when u go in it's ok. You need to ring the door bell and someone says hey in a tiny little window and you enter from another wall.   Place is super dark, they have tiny flashlights on the menu. The bread they give you is hard with no flavor.  Ordered Caesar salad (Taste like raw garlic and butter or oil didn't like it) and Italian dressing salad (salad seems old not bright green or crisp to it).    Ordered the clam paste with white wine. The clams was soo over cooked it seem like I was chewing gum there. The paste was cover cooked. The sauce has a tiny bit of spicy which I didn't like. I didn't even finish 1/2 my plate. Took it to go. Hoping someone would eat it at home. nope ending up in the trash. Waste of $23.95    Also ordered the Sausage Spaghetti plus extra $5.00 for a huge meatball. The paste was over cooked again, the meatball was soft, the sauce didn't taste good had a sweet but nasty bitter flavor, and the sausage was just ok nothing special. Chef Boyardee Ravioli is soo much better. Could have bought a few dozen cans.  I would not go back there. I wouldn't even go there to begin with but my roommate gave me a gift card. So I went. Should have sold it. Next time going with my gut tells me and not my heart.

eQ7k62_GFhBQN-uMj5v76w.text: We had so much fun, the authentic Italian way! I love the "secret" entrance, music and ambiance of this place. I had the chicken picata, delicious! Would highly recommend for a fun night out with good food.

rcAinVCXoXbuJzxla2fdjA.text: Loved it. Been back 3 times in the past 2 weeks. I'm an old school Italian and appreciate fine dining and authentic food. This place is superb. Their service is on point as well as the atmosphere. Ziggy the door man is a riot. It's now my Tuesday dinner spot with my crew!

NysNquDFJweN7XVWM96g5w.text: Food was not good at all. Eggplant park tasted frozen. Only thing good about this place was the singer and the secret entrance.

510Bmaw3ykrqqic4MMYm3w.text: Outstanding food, location, ambiance and did I mention the meatballs? I'm still full from 4 days ago.

5FUGxeYoXCcTuOQqgQPDlw.text: WORST SERVICE EVER!!!!  When we went inside, before entering the actual restaurant, there was a room where you have to ring the door bell to enter the restaurant. It took them 5 mins to let us in; making us wait in the cold.   Once we get in and got table, it took the waitress 15 mins before noticing that we were here.   soooooo the service was a bad. Now the food....  We ordered, the scampi shrimp and the rib eye steak dinner. it was OK, nothing special. the rib eye steak  comes with the steak and mashed potato, and THAT'S ALL. I can go to walmart and make my own steak for like quarter of the price.   overall, im just pissed at the service!!!!

XHHXXJWO4X8edc35eFldmg.text: I had a great experience here at Christmas.  Very cozy, romantic atmosphere, delicious food, great service and the entertainer was wonderful.   Unfortunately not so great when I went back for Valentines Day.  Instead of being seated in the romantic main room with chandeliers, red booths and great service, we were seated in an annex room off to the side which not only felt like we were dining in a caboose, it was also right next to the kitchen!  Not romantic at all, service was terrible and food iffy.  The staff were completely overwhelmed and had obviously overbooked.   We just ordered appetizers in order to get out of that place as soon as possible.  That being said, I guess I learned my lesson about trying to dine out on Valentines day.  Will definitely go back on a regular day and hopefully will be able to come back and give 5 stars!

yQFK3_JzCxN42fuv5hw5gg.text: NOTE: We decided this place was out of our price range and left before we even tried any of the food.    We drove past this place five times in one day, so I decided we should stop here. There are few lights on, so you can't entirely tell if it is open or night, and it was a little confusing as to where the entrance, until I saw the giant "entrance" sign.   I agree with the other reviews about the fun speakeasy entrance.   We were walked to out booth, but I had to watch a few spots because it seems like the wood floor is starting to rot in spots. But you can't see it because the place is very dimly lit. There was music playing and a Sinatra-ish live singer. The music was on the loud side, but good.   We were given menus, and then realized that a simple spaghetti is $18. And if you want to share it, they want to charge you an additional $6. The spaghetti is basically the cheapest thing on the menu besides appetizers. We decided this place was out of our price range and left before we even tried any of the food.  I was a little bummed cause the atmosphere was fun, but that is just too much to pay for a little bit of pasta.

2H5TTDWj2oPjZRmFRZdRyQ.text: My husband and I and another couple went to Capo's while on a business / vacation trip. Arrived early no problem with reservations. Seated right away.                            Service excellent as well as our meals. A bit pricey but mainly due to alcoholic beverages .  When we left we asked if a cab could be called, within a few minutes a driver used by the  restaurant  arrived. Great service! Will definitely go back on our next visit to Vegas.

y_-zPgIKw-DBeYlxjUr1_w.text: This place is amaZing! The environment is really nice and live music really attractive. The only thing it should improve is the time to bring the food. It took them over 30 minutes to bring my food after my salad.  The mushroom risotto is perfect and the ceasers salad amazing. I would recommend this restaurant for everybody that wants to stay away from the strip. And locals on Tuesday get $20 discount in one plate, what is an amazing deal for a good food.

yBceNTz4tM_AuGHLoAlW5Q.text: I went to this place with some friends and we had a very good time.  The food is a little pricey for what you get in Vegas but the entertainment more than made up for it.  There was a table side magician and a Frank Sinatra type singer who was wonderful! We will definitely go again!

jSDuUO3EO-rB77QN-CYydA.text: This is a unique experience, highlighted by the mob themed schtick that starts literally as you enter the door. The food, is better than average and you get a lot of it! The meatball appetizer is terrific, and everyone was happy with their meals. Desert was also top notch with the cannoli. Here's the one rub, and it's annoying. Because we had 8 of us, the 18% tip is included. That's fair, but I have to say that our waitress was below par. Inattentive, and lacking instincts to determine some basic needs that we had were annoying, but literally having to have other servers find her for us was aggravating. She seemed to lack training and her work ethic was marginal. I still say come for the food and atmosphere, but beware that automatic tipping leads to unmotivated waitresses on occasion.

YKi4GJT6hDolRRDA6AbRAA.text: This place was a rip off...service was so bad, it's hot and stuffy inside, the food is not that great over priced. We had a  True gangster experience though,  we were robbed..

lH-qMInbnC5G8u9TuyaPBw.text: Won't be disappointed by the chicken parm!! So delicious! We had entertainment on a Saturday evening...an awesome crooner and table side magician. Fabulous service too!!

Z2winOtwUW9-j5E2v4QD7w.text: I'm from New York and I know good Italian food when I see it and this place is the best Italian restaurant I've ever been too. The place's atmosphere is very cool and the place brings an old mafia restaurant vibe to it. I normally don't give restaurants five stars but this restaurant was well deserved.

J43WZShFBDd0Bpjta4YRnQ.text: Excellent!  The food is fantastic.  At first, I had some doubts because it seemed a bit touristy but the food exceeded my expectations.    Great music, delicious food, open kitchen.  The only issue I had with this restaurant is that it is a bit dark.  Actually, it's very dark!

hRGEM6KNLGY3ogj488Qm7g.text: Capo's is a terrifically themed speakeasy. From the front door to Bobby singing Sinatra tunes, The atmosphere is all encompassing. The food is 5 star also. My eggplant parmesan was just right. Not oily and coated with tasty cheese toasted to perfection, Morello beer to wash it down. Enjoy a night out with some bootleg hooch and don't forget to hit the tip jar on the piano... or else some Goomba might pay you a visit.

PJEUpcCnPzvA4VLp-aan9Q.text: I have been here multiple times. I have been here for multiple occasions. I have always talked up Capo's Italian Cuisine (CIC), no doubt! As a matter of fact, I talked up CIC to at least 3 other people before my most recent visit this week (02/22). I mean...REALLY talked up! CIC has taken on an almost magical type of of existence to me. Why the 3 stars then? I'll get to that eventually. Let me first discuss why I "dug" this place...... Gangster...ole' school gangster. I don't want to give too much away. Mafioso themed...no doubt. Dark...very dark. That is lighting and ambience. Has nothing to do with the wait staff, and the food.....more on that in just a bit. Cool lyrical(s)....you might get some soothing sounds by some cool ass crooner singing a little Sinatra or a little Dino. I have found the volume to vary...but never over whelming. Magic?! Yup! Depending on the night/time you visit, your gonna get some of the best up close, in your face MAGIC...you have ever seen! The wait staff......Always friendly and during my most recent visit...defused the situation. Not the maitre d'....not the manager...more on that later. The food. Absolutely phenomenal! So much so that during lunch and during dinner...I leave the upper north end of the valley and go to parts I would rather not after work..or during high travel hours...or travel multiple miles period! I love the following.... Cheesy bread....Check. Nico's Caesar....Check. "Chicken Lucchese"....Chicken breast breaded topped with mozzarella, broccoli, mushroom, capers, lemon, butter, white wine & a touch of crushed red pepper / 24.95 (Retrieved from caposrestaurant.blogspot...)....Check. "Angels with Dirty Faces" Angel hair pasta with peas, mushrooms & pepperoni, tossed with Capo's pink sauce / 18.95 (Retrieved from caposrestaurant.blogspot...)....Check. And now......the negative....what has placed a seed of doubt in my head..perhaps...forever. The GF and I decided to spend a belated Valentine's Day dinner here on 02/22/18. After working, rushed home to make myself somewhat presentable. Changed out and got on the road and arrived 10 minutes before our "RESERVATIONS" at 7:30 PM. The atmo was that of pure chaos. Not what I have become accustomed too at CIC. There was a "hurry up and get in here" type of vibe, followed up with the maitre d' will be right with you....NOT. The waiting area leaves something to be desired and bodies started staking up. Some of those before became frustrated and punched out. Bodies continued to stack. The "maitre d'" occasionally showed up, but there was little to no attention shown to "RESERVATION" times. I can verify this because.....RANDOMLY, the GF saw a friend and another party that showed with.....NO RESERVATIONS...get seated before us. It was almost 40 minutes before we were shown a table. A table that was presented to dine at or we could wait for a booth that was being prepared. Hell, we waited that long, lets wait for the booth. Almost 45 minutes....we finally sat down to eat. Our experience with those in charge was nothing but shall I say.....glib. Hands down the worst "reservation" experience I have had in my almost 22 years in Vegas. Enough...no more dinners. Maybe I'll return during the lunching hour.

A0YMBxRSRTL6HNFYWcjm6g.text: Great  local italian place to eat. Good food and good staff. I had a good time, I definitely come back . Thanks

aeQdQmiJPKBZCWHpeGDAYg.text: I have been dining at Capos for over two years now and this review is so overdue. This is hands down my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas, I have dined here over 10 times! (I always forget to check in) I absolutely love the mobster vibe this place gives out. I have only dined here in the evenings date nights, family gatherings and fine dinings.  Each time you dine here you gotta buzz in and the guy with the mob (host) will ask for the password or reservation. Once you tell him you do or not (name and time) he'll open the door and let you in. As you walk in, it's pretty dark which I love! Definitely different from all other restaurants I have dined at.   There is live entertainment from a nice gentleman who sounds like Sinatra which I thought was a recording but his actual voice. He sung my boyfriend and I a song and even included my name! Came I give this place 10 stars!!!??  The servers are friendly and nice, drinks are delicious I recommend the raspberry Italian Margarita so good!  The food is to die for. I am never disappointed here at all. If you want an adventurous night filled with good eats and entertainment you must come! I also recommend to make a reservation because this place is very popular; tables and bar setting fills up quick.  Try it, you won't be disappointed at all!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My house salad so good! And in the back ground is the nico drink!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. His parm chicken with spaghetti!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed chicken Anastasia! My favorite!

7G781qCllkf8LjU5v1EMhA.text: The whole dinning experience from the moment the secret door was opened up to the last bite of a mist delicious dinner was wonderful. The staff is very professional and willing to interact with the us. The menu offers a wide verity of delicious parings.

GZOOkiXxTlP_EaPiA1jHww.text: This place has a cool fun mafia theme.  It's dark and cheesy but fun. The food was reasonably priced and portions were average. I had the clams and pasta and it was ok. It had lots of clams but the sauce was average. The Cesar salad was good fresh and large. The wine list by the bottle was large and prices were reasonable. I had the Tiramisu and I was very disappointed it was dry and very full of the lady fingers. The surprise of the night was the port list. It was great with Taylor 10 20 and 30 year Ports being available. Service was good our waiter was very attentive the negative was the kitchen seemed slow that night but not a huge deal.  I would definitely come back and try more of the menu.

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K7nBYn8W-z3YG-PNLBkw_g.text: No spoilers but I do have I share this is my new favorite place in Vegas. Treated to delicious appetizers of the calamari, meatballs (MUST GET), pesto pasta, mushroom risotto...list goes on and everything tasted delicious from soup and salad to dessert of creme brulee. Ambiance was beautiful especially sitting in front of the pianist who sang throughout the evening. 10 year anniversary dinner I will never forget!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At Capos with my one and only.

dRAcCVfh6AmbjgumsxPheQ.text: This is one of my favorite place for great food and service. Entertainment is the best. Will return many times

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thanks

RZRcp3ls-4xOgrDMS7DOtw.text: Ate there last night and the food was fantastic.  The Penne Vodka sauce and Meatball.  Meatball was the best I ever had.

XNXHm3n44cLdi3pHPP5NGw.text: Party for 20, called the restaurant and they connected me to Janeen.  We had the private room and Janeen helped with selection of our family style meal. Everything was DELICIOUS. I was never a big Italian fan but the fried ravioli, lasagne and steak were amazing.  So good that I ate the left overs cold the next day (we didn't have a microwave).  Janeen was just as nice in person as she was on the phone.  Excellent experience.

FbDveKvWMuCEiS0IWndTBw.text: First time at Capo's! OMG Fantastic. Uber'd there from the convention center. We had reservation. Not a long wait at all. Atmosphere was awesome. Dark with red lights behind the bar. My friend and split the lemon piccata chicken and mushroom riosoto. I could have made that risoto my whole meal. It was fantastic!!! The lemon piccata truly was one of the best I've had. Highly recommend! Will be back for sure!!!!

jT8wzfPw-WJVzo52c-BW0w.text: I've been to Capo's twice and each time they were amazing! The first time I went, my friends treated me to this speakeasy but we didn't know what on earth we were getting into and we thought you use the phone to get in! The second time, I brought my boyfriend here for his birthday and he absolutely loved it! The food is absolutely fantastic and they even catered to my cilantro allergy! The atmosphere is top notch and the live music is always a plus!

wOTnL0ix9LQshgRC2FTyIQ.text: What a neat place!  I had The Rat Pack chicken dish which was delicious and my husband had the Spaghetti and Meatball he said it would have been a 5 star dish except he felt it was a bit to saucy. I'm only giving 4 stars because our server never returned to fill our drink glasses or check on us once we were served our food.

a6duDFM4_unbuBiWoucHpQ.text: Food and service is always on point  I ordered the veal parmigiana and it's so tender you don't need a knife

uIuhxo13uNqoruXpYZxV4A.text: This rating is long over due. We celebrated my mother in laws 90th birthday on July 21st. Unfortunately she's been in the hospital since we got home so apologies for the delay. From the time I made reservations and spoke to Janeen customer service had been amazing. We reserved the back room with a party of 22 and food was served family style. We had sooo much food that was absolutely delicious.   The boys helped my mother in law from her wheelchair to a chair, I must say that made her year. By the way the boys were very handsome.   We had a 4-course dinner which was served in style. Janeen made sure everyone was well taken care of.   To top off the night cheesecake was served with many candles.   Amazing time but on top of the wonderful time Janeen made sure left overs were not wasted but went to folks that are in need.   Capos is our go to restaurant when in Las Vegas now our family knows the best place for Italian food and ambience.   Love Capos.  You are FANTASTIC! Best experience when away from home.   Thank you.

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More family.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday cheese cake

yYndVT9gIaWAvnH-bX3jbw.text: Old school speakeasy with gangster motif. We love sitting at the bar and the service is excellent. Italian food really done well. Try the meatball aps and if you don't finish take them home and eat cold the next day. Pasta  arrabiata has some spice to it and the sauce rivals my mother's (and she was born in Rome).  Kevin will sing you a few songs from Sinatra or Tony Bennett and he will also let you know he's met them.  Good place off the strip a few miles   If you're a local an easy drive if you are just visiting it's a 10 dollar Uber.   Have fun!

rQCjtrU0i5TXn77ziCZiKQ.text: The best thing is not always the healthy thing! This is official for right now the best Italian restaurant. Make sure you make a appointment because this place is always packed. The entrance to the restaurant is cool it is like a speakeasy. When we walked in it was so much to look at but it is very dark. They had the movie casino playing in the background and a Italian singer. Our waiter Jeremy was awesome and everything came out pretty quickly. I had the lasagna and it was terrific! It sat in a bed of red sauce to die for. Will be going back soon.

FkwPleahxC953c9BPi6NYQ.text: My boyfriend and I came here for a quick dinner on a Saturday night. I guess I should have done a bit more research before stopping by because I had no idea it was a speak easy type setting. When you walk in you need to ring a doorbell to gain access and then are ushered through a somewhat secret entrance way.  The place has a super old time mobster feel to it. The lighting was super dark and there was some Sinatra type live music, def a cool and different vibe.  Food wise we absolutely loved the pasta and meatball. It has a very tasty, homemade flavor and the portion size was enough for us to share. The stuffed mushrooms were pretty tasty too. They had a bit of a spicy sausage kick to them.   I would certainly come back here again, but recommend making reservations before since we were only able to sit at the bar.

xt8VFxNQdrcVpwuV18_32g.text: This restaurant is a hidden treasure .  The atmosphere is old school Italian . You have to believe it to see it. The ambiance and food is priceless . Francisco and Sara exemplify superior customer service . Make sure you call ahead for your password to gain entry to this amazing experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
