PcXB7vTFMuQc6HHEK3FJcQ.text: I definitely have to say the entrance and the greeting was amazing, it's a very unique and creative vibe. Great atmosphere. But the downside was the handmade pasta, did not taste as fresh as I had hoped. The Duck Soup was hands down amazing and I would go back for that soup. I'm a local but I would definitely say this is more of a tourist spot.

TZeYs6JR-XgsbwE2XzV4kg.text: Seriously some of the best pasta and steak I've ever had. The inside was incredibly cool and the waitress was attentive and kind.  The only downside is the cost, but we didn't mind because it was a date night for us.

Xr7SWuInVzd96nUKO47w7Q.text: Jeremy is the best server ever!!! Made the whole experience well worth it. Highly recommend Capo's to anyone especially if Jeremy is your server!

c7ebE5PylXoFQFDwcRLwng.text: I love this place!!! The food is amazing, the atmosphere is fun and the staff a delight. The piano bar is entertaining and pulls the crowd together. This out of the way speakeasy is worth the drive off the strip. Everyone in our party loved the food and said it was one of the best parts of our trip. The only thing my daughter didn't like was the smell of garlic....which I LOVED!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pRscOQboB43sBiEkHU-Kqg.text: I had to come back last week and eat here while in Vegas and let me tell you they still haven't disappointed me. EVERYTHINGGGG cheese bread and sauce it's a must try and their Caesar salad and capones dish omg to die for!!! Cannoli dessert the best!!!   THANK YOU STAFF FOR THE BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE AND CHEFS FOR THE BEST ITALIAN FOOD made here!!!!!

VEM0pt9Te_sc3BBclksqCA.text: I went here for my anniversary and had such a great time! The food was amazing, everything from the bread to the chicken fettuccini dish. There was even a magician there that night that came by our table! The live music is a great touch too.

KqM9ynyTb6C0HRX28zmiuw.text: The ambiance and shtick is on point. The cocktails were delicious. The appetizer was great BUT the steak was well done when I ordered medium same thing happened to my wife's meal. They were generous and comp'd the steak. Also if you are with a large group they don't split the check so it a pain to figure out who owes what

zBtTADAjm1fsn3dLNZidqg.text: We love this kitschy old-school Italian joint.  From the secret door at the entrance, Rat Pack-style live music, somewhat surly attitude from the staff, pictures of mobsters on the walls, you are transported to another time and place.  The food is really good. Great lasagna, calamari, and linguine with clams. I had the "Angels with Dirty Faces" angel hair with pink sauce- delicious.  Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta- really good!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The amazing lasagna!

zKkNo6MtgCvF9gQ_25e44A.text: Such an amazing place!!! What a little gem!! It's dark and romantic and a fun atmosphere. Our server Arlene was amazing and so friendly, and brought out our delicious food in great time. We can't wait to come back with friends and family.

ajDaKETOGhj2HVNs7-mcqA.text: Awesome service from Sarah our waitress, food is killah just look at their tomahawk steak

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YlNUkRKt3336hQEMbkpoQQ.text: This was my first time here. Great food in a very unique atmosphere. The service was great as well. Best to make reservations in advance.

OEMOKRFWyjw3ly8Q3tLryg.text: Cool place. Funny lounge singer inside. Neat decor. Had a great evening there. Didn't eat any food. But the atmosphere was fun for an evening of drinking with friends

lYo_ohCpO5LEy7xc9RklLA.text: My favoite till this day. I come from San Diego and this is the first place we think about. I had the "Chef sleeps with the fishes" (i think or somthing similar) and my mom n law had the rissotto. Please please "Capos" dont change your recipes. they are perfect the way they are. Thank you. Staff very freindly.

2x8Op7MTPrhFCr70_2EF8g.text: This place was excellent. You go for the food of course but the atmosphere also contributes to a great extent what the overall meal and experience is like. You will not be disappointed with Capo's.  First off, the entrance is not obvious, you have to be buzzed in after answering a question or maybe even two. The lighting is a bit dark but it adds to the theme which of course is all about the mob. Capone is everywhere on the walls as well as many of his counterparts from then and even more recent.   The food was amazing. We had the stuffed mushrooms and bread as our appetizer. That was something I would go back for alone. Both my wife and I had pasta dishes which were fantastic. My penne pasta with vodka sauce and a meatball was incredible and my wife's cheese tortellini with alfredo sauce and pepperoni was just as good.  The service was superb and everyone there was extremely pleasant to talk to. If I'm back in Las Vegas, I'm going to Capo's! Jeff

-Zf2YeDKvPOjnnxYJ5vCNA.text: Follow up on the check in! First time eating at Capo's. I ordered the rib-eye, which was amazing. It was cooked perfectly and the flavor was spot on. My husband told the server to surprise him! The server ordered him the special, which was the lobster ravioli. He enjoyed it thoroughly. I can never go to an Italian restaurant and not order tiramisu. It was delicious. The table ordered cannolis, they too were yummy and super sweet! We forgot to use our check-in discount when the bill came but will remember to use it on our next visit. The lighting is on the low side, however each menu has their own little light to see. The bathrooms were clean and did not smell.

tbM1B_wNADH-qAIr-qNRHQ.text: Finally got to try this place after finding it on yelp about a month ago. Atmosphere was great. Service and food was on par! Definitely coming back with out of town guests.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara with a meat ball on the side. Had to take home leftovers
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Caesar salad in my opinion.

9hB5AIpTPOniGOjtAznihw.text: I had such a great time at this restaurant. The entry into the restaurant itself is fun, and the hospitality was amazing. Not to mention the fact that the giant meatballs are so delicious, as well as my lemon drop martini!. The dark, old world ambiance is great but bring your reading glasses or be prepared to turn the flashlight feature on your cell phone so you can read the menu. But it is very cozy in there. I'm definitely going to go back!

pmJr-LQ2qECiOk6w5AFRdg.text: Extra star for the fun ambiance and atmosphere of Capo's! The food was very good, and they have a nice wine selection as well. Live piano music and/or singing set the mood in this dark space. Very old-school vibe with Donnie Brasco playing on the bar TV and a feeling like you're back in 70's Vegas when the mob ran the show.

s6ElW5mjLqHEqCMKYw8d2Q.text: I absolutely love this restaurant. I ordered takeout and it came to my house and it was so good I couldn't believe it. Their mushroom risotto is amazing their chicken marsala yum absolute yum and let's not even mention that atmosphere when you actually go to the restaurant I love it love it love it 5 stars all the way

BUaoiDiCIyQU0rdtfd57Gg.text: I love this place! For a restaurant like this sometimes you are unsure if the "experience" and the cuisine will both deliver. Luckily this place definitely delivers on both aspects! favorite dishes: Meatballs, fried calamari, chicken piccata, chicken Angelo, chicken anastasia. So much food for a great price! I will be back here again.

hSW05HPzW2z-2PKlzxgXTA.text: This place is awesome. Super cool atmosphere. My boyfriend and I loved the entrance to the restaurant. Our waitress, Erin, was very nice and gave excellent service, as did everyone else we interacted with in the restaurant. We ordered the ravioli with Alfredo sauce, stuffed chicken, and turtle cheesecake for dessert. Everything was delicious. 10/10 would recommend!

JXFHoGigpktCcKayitlIvA.text: This place is like a hidden gem off the strip of Las Vegas. The food is amazing and the service is fantastic! If you love the old mafia vibe, then this is the place for you. They serve a variety of Italian food and all the items we ordered were delicious. I would definitely recommend making a reservation first. This place is worth leaving the strip for. I would post pictures but the ambiance was a little dark.

OFsaKp6GWA5pstewZA9B0Q.text: Again this place is an excellent brunch choice!! Use the coupons from travel zoo and Groupon and you will be most pleased you made the trip.Time to try them for dinner!!!

DPrkIZEHFtOb9akPHMkROQ.text: It was a great atmosphere - complete with prohibition style decor, great actor/servers, and a good lounge rat pack singer.  But the food left something to be desired, especially at the price tag. A lot of patrons seemed to be using groupons, which helped on the price.  But the menu seems to adjust to this by increasing the price.  Great decor, high prices - but no better food than your average Italian eatery.

huZT1nbe42nAD--j9cgRWg.text: Fun place to go with friends.  After you find the entrance and knock on the door, you'll go inside a dimly lit dining room.  Food is good, choices on the menu are good,  and the entertainer is fun...we'll be back!

QVxQNK5pZlvAa_t3dXhRNQ.text: Love this place...love the food which since they fixed the dinner salad..lol is great! We usually eat the steak ...always delicious, wine good, entertainment. ..entertaining! Unique and oldstyle..always right.

i6yWcVM0Ly-e8NrI7DSxmw.text: This is a good place if you are tired of the typical restaurant atmosphere.  Their whole theme is based on the Italian mafia... When you walk in you have to ring the door bell and someone will answer in a small window. its a pretty nice experience.. the inside of the restaurant is very dark and very " mafia" like... the food is decent but the best part is that  they always have someone signing during the weekends.

kXPkfVt_lvU9bdZalrV1cA.text: Been meaning to write about this place. I absolutely love it. Great drink menu. Cool bar. Outside patio. Piano player. Dark and cozy. Fun hosts. Delicious food (finally found someone who can cook my steak right) and a great atmosphere.

S6nT8gMaMmPy5pSOgrVwfA.text: If you like the mob life you'll love this joint.  Live crooner sinjng the old tunes and he sings them so well.  Food is good Italian fare which is hard to mess up.   The atmosphere is what makes this place special.  Dark dimly lit.   Total mobster speak easy feel

7uBPitZcUTZa8GL8KFezaQ.text: First heard about Capo's from "Man Finds Food".  We knew we had to give Capo's a try.  We wanted to have lunch, and when we drove up, saw it was 2-for-Tuesday.  Great start so far.  Walked around, took photos, and went to enter.  Pushed the button, and sure enough, a young guy slides open the "visual door", and tells us to "get in here".  Wall/door swings open, and our senses are indulged with the ambiance.  Speaking of ambiance, there is no one word to describe Capo's.  You say something about the food, you miss the atmosphere.  You say about the atmosphere, you miss the employees.  You get the idea.  We are seated in a booth, and the darkness of the place just exudes speak-easy.  The smells from the kitchen tell us we chose wisely.  When our waiter arrives, we ask about the 2-for, and he tells us that is't $20 off the second entree for dinner.  Lunch now?  We decide to see the dinner menu, and that was the right decision.  Each menu had a little flashlight attached to it, as yes, it is that dark.  We order, then sit back and soak in the feel.    I had to use the facilities, and when I returned, the guy that gave directions was also the singer.  Very friendly/talkative, and when I told him it was our anniversary (celebrating a bit late), he offered to sing a song or 2 for us.  That was very special.  The song?  "Unforgettable".  Food arrives, and our taste buds could not wait.  Wife had the ravioli, and I the spaghetti with veggie ball.  One bite, and we are in love with Capo's.  You know when you read/hear/watch a review, and you think that might work?  MFF was so far off........  it was that good.  NO, it was that excellent!!!  The cheese in wife's ravioli melted in her mouth, it was so smooth.  Was my meatball really veggie?  There was a heft to it that was never experienced before.  I don't know if they put something extra in it, as I was on gastro-relaxation for the next few hours.  And......  another song for us before we left.  Capo's, know that on future trips to Vegas, we plan on visiting you over and over.  I wonder how good lunch is?????

WbqbCLqAheSxPYE6XXq0SA.text: I really loved this place.  I have been driving by it forever and thought it was just some junky poker bar.  I saw the reviews on Yelp and was surprised at how high the reviews were given my impression of the outside.  The bf and I were looking for a happy hour spot and Capo's came up.  Remembering the positive reviews I decided to give it a shot.  The inside of the restaurant is beautiful.  Very romantic with live music.  Now I get it that it is consistent with a prohibition bar, mangy on the outside, luxurious on the inside.    The bar manager was very helpful in terms of ordering suggestions.  We were there at happy hour so sat at the bar and enjoyed 1/2 off appetizers and the bf had a few 1/2 off drinks.   There is a lot to see in this restaurant.  We watched the bar manager argue with the musician to sing more and drink less, the kitchen is open and watched all the food being prepared and the cooks talk back and forth between each other and wrangle over each other to get the food cooked, and watched the matre d' yell at people in the "secret entrance" about coming in.  Had we been sitting in the dinning room we would have missed all this.  And this may not be for all people, but we loved it.  I am so over personality-less drones asking me if I have ever tried their world famous chicken poppers, or something to that effect.    We got there around 5pm and it was pretty slow, by the time we left at 7pm the place was packed.  It turns out that we were there on Tuesday which is there 2 - 1 Tuesday, 2 entrees for the price of 1.  The bf and I decided to come back on another Tuesday to try the entree menu.    The only downside was that we ordered deserts to go, the bf got a red velvet cheesecake and I got the bread pudding.  I don't really like either cheesecake or red velvet (both are highly overrated as far as I'm concerned), but I did try a bite of his and could appreciate it.  Unfortunately the bread pudding was a fail.  It was more like cinnamon french toast, not really what I wanted.  I still won't reduce a star for that though, I just won't order it again.

SJb7LfhLWTZFY91s0PU6ew.text: Love the ambiance, food is phenomenal and we loved the live entertainment,  and don't forget your password

IlN5fzzciogIbJ5WICZXcg.text: A fun place to take friends or a date. The "speakeasy" feel to adds to the experience and I'm a huge fan of the movies being played on the screen. A real must!

eW8-4c4-sFgxCOGlbNLjxA.text: The food was mediocre, the service horrible. I was taken there by a local who has gone there many times and takes clients there for work. I asked for a steak, no butter and some gluten free pasta. Halfway through my salad the waitress informed me that the chef has accidentally used some butter, would that be ok? They eventually made me another one, the gluten free pasta was small and without any taste. When I complained no one seemed to have an interest in making this right. I left a martini on the table and left asap. I will NEVER eat there again.

hZQUUmF4jGAiQkXZ-Rq54Q.text: We met some friends at Capos Italian Restaurant (their only location now being on W. Sahara Ave in LV, NV. We loved the other location and were hoping that the new location would be just as good or better. Please note that we are a couple that go out to dinner often, we like all kinds of food and are willing to pay for great service, food and ambiance. Our journey here began when we went into the private room entrance and we were asked "how many are in your party." For those of you who frequented the "other" location, this was a first of many touches that are now gone from the "new" location. We were then asked if we wanted to sit at our table and wait for our friends. We opted to have a drink at the bar. The bar is actually opposite the open kitchen which is very HOT and not comfortable at all. The bartender, who was a very good one, was talking to us about schedule issues for the staff and how she was supposed to be there in the morning and not the evening......etc, etc. Not exactly a welcoming opener to our dinner. Our friends showed up within a few minutes and we were escorted back to a back booth in the restaurant. I asked if it was a good table and was told it was "superb". Ah, if they only told us that a large party was going to be sitting in front of us! The noise was so loud I couldn't hear the people next to me talk. When the singer began his act, the place was way over the top loud. In the other location, the singer interacted with the people in the restaurant. This was not the case here. The restaurant air-conditioning was almost non-existent and actually become extremely uncomfortable. No, I wasn't having a hot flash, I was HOT! Is this a sign of the restaurant not being able to afford their energy bill?? Our waitress was very nonchalant and really not very friendly. We ordered drinks, and then dinner. The menu is extensive although no eggplant dishes which was weird for an Italian Restaurant. The food was just "okay". We have definitely had better and for way less money. One of the ladies in our party had a shrimp dish and the shrimp was almost hard as a rock and way overcooked. When the Chef came around to ask how things were, our friend said that her shrimp dish was way overcooked. His response, "thank you for letting us know", and moved on. We had a piece of cheese cake for dessert with caramel sauce and it was worse than store bought cheese cake. The flavor was simply "okay". Not great. We did use a Restaurant.com coupon which saved us $30 but the coupon also stipulates that 18% gratuity is added to the check. I would skip this restaurant and this coupon. With so many choices for GREAT Italian food, I would definitely avoid this restaurant and try some of the GREAT ones here in Vegas.

AQTddWjtp8BiALuUZioe0w.text: Came here for a wedding rehearsal dinner.  This is a really dark place.  Once entering this establishment, your eyes take some time getting acclimated to how dark it is inside.  The food was good and the service was attentive.

N2DyV9uYVQ4VZaEF-7RzIA.text: I've been back numerous times since my first review of Capo's in June.  I am HAPPY to report the food is still FANTASTIC with AMAZING quality.  They still have a Locals Special on Tuesday nights for 2for1 dinners which is great for us locals, and now they serve lunch, too!  I went for lunch there today with a work colleague and same great food and service.  YUM!  Definitely a nice treat.  I recommend to anyone looking for excellent NY/Chicago Italian in Vegas.

zNtDEpMtK_t2a8F4j-V5Cw.text: This place use to be much better than it is now. We went back not to long ago and had a early dinner. The place was empty The only cool thing everyone seems to like is not knowing what door to go in and when you do find it you knock and they ask who sent ya. Other than that the place is WAY too dark. Didn't have a good feel like some places give you a romantic feeling or cozy  this did not it was actually a little creepy to me. We sat and waited it seemed like a  long time to be waited on because they must have things to do before they take orders or something. We were there way too long. I think they do have coupons you can get on Groupon make sure you do this because paying full price you will not be happy. Do you know the feeling when you eat someplace and feel like you were ripped off?  That's how we felt after eating here. Over all the food is not as good as it use to be.  The service is no where as good as it should be. Not worth making the trip there especially if you are near the strip. It is up Sahara pretty far. We won't be going back there are WAY better Italian places in town that are MUCH better!!

CwXY_AWwNvbcju4Ch_eEcA.text: Very cool place. When you walk in, it looked like a speakeasy from the 20s. There is an old telephone to the right that was actually a door and this leads you into the restaurant. The ambiance was amazing. Very dim lighting, so dim they give you flashlights to read the menu! They had a live singer that reminded me of Sinatra. We left happy, full, and wanting to go back!,

_-7cr2llU-UgTdHV0lVnCA.text: A short drive from the strip, Capo's is totally worth leaving the bright lights and drunken frat boys stumbling down Las Vegas Boulevard. Go West on Tropicana and you're there in about 15 minutes.  The beauty is in the details at Capo's. When you arrive, you walk into a small vestibule. Soon, a small window slides open and a slightly frightening italian man asks what you want. If you manage to convince him you deserve entrance (don't worry- you will), he disappears, only to reappear shortly thereafter to open the door wide, allowing you into the dimly lit restaurant. The chairs and booths are comfortable. The music is fun and often sung by a guy trying for all his might to be Sinatra. Old ganster movies such as the OG Ocean's 11 are playing on a large flatscreen above the bar. The walls are decorated with pictures of infamous mobsters and the boothes are all red velvet and leather.  The food. My. God. The. Food. Take a lactaide before you get there- these people are serious about cheese. And garlic. This is everything you love but know you shouldn't about Italian cusine. I highly recommend the bruschetta (a beautiful harmony of tomatoes, onion and pesto with a bit of a kick) and "The Chef Sleeps with da Fishes" (an alfredo dish with at least a dozen large, tender shirmp swimming in creamy cheesey goodness).   This is a great place for groups and families. We had a party of 25 including 5 children and 4 teenagers. Everyone LOVED both the food and the ambiance. There was another large group of about 20 and we had absolutely NO problem with service. Everyone was very attentive with the doorman, waiter, busboy and party planner all coming by to make sure everyone was taken care of.   The skinny: Credit cards are accepted. Entrees range from $10.50 for spaghetti w/ meatballs to $25 for specialty dishes Several desserts are available for about $7 each Full bar and good wine selection available Reservations are HIGHLY recommended as the place is not big  **Important note: If you have a group of 15 or more you will have to have a set menu, where everyone pays the same price, starting at about $35 p/p. Children under ten are half price.

1_Q5CpVPcZ-pYgADBca8Zg.text: From the ambiance to the food this place was excellent.  Just walking into the place with the secret passage way was entertaining.  Service was excellent!  Unsure of what wine we wanted we were able to try several before settling on a bottle.  The meatballs in their apicy sauce was delicious.  Don't hesitate to try this place.

82wCtKqTIdYWwETG81idvg.text: Fantastico!!!! Amazing food attentive fun staff and awesome classic Italian Mafia ambiance.. While in Vegas do yourself a favor venture off the strip to this place promise you will not be sorry!!! We have been to 5 star restaurants with beautiful views but crap food and watered down drinks.  Prices affordable expected to pay more and would have gladly paid considering the delicious quality of food and drinks.

j2FI__RY-lv75RdDTy8Ifw.text: Food is definately not the reason to trek to this place. I found the wedding soup inedible and the prices mediocre for below average Italian. Experience was interesting and kitsch, and server was kind and replaced soup without hesitation. Just so many competent restaurants on the strip that made my experience below average.

dQwm91jM7ggFvKhycix_YQ.text: The food is average. The decor is awesome. the theme is weird. the idea would be great if the food shined through.

SE4Ex3yVGsLJrBnqYAY3Tw.text: Found this restaurant thru Yelp. After reading the reviews we were intrigued.  When we drove up to the building we weren't sure we were in the right place but once we got inside the greeting at the door, the ambiance,  the food, and the service were awesome.would definitely go again and bring friends.

j5YelXojgqDVou7wiXkdrA.text: Okay here is a review on Cappos. I have been reading about this place on yelp and was so excited to go there. It is a really cool place super super dark , which Is fine, but the darkness doesn't lean toward a romantic atmosphere , it just leads to an eyesore . There is a Tiny little flashlight on the menu, but you Have to hold The little button down As You look at the Menu so its kind of tricky to read the menu and hold the flashlight .It's so dark you can barely see your food. Okay so I am a pretty easy going person with not much complaints , so let's move on to the decor . Super cool looking inside but looks kind of small , we were seated in a nice booth and waitress and host were super nice, we used a 50 gift certificate from restaurant.com which was well worth it . We ordered the calamari with peppers, and the stuffed mushrooms for the appetizers . The calamari was just okay. They tasted like the oil was a little burnt. Now for the stuffed mushrooms. They were really small little button mushrooms that were stuffed with prosciutto and smoked provolone cheese . It seemed as though if you put your fork in it the mushrooms would fly off the fork and end up across the room They were okay but it seemed like the chef poured chunks of kosher salt in it. As I did taste chunks of salt. Now onto the entrees . They were very large portions my boyfriend ordered the carbonara and I ordered the stuffed ravioli. The ravioli was just okay it was cooked with peas and bacon and about 2 lbs of butter. It was way too oily for my tastes . And once more it had chunks of kosher salt in it . (I don't know why the chef chooses to dress all the food with extra salt if your cooking fresh italian food the flavor comes from the fresh herb cheese and ingredients . Anyway being that my boyfriend is Italian , we know really great Italian good when we taste it , and overall we were looking forward to a really great Italian meal with great pasta . This Pasta was just okay . It's good to go there for the experience , but not for authentic Italian food.

bCmaqCFiPEijn8pbwgD6Lw.text: The entrance is neat and set the tone for a fun evening which started off with great happy hour prices at the bar. Once we were seated the live music started and the dimly lit booths made you feel like you were in  a 1920's speakeasy. Food was good, service OK,  and evening was very enjoyable and a good value. As Vegas locals we are always looking for non-tourist places away from the strip and this was a great find.

Mj_OcaEN33EFs8M2V-97kw.text: Love Capos! My friends and I went there last weekend and had so much fun. The food was amazing and huge portions. The singer was so much fun and very entertaining. This place is great for large groups (we had 14).Just a fun atmosphere! The only bad this was it was a $20 taxi ride from our hotel but well worth it!!

8wBy8Z1fCn9pqBC36KbpFA.text: I would reaaally recommend this place if Italian is what you love. Great food, wonderful atmosphere and very good service.

nYDU6LXUA_4CQH1238oVlA.text: Would have never ventured in here unless Groupon offered a reason..Now WE are sooo HOOKED! We love this place! Love Ziggy! And Love Jeri the waitress! The food is absolutely amazing and we leave absolutely satiated! We've tried a lot on the menu, every time we go back we try something different. No disappointments yet. What tops the cake to this amazing ambience experience is the live music of the classics! Keep it up "fellas"!

n0Rni37SGuZTgNP3ErqNog.text: Food was some of the best Italian we've ever eaten! Service was top notch, atmosphere was awesome, the singer was really cool, and he'd come talk to you at your table between sets! He also takes requests! We will definatly be back!!!

IY31evCN35V-qG_d0KgdEQ.text: WORST SERVICE EVER AND fOOD IS NO GOOD ANYMORE EITHER.  Ok let me start out by saying I've been going yo capos for about 7 years and it was great back when it was on tropicana. Last year I took my girlfriend for a romantic dinner and we were there for 3 hours and didn't even get our salads, this was due to the fact they were filming a "real housewife"eating dinner. So we got a glass of water and I had 1 beer and asked to speak to someone about an hour and a half into it. Noone came so we continued to wait when someone finally came over he tried to give me an attitude and hand me a bill for my food, I looked at him and laughed and said I'm not paying got anything and left and vowed to never to go back. Well needless to say I had to give my favorite restaurant for 7 years one last shot me and a group of 10 friends went there on sat. For my birthday dinner everyone said there food was not good including mine, I had the veal parm and there was a pound of cheese covering it to start, it was very bland and not the same as the old recipe. We were there waiting for out check for an hour after we ate w didn't even see our server, and the place only had 3 tables of people so it's not like they were busy. I would never recommend this place to anybody anymore. What happened to you guys ?

jaHEH4sLsDU2L0pBhRc6_w.text: I used to LOVE this place. They were small, intimate and amazingly friendly. However - this last time, the service just wasn't that amazing and the prices seem to have gone up. It took us more than 30 minutes to be seated, yet the bartender scolded me for getting the drink special even though we were being seated for dinner.... really?

wlC_ugXSEw6tToxPwN9KSw.text: I had a great experience at Capo's. The food was delicious and their house wine was one of the best wines I've tasted so far. The atmosphere was amazing. When you first walk in you have to press this door bell and they let you in by unconventional means. It was dark and had the authentic feel of a speakeasy. They give you a small flashlight to view the menu because it is so dark; it feels as if it was all lit by candlelight. The service was good and I went with my boyfriend and he got the singer to sing us a song so that is always a plus. To those who complain about the darkness or the attitude of employees.... you shouldn't go to a SPEAKEASY themed restaurant if you aren't prepared for the atmosphere and workers. The restaurant is pricey but worth it. I would recommend it as a place to go if you are on a date or celebrating with family and friends.

zieCY_yq75c7vYzwxyeYHQ.text: Overrated? Fuget about it! Capo's did not disappoint at all. Took my girl here last week and we both loved it. I didn't tell her about the entrance, which scared the crap out of her. Good times! Lol. The ambiance and food were great. The chocolate cake was delicious. The crooner was awesome. My girl loved it so much that she got up and danced with me. Capo's will definitely be a "must do" on my future visits to Vegas.

Dks02pJP7mxaa39--uwe5A.text: Came here for the first time on 8/16/14. I love Italian food as my girlfriend is old school Italian and cooks her ass off for me. Love the mob them and the entrance is wonderful and unique. As you go in, you see the bar first and all the memorabilia from the wise guys era. The booths are old school and at this point everything is awesome. However, I am not a I need a flashlight to read your menu kinda guy. I am sure this is part of the ambiance, but It is not for me. Perfect place for a first date. We sat down and had our waitress (cant remember her name) she was kind and nice and very obnoxious as a old school waitress from back East should be. She stated that she had been there for over 13 years so that tells me about the loyalty here as this is not found in the food business anymore so my hat off to these people for treating their employees right. My son and I had the Lasagna and my girlfriend had the raviolis. The salad was on point and the bread was excellent. Before our food came we got the treat of the magician on staff. He is WONDERFUL if you have children and his tricks blew my mind as I sat 1 ft away. The singing is awesome (everything you would expect from an Italian joint) and overall at this point a wonderful dining experience. Our food came and I have to tell you, this is the first Lasagna that I had to eat slow so I could savor how delicious it was. My son stated the same and its just lasagna for Christ sake. I have had this dish at least 500 times from my girl and had to hurt her feelings "BABE YOUR LASAGNA SUCKS COMPARED TO THIS"..... dinner was over and we had the cannolis. EXCELLENT....took them home so the little ones could indulge. Prices were a little steep for the food to price ratio. I will deff be back as I cant wait to try a more difficult dish. Again, your going on a first date, this place will break the ice for you up to 80%....I HIGHLY RECOMMEND CAPOS ITALIAN CUISINE......

puoSVRnBwpC-92kelU-pWg.text: Saw this place on TV and had good reviews so we wanted to check it out. We didn't have a reservation but got straight in , we had a 10 year old with us so they sat us in a side room closed off from the main part of the restaurant that had plenty of tables available. This was a let down considering we could hear the entertainment of live singing and music and everyone enjoying it while we were stuck in a extremely dark boring room watching the dishwasher through an open curtain. Apparently there not big on having kids in the establishment. It took our waitress about 10 min to take our drink order and then an additional 15 to come back to take our food order. We got our soup and salads shortly after which were not impressive at all but we were looking forward to our entrees...... 50 minutes later we were still sitting there in the dark with one other table with kids bored out our minds and starving. We asked our server how much longer it would be and were told "2 minutes",  ten minutes had gone by and the table aside of us who got there well after us received there meals first which were steaks and pastas! Obviously we were extremely frustrated at this point and told another server who was trying to pacify us by saying our food was coming out now that we were done with the situation and leaving. We offered to the manager to pay for our sodas and soups/salads and he treated us very rudely as if we were the problem saying our food was coming out in 2 minutes! We explained to him our frustration and he acted as if he could care less, he told the owners brother the situation n they both kept there backs turned to us not giving us an answer to how much we owed, they finally told us not to worry about it. In no way shape or form did they try to make our experience better or make up for the fact that our order had been placed literally over an hour ago n we had yet to receive our meal. We will never return!

-NGPRkVXSZVIQYSbuXVikQ.text: I've been here four times in the last 8 months or so, all my friends I've taken absolutely love this place. The food is great, always cooked to perfection.

OmV6BtTx8tN-YkRahKDXsQ.text: What an awesome place! It is dark but you get flashlights with your menu. You have to know the secret password to get in.. just kidding but the entrance is quite spiffy. The bartender is awesome and such a sweety. My friend lives right by here so we get hooked up when I accompany him when I'm in town. Wonderfully awesome italian pasta. Their soups are good too.

V9rDfG_sCulzAClM9yNeMg.text: Great afterhours on Tuesday nights. Good for getting away from the strip a little.

1dVgSRkHgeG_sPS6MaLESA.text: All four of us really enjoyed ourselves at this restaurant last night.  The food and service was good and the atmosphere is great.  What a cool place to hang out with family and friends and enjoy a good Italian meal.  We started off with the Genovese Calamari, Busta Cap's (stuffed mushrooms) and the Lucky Lucianos House Salad.  For Entree's we had The Chef with Fishes, Stuffed Chicken Anastatia, Chicken Lucchese and Da Don's Pasta with Meatball.  Several Drinks were enjoyed and our bill was $187.00.  Three of us brought home left over's.  I would definitely give this restaurant a try.

AiZXNuQT9U3lj66w60Qr1g.text: First time for us to tonight and from the time we rang the bell until we left it was a welcome, romantic atmosphere! The entertainment was perfect ( Monday night) lots of Sinatra, the people were like family. This is my new favorite place, the food was great and the price was right. Service A+, etc... If I had visitors this would be the restuarant I would bring them too! Kudos to Capo's, we will be back!

ZKKpxfZBxGBzfI976IhmUg.text: I loved this place it's so mob theme, from the outside looks crappy but you go inside its a total different world. The music it's perfect for the place and the lighting sets the mood for a date night.  I went to celebrate my wedding anniversary and I would definitely come again when I'm in Vegas.

3tAE2LVj7gKWPykBueX3fA.text: Kind of fun...  pretty good food interesting atmosphere. Our waiter was great Brandon. The calamari was a little squishy and the batter didn't quite stick... the meat sauce was delicious & the hubby enjoyed his fettuccine alfredo. Overall pretty good.

N7A3v_oMAdlqP3w06edvfw.text: Love this place.  The food is delicious and the bartender Brandon is very personable and friendly.  He makes excellent cocktails especially  martinis.  Definitely will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vcJJjKSuNNaWGfxl9mEUUA.text: This place is throw back as soon as you walk in. The drinks are so good and the the food is Amazing. I highly recommend this place when your in Vegas. A must stop in and eat at a hidden gem in old Vegas!!

m1FN8nFvafYAWvSscePwSA.text: Love it here! Especially the staff. I've been here multiple times and loved it each time. Jeremy made it a great experience and added to the great atmosphere. We will be back here over and over again. Tonight there was a special touch with a table side magician. Please keep that up!

PoeFi0DOFAwBmuoTlPObzQ.text: So right away the entrance and theme is so frikken cool :)  The music and lighting and food is spot on :) Gonna be coming more often to try each dish and try the drinks!

WAGCv_joR-y4_swYK5797Q.text: From the very cool entrance to nice staff and further to some good selection of drinks followed by a quality Italian food. We enjoyed it a lot! Also, portions are humongous and well priced! Recommended !

Yk47msgi6-nH4AS1OwzVLQ.text: Something different. You think you are someplace else. Good food. The meatballs are huge. Sauces have good flavor without the salty taste usually associated with red sauce.   Pasta is cooked correctly. Friendly helpful service. Worth a try

sOnQ0BgAaPTGQ0CYbxbCfg.text: My fiance and I went here for our 2016 Valentines dinner. We didn't make reservations because we didn't know since it was our first time. Let me say this....it exceeded my expectations of Italian food and more. Olive Garden & Carrabba's can't even compare to Capo's. From the garlic cheese bread, to the duck soup, salad, and the shrimp scampi to the chicken parmigiana....the food was absolutely good. We will go back again and we will never go to olive garden or Carrabba's again.

WVna2sehIgybBrU0yOH6aA.text: Great service!  Jeremy was awesome.   Capos is a fun vibrant and delicious experience.  The live music topped it off.  Highly recommend it.   We will be coming back again

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try the meat balls.  They are the best!

NlirDL1gHRVHogRUfOorZw.text: A  classy speakeasy fine dinning room.  I love this place, it has all the old feel of a Mobster hangout and great Italian food.  a group of ten of went to dinner and we placed our order and we had pasta, and some had steak and chicken dishes, the food was amazing.  We had four bottles of wine and the after dinner drinks and coffee. just a great avenging.   The wait staff were really polished, when we got our main course there was like five servers and they put all the plates on the table at one time it was cool.  Real classy place.....

W705XH1dA9r8tDi0ydDm3g.text: My boyfriend and I just celebrated our 5 year anniversary here and it was farrr from a disappointment! GREAT customer service and AMAZING food! If you're visiting Las Vegas we both HIGHLY recommend this restaurant

gH9jaTDnKofZhXAGQrLKeg.text: Fantastic traditional Italian food.  Great ambience.  Bring all visitors here. Live music and a mob theme,  old school Vegas.

inOyZyfK6fufGajva0EWVA.text: Awesome experience!  Love the little window that the host peeks out of, and the secret door. We absolutely LOVED the food. The waiters and bussers were super friendly. The ambiance was perfect, right down to the little flashlights for the menus. Beautiful chandeliers. They had a live 'lounge singer' that made the experience complete. We will most definitely be going back!

w1zzNKqLSYfK9bY5tv0OPw.text: Loved this restaurant! From the moment we entered the "secret" door, the service was great, the food was amazing and the atmosphere was very unique. I had the spaghetti & meatballs & my husband had the lasagna. They were both amazing! There was a nice live band playing and the restaurant had lots of mob related art  & artifacts. Great place!

ZApMHPF09-_ZTyU_2-PSaA.text: My husband and I have been wanting to try this restaurant for a while. So what better day than Valentines Day!? Our reservation was for 9:45 pm. We arrived early and figured we could sit at the bar while waiting. We had arrived at 9pm. We we're pleasantly greeted at the door and seated right away. I have nothing but praise for Capos. Our waitress, Mettia was very attentive and had a great personality which in the Hospitality is a must!! We truly enjoyed our meal. We will be coming back!!

uB_8evZdx14yx7f58xt-yg.text: This restaurant is soooo freaking coooooool! Great food! And cool setup! I would definitely recommend to anyone who likes Italian food! You will not be disappointed!! We sat at the bar and ate which was cool cuz we got to watch everyone walk in! :)

1WGZsGZ_EB7_Tn_eDKF31g.text: New chef = lots of changes, not for the better. (This review's visit: April 2013)  The Italian dressing that was SO good, circa the previous chef is now completely different. Now: inedible (greasy, yellow, tasteless and, just...No). Garden salad ($6) was made with rusty, wilty lettuce, carrots were stale. Nothing in it was fresh.   Lasagna - check out my pic. I was expecting a luscious, beautiful, hearty, home-made hunk of well-made lasagna (for $10).    During this lunch service, only two other tables were occupied in the resto, but still my server couldn't get things off the ground. We spent the next 45 minutes trying to deal with one thing after another: funky new dressing, funky salad which he accidentally charged for as it was a swap for the pasta, we ordered a meatball but no meatball arrived, waited another 20 minutes for that lasagna to get boxed up, etc... Too much management required. Oyy.  My previous stellar review, which I was delighted to write, belonged to the previous chef. I was expecting a repeat experience, but this was like a different restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is what I saw when I opened my lunchtime lasagna to-go. Fork added for size... Unimpressed. Definitely not worth $10.

HXgSPwxANADu8IxIiX6fLQ.text: I was very disappointed in this place. We came in one hour prior to closing and I did not have a reservation and was told that I would have to sit at the bar. Meanwhile throughout the whole meal we could have sat down at many tables that were not reserved yet. The Italian Ambiance experience was ruined when I had to hear a bunch of Mexican Cooks shouting orders in Spanish and I felt like I was in a Mexican restaurant instead of an Italian restaurant.. my soup was cold and bread was hard.. the lighting in the place is too dark where they Supply a little light for you to read the menu.. I would not recommend this place to anyone

cT5_5fJRmXqQabpfH6mXsw.text: Lived in Vegas since 2004 and Finally tried this place. Very Good. Finding out the family that owns it is from same neighborhood as I in Chicago. Great experience and loved my Pasta.

obyWqnBg4EMJWDXNy49wag.text: Love this place   An excellent selection of food and wine with an awesome flair! If you like Italian food this place is almost a must visit.

YTRxVcikttNy3L2wAIBrWA.text: This place is a local Gem!! Sooo cool and the night we were there they had live entertainment. The food is so delicious noodles were cooked perfectly not overdone and watery and the sauces had the right amount of flavor. The tomato based sauce was my favorite but one in our party had the Alfredo I think it was and they really enjoyed the creamy deliciousness. This is a must go when in town!!

tBCknaN4HLUMqeBejdtJAw.text: This place is amazing! Such a fun night with friends, good food, and great memories. From the get go at the front door. We had the boneless rib eye and lobster. This is a fun off the strip restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Making the decision on which lobster to pick. This place is pretty bad ass!

56BVjdOBGtWVF3zJlytTUQ.text: We came here for my son's 21st birthday celebration and thought it would be a nice, but different, dining experience. We were rather disappointed with the whole experience.  First of all, this was supposed to be a speakeasy type of place reminiscent of the mobster days.  Imagine my surprise when they seated us at a table and the head of the table was facing away from the door!  Rule number one:  gangsters ALWAYS seat FACING the main entrance door so they know who is coming at them and if they have a weapon! Being from Central California, I brought my own wine:  a magnum of a 1998 Silver Oak, Napa Valley.  I am used to paying corkage fees in California-  $15 to $30 dollars in the nice restaurants.  But I was charged $60 for corkage because they "had Silver Oak there".  I pointed out that it was a 21 year old magnum of the Napa Valley grapes (as opposed to the Alexander Valley grapes).  This didn't faze them at all-- or maybe they didn't understand the difference.  At that point, I didn't care since I had carried it on the plane from California specifically for this dinner so had them open it anyway. Now, on to the food: I had the drop duck egg soup-- way too salty! My boneless rib eye steak was so fatty and sinewy that I couldn't eat half of it. The mashed potatoes was just so oily and greasy-- no wonder they make you eat in the dark! Overall, I will never go back to that place-- not when there are so many delicious steak restaurants on the strip.

7CYs1cEXJbMUPROTsbvofg.text: This place is great ! From the time you ring the bell at the " Back Door " to get in... you feel like you're in an old 80's gangster movie. The girls at the bar are super friendly and if you come by without a reservation, they will usually take you to sit in the bar area and you can get full meals there as well. We came during happy hour this time just before the dinner rush. There were a few appetizers on special but they're regular meals are outstanding ! So hi to Vinny, Sal, Joey, Pauly, Tony, Mikey and hey... fugetaboutit !!! Aloha

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour at the bar ! Hey Vinny, pass the Dr Pepper !
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice and dark, vibey place...
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just like at Mama&#39;s house !

RjhqYwqOeeOsXXtn-d6JBA.text: Been there three times. First time the grill was down, no steaks.  Second time was good, there were only 5 tables seated.  Last night was a complete train wreck!! Made reservations for a table for 5 on a birthday.  Got put in a booth, 20 mins for appetizers to show up (calamari, antipasto, bruschetta). We place dinner order at this time. 20 mins later soups and salads. 30 minutes later I have to get someone because server was missing and ask where the order was. 40 MINUTES LATER only one entree comes out. Mor excuses 15 more minutes go by and the rest of the order comes out. Total order;  3 lasagna, 2 ribeyes $40 ribeyes are less than an inch thick.  And over cooked.  I'll buy mine Sam's club and not be disappointed thank you.   Two of my kids fell asleep.  Complete failure.  Still paid full price. Fleming's made a mistake on ONE steak and comped ENTIRE meal.  For the whole 2 hour nightmare we saw our server 4 times.  2 of them were to make excuses.

FyT86ZHXk3-fgFDjOT7Zsw.text: First time here and now this is my favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas. Great food choices with authentic Italian dishes. I had the carbonara with shrimp which was amazing! Portions sizes were big and I was happy to have left overs. Other dishes my party ordered was the chicken Alfredo and uncle Pauly's arrabiata. Both were delicious as well. Warm ciabatta with butter was served as we sat down. I decided to try a bloody mary. Not the best that I've had but it's up there. Only downside is that it's very dark inside. However, each menu comes with a mini flashlight which help. Good service. Definitely will be back when we come back to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara with shrimp (no peas)
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uncle Pauly&#39;s Arriabata (sp?)
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Alfredo

kwcsTaH3COGSmwh96TjaxQ.text: Where to begin? This is by far one of the strongest Italian restaurants I've ever been to...everything from the appetizer, to the soup, to the salad, to the meal, was FANTASTIC. I was completely blown away by this place. I will visit again the next time I'm in town.

xk4PmVdgkACltsfH7gJp0A.text: What an awful, awful experience!! I have never had such terrible service in my life! First and only time at this place on a Saturday afternoon with my wife. We went through the whole password at the back door and going through the secret door featuring a payphone attached in front of it. It has the whole mobster, dimly-lit environment. I had to ask a busboy nearby if we would ever see our server! We waited over 20 minutes before our server, Kaitlyn, finally emerged from her long winters nap. In fact, we'd waited so long for her that we'd finished the complimentary bread one of the runners brought us. When I mentioned to her that I had requested drinks from the maitre'd, she curtly replied that,  "Well, he's the maitre'd, and I'm your server and I'd like to take your order 'if I may!' " She was very bellicose and argumentative, likely because she knew she'd been ignoring us. I ignored her sheer rudeness and asked her questions about items on the menu. We ordered garlic cheese bread for an appetizer,  and she said she'd return to take our dinner order. She finally brought us our first round of drinks and then disappeared into the shadows of the place. Another 20 minutes later, she finally returns to us to take our dinner order. She advised us we'd have to pay an additional ten bucks to share a 24 dollar plate of lasagna with my wife. We told her we would continue reviewing the menu. We would never see her again. I watched her service four other tables at least three times each while completely and maliciously ignoring us. When I'd finally decided I'd had enough of Kaitlyn's rude and reprehensible treatment, I got up and asked the maitre'd for our check for the appetizer. He politely said it was on the house.   I cannot possibly fathom how or why a town built on customer service would employ such a woefully inadequate and mean-spirited server. She should be far away from any customer contact. I wish I could give this place less than a full star, for that don't even deserve that!  AVOID!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great ambience, awful service

hmU9g2UOCkl7WqUdFi7dPA.text: Wonderful.. From the entrance to leaving..we enjoyed the stories..the different themed rooms..the hospitality of everyone..Our server's name was Ed..he was GREAT. WE were checked on at the right times, the Host even took our pic.We will be Back again. (THE HAMBURGERS and Meatballs are huge...like the Flintstones,hahahaha) The cheesy bread was delicious with the marinara and pink sauce with just enough garlic..YUUUMMMEEEEE)

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch with the  family ..enjoying the ambience and food..very delicious..YAAAHYYY!!!

Qe7-DtfroSD3mkA1JXHOQg.text: Meh. My Salad had bad tomatoes & a hair, my asparagus was woody, my main was cold & tasted of flour instead of lemon. I was a guest so I didn't say anything but I won't go here again. If it was only my meal messed up I might give them another try but there were other problems with the group meal, timing, etc....  There are too many other places to eat.

eRXTURax9SD38xPCsUldoA.text: Get your ass off of the strip and get over here and have some real Italian food this place is been around forever and it is not to be beat!  Don't miss anything they serve with their pink sauce on it it's maybe the best I've ever had in my life! Also tip your damn piano player on the way out the door he  makes the atmosphere just that much better.

-TGqHAsU9ZMneNzISawhrw.text: I don't want to be a spoiler, so I'll write a review without getting into many details ;-)   First of all, I found this restaurant thanks to Yelp! My family and I visit Las Vegas a couple times a year and we make sure we visit Capo's. It's been now 3 years! And I've never been disappointed!   The place:  Capo's is like a cute Italian restaurant from the old days. It is dark but that's part of their ambiance, they do have lights for people to read their menus. Some days during the week they have live music, a piano player who sings and tells stories.   Food & drinks:  Capo's is famous for their "giant meatballs." I've had them at least 3 times. Always love them and order them to share with friends as an appetizer. I think is amazing how they make big meatballs but Cook them right!   The pasta here is made from scratch and it tastes really good! One day I had their "Capo's Lasagna" and now I can't eat anything else from their menu. That's all I always want! This Lasagna is the bomb! Is so good! So much beef, so much cheese and the most incredible lasagna sauce. I just love it!   During our last visit my husband had "Chicken Marsala" with spaghetti. I had a bite and omg one of the best Marsala sauce I've ever had. The spaghetti was great as well! They put just the right amount of sauce so you could enjoy the Marsala.     The drink menu has a some cocktails, I've had "The Nico," -it's fruity and made with rum! It's my fave here.  "The cosmo" -with vodka and it's ok  "Italian Margaritas" -really good here! I like them a lot!    They have some great "Tiramisu" - I love it! It was puffy, creamy and right amount of coffee. It is a generous slice so I recommend to share :-)   Service:  The staff here is funny and attentive. You have a host, a server and somebody in charge to get waters and take the dirty dishes and glasses.  I love the staff uniforms! They all look fancy and good looking!   Bonus:  When you check in with Yelp you get $10 off your bill if it's at least $75. Who doesn't love a good deal?

EZYI8OXbyhQWWPMigMaZsQ.text: Amazing atmosphere and deserts. Has nice old school music, you will feel like you're in the 50's. Great for all ages. Has a good lunch menu too!

AbBkgYVybS7Wg0aLe20Wcw.text: First off, this is without a doubt one of the nicest restaurants in Las Vegas.  From the outside, it doesn't look like much, but on the inside (besides not being able to see a thing), there is hardly a better restaurant in the area.  Everything was perfect.

jjrHvqE8JXGvFISxZkfyxw.text: A couple of our friends wanted to try this restaurant so they asked us to join them on a Saturday for dinner.  Our reservation was for 6:45pm and we arrived about 10 minutes before.   However, we had to wait about 30 minutes  before being seated.   The place was pretty dark inside and there was a small pin light attached to the menu.  We just used the torch light from our iPhones.    We started off with a couple of appetizers, fried calamari and antipasto salad.    The calamari was very fresh and tasty.  The salad was very good as well.  My husband ordered lasagna and I had medium rare fillet with mash potatoes and grilled asparagus.   The other couple ordered a couple of pasta dishes.     My husband's lasagna was a big portion, enough for two.   I am not a fan of pastas and heavy sauces but I liked the taste of this lasagna and the meat sauce.   My fillet was delicious and was cooked perfectly.   Grilled asparagus was good.  The mash potatoes tasted good but had too much butter so I only took a bite of it.   Also, I had to scrape off a big chunk of butter on top of my steak.     Overall, we all had fun evening and enjoyed our food.  Just wished the place weren't so dark.

Z4DLdHkDWP1nYuZtSGirFQ.text: Fantastic service,Fantastic food, fantastic lounge piano Music nightly!  Real old style gangster Mob restaurant. Top of the line one of my Las Vegas favorite restaurants.  Live Entertainment Nightly Happy Hour Nightly 3 - 6 Monday Industry Night  50% off food and drinks 5-10 at bar with industry ID Tuesday 2 For 1 Entrees For Locals  With Nevada ID *up to $20.00 with purchase of two beverages.

ikCJZgiFSa-A_KKsktSrcA.text: I tried the arrabbiata pasta. It was delicious but super garlicky. I had it with the vegetarian meatball, which was huge and pretty average. I really liked the whole theme; it is very dark in there but there are little lights to see the menu. There also was a piano that someone played for 30 minutes or so. I went for a birthday party and all of our food turned out great. The only thing that did not go well was paying. They allowed us only split the check with two cards or one card and cash. Then we discovered that you can only pay with a chip card after that. It was super inconvenient as we were a big party and not prepared for. We had a reservation for 8 people (I just feel like they could have told us ahead of time). It was a nice, a little higher end so we were just surprised.

8Iz__T1um3JBZwY6Cca08Q.text: Great food, great service and the ambience is perfect. We stop here often when in town. I recommend making reservations if you're going on a weekend as they get quite busy..

p7e5zPJ24M4sz4JHtW9Pgg.text: Entered through the secret entrance, which was very interesting and surprising. The restaurant itself is dimly lit and has a classic Italian restaurant vibe. There was live piano and singer.   We had reservation but still had to wait for half an hour for our table. We were seated right next to entrance and kitchen. It was stuffy and kinda smoky, not the best seats.   Loved the complimentary bread.   Got shrimp scampi for appetizer and it was the best! The sauce was buttery and garlicky. I could eat this everyday!  Pasta comes with salad or soup. Duck soup was great.   The chef sleeps with fish pasta: disappointing. Pasta was overcooked and bland. I added a lot of salt and still couldn't save it. Ended up only eating the shrimps.   Meatball: enjoyed the sauce. Meatballs decent.   Veal parm with pasta: bf loved it. I liked the pasta more than veal cuz the sauce was sooooo delicious!   Lava cake: kinda spongy n didn't melt very well in the middle. Next time I wanna try tiramisu.

qtRpfvpKLBXjt2jaP0oWYA.text: Very disappointed.  For over a year my friend has been raving on about this restaurant, the amazing food, the fantastic live music (piano, singer) and atmosphere you won't forget. We had an older business contact coming to town from Houston & I thought we'd impress him with a dinner at a speakeasy.  I was told to make reservations well in advance, 1 week ahead seemed to be no issue, yay. Very impressive outside entry cove with wanted posters, old closed sign on the door and a sign to ring the door bell which we did, and then we waited.  The door greeting was fun, we entered, our table was not ready so we decided to sit at the bar.  The bartender was very pleasant, knowledgeable, quick, (not very busy) & she poured a good drink.    That was the best of the evening.  Our table was in a booth and was located right behind us from the bar.  This seemed ok, liked falling off the barstool to the table if we needed that, or being close to the door or the restroom if we needed that, but we didn't.  I know we are old, but we are not THAT old!  Unfortunately, we were too busy talking to realize that this table was out of range of the music and not having been there before, it apparently is also the land of forgotten service.  The majority of the dining is further in the building.  Not seeing this area, I have no idea if they were slammed for dinner, if they were understaffed, or if we were just forgotten. The other issue is the table size.  We were in a booth that seated the 3 of us fairly comfortably.  I need to add that this restaurant is DARK.  The floor is dark, the tablecloth was black, the cushions were black...... you get it, a speakeasy.  Our table was round and small, and you'll find it hard to believe me, but as appetizers were brought out and Nicole (sorry if I've spelled your name wrong) was moving items around, there was so much black linen that I misjudged the table size and almost moved a small plate of silverware right off the table.  That table size was barely enough for 2 people.  Our plates, drinks, water and whatnot were all over lapping each other. Food wise, Mr. Houston loves linguini and ordered an entree that included two options.  He received only one of the two.  Grumble, grumble, requested the other and it did come, the linguini was good.  My partner had salmon and said it was delicious. I have never been more embarrassed, I'm old enough to know to go first and check out a restaurant if you are going to wine and dine someone, especially if they are buying.  At the end of dinner, our Houston contact just wanted to go back to his room.  End of evening.  I think I'd like to go back and sit with the "adults" and enjoy the music.  The 1 star boils down to very poor service, being seated (having made a reservation 1 week in advance), in a crappy location that should have been for 2 people instead of 3 and order mixups.  There were 2 but I saw no reason to continue on that road.  So now I pray that Vinnie doesn't come hunt me down & break my kneecaps!

-Dzu0fjQGEZZ65yYhMhOqQ.text: Great food great staff! Was a great experience coming from out of town !! Chefs Are very nice as well

1Io7Hup7BJNqSw3fvS594A.text: Amazing food! Customer service is excellent, which rarely exists in Las vegas anymore. Every dish I have tried here is amazing and huge. A vegas gem.

y86X3uQzACn3GQb0ojvtrA.text: Thought there sauce was terrible and very slow service on a Monday night! I ordered the lasagna and the house made sausage and it arrived cold so sent it back and it came back very dry overall not a good experience

Nm9OWGIrnK1VH2gmT3xs3w.text: We had a great experience at Capo's. From the moment we walked in the door everything was perfect. We were greeted by the host from a secret door who sat us right away. The restaurant is an exact replica of Italian restaurants from the mafia days. Aside from the great decor, the food is also incredible. From the salad, to the soup, to the chicken and pasta, everything was perfect. I ordered the caprese salad and the chicken Marsala on a bed of angel hair and left nothing on either plate. I will be back when I'm in Las Vegas again.

BbBfzRqekY7Ak4n4IR5Zpg.text: This place is awesome! The peephole to see you and let you in the restaurant, the dark lighting and red leather seating adds to the ambiance. We had a large group of 20 people and were able to get the back room to ourselves. Everyone in the party was veryyyyyyyy happy with their dishes. We left stuffed and extremely satisfied!

x0OENGRpwk1TqYL_pR4c2g.text: Yes, we really wanted to like this restaurant. Always looked really intriguing when we drove by. Read the reviews had four stars, so we figured yes let's try it. It was Mother's Day we took my 87-year-old mom there. When we arrived it is a  speakeasy themed. As you enter the  front door there is an the inside door. One has to ring the bell, a  guy opens the little window to peer out and greet us. Really cute . Trouble Is, No one answered. We waited five minutes, ring the bell again, still no one answered. It took 10 minutes for someone to come to the window and let us in. Once inside, the  a atmosphere was fantastic, full of charm and character. The the host said follow me and as we started to, but he disappeared. Mind you, my mom is 87 and very slow at walking. We waited 10 minutes. Meanwhile we see in the distance people  seated being served. Finally the host came back in and told us once again to follow him. He sat us down in the lounge area where the bar is. We sat for at least 15 minutes before our waitress came by. She told us the special, and I asked her about wines. She was not sure of the Italian wine selection, she said that bartender was on break but she would get right back to us. We waited another 20 minutes at least. At last a nice gentleman brought us some water. I asked "please could you find our Server? " He said he would. When server came back, she was very annoyed and curt, we ordered wine politely and we decided we better order our meal too, because we didn't know when we see her again. Another 20 minutes went by before our wine appeared meanwhile our salads came. We saw a wine bottle and three glasses sitting on the bar, we were so close, we could've picked it up and brought it to our table, but we were hoping that she herself by bringing it to us. She, instead was talking to the bartender and walked away, to who knows where. The place was not that crowded. The bartender was very busy which is understandable, but she herself brought us a bottle of wine and poured it. She was very nice. In the meantime main dish came, It was mediocre at best.Tasted like Olive Garden. That's fine, but if I'm dining at a restaurant $25 a plate, I expect something extraordinary. Two different male waiters delivered our food,  both were very nice. We couldn't eat all on our plate so not finding our waitress anywhere again, I asked the bus boy if we could have it boxed up to take home. Someone else came back with the boxes and said here you go! We had to fill them ourselves. Now normally, I would not mind doing this. But, at $25 Plate I expect that  they would box it up for us. This is not a cheap restaurant. Yet another gentleman came by and asked us if we wanted coffee, We said yes, and could we see the dessert menu. He came back and apologized saying the coffee is almost empty and he had to make more. At that point we should've just said forget it, but no being gluttons for punishment, we said that's OK. He also gave us only one menu for the 3 of us to share  We waited again what seemed forever. Our waitress finally came round zooming by. We asked if our coffee was ready and when she had a moment could we have two more menus. She shot us a smart look and said well it takes a while to make the coffee, threw 2 more menus at us. We ordered desert from another gentleman that came very out quickly, creme brulee. But no coffee. The bus boy looked and saw we had a dessert but no coffee, he talked to the waitress she shrugged her shoulders, and he dashed in to bring our coffee. He apologize profusely, we said it was OK because honestly, he was the only one that was on top of it. We finished, and waited for the check,  for 20 minutes. No server. We asked the manager For the check. And he said right away. Our original server, came by about 15 minutes later and she slapped the check on the table without looking at us or saying a word and ran off, huge attitude. We are not hard people to please, but this was totally unacceptable. The dinner came close to $200 for lousy service. I say it's a racked up tourist trap. if I could've given the rating a big fat zero I would've. The only reason I gave it to stars because the atmosphere was really cool.

Tmx1wYniB0db6t1rlco7eA.text: OMG...a must go to when in Las Vegas!!! The food, the atmosphere, the people, the singer/entertainer are all top notch!! You gave to experience this place...when we are in Las Vegas we always go here. You can't go wrong!! Thank you for the best food, atmosphere, people/staff, and Frank Sinatra music/singer!!!

MhsDNAhe1YQcUhWLZZJ87w.text: This place has not only great food and service but is just a fun and exciting place to hang out! You feel like you walked into an old hang out where all the mobsters would go to drink and listen to a live band. We ate here for my sisters 32nd birthday and she couldn't get enough of the decorations and atmosphere. I had the chicken parmesan with spaghetti. The chicken was HUGE! It was a little pricey, $25, but I had so much left over it was basically two meals. The meal came with a salad first and I tried the creamy garlic dressing which was very garlicy but yummy. Before the meal they served warm bread with olive oil and vinegar and the bread was nice and warm!! I spoke with the waitress, Sara, when I went to the "restroom" to order a cheesecake for my sisters birthday dessert surprise. When they brought it out with the candle lit up the band sang to her Frank Sinatra style! We will definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p_163vYNtY4JWd78WI9pFg.text: This was a really fun evening. The food and service were a great break from the traditional Vegas vacation strip meal. The live music was enjoyable too. Not to loud or over powering. Just the right level. I had the veal parmigiana and could cut it with my fork.

FXXA45HU-vlaDE6mIAlw2w.text: This restaurant has really good Italian food. The portion sizes are large you can probably share just about any plate, my husband and I have learned the hard way twice not finishing our food both times we've gone and it's kind of pricey. We both get different plates each time we've gone to try different things and we are pleasantly surprised each time! The mixed drinks are delicious. Sometimes there is live entertainment with a piano player, so that's a lot of fun especially with a large group!  Be sure and make reservations because this place fills up fast.

LSfOLu9SFZsqLKfoNqR36A.text: Pros: The atmosphere was awesome! Food was great and the proportions good.   Cons: wine was super pricey ($40 for a $10 bottle of wine) and waiters hovering around you.

UI0NkksNKB7KE265D_S4JQ.text: We had reservations at 7:45 and still had to wait till 8:30 to get sat. Then waited 30 mins for bread and water. Got our salads before the wine too. This place would be great if they had better service, because we enjoyed the food and the ambiance, but it took 2 1/2 hours to have dinner! The magician that comes around the tables was amazing!

zRuzA4hZ0LExMSrv9hVJFw.text: Sara, the beautiful Spanish server did an amazing job! The food was second, only to her service!

nK2djcuksZkUhUtm5SJWtQ.text: Omg absolutely LOVE Love  this place. From the food to the experience.   The place is set up as an old speakeasy. You go in the back door and ring a bell on a different door. Then a person from the side opens a little window and asks what you want. You give them the code phrase. After asking us if we were followed to which we laughed and said no, he opens a secret door and let's us in. The decor was perfect. Dimly lit with red and black. The menus had a mini flashlight attached so you can read the menu. The walls had lots of mafia pictures up too. When music wasn't playing on the speakers, a piano player was playing. Perfect music to make you feel like you were in a different era.    Food wise: we had fried ravioli as an appetizer that were to die for. So good. I loved the names of their dishes too. It was definitely a theme. Some of the other temptations (appetizers) were "Bust a cap" (mushroom caps ) and "Mafioso Caprese".   For dinner we ordered from their Man Made Man Pastas menu. I had the "Uncle Paulys arrabiata". My friends had "the chef sleeps with the fishes", "Rat pack pesto", and "Vinnies ala vodka". All of our food was absolutely amazingly delicious.   This place is a must see in my opinion and by far the best food I had in Vegas.
