Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The girls enjoying the place
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the restaurant when you walk in

iSlZGOrQmO6lLdzul9KfhQ.text: This place is very cute. The staff was all very friendly. The food was delicious. I am going back again so I can take my mom.

Mj3Ev2mF5LWqIeUXfQgUvg.text: Love this little gem of a restaurant in Las Vegas!  It gives the feel of old Vegas with some really good Italian food. I am a Vegas local and bring out of towners here all the time - they have all LOVED it. In the evening they have live music.  The speakeasy concept is really fun whether you are 10 or 100!

cEzSgIe2tWPZWCAiHAytWQ.text: I almost forgot how wonderful this place is! I used to frequent this place when Nico Santucci, the owner used to chill at the bar on certain nights. Super down to earth guy :) There was a guy on keys back in the day and I'd sit with him and sing a few Italian tunes I have!   Atmosphere? Capo's.... Al Capone. I mean, he really nails it when it comes to capturing the essence of how things were run back in the day. The mafia flare and history, with a sense of friendly customer service!   Now the food? Tonight we had the cheesy garlic bread. I had the Chicken Luchesse. My mother had the Angelo, and my fiance had the parmigiano. I heard not one single complaint! Even though the kitchen was slammed that night (we were seated at the bar in front of the cooking line) everything was presented beautifully. One mistake was my fiance had ordered mushroom risotto but they forgot that and did spaghetti. No problem there! They brought a side of mushroom risotto right out for him....   Mushroom Risotto was definitely my favorite and seemed to be the general consensus. It was creamy, rich, and buttery. The consistency of the risotto was that of a pilaf compared to a calrose or jasmin rice. nom nom ...   My fiance definitely said it was the best chicken parm he's ever had. So expect us to NOW frequent this place yet again.   Mom enjoyed her chicken Angelo. Lighter in flavor but the wine reduction leaves you wanting more.   We shared cannollis at the end of the night, leaving my fiance with the chocolate cake. If you're wanting a wonderfully thick yet moist fudge cake, this is what you want! It's really rich, but if that's your thing, go for it. I don't have a huge sweet tooth, but my fiance certainly does. The plain cannoli had a hint of cinnamon. So good! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NKUN-kx8xIkbYjM5xNjJuQ.text: This place is amazing, the atmosphere was just really neat and the staff was on their game. We did have to have reservations to get in and that had a cancellation so we were able to get in that night. Mainly they say they are booked at least a week out. Once your inside you cant see outside at all its rather dark and chilly (so if you get cold easily then you better bring a coat). I like colder places but it was chilly in there. They have a pretty good selection of food mostly Italian, but some other options as well. They also have really good well drinks and wine also. The service was very well up to par they kept drinks full and waiters were always asking if we needed anything. It was crowded but that makes sense its not a too overly big place inside. They have good portion sized food I had their lasagna and man I didn't really how big of a peice you get. We had appetizers too next time we will skip that, because the food portions are good. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a neat little "mob style" dining!

QxVmYH_CLDyHXAe1hQ0ogw.text: My wife and I had never been there but we're big foodies and we're celebrating my birthday so why not! The food was coming out extremely quick, we weren't even done with our apps when our soups came out, we weren't even done with our soups when our mains came out. It felt super rushed!!! Our server was great except he disappeared for about 30 minutes and eventually someone else had to come check on us. But WORSE OF ALL, THE HOST!!! I wish they would get someone who is actually there to do their job!! He was rude and was more concerned with looking like a customer by sitting on the bar then focusing on the real customers. Not to mention, my wife asked him if they could sing happy birthday, he said yes but we had to buy a dessert! The portions are so big that by the end we didn't want a dessert but apparently that was the only way to get a song so my wife insisted. The dessert we had was okay but we did it just for the happy birthday song which NEVER happened which means the host forgot to write it down and tell our server, extremely unprofessional! It made us even more mad when we saw the table next to us also get a dessert which came out with a birthday candle!! Needless to say you're paying to have dinner inside a museum because the service we received specially by the host who didn't seem to care was pretty bad. We were really excited about going to Capo's but I doubt we'll be back again!

5HNGkZQ6HLVJC9jNrLrNhg.text: Couldn't find the entrance... speak easy style Bad-ass Italian guy manning the secret entrance... speak easy style Flashlights provided to read the menu...speak easy style Dude in a tux singing Frank Sinatra...speak easy style Mediocre cut of veal drenched in a semi-tasty sauce... speak easy style? Half hour in between waitress visits... Umm...speak easy style??

A4ah8j86UR4CQPd7jdlylg.text: First time here and thought the trick door was fun. We didn't have reservations so we sat at the bar. It was a Tuesday so I was shocked the place was booked out. Live music, nice dark ambience. Calamari was ok but nothing to write home about. We got the shrimp scampi and carbonara with added shrimp and two side Cesars. Food was excellent. Service was good. I will definitely be back

nO7SJ34qt0N-uH7wq3YVCw.text: What a great hidden gem. Wonderful mobster schtick with live music and a magician. And the food was delicious too! Nice way to get away from the seriousness of the strip.

e5mbyzxfUN3tkXvEDKgSfA.text: The best place to go for Italian and the BEST steak I've had in Vegas.... I live here and have eaten at quite a few steak places, including the strip. The environment is chill, laid back and I enjoy speak easy theme. Love love love. I take all my guests here when they visit from out of town.

j3j4NLXP_pUuXfKLyuPRMg.text: The left over dish is a must try!! It's so tasty. We come all the way from California just to eat this

YVvUDVAqLghZWczv4VBeag.text: Atmosphere: It's set up to be themed like a Mob Speakeasy and I absolutely love the theme down to the trick door.  We went on a Sunday night and the dinner crowd was beginning to thin. It was extremely dark. How dark? The some of the menus had flashlights attached to them.  They had a live performer singing and playing the piano which I thought was a nice touch.  Food: I really wish I could say I enjoyed the food here. Maybe it was because we came on a Sunday night or it was just an off night for them but I was not impressed at all. Food was comparable to your local Olive Garden.  We ordered the calamari for an appetizer. My comment about it being comparable to Olive Garden might be harsh but this dish is exactly why I said it. The color and texture both reminded me of the calamari at Olive Garden.  Our main dishes were the Vinne's Alla Vodka and Santucci's Pasta.   Santucci's Pasta was very plain. I don't understand the hype about Capone's sauce. Short of them accidentally serving us another sauce on it I was not impressed.  Vinne's Alla Vodka was just disappointing. I'm a sucker for Vodka sauce so I hoped this would be the saving grace. It wasn't. The penne taste like it was only half cooked.  Service: Through it all I can honestly say it was the service that saved this from dropping to a two. Our waitress was absolutely amazing. She gave us a heads up about wait times and when were done even offered to call us a cab. Unfortunately we weren't the only tourists there and kept getting our cabs stolen by other patrons.  11pm came around and our waitress saw we were still waiting outside. The restaurant closed at 10pm. She waited with us until our cab came and got us.  Overall: I don't plan on going back. One and done was enough for me.

0bJHftLujm4cty-fwxh5bQ.text: Here's the low down :  Killer old school Vegas vibes & a dope spot to wow your guests. GO HUNGRY! Like don't eat all day to prepare, haha.  Here's a Capos order euphoria:  "Bust a Cap" - stuffed mushroom caps (you could share but prob will want to literally bust a cap so get your own!)  "Ma's Meat Balls & Peppers" - these are the real MVP!!!! I wasn't even a prior meatball fan, then this dish happened. (Def shareable portion)  "Stuffed chicken Anastasia" - GRADE A DELICIOUS!! Have the MUSHROOM RISOTTO as your side, trust me.   Prepare to leave with a full belly and to go boxes.

zcxr_A2DqjPzTWqF8ZMm1Q.text: AMAZING!!!  From the entrance to the welcome to the service to the food to the music to the drink selection to the food; of you even remotely like Italian food, this place is the BOMB.  My 2 colleagues also thought the same thing.  The atmosphere and the ambience was top shelf.  I had the Uncle Pauly's Arrabiata which was to die for of you like some spice in your pasta.  The salad was also really good.  No appetizers because we figured the entrees would be sizeable which they were not but the salad and pasta were the perfect portion and the perfect price.    I will most definitely be back to this place to eat, drink and feel like I'm in Chicago in the 20s.  Can't for wrong here.    1/25/2017: Still amazing.  Great vibe, great service and some of the best Italian in Vegas.  Couple that the ambience of the music and a local magician performing some table tricks while waiting for our food was a nice touch.  Plus the fact that the prices won't break the bank makes it even more inviting.  The only caveat is if you wish to go with a small or large group, make reservations.  This places fills up fast!

6C4LiqVgSNx9TLs5Vx6aJw.text: Took the family to Capo's for my Pop's birthday. Everyone loved it!  They really played up the whole "speakeasy" aspect and the atmosphere was great!  The food was delicious and the names of the dishes fit in perfectly with the mob theme. They had an wonderful Frank Sinatra style singer and an amazing magician that visited each table. It was a real treat. Thanks Capo's!!!

K4xPlnA5JscFE9G6-VO7Qg.text: We enjoyed dinner at Capo's this evening.  The servers are out of this world!  Not only are they all very good looking, (wink wink)  their momma's would be proud!  So polite and attention to every detail! The food is amazing; tasty and huge portions.  We are looking forward to Capo's again.  It's everything you could want in good Italian food.   Thanks for a fun dining experience!

wq5Ue4NqXcKdbCEzwClK3g.text: Amazing experience and amazing food! Legit Italian spot. From the second we walked into the door the waiter and staff were great. Will definitely be making this place a go to restaurant.

ZJJJzf1AUQjZn7J6xyQ62g.text: I recently had the chance to have dinner here with a friend from out of town. I have heard many a story so off we went.      I found from other reviews that reservation are a sure fire way to go. so I made our reservations and got the password. Others had stated that with out a reservation there visit was not as enjoyable as it should have been. So off we went with password and info in hand..    When you get there its just a rectangle building nothing fancy, and you really don't have to hunt for the door its pretty easy to spot. Once you enter the whole mob atmosphere is in full play. Dark mysterious and a bit unknown. I wont go into to much here as its an experience in itself, But ring the bell and wait...      Once your inside, its a very lively place.. you enter by the bar and its all old school inside. and the matradee takes you to your table. Now had I known there where 2 rooms I would have requested the main room when placing my reservation. The back room is small and you can not see much if anything that is going on int he main area. Its also seems to be where the place you if you brought your kids..( which I do not recommend ). And it is right by the entrance to the kitchen so a bit busy and noisy. But it does have its own charm.      All the chairs and booths are covered in red velvet, which was a nice touch. The music is mostly from a live singer who is doing all the Sinatra hits for the era. We could hear him but not see him as he walks around and sings.      Now I had heard some really bad things about service, so I was prepared. We sat for a what seemed about 10 min with no one addressing us, I was hmmmm, but then a waiter came to the table and got our drink orders and appetizers. Did mention its dark in there? they give you little flash lights to read the menu by.. Thought is was different. The rest of the night waiter service was excellent. Never had to ask for anything. So slow start but nice recovery.     They bring you out bread service, which is nice portion of a fresh sourdough. Or apps and salads where out in a rather timely fashion and where outstanding. I recommend the garlic bread and sauce, I don't know how they make the sauce but it was one of the best I have tasted in a long time. Our meals arrived to the table timed perfectly. The portions are large but not over bearing the plate. plenty to take home. Food was hot, plenty of sauce and delicious. Again the lasagna was fantastic and if you order a meatball its about the size of a softball..  Its a meal by itself.      We where asked if we would like any desert and we passed as there just was no more room. we where not hurried at that point either. we finished our drinks and chatted a bit and then decided to head out. as we got up from our table we where thanked for coming in and we made our way to the main room. at this point we where escorted to the exit. Much like you would have been in the day. you exit through side doors to the parking lot. As we where leaving we took a few minutes and just looked around the room..  lots of old photos and posters.. you really get the feel that the Mob bosses may have been in a corner booth conducting business..        I highly recommend you give it a try, if nothing else just for the experience. And don't forget the password!! the guy at the door doesn't like that..

6MZfOpxfC5MM0r3Pkocnrg.text: I heard about Capo's from a friend and was intrigued...and Capo's did not disappoint! Great experience. Atmosphere, food and service...all excellent. Definitely would go back.

k2o3AtvCZ6quNKMQESkfjQ.text: I liked my the Fried calamari and the chicken anastasia very much. And the rigotta cheese cake was great I had one and got one to go for later.

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken anstasia, was great
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari

z0b3l5D45NMj7EuesX6bRw.text: AMAZING food and great customer service!! Get "The Chef's Swims with Fishes"! You will not be disappointed!

R5_1gme8dxKr9QtjORL0cg.text: This place is fabulous, food, entertainment and service if fantastic! Sangria is a must try!

NcCW9xMd6kfuqWsxjQHzZw.text: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and it was outstanding! The service was impeccable and the entertainment was delightful. The food was out of this world!! For starters we had Ma's Meatballs & Peppers ..... These 2 huge meatballs come in this heavenly marinara sauce and they are DELICIOUS!!! I died and went to heaven when I ate these .... Something so simple but yet so perfectly flavored and just, wow! We also had the Fredo's Wise Guy Alfredo, Angels with Dirty Faces and the special of the day which was the 20oz Porter House Steak with Mashed Potatoes and Salad. For dessert we had Tiramisu martinis which was fantastic - hit the spot after such a decadent meal. Everything was cooked to perfection; I love this place and we will be returning each time we go to Vegas. If I could give them more than 5 stars I would!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 20oz Porterhouse Steak, Vegetables, Mashed Potatoes, Lobster Tail, Caesar Salad and the Angels with Dirty Faces pasta ...
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert: Tiramisu Martinis and a scoop of ice cream for my birthday from the waiter ...
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ma&#39;s Meatballs and Peppers ... DELICIOUS!!!!

W7tJDi9_7bfXUMp-zP92zw.text: Capo's is a hidden gem. Most will stay on the strip when visiting LV, but a few miles West on Sahara sits a dining spit that all must try.  Speakeasies change the dining experience and this one doesn't let you down. The steaks, pasta, appetizers etc. all are amazing.   The service is impeccable and the entertainment is first class.   Earlier this month, I brought customers on back to back nights. This time I brought my family. Awesome all 3 times.

AyIoYfTXYhj4Elm56-QASw.text: Went here for an anniversary dinner and we had a great time. First off, the atmosphere was very cool- don't want to give it all away but the speakeasy and old school Italian vibe works very well with the restaurant and adds to the experience for sure. Food was delicious! Definitely recommend the meatballs and chicken Parmesan, as well as the cannolis yum!   When we were first seated we did have to wait almost 20 minutes to be served and even receive water. This was frustrating and the main reason I only gave the restaurant 4 stars. Once our waiter was able to come by the rest of the service was good- he checked on us regularly and was able to provide us with great recommendations as well as make us feel welcomed.   The added touch of the Sinatra singing is a plus. If you want to visit a classic Italian restaurant with great food- this is the place. What a fun experience!

ZH5bUeacsDbwmll04tzFew.text: NEW!!! Check out the first room to your right when walking in....there is a new private room we used last nite for the 4 of us in our party. It's pretty cool! After paying a nominal fee to reserve the room here is what we received: privacy, personal waiter and busboy with amazing personalities, 4 reserved bar chairs for when we wanted to stretch our legs and enjoy the main dining atmosphere, a big screen TV playing Godfather the movie, constant visits and interaction with management (really great guy) and obviously the best food in town. I would highly  recommend this cozy but spacious eating area next time you have a party of 4-5. 5 stars all the way around! Note: reservations are a MUST. There was a couple turned away because this place is quite busy and well liked.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our own private setting to celebrate the 1 year anniversary for our friends from Tulsa, OK
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bartenders are so down to earth and super friendly...
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Find the secret door...

pwsRQlO5_TtDkyR6IZm4NQ.text: Food is excellent, staff is entertaining and usually sing old Sinatra hits, the decor is old style mafioso Vegas. They do some fun things here (I won't give it away incase you haven't been here before), if your out for a nice romantic dinner or suggesting the same to someone this is the place for sure.   Although it's really more of an italian resteraunt  for dinner we had the two specials that night which were Halibut and a Filet. I had my heart set on pasta when we arrived but was absoluately not dissapointed with the specials. They totally met expectation. Service is always impeccable, we'll be back again soon for sure

GloqFuNrvh55zL9FNAFbbQ.text: As a local, it's one of my favorite old-school places in Vegas! Good food, fun vibe, good prices!  Love Bobby on the mic!!  Highly recommend for a good time!

vK15eYsIdNh7iRfbXhtL2A.text: First let me tell you that the entrance is in the rear of the building. You enter and you'll ring the doorbell. I'm not going to say anymore but I'll tell you it will be fun. Then let me tell you that I'm from Chicago and I know great Italian food. Capo's experience has made me proud to say this is now my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I ordered the meatball appetizer and it turned out to be 2 huge meatballs. They were fantastic and could be an entree. It came with soup, I chose the Italian egg drop soup. Then the veal parmigiana came . It was the largest piece of veal I've ever gotten. It was tender and so good I ordered one to go for my lunch the next day. And they have a singer who was very enjoyable. My server was Erin who was great and I suggest you ask for her. All in all I have become a Capo's regular. GO THERE, you won't be sorry.

ilbYXG_UHVzMvIKTRLYtKg.text: We came here on a Sunday morning with a Travelzoo voucher for their Brunch for 2 w/Bottomless Drinks. Unfortunately, this place is so out of the way that it has to resort to deals to get anybody off the strip and that makes me really sad. We were fortunate to come in on a "Sinatra Sunday" when they had a man singing Sinatra live and wow - he was just amazing, sounded almost exactly like Sinatra - he was even taking requests!  There weren't many people there so our waitress was fairly attentive, we had our bottomless mimosas refilled to our hearts' desire. The breakfast food was average, but that's not why we went. The live music coupled with the dark interior, Prohibition era decoration, photos of mobsters, and even an entrance where you have to knock to be let in - really made this an awesome experience for us, I would recommend it as a must for anybody visiting Vegas and looking to get off the strip.

t6FjiFLoKSDjoszNsCD8Qg.text: 5 stars for sure.  I went there for lunch,  had the house salad and it was great,  the dressing was perfect,  you could tell th eyes made it there,  not bottled and brought in and I appreciate that.  I also had the Chicken Parm,  out if this world,  the chicken breast was huge,  (I had the dinner portion for lunch) and the sauce cheeses and pasta side was just amazing.  Loved the decor,  sat at the bar,  watching the chefs cook,  pretty Co watching them work.  5 stars for sure.

166Al365dP1PwUrliwQciQ.text: This place is AWESOME. From the minute you enter you are taken back to an old style Italian eatery. The food is outstanding and the ambiance is unbeatable. We came looking for a dining experience and were thoroughly impressed. Highly recommended. Enjoy!

Z1jU_OjmnvbaYkxdVkJmzA.text: So so good. If you are staying in Vegas and up for a quick Uber ride off the strip for some excellent Italian cuisine in a really cool atmosphere, this place is for you. I won't spoil all of the surprises, but walking in is like stepping back into time, with a great, dark, "mobster" feel. If you are vegetarian, spend the extra $5 to add a veggie meatball to any entree, you won't be sorry. Fast, friendly service. 1 star taken off for overall experience, because we were seated in a curtained off area which seemed like "overflow" back by the kitchen and it was pretty noisy. Not a huge disappointment, because it was not our first trip to Capo's. Hopefully we will be back to Vegas, and it won't be our last!

33LG9oJaSd8YSEWCUdvhrg.text: I'm very meticulous when it comes to good Italian food . I grew up with my mom hanging the fresh made pasta on the racks on Wed's for Sunday family dinners. That's what you will get at Capos , an incredible east coast sized potion of home cooked Italian cuisine . A fun speak easy type mobster connected feeling upon entering. Every time I have guest in town I put Capos first on the list for me to take them to. We always have an incredible dining experience. It's an old school vibe with a piano and a throw back crooner who will sing all your favorites from the Chairman Of The Board AKA old blue eyes Mr. Frank Sinatra. Good food, great price, excellent atmosphere incredible service. Make reservations. You won't be sorry. They will make you a diner you can't refuse!!!!  You'll  feel like a reel Goomba or if your a Sicilian "Cumpari" Forget about it , Ciao Ciao.

XDZUNAQ0NYFk0gYWOo9JVg.text: Party of 8 attending for a graduation celebration.  Understand that reservations were made and we were seated at table next to a kitchen (separated by hanging dark drapes).   The noise from both the kitchen area and the outrageously loud music made any conversation impossible.  Service was very slow and when requested butter for bread, it took a second request to provide it.  Server, after taking order, only appeared once to inquire if all OK. The extremely dark atmosphere may be part of the restaurant theme but made for a great tripping hazard -- could not see where you were going.  I got the impression the extreme darkness was possible a cover up for cleanliness. Food was OK but not worth the dinner menu pricing.  Definitely would not recommend.

owCedgDRsPEgceg2b1SuDw.text: Coming to Vegas I was told I must try this place, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is fun and it was a must experience.   After coming here I won't be coming back. The evening started out on a positive. Liked the idea and the decorations and atmosphere, but the food was sub par for the price. It said steakhouse so I ventured for the $40 steak. My friend had to change her order due to them being out of food and she was also not impressed with the selection.   We did make reservations and asked about the special to make sure it was still going on when we called. We were assured it was. However, after we ate the waitress brings the bill and after inspection find out the special was not honored.  She then told us that the special was for locals only and we were clearly not locals.   They did finally honor the discount, but not without complaint.  The waitress told me that "next time I just need to be aware". Maybe I should've read more reviews or maybe they should mention that when calling to make reservations.  Either way there will be no next time for this patron.

aH2HKhYLmZdPd8pdtfSP5A.text: Rachel was our waitress and got to say it was awesome! Great experience and great service, Rachel was very nice and attentive to refills and service. It was everything you could ever want in a mob theme restaurant. Very romantic and dark but it was the ambiance and food was perfect. Music was great, very rat pack Sinatra and Martin along with some Godfather tunes. It will be my spot.

4w-B1hxpEf7pdrz84BRGhw.text: Love love love this place. The food is amazing. The atmosphere is so real. My favorite Italian restaurant.

04RnVkW4Xf3q42Joq_PZ3g.text: Delicious Italian food with an old-world Vegas ambiance. Great service from Ashley, great wine, and great food made catching up with old friends perfect. Have fun finding the door to get in! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Lucchese with spaghetti

peumSJl4LjwD30MQOO0sAA.text: Great service and value. Delicious food. Don't miss out! A True Vegas attraction. Everything on the menu was terrific. Especially the garlic cheese bread. Wow!

C5IAr7o1USsz525grXn6Fw.text: My new favorite place. Love the atmosphere and food. Even the entry was fun! Our server, Jeremy, was great and took care of us. I recommend trying it out.

tfDa4du2AVc2_xx5fS8Fwg.text: This is a great place! Iv'e been there three times and all experiences were very good.  Every pasta dish I tried was tasty, especially the ravioli. The fried calamari is exceptional. Service is great. Every staff member was really patient for questions and very nice generally. Notice that the main dishes come with a small salad or soup besides the great appetizers so you might consider it before ordering a lot of appetizers.  All and all I would recommend this place!

4iCDJHu9HQN4FBf4U618WA.text: I took my Cousin and Aunt here for my Aunt's 90th Birthday. We went for lunch and it was very, very good. My Cousin used to own an Italian catering business and she was very impressed by the food. We had the Spaghetti Saltimbocca (not sure I spelled it right), and meatballs. The meatballs were ENORMUS and yummy. We finished off the lunch by sharing a tiramisu. I had not previously been a fan of tiramisu but it was incredible. Our server was Brittany and she answered any questions we had and was an attentive server. The 1940's Mobster theme is well done, and not over the top. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience and I know I will go back when I am in Vegas again.

aBZYcTOontmqE61EXFQElg.text: Atrocious service. My trip here led to a shouting match with the manager. We purchased a groupon for a party of four. The other couple cancelled, and the restaurant manager refused to honor the groupon, even though it would have resulted in us spending more money than we would have.  Apparently they are all good on cash here, so don't bother giving them any of yours. Never had a worse dining, or in this case a "not-dining" experience in my life.   Can't wait to see this place turned into more parking lot. Their terrible management is going to make that happen sooner than later.

_pFbzKCAZXnZ-Vx8QTWuYQ.text: We went for lunch on a Groupon and can't wait to try it for dinner. We loved the place from the ambiance to the food and the service. The service and food were both fantastic. My wife and I are both Italian....The meatballs tasted just like the ones she makes. Great!!

7tYBn_hwDv_gUNhZK5LtIQ.text: Drove around looking for a place for dinner, and just happened to stumble across this place . . . though we would park in the back since most of the front stalls were already taken . . . glad we did the entrance is hidden near the back of the restaurant.  Getting in was a trip . . . but I will not spoil that here . . . that is for you to find out.  Since we did not have reservations and were really pretting hungry . . . we opted for eating at the bar near the kitchen . . . this was like eating at a chef's table in some high dollar restaurant only fun.  The inside decor took us back to the days of what it must have been like back when mobsters ran Las Vegas.  We started off with the stuffed mushrooms . . . Great choice, they we unbelievable . . . then a house salad . . . perfect with just the right amount of itialian dressing . . . and a main course of the lasagna with an extra meatball . . . even though I was starving coming in . . . it was too much for me, but was so tasty that I coulldn't stop.  Our server asked us if we would like desert . . . I always like to look . . . and even tough stuffed . . . I had to try the cannolies . . . out of this world.  We must have done something right though . . . because after we paid the bill and were getting ready to leave . . . out server asked us if we would liike to enter the PRIVATE cigar room for a cigar and some congac . . . not sure how many get to experience this, but it was unbelievable . . . and if I told you who we met and rubbed elbows with . . . well you know what I'd have to do.  This place will definitely be on my to do again list for the next time I visit Las Vegas.

um5-Pc8VlA8RvSCR-j-lDA.text: This place is horrible. My wife got 100 dollars for 50 on groupon so we tried it out, otherwise we would of never gone to this place.   Inside is cool, and that is about the only good thing they have going for them.   The waitress was rude and only checked on us twice in the 2 hours we were there. Why were we there for two hours? well the waitress did not care about us and thats how long it took us to get served the crappiest italian food I ever ate. My wifes ravioli had 5 pieces covered in soupy alfredo which cost 25 bucks. I have chicken parm in which it had no chicken, and kids has spaghetti and meatballs. Every plate of horrible.  We really could not wait to get out of the place. I would never recommend this place to any of my friends. Costs over 100 bucks easy for a family and its the worst. Seriously, CiCis pizza would of been better.

F3G8J69nSXM1zL4d7hoe1A.text: I don't like Italian noodles that much. But this place is so cool, I do like this place, the live music, the magic show, and the special design. If you like Italian food, come here. You will be surprised. P.s. I don't think they offer pizza.

3XFFGreK9r-WYPWgqU3GdA.text: So much fun! An authentic Italian experience. The speakeasy vibe is wonderful. The entrance to the restaurant is exciting, and the service is always good. And the food is always on point. Tuesday's they have a 2 for 1 local deal that's unbeatable. Lunch and dinner prices are reasonable for what you get.

UmF8CSUET3xRfKke6BsmbA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE!! Based on reviews I went with the scar face shrimp scampi. It was soooo good and a big portion too!  I was sad I wasn't able to take the left overs home since I came here for my birthday and was staying at the mirage. The atmosphere was the best. Super dark with the piano player goin it felt so romantic. Best bday dinner ever. Thanks Capos, please don't ever break my heart!

Iy7v_1fh2Us_EOkiTZgrdw.text: I love this place !!!! It's dark and fun with great food.   If you want great Italian food with an amazing dining experience this is the place to try. I went with a small group and had a blast!

cOuENHQ_MXWPKxHwpoZ3Xw.text: This is a True hidden gem!!!! Everything we ordered was to die for! I would highly recommend this place to any and everyone! Being a culinary student this is definitely a kitchen I would love to even work in! My experience was that amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing fresh pasta! This is to die for!

22dBPN5YYly2VwR8bIN34g.text: Overall, it was a good experience! got a groupon $30 for $60. I feel like our waitress put us off to the side after she got sat with another party who probably didnt have a groupon.  food wise, this place was great! My boyfriend got the spaghetti and huge meatball and I got the penne a la vodka with chicken. We only go to a handful of Italuan spots in L.A. because we like authentic Italian. We will definitely be back for the food! The ambiance was really cool too! Red velvet and read leather, dark with small chandeliers. The entrance to this spot was a real treat, makes you feel like a mobster, especially after going to the mob attraction at the Tropicana, Fogetaboutit! Don't forget the calamari and red wine!  Only downside is that it is off the strip and getting a taxi is pricey! From the Tropicana to Capo's was $25 one way!

-xIe2wjN2vPelyBYNWwpfA.text: Absolutely phenomenal! The service was excellent- from the doorman, the entertainment, and the waiter. And the food was out of this world! We especially enjoyed the Caesar salad (homemade dressing is wonderful), the mushroom risotto, and the lasagna (meat and cheese galore!). Will definitely be returning on our next trip to Vegas.

pvzj9g1UAUGOgS_9AiltmA.text: Food great. Service pitiful!!  Had to ask for everything. Waitress kept disappearing and had to go find her. I think they completely forgot to turn in my order then made excuses for why it took 40 minutes to get an appetizer. We had a large party and they refused to split the check, we had to calculate the bill tax & tip. Then waitress got an attitude with us because she had to wait for us to figure out the bill. Such a shame. This is 3rd time I've had this experience here. Doubt the 25 people in our party will return.

NGH8AyzkuZG7YzElP8j1sQ.text: Went for Valentine's day.  Great ambience for that special day. I had the lasagna, delicious!  My gf had the meatballs, more delicious!  Hahaha.  The meatballs are great!  I believe they used ground Italian sausage.  The sauce is great. The singer singing ol' blue eyes songs was on point.  Definitely recommend this place.

YzVCT_2ppdt2VSgTAZf3Yw.text: The food here is amazing!!! Can't say enough about that!!! Bartender was very unfriendly when sat to have a drink, as was mad no one stocked bar ahead of time. Waitress we had was off as well, concerned with way more other things than service to us. Waiters around us were great though with there tables and just wish we had one of them serving us.

IR9luLU21Ut2G_ZhScM_cQ.text: This place is just amazing! Since the moment that you get in at the restaurant they make you feel in a Mafia movie. The customer service deserve 10 stars, they are really pleasant. The menu is not to big but you can find really good options. We ate the primavera and carbonara and it was delicious. I definitely will come back.

4xu40s5Lj5T36eg4tpClkA.text: The food wasn't bad, in fact it was decent but not as good as some I have had in Las Vegas. My rating isn't based on the food it is based on the distinct feeling small children aren't "very" welcome. Firstly while many people find the "faux mob" motif part of the ambience I found it quirky. From having a small window opened to the "mob whisper" host. This is their "thing" and judging from reviews it is well received so this is MY problem not theirs. My issue was actually that we went late afternoon/early evening with our 3 year old and 7 month old. We were sat by a side door-which was opened a couple of times letting broad daylight into an otherwise very dark restaurant. We definitely were sat "out of the way" of everyone-that is the feeling I got. Our server was decent-not great, service was decent. What my rating is really down to is they clearly wanted us out before the "dinner crowd" really started and it was painfully obvious. I was a waitress in college so I know about rushing people out/turning the "four top" etc and this was definitely the feeling I got. I think an all adult party who liked the "faux mob" motif would be received better and quite like this restaurant.

F5BM8-NyjhNNOg6gnPsZzw.text: I love this place! Me and my boyfriend came here because he loves Italian food, and he's very picky. First impression, I didn't know what to expect. I'll leave it at that, because it's honestly better to experience it first hand. Inside the decor was nice, dim lit but romantic.   The ambience was like old-school Vegas, like what you would see in those old gangsta mob movies. I really enjoyed it. There was a guy who sang old school Vegas songs. I was in love, with the ambience, food, and my partner. It was pure magic. I would like to come here again. Hint, hint to my boyfriend. lol ;)

nNzJhtZsyklFTnlEnoVAjw.text: Really good food, extremely nice staff, and super cool atmosphere. There's a secret entrance to get in...Check it out!!

I8wulLnCpB0CXUtuLXnyUQ.text: According to the owner, the old chef is at the new location on sahara.  We always have fun at capo especially people tend to loosen up when it's so dark.lol Food is always good, love how they mix toasted garlic and fresh garlic together in most of the dishes.  One of my favorite italian restaurant in vegas especially when I have friends visit from other states.

mOTCseeB-gJ9v9n1DeyD5g.text: Food was phenomenal as always, service was stellar. We always come here for our pasta cravings and Sinatra music. Best in town in my oppinion. Recommend to any couples or special events with a loved one or family. Will always come back no matter what.

8QSKHIbDVE8Z18YcgwmU1w.text: Amazing! Went in with a party of 10. Everyone enjoyed there food. The staff were very attentive. Best Italian food I've had in a long time! Reminds me of my Italian mother in law's cooking! FYI getting in to the place requires a password the place is entertaining! There was a magician. Thought the guy was going to be typical, he was mesmerizing! We gave him a nice tip! He deserved it

H3LR0MThpHmHE1u3Juao0w.text: 5 stars all the way. The food was out of this world amazing, the decor and theme inside was to die for and the food was an Italian dream come True! Rachel was an amazing server and the rest of the staff tending to our table were also very nice and attentive. My husband and I have officially found our Italian restaurant home!

UAChlQa8WMM6Z7zsdgLDJg.text: Simply put , the best that Vegas has to offer. Excellent food, drinks, entertainment, service by server Jeremy. Do not miss this place when in Vegas. Great bang for the bucks

i2DNUiLu1u2KHcitXw-Lmw.text: Took family here just to show them how cool the restaurant is. We had 11 people so the "waitress" automatically gets a gratuity she doesn't even remotely deserve.. We've now had this same gal 3 times and I don't understand why she hasn't been fired.  We finally said no more Capos after last nights' dinner.  It's very frustrating to feel stuck at a restaurant for 2 and a half hours solely based on a horrible waitress. It's always fun to have people show up a half hour after you and they're fed and gone before we get our food and sit there with empty drinks. Oh, and my Aunt got her dinner 10 minutes before the rest of us so she sat there waiting for our meals, we told her to eat it or share it because it was a 50/50 if any of us were getting fed at all. Shame on you Capos for allowing just one person to ruin what should have been a simple fun night.

VxJS5KpWtif2a6iX-RVoiQ.text: Did t know what to expect since it was off strip!!! Went with colleagues. We had the best time. The scene was great but the food was amazing!!!!! And we are NJ & NY residents. The meatballs/ were insane. The penne Alla vodka sauce was really good. Everything we ordered was awesome.

IcGUyPjFTGgdK-MG6rHhDw.text: I've lived in vegas for a very long time and I've seen this place for a very long time and my dad and I finally decided to try it.  I love the theme and how you have to enter the place, although the inside is very dark, it's just part of the atmosphere. The singer was very very good and not over bearing. The prices are a LITTLE high but the portions and the quality were FANTASTIC!  Service was not bad, but we definitely had a new server that didn't know how to talk to guests. I'd say he was in his very early 20s and would touch my dad on his shoulder a few times, he's call both of us bro, bud, etc . If it was part of the atmosphere of the place then yea it's no problem but in this case it wasn't. Although he was attentive (which I definitely appreciate) and he was nice and wasn't at all rude, he needs to learn how to talk respectfully to his customers.  All in all he did a good job and he'll learn.   1 thing that was a big disappointment.. DESSERT!  I have been to Noras and now here and both have awful desserts. I tried the Tiramisu here and it was blah!  I haven't met an italian yet in vegas who can make a good Tiramisu, they make it the american way and it's not very good :-(    Other then dessert, we will definitely be back very soon.

wsBnLzeoWQ9cO-3Bnkiv3Q.text: What a fun experience!  It's like an old Italian speak easy, with secret door entry.  For a special event, we sat in a private room, where we could pick out our own mob movie, (Bronx Tale), and had such a fun evening.  Reasonably priced, and highly recommend!

M6CCDpeonSVHiJnsepfcUQ.text: Great food, but not accomodating for large parties. Won't split the check and auto gratuity is also on tax. It's too bad because service is wonderful, ambiance is nice and food is delicious.

mdrr2UwpV7TOI1-JyyOPAg.text: Of all the places I've rated, this deserves the highest honor. Terrific food, the meatballs are fantastic, but what really sets them apart is the service. So nice. So polite. No attitude. The only place I've ever had just as good service was on a Princess cruise ship. Well done, Capo's. Will definitely come back!!!

534ancRwhW25Y8K4V8BIAA.text: Our waiter Jeremy was great ask to sit in his section. A little bit of an attitude which adds to the mob style - good job bucko!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at the size of those meatballs!

S9qy2xw6o1VvHmdlyL-leA.text: Full disclosure: I've been wanting to eat here for at least a year. Capo's owner, Nico Santucci, randomly followed me on Twitter so I took a look into what he was all about when I discovered Capo's. A mob themed Italian restaurant with a speakeasy style entrance? Sold! After finally getting to dine here,  I can say it exceeded everyone of my expectations. I had a reso for 5:30 (highly recommended BTW) and got in using the password (found on their website). It was cool to play along with the door man (apparently I had Auntie G's money) but when we got in he was so nice. It is very dark in there so watch your step. Our table was near the bar but you can see the kitchen so it was a bit brighter than if you sat near the back. Our server, Brandon, was very good, very attentive. One of the ways I judge a restaurant's service is how often my water glass gets filled. Never got below halfway so zero complaints. The food? Unbelievable. I had the Chicken Anastasia with a side of spaghetti. My companion had the lasagna. The Anastasia was perfect. The pink sauce was rich and the chicken was tender. My companion said the lasagna was the best she's ever had by a wide margin. They absolutely do not skimp on the ingredients. I had a bite of the lasagna and it was an explosion of cheese.  The Capone's Secret Sauce was a wise investment by Mr. Santucci. It is absolutely delicious (just ask Adam Richman) There is live entertainment here with a gentleman singing Sinatra tunes. So between the dark vibe and the singing it makes for a great atmosphere. However, be sure to ask to sit closer to the back of the restaurant where it's quieter as the bartenders chatter can take you out of your zone. My companion can be picky so I was afraid she wouldn't care for it but nope. She loved it. Capo's is a place we will be visiting every time I'm in Vegas. Buon Appetito!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Anastasia with a side of spaghetti. It was as good as it looked.

jk6hTCbnSlwryHQxNF6jvg.text: I love coming to Capo's! The food is amazing! Great service and the ambiance is the best. You won't be disappointed if you eat here. Best red Sangria in town!

7smit34lhmaO4QIQQy7pJQ.text: It was our 5th anniversary and we wanted to do something out of the ordinary for dinner. We'd never been here before but had heard great things. We checked out the website and were really intrigued, it looked fun! Then to top it off, we found a 'Groupon Now' deal that was $25 for $50, so we gave it a shot.  When we got there the entrance was confusing, we thought we were in the wrong place. But we were delighted when we were greeted through the little hidden window and welcomed in. Instantly we knew this would be a place we'd return to. The decor is so romantic, velvet wallpaper, red leather booths, and chandeliers hanging above each table. They had live music by a piano player and later there was a lounge style act while we ate. It really was entertaining rather than distracting, and the music was mostly love songs. Being that it was our anniversary we even got up and danced - I didn't expect this at dinner!  The menu looked good but we ended up ordering both specials for the evening: Filet mignon and halibut with risotto.. They were fantastic! We couldn't believe the food was so good! The wine list was a little pricey, but not totally unreasonable.  The biggest surprise was the service. Our waitress was very attentive, offered suggestions, gave us tastings of the wines we were debating about and was not at all put off when she found out we had a Groupon.  A man came around selling roses, which I think could be annoying if you're not with a date, but for us it was an added feature for an anniversary meal.  We will be coming back soon, esp. because they regularly offer their Groupon. I'd highly recommend trying this place but go on a night that you're up for the entertainment.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The dining room

YYTbWRY9jpGtxcqwurGeHw.text: We ordered the tomahawk steak special and shared it! We had it cooked rare and our waiter Brandon was so excited! When it came out it was medium rare. We were ok with it. If it woulda been cooked anything more we woulda sent it back. Was very good. Had a pasta on the side. Our pasta was al dente. I've never been a fan but the sauce was good. You could never imagine this place used to be a Hooters. Seems like it's been here forever. Brandon told us that Tuesday are 2 for 1 for locals. Love that u gotta ring the bell and they slide open the door and ask who it is and if u have reservations! We'll be back! Live entertainment! Good stuff!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our tomahawk steak!

2sRmfLCrTPpfNv-W5H84Sw.text: I was really excited to come here. And I wanted to love the food. The "host" was awesome - he gave us the "mob" feel. Unfortunately, my meal was terrible. For $26.95, I expected the shrimp scampi to be perfect. The pasta was extremely mushy and sauce watery. And I should've returned it. Only 5 medium shrimps? Oh, and my friend's chicken parmigiana was so-so.  It pains me to give such a bad review considering all the 5 stars. Maybe it was a bad night for the chef? But I will not return.

jG-wWhiz8541z8dallZgUg.text: Really good food and awesome service. Waiters had great personalities. We enjoyed  everything.

ulynq5UcnnuXUzTJm9c61Q.text: We travel all over the world and when we arrived at Capos we were very pleased! It was packed so we sat at the bar but the ambiance was terrific! Food was WAY better than expected! Head off the strip for this Italian gem !!

1TppeGri1bp-BzzX6oNCgA.text: Came for the lunch Groupon special and was super impressed! Both my wife and I had pasta that we felt was far better than most Italian joints. I also love the decor and feel of this quaint little speakeasy. The service was top notch and my glass never went empty! We will absolutely be back!!!

somULcugvmN8fWBQaDoaqA.text: The food was good.  The service was terrible and waitress was rude.  Entertainment was fun.

us-_N5xxTJJePsX8vdNtWw.text: The food was so good I forgot to take a picture. I had the Pedro pasta with chicken and my bf had the spaghetti and meatballs and they were both soooo good.  We also had the Italian salad and it was really good.  I would definitely recommend making a reservation because it was our first time here and we didn't know.  It's a must try.

jyEq4kgMO75bABrJ8G9rmw.text: Went for lunch, the Italian Beef was very good. Go with the pasta salad over the fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MoJKkO2xE35d9uGE4h9IkQ.text: Brought some friends this time.My friends loved the speak easy entrance.It was a surprise 70th birthday party that I arranged in advance! The restaurant took advantage of me because they claimed,Brandon who I had spoken to twice never write down my reservation or noted the fact that he would allow me to use multiple coupons! So now they would allow it but not include the soft drinks which are supposed to be included.  They were supposed to just take my 22 friends orders, instead the waiter asked for add ins of shrimp or meatballs to the various menu items. I objected they went back to each person all declined the add ins except 1 party who they still put on my bill. They yelp offered $10 off $75 or more which they would not give me. Because I used a coupon! My bill was almost $300 plus cost of coupons and I thought this very cheap of them! Food is always great but, the way they treated me was shabby.  By the way they charge $25 to serve cake that I brought with using my paper plates! Cheap cheap cheap

jRbp1l-RprwwEgPo3N1_9g.text: Overall, the foods were good. The pasta dish with the extra add on shrimps tasted delicious. Service was prompt.

QV1uabedL1VXBhRitm_TcA.text: The best part about this restaurant was probably the beginning when you have to guess a password & they walk you in through a secret entrance, the setting is nice  but the food wasn't what I expected AT ALL! specially for their high prices. It was a total of 12 people in our table and only 4/12 people liked their food. First of all the food took about and hour to come to our table, by that time you already just want to get out of the place. Second my pasta was hard and the sauce didn't compliment  the plate at ALL, when we told the waitress that we hadn't enjoy our meal she scattered my plate looking if I had ate any of my shrimps & telling me why I hadn't said anything in the beginning ( okay? But keep it to yourself because it sounded & looked SO RUDE). She did make a discount to our tab , but with attitude. Overall my experience wasn't a great one & I will probably not come back again when I know they are many places with better quality food & less pricey.

xLDypxLEaXGmJnrKiiV8XA.text: Place is disgusting. I was told that they were going through a renovation.  Yet I see an inspector come behind the bar to check around.  I've seen this man before.. pest control.  Seems like they have an infestation of some sort.  I decided to leave because it seemed unsanitary and I didn't want to get sick.. gross .

__CbQb0Y3PWrcBj8CRUwJA.text: Got a Groupon Deal for this place " when we ware done with our food our server told us we Cannot use it " The Groupon Can only be use from 11AM-3:00PM  I admit I was upset but when I though about how good our service was , and How Good Our food was and , how one of a kind experience we just had    I forget I even was Upset for them not taking our Groupon LOL . " I will definitely will go back with oh without GroupOn we enjoyed every Moment of it

3jf1LFlifzfl-I5GeSFGoA.text: I wish I could give this place 10 stars!  Yes, folks, 10 stars...  I looked at how many stars this place had and of course the pictures before we went.  However, I am so glad I didn't read all the details and we went to the location and were surprised.  As much as I want to put all the details of my favorite entrance at an establishment ever on this review, I will refrain so others can enjoy it without expecting it as well.   Once you are seated, you are amped up from the entrance and things keep going up hill from there.  We immediately ordered our drinks and began to look over the exquisite menu.    Only down fall is that we went at dinner time, and I have 2 picky teenagers. They both wanted to order meatball sandwiches, which is only on the lunch menu and you cannot order for dinner.    They were also out of lasagna which would have been a 2nd choice for my kids.    I ordered the chicken Anastasia with a side of spaghetti.  The chicken dish was so amazing.  The chicken was crisp and crunchy on the outside which is so unique and appetizing.  I didn't try the spaghetti, because I am not really a fan of spaghetti (it is always boring) so I took it to go.  Later that night, when I gave in and decided to eat the left over spaghetti, I was absolutely shocked; it was so tasty and flavorful.  No one, not even Spaghetti Factory has such flavorful spaghetti. Oh and my daughter upgraded to the Caesar salad (she let me have a taste) and I was so jealous! It is not your average salad and I was craving it all the next day. My salad had artichokes which was off the hook.   The atmosphere is classy, and since it was dinner, our candles were lit and the lights went down.  We did get to enjoy the piano being played toward the end of our stay.    We love Capo's and cannot wait to go back.

-5MUBLl6hXICYrTFMRGmvw.text: I used to come here often back in 2010.  I came here a couple weeks ago.  I really enjoy the atmosphere.  It's super dark inside.   I enjoy the Italian food, music and shows on tv.  I normally come here during lunch time and order dinner dishes.    Cheese Garlic Bread (The dip was delicious!) Tony's Duck Soup (Pretty Good!) Scarface Shrimp Scampi (Yum!)  It wasn't so clean the last time we came here.  Sticky seats and table cloths and holes in them.  A bit run down since I was here last here in years.  Still good food though.

tAO7DBH-W0ea0MXXW0yqIA.text: Great food and even better atmosphere. I definitely recommend the short drive off strip.

RJtZzipsFOg_MfViLCck2g.text: We had a great meal at Capo's. We arrived without a reservation about 8:30 pm on a Tuesday; the place was packed. The host graciously sat us but warned us we were sitting near the kitchen so it might be loud. Male vocalist (lovely voice) was singing Sinatra and my husband kept telling me it was a recording of Sinatra and not live. It wasn't until the end of dinner that he believed me!  Our server had an Italian mafioso accent and he was very attentive. I had the pasta fagioli; it was very flavorful and more broth-like rather than thick which is what I prefer. Also tried the "Angels with a dirty face" which is angel hair pasta with prosciutto, peas & mushrooms in a pink sauce (mixing the Alfredo with a red sauce?).  It was perfect as was my husband's Chicken Parmesan. The chicken was so tender he didn't need a knife. He also added a meatball (huge and delicious).   Next time I will make a reservation and sit away from the noise of the kitchen. No, I'll sit anyplace to eat that food again!

4OdR3fEhYMTiaGwKCfKA_A.text: Always delicious. It was busy for a Tuesday night with it being locals night. If you show your ID, you get buy one get one free for entrees up to $20. Can't beat that!!

cLtXw2k4pcfDk50dfoeA7Q.text: The atmosphere is fun.  The food was good, but service is AWFUL.  No olives in the martinis, no silverware on the table and the waiter came by to take our drink order, order dinner, dessert and give us the bill.  Never checked on us.

egTaL6TUxvy0q0Y1gmEAig.text: This was our 2nd time there, friends took us. A unique place when entering!!!   But AMAZING food- the meatballs are a must to try! Staff are great & recommend the popular items, however from what I've had/tried I think most items on the menu are excellent! It's an amazing experience & great place to relax & be with friends!

YHtXOKOiHbmwiDs8Zp3PBw.text: I ended up at Capo's after turning up too late to seat on a Sunday night at a couple of other venues.  The decor here is pretty lush ... and I suppose that's the main attraction. Red (or black) curved banquette seating. Black velvet fleur-de-lis reps on gold-foil wallpaper. Lots of dark woods everywhere. Brass & gold chandeliers over the tables. Very dark lighting. That sort of thing.   Adding to it was the ambient music, delivered by a piano player ... on a real piano ... who tickled ivory all across the Great American Songbook.   In certain other ways, the whole old-school Italian message went a wee bit over-the-top. Huge mugshot photos of Al Capone, Bugsy Siegel, Lucky Luciano, Frank Sinatra, et. al. The TV closest to me was running "Donnie Brasco." And half the items on the menu were tagged in similar fashion, such as "Rigatoni Trafficante" and "The Gallows with Clams." Yes, the latter is linguine. And there is a bit of gangster theater at-the-front-door, Ring the bell, the greeter opens a secret panel through a small picture hanging on the wall, you ask to get in. Then a door--a door-in-the-wall-that-wasn't-there, not the door-that-looked-like-the-door--opens to let you in. Oh my, Mabel, this must be a speakeasy!  OK that part of the atmosphere, again, seems a little bit too overcooked for my palate. It's not my money, but if it were, I would take that stuff down a notch. I suppose it's for tourist-effect, who'll go home saying this is joint is 'authentic vintage Vegas.' Or something like that.  But the actual dining spaces are very MidCentury gourmet-room lush, and so one can easily overlook all the other.  I went with the Italian house salad, included with the 14-ounce no-bone ribeye, mixed veggies & mashed potatoes. A pretty durn good meal. The salad dressing was seasoned oh-so-well and the ribeye was also charcoaled quite well - and juicy. That was a $40 plate, btw. I took a pass on the 24-ounce porterhouse 'special' at $60. Those prices are a wee bit higher than I would marry to the overall experience, but hardly enough of a difference to call them a deal-breaker.  There's a Tuesday 2-fer-$20-off deal, if you pony up for a couple of cocktails. I am basically immune to alcohol consumption, so I didn't look at the cocktail prices ... and so I can't tell you if the $20 is already buried in them. And there's also a "Sinatra brunch" on Sundays from 11am until 2pm. Let's just hope that by "Sinatra" they don't mean it's endless shots of Jack Daniels chased with a bowl of olives!  I liked this place, clearly, for the core of its decor and its respectable food. So I think I'll keep it on-the-radar primarily as a solid atmosphere option during an evening out with a lady companion.

26MOKOuUSYztwB0P2yNhSQ.text: This is such a wonderful little restaurant in Las Vegas. Dim, very cool, speakeasy atmosphere. Great service, great food, live italian music (they take requests). Whether you are a tourist or local, you have to check this place out.

Pl8sgjOcHgnewv2zbePZcw.text: I LOVED the idea of this restaurant and a friend who has cancer and can barely get out of his house.  He was very excited to experience this restaurant and show it to me last night.  He made reservations weeks ago.  You walk in and knock and a guy with an Italian accent asks what you want kind of rude which was great.    But once we got in we were put in the first booth so there was no way to watch the entertainment at all.  My friend who is probably not going to get to go out much longer i felt bad because the whole point was to show me the entertainment which we never got to see.   Our waitress although she was very nice was pretty slow and the biggest problem is she barely spoke English.  I believe she was from the middle east. Again extremely nice lady. But we could not understand the specials, her accent was so heavy and she spoke so fast.   We ordered steak and lobster and the lobster and steak  were perfect but the risotto was too chewy and bland.  I make risotto my self and it comes out so much better.  The rice definitely wasn't fully done.    Also it took forever to get our food. Then when they brought out our plates it took another ten minutes to get a knife to cut our steaks.    The waitresses did not ask how our food was.  This place has the best concept ever.  But definitely disappointed with our experience.   I will try this again maybe with my family and update my next experience.   But i do love the concept, I just think if someone who is sick makes a reservation in advanced spends almost 300 in a restaurant should not be thrown in the front booth.  I am sure this place offers a great experience but sadly we didn't get to enjoy it.   Hopefully this was just a fluke and next time we will be treated better.

kq4fs7Q7JDsPmELYWqGbQw.text: A slew of prohibition-era themed restaurants & bars use secret doors & gatekeepers who ask for passwords; Capo's is no different. They are fully committed to the speakeasy theme, which is cheesy, but fun; a sultry lounge singer, ultra dim lights, & menu items dedicated to mobs and gangsters convey an air of danger & mystique even though your surroundings are totally safe (it's a family-friendly or Girls' Night Out kinda place, to be honest.)   Capo's isn't just all about the theatrics, the food is actually really good...I'm not sure he would agree in regards to his veal Parmesan, but I enjoyed our "temptations" (appetizer) called "Dino's Deep Fried Ravioli" with tangy pink sauce. My "Man-Made Pasta, spaghetti & meatballs named "Santucci's Pasta," was indeed well-made (see what I did there?)  A few blocks from the Strip, which means your wallet catches a temporary break (until you get back to gambling & eating somewhere in Caesar's or the Cosmopolitan.) Check in on Yelp for $10 off of $75.

H2MRyvWB69JKKtN2D19ikg.text: Had a great time here. The server Sara is super friendly! The food is amazing and the door guy Ziggy is hilarious.

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8EQcuePE6N-YwyCkKTgpnQ.text: Loved this place!  Make sure to make a reservation, we saw many people turned away during our Saturday night visit.  I ordered the lasagne with a Caesar salad and my husband ordered the rigatoni with a house salad.  We also shared the caprese appetizer.  Everything we had was fantastic!  My salad was garlicky, which I loved.  My husband's salad with Italian dressing was also good, but he found it to be too salty.  The caprese was composed of some fantastic prosciutto on top of perfectly ripe tomatoes, creamy mozzarella, and fresh basil.  It was quite good.  The rigatoni with Alfredo sauce was very heavy with a mild flavor, but we both loved it.  The lasagna was one of the best I've ever had!!  I think the use of their excellent meatballs in the lasagna is what really made it so excellent.  While I wouldn't rate Capo's as a 5 star restaurant on food alone (I reserve those ratings for the particularly spectacular), the ambiance was super fun and interesting.  It would be a great place for a large group dinner or for a romantic date, and you can't say that about many places.  Highly recommended!

ychb14qK5xE95F5kY3vg9w.text: It was good.  Not great, but good.  If I lived closer, I'm sure I'd go again in hopes that our experience was just an off night.  We got there at 5 on a Friday night and there were only three other tables with people at them (not busy).  The sangria was not really good, my wife liked the Amaretto sour.  The Brushetta was tasty, unfortunately ran out of tomatoes before running out of bread.  We both had the Vodka penne (I added sausage).  The sausage was good, the vodka sauce was really good.  We saved room for dessert and had the canolis.  Again, just good.  There was nothing above good. Now for the bad.  The service was so slow.  We almost got up and left.  I ordered the Brushetta at the same time I ordered the drinks, which was as soon as we sat down just about.  Everything took too long to make it to the table.  I eat out a lot and when I say it was slow, I have a lot of places to compare it to.  Watching other tables, we saw other people getting impatient waiting for their food. Oh, our waiter, Francisco, was very nice.  Sorry, almost forgot that.

VlPyalB1_vUJszImJ5IQkA.text: This is one of our go to places when we have visitors in town. Quirky based upon the old speak easy's of yesteryear. From the surprise entry to the "brash" host you travel back in time. The place is dark with low lights so you get a flashlight with your menu. Great drinks from the bar and live entertainment. The food is really True Italian with the large meatballs and homemade sauce a must try. If your in town and get a chance to go by all means do so.

tto981ffvm-wu0orkaxOvw.text: One of our favorite restaurants in general in Las Vegas and definitely our #1 Italian place! My favorite is the creamy garlic salad to start with Vinny a la vodka with a meatball! They also have a delicious vegetarian meat that my partner gets everytime as well. Besides the food being great, the atmosphere is also fun and service is almost always spot on.

uPE4yDyaXC0BeO5qGg7cig.text: The food here is amazing and authentic. I got the Spaghetti and meatballs, and the taste was unbelievable! Be weary of other Italian Cuisine's, a lot of other places will use just one large noodle to rip off their customers. I can say with full confidence that Capo's Italian Cuisine has the best interest of their consumers!

kGG8Asx9l3wU5f1WcbcdmQ.text: I was referred this place because I'm from Jersey and I'll admit a tough critic. I read the other reviews and was torn from the bad vs the good. I first tried to book a reso for my boyfriend and Is anniversary and open table was booked, tried to call and couldn't get through. My dads in town from Jersey and I figured give it another try. I was blown away!! We entered this speakeasy style room and a little door opened with a guy who's NY style sarcasm made my heart miss home. Not for the easily offended. He sat us to our table and from there Sara and her busser team timed everything flawlessly. My boyfriend, father and I are all in the service industry and were very impressed with the service. If you're nice to them theyll be nice to you! With a sprinkle of wit and sarcasm of course.  The ambiance is perfect. Live singer and I usually HATE dim lighting. There are small flash flights in the menus to help read. By then your eyes adjust and the chandeliers above the tables provide just enough light.  We got a bottle of wine $50 Black Diamond Cab. Standard good, my favorite is The Prisoner; and some apps. The meatballs and cheesy garlic bread are a MUST. We also got the bruschetta which was very tasty! But filled me up quick.  For entrees I got the eggplant parmesan with angel hair, they got a blackened chicken linguine and an angel hair shrimp scampi. All astounding! Truly recommend because I'm a Chicken/Eggplant/Veal Parm snob.  We lastly told our waitress it was my dads birthday, the singer had been coming around continuously throughout the night and then again to sing happy birthday with a tiramisu. Which was so light and delicious!  The communication between the waitress and busser team did not go unnoticed but the experience truly started as soon as you "ring the bell" I'd recommend this place to any east coast friend coming in to town looking for a piece of home. 5 stars!

zuhllJjtATknD9KQ5cqYgw.text: Atmosphere is fun! They play the part very well and the entrance sets the tone. The restaurant is extremely dark, so if you're not into that for some reason, this isn't the place for you. The menus even have little lights on them because it's that dark!  We started with garlic cheese bread which was yummy! I had the chicken parm with pasta and a meatball. The chicken was delicious and the meatball was very good. The side of spaghetti wasn't anything special.   The waiter was attentive and they were fast with refills, which I like! Overall I think this is a fun place! The first time I visited the restaurant, they had loud music which was way too loud but this time they were playing old songs...which went with the theme of the restaurants. We were there early on a weekend night, so maybe we were lucky to miss the loud music lol.   We used a $10 yelp check in offer, which made our bill $69 for two people.

jA1L3mcULikRwajzxj1nDw.text: When the speakeasy window opened, I gave them the password "mobster" to ensure admittance. The order consisted of spaghetti with meatballs and Italian sausage and lasagna. Dimly lit, comfortable environment with excellent service. Many traditional Italian dishes looked good on the menu. (I love Italian food) Next time, I'm getting the shrimp scampi. Definitely recommended.

FfnCuMQWcW75lFjXknXl4g.text: I must admit the experience was like many of the reviews said it was .   This is a must if you want some of the best home made Italian food .  The atmosphere is like alcapone days , low light in the restaurant, to get in you have to give a password, a guy singing Sinatra etc It is reasonably priced and the experience is wonderful .  We will be back !

BKgRHySfEvCVPVHDZ42KxQ.text: This place is amazing!!! I am a huge fan of Italian food and this was by far the best antipasto platter I have had!!! Everything was amazing! We definitely will be back

Wt1qj4ezNie2cu9rk1jTdg.text: Wanted to take advantage of the 2 for 1 special.  The waitress lets us know we need to buy drinks to get the special, so we order drinks.  After the drinks come she tells us we need to be residents to take advantage of the special.  What a cheesy way to make us buy drinks!  Ordered the bust a cap, capo's house salad, Rat pack Italian beef, and Santucci's pasta with meatball.  Bust a cap was okay, nothing special. capo's salad had too much dressing.  Rat pack Italian beef was good.  Santucci's pasta with meatball tasted like something I could find at the costco frozen food isle.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bust a cap

byWdJtanmjD6a0Dq22_uhQ.text: Good place for a date. The menu options are good... I wanted to try more than one thing but the portions are pretty big. They give you breadsticks before dinner so be warned.... don't fill up on breadsticks. The alcohol drinks were good as well. The whole vibe there was awesome. I liked how they had a singer and a piano player. By the end of the night we needed to go boxes. Our waiter was awesome and attentive. Every chance he had he checked in on us to see if we needed anything else. Wish we had enough room for dessert though. Definitely go and try it out. It's a nice place to go and check out.

8fTZZ7D3cB4Gl6ohFjMKNg.text: A Las Vegas institution.  Eggplant Parmesan and all the dishes are from family recipes handed down generation after generation. The Legend and lore of this restaurant must be experienced firsthand. There is nothing that I can say in this review or any other review by anybody else that will give the story of Capo's Italian restaurant, Steakhouse & Speakeasy the Justice it deserves.  To be fair, I must describe some of the unique qualities of this venue. First, it is a speakeasy. You go to the corner of the building marked "entrance", ring the doorbell, and wait for the door man to poke his head out of a hidey hole and challenge you for the password. So, in Times Gone by, that was how it was done at a speakeasy. It's probably best to make reservations. It's also probably best to keep an open mind. This restaurant is not like any restaurant you have ever eaten at.  The menu, in all of its Glory, has very catchy names fashion After mobsters and like. The food is of superior quality, in all of Las Vegas very few restaurateurs can challenge the quality of Capo's. And they will not win. Nor have they ever. Sorry to Giada, Mario, and Bobby.  Let me repeat so that it is abundantly clear: this is not like any restaurant you have experienced in the past. The recipes are handed down from Generations. The quality is superior. The experience is exemplary, entertaining, and unique. There is a crooner playing the piano singing the tunes of the greats. Make sure you tip him and everybody else. This is a speakeasy!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PBeK5tnat0j9dwCQ6XfgJg.text: Ok so the best way to describe this place is a restaurant version of a fun dive bar.  if this was a dive bar with a restaurant attached then this place would be a 10 star joint.    This place is worth checking out, although it would be hard for me to go again.

93bP5ntWdrE7JduiW4D2aw.text: The atmosphere is very good, secret door to enter, live music nightly, and we have magician performing table magic.  But I have to say the food is about average.  To me, it is worth a visit, especially taking your friends who have been to Vegas couple times and don't know anything outside of the strip, seeing their face when they see the secret door open is priceless.

kxZwDq_QBfBc4Is63FMDDA.text: Pricey but worth it. Good to go with family or friends. Not to cozy for kids. Food is a bit pricey but tadte delicious..

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed chicken

QFIgXbEFMXLdg8-_xXPpYw.text: You go here more for the atmosphere, they did a great job living up the mob theme.  They even setup an elaborate entrance where you have to knock before coming in.  The restaurant is super dark and they provide mini flashlights for you to see the menus.  If you don't like dark places, avoid this place like the plague.  Expect generous portions, so bring your appetite.  They even provide a lounge singer.  The bread is awesome, it's nice and crispy, served hot... add some butter, it really hits the spot.  The calamari was excellent, only comment is that we wished that they included the squid legs.  The sauce the comes with it had a perfect balance, not too sweet or sour.  The clams linguine "The Gallows with Clams" with white sauce is another good entree to choose.  The noodles were firm and sucks up the flavors of the dish.  The clams were on a bit on the side but perfectly cooked.  We had high hopes for their famous meatball with spaghetti, as we hear several servers pushing this dish.  Nothing that says wow gotta get it, but still solid.  You get a big meatball in the middle of a pile of spaghetti.  The meatball was slightly fluffy with yet the density of the meat.  The "Sawed Off Sausage & Peppers" was not to our liking.  The red wine is too overwhelming and dominates the flavor of the dish.  So much that even the sausage is not spared from the overwhelming wine flavor.  Why the three star rating?  Our waiter was horrible, barely stopped by to see how we were doing and wasn't helpful at all.  For example, he didn't mention the Tuesday night special, we only knew about it by eavesdropping on another table (I'm a former Auditor).  What saved them was the busboy and other supporting staff that filled in for him.  Also, the prices were on the high side, in the low $20 to $30 range.  As mentioned before it's really dark, it was interesting at first but the novelty quickly evaporates.  It gets irritating not seeing your food before eating (that's how dark it is).   They have a Yelp check in special, be sure to unlock the deal by checking in!

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with meatball
