ioDpu1jLORVaxDeHLa9yDg.text: Pricey but awesome food and service! Well worthwhile!  They have huge portions of food and the Bruschetta was the best I've ever eaten.  The fun and exciting Mobster vibe with The Secret entrance is really cool. And they even have a piano and apparently they have a pianist and jazz musician that come in regularly.   This is just all around a great place to go and I highly recommend it

j9zyuTtqLiHiD2orGTZd8Q.text: I didn't know what to expect coming here, I was invited on a dinner date and pulled up not sure if I was overdressed or underdressed. It's a True speakeasy, definitely exceeding expectations.   On the night we went they were slammed packed and couldn't accept any more reservations, but we were offered immediate seating at the bar.   I went for spaghetti & meatballs since they were supposed to be the best in town, my food was good. She opted for Filet Mignon, which was FRICKING AMAZING!!!! I was blown away by how tender, juicy, and flavorful the steak was prepared. The cabernet pairing went perfectly with our meals. Sorry to say I had more of the steak than my own food, that's how delicious it was.  The ambiance was nice and dark, very hole in the wall elegant mafia, I don't even know how to explain. Everything was priced reasonably and I'd definitely return.

NDzwKMhTt0YFd-ZBFn7kaQ.text: We really enjoyed the mafia/speakeasy vibe it was fun. The restaurant is dimly lit they provide flashlights with the menu. THe lounge singer was great, not too loud but loud enough to add to the ambiance. Portions are huge by any standard, and you could split an entree and still leave full. I liked the pasta and the sauce they have and recommend it. Overall its a great spot to visit and get off the strip if you are a tourist. don't forget to text and get the password ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6wBL81x-SQgbg-dksgIAlA.text: Very disappointed  My mom's birthday and I was expecting them to at least wish her happy birthday. Told 4 different employees and made the reservation with special requests for her birthday dinner. They didn't care about it and I was embarrassed because I told her that was going to be a great dinner and the lasagna was good everything else too salty and no flavor.

VwMjBKGbAyjrccvVrtHGRw.text: The mob themed ambiance is so fun & eclectic, if you're down to have an experience during your Italian meal, this is the place.   Came here today for my boyfriends birthday meal. He LOVES this place.   Ordered the calamari to start - the best I've found in town, it's DELICIOUS - not rubbery at all, fresh and the breading is perfection.   Chris ordered the shrimp scampi, which if you're looking for traditional scampi swimming in butter - won't disappoint. I ordered the shrimp fettuccine with sun dried tomatoes and pancetta in a garlic sauce. Yum!   Chris did order a couple beers & I feel like $7 for a bottle of Michelob Ultra is ridiculously overpriced & the food itself is a little bit overpriced, especially for lunch. Bill totaled $96 for two pasta meals, calamari, and two beers.   Not a complaint because the food never disappoints, service is awesome & the themed environment is so much fun!!  On Tuesdays they do have up to $20 off for locals, so don't forget to ask about that discount.

CDQSPezsAHnkUg0mRRRZTQ.text: I went with my mother and girlfriend a couple of weeks ago... Looked forward to trying it out as I had heard good things....   Welcome was as expected, the whole mobster thing, quirky. Took ages to get any service at our table though, wasn't particularly attentive throughout the dinner.   all 3 of us ordered together, took well over 30 minutes to get food.  Ordered the sausage special, meat and sauce were great but pasta was well under cooked. I pointed this out to server and he offered to have it replaced but I told him I didn't want to wait another 30 minutes... and with that he walked off.   I thought he may have discounted it from the bill, but nothing. Paid the $187 and went on our way.   Wouldn't go back, would rather spend my money at Nora's or any pf Vegas' other Italian restaurants.   Disappointed...

FONBFEzi2zeBz1W9_FbNBQ.text: My girlfriend took me to Capo's the other night and all I can say is it was beyond fabulous! From the moment I rang the bell to the desert! Best Italian food since Little Italy in NY! I will forever rave about this place!! Great atmosphere, service, food and drinks! LOVE IT I'll definitely be back!!!!

1KFpdkMmfd7YTywyoI2Brw.text: I would have to say I had high hopes for this long-time standing Italian restaurant in Vegas with such a cool speakeasy theme but I was disappointed. Booked a party of 8 last night for my best friend's birthday celebration. The ambiance was very dark and super dim lighting as if to keep you from seeing the food or menu or anything for that matter. The drinks were decent and probably why I gave this place at least 2 stars. The rest of the experience from my point of view was dismal.  My almost $50 Cioppino came with no lobster tail (at first I thought it was minced into the dish) but asked the server, Lolita and apparently it was forgotten.  By the time my lobster tail came out, the rest of my table completed their entrees and the busser even brought out to go boxes for the table!! That's how long it took!  My house salad had wilted lettuce or spring mix. My friend's meatball salad had pasta in it even though he specifically asked for no pasta and when it was brought the server's attention, nothing was done about it.  After all this, the only gesture of goodwill they offered was to provide complimentary dessert for the birthday boy...  If it was not my BFF's birthday and his choice on the restaurant, I would not have chosen this place. Nora's Italian or Eataly at the Park are way better choices of Italian cuisine. Will not be coming back.

QXfcHPhxemqalc7mSrN56Q.text: Capo's is a must. We ate a Wofgang Pucks at theVenetian the night before, which was good, especially since we met the pocket chef himself..He was out glad handing all of his patrons, was as pleasant and charming as you might expect.  I was designated to find the next dinner restaurant, and had my laptop, so i yelped Mario Batali's B & B restaurant which had not so hot ratings by fellow yelpers. So I searched yelp and found Capo's, with two locations, W tropicana and  W Sahara.  Rave reviews from yelpers, so i called to see which was closer to theTreasure Island where we were staying.  Only a  machine at the Tropicana location, but a real person at the W Sahara location.The dude said he was about a mile closer, so we made reservations for five at six PM. easy to find, valet parking which was almost a neccessity because he directed us to the entry, which is a whole other story.  Dark, early sixties/late fifties decor, really great food and a very memorable time.  Piano player/crooner. I don't think you will be dissappointed.   I added this review because although the other location was yelped highly, the sahara location wasn't on the yelp list yet.

MGADBph7ksZjs5n3g0a8gA.text: Caesar salad excellent, Moscato wine excelllent, garlic butter excellent, bread ... meh. Service terrible. Nice garlic sauce but overpriced ravioli. Only 5 ravioli for $18.95. Wasn't good enough to warrant that price and the extra $5 for a average meatball. I don't know why it's "famous" because it tasted like bread crumbs to me. Food sat under the heating lamp for 20 minutes before someone finally delivered it. We were there far longer than we needed to be waiting for service and missed a planned event because of it. (No, they weren't that busy) Trying to get in was fun but we were not put in the room showing on the website. It was a side room that wasn't very nice. And if its so authentic why don't they have authentic SWEET Italian sausage. Why is that so hard to find in the west? Lastly, I get checking ID when you use a credit card but taking your license to the back is not necessary. I don't trust it. Bring cash.

NEOpnWCLT_9KbRNqbPzKAQ.text: I went to capo's a week ago with a few of my family members.  I found out about it through some friends, and they said it is suppose to be the most authentic restaurant in town for italian cuisine.  And they were RIGHT!  We arrived and walked into a corridor where we had to ring the buzzer.  Out of no where, this guy pops his out and asks us "How ya doin?'" with an italian accent.  On this friday night, we got the opportunity to listen to Bobby, the live entertainment, at our table side.  Not only that, the waiter Billy, fit the entire motif of the "mobster style" dinning.  The food was phenomenal.  I had the scampi, a caesar salad, the sawed off sausage and peppers, and the tiramisu for dessert.  The rest of the family had lasagna, chicken alfredo, and the chicken al vodka.  No complaints, and we all loved the place and will enjoy going back often.  A great experience everyone can enjoy.

AkgVLROz6iXNa9RXzDEHqQ.text: I give it a 4 broken down as follows:  3.5 for the food, 5 plus for the ambiance and service.  This is a great date place, as well as a great place to take large groups from out of town.

EkUp-bvZ_OfSZAJFQZFCJQ.text: Capo's is  a great asset to Las Vegas!  There are many italian themed restaurants, but this place is exceptional.  This restaurant is totally different from any other in Vegas, and most especially  the service is what stands out to make it such a great place.  From the minute you walk into this restuarant, it is all about you.  Everyone from the person that seats you, to the servers, to the cooks--you can see them cooking from the bar seats-- the customer and your experience is what matters.  This alone is so much different than most other restaurants in Las Vegas.  This is actually what sets this restaurant apart from all the rest. The decor is great--puts you back into 1960--and so is the food.  Try everything, but most especially you cannot miss the calamari. This place is sure to last because they go above and beyond.  It is not unusual to see the owner and  his wife here; obviously this is an endeavor that matters to them. There are many choices in Las Vegas, but this place is not to miss.

FE7Y19IXUq0ba5iSXmmtDg.text: Took my fiancee there for his birthday 7/15/09 hoping to give him the best birthday experience ever. We were promptly seated after showing ourselves at  the "trick door". Taken to a dark but chandelier booth where we were greeted immediately by a our host-assistant. No hiccups, plateware was removed, our drinks were brought expeditiously,our order was taken. we were serenaded by old-school las vegas musicians who knew just what my fiancee requested they sung directly to me until i would have said yes to anything. dinner followed promptly; we had to wait on nothing thruout the evening UNTIL it came to our desire to have dessert and coffee; there was not a soul to be found. Imagine that, being on the way to 5 stars and then blowing it by not even showing up to ask us about offering us coffee or an after dinner aperitif. waah!. I'd like to think my love was overall happy with his birthday dinner but i had wanted it to go so perfectly. oh well, the entrees were exquisite as always and I can't wait to come back. i hope they will have ironed out the end of the dinner for us return patrons, so we can add a much DESERVED exclamation point to end the evening; thank Nico for his overall 4 1/2 stars service.

3VBo4BTk3oMruFFHBKJBmg.text: I purchased a Groupon Now for this restraunt and there was no fine print when I purchased it. So, I'm excited to go there, and we get there, and we had to wait for 5 minutes after ringing the bell, and snuck in after someone happened to go through the door, to be "greeted" by the rudest, scowl faced man stating "you need a reservation." With seats clearly open behind him, and I said "we have a groupon now..." to him saying "Meh. A groupon. Heh. Whatever." After 10 min we're seated, with him saying to the waitress "they have a groupon" quite snobbilyy. then it took 30 minutes for us to even receive WATER. Then we are told you have to spend $60 to even use the groupon after the groupons been redeemed so you have no choice, then we're told we can't even use 2 groupons or split checks. So it takes forever to even order, and forever to even receive the food. Then, the bread does go stale after 2 minutes and the butter they bring you is very little, and after asking for extra, we don't get any extra. The soup was cold. And the food was very bland, and it hurts yur stomach. The waitress was extremely rude, and the bouncer stands over the entire dinner watching you to make sure you don't share bc then they charge $6. So, I'm sitting through this entire dinner highly tense and not enjoying my dinner at all, I feel like I was about to cry or eve throw up. After asking for the check, the girl unauthorizingly took $16 for a tip for hrself. And for a groupon that was only supposed to be $25 for $50 ended up costing me about $80. And that's not with me ordering extra,, that's with all the outrageous fees they charge. The staff was RUDE. And it was literaly the most unenjoyable experience I have ever had. I have never written a review in my life, but I just HAD to for this terrible hell-hole.

wWQ1OKYuaJvieR-Qsh_Vlw.text: I am so glad to have found this on yelp...My husband and I were in Las Vegas for a week..We had a rental car so this was a big help when trying out restaurants off the strip.  I made a reservation for his b.d.  What a fun place.  We arrived during happy hour because we had tickets to a show later.  All the house wine, beer and well drinks are half price along with appetizers. I think that is from 4pm to 7pm., not 100% sure about times.  We had drinks at the bar and shared an order of Calamari...(It was huge and so.o.o.o good. ) The dipping sauce was fabulous.   Since everyone said the portions were huge, we decided to split an entree and a desert.  We told our server our intentions and there wasn't an extra plate charge or any problem with sharing.  They even divided the entree into to separate servings which we still couldn't eat all of it....By the way, we had ordered spaghetti with the meat sauce.  The meat sauce was a mixture of Italian Sausage and ground beef...It was excellent...I wish we had this place in Atlanta.  For desert we ordered the Chocolate Molten cake with vanilla icecream  It was so yummy.. My husband is Italian so he loved the Godfather movies playing on the bar t.v. and he loved the singer coming around singing Frank Sinatra songs.  I had read on yelp to request a booth for a romantic dinner so I did and it was perfect.  It was a great evening and my husband loved it.

xvPve8sRyV5cICCUznYNFg.text: One of our worst dining experiences ever!  The place is so dark that no one can read the menu!  Music so loud we could hardly hear each other speak.  Overcharged for drinks - two of them at twelve dollars a piece!  Veal marsala and veal parmagiana substandard.  Sausage and pepper meal was so bad one of us couldn't finish eating it.  Only one member in our party of four was happy - with her lasagna.  Bread was cold and too crusty and flakey.  Soup was okay; dinner salad outstanding. Service was absolutely awful!  The attitude was one of not caring in the least bit about anything.  We made it clear two of us were having birthdays.  After dinner, long after dinner, someone came to the table and asked if we wanted dessert.  I looked at him and said the restaurant was told two of us were celebrating birthdays - to which he retorted, 'no one told me,' and he disappeared, never to be seen again.  Fifteen minutes later I spoke with the manager, and five minutes after that, we were given two brownies with vanilla ice cream, and candles that weren't even lit.  Dinner tab was $140, and we felt terrible for the host that he had to pay such a bill for such an awful experience.  I would discourage absolutely everyone from eating in this establishment - we should have left after realizing it is impossible to see anything inside it.  Shame on these guys for keeping their doors open.

IMS1BbVeKVW2wHqwxouVnA.text: A speak easy atmosphere with great food and a fabulous lounge singer that made the trip incredible. We had reservations that we weren't able to make on time but.... the great staff got us seated in short time and it was fantastic! Highly recommend.

DP15S0AEJQTGj5irTx1Dig.text: I guess after all of the hype I was totally let down. My husband and I were looking forward to a really cool mafia themed experience when we recently dined here. Unfortunately aside from the sort of fun surprise entrance, mafia themed movies playing and an outline of a dead body, there wasn't much that separated this from an average Italian joint, except maybe the price. $26 for chicken parm???? With our two glasses of wine, two entrees plus the cab ride from the strip it ended up costing us more than $125. Definitely not worth it. Thought we'd be saving some money by going off the strip, but not the case.

96JYaxKPIvBN16ErK1rEHg.text: Finally got to Capo's. Enjoyed every minute. Fabulous old school Italian ambiance... dark and red, my kind of place. Seafood pasta (cioppino) was delicious and huge... took half home and had another spectacular meal with the leftovers! Tableside/close-up magic was a bonus!

p9xkXl4arL6Y7on18Mklcw.text: Another spot you don't want to miss when going to Vegas..love the entrance way and the secret door. From the moment you walk in it's like your in an underground mob style restaurant. They have a Frank Sinatra impersonator playing the piano. The food was yummy but a bit pricey that's why I only gave four stars.

KIzVaF4dwsH_mF-k1B_Kcg.text: Right from the start this place was a lot of fun and is worth a visit. The "secret" entrance, the dim lighting with the mob themed decor, yes AND the food... cibo eccellente!  We went for Sunday brunch. Even though we could have ordered off the lunch menu we were both hungry for breakfast so I ordered the Mad Sam's Spicy omelet and my wife had Vinnie's Veggie.  Both omelets were made from 4 eggs and included home fries and bread, Mad Sam was filled with Italian meatball and sausage with a slightly spicy red sauce was unique and pleasantly different. My wife chose the vegetarian option customized to her taste and said it was the best omelet she's ever had, if you knew my wife you would know what a powerful statement this really is. We both had mimosas made with fresh squeezed orange juice, super awesome!

4h21dSM7Rqmwetak64ffiA.text: This establishment came highly recommended by a stranger while waiting in line at the hotel.  The experience started from the moment we stepped foot in.... the man greeting us was very friendly and had a great sense of humor.   ALL the staff was accommodating and had a smile on their face... including the singer.   The food , however, was even better.  Very fulfilling so definitely go hungry.  Very reasonably priced and portions are more than enough.  I will absolutely be coming back next time I visit Vegas!!

37W20QzcU_VEKvNiXezHvw.text: Love it here a nice Italian restaurant food is great and service also.. love the gangster underground theme,,, great for Las Vegas... if you're looking for a good Las Vegas Italian restaurant this is a place for you

BeA5AyKrowSgq15NAb5BRQ.text: As a tourist visiting Las Vegas visiting this fine establishment was one of the highlights of our trip. It was a lot of fun going somewhere away from the strip and the atmosphere was unique to any restaurant I've been to. The setting felt very authentic to the time period it was meant to represent.  Now for the food. Bread was, well, sliced bread, nothing special, and the butter was cold and thus annoying to spread. We got salads with the garlic dressing which was good, but would have been better with about half the quantity. Our entrees were lasagne and chicken parmesan and we loved them both. The ricotta cheesecake still has my woman kicking her own ass that we only got one slice to go versus two.  Highly recommended for anyone craving Italian somewhere different.

ZRM6GiMEu6Qw9j84514_WQ.text: This was our first Capo's experience, but definitely not our last. From the moment we rang the bell we had the most phenomenal service. The food was out of this world. The lasagna is a must!!!

eSgglS10Lcup1iL7vo-DEw.text: Foods amazing. The Bust A Cap was great, and the ambiance is reminiscent of old mobster Vegas. Kevin singing made the night for us putting the topping on great food and a great restaurant.

QvH5iVIy_iUWbA40TLhHdw.text: This was one of the worst Italian restaurants I have ever experienced. Their gimmick is cute, the guy in the peekhole asking for the code word. But I just spent $150.+ $20 tip and $10 for the piano player (because I felt sorry for him) and the food was awful. It began with undercooked calamari continuing to a limp salad then moving on to a tough veal Marsala that was difficult to cut with a steak knife. My husband had spaghetti in a meat sauce that he could not finish. If you have Italian food this is probably the place for you. I just looked at the other reviews of this restaurant and I can't believe it. How could anyone give this place a good review?

1w7pOaz67URrF4fSkaq9Ig.text: This is a place you would drive past without stopping. you should stop. great atmosphere and great service and even better food.  the lasagna would feed a family, and the meatballs are amazing. best Italian I've had in a long time.

gujYtkh1Db_iWfpM_KOaDQ.text: I'm going to try and kept this as short as possible. Made reservations, showed up, rang the bell...and nothing. They let my husband and I in with no fanfare or show. Not sure what the "admittance" process is suppose to be, but it did not live up to the hype of the previous reviews. Once we were seated (in the back by the kitchen), we had plenty of time to decide what we wanted to eat and to contemplate the meaning of life.  It seemed that we and the 3 other surrounding tables were be handled by 2 different servers but they did not seem to communicate with each other.  Service was spotty at best. The male server was amazing at saying he would bring the items we were missing but then forget. He was like the guy on 50 First Dates whose memory would reset after 10 seconds.  Then after waiting for the female server to come back we would get our items promptly.   Food:  The cheap knock off version of what people think Italian good should taste like.  I ordered Santucci's Pasta with a huge meatball and my husband ordered Da Don's Lasagna.  My paste seemed slightly undercooked and the sauce and meatball had a strange flavor. It was nothing special.  My husbands lasagna was ok but they use the same sauce as my spaghetti.  That would have been fine if the sauce had been good, but it definitely was not.   Entertainment:  There's not a whole lot that I can say about it since we could not see it from where we were seated. I will say that while we couldn't see it, we could definitely hear it.  The male singers voice was blaring over the speakers. It was so loud that my husband and I could not talk without yelling at each other.  This probably would not have been an issue had we been able to see what was going on.  This ended up annoying us more than anything. We were happy when he finally decided to take a break.  They went to canned CD music which was perfect because it wasn't as loud.  Price:  The best way I can describe this is they charge Friday night A team stripper price for the Tuesday afternoon C team.  Overall my husband and I will not be back. There is better food and entertainment in Vegas for less money.

UBjWdNI88VPbvhMSoA-G9w.text: At first I was skeptical when I walked in to the place and then I walked inside very nice atmosphere was shocked. Sat at the bar with my husband we where early for our reservation ordered a bottle of wine from Italy which was very good. The best part was the food absolutely yummy I'll be back for seconds..

WElvZiD_aX87AD7_ailnDA.text: You know you go to Vegas too often when you start heading to Off-Strip places for dinner.   Capo's has evidently been featured on one of those food TV shows and there's definitely a gangster mob speakeasy theme here. Right up my alley, obviously. You ring the bell outside the entrance and a guy slides open a tiny window and asks what you want/what you're doing there, sort of like Robert De Niro's 'whads da matter with ya?' voice.  We didn't have reservations, which you probably should do if you want a table. It was no prob, we got seated at the bar and were fine with that.  It's really dark in here, so much so that the menu includes a little light on it so you can read it.  Good thing I checked out the menu online before so I kinda had a clue!  A bartender was our server, she was really nice and pleasant and checked on us frequently.  I'd tell you she was really attractive too, but again it was too dark to tell, so maybe it was just a guy that had extremely large pectoral muscles. Oh, she (or he?) was really good at making recommendations and answering questions about the menu too.  What we had: bruschetta, calamari, meatballs, and my main course was Vinnie's Alla Vodka.  The latter comes in at a bit under $20 and is what I'd totally recommend. The meatball appetizer also seems to be one of their signature items and is probably something you should give a try.  I know we had a few other things, but this is what I can remember.  Or, maybe it was just so dark that I couldn't see half of what I ate.  Don't forget to check out the decor here too.

W3mEbtKiQj3CU-fc8QG98g.text: I love this place. There pink sauce is delicious. I've been here a few times and I love most of my expirience. My only complaint would be the singer. He is too busy flirting to sing a song to the crowed or he looks bored out of his mind. I've been here a few times and each time is the same. It's like come on dude you get paid for this, at least try. But everything else is great. From the time you come in to the service to the time you leave. It's like stepping back in time.

LEobZ_Z7GZiQcyxKexFfYQ.text: I went here for my bday dinner with friends . I love food - I love Italian .   The bill overcharged my party of 13 by $11- which may not seem like a big deal but for a group of 13 people and how much they already made from us - I don't find this amusing . Me and my best friend use to come here when they first opened in 2010. Now, I picked this place for my bday dinner and it left a bad taste in my mouth .   Yeah the singer sang to me , I ve came here with a friend prior and they do ladies night . But customer service needs to be so much better and in addition - you shouldn't ask a large party for extra gratuity . Gratuity is given - not asked for !    Place could have more lighting ! Re-vamp your drink specials and your  2 for 1 deal !

9Jsw4kotA_KqBM-HdFbYbQ.text: Pretty darn terrible, even with the Groupon. Lunch menu is extremely limited. Food is barely edible. Gimmicky.

fz3HzBAkhWG49A-PjVXknw.text: Outstanding! Great food, great atmosphere, great service! Buy the cheesy bread appetizer. Do it, regardless that they give you free bread. The meatballs and lasagna are my fave dishes but everything tastes good. If you're fascinated by the mob or rat pack era, you need to eat here. Don't mistake its dingy exterior for what waits within. Also the host and waiters try to stay in Italian mob character (but not cheesy, very classy). Best restaurant in Vegas. I eat here every time.

iLmCzdTLiUy-pMMKD4IVwA.text: Went with friends that were visiting from Cali - they've been going there for years.  Was skeptical, but was pleasantly surprised.  Had Penne with meat sauce.  Large portion could only eat half.  Had Creme Brulee for desert.  Hubby had Spaghetti with meat sauce and A meatball.  He wasn't fond of the meatball.  There was a party of about 12 next to us and they were so load, I can still hear them.  They should have kept that group in the room away from the main room.  I could barely hear the singer.  Food: Good.  Ambience - could be better.

rCHmts9dRjT5Gxsn7OoGYA.text: This is my favorite place in Vegas! I wish we had a place like this at home. From the atmosphere and service to the amazing dinner, drinks and dessert, everything spectacular!! We will definitely come back every time we are on town!

7SwFAfeHsvVGtXQRwIpeRQ.text: The entrance is very well done; it sets the tone for  the dining experience.   The Caesar salad was very good. It had the prefect dressing/lettuce ratio, if that's your sort of thing. The Rat Pack Pesto w/ shrimp was very yummy. My husband ordered the Carbonara with chicken. He thought it was bland; however I felt that it tasted like a typical carbonara dish.   We were seated near the kitchen entrance and patio door so the continuous yelling of "corner" by the waiters was quite annoying. Additionally it was very drafty when the patio door was opened. The piano singer was entertaining. Our waiter was polite but not overly attentive.   All and all not the best Italian food I've ever had but not as basic (or gross) as an Olive Garden.

S1JK9weg2k7kRFk5TaCTOA.text: I came here with a large group to celebrate my bachelorette party and we had a blast!  They treated us very well and the singer spent a lot of time at our table serenading each of us.   I loved the atmosphere and the entrance.  It was exactly what I wanted, a gangster-themed Italian restaurant.  The food was good, not great, but who cared?  The atmosphere was why we were there.  I had the pasta with the vodka sauce, which was tasty, but very salty.  I was unable to finish my meal because of all the bread I had eaten.  Overall, a very positive experience.

dfGIS2TViUoweJValC025g.text: Capo's is an adorable little old Italian restaurant.  When you first step in you get the feeling your walking into an old mafia movie.  They have a little dark room you step into, they peep their head in through a hole, and then walk around and let you into the coolest restaurant around.  The decor is great!  They have a singer who comes a couple nights a week who sings all the standards, and he does a great job.  Plus, the food is fantastic.  I had the homemade meatballs, my fiance had the rigatoni alla vodka , and my future father in law had the Tony duck's soup.  All of the dishes were very tasty, we'll be sure to visit any time we are in Vegas.

HygiXHT3_2_rhVa0x0O2FQ.text: Its a great restraunt and theme EXCEPT for those to cheap to get a babysitter....kids ruin the ambiance so dont ask to get seated in the back of the restraunt. With that being said the host was hilarious, service was great, food was good except the side of spaghetti. The sauce tastes straight of a ragu jar

0Une3AAeoMWKZdEOVsyeBA.text: Love everything about this restaurant--ambience, food, drinks, service, lounge singers! I love taking people here that have never been here and waiting for the window to open and seeing the look on their faces. It's a blast!

-gOzlIG29Ia6chr_8-TDkg.text: Our family of 6 came to this restaurant based on a recommendation from a family member. We were so excited to go and experience this unusual place for dining. Unusual it was. The only nice thing, was the singer singing "Sinatra" songs."  This restaurant was dark,(they have tiny LED lights to view menu which are difficult to use if you have arthritis in your hands),  unfriendly,  terrible service, horrible food and were very DECEPTIVE with their bills. This was by far the worst eating experience of our lives. Caution to anyone who does not know the owners! The food was so bad I couldn't eat it. Who ever heard of Pasta Fagiola with crushed spaghetti, no beans and jarred garlic? The eggplant rolatini tasted like old cheese with jarred garlic overkill. I just couldn't eat it. The chicken picata was bland like lemon was squeezed on it. The mushroom risotto was hard and undercooked. My husband couldn't eat his eggplant either! No one enjoyed the food or the atmosphere. Then came the bill. LOCALS BEWARE! Sundays is pasta 2 for 1 (up to $20.00 only). If you don't tell them you're a local, you will be overcharged. Then there's the issue of the bill. It is a light carbon that is not ledgible! There were 2 prices on the bill (hand written). They charged us extra because they said they didn't know we were locals. Well, I let that go. I got back my adjusted bill and credit card back which had a transaction on it. Again it had 2 prices. $130. and $165.  I questioned the waiter again!  He said they included gratuity. Well, the "gratuity box" was blank and he wrote "Grat" over a preprinted "Thankyou" on the bill which was not ledgible. Also, it seemed to all of us that they charged OVER 20% for a TIP! People who don't know are going to be in for a rude surprise....Double tipping! We would never go back to Capo's again. My only mistake was complaining after the meal and paying for that horrible experience. All I got was an apology! Not a compensation by a long shot! And by the way, my bill originally started at $226. and went down to $130. which was still too much for the quality and service  received. Does anyone see a problem with a $96. difference? That's after having the waiter review with us 3 times as to what we were being charged for! I could not in good faith recommend this restaurant! If you're used to good Italian restaurants or Italian home cooking, you will hate this food! There was nothing authentic about it! This restaurant was way overpriced...

sH2IhMMDL9QJCROExPUIkg.text: Fellow Yelper's hinted my group to Capo's and there was not an ounce of disappointment by this choice. My boyfriend is Italian so I have a tough critic when dining at an Italian restaurant. He was extremely pleased with the selection.   I will be honest that I was a bit hesitant when I saw the location. Capo's is in a ghetto looking neighborhood within a strip mall, off the Vegas Strip. I guess that consoled myself that it would be worth a try when I saw Ruth Chris in the same type of setting, but a couple blocks back.   The entrance to the restaurant is quite fun and interesting. It is a simulated gangster hangout. You have to ring a door bell so that you can be let in. The restaurant itself is dark and you get a little light to read the menu. Capo's offers that very best service that I have seen at any restaurant. Jennine was our waitress and she was knowledgeable, attentive and looked happy to work at Capo's. The restaurant had a busboy, Jeremy who just worked his tail off and made sure that all the customers had all that they needed.   My boyfriend and I shared the lasagna as well as the egg drop soup with spinach. It was excellent. Taste, texture and temperature were outstanding. So far, Capo's is by far the best that we have had.   If only the restaurants on the strip could get the concept of great service and excellent food would they even be able to compete with Capo's.

G4qGkqQit-Rh9CPIoxYbNA.text: I have been hearing about this restaurant for years and finally went5 last night! It was GREAT!!!! It was fun from the start and the food was amazing! I will  be back!

iMzt_3CqREkFViZjTwXllQ.text: First of all this place was cool the decor, atmosphere, the secret entrance all great.... but the food not so great. Hubby had the veal and it was bland no flavor whatsoever, I had the manicotti and it was to salty...and for the price it was not worth it. Not even the guy who did such a good job singing could make us go back..... Good thing I had a coupon $20 off..

oO9Txy8dA4ZH9xLmJlhZRQ.text: We have been to Capo's several times.  We have loved the food and experience but this past week we took a group of work associates to the restaurant and our feelings have totally changed.  We established a group menu and price per person prior to going to the facility.  When it was time to get the bill I was presented a check with a mysterious room charge I was never told about, a price that was $5.00 more per person and a total head count that was 6 more people then were dining (our head count was exactly what we reserved).  I pointed the errors out to our server and she told me the manager who arranged the menu was out of town and she, as the server, could not make any changes to it.  I informed the server I refused to pay the ridiculous over charges.  We spent about a half hour going back and forth (while our paid limo was waiting outside).  I had to go out to the limo, get my phone, and sort through deleted emails to show her that the bill was wrong.  Finally she agreed to reduce the charges.  I have no problem with a manager going on vacation but at least have someone present who can make a decision to correct a wrong!  We will NEVER be going back her again!

9MSTlhaGwUUlovj9pLa4wA.text: This restaurant would have received 4-stars if the service had been better.  Walking in, the ambiance is super and our party of 4 enjoyed the Italian mobster shtick.  The mobster movies  (Godfather III was on), Sinatra sound-alike on piano and waiter with an attitude were all appreciated.  The food was very good and reasonably priced, although nothing really out of the ordinary.  I had Eggplant Parmesan and the others had the Salmon Special (good & garlic-y), Chicken Angelo (portion on the small side) and Chicken Parmesan.  After our cocktails, bread, and salads were served, our waiter went MIA... hey, buddy, we want some vino with our food!  He hadn't been one of the servers of our main courses, and it took a good 10 minutes for the busboy to get the waiter back to our table to take our wine order.  We ended with cappuccino and coffee.  All in all, an enjoyable experience but we'll probably seek out other restaurants (there's a few in Las Vegas!) next time we're in the mood for Italian food.

X7csfJ2xTMIsiGfT8L3RpA.text: Disappointing is by far too nice of an adjective here.  My husband and I used to visit  Capos on Tropicana and always had a great experience.  Capos on Sahara is seriously a restaurant not associated with its past by any means.  First upon arrival we were greeted in the interesting way at the speak-easy door by the maitre d.  We did not have a reservation and we were sat within 5 minute upon arrival.   While waiting I will add the maitre d was discussing how they were waiting for Anthony Bourdin to arrive... We were sat and waited a good 10 minutes before being asked if we would like to order anything to drink.  when we finally ordered we were ready to finalize our entire meal order.  I ordered the calamari and linquini and clams.  my husband ordered the sausage ravioli .   We were brought bread which I seriously thought looked and tasted like a crouton.  crunchy and dry. when the wines were served I was unhappily surprised and how small the glass of red was.  for 12 dollars you would think the glass would be served 1/2 full however it was filled 1/4 full and the white was 3/4 full. the calamari came and it tasted frozen and heated through.   we finished the calamari and waited at least 25 min until our entrees came.  i knew after my first bite of the linquini and clams the "fresh pasta" wasnt fresh, the clams were very very chewy and the sauce tasted like it had tons of sugar in it.  i have never tasted linquine and clams white sauce quite like this before.  my husbands ravolis tasted ok but again the sauce didnt taste fresh more like Hunts Spaghetti Sauce out of the can. i was looking forward to the bread pudding but after eating the entree i decided that if the appetizer and main were so bad i didnt think capos could recover with a good dessert so we decided to pass. we live quite close to capos and and we decided to leave immediately following dinner.  my stomach was turning and I just wanted to get home.  not 2 minutes upon leaving did I tell my husband that i felt sick.  we were 1 block away from home and i made him pull over.  i could not hold it in , i tried but couldnt .  so with the overcooked possibly spoiled clams, not fresh made pasta, chewy calamari and old bread i had left on the pavement i am here at YELP making sure you all know how horrible my experience was.  I warn all to be very very careful here.   Anthony Bourdin will NOT be impressed!

coZWvG3QXFMP2CqCW54vKg.text: I am updating a review of a dinner that I had at Capo's.  My problem was being part of a group.  Capo's did contact me with my concern's and I now feel that CAPO'S DOES CARE ABOUT THERE CUSTOMERS.  Capo's also informed me that they are changing the way that they bill customers in a large party.  I also was in error on the tip added to our bill.  CAPO'S ADDS 20 PERCENT FOR LARGE GROUPS.  I feel that this is a fair tip for groups.  We always loved Capo's at their other location and will be giving them another try.

e2LHRcOTV8fdfF-4zLpj-g.text: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!  The food is horrible and overpriced!!!  Trust me you will feel like you have been taken by the mob if you eat here. The linguine and clams was swimming in oil, the chicken Anastasia was not a chicken breast but more like a chicken roll like the texture and taste of McDonald chicken nuggets and the pink sauce was disgusting. The lasagna was 2 lasagna noodles with a little bit of meat and runny cheese in the middle swimming in pasta sauce. The eggplant Parmesan was covered in cheese that turned very hard and chewy like string cheese. The pasta noodles was soft and mushy and the red sauce was very bland. The atmosphere and the old Vegas theme was the only good thing about the place but not worth paying for tasteless over priced food.  To sum it up you will feel like a fool for not listening to the bad reviews and dropping your hard earned cash on this crud. And then you will be sitting in front of the computer screen the next day writing a bad review.

qITVPlwF5xFmmqoPLYzc3Q.text: We found this resteraunt thank you to all of you yelpers!! My BF took me for my Bday and we loved it! The food was sooooo good and we were given a cozy little romantic booth. We also gave them a bday cake that they placed candles on and the singer came out with the waitress and sang to me over his microphone. Sounds embarressing but thankfully because of the way the cozy little booth was it was all good. The bathroom was nice and clean. The prices were really good and like I said the food tasted amazing. My only issue was the music was VERY loud so if your looking for a place to just sit and chat. This won't be the right venue for you!

OJb6eDP2uJVRDJHcAvoO9g.text: A great experience - we all agreed that we would remember being here. We enjoyed the mob theme, and the singer had a good song list delivered with convincing style. One of my friends knew the words to "On the Street Where You Live," which led to a duet!  The place is really dark, so they attach little LED flashlights to the menus.  Portion sizes were generous. One friend had a simple dish of angel hair pasta with marinara sauce, and another had the same with Italian sausage added. Both said their dishes were "excellent". Another friend gave two thumbs up on the shrimp scampi. I tried the Uncle Pauly's Arrabiata, and as noted in other reviews it was peppery with lots of raw slivered garlic. Caution: you WILL smell like garlic the next day if you order this dish!  Prices were very good. No, it's not the world's best Italian food, but the total experience is very very enjoyable.  From the Strip, it's about a $15 cab fare for a party of 4.

zdyMMEyZvAYf0wdHBEqEIw.text: we were there to celebrate a 21st birthday and looking forward to a nice dinner we had a lovely dinner even if it did take quite a while to get to our table.the ribeye was off the chart and large enough to share everyone else said their food was   amazing and due to the long wait for our dinner they even comped the birthday girls dinner!!!  my only disappointment was i was looking forward to hearing  old blue eyes sing instead we had to listen to wayne newton wanna be. that was painful!!!!!!! i say give it a try :)

RFFE4bqMFZR1_JXdBCihYg.text: great food !! bartender was fantastic !! appetizers at bar dinner at table . hardest part was getting in but that's the fun of this place.

TvV1s0DQ6db5Z6ilN2qp0A.text: We decided to try Capo's for dinner. The ambiance is very nice. It is definitely very dark. I had to use my phone light to look at the menu. They had an impersonator singing and that was neat. We ordered 2 milks and the waitress brought us a cup of half and half mixed with water. It was disgusting. Apparently they don't carry milk. But the waitress could have said that instead of trying to trick us into drinking something that clearly wasn't milk. I went to order an item I saw off the online menu and the waitress told me they took that item off the menu 8 years ago. Really? They couldn't update their menu. It would take 5 minutes. I settled for the lasagna and I would say stouffer's is better. Our bill came to $103. My cocktail the size of a shot was $10. They charge strip prices with a Denny's quality type of food. I was very disappointed. I wish I had gone to Tbones and spent that money on quality dining. The air was broke in 105 degree weather. We were so hot and sweating sitting there. They should close the restaurant until that is fixed.

XBQ9gsSNXtTN48K27P9zPA.text: So I just moved to Vegas about 7 months ago. This is one of the first off the strip places I had gone to. Quite possibly the best place out there. The outside resembles what looks to be some piece of crap shed however when you enter the world transforms into a 1920's speakeasy. From the time I entered to the bill I knew I was going to enjoy this place. My favorite is their chicken marsala it is to die for. But back to the atmosphere, its great maybe a little bit to dark but I understand why. The host looks like he just finished a hit on someone based on his size which gives it more of that authentic look. Best part is they have a pianist on certain days, which can sing some amazing Sinatra. The food and drinks yes might be a little on the pricy side but defiantly worth every penny. The wait staff is great two I have had the same waitress twice and both times she was great the other 4 times I went there it was different people yet still really good at their jobs. I even ended up stay after close on day to enjoy a beer with some of the people that worked there. A++ I haven't been to their other location but I can only assume its just as good.

XwziYJn6-Vih5F0AJdHiCw.text: The absolute worse!  Served me dead mussels (no, the shells were not open!), lousy service, loud, obnoxious singer who couldn't carry a tune in a paper bag, way too dark, even with the stupid menu lights, ridiculously overpriced.  This dump is not in New York City but tries to be.  If you like Italian food, go somewhere else (Olive Garden would be better and that's not saying much).  If you want Mafia environment, go to New York or Chicago.  This "movie set" needs to be run out of town!

Rbs-sr87EHNLaL8ZWA_VCA.text: I lived in Vegas for a year and ate here several times -- always consistently delicious. I recently went out to Vegas for a work trip and was delighted to find nothing had changed -- still delicious. My stomach nor my co-workers were disappointed.

BIIE30llYnNd-JO_8DZGIA.text: I don't even know where to start, I wanted to try this place for a very long time and we finally did and I must say It was beyond my expectations, this place is amazing. I loved the ambiance, the decor is beautiful and different from any Italian restaurant I've been to. The best part was of course the food and definitely the Frank Sinatra singer that dedicated songs to me all night since it was my birthday, it was so memorable! Definitely a night to remember!!!!  The staff is very helpful and attentive and the food is to die for! I made reservations for 11 people for my birthday dinner and from the moment we came in the host and the waiters turned all their attention to our every need. By far the best costumer service I have ever received. they made us feel right at home, very welcomed specially our older waiter he was so nice. I highly recommend this place wether you're going on a date or just a girls night out , it's the perfect place to go and you will definitely enjoy it!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious pasta
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful ambiance
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our party of 11

xThdsaMzO4FETGZvd_5yjw.text: I love this place. Everything I have has been excellent especially the Stuffed Chicken Angelina. One of the best things I've ever had at any restaurant.  The singer they have is great and even comes to your table to serenade the ladies. We even had a magician come to our table one night which was a cool touch.

uYhqRBJYGtBGxtsfO__Nsg.text: Amazing restaurant! Came here on a Sunday evening for a friend's birthday and the whole experience was just so much fun. It had the feel of an old mob speakeasy from start to finish. Going on, you have to knock on an outside door and someone pops their head out of a side panel to see who you are. After confirming the reservation, you are let into a dimly let restaurant where the decor is clean, cool, and old school (with pictures of mobsters hanging up). The music was calm and easy, and by midway through the meal we had a live singer going around the tables. He was awesome.   As for the food: absolutely amazing. I'm a vegetarian and was very happy with the selection. We started with the fried ricotta rivoli and had the soup (pasta fagioli, much like minestrone) or salad that came with our entrees. I then got the rigatoni trafficante (minus the prosciutto) and my friend got the shrimp alfredo. Everything was so delicious and clearly homemade. We would have gotten dessert but we were super stuffed.   Over all, it's a bit out of the way (relative to the Strip) but definitely worth it, both for the experience and for the food. I highly recommend Capo's!

nqvfEBeCJWqRQ3y7HnEPKA.text: I planned for a fantastic anniversary dinner with my partner. The ambiance and our service impeccable, the best in Vegas we've had (I told her too!) but went against my better judgement on the lasagna that was brought to my table. I cook and cook well enough to know the piece that was brought was old. The cheese on top was encrusted and charred so hard it was impossble it was a new piece. The sausage inside had a slime texture. I had two bites and left it to take home. For two days I have been sick with the worst stomach cramps and vomiting. Folks are visiting in October and made reservations long ago but unfortunately do not feel comfortable bringing them. Capo's, I hope quality control does not become an issue for others and I am saddened to give you such a low rating but still very upset I had to pay to be made ill on a very special night.

xnKMeqpJXBnX5MGEZUevtA.text: Totally enticed by the idea of a speakeasy, which was brought to my attention by the beloved Groupon for their lunch menu. Wonderful service and tasty food! I had the Carbonara with Shrimp and my husband had the spaghetti with meatball. Two salads, 2 entrees, and two drinks. Yum! Ciao!

Uc0y1f43sBVok1xGdyOHLA.text: I enjoyed my experiences and food i have had here. Love the atmosphere!! The lounge singer and piano player. Please be advised try to sit as far away from the piano and singer, the speakers and music can get loud and you are unable to hear yourself or your company speak. Other then that i would definately recommend this restaurant to anyone!

umnoQ7VaNMt0ps9YGIn5YQ.text: Food was good. We had a fun time. Only thing that I would highly recommend against is going with a big group of people unless 1 person is footing the bill or everyone brings lots of cash because they don't allow splitting of the check between multiple people and it seemed like such a big debacle and the waitress couldn't figure it out. Other than that, good food and ok atmosphere. Kind of loud but it was nice. Really only 2.5 stars

jhE5D4x4dDYbcU7yqxtb9g.text: The pasta was excellent, the Cesar Salad was terrible. My friend had blackened chicken and it was too salty to eat. I felt it was overpriced for the quality of food, but the manager did give us a discount. Drinks were good, and the service provider was excellent, although new. The mobster theme was cute but so dark it could have passed as a vampire's lair as well. All in all it was okay. I didn't appreciate the entire place being fairly empty and having to sit at the bar.

2Wit0pG1z2PRFCYkOxWmvA.text: I came to Capo's because my coworkers suggested this restaurant. I brought my best friend for her birthday with other friends and everyone was so impressed with the food. The outside appearance might throw you off, but once you walk in, you'll absolutely adore it. Not only was the food delicious, the service was great! Our waitress attended us very well and made sure we were happy, and full. I recommend the cheese bread and meatballs for appetizers, and the ravioli for a main course! Be prepared to get stuffed. Come with a HUGE appetite. Oh, and if you are in the mood for a drink, try the red sangria! Simply delicious and refreshing.

LdPu-Lii1sXljrGxd8ijlA.text: My girlfriend and I were looking for a great Italian restaurant for our anniversary.  We wanted somewhere off the Strip and decided on Capo's after hearing a good review from some friends that ate there.  I made reservations for 8pm and we arrived about 10-15 minutes before hand.  We did the whole gimmick thing of ringing the doorbell, telling the guy through the wall my name and reservation time to get in the secret door, and then started the waiting game.  The seemingly never-ending waiting game.  We stood for a while, while people in front of us were either escorted to their tables or left because they got tired of waiting.  We should've followed them, but we were really looking forward to eating there.  When the limited seating in the waiting area was free, we decided to sit down and continued to play the waiting game.  Twice, we were told our table was being cleaned and we would be seated shortly.  Those were lies.  We were finally seated around 8:40pm, all the way in the back corner of the "movie room" where Goodfellas was playing.  The server and bussers were quick to take our orders and get our drinks, but that's the only thing that was quick about it all.  We were back to playing the waiting game.  Throughout the night, we're watching as tables around us were sat, ordered, ate, and left.  All the while, we were still waiting for our food.  Multiple people, including who I could only assume was a manager, came to us and apologized throughout the ordeal, assuring us that our food would be coming up shortly.  Like before, they were all lies.  I should point out that none of these people were our server.  It was if she was purposely ignoring us.  It was a few minutes after 10pm when we finally got our food.  The food was not worth the wait at all.  It wasn't even worth half of the time we waited.  Their supposedly freshly made pasta was anything but, the meatballs tasted like they were store-bought, and their tomato sauce was extremely thin.  I'm not one to demand free things when service is bad, I just won't return and will make sure others hear of my bad experiences.  When I got the check and saw that they comped one of the meals, we were thinking that was their way of apologizing for the long wait.  That was until we drove away and noticed the sign that said 2 for 1 Tuesdays.  They comped the meal because that's what they do on Tuesday nights, not because they screwed up.  The one star is for the ambiance.  Had they owned up for their complete failures in customer service, they would've earned a second star.

kQDSfBCxcUvPtT5ga-hSlA.text: I met a date here, and as I walk in i can see the lounge singer there hitting on the girl i brought there.  As dinner continued the food was not cheaply priced and not outstanding.   Lower or equal to olive garden.   As the night progressed, I tried to enjoy the night but the lounge singe decided to play music very loud destroying any romantic evening, and when we were done the lounge singer ran out to talk to my date again.  If this is a place your bringing a girl for the first time you should get there first or the employees will pick up your date.  Very unprofessional, expensive and not relaxing.   The only good thing about the place is it has a nice atmosphere.. Sometimes Yes I have been there 5+ times and never had really good food, and was amazed when my date went home with the lounge singer.      So if you want to overpay for low quality food and have the employees hitting on your date, This place is Perfect!!!  You will never see me there again though.....  dinner for 2, about $100.   price of loosing your date to an employee of the restaurant, priceless !!

QFfnryxCU3VDGtgrp9BtSQ.text: We finally went back to capo's today had the groupon lunch deal.  The food was all spot on!  Salads were very tasty with nice fresh ingredients . Then came our sandwiches...YUM!!!  The fries have an aioli sauce drizzled on them that definitely is addictive!!  My hubby had the chicken parm sandwich I had the antipasti one and they were both awesome again everything was fresh and great quality!!  Too bad we didn't have room for dessert!

PkrSaO06TQXGHHe0HVbbEg.text: This place salvaged my birthday weekend. I was miserable from going to NOBU, I had hair inside my sushi, and the waitress accused me, I didn't even get anyone to sing "Happy Birthday," but going to Capo's was fantastic. Food was delicious and extremely filling. The theme is cute too.

33X8UYdehmVBDvs6UdsUAw.text: My husband and I went to capos on a whim while staying in Vegas. We wanted to go somewhere fun without paying an arm and a leg, and Capo's didn't disappoint. It looks a little weird on the outside, and I was not optimistic but I couldn't have been more wrong. As soon as we got inside, the entire atmosphere shifted and we were standing in a beautiful restaurant with chandelers, high back booths, and Frank Sinatra surrounding the bar. The food was delicious, and the staff was so fun and helpful. We had a great time at Capo's and would absolutely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great atmosphere.

nXNBJeDUIKsHpJoFSkCNTA.text: First time here. First of all, I love the trick where the door is opened from the hidden door, very neat. Secondly, I enjoyed how easy it was to make a reservation. I loved the cheese bread, the sauce for it was pretty good. Also, the lasagna has a mixture of cheese that go together wonderful, was not disappointed. Finally, the chocolate dipped cannolis are to DIE for! They're small, but very delicious. Had great service, our waiter was always on top of our refills and checking up on us. Friendly and good service! I'd definitely recommend stopping by here if you're hanging out in Vegas.

RPKXxRj6gdrff2btoGDRBQ.text: I thought of doing something special for are trip too Vegas we go every year .I must say it is a different place for sure at first I thought the place was closed .don't leave it is open ! The food was OK I was disappointed with the flashlight thing what are we 6 ?

Y45KkSac5MGP_4LNXSYNGw.text: We have always loved this place! This has always been our go to place when here for the National Final's Rodeo. We have always recommended this restaurant to all our friends coming to Vegas! We have always made our reservations for Tuesday night because it's 2 for 1...but we were very disappointed tonight. Apparently only locals are encouraged to come on Tuesdays because you have to be a local to get 2 for 1 on Tuesday. I really don't understand this concept and never heard of any restaurant having this policy. Our bill was $270 for 7 people and of course we were expecting it to be half of that. I spoke to the manager after we received the bill and she explained this was their new policy. She did deduct $20. I'm still very disappointed that a business wants to serve locals differently than anyone who walks through their doors.

kXAEF96G7mLgaw6t2Va4sg.text: I love this place, great staff and great food. The theme is phenomenal and they keep up with it. Absolute favorite things are the deep fried ravioli and the Alfredo.

jLQ3MEcfjsGhwaJhNt5DuQ.text: I am only giving this place one star because of ambiance. Capos is a very cute restaurant and my husband and I came in for our anniversary. The service was good except our server put our food order in later for our main course so we waited over 30-40 mins between our salad and dinners. Unfortunately the food was terrible!! I ordered what was to be a prime ribeye which was over cooked and flat!!!! No flavor at all and my husband had pasta with meatballs and sausage. Typical Italian food. It was so dry and the meatball I can't even describe, just awful. I think it was to much breading?? The dessert was good. Espresso cold. Oh well, we still enjoyed ourselves, but will not return.

NSOUjbzx-VfZk2nKj8OFCQ.text: The food wasn't very good at all. The food was over priced. Kate, our server was awesome!! The ambiance and experience was wonderful! The 2 stars is strictly for the food and price.

U7CZ9rVSGc991GV4cAlPdw.text: Decided to try this place out as my colleague recommended it. The entrance is entertaining and catches you off guard if you're not from the area. Though it is very dark inside, it gives you the vibe of the old-school mobster hangout. The food and service were exceptional. I sat at the bar and Liz waited on me. She was on top of it and super friendly. The exit was pretty funny too. Look at the floor when you walk out. Only downside...Needed to undo a notch on my belt after I left here! Recommended!

9simS507NAaPYApytmOEqw.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas. The food is fantastic. The speakeasy theme is the coolest. They have a Sinatra style singer who is great. The staff are top notch. It's a bit pricy but worth every penny. I usually order the spaghetti or lasagna but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. A great place to experience the old Vegas lifestyle.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with meat sauce and meatball. The yummiest.

CSTCU9YCwfy3c0QbLr4dZQ.text: What a fun way to dine old old school! Strip mall location ~ No no strippers. When we got off our flight our mouths were watering ~ plus Southwest peanuts won't cut it for me when your hungry. But, because we knew we were going to have a great super bowl Sunday wkd~ no gambling.                                                                     Food was incredible! Start out with the amazing fresh bread & salads.                                   My husband had special of the night Chicken "Yada yada" ~ forgot name ~that didn't go to waist. I had Veal with risotto~ it was tender, cooked to perfection.                     The rest of the gang had the best they ever had Lasagne. We chose a beautiful Chianti that was perfect with meal .         When in Vegas ~ GO TO "Capos"! Ciao

LDHH8NoNBG_gwrX1JhPzcA.text: Delicious as usual!  This Las Vegas icon is simply amazing. As a recent gluten free concert, I was thrilled to find they have a whole gluten free menu!  I had the gluten free chicken piccata and spaghetti and it was delicious. The decor, the music, the menu - perfection!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gqrv42E50riNgZy3Sg0sXw.text: Decent food. Music is WAY TOO LOUD. Horrible service. The gimmick isn't worth the time. Go someplace else.  First, as we pulled into the parking lot, there were lots of cop cars and an ambulance. Apparently someone tried breaking in the back with a butcher knife and attacked the cooks. Not a nice neighborhood. The mob and gangster theme can only go so far before the violence is real.  Next, we made a reservation here because we cancelled one at Herbs and Rye (amazing place) so we could take some friends to Capo's because it has a reputation of a cute fun place. Wrong. We ordered a round of drinks, ordered all of our food and an appetizer. Got the drinks, got the appetizer, then 15-20 minutes later without seeing our server with no refills on drinks and table cleared, we still hadn't gotten our salads. Two tables came and sat during our appetizer that now had their salads and meals. I spoke to the manager who blamed the kitchen issue, even though the server never came to check on us or refill drinks.  They brought us a "round on the house" and said our meals (now at almost an hour late), were next. That was a lie. Salads and second round of drinks were gone, a third table that came in after us received their entrees, and we were still sitting there. The manager came over and said he was comping the meal. Fine, we will wait for the entrees at this point, (one hour and 20 minutes).  Entrees arrived. Food was good, which is a shame that the service was so horrible. Risotto was great, all dishes were flavorful and good portion, but overpriced.  The bill arrived, and they just gave a small discount. Not comped. I told the server that the manager told us it was being comped. Manager came back over and said we misunderstood him, that "comped" was only a portion, not actually comped. So we ended up paying for that "round of drinks on the house" along with food that was clearly forgotten.  The thing this server and manager didn't know is that not only was our table of 4 all experienced restaurant workers, a manager, and a chef, but making the excuse of the "hood system" going down in the kitchen when 3 other tables got the entrees and were almost done by the time we got ours is just a disrespectful lie instead of just saying the server forgot to put our order in. At least honesty would be respectful. A full comp should have been the least they could have done with this debacle, but to lie and make excuses? Uncalled for.   Overpriced. Decent food. Music is WAY TOO LOUD. Horrible service. The gimmick isn't worth the time. Go someplace else.

REThvZ0vlh4dIiZRJxC1SQ.text: We tried to book this restaurant for a few times and finally manage to get in for Christmas Eve! Food is really good...  We are a group of 8 so we got to try all different dishes. First have to give them applause on how we can get in. We had a blast.  Excellent service, very attentive waiter, he gives us refills without we notice we need a refill. . We will come back...

anjOdD1wNOmYp_BPyFdNrw.text: Great atmosphere and great food! Our server was excellent tonight as well. The Racketeering Ravioli was amazing. I was a little disappointed in the house white white but the red that she suggested was spot on! We celebrated my cousins birthday and could not have been any happier. Love everything about this place and can't wait to make it a frequent stop

Wgya8UOUMzCOgo3ihItiBg.text: What a fantastic find!! The entrance was cool.. you go in the back door and ring a bell and wait for someone to open a small door and take your information.  (no password needed lol) Then the makeshift telephone opens and that's how you get in.  It's VERY dark so you have lights attached to your menus.  Service was exceptional.  Music was very romantic and we loved the setting.  The food was to die for.  The linguine with red sauce and blackened chicken might be one of the best dishes I have ever had.  We will definitely be going back.

Cu-XGTKAc0CWxygLearzIg.text: Excellent food, but waiter spilled a $50 bottle of wine (Our 2nd of the nite) onto or table and cell phone, wiped off my cell phone, and did not offer a Complimentary bottle nor even a glass of wine for the inconvenience. Bill was $238 before tip. Hope u like waiters and bus boys constantly circling around you too, makes it feel like your being rushed. A shame

75ARpB_N-SYCSHPr4Xr4ZQ.text: Atmosphere has a very cool vibe! Fredy's alfredo is a must to order! If you want something different, off-strip, this is a good place to go. Cocktails were a little weak. They do have a smoking patio, if that is important to you. Overall, we would go back.

zatuvlGi_WbhVKOzMgamPg.text: A hidden gem in Las Vegas. The food is amazing, hands down the best Italian food I've had here. The atmosphere is perfect and decor completes this Speakeasy spot. I highly recommend this for a date night, to treat out of town guests or just to stop by and have a drink at the bar. It won't disappoint.

bL6nmUfSa2_paMw1yy1mOw.text: We had an amazing time!  Everything is so much fun -- from the secret entrance to the ambiance.  I'm new in town and it's my new favorite place to take friends when they come to Vegas!  The food was delicious to boot!

y7wtyWi8TICbKmGvBEvXEg.text: Great Italian food.  Meatballs are the best and the lasagna is to die for.  I had the chicken piccata fabulous.  I never had a bad meal here.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

old7jAgt8EixXVmyU-LeWw.text: My wife and I decided to have a date night without our son so we decided to try something different and explore this part of the valley.   First, the entrance and ambiance at Capos is cool, I don't want to ruin it so I won't tell you.   As for the food.  They said their meatballs is what they're known for, so I ordered a meatball apetizer and a chicken marsala.  My wife ordered their clam linguini.  And sorry but I don't know the official menu names.    The meatballs were great, clams and chicken was awsome but I do have to point out.  Their mushroom risotto was TO DIE FOR!  YUMMM.  It was a side to the chicken marsala and my wife and I were fighting over it. Well of course I gave it to here. Let's just say, the next time we go to Capos we both will be ordering the mushroom risotto with a side of something.

nymlhFpSEtdJPyId5bZGkA.text: This place is overall amazing!!!! Its hard to write a review about a awesome place,like this that has so many surprises and not ruin them. So I will do this.... Ill tell you if you go here, prepare yourself for some surprises that you can only get from a speakeasy restaurant.  The food was the best from my trip! There was a magician walking around from table to table blowing minds! While they had a frank Sinatra impersonator tearing up the microphone. From experience, food, and service this place is a must when visiting Vegas. Its off the strip, dark and so much Damn fun! Cant wait to take everyone I know back to this place whenever I get a chance!

izDrnV71qnOXiJiM1NSnSg.text: What a find! Our friends were told about this place and we weren't disappointed ! This speakeasy / 20's Chicago gangster days restaurant was excellent ! From the back door secret entrance to the singer and the wait staff dressed the part!  And let's not forget the food! Everything was perfect! One thing is to make reservations because it fills up everyday.  If your wanting great Italian cuisine and atmosphere? Bring your friends, you won't be disappointed !
