2MtLo47Tr1jw5uTfMfsEUQ.text: This place has amazing atmosphere and delicious food. I can't recommend the cannoli high enough!

p-UiOoiiZyPYlMSuC6fabw.text: Cool theme! Nice staff. Super dark had a hair in my food couldn't see it until it was in my mouth so that's kinda gross since it's soo dark. Salad was blah plain nothing fancy, the bread was cold and dry no flavor. The chicken parm was delish though so that made up for it. The cocktails were also great.

ycWx8bV-HtO_SM15HTUtHg.text: Loved this place! It is so authentic! It was so much fun ringing the bell and having the guy ask us for the password. Thinking that was the door. But then he opened a door behind the pay phone. The service was amazing. Everybody were fantastic. Can't wait to go back again!

8zXf4dODKhJ9SkwBFynSKg.text: The atmosphere was nice but the food was  overpriced.  Make sure you double check your bill, they add gratuity on 6 people and they don't let you know it's on the check.

5kymTJX7dVwmcoFVq0PYew.text: we had a few appetizers, entrees, and desert.. EVERYTHING was DELICIOUS! only thing i would change is the open kitchen concept, i work in the restaurant industry and from where i was sitting in the booth thats all i could see and it made me feel like i was at work, when i go out thats the last thing i want! there should be a dummy wall put up if possible..

t8FSdRA8PlCsOTnwNzDoQA.text: As the others said its too dark but the atmosphere is fun. The food is really, really good.  Ordered house salad - super yummy & Hubby ordered Caesar, again, something better than the ordinary.  Same with the shrimp Alfredo, Penne ala vodka was just ok.  Ordered the Tiramisu Martini because of the review that suggested "order desert first" oh yea! Solid advice!

iCZHosdj4d8wvp-mATHT8Q.text: I grew up in Italian family and the food is as good as my grandmothers. So take the time and get off the strip. The atmosphere inside is awesome so ignore the outside.

2bRVeKNDknp1rzXfXtqPNw.text: I love the food and the great service BUT I made reservations for my work event (7 people) and the location on Tropicana was closed.  I wish they would have told me this when I called the Tropicana number and made the reservations??? We had to wait for a taxi to take us to the 2nd location.  Not a good way to impress the owner of your company

tzhCP23IgV6mLeOyWIiyQA.text: This place was great!!! The food was outstanding! The theme was really cool! And the atmosphere was amazing! Do yourself a favor and just go!

yAy1xadPBAtC9tElcDabtQ.text: I hadn't been to Capo's in a long, long while so was excited that our group decided to go there to celebrate a friend's birthday tonight. Once we were in and seater, I remembered why I hadn't been there in a while. The place is so dark you have to get the flashlight on your phone to not only read the menu, but see your food. They do have little lights attached to the menus but they aren't bright enough. So they know it's dark and?? Then there's the live entertainment. The music was good, it was very good, but it was SO loud we couldn't converse across the table. The food was ok, nothing special but ok. A bit pricey. The magician who went around was good but again, we had to shine a flashlight on him to see his tricks. It was a fun and unique evening but maybe it's better for the younger set? Our group was 50-62 and it was just too loud and too dark to enjoy. The secret entry is fun and the 3 tourists in our group of 5 found it unique but it didn't overcome the ultimate annoyance at spending the entire meal saying "what? Huh? Say again? Louder?" A frustrating evening.

yZKtjg_ktVL1R4n6PC5S7w.text: I love the theme, the decor and the lighting.  In terms of the food, my husband ordered the spaghetti with a vegetarian meatball.  It was absolutely delicious.  I ordered the pasta carbonara and the chicken was really juicy.  Our greater was super kind and had great customer service.

0FP6hGE8CYlmSUvSF1dkbg.text: I have been to Capo's several times over the last few years, dating back to when they were located on Tropicana.  Since they have moved from the Trop location to Sahara this restaurant has gone seriously down hill, each time I go worse than the visit before. I was greeted by the door guy, always somewhat gruff, but this time was very rude. Like why was I here, dinner?  Imagine that.   Then while we were enjoying a pre dinner drink at the bar, we requested a table.  The "host" which was the same guy from the door, seats us at a booth, one of several that were vacant.  Then he tells us that they are all reserved and he can give it to us if we make it "worth his while". So we tip him $5 as we walked all of 2 feet from the bar and figured he was just acting out the Chicago wise guy persona. He said, you can give me another one of those and stood there expecting more tip. Very odd indeed. It's not like he put much effort into it, and the booths remained empty throughout our dinner so they were not all reseved after all. The dinner was okay, service was decent, food was decent, but overall the restaurant had a dirty, dingy feel to it. The icing on the cake was the experience at the table next to us, where one of the guest was stung by a scorpion while he ate dinner.  He even took a picture of it! So, if there are scorpions, which to Capos' defense, are native to the SW part of town, then you know there are other bugs and they definitely are not proactively preventing them from being in their facility. Overall, I would saw last night's visit will definitely be the last. Not enough good to convince me it's worth spending money there.

arEtdpyLpVE1scKhs6Fd5A.text: I enjoyed it, it was a unique experience. I thought it was fun! The food did not look very appetizing, but it tasted really good.

44RVxMrGcq7uL8w4pU2mPQ.text: You know what?  This place has a lot of class, style, and good food.  I had almost every appetizer here and they all tasted great!  I also had the porterhouse and it too was very good. The staff is really friendly also.

PBTmu9zrrIynyBJ-88T8Cg.text: Excellent food, excellent service. The decor and vibe of the place is amazing. The food was soooo good! We had lasagna, spaghetti and meatballs and the cheesebread was to die for. The waitress was nice and had great suggestions for us. We will definitely be returning the next time were in town!

V9-goyk9cxA4EG3yeeBDMg.text: We were in Vegas for a fun weekend to start off 2015. Our son-in-law found this location searching for a nice place to take us for dinner, well Capo's fit the bill! The food was wonderful, I had the Scarface Shrimp dish, (garlic shrimp scampi in garlic sauce on a bed of angle hair). Just  wonderful.  If you sat at the bar you could watch every meal prepared in the old school, open kitchen. Fun place with really good food! Now the entertainment was great too, with Frank S. being channeled through the gifted crooner. And the slight of hand magician with the amazing card tricks was a plus to the evening.

AmV6reBJkv2Z7clOulGSEg.text: The entrance was the #1 impressive thing about this place, as it is completely a surprise and almost shocks you.  I won't give it up here but it's worth at least getting a drink to experience that part.  Greeter was great.  Lounge singer was very 70s and campy, but liked him none the less.  Food is pretty below average in pretty much every way possible.  Bread they bring out is pretty bad and dries out within minutes of being at the table to the point it's inedible.  Salads were small, boring and WAY drowned in dressing.  Calamari is $15 or so, and is half the size of what they'd give you at Capitol Grille, and is pretty bland and mushy.  the pasta tasted as though it were cooked in rancid water.  the chef was nice enough to come out and bring my wife a personalized dish that he eats, and it tasted the same.  we smiled and pretended to enjoy it just to keep from looking like big complainers.  We literally don't complain usually, but her first dish was inedible.  My lasagna was decent, but nothing spectacular and the sauce was too sweet (but that's a matter of taste, so i digress.)  Desert: It was spectacular.  Try the tiramisu, it is the best I've ever had.  Canolis were great too.  Loved it.  Our server was new, and he told us as such, so he was pretty clueless overall, but very nice as well.  Bus boys were very attentive.  Service overall was above average but the food was just so mediocre I can't think of a reason to talk myself into visiting again.  If you go, get a drink, maybe an app, and head somewhere else for a good italian dinner.  For God's sake, Maggianos (a chain) kills this place at the same price point.  You're better of there or Macaroni Grill truthfully.

tcclaLk27q9OiScHPXNAww.text: This place was awesome! I feel like I found a hidden gem in Las Vegas. We will definitely be back with friends. My fiance enjoyed it as well, from the entertainment (magic and a singer) to the locals sitting at the bar. The food was good too! Prices weren't too outrageous. I loved the atmosphere, whoever decorated did very well. I enjoyed the entrance in the back especially. I literally have no complaints. If I were to really search for one, it would be the urgency of receiving my drink from the bar. But seriously ignore the lady on here complaining of salty food and making you feel like you should have reservations. You will enjoy it here I promise!! :')

WKgShRzpAZGUOOcpSBx-Vg.text: now i will admit this place has good pasta... but that's where it stops.. i paid 23 dollars for a chicken dish (no pasta).. the chicken came by itself.. it weighed less than 7oz...   please give me my moneys worth...   the chicken did taste good though.. it was just a portion issue

tAXFvOHAFyLLsy2la-3szw.text: This place was soo much fun. The food was delicious. Bobby the singer was wonderful and made my girlfriends night. Definitely will come back

BWvozMvm55-t3zotthlYow.text: Stuffed chicken Anastasia is a must try dish. Dino's dirty martini is a must try drink. Live music and even a magician! Great dim atmosphere.

b1gHE7G-LOmrqrX4LJv21g.text: Always enjoy this restaurant because they show their appreciation for me stopping in. I'm a Las Vegas resident and have hundreds of choices for dining out yet this establishment never disappoints. Put a smile on, figure out how to get in, then enjoy a wonderful evening. Hint: I'm going on record here. Whatever you order is gonna be great, or else. Ask for Dominick or Nico.

0UtYKwcFBMqigq7WNQ8Exg.text: Off the beaten path but very worth it! Quiet, intimate dining with a great atmosphere. Food was excellent very very authentic! They also have a very good wine selection, as well as a few great Italian wines.  We will  be going back and telling all we know how amazing it was!! HIGHLY recommend reservations as they book up quick due to limited seating.

46T37ZRzgCK8YOc1D-sAqA.text: We had lunch at Capo's. The meal was amazing. We had the spaghetti with Mama's Meatball and one with a vegetarian meatball. Both were delicious but the vegetarian meatball was extraordinary! A must try. We also had the bruschetta which was also delicious. Janine & Brendan were excellent servers.The singer was a perfect touch at this speak easy Italian restaurant.

r6ttcQLGlpz1M5A_pX_oNg.text: WOW!WOW! and WOW!  When you first pull up to the place it seems a bit off putting, part of the charm really.  The fun begins the moment you open the door to the waiting area and I will not say anymore about this, you must experience for yourself.   Make sure to make a reservation, we went on a Monday evening and the folks coming in behind us at 7 pm could not get in unless they agreed to sit at the bar, yes they get that busy.   The ambiance is incredible!!!  The staff is AMAZING!!!  The food, well I cannot even do it justice.  You must try the meatballs of course.  My boyfriend had the Cioppino and said it was probably the best he has had anywhere, including SFO.   Absolutely nothing to complain about, the bill was reasonable, we had such a great dinner and will definitely be going back.  This is a MUST if you are visiting VEGAS, get off the strip and the over priced hotel restaurant so / so tasting foods and give this a try.  You will not regret it one bit.

x5IkqGV4joPJcG-RIDonZw.text: The Stuffed Chicken Anastasia is sooooooo good! I can keep having more and more and more yummmmm!!! You can also pick and choose what side you would like for most entrees I enjoyed the classic Alfredo. Apps are perfect for sharing will def come back again! Tiramisu martini strong and delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Lh1Stb9ewlQxU83A8r9TeQ.text: OMG What a disappointment. Overrated, overpriced,  too dark, and please please please turn down that way TOO LOUD awful music. No one  loves Frank Sinatra more than me, but what I love more is great food and great conversation with my family, which was impossible in this horrible place. The outside needs a good paint job or power cleaning, the inside is awful. The food was awful, my husband wasn't cutting his steak , he was sawing it. I had lasagna and the sauce was way too sweet, like sugar. I could go on forever saying bad things about this place, but it's late and my head is still pounding from the bad experience of "dining" at Capos. Their gangster gimmick worked  because the place was packed,but I would guess it's a one time deal and most people don"t go back.  I swear I never get headaches and my head is still pounding. Romantic date, special occasion, or wanting good food this is not the place to go. One more thing, my husband was still sawing his steak and I was still pushing my lasagna around pretending to eat it when the waiter asked us if we wanted dessert and coffee.  Who does that? I'm thinking it's a good idea to wait till people have finished eating before pushing dessert and coffee.

Gtfox-KUB6ssY9PLaon6Lw.text: This restaurant is adorable.  When you first walk in, you are in this little vestibule and there are pictures on the wall one of which was Rocky Marciano fighting in some prizefight.  Suddenly, the picture moves to reveal a square hole in the wall with a man standing on the other side and he asks you if you have a reservation.  He then opens the door for you and this is really cute, too, because a payphone on the wall suddenly swings open and you are invited into the restaurant.    From there, this service has more personality and character than Tony and Tina's wedding... we had such a magnificent time and the food was absolutely delicious. Service was amazing and everyone there was so friendly and so very, very Italian...    The walls are adorned with famous mafia figures, e.g., a huge poster of Al Capone.  The food was delicious... the stuffed Chicken Anastasia was the best thing I've ever tasted.  Don't be an idiot...  go to this restaurant when you are in Las Vegas.  You won't be sorry.  It's old school class meets crime drama with really good Italian food and steaks!  I'm coming back in two weeks!  I can't say enough about this restaurant's charm!  This place is an original... with great service!  There was a man singing live Sinatra type Songs and he was excellent, too.    Sincerely happy....  Scott Prussack Attorney and lover of all things wonderful!

jQrXYMoRYUoTfzL9yyZZ5w.text: Legit good! Amazing food.  Great atmosphere.  Great live entertainment.  Great service.  Loved.  Totally recommend.  Must try

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The really give you the speakeasy experience

-Y4cWtsTCqnFwp7HH2pn3g.text: Hidden gem in Vegas! Brunch experience was great. Loved the environment and jazz music. The Capo's Toast dish was so tasty and very very filling. Would highly recommend taking friends/family to this restaurant for a fun time!

dYFXMtv4UVE-r1iMWSCQJQ.text: This is my second visit. Although the food is well prepared it is extremely overpriced they have raised their prices tonight had the lasagna average lasagna prepared well not quite as good as it sounded on the menu as there was no apparent sausage but $25 for a piece of lasagna come on really. And then they ask you for your salad they don't tell you that if you order a Caesar salad it's an upcharge. $26 for chicken parmesan it's chicken parmesan people No frills No deals you need to raise your $$ to $$$$ on your website. Tonight very disappointed again the food was ok wait staff great the gangster at the door is fun. But that certainly doesn't excuse the extortion prices on the food.

vGxwrktSG6mDCg21Ubg0ww.text: I love this restaurant. The service is phenomenal; very attentive and just amazing . The whole mobster vibe is fun for everyone, also the guy singing makes it even better. I love Italian food, especially growing up in New Haven, CT, we have some of the best Italian food and this restaurant brought me home. I went here for my Anniversary and I was so glad I did. I had the chicken parmesan and it was very good. I plan on taking friends there when they come into town. It's great for a date, families or big groups. I highly recommend this place to anyone. Make a reservation!

i3kvAvbAqduyt9EwkQpu8A.text: Where do I begin with this experience? You pull up to a shady looking building (seriously don't be afraid) you walk through the first door where you find yourself in front of another Red door which says that the restaurant is shut down due to prohibition. ??? Um... then something fantastic happens after you ring the doorbell (go ahead try it!) The food was delicious and the appetizer was heavenly! I love the fact that they cater to vegetarians and they had special "meatballs" for us. It's really dark in there so make sure to use the light they provide you. Also, the SERVICE WAS UNLIKE ANY OTHER! Great job guys! The live music was also a great touch. I0/10 would recommend and go again in a heartbeat. Loved.

yyeTwuj5-k0qzCSC3KgSUQ.text: Mix up on the Reservations but they made things good. We brought an out of town guest and this was a good choice to impress. Food was wonderful, service tops, live lounge singer was entertaining.... and one of the best Bourbon Manhattans in Las Vegas. Get the password and escape within.... old school Chicago.

mbq7HGPVD4ZNkb2FDEOU7A.text: The best experience ever!! The food is so good that I don't know where to begin. We had 4 people with lasagna, chicken Marsala, veal parmesan, and chicken Parmesan. I will be back after I digest.

eaLH55427VNgyk9C6sC8MA.text: This is definitely a go-to spot for taking visitors for me! In pretty heavy rotation. Food is pricey but they usually have some kind of deal going on so keep an eye out for Groupon (usually a lunch deal), 5% cash back on Yelp and/or BOGO deal on Tuesdays for locals. Nice thing about that BOGO deal too is they will just take $40 off your total bill if you bring visitors with you ($20 for each local).   Favorite part is the entrance! I always feel cool busting out with the password. Ambiance inside definitely gives you that speakeasy feel- dim lighting, red tufted leather seats, The Godfather on one of the TVs, live music after 6pm (piano, Frank Sinatra singer). They have HH 3-6p Mon-Sat if you don't mind sitting at the bar.   If you get a salad, get the dressing on the side since they are pretty heavy handed. Cesar w/ chicken is also a fave for me. Try the Italian Duck Egg Drop Soup if you're feeling adventurous- a bit salty but hits the spot for me when there's word that there may be e.coli in my lettuce. They also substituted our lettuce w/ spring mix last night which was nice. Creme brulee is my fave dessert!  Usually opt for the picatta dishes. Pastas are all homemade, their meatballs are ginormous, so really hard to go wrong w/ that. Great service/ambiance, decent food and ongoing deals make this a 4 for me.

zgVSfx3cOz8daQbwDy9_XQ.text: Came here for lunch on a Friday. Only a few customers were there. The entrance is pretty cool and its unique & funny trying to get in. The decor is old school mob vibe. Its dark and they had Sinatra and jazz playing. The seating is intimate but romantic wiith flickering candles on the tables. All the waiters wear all black with bow ties and suspenders. Our server was great! Very attentive and offered items that were off menu. He was also very funny.  Garden Salad - Fresh greens, and creamy garlic deessing. Flavorful. Calamari is a MUST try! Its super tender. It was complimented by the pepperoncinis and lemon. It had a great marinara for dipping. We had grilled chicken samdwhiches. I had the antipasto one that had italian cheeses and meat, on a grilled ciabatta bread. Really tasty besides the hot wilted lettuce.  My date enjoyed his crispy chicken paninni as well. We also had chianti that was pretty tasty. We will be back to try dinner menu. Great place for romantic date. Theres a piano there too, I m assuming they have live music, but not sure when.

e7yQ48EnfENrNw8Ad_vgKg.text: Twenty ladies for a Saturday luncheon in The Taylor Street Room. Quality food, delightful service from Janeen and leftovers!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All our former Chicagoans love being at Capo&#39;s
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes! Capo&#39;s has gift cards

EYIWxiv2TqupU6Rh0m8h0g.text: Good mobster atmosphere, but don't let 2 for 1 Tuesdays fool you. It is not 2 meals for the price of one. The shrimp in the scampi was delicious, the noodles were like grandma used to make. You will get a kick of how you get in, and a funny ending on the way out. Dark atmosphere. We enjoyed.

JTT-8mYtxsZkWX-9AH8hvw.text: Great food great place for date ,experience the old vegas or mob days . Love the music and signer. All around great.

OSOITzQm7L1H3_aKpZrQ4Q.text: Can't even give one star  OMG !!!!! Waitress was awesome !!!!! Hence our appetiser 50 mins in same time as our cold ass food !!!!! For lunch with 3 tables in  Not coming back

qvUUjYpL_TQQVHZKhQa0rA.text: It's interesting that there are so complaints about the service. With my experience tonight, the atmosphere and the service is what kept this from being a 2 star review.   The restaurant is pretty dark when you walk in, and it will take a little bit for your eyes to adjust. Definitely, a cool speakeasy vibe with pictures of gangsters on the walls. All of the employees were very nice and checked in on our group from time to time. I started with the Garlic Cheese Bread and had Da Don's Lasagna for dinner. I was expecting/hoping the garlic cheese bread would be crispy and toasted, but instead, it was very soft, almost soggy. The sauce that it comes with was ok, and was much needed to add flavor to the bread, which didn't have much flavor by itself. My lasagna was large, but tough and rubbery. It seemed like the cheese within the layers was not heated enough, so it wasn't melted. Whenever I would try to bring my fork to my mouth, the lasagna would take my food back to the plate. The only way I can describe the sauce is that it was a little harsh tasting, or acidic for my taste. I only ate a quarter of it, before I gave up.   I really wanted to like Capo's, and was looking forward to my dinner. Everyone else at my table enjoyed their food, so maybe I'll come back and order something different and see if that helps. I'll make sure to update my review whenever that happens. I feel they deserve a second chance. Like I said, the atmosphere is cool, and the employees were very nice. The magician that visits the tables was great! His tricks were comparable to the magicians at The Magic Castle in Hollywood. I'll let everyone know after I give it another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Da Don&#39;s Lasagna.

qLn6zvk5TwxKiTdtyQZ9TA.text: Great experience and great food. Took a group of 9 adults and 1 child and it was fun for all. Service was top notch.

Pz1UHnGdsLRbjvXekvTaUA.text: We went here after our wedding and this place was amazing!  The best Italian food I have ever eaten!  The food was fresh and well worth the wait. We had made a reservation for 15 and we were all taken care of very well. The atmosphere was so serene and definitely speak easy vibe.  We will be coming back !

hT4EGiwnxXObMU9jxutEUg.text: This was our first time here.  We heard about this place on our last trip and decided to come back for our 1st anniversary.  Awesome place - everyone should try it atleast once!! The food was good, the staff was friendly, the ambiance is killer and the cheesecake is amazing!

hLDK3mAGWEItyDyTzvMXbw.text: This was our second time around. First time was for dinner, and this time for lunch. Both times I was not disappointed. Although i would have preferred a slightly larger portion for dinner, the experience was very positive thanks to Erin's friendly service. Lunch however was a surprise, and even though I did expect the opposite since we ordered from their lunch special menu, the portions were actually very filling. I ordered the Chicken Parmesan sandwich which was loaded and delicious (although I suggest asking for a little less sauce or even on the side to avoid the sogginess on the bread of you let it sit more than a few minutes) What made the afternoon even better was the excellent service and super friendly attitude of both Josh our bus person and Angela our waitress. Nether of them had been there for long, but they acted as if they did with excellent knowledge of the food and friendly service which made our stay more enjoyable. Everything you expect from a True Italian restaurant, from the romantic atmosphere with dimmed chandeliers candles (make sure you bring your phone for use of the flashlight when reading the menu) and a live piano (at night), not to mention the consistent playing of old Frank Sinatra and mob movies on some screens on one side of the room. We were too full to try the deserts but we will definitely go again soon. It is definitely one of the hidden local spots. Oh, and did I mention they also have 2 for 1 Tuesdays in case you did not notice the sign on the front of the restaurant.

DrU5zdXqrdbgKdpEZR6qDA.text: Had friends visiting from out of town and brought them here. Food was excellent. Atmosphere is amazing. The speakeasy vibe made our experience wonderful. I think the only downside of our night was that the bartenders weren't educated on classic cocktails (asked for a London Pickup and a Bronx Cocktail) so we had to settle for some Old Fashioneds in their original form, no fruit. Other than that I would recommend it to anyone looking for great food in a throwback environment.

3xDVl3svZN0ifJpegWJWGQ.text: We went at night without making a reservation. We got seated, but our choice was private room or the bar. We chose the bar. It wasn't bad, but next time we will make reservations. Now, on to food.....I got cheese raviolis, and it was great! I would definitely order it again. My friend had spaghetti and a meatball, the biggest meatball I've ever seen in my life. Lol. This place was awesome. The atmosphere, food, service (servers and the guy singing while you ate), I will definitely return and recommend to others. Don't let the outside fool you!

pECUqT2oVDLu9b5uYk5F_Q.text: So listen. My team of 12 and I had lunch here this afternoon and let me tell you it is a Las Vegas Must Do! We were seated in a private room and Everything from the food, (which was homemade and clearly made with love), to the service, to the overall experience was top notch.  We will definitely be coming back this summer with family and friends! Way to go Capo's you exceeded ALL expectations! Well done!

WkSCEeNQCRyFlUF93TTWnw.text: I've read a lot of good reviews on Yelp and was intrigued but sadly disappointed. The atmosphere was just what I expected. It was very dark inside and stereotypical Italian complete with secret entry but the food was average. It was disappointing. We ordered lasagna and chicken picata and both were flavorless. Our server was nice but not enough attentive. And when we wanted to ask for another round of drinks he was not paying attention to our table. They have a live singer with a lovely voice. I will return just for the live music.  Overall, not as good as I was expecting.

e2Q9GM8qMyOjH0ahdIkCBg.text: Really loved their food, it took about 10 minutes for my eyes to adjust since it's extremely dark inside but it goes with the ambiance. I do prefer more lighting just because you never know if there is a hair in your food. The quality is nice, servers were attentive and polite, the entrance was fun but the restrooms are under kept. It's worth going for the experience and the dishes we tried were very tasty, I wouldn't come here all the time, but perhaps often.

R87HaZBK-8XsgFK3QsjQ8w.text: Very cool speakeasy establishment. They have a really romantic setting, beautiful music, delicious food and overall great experience. If you're in the area it's definitely a must! Can't wait to go back.

TLKItKkrh4cF0Xz6V4KuYg.text: Been a customer since they first opened on W Tropicana.  Loved this place from the very first visit.  The calamari is really good, not overcooked, not greasy and not tough. I love their shrimp scampi and chicken Angelo. I've tried some of their specials as well and they're all wonderful. The servers are very attentive and knowledgable of their menu.  Great atmosphere to let loose, enjoy some good eats and drinks!

lJl3ccsxfXVSGzvDE5nXFA.text: The food itself is actually of good quality and taste. However, the portions are small for their price.   I made a reservation through OpenTable for my brother's birthday and made a note of it because he loves the mafia theme and the singers from the era. Unfortunately we were seated by the bar without any view, were told we couldn't move because the other spaces were booked (though I did see empty booths throughout the entire time we were there), and no one wished him a happy birthday (not that they needed to).   The singer himself was great and I really wish we could have watched him perform. We won't be going back.

UphbHppaPHr84mjmQgseSA.text: Hands down best Italian food restaurant I have been to in Vegas and believe me I have tried a lot out here,  being from ny I have been searching for a good place for quite some time, the food here, the ambiance, service, absolutely outstanding,  a little pricey but that comes with fine dining so I don't mind. Highly recommend

6o4Tz8U3C60nuPkoB1SKlg.text: When you walk into the door, you have to press the button and then someone answers from a square window on the right. Once you enter from the secret door you're transported back into the time of great big band music and Italian culture. I was pleasantly surprised!  This place has an amazing vibe! Very cozy and romantic ambience. Amazing singer and entertainer! Ashley is an awesome server! Food was great as well...delicious creme brulee and tiramisu! The meatballs appetizer was soooo good too!   This place is a must for everyone!

NPpeCo-eBVS_bc6UJcSNUw.text: Visiting from New Jersey and had seen this place on man vs food so decided to check it out... it was amazing! It's a speakeasy! Portions were huge! Our waitress was so friendly! We started with the caprese and the mob meatball salad which were both great, the red marinara was spicy and so good!! For dinner we had the lasagna and chicken parmigiana both were delightful! To end the night we had the cannolis which come 2 in an order and are so creamy! Highly recommend coming here!!!!

xJaX42otVG5gzTGVrdlI3Q.text: Okay, the place is kitschy and the food is ok.  Everything else is awesome.  The live music is excellent,the ambiance is great, and the service is spot on.  Looking for an old Vegas Italian restaurant with that old Vegas feel?  Go and see for yourself.  Oh and Two for One Tuesdays get $20 off your bill for two dinner selections.

tgbQxC3kQxj0_OvFgXHOhA.text: I had a great time here with my girlfriend for a birthday dinner. The Speak easy style is fun but they lay it on heavy at times lol Live music and a great steak for the right price

_NCF3H2GtQIm6Rov9J_t-Q.text: I don't even like Italian food but I love this restaurant.  It's my new favorite Vegas locale.  The food was excellent as was the service.  Can't wait to go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v7OyDBmuLtwsLQY2qVL6kA.text: We arrived at 9:40 pm on a Tuesday. We rang the bell and the host opened the secret door and asked if we had a reservation. I told him we did not, he acted like he was annoyed. He said the kitchen was closing soon I told him we already had looked at the menu online and we knew what we wanted, the server was nice she took our order. My wife had the Angels with dirty faces without the pepperoni, I had the Chicken parmesan. When the food came it was great the Chicken was the best I have had, cooked perfectly my wife's dish was also delicious. I think the host was busting my chops because I didn't call ahead. I recommend this place you won't be disappointed. Great atmosphere with big red booths, mob pictures on the wall and Frank Sinatra music being performed by a man playing a piano. Next time in Las Vegas we will be back.

N7sgXxRWBgFJRrob7eFADQ.text: Nice atmosphere but food is not good.  Spent $160 for 4 people with drinks.  If you want to try something new come here but the food will disappoint.

6sQbaPwfh6m0H5y4Fx5IzA.text: A great dinner for a large party. Staff was very curtious. Food was delicious and ready quickly, had a wonderful singer and magician for entertainment that did not disappoint! Thank you again for providing a great last night in town for my guests!

HJ3dSlOcuEBT_rxyLm8TCQ.text: Favorite Italian in Vegas! Killer atmosphere and amazing food   My favorites: Chicken Parm Caesar Salad Risotto   Enjoy!  Ps. Locals are 2 for 1 on Tuesdays.

ZtvRgFXHNWSlIwV6LLncvQ.text: Italian food is probably my favorite type of food to go out for. I've been to a number of restaurants in search of good Italian meals and it's been hit and miss. Capo's is a definite hit! From the surprising entrance/greeting  to the almost listenable piano lounge singer (the food wasn't the only thing that was cheesy), the ambiance is a serious part of the experience. The service was overly friendly and helpful but the food was the real star. I had the lasagna which came with a salad and bread. Although a tad on the pricey side, it is a good sized portion and probably the best lasagna I've had since my friend John's super Italian mom made hers back in Ct in the 70s. I went with 3 good friends and they all had the same great experience. Found out they have a locals deal on Tues of 20% off. Will definitely go back again and spread the good word!

Icak-O3OFR7rYqz84lDnbw.text: I cannot rave enough about the deliciousness that is Capo's Italian Cuisine! I had the Capone's Carbonara dish and it was drool-worthy good! The variety of flavors in this dish come together to form a beautiful symphony in your mouth. I wanted to not only scarf the entire thing down, but also lick the plate clean. The atmosphere is also awesome. There is a secret entrance to get in and the dining room has a vintage look and feel to it. I highly recommend this place if you're ever in Vegas. It's not on the strip, but well worth the drive to it! I definitely plan on going back on my next trip to Vegas.   *The lot has plenty of parking  **The service is friendly  ***If I could, I would give Capo's a 6-star rating!

yRxdXG7jm8SOo27qi1G6aA.text: Let me tell you about the time my friends and I had 1 edible then went to Capo's. Before the cab picked us up from Bally's 3 of us split an edible that was the size of a mini tootsie roll. We all got into the car and started our drive away from the strip.  Now let me just warn you this place is NOT by the strip. Anyways we get there and the entrance was amazing, you don't even know you're in the right place! At least not till the mafia boss let's you in the back from the magic wall.   So we get seated in the Frank Sinatra booth and order apps and dinner. Our server was AMAZING, the food AMAZING, atmosphere AMAZING. It wasn't till right before the dessert came that the edible hit us like a southern grandma in church! We could not stop laughing and started losing all sense of reality and feeling in our legs. My friend and I had to use the restroom which is not easy when you can't tell your legs to move or get up. I some how made it to the bathroom. I lost my friend and come to find out she was outside throwing up like the exorcist all along a random alley. We got into an uber and made it safely to our hotels   Would I go back to Capo's? YES!  Am I ever trying edibles again? NOOOOOOOO

hjN-hSaPrZHBw9nSkHnRcA.text: I was attracted to this restaurant by all the wonderful reviews.  The concept is fun and a brilliant way to attract customers but the restaurant falls short.  We had high expectations because of all the positive comments but that was not the case.  1.  Drinks were perfect 2.  Order the meatball appetizer...these were the best part of the meal 3.  Nothing we ordered was paced!  You shouldn't ever be served the next course before you're done with the prior course 4.  We had to ask the busser for a bottle of wine because our waitress was AWOL 5.  Ordered dessert with the busser because the waitress was again AWOL 6.  When you are serving a good product you don't need to hide it in sauces  When the waitress was available she was great but after our meal arrived we were never checked on.    We wanted to LOVE this restaurant but will most likely visit for drinks and appetizers at the bar only.  The restaurant would be best as a place to meet up and drink but not as a dining destination.

62MjVfi4H4qdev-2GXSebA.text: One of our most favorite spots! It's so fun! The food is amazing! The vibe is just cool. It's like being transported back in time. The singer singing frank or Dino makes the night even better. Call ahead and ask for the password. You'll be glad you did

e49s3-kG4d-PKYA3n-3iQQ.text: This was my first visit at Capo's and it was an excellent one! They have a dramatic entrance where you ring the doorbell and the guy opens up a small window to see who you are, then opens the door to let you in.  The place was very dim with lots of awesome decor from the mafia world. While casual dress is ok, I felt under-dressed wearing jeans as many were dressed a little bit more formal.  Then the tables that were empty were already reserved. So, my friends and I ended up dining at the bar. Oh boy! I was happy that we ended up at the bar! You can see all the live actions while they cook and prepare your meals. They have TVs at the bar and a live singer by the piano at the center of the restaurant (I came in at the right night). It's really awesome!   I ordered Tony Duck's soup and Spaghetti with Meatballs. The soup does not contain any duck. It has spinach and eggs with such a flavorful broth! I came here to try out their spaghetti with meatballs and it was delicious! The homemade meatball was bigger than my fist. It was moist and did not fall apart when slicing. The marinara was well flavored and good consistency. I prefer my pasta a little thicker though.   This is one of the great dining experience I would not hesitate to take my family and friends when visiting town. Capo's is definitely an added gem for Vegas! And the cute and friendly female bartenders added a nice touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homemade spaghetti with meatballs = delicious and huge portion!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tony Duck&#39;s soup.

IKyKHzuUS5QjIgruqf0f3w.text: Went here for dinner on a Tuesday night (if you are a local you get a discount on Tuesdays). The service was great, they sat us by the bar and kitchen so it was a little noisy but that was to be expected based on how the seating is laid out. The food was great with big portions, it took a little long to come out and the servers were very apologetic for that. Overall it is a cool place to have diner and I would go back.

aR3DpD3AgVRn0IuH98jmDQ.text: This place is amazing!! From the atmosphere to the food. Jeremy was our server and he was the best. At first I thought the magician was going to be cheesy but he was awesome and his tricks were the best I have ever seen. I would recommend this place to anyone! We went with 4 people we all had appetizers, dessert and our bill was just under $150.   Second time here and it was just as amazing if not better!!!! This time tried the shrimp scampi....it was delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another amazing meal at Capo&#39;s. A must try in Vegas!!!

D5Jj3Gnj5Zg-WM6ZnLFt1Q.text: Great service and cool gangster inspired set up with Al Capone recipes.  They are not shy on their portions and even had a singer during brunch time.  The chicken parmesan sandwich and meatballs were really good.  The sauce is a little spicy which I love.  Prices are also reasonable for Vegas.  My New Yorker Italian husband liked everything we had as well.  We had leftovers for later.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan sandwich
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball appetizer, sauce has a little spiciness to it

h4DsA9ctaq8Va5R0Za_t9Q.text: A nice little Italian restaurant in Vegas with the old school mobster feel. The chicken parmesan was excellent with garlic mash potatoes. The garlic bread with mozzarella cheese was a delight before my entree. I will most definitely be visiting this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5D3Aoh4d854MEv9Y-b1TwA.text: Great vibe and fantastic food. The shrimp scampi was amazing. Loved the whole speakeasy theme. I will make it a point to go back

Qg3nHW3xdTaQ0p3oq1AKrA.text: What a MF'in gem! Wow! We ordered the fried ravioli for starters - amazing. Although you only get four pieces and are left craving for more. For our entrees we ordered the eggplant parmagiana and penne ala vodka. Both were just simply amazing. I substituted the spaghetti for pesto pasta which was also great. Overall this has been one of the best Italian places that my wife and I have been to across the US. It's such a great place and totally worth the trek off the strip. Not to mention the entire ambiance of the place rocks starting from he very cool way that they greet you at the entrance. Thank you Capos!   PS - be sure to check the address that uber suggests for this place as it is not current with their actual location. We learned this the hard way after going to their previous address suggested by Uber.

UOGNdY57kFNdkGYH7fJw5g.text: Run...do not walk...run here! It's such a fantastic restaurant and experience. The food: holy smokes amazing Italian food. You might gain eight pounds over the course of dinner, but don't worry about it -- worth it. I've never had a bad meal here. But make sure to experience one of their meatballs. Unrivaled meat heaven. You can order one on the side with any meal for $5 bones.   The staff are friendly and efficient. We sat at the bar and Sierra was our barkeep. She's awesome, knows her booze and very sweet.

aaRcCkoFY_3lBF5oBs9KyA.text: Took my mother in law here for her birthday. It was our first time in. None of us had been in this building since it was a Hooters many years ago. Parking is right outside so it's easy to get in and out. The big double doors facing west are the exit doors. Luckily there was a sign pointing us into the entrance that resembled a prison entrance. One inside the first entrance you ring the bell and a man's face pops through what was picture on the wall. After some small talk you're granted an entrance into a very dim lit restaurant. There are old mobster photos and  memorabilia on all of the walls. This place resembles and old speak easy that the mafia would have hung out in back in the day.  Live lobsters are there at the front for you to chose from. I will advise that if you have any large members in your group to specify a table over a booth when booking your reservation. There is both live and ambient music played during your meal. Sine it is so dark inside, they have attached small LED flashlights to every menu.    Full bar available or you can stick to their specialty drinks.  Seating is round booth (almost a full circle), bar area or traditional table and chairs. The do have space for large parties. We ordered the fried raviolis as an appetizer. They came out perfect! Slightly crunchy, cheesy and flavorful. Everyone ordered a sale over the soup, probably because it was over 100 degrees outside. The creamy garlic dressing was good. I'd recommend the house salad to anyone that is a big artichoke fan because there was a huge artichoke heart on top of my salad. The caesar salad was built from shredded Romain lettuce and the dressing was good there too.  I wanted spaghetti. I was torn between the meat sauce or meatball, so I got BOTH. The meat sauce and added ONE meatball. They are a half pound each.  I got to sample my mother in law's shrimp scampi and my guy's chicken Alfredo. Both were great. I was torn between all three so it worked out.  Luckily we saved room for dessert. I had the lava cake and he had the cheesecake. Both were great. I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for a fun off the strip Italian dinner. It think this would be a great spot to go after checking out the mob museum.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Al &#39;s Ricotta Cheese Cake with raspberry sauce
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scarface Shrimp Scampi
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghettini with meat sauce and one 1/2 pound meatball

pA4JNUs5k3UDBEwJXt9kyg.text: A fun interactive place, staff was friendly and very attentive, food was great, definitely order the meatballs as an appetizer u won't b disappointed.

s_zw5BdDZ8ZsJBGw-1pVoA.text: Amazing Experience from stepping foot inside the door!  Just like goin back in time!  Food portions are HUGE, be sure to go there hungry!  All of our food choices were so yummy, unfortunately we could not take leftovers with use due to staying in a hotel without a fridge.  Will definitely be visiting again!!!!

5VQKYnEPbkVHpWpdTlxzsg.text: Great atmosphere and great food. I would definitely recommend it. Jerry is also a great!!!

_N4UFxLDQOkri-UDjrhQ7w.text: Finally crossed this place off our list! And so glad we did. My husband and I just finished up a delicious lunch here and it was soooo good! I had the chicken parm sandwich with pasta salad and hubby had Uncle Pauly's Arrabiata with their famous meatball. Their red sauce is flavorful and one of the best I've had. Staff was attentive in refilling our water and polite. Atmosphere is cool, very dark with an old school feel. I highly recommend this place when in Vegas!

dnoS3zFH6JTfs0G6bfdmYQ.text: For lunch I had the Pasta Primavera with chicken. It was a good portion. The vegetables, pasta  and chicken were all  fresh and delicious. They use a wine sauce  that's quite distinctive to the palette and nose but it's excellent. Husband had the spaghetti and meatball which was very good. We shared stuffed mushrooms for appetizers that were good and they too were in a wine sauce covered in delicious mozzarella cheese (excellent quality cheese!) The bread was great for dipping; crispy outside, soft inside. We were seated and within one minute  our server asked if we were ready to order. I told her we just sat down (which she knew!) I asked her to please give us time to look at the menu. She maybe walked two tables away and returned to asked if we wanted any appetizers (!!??!!) which I didn't get to look at yet either so she just decided on her own to read ALL OF THEM to us (!!??!!). She did the same thing with the dessert menu and that's the only reason this place gets 3 stars instead of 5. And we felt rushed to order our lunch entree too even though I told this girl we weren't ready. We were in the restaurant less than 5 minutes and she's trying to get appetizers and entree orders from us,  we didn't even get our drinks yet! There was no reason for her to be so pushy, it was lunchtime and there were only 6 other tables. If you are going to charge high prices  I expect top knotch service! Anyway, Food was good but for the prices they charge I should be able to sit and read their menu so I could get what I wanted not what she rambled off. The gentleman who let us in was super nice and informative and the bus boys were outstanding. Our server never checked on us about the appetizer, our meal or dessert and we had to track her down for our check. I guess she couldn't get anymore money out of us so she was done with us. But know this was just the way she operated as I watched our neighboring tables get superb attentive  service and maybe we'll return but certainly we will ask for a different server.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bill for lunch
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spumoni...sorry for the terrible picture, it&#39;s dark in the restaurant!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and giant meatball YUM!

Mf93crzngG4jzjXqcwk4sg.text: In a city where hype always overrides the final product, Capo's delivers good old-fashioned Italian food in a cool atmosphere and with reasonable prices. I won't ruin the surprise of how they greet you, but let me just say that it sets the mood for the start of a very enjoyable evening. Having worked in Vegas once a month for work this past year, most of the dinners I've had have been very expensive and very poor quality. If you're in town and want to get off the Strip, that's where you'll find some of the better quality of Las Vegas. Capos has it all really. The food is wonderful.... I had the Chicken parm, salad and soup. The parm was great and had a light, but very flavorful, sweet marinara sauce. The wedding soup was one of the best I've had in years too. Too much dressing on the salad, but they make their own dressings, so I didn't care. They make it all from scratch.... 4-5 different pasta sauces are available, in addition to alfredo and vodka sauces. I was eating on a Wednesday night and they even had live music... a very easy listening Frank Sinatra-like. The service was great and the bartender and manager all take special interest in making sure that you are enjoying your meal and experience.  Get off the strip and go.... you'll be glad that you did.

WNhMEFW5Gg4Ja-DVI4i-Sg.text: Recommended by a former native and definitely less touristy than other Vegas restaurants.  I was enveloped by the delicious garlicly aroma as soon as I walked through the door.  The pastas (al dente), veal picata (could cut with a fork), and shrimp fettuccini delivered the goods and Capo's remains on my list as one of the best restaurants off the strip in Las Vegas.  The restaurant's speakeasy theme and dark interior might take you a little off guard but its mafioso/brat pack vibe is easy to embrace, as is the live Sinatra style music.  Two for one entrees on Tuesdays just adds to the restaurant's likability.

R9lrY4Ar-gIHZyZG24W1nw.text: Capo's is a place concerned with the experience. When you walk in the front door, you enter in a little vestibule area with no windows, no doorknobs (that work), and a camera in the corner. A little screen slides open and the guy asks you what you want, kinda like a speakeasy. When you enter the actual restaurant, it's very dark (so dark, in fact, that the menus have little flashlights attached to them) but decorated well.   I went there with a group of people. We were supposed to meet at 8:00, but not everyone showed up until about 8:45. To kill time, the few of us who were there decided to wait at the bar. After a few drinks, the bartender let us know that appetizers at the bar were half off. Sounded like a good deal, so I ordered the calamari, which was $14.99. The bill was non-transferable, so when enough of our party showed up to be seated, we asked to close out our tab. This was the first shady part:  Bartender: That'll be $10.82 Me: I thought the calamari was $14.99? Bartender: It is. Me: Didn't you tell us appetizers were half off? Bartender: Well the calamari is $10. Me: (Puzzled look) Bartender: Ok fine. Umm...just give me $8.  We sit down at the table and look over the menu. Everything is typical Italian, but I really got sticker shock when I saw the prices. Entree prices averaged around $24, which wouldn't be that crazy for a fine dining venue, but this really didn't strike me as such a place. Anyhow, the calamari had really taken the edge off, so my girlfriend and I decided to split an entree. We ordered the veal parmigiana, which was $28.99.   When we ordered our food, it was just after 9:00. When we got our food, it was just before 10:00. Granted there were 10 people in our group, but we were the only people in the place, literally. I don't know what they were doing, but I can't remember the last time my food took that long, even in crowded restaurants. I don't think I would have normally gotten so irritated, but I had gotten up at 3:30 for work that morning and had to wake up at 6:00 the next morning, so I had been antsy to get home and go to sleep.  When finally get our food, I ask for a separate check. I admit, I had forgotten to ask for it up front, but all the other restaurants I've been to in this town dodn't have problems splitting the check up post-meal, so I didn't think they would either.  Me: Excuse me, I need to leave soon. Could I pay for my meal now? Waitress: I'm sorry, but we can't split the bill after it's been created. Me: Oh, OK. Well could you please charge the amount of my meal to my card and apply it towards the bill? (I hold my credit card out) Waitress: We can only take two cards per bill, so only one other card can be used. Me: OK, well I know the rest of the people have cash, so I'm alright with this. Waitress: Fine. Let me figure out what your total is.  --about 5 minutes pass--  Waitress: You're total is $36.xx. Me: $36.xx?? What was the gratuity? I thought the veal was $28.99? Waitress: You two split the meal. There's a $4 split charge. Me: You didn't tell us about that when we ordered. Waitress: It's on the menu. Here, see? (She was right. The $4 split charge was indicated, but it was on the back page underneath the desserts. Since we hadn't gotten to desserts yet, we hadn't looked at the back page.) Me: OK, you're right, but why didn't you tell us about this when we ordered? Waitress: It's on the menu, so we don't tell people about it. Me: So when someone is asking for something and will be unknowingly charged extra, you don't think it's appropriate to let them know? Waitress: Nope. We're not allowed to tell people about it.  Me: Not allowed?? Waitress: Nope. The owner says we're not allowed to tell people about it. Me: That's really shady. Jen: Could we speak to the manager? Waitress: I am the manager.  Jen: Well then can we speak to whoever you report to? Waitress: He's not here. Jen: Well then how does your restaurant handle customer service? Waitress: Fine, I'll take the $4 off.  The waitress is gone for about 10 minutes doing who knows what. In the mean time, we're eating our veal, and it was mediocre at best. I would say the meat was maybe a couple millimeters thick with twice as much breading. The pasta sauce was lacking and nothing worth going back for. I gotta say, accounting for the cost and quality, you would get an exponentially better deal at Olive Garden.   She finally came back with our check, $31.30, and I paid. It seemed like everything worked out. However, after charging my card, she didn't stick around long enough for us to ask for a to-go container. We waited for about 10 minutes before my girlfriend decided to just go ask for one. She walked over to where the kitchen entrance/waitress station was, poked her head in, and said "Excuse me." When the waitress saw her, she jumped around a corner. Literally. Our waitress ran away.   The service was shady and the food was mediocre. I would only recommend this place to someone for drinks.

oIYK5Db2NKCQVzi7csE1fA.text: This place is the best kept secret off the Vegas Strip. Every time I have a friend from out ta town visit, I make it a must stop. The atmosphere, service, food, and entertainment are second to none. everything from the second you enter the door, until the moment you leave is a top shelf experience. Capo's has a perfect recipe for an unforgettable experience. If you visit one place in Vegas, visit Capo's

Rxu6QIF4iQ3ccS0r2Pn7gA.text: Wow! This place rocks!! SINNER Magazine had a tweetup party there last night and I couldn't have imagined a better place. The atmosphere, the people, the food, the drinks.... Everyone that worked there treated us like royalty and I would go back just to hang out with them! The food was yummy and the drinks were strong. I loved it and you'll see me there whenever I'm in Las Vegas :)

cSw8crcoktaAoCxp2s8H0Q.text: We were wanting a restaurant that was not overly priced, which is normally what you find in Vegas.  It was a nice restaurant with a great atmosphere, reasonably price meals, and really attentive staff.  I would definitely come back to this little hidden gem!

DbAGvvUhEgPmTN2YzupX6A.text: My wife joined me on a biz trip Vegas in January, an associate recommended Capo's so we tried it, it was a good experiance. I'm normally not much into theme restaurants but I DO like old ganster flicks so this was great. The speakeasy atmosphere is awesome, the service and staff are fantasico! We waited a few minutes at the bar, my odered a martini which she enjoyed. The waiter recommended a steak dish and since my wife loves steak we took him up n it, it was pretty good. We enjoyed the entertainment, a guy singing Sinatra and other old standards. It was a fun, memorable evening. I recommend it, it's a nice change of pace from the buffets and hotel restaurants on the strip.

pQTRX9h4IwD3mqhOW3eZkg.text: Capo's is definitely NOT a place to go in the daytime for lunch!!! I don't even know how relevant it is in the evening, though maybe the entertainment may be better than the food.  I went to lunch there recently with a group of friends.  The food was not very good.  Their bread is horrible!  It is dry and tasteless. Come on guys, with all the restaurants in Las Vegas who serve good bread, you can do better!  Several of us got food which was not very warm.  One person got a burnt (really burnt) meatball.  The tomato sauce was sickeningly sweet, as though it had a ton of sugar in it. I was most disappointed with my dish, Pasta Primavera. You would think it would be a medley of veggies, i.e. brocolli, squash, carrots, etc.  Nope! It was as if they took the pasta and threw in some of their bell pepper strips (tiny) from their sausage and peppers, and added tons of red onion. That was it and this meager amount of vegetable was swimming in oil.   The atmosphere was depressing with no windows and big chandeliers and dark walls.  If you are a tourist and want the "speakeasy" feeling of the mobs, go to The Plaza hotel downtown and go to Oscar's.  They have a cute backroom with much better atmosphere and much, much better food. In all fairness, the waiter we had was such a nice young man and kept trying to appease our group, and so I say "don't shoot the messenger", it wasn't his fault the manager can't get a good Italian chef or find a decent bread bakery.  I give Capo's a big, fat "D"!

9XPvjVyeUWI6ASfjjMXsWw.text: Capo's, I loved the mob scene .. The guy singing Frank Sinatra was good, the really dim lighting was romantic, the food was great, my husband ordered us the Chi Town Scampi which was great, Gotti's Chicken Angelo and Capo's Parmigiana both were awesome and full of flavor, neither one of us had room for dessert. The booths are comfortable and really private which I enjoyed... I would definitely recommend this place for a romantic dinner with your mate (:

MJFBeEPvT-KXXhNQ4vbVdQ.text: Great Italian food. Great Sinatra music playing all night. Everything was excellent from service to desert. Try out the cigar room in the back.

Soz00P8ULlPI1-1PBpgGYw.text: The best Italian food in Vegas and super cool atmosphere.. Oh, the meatballs are ridiculous, maybe the best on earth.

IORqovwyTKNaCHbNY_HbAA.text: First time here, and thought it was awesome.  The look of the place was pretty cool, I like the speakeasy atmosphere.  I had the Rigatoni Alla Vodka, with sausage in it.  I have had it at plenty other places but Capo's was definitely the best.  The house salad that came with the dinner wasn't to bad also.  My Girlfriend had  Stuffed Chicken Anastatia she thought it was very good, I tried it "excellent".  They also had a singer for entertainment who covered old crooner hits.  I will definitely be back, sooner then later.

UTFJNsbRA65r3IR4nz-lpQ.text: I was at this restaurant last night, and I have to say, for the second time, it didn't impress me.  And I will have to disagree with Ashley P.  We had a rather large party, dinner was supposed to be at 8:00PM. Unfortunately, some of the party arrived about 8:20, so we had been sitting for 1/2 and hour waiting for other half of party.  Meanwhile, I could not even get a glass of water.  No bread. No waitress.  Even after rest of party arrived, I sat there for about 25 minutes until I flagged down a waitress and asked if we could please start ordering since its almost 9:00 and I have to get up for work.  She looked surprised.  I'm not sure how long she thought we were going to sit there before ordering. My husband ordered lasagna, as did 2 others.  When it came, it was cold. Hot plate, cold food.  When my husband told the waitress, she picked it up and said "well the plate is hot!"  That is not how you treat a customer paying 23.00 for a piece of lasagna.  I'm sorry, but Maggianos service is 100% better, food is cheaper, and more of it, as well as it tastes better.  The penne that I had tasted like it was rinsed with dirty sink water.  Perhaps if it wasn't as pricey as it is, I would not be complaining as much.  But with those prices, the service should be way better. I will not go there again, nor advise anyone else to.

ZCAbTupje7IitMQQk0WQWg.text: I now live in Las Vegas and have many friends in other cities from business and travel.  I have been put in the unfortunate position of having to choose the restaurant for my firiends who may only be here for one night passing through.  Luckily for me Capo's is here!  I ALWAYS talk over with them if they want to eat a 'famous chef' dinner or an interesting fun and always delicious dinner, my favorite italian place.          When friends want the "famous chef" dinner the conversation continues and we choose from many and .... it doesn't always turn out so well, as all of us locals know.   But I always promise to myself the next time will be Capo's!      THEN - those who chose Capo's the first time ALWAYS rave rave rave about the experience and the food - ALWAYS!   And I always ask if they think they've made the right decision and they all tell me I should not have given them a choice.    I have yet to have that happen once with  the "famous chef" restaurant experience.    Wait, except for once, mom and dad visited and we had a Wolfgang Puck  Thanksgiving Day meal... mom loved it, but I get the feeling she likes to say Wolfgang Puck too.  Also no 'rave rave rave', just a nod saying this is better than I expected.  ;-)    Dad, the Italian, raved raved raved about Capo's, mom tells her friends "oh you have to have her take you to this little secret Italian place with the tommy gun right up there on the wall".  rofl

A9NIkrg46Nxa5oOX8aBkJw.text: This place was great, The only reason I knew about this place was because my fiancee and I wanted a nice Italian Restaurant and we asked the Taxi Driver where to go and he took us here, and boy what a find.  The atmosphere is great makes you feel like a Italian mobster.   A small detail that I really liked is that the booths are high so when my fiancee and I were cozying up it didn't feel like everybody was watching us, nobody could see us and we couldn't see anybody else which was great.  The service was fantastic, not only efficient but friendly and the food was a solid 8/10.  The price is relatively reasonable.  I am going back in a few weeks for my bachelor party so lets see how they deal with a large rowdy group.!!!  But I recommend this place, you will not be dissapointed

k4qWtZZalVESpMaH0wG07A.text: This place is truly a gem. It is off the strip but not to far, you definitely need to drive here from your hotel, cab ride will run you 20-30 bucks!  Exterior is cool, old school gangster limo out front with Mug Shots of famous mobsters, verry cool.  Entrance is very sketchy at first, you wonder if they are even open, and SURPRISE!! They are, you'll see what I mean.  The ambiance is great, real "members only" kind of feel. Photos and even chalk outlines on the floor to add to the gangster ambiance.  Live music by an authentic Chicago singer, songs by Dean Martin and Frank Sinatra. He walks around and introduces himself and interacts with the audience and will even sing you Happy Birthday.   Food is fantastic, real authentice italian. I had the Lasagna while my girlfriend had the Ziti. Both delicious.   Prices are more than reasonable, prepare for 20-30 a plate. Well worth the experience! Will go there every time I visit Vegas

gRPKQOXBLMomasde6TM3NQ.text: This place was okay I had the chicken anastasia, it was a dry piece of chicken stuffed with spinach someone forgot about the ricotta, the sugo sauce was awful and bland, but my hubby had the gotti and mash potatoes and it was delicious. Beware this is not a place to go with a big party, and beware they charge $100.00 for the private room and with big parties they don't allow you to sit anywhere else then the private room. They add on tips and the service sucks.. They don't allow splitting the checks. The power went out our server never came to check on us once during the outage, if it wasn't for the bus boy we never would have gotten our drinks refilled, and it took 2.5 hours to get our food.. we attempted to make reservations earlier that day but they don't open til 5pm we called at 450pm and we're able to make a reservation were told that they would waived the room fee, when we got there they hunted me down to question me about the fee. I wouldn't have minded paying the fee but there was no air conditioning and it was a little side room that was hot and stuffy and there was no view to enjoy the entertainment,  not what one expects to pay additional for. Our bill was over 400.00 and an additional tip of 85 was placed on the bill for a party of 10 adults and 4 children. After the 2.5 hour wait for dinner we couldn't wait to get out of there and I was to hot and exhausted from complaining about the stupid room fee to stay and complain about the awful service. I felt ripped of with the quailty and quanity of the food vs. The price. I thank them for at least taking the room fee off as it is not worth it and they had told me that they would waive the fee in the first place anyways. Thank you Capos for making our yearly Vegas family vacation dinner memorable in a bad way.  We won't be back, there is to many other places in Las Vegas that consistantly serve better food with better service then this place that will appreciate our business..

V_6jX3QshnkOEbzaet-qUg.text: My wife and I were in Las Vegas for our 20th wedding anniversary and since we are both into "Godfather-like" things (movies, restaurants, etc) we wanted to check out Capo's ourselves.  We had first seen the Capo's restaurant when driving around Las Vegas on a previous trip - so we had it 'marked' (if you will) for our next visit.  Nothing short of amazing is what I would say.  The service was fantastic - we mentioned in casual conversation with our waiter that it was our 20th anniversary and before we knew it, we were being acknowledged by the bar singer.  He dedicated a song to my wife and I and it *just happened* to be her absolute favorite song -  Unforgettable by Nat King Cole.  Coincidence?  Maybe - but it really set the mood for the rest of the evening.  Either the owner or the chef came around to our tables during the evening to see how we liked our 'experience.'  He carried on a 5 minute conversation with us which was fantastic.  He did not seem hurried or the usual 'How was your dinner' and then on to the next table.  It was yet another very nice touch.  When we arrived, the place had about four or five other patrons in it.  We got there about 6:00PM on a Wednesday.  By the time we left (about 8:00 or so), the restaurant was about half-full.  Overall, the food was simply fantastic.  We've had lots of Italian food - including Italian food from places in Chicago, and both my wife and I agreed that this was the best we had had.  I highly suggest you try out Capo's if you're in the neighborhood.  It's worth the 10 minute drive from the strip.

ppPrhxToENXL3p_xosulJw.text: the atmosphere and ambiance are priceless like visiting a old speak easy  so dark in there that they put flashlights attached to the menu amazing brucchetta and chicken parm fun place

-knsSKXcb5MqKuk3UxDXrA.text: this place has great food and huge proportions. Not only is the food good, but this place is a whole experience. Everything makes u feel like you are back in the mobster days. The servers are dressed the part, and talk the part. I loved it, and would definitely go back. It's a great place to take company. I took a friend from out of town, and she said next time she is here, we are going back to Capo's.

9nVTjoBVDAOYyQj4dlGn9Q.text: Had the spaghetti with a giant meatball. It was absolutely delicious.  Service was just as good as the food.  Definitely a dining experience everyone should try

mMWIHlcyUSx3lbyiPJrz3A.text: 2nd time here. First with girlfriends and now with the hubby. Love the kitch but the food is worth coming back for. Their creamy garlic dressing is fantastic and the meat sauce is so good.

1YuA4jSWnAi46Vw_d7Ae1w.text: Came here for lunch for the first time and everything was amazing! We walked in and a note attached said to ring the bell, so We did and surprising the person answered us behind the picture fame asked us if we had reservation, we said, "no" but let us in through a different door that was attached to the public pay phone, interesting concept. My husband and I had the chicken sandwich and their homemade spaghetti meatball, both were excellent, and our server, Santana was amazing which made this whole experience great! We will be back to try their dinner menu next......

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghettini and meatball, excellent!

KkxB7DTmH2PrQYyPui2g9A.text: The Food was DELICIOUS!!!! real authentic Italian. Before I had their food I always heard that Capo's food was great. Last night my family & I had a great experience @ Capo's. The only thing I didn't really like was that they don't allow people to pay separate checks. When our bill came we all had to get out our phone calculators to see how much each other's tab was going to be. But other than that I will be coming back. The FOOD IS PHENOMENAL!!!!

zIGVV8kV3zVUIlJsJ5U3Mw.text: The place was amazing, but the service was awful, they charged 2 lobster soup that we never receive because there was not more, they force us to give 25 % of tips, and when I ask for another margaritha the bar was closed, the person who answer the phone was very rud, I called to add 2 more persons and they say not, when we arrived they have 10 chair and we were 6. Its a shame that the service is too bad because the place its beautiful

Iz4gpSPnR2QuhxxV16bL7Q.text: Live singer sang for my 17 month old son who was dancing along and clapping to his music! Loved the decor and my husband couldn't stop talking about how great his steak was! Attentive, friendly staff.

k6mTk7bZPWE0FrohjFsuVg.text: My flight arrived at 7 p.m., and after a month-long sojourn in the Garden State, I was ready to reclaim Vegas.  Hubby picked me up at the airport and suggested Capo's.  He can't resist a deal, and Tuesdays it's 2 for 1.  In fact, right under the tall restaurant sign facing East, it proclaims in big letters, not to be missed by any local OR tourist, "2 for 1 Tuesdays."  But more about that later.  We had a reservation and arrived a bit early, so we had to wait.  And wait some more.  So we got to hang out near the bar, with every seat filled by jocks drinking and shouting at various sports on the TVs.  No matter that the Vice Presidential debate was being aired, but not here.  I won't ding them for that, since most people wouldn't care.   At last we were seated, but our table was at one of the booths lining the bar, not in the main dining room.  That meant hearing the clanging pots from the kitchen right behind the bar, along with the aforementioned shouting jocks.  A very short while later, I noticed that the couple who walked in right in front of us, who did not have reservations, were seated immediately after us in a nice, quiet room right off the main dining room.  Normally, I would have insisted on another table, but I was exhausted from my sleepless flight.  I was still on East Coast time and it was late, even for me.  It took quite a while for the server to come over.  He apologized, but it was indicative of the service through the rest of the meal.  Not terrible, but not attentive enough, and certainly not as good as what we'd experienced here in the past.  Prices have really increased.  Yeah, Capo's is higher end, but it's not the Strip.  At least the Sangria I ordered was a good-sized glass and was very tasty.  But the copious amount of fruit turned out to be just lemon, lime and orange peel and pith.  And the dishes are served with salad or soup, and a choice of side, so it's not all that bad.  My husband had Chicken Lucchese, with mushroom risotto as his side dish.  His chicken was a very large portion covered with mozzarella, mushrooms, capers and broccoli.  My Chicken Picatta, on the other hand, was half that size.  I wasn't terribly hungry, so this time it was enough for me to still take home some of it, but the discrepancy in size was insane, especially since his had so much more stuff on it.  And was only priced at $1 more.  When it came time to pack up the leftovers, we were provided with boxes.  I usually like to box up my food myself.  But in this case, the plates were huge and heavy, and both had drippy sauce.  After I took care of mine, Herb put that plate on one corner of the table, along with our bread plates.  There was no room to maneuver, and the plates just sat there unremoved, while wait staff walked by several times and ignored how I was struggling.  This is not a hallmark of good service.  Now for the fun part - the check.  It was not 2 for 1.  It was 2 for 1 only "if we had ordered the same dish."  Did it say that on the big sign outside?  Nay!  The bill was reduced by $20, not the amount it should have been.  Did it say "$20 max" on the big sign outside?  Again, nay.  And when we asked to see the manager, she, or someone claiming to be the manager, sat down and began a double-talk routine that would rival Abbott and Costello, telling us multiple times what I've just written above, repeating over and over that they weren't her's, but the owner's rules.  The biggest zinger, though, was when she said that the 2 for 1 was only for locals.  WTF?  Can you imagine being tourists on a budget schlepping by cab from the Strip because they heard about their Tuesday policy and finding out only at the end that they were SOL?  And did it say it on that big sign?  Third NAY.  Why would a tourist think this 2 for 1 didn't apply to them?  This has to be a blatant lie, and we don't like being lied to.  Obviously, the $4 difference in our check is small and will neither make nor break us.  But this kind of crap is not the way to run a business and alienate customers.  Is the food good?  Yeah.  But there are enough good Italian restaurants in this town with great atmosphere to ever have to put up with this.

mbyGPg34AO3e-gH2irLzDw.text: Great ambiance, music was a nice touch and the magician going table to table was amazing! We order several bottles of wine which were good. Food was very average, to be honest I make a better carbonara, though they were very generous with the prawns. My husband ordered veil Marsala and wasn't very impressed either. To be fair neither of us disliked our food, it just wasn't impressive. Service was good.

PtJs4qDefRA74JUE39caqw.text: So cool! I absolutely loved the vibe of this place. At first I wasn't sure why we had to ring a doorbell to get in but I get it now. It all comes together. It's all part of the feel and experience of this restaurant. You walk in to a dimly lit dining room and bar and with Frank Sinatra music playing, felt like something in a movie. We got to sit in a corner booth and order our meal from a waiter with an Brooklyn Italian accent, just a very cool experience.   The reason we dropped in is because we got a Groupon for a prix fixe lunch for two which included a soda, salad and entree for $20. What an great deal. The Italian house salad was fresh and dressed with zesty Italian dressing and Parmesan. I ordered the carbonara with chicken as recommended by the waiter and the lady sitting in the booth next to us and it was not at all disappointing. Creamy sauce, perfectly cooked pasta, tender chicken, peas scattered within. Yum! I wasn't able to finish it because it was quite a large serving for lunch so the waiter brought me a large togo box for me. My fiance got the meatball sub and of course I had to try it. The meatballs were huge! They were tender and so flavorful. The bread was baked to perfection and the marinara sauce that came with it was super fresh, you could just taste all the fresh tomatoes in it.   This place is awesome. The experience is definitely one of a kind. If you haven't been, you have to at least check it out once. I've never been to a place like it. It's something you would expect in New York's Little Italy. What a fun place. I know I'll be back to bring my family when they visit. I know they'll get a kick out of it.
