I04Zd2n0c5DooDlmA5GDNw.text: Great Restaurant Awsome  atmosphere and historical feel. This was my 2nd visit actually and this time I brought my Dad, who is the man responsible for my interest in 20th century italian american history and culture, so we're and we order our drinks and appetizers, my Dad gets a makers mark manhattan, my wife orders mango martini, and sodas for the boys and I, appetizers were stuffed mushroom caps, deep fried ravioli, brushetta, which were all delicious, next up was our first course, 4 Pasta Fagioli and 1 nico's ceasar salad, all for our main entrees, we ordered a bottle coppola red wine with our meal,my wife ordered the stuffed chicken anastasiashe enjoyed it, My Brother Ordered giant half pound Ma's meatballs, they were delicious as well my son ordered scarface shrimp scampy and loved it, My father ordered The evenings special, Lamb Chops cooked Medium Rare and I Ordered Primos Prime Steak Ribeye dinner cooked Medium. Here is where the only Issues to our dinner resided: My Boneless Ribeye came to me medium RARE instead of Medium and my mashed potatoes weren't the warmest when they arrived. I asked my Father how he liked dinner a day later and he said it was excellent but his Lamb Chops were a little over cooked(Medium) *BINGO*it wasn't a big deal, but Francisco or the Chef obviously got confused with who ordered Medium and Medium Rare. The devil is in the details! Im not the type to complain or send food back or do things that would irritate someone handling the food my family is planning to eat, but that was my only knock if any on a 5 star family dinner.service was pretty awsome with Francisco did a great job serving us. Just My Steak undercooked we'll be back though. Thanks

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pv-8nBPfWmaDuF-sPSIJpw.text: This was our 2nd visit. It was fantastic. Jeremy, our fabulous server, was very attentive as well as the nice guy keeping our waters full.  We started with the meatballs and shrimp cocktail. Both are very delicious. Our main courses of Cioppino, lasagne, chick Parm were  large portions and so good. The Cioppino was loaded with seafood. A really enjoyable meal.

dG_xAYGz5_8JEspx_NTkog.text: The atmosphere was seductive and mysterious, all while being very welcoming. We visited on a Sunday, so they had a wonderful Sinatra influenced singer, Dave De'Costa, covering a variety of classic songs. He was charming, amusing, and sounded just like the legend himself.   The creamy garlic salad was delicious. I could have easily consumed several more servings. The bread was warm and soft, with a flakey outer crust. I ordered the chicken carbonara and a vanilla cream soda. Everything was beyond satisfying and I look forward to my return.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frank Sinatra Sunday for lunch. This singer is so wonderful. He&#39;s got an identical voice to the legend.

jhYZJ91L2bIlIHaQmPWsKQ.text: First visit with my hubby. Loved the atmosphere! Food and drinks weren't the best I ever had but we still enjoyed ourselves. Loved the music.

ZmATYVyNYafeTueajsVGBg.text: Wow!  Great atmosphere, GREAT service, EXCEPTIONAL food!  I'd give it 10 stars if I could.  I'll keep this review short...stop reading and go.

RhIty0RrUFWXxgq8fqceeA.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  I always bring family and friends to the Sahara location when they are in town.  The experience is always worth the trip.

LtgDzROSTGU1TzcmADYSrQ.text: Loved the experience!!! Themed to gangsters or mob. Went after mob Musium. Perfect conclusion to a perfect day. Meatball appetizer fantastic, scampi over angel hair pasta, wonderful, ravioli amazing, spaghetti and Italian sausage really great. Split it and still brought home food! Great table side magician. Perfect music for setting. Loved it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room

rbW3xYIDNwWKsM5AragxXw.text: This is hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas! As a local, this is my go to spot to take my out of town guests who visit for an authentic Italian dinner. The atmosphere is sooooo cool. I love the speakeasy style (and the entrance is the best!), dim lighting, chandeliers and Mafia movies playing in the background. Although best for an adult date night or gathering, I also bring my kids here as well. One of my favorite things is the live singer there on Saturdays (and possibly other days of the week) who plays the piano and sings classics from that era (think Frank Sinatra, etc.) NOW...let's get to the food. The meatballs are out of this world. The shrimp scampi is amazing. You must try the mushroom risotto. My 9 year old son loves the fettuccine alfredo. My husband loves the chocolate dipped cannolis for dessert. Service is always on point. I recently threw a dinner birthday party there (of 14 people) for a friend. We had to change the number on the reservation a couple of times and they were very accommodating. They were super attentive and friendly with excellent service while handling that large of a group. They went out of their way to acknowledge the birthday girl and help make her night extra special. This place has been open since the 60's and I guarantee will be there for a long long time to come!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom parmesan risotto. I get it every time!!!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homemade meatballs...what could be better?

92FtqoDKSw9EG51PxB3k5g.text: Excellent!!!   Food was delicious and the service was perfect!!  There were eight of us and they took very good care of us.  It's refreshing to go to a restaurant where the staff is so attentive.   We were all very pleased.  And the clever entrance ---- well, you just have to go there and see it.

kpIcvudUXpmkgEUCL5YUzA.text: Absolutely my favorite restaurant in Vegas!!! We went for my wife's bday celebration, I had the Santucci's Pasta and the wife had The Angels With Dirty Faces. Ma's Meatballs were crazy good. Literally the best sauce I have ever had. Ambiance was unbelievable front the entrance to our seating area to even getting a serenade of My Way by the Frankie Blue Eyes Cover singer made this the best two hours we had our last trip in Vegas. Will absolutely go back the first night of every trip we take  to Vegas which is in 4 months!!! Capo's is Vegas!!!

CQgq7kFsFMRniA2bPEpsDA.text: Make sure you make a reservation, very busy but well worth it. The entrance is towards the side kind of hard to see and right when you enter you have to be buzzed in to get inside the restaurant..the restaurant is dark inside and the menus have flashlights. Overall experience was great..food was fantastic, for appetizer I had the calamari and main dish was the shrimp scampi. Everything was good and I will definitely be back!

PBqExbif7OD6pDOyenDc4w.text: Capo's was certainly a different dining experience. Let me make things clear, these people are reservation only so don't plan on showing up without one as they will not let you inside. These people give off a genuine 1940's gangster style experience. The people here have New York and Italian accents giving off an extra impression. The lighting here is very dim and the atmosphere is romantic and intimate. They have a Frank Sinatra style vocalist singing in the dining area every 10-15 minutes. The food however was not outstanding, though it was very good. The pasta here had an odd, metallic taste to it. Other than that, the chicken was very well done and the rest was very good. I will certainly be back but maybe for a more romantic occasion.

nVJOAfhFAJxegUrA_dKd-Q.text: We went here while on vacation in Las Vegas and had a mob night. When you arrive the entry makes conversation for the rest of the dinner. We had reservations and when we arrived we got placed into a huge plush red side both in one of the corners. Note however it is dark in here almost "I can't see" kind of dark. So if you are sleepy maybe don't go cause you could fall asleep. While eatting we enjoyed the sing styles of a Frank Sinatra wanna be who was not at all bad. He was interacting with the diners even singing happy Birthday.  This place is pretty cool. We all had a good time and did not have trouble finding something to eat. I choose the Trafficante Rigatoni and a raspberry/ lemon martini thing. Both were very good. They use real oils and top notch ingredients. This is not your local Noodles and Co.   But with that said this place is on the pricey side. For my dish and my drink it put me back $25.00. Altogether for our party of 5 it put use back $137.00. So be prepared for that. When we finished we took a few pictures with the chalk drawings and the old school car outside.   Overall we had a great dinner and a good experience. I would go here again after saving up some babysitting money.

RFCP2Bnn-zrRpCy921t1xA.text: Went with my family this past Monday and the place was packed! The food was great. Wanted the Lasagna but they were out of it so went with spaghetti and the meatball was one of the best I've ever tasted.  There was live music and the ambience is really intimate and fun. We will be back!

YIX8qEWK9NPzC_TTFX_DDQ.text: Based upon fellow Yelp reviews, I thought, we're in for a treat! Wrong!   Upon arriving, the restaurant is so dimly lit that they have mini flashlights so you can read the menu. I also think the lack of lighting hides the mediocrity of the food.   I ordered the chicken piccatta. It wasn't very tender or flavorful. The accompanying pasta and marinara sauce was the worst I've eaten in a long time. The salad which preceded the entree was swimming in Italian dressing and grated Parmesan cheese.   This place would have one star, but the service was attentive. The singer had a good voice and was pleasant to listen to during dinner. I tipped him $5 on my way out to show some appreciation for his talent.   Perhaps I didn't order the right dish, but I won't be back when I visit Las Vegas.

qNr187l33bqd4-ys9WJU6A.text: This place is special indeed! My ex wife and I made this our romantic spot for dinner and I missed it so much that my current wife consented to make it ours. It wasn't a tough sell when we opted for the private dining room and when she tasted how good the sauce was in her spaghetti it was done. I love the robust flavor of the linguine with clans nestled in their shells atop one of the best white sauces I have ever tasted! I will ALWAYS come here for the rest of my life.

D_vYQCZglIiZR7MMdrf69g.text: I went here for my birthday celebration. I had heard about it and thought it sounded good. When I arrived I was surprised that it was in a strip mall. The concept is very cute. The interior is ok but small. When we sat at our booth I thought it would be nice but that's when things fell apart. My daughter ordered a steak. $23.95! It was over cooked and breaded to much. She sent it back and told them about it. They still had the nerve to charge her $20.00 for a tiny salad and a little pasta. The rest of our party ordered their food and said it was just ok but the prices are way to high. The piano player was way in a corner and he kept singing to the wall instead of the crowd. There were two birthdays at our table and not one did one thing. The waitress was polite but not friendly. I wouldn't recommend this place at all. If you don't live in Summerlin it's a ways out from the Strip.

3Z6CGMcIunuz0B_wMaI2Hw.text: Absolutely not the best Italian food I have ever had. Being from out of town (Dallas, TX) this is NOT a very good Italian restauaurant. Very effected by the mob from way back then. And Al Capone pics all over the place? Give me a break......he was mainly a Chicago mobster.  I had the lasagna and a third of it was burned and they still served it to me.  I had gas and stomach issues all day the next day. Horrible.

2jYuFT7gHIA_kq0KQcPgmQ.text: I must say I have been here before on several occasions and loved it ; however this time my expectations were so high only to leave me with mediocre thoughts of this visit.  First of all I am all about cleanliness , but I could not help but focus on my spotted , unpolished wine glass. My husband tried to get my attention off the topic , but it still was in the back of mind.     On the bright side with a few glasses of Riesling I was able to get over it . Upon our arrival I was surprised by the speakeasy entrance where I focused my eyes on the door I was sure was to secretly open, was actually on the opposite side. This greeting is a fun goodfellas type greeting in a secret corridor.  For starters my hubby and I both had a salad -his with house vinaigrette and I chose the bleu cheese. He was quite pleased but mine was drenched in the bleu cheese. Blech! I don't like my salad drowning in the dressing.  For dinner we both chose the Scarface shrimp scampi . On the plus side the shrimp was plump and generous in size.  The linguine was flavored with a small amount of scampi seasoning , tomatoes and garlic. The flavor was good but it was as if the chef dumped the linguine out and didn't toss the seasoning all the way through. I can eat some pasta but this was like a bland pile of linguine for $25 a plate , I expected more.  The ambiance was warm and relaxing. On Fridays they have a frank Sinatra crooner singing old blue eyes remakes. On my previous visits they would be playing old mobster movies but this time it was showing a basketball game.  The best thing to make up for my downer of dinner was the dessert! Chocolate cannoli's were Devine,with a rich, cinnamon chocolate coating= tasty! All in all , I still like this place . I will just order a different plate next time, I also may consider going to the Sahara location.? I love the idea and nostalgia Capo's brings so I am willing to give it another visit.  Try it for yourself , meanwhile I will forget about it !!!!!

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scarface Shrimp Scampi
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Capo&#39;s chocolate covered cannoli&#39;s

FyQZJ5GowF9TOPVkKwewrg.text: I just got back from Vegas and the highlight of my trip was going to Capo's! I will go there now every time I go to Vegas. We had a party of 12 and we enjoyed it so much, we stayed for 3 hours. The entrance in "speak easy" style set the tone for our experince and it lived up to the hype. We found them by a web search when I typed in Mafia Restaraunt Las Vegas and I was sold. The food was amazing and the staff went out of their way to make us feel special while we were there.   The fact that they have a seperate smokers lounge with cigars was a blast too! I feel it is a must visit when you are in Vegas!

0ep33GP9F0N5ah7HOm8mkw.text: What a cool place!  The speakeasy theme and the decor, a crooner with a piano singing standards - love it!    This is a GREAT place to bring out-of-towners or go on a date.    I've been here three times.  Once on a terrible date that was only salvageable by the happy experience of Capo's, and two other times with my family and friends.  My mother loved it - said it reminded her of old Vegas and her boyfriend, super North NJ kind of guy said it reminded him of old Jersey.  So it's a coast to coast venue?  Dunno, but super Italiano.  Has Godfather, Casino, and Goodfellas and all those flicks randomly on in the background with subtitles.  Heavy Italian/Mafia decor and themes everywhere.  Crystal chandeliers, red booths, cherry/mahogany wood everywhere.    Warning: VERY subdued lighting.  The menus have little flashlights on them but they don't always work.    I've had the tortelloni entree which had a very rich, delicious cheese in a generous portion, the salad with giant meatballs (which kinda worked in a way... a little odd but I can't complain a bit about it), and the chicken Parmesan, which was also portioned very well and quite good.    The waiters are all very slick and remind me of being home in NJ in the way that they speak.  Although my last waiter kind of blinked when I said I wanted hot coffee in the middle of summer at 3pm.  Heh.

2j0UwqQ0qew0_b_Qu8fwAA.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant!  Everything about this place was good: the swanky atmosphere, the tasty bread, soup and main pasta dishes were all authentic Italian goodness.  Oh and the singer was very charming too, he even dedicated a song to my boyfriend and I.  We can't wait to go back to Vegas to eat here again.

h-3o-2I0nhTsZ30pSsXd0w.text: Come for the ambiance, NOT the food!  I have been to this restaurant a couple times and the mob themed experience is fun for a first timer.  However, the food is "just okay" and the prices are not about the quality of the food, but for maintaining the mobster atmosphere.  I would recommend this place for folks looking for a fun story to leave Vegas with.  If you are hungry and looking for a great meal to savor, this is NOT the place for you.  On our last visit the server was very nice, but the bar staff that was a different story.  I am not sure if I will come back to Capo's again, because I have had my fill of Vegas stories. If you are looking for an experience you won't forget this may be the place.  You wont forget how rude the bar staff can be.  Also, you wont forget how mediocre the food was and the price you paid for it!

uICkThhvh7J2ENIjS-56kQ.text: Wonderful throwback to the speakeasy!!! Even the way you enter is amusing! Ambiance.was spot on, great for a date night. Food was delicious . Nice to be able to take your time & eat for once . Service was nice, entertainment was delightful! A must try.

8vQ5wVdzsgXwdJ5qQCTT5A.text: A groupon got us in the door but the amazing food would bring us back. The "trickey" entry gave us a laugh and set the tone for the rest of the visit.  Made us feel like we were in the original Vegas.

kI2q78yQCe7K1YhDfghySw.text: Had dinner here last night for my fathers birthday and to put it lightly...we weren't happy. The back of their menu even says to state any complaint before you leave and asks you not to be a "Jimmy The Weasel". Red flag much?  For starters the food was nothing spectacular and extremely overpriced. I had the "Sawed Off" sausage and peppers which was $22! C'mon now. The dish was nearly all pasta and peppers with very little sausage. My dad had the extremely small portioned "Gotti" chicken. My wife had the fettuccine alfredo and actually left the restaurant saying she was still hungry. Don't get me wrong, the food was okay...not spectacular, but okay.  Now I'm not one to complain about a restaurant especially when the food is okay. My family and I enjoy trying new places and you're not always going to have a great experience. However, Capo's had me ready to refuse paying the bill. We used a $25 for $50 Groupon last night and Capo's works the system to where the Groupon is useless. We had 4 adults and my 4 year old son (who shared a plate). With the Groupon applied our bill was $77.77 ($127.77 without). However, the waitress took it upon herself to add $25.55 for gratuity putting the bill back up to $103.32. With the price of my Groupon, the bill was actually $0.55 higher than it would have been without a tip and to be honest, the service we received didn't deserve anywhere near a $25 tip. Once they took the credit card, the waitress even went as far as writing the tip amount on the credit card slip herself!!! Correct me if I'm wrong but I believe that's illegal...  Now I realize many Groupon's have fine print stating there will be an added gratuity or something but not in Capo's Groupon. Be warned, this place has other reviews about the business scamming customers and now I see why. They make the Groupon useless by adding their own tip at their chosen amount. I will never return to this place and will contact Groupon in attempt to have these theives removed from their site. Now I just have to hope they didn't steal my credit card info!

deybNXD92y_zd9uTKuOkxQ.text: Lots of fun. Great food and an amazing atmosphere!  Waiter a little slow was only problem. Will be back!

E5l2Pd-QZm0XsddSUrMKsA.text: Atmosphere and music is great. Sat at the bar and the bartender was great. Food wasnt great. Calamari was rubbery and tasted old. Pasta was over cooked and a bit disapointing. Bartender offered us the cheesecake for dessert. We agreed just to have him come back and tell us there out of cheese cake. Saw the happy hour menu and that might make me stop by again to give them a chance.

mDfwMvAepB9JW26fD74qjg.text: I picked up a groupon for this as I love Italian food and who doesn't love the mafioso style of the place that I heard things about. It was cool walking in and the little hidden door, the man at the door was very funny and made a couple of jokes before letting me and my date in. Service was pretty good and the food was excellent. Nice and dimly lit, very comfortable place to go. Will certainly go back again.

OPVf7YGTCIDcYX819-U4kQ.text: Found this place on Yelp and since I like Italian, I figured why not?  The first thing that caught my attention was the way you enter the restaurant.  I won't spoil it, but its pretty cool and a nice touch to enter the place.  Once you enter, it is dimly lit and feels almost like a mob bar.  The host was wearing a nice Italian looking suit and the ambiance and decor of the restaurant screams Little Italy, even though it has a tattoo parlor and a check cashing place right next door.  Once we were seated, the waitress came over and offered us drinks and told us about the specials which were described excellently.  She left and a moment later an assistant had bread and our drinks.  We ordered a few moments later and the service never stopped being superb.  The food came out and it was excellent.  I had the ribeye with blue cheese crumb crust and spaghetti on the side with a caesar salad.  Very delicious.  We stayed in the restaurant for 2 hours but never felt rushed or pressured to leave.  The live music that was playing in the background I didn't even realize it was live until I caught a glimpse of the singer.  Overall, I would definitely recommend it.  Whether its for a romantic date or just dinner with a good friend, the place works for either occasion.

G7BAGONIzGy4hmzt62gQeA.text: First off, the ambiance and building are fantastic.  We got lost and missed our reservation and they were super helpful getting us another one the next night.  We were excited when we got there because it was a fantastic set up (although in a weird area for tourists).  They have a beautiful piano but no one played it.  Instead there was a man singing to a karaoke machine with Sinatra CD's.  There was a magician going table to table but he did not visit our table.   However, the food is mediocre at best.  The fried ravioli was obviously frozen then dropped in a fryer.  It was mushy and tasteless.  The salads were fine.  Romaine lettuce seemed fresh and dressing was fine.  It tasted over seasoned, but we could not identify the spice over used.  Basil???   I ordered the fetticcine  Alfredo with grilled chicken and it was awful.  The chicken was NOT grilled.  I'm pretty sure it was frozen, precooked chicken chunks.  The sauce was awful and did not taste fresh.  Husband had the lasagna and said it was not good.  He ate a little then said, "It's not even worth finishing".  Everything was over seasoned as if they use bottled sauce and just add seasoning to make it taste "better."  We did not bother with dessert.  So disappointing because it was NOT cheap.  The theme is really neat that's it.  Not fresh, not good, not tasty.

TZsVapzWkD5Lymy7Hm76zA.text: If you're in Vegas and want to have great Italian food with a super unique experience, EAT HERE!  I would recommend that you make a reservation because it's a popular restaurant. The entrance is this little door and you walk in and there's a doorbell to push. A little window slides open and a guy asks for your name, like a mob restaurant, and then a secret door opens! SO COOL!  It is really dark inside and the menus even have little flashlights to help you see.  We ordered the stuffed ravioli with their homemade sauce. The ravioli was outstanding and so was the service. I would love to visit here again.

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Racketeers Ravioli
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1k5EUP5Fm-5VBiVm9a_T3w.text: Must go to in Las Vegas, such a cool atmosphere and the food is outstanding, love the speakeasy vibe and the secret entrance is very cool, live entertainment as well as a great drink menu

Mls5x7JIx8X4dxl8Nj52cQ.text: This place is so good I go on a Monday when Tuesday is buy one get one free!   I live in Vegas 4 days a week and So Cal 3 days a week, having restaurants in both states allows me to try a lot of joints.   Capo's by far is one of my favorites and is to mostly locals. Giada's (review to come soon) is another favorite but these two couldn't be more different but yet in my top 2 Italian eatery to visit.  I'm a chef and I used to be involved in Italian restaurants but now we have open different concepts.   Tonight we got the meatball and peppers app along with Cheese ravioli and chicken piccata. Everything was awesome, we usually sit at the bar which faces the line (kitchen) and can watch all the meals get produced and it's like a Ballet the way these guys work.  This place always seems to have a wait but being Italian and a chef and restaurant owner I think they always find a little spot for me, being a local for 20 years doesn't hurt either!  This is a must visit for ALL and come on a empty stomach because they will need the room.  The only thing I see that could piss people off and I wish I had enough balls to do it at my places is a "split charge" of $10, so if your going to try and be cheap and share a entire it's going to cost you! Bravo for sticking up for your servers and keeping the average per head close to $20! If you dint want to spend mo eat then don't go out to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UCjY7Yy5-Dyw4YnnGn31iA.text: Oh my God do dissapointed.Rang bell in back of resturant.Got greeted by a big bufone with no manners.It was pitch black.He did offer me a lite or asistance.The opening however was cool it was like a speakeasy in the 20's.The concept was very cool.I sat myself and joined my other party of one.Ordered Claims with linguine (spelled wrong maybe)Got a good sauce....but empty shells no clams...REALLY!!They brought me another dish.It was like soup...and again no clamsFORGET ABOUT IT.If you go there.....go for drinks and appetizers....Fine Dining no way.Too bad.The music was awesome...POTENTAIL. SO MUCH.Contact me management...I am a food critic from back east..EC. . .

et0mQuf31Get-RbATkCYPg.text: So we had reservations for Friday night and it was fairly easy to get them - we merely called the day before around 4pm.  We were greeted with someone sliding the door in a small open space that was close to eye level - this was a nifty surprise that made it seem top secret.  Despite having reservations, I think the place forgot about us...We were seated at the bar for 30 minutes and had to request attention.  They then seated us in a separate room, away from all the live music though...So after ordering a second round of drinks there (first at the bar), we asked to be relocated again.  I think we just caught them at a bad moment, but they were quick to make amends by providing us another free bread basket.  The meatball here is to die for - all the bread crumbs it entailed made it so tender.  The tomato sauce is rich, indulgent, and tart. We dipped 2 baskets worth of their hearty, crusty bread with their sauce and were so stuffed just sharing this.  Just as an FYI, the white chocolate martini is extremely sweet - I have the worst sweet tooth but even this was a bit overbearing.  Other than that, the other 3 drinks we had were safe bets and well made so.  Loved that the place kept the integrity of an old school feel.  It is a very dimly lit place with live music.  My date and I were very impressed.  Note that it is an older crowd.  My date and I are in our mid 20's, everyone else present was probably 40-60+

JN1KtB7pgOMjy27Y_hK8Aw.text: The food was to die for and the whole speak easy experience is short lived but its cool. The doorman has some character to him and if you easily get offended don't please its part of the act. BOOK early because they get packed every single night.   The drinks were a 10 The food was a 10  They chef is on his game every night.  Thanks Capos!

bAAS2tA2q5-v-gy4F-R1MQ.text: You drive past this joint on Sahara and wonder, "What the heck is a 'Capo's'? and "What is that all about?" You might decide one day to be intrepid enough to go inside the unassuming little brick house, armed with the password you've been told is the entry requirement, and wait nervously in a foyer reminiscent of a speakeasy from the 1920's.  You almost expect an uniformed officer to come up behind you and ask for your ID, or why you are there.  Then, all of a sudden, a Judas hole slides open, and a gruff voice demands the reason for your presence.  You remember your parole ("Joey sent me") and pass through to one of the darkest rooms you have ever encountered, even in all of Las Vegas, every single casino included.  Not a single window is uncovered in the medium sized dining room, which is more upscale piano bar/dive than restaurant. Resplendent overhanging chandeliers above the table booths provide the only light in the room other than your guide's penlight.   You are seated at a semi-circular booth with blood red vinyl coverings.  Your guide assists you to get inside.  You hear the piano man sing and play, interspersed with canned music.  He wears a fancy suit with a shirt opened up to his navel, but he is good.  It is surreal.    You strain to read the menu, then realize it comes with its own penlight, which you turn on, and make out a traditional Italian, "Goodfellas" cuisine.  Pasta, steaks, soups, and salads.  But also, surprisingly, whole lobster, which you choose.  You decline to pick out the little fella yourself, as invited by the server--leaving the dirty work to your waitress, who is sweet and whose hair almost ascends up to the bottom of the chandelier.  The egg drop soup is briny and filled with hearty vegetables, a great appetite opener.  Salad is rich with a house-made Italian vinaigrette. Your cheese bread appetizer is warm, robust, and melts in your mouth. Your steak is tender, juicy, and unstinting.  The lobster you selected is outta sight.  Mammoth creature served to you on an enormous platter undergirded with buttery zucchini, broccolini, and squash.  The lobster has been plated and scored perfectly.  Your shrimp cocktail hearkens back to the good 'ol days, when Vegas was run by guys who are now immortalized in downtown's Mob Museum.  You hear the crooner ask the ladies for a suggestion, and you call out one.  You order dessert, your eyes now adjusted to the darkness, and enjoy the flavorful confections brought to your table, including a delicately flavored tiramisu and a cappuccino Starbucks wishes they could pull off.  You notice there is an extensive wine and cocktail list (but it is during the day and you pass).    You notice that whenever you finish a dish, it is quickly taken away, and your glass never remains less than full for more than a few moments.  You notice every person helps out who even walks by your table, and you get the feeling that you are a "VIP."  Maybe these people are mistaking you for someone else? No, that's just the way that they are with their patrons.  After all, "Joey sent 'ya." You wonder what the heck kind of place is this, with black tape and Victorian mirrors covering the windows.  You could be there at 3am or 3pm and not know the difference.  Nor feel it.  It is not even Las Vegas anymore.  It is Chicago.  Or New Jersey.  Or gritty Philly.  Or what have you.  You leave, slip the singer a fiver who acknowledges it with more than expected appreciation, and notice the chalk outline of a body in the lobby.  Being initiated at Joe's, this type of thing no longer bothers you, and you regard it with amusement, not horror.  Hitting the sunlight in the outside world, you are temporarily blinded and stumble towards your vehicle with a full belly, and fond memories of a place just beyond your imagination.  Tip: Be sure to Check in on Yelp and get $10 off $75 (above which you most certainly will spend).

TTSIc6xc0wulzbxXufUORQ.text: I came here with a group of coworkers for an offsite meeting. It's a dark, speak easy type of restaurant/bar, with red leather booths. It's a fun experience just as soon as you enter the door. We sat in a dark private room & served with several different pasta dishes. Everything was delicious, stiff drinks and awesome, attentive staff. It was a great experience worth remembering.

h87-CxlyAqe3D89r9MDF_Q.text: Ambience, food, music...everything magical!! It's a must if your in Las Vegas! I had the steak  and it did not disappoint--good part is that it is off the strip so feel like a local eating there.

8-6UMroEB0d3ny8Mwf4F2Q.text: Was expecting so much more than below average. Calamari for our appetizer was sub par. No tentacles ... just rings tells me it wasn't fresh but frozen. The sauce with it was literally red with absolutely no flavor. The bread was not warm just sitting in a basket covered with a napkin. No olive oil or balsamic ?? Weird. I ordered eggplant Parmesan and my friend ordered chicken Anastasia... chicken was dry and not tender at all. Eggplant Parmesan was very tasty. We ordered tiramisu for dessert to share ... very good. Service ?? Two ladies having dinner are frequently discarded and this place was no different. Never checked on us to see if we liked our meal, etc. We both work in the service industry and are super good tippers if we receive decent service. This service ... very poor. Needless to say, we won't be back.

_QC9bolA8u5BRYjIrb8Uww.text: Amazing atmosphere and ambience has the look and feel of a gangsters hangout. Food was incredible. Great Italian food!

_MfEymOUBpq1On4NZc9V4w.text: We came here for my moms birthday. First impression I didn't like the entrance theme. You have to ring a doorbell to get it since the door is locked and you have to be let in. I stood in the lobby way too long.  Walking in you can't see anything since they have the lights super low where you need a flashlight to see the menu.    Food was amazing! Service was amazing no complaints. I ate the Anastasia Chicken, bomb! I had a salad which was good and the mushroom risotto which was good..

D_V7ltMgXjpBfiTMUgIqyg.text: So we came to Capo's in the same weekend that we visited several "upscale" restaurants [some owned by celebrity chefs] and this was the best restaurant we visited all weekend.  The service was great starting from the "greeting". Our waitress Sara was awesome and interacted with our group very well. She certainly added to the fun. After starting with a couple of pitchers of Sangria we ordered some appetizers and onto dinner.   My wife chose to go with the Chi Town shrimp scampi appetizer for her dinner which was really good. I had the spaghetti and vegetarian meatless meatball. Yes, that is right, a meatless meatball. I have had some better faux meats around but still the marinera sauce really takes over the taste and I really enjoyed this meal.  My brother had the lobster risotto and I had to taste it but I am glad I did; may be the most delicious thing I have ever tasted. At over $100 its something you only try on your birthday weekend but man it was good.  Everything about this place made you want to come back. I have to go get a fake NV license because I read that Tue is local 2:1 specials. Hope to come back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My meatless vege meatball and spaghetti was very good.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Even broke my vegan streak; had to taste my brothers lobster risotto.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My veggie meatball pasta

3ojMQeetmu0q5ehNfthinQ.text: One of our date night spots. Dem romantic swanky lil spot. Great food and drinks. Get the shrimp scampi its my absolute favorite.  Oh and I cant forget the nostalgic entertainment and low key mobster vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UCSk1W84w13_5BpPOZNwzg.text: Decent enough Italian cuisine and terrific ambiance.  Sunday brunch is the best time to visit if you aren't a drinking.

WZVclnUfY5GkIKGQ2XKBig.text: This is the most original Italian place in town it never gets old !! Great atmosphere and even better food and experience

Dv0Jjw-a3R7gn6ZRfKAdJA.text: Went here for a night with friends. I have heard good things, and finally made reservations. We were not disappointed at all. Loved the entrance and having a password to get in. Was super dark and took awhile for my eyes to adjust, but then the full speakeasy experience was awesome. The guy singing, then our waiter Armondo (who was AWESOME - love him) joined in as well singing to our table. Completely blown away. Oh, the food?  Amazing. I am a lasagna fan, and this did not disappoint. Everything was so good from Sausage & peppers, to meatballs (spicy!) to salads and finally main course. Veal, gluten free, steak, and my lasagna were all amazing. 5 stars!  Go and enjoy, I'd recommend reservations. And give Armondo a raise!

PqmaHAokrE4iou0xs5h8nA.text: Great experience , good food and well worth the drive off the strip.

ThjrbYdz6VL_aF8UXSSKhA.text: Capo's has turned into an annual right of passage when visiting Vegas.  It's well worth the Uber off the strip for some great meatballs and lasagna.  Portion sizes are perfect to share or take home.  Loved the live music.

gbFI4Zu5e95ibTn9BP3TOw.text: Delishhhhh! Recommended when I was here on business last year! Been coming ever since! We have brought and introduced about 8 people to this good restaurant! Must have the spaghetti and meatball! Lunch is extremely reasonable and dinner is a bit more expensive. Also, Tuesday's if you order off the regular menu u get $20 off!

aKUdhbzkYMdgcw-s-Fohpw.text: I don't know how this gem doesn't have 5 stars from everyone. I've lived in Vegas for 5 years and finally had the honor of eating at capos today. I've eaten at many well known Italian restaurants and nothing comes close to this one. The live entertainment they had singing Frank Sinatra songs was phenomenal. Can't wait to bring family and friends here when they are in town. The marinara sauce is the best I've ever had and I grew up on spaghetti

EYjg-jPio5a2oLhhR9yiEg.text: We did the Speakeasy entrance and it was fun. We were escorted to the main, however a rather dark dining room setting. Our server Francisco (who is on his game) came immediately with bread and we ordered a salad, fried calamari and wine for the table and all were very good.  I ordered the Veal Parm, entrees come with a side and salad, it was good. Others in our party ordered lamb chops, rigatoni in a vodka sauce and a couple ordered Chicken Angelo. It was a nice experience, next!

DBwNqzuFyZwNbSnFaGUuUg.text: Perfect place for first date or any celebration! They have live music and and their food is amazing. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Loved the atmosphere here.

wmyx50R1oXVjI4cklHyeJw.text: Extremely large portions that make the prices very reasonable. The house sauce is a little sweet for my tastes but it was all there. The meatball was large and good. The chicken parmigiana as very good and they don't skimp on the mozzarella. The chicken lucresse was excellent and definitely the best part of our order. The drinks are very strong so be prepared.

geNRsMaaAzmCWDKILXeZug.text: This is a legitimate Italian restaurant!  The food is unbelievably delicious and the staff is very friendly and most accommodating. I highly recommend this place, whether or not you are a local or a visitor.

71FS5X4Y7QWz7eKbwl5_KA.text: Excellent Italian food! Sleeps With Fishes pasta was really good. The Vinnies Alla Vodka Pasta was incredible. The garlic cheesy bread as an appetizer was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j-ReG3RjQXvUVxCQAcOkww.text: Oh God, what a night we had here! We made reservations for last night and I was beyond excited to come here, and I can tell you it was everything I expected and more! So I don't want to just spoil it for you but they have a peculiar way of taking reservations and receiving you when you arrive, it made us feel like we were back to the old days when Mafia was all over the place and things had a hint of suspense and mystery.  The place is absolutely gorgeous! The decoration, the chandeliers and pictures on the walls just take you right back to a different era. We were seated immediately and they had us in the red booth by the mirrors, facing the whole place, excellent!  Customer service wise they're also amazing, our server lady was very cordial and attentive, she took our orders and made sure to help me find a non alcoholic drink (I'm pregnant) so I wouldn't feel so left out as everybody with me was drinking. She suggested me a fruit punch that was delicious! Food came out pretty quick, we had appetizers, a soup/salad and our main meal. I must say that everything, absolutely everything, smelled and tasted fantastic! Me and my girl had dessert as well, she had the cannoli while I had a tiramisu, yes it was tasty and fresh. We ended up bringing some of the food home as their meals are good sized. Last but not least, I'd like to go back to the atmosphere. This place was beyond what I expected, the lightning and music were so relaxing and intriguing. They had a singer who made me cry happy tears, oh my God! That man had such a soft voice and he actually walked up to our table to sing us a song and I couldn't hold my tears, he was very friendly and interactive with us. This easily became my favorite restaurant and I'm already planning on making reservations for their Sinatra brunch on Sunday!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Us
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Da Don&#39;s Lasagna, it&#39;s bigger than it looks!

nvD2YNsw6PXceYvUmy1THg.text: Send your out of town friends here for a really fun time.  For locals the food is really good.  Price is ok.

PkAtrEu3oCKuQjrcvsY3Bw.text: Everytime we are out in Vegas we hit this spot up! Great food. Great service. Great ambiance. Love this place! A must try when un Vegas.

yjNIEl_iCs1jhcoNTbyTwg.text: We stopped by on a Tuesday night not realizing they have a 2 for 1 special for locals on Tuesday's, score!  This place has a very fun atmosphere that takes you back to another time. The food was delicious. Try the Fried Ricotta and Bruchetta for starter, it's amazing. Creamy garlic salad that came with entree was good as well. We got Fettucini and Angel with a Dirty Face pasta. They were excellent. The only cons were the noise level, it's pretty loud, and we weren't impressed with the bread they brought out.   We had dinner here for my mom's birthday and they made it fun. The live singer sang her happy birthday and a few other songs throughout the night.

AaA-6m7H-zCpgmOzVvtwlg.text: One of the best places to enjoy a nice romantic dinner in a different retro mobster atmosphere!! Love the place specially being from Chicago!! Al Capone is the main star!! Reservations are a must but so much worth it!! Off the strip not to far from it! The food is amazing in try Italian home made cuisine where grandma feed you with a plate to serve the entire block! !

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lV_bZkFtus9maChEqaaKkg.text: A very unique dining experience! The service and atmosphere were great and the best part was the food! Couldn't find fault with anything-from appetizers all the way to dessert! I highly recommend it!

WmjYC44ffsVmQtPYCa99Zg.text: We went to Capo's for dinner with old friends for the first time after a recommendation from another friend.  The service was great and the food was delicious.  There was live entertainment with someone on the piano.  The music was good.  The restaurant was a bit on the loud side with the music and people talking, however we would definitely visit this restaurant again when we come back to Las Vegas.  We called a head of time to find out the password, which we were told was Lasagna.  It sounds like you can say anything for the password.  They kind of tease you/give you a bad time when you come in, but it is all in fun.  We thoroughly enjoyed our evening.

uuluODg12diDlsY1UhD9LQ.text: Food was amazing!!! Had the Chicken Anastasia and the chicken parm and both were delicious. Had amazing service. Kaitlin was awesome. Definitely returning for another night

J9wgq4_GmoL3HN_UGdH6dA.text: Great Italian food. Our spaghetti lunch was huge. My wife and I shared a huge meatball and salad. And I do mean the meatball was huge. Quirky restaurant with a mobster like feel to it. Don't forget to give them the password to get in. Definitely plan to go back when we return to Vegas.

U6SXfH0NGYGH-e2InsZW1g.text: So happy to find this gem off the strip in Vegas.  If you are there do yourself a favor and grab an Uber and head on over for a delicious and entertaining night of piano, drinks, pasta, and great staff.  I love that they have the little semi- circle booths so you can snuggle up with your dining companion if that is your thing or spread way out if things are not going well.

ooYGfsrcuorOMX_w2RmDmg.text: This was one of the highlights to our trip to Vegas. Loved the ambiance, service was superb, live piano music was wonderful, and the food was easily the best Italian food I've enjoyed. And the portions are huge. We were staying on the strip and took a cab to the restaurant. When it was time to go, we asked our waiter about calling us a cab, he told us it would be hard to get a cab off the strip that far and could be a 45 minute wait. He came back 5 minutes later and had arranged a ride with 'a driver' that was at the bar. Turns out the driver is normally Capo's Sinatra singer but was not working due to laryngitis. They were awesome! Love Capo's.

964yBcEXJnrabfPDQ3Xzqg.text: Found this place on Yelp and, while I had family visiting, decided to give it a try. I LOVE themed restaurants and this one does not disappoint. From the secret entrance to the warm welcome, you feel like you are part of this loving MOB family. Lol The food was AMAZING and worth the price. It is a little pricey, maybe not something you can do every night, but I promise when you do go you will not be disappointed with the flavor blasts in your mouth. The flavors are reminiscent of my vacation in Italy...LOVED IT!!

pg42sUg1Sx7qnmFd4Egmyg.text: We loved it! The fried ravioli will haunt me, they were that good! The lasagna is out of this world delicious! Make reservations, the place is small, loved the live entertainment.

5dvEdojwm6cuf4yjX_Fwgw.text: This is our go to for a romantic Italian date night.  Our server Sara has served us multiple times and she's always attentive without being overbearing.  The crooner that sings the standards (I wish I knew his name) is EXCELLENT and even takes requests. And the food is always delicious and expertly prepared.  From the time your greeted ( I won't give it away but it's awesome) until you leave, you're transformed into a Goodfellas ambience.  Fugetaboutit!

qe_7dq_4oeyEuiPAv81fmg.text: Visiting my best friend in Vegas & we decided to check this place out after hearing great things. Here is our experience.... We walk into a small foyer with locked doors and a doorbell for entrance, this is at 6 PM on Wednesday. A small wizard of oz "face door" opens with a guy asking is we have reservations, we tell him no, he offers us to come in if we agree to sit at the bar, we were ok with that. I'm thinking "are they going for an Italian Mafia impression? Cuz, it's working!!" We sit at a nice big bar, in a place that was at least 90% empty --- REALLY? And a reservation is necessary for a table or booth?   Bartender takes our drink orders and delivers the menus. The place is so dark, the menus have a keychain flashlight attached to them. The Caesar salad was limp, greasy and pretty flavorless. The pasta e figioli soup had a nice flavor, but the puree texture was kinda weird, I prefer a broth and chunky texture.   My friend ordered the "sleeps with fish" specialty pasta dish, and she said it was VERY good. I ordered the vodka specialty pasta with blackened chicken, the pasta "pink" sauce was really flavorful and I really enjoyed the sun-dried tomatoes. The blackened chicken was extremely salty. The bread served with the meal was really good.  The bartender/waitress asked us to give her our honest impression of the things we had, so we told her.... Before long, the manager came over and apologized and offered to remove the extra charges for the blackened chicken and the Caesar salad "upgrades", which was very nice of him. (I think that was the same "face" that opened the little wizard of oz door when we got there).  The bill arrives and my friend pays with her credit card. There isn't a keychain flashlight on the bill, and with the lights so low, my friend misread the total as being $20 more than it actually was (we noticed her copy later in the evening in "light").... I am quite curious to see if they ran her card for the actual tip amount she posted or the wrong total and take the $40+ tip, instead of the $20+ tip that was intended.   I may end up adjusting my rating accordingly when I find out if they are honest or not.

NRrIGuz4lYJSJ766Zic5SQ.text: Enjoyed thoroughly.   Very entertaining.  Strong drinks. Great food.  Fun atmosphere.  Live singer doing old time croons. Enjoy!   About $60 per person including drinks.

kVxsc1DXTuB2AsDImHK1AQ.text: Omg I felt like I was back in NY years ago ! My youth was flashing in my eyes . Secret ring in entrance . Low lighting piano man . Totally cool . Nice little hidden gem . 5 stars totally on theme and place .. Excellent job . Will follow with review for food and service . Very nice ole looking decor . Ok menu is basic . Had chicken parm and meatball parm both excellent . Not the biggest but just right . Cesar salad was very good and sandwich come with fries or antipasta salad . It was a great little lunch experience .

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesar salad for 2
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm side antipasta
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Total trip ! Love the way in . MoB style . Felt like I was back home

7PIoDTPV5X8Qxrl4LEm1ug.text: I had the spagheti in meat sauce, with a meatball side. The food was very good. The decor, with the dark red interior and mobster pictures on the wall, gives it an old "Mafia" world charm....which I found fun and appealing. I will definitely go back....by the way, if you go on Tuesdays, they give you one entree free with the purchase of any entree (up to $20 off your bill). You can't beat that deal

qU5drrFKJl4OX3B6mHY2Ig.text: This was our 2nd visit to Capo's and loved every minute.  What a great vibe, attention from the waiter, food, atmosphere.  We dined at 5pm and by 6 - 6:30pm the place was filling up.  We LOVED the magician (V) and his table tricks.  Very accomplished.  The singer was wonderful and sang a song my sister requested right at our table. If you want a slice of old world Vegas with a mob theme and great food, go here.

DrVwGW9zV04d6f5CMtix-Q.text: The atmosphere is great. The dimly lit room, red leather booths, and  flashlights to read the menu add to the old school supper club feeling. We enjoyed the singer doing Sinatra songs while walking aound the room. The food is very good with the portions being enough to fill you up. Consequently we did not have room for dessert. The chicken picata with garlic mash was excellent as well as the veal picata with mushroom risotto. The only downside to the food was the crusty bread was dried out on the inside. The night of our visit the service could have been better. First our server did not offer us water. She seemed to disappear for a while and we had a hard time flagging down another person to help us. The restaurant was full. There was a group of about 20 people at one table. They could have had more servers. Resolving these items will add other star.

a0evhotA1v8p_IhK-shGAg.text: Loved it! Loved it! Loved it! Service, food, ambiance, photos, the entry, the kitchen, the live singing .....wow, just wow. We will be back and soon!

GDGdlElEkH75_yzpSpn6Kg.text: Came here with a groupon enticed by the Speakeasy theme. I am Italian and their meatballs are exquisite. Normally don't order pasta salad, but there's a must. Fresh and tasty not covered in Italian dressing. Love the secret entrance- won't ruin the fun by telling you what to look for. Love it and will definitely be back.

gtbewEhu0lyRAV_SPwzR8g.text: we eat here a lot for dinner but tried it for lunch, menu  limited but just as good as evening, new waitress " arlene ""  a pleasant surprise, she is wasted on lunch service, made us feel at home !! their vodka sauce is the best in las vegas, no problems here

yaFjfuRt7Frif7hf9LV_cQ.text: Let me praise this place first and foremost for it's customer service. The one thing I'm always impressed by is when you have a large group of people, and they provide excellent customer service. We had a group of 11 people and only 1 waitress. She was awesome and amazingly attentive the entire time.   I was very nervous because my boyfriend's grandparents are obsessed with Italian. I never recommend places that I haven't been to, but all of my friends that I trust had recommended it to me. I'm so glad I made the choice! Everyone loved everything they got, and the best in my opinion was the Chicken Marsala. Most of us passed around our dishes to try everything out, and there wasn't one thing I didn't like. I do love Italian, and I have been very picky on the places that I like. I'm not a fan of chain restaurants. I just feel they're all the same and generally the same "OK" type of quality of food. There are a few exceptions, but I usually shy away from these places.   I see people on here complaining about the prices. I feel that the prices are very reasonable, and here is why -  The dinners come with bread, soup or salad.  They give you large portions (even though I typically appreciate smaller portions so I don't over eat.) They have live entertainment, I'm sure it's mostly in the evenings.  The ambiance and the experience. It's cute and "mob" style.  The service. I always pay attention to the service and the service around me, and everyone seemed very content. The singer and the manager even thanked us for coming in and dining with them.   People need to take in account for everything, not just the prices, especially if it's worth the prices and it's good food.   I know it may not be consistent across the board for everyone, but I had an awesome experience. Go to their website, look at their menu before you go. It's definitely recommended for anyone who enjoys something different than the norm.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vinny&#39;s Ala Vokda

gEXp8Jvq9tmE1mjFnXWOCw.text: Came here for lunch on a groupon. I had the meatball sandwich amazing! Cheesy and the aioli fries were out of his world. Boyfriend had the chicken Parmesan sandwhich can. He smashed it. His whole plate actually. Ambience is dark and romantic with old Mafia theme classy music and chandeliers. Been here for dinner once with a bachelorette party. Chicken was good and mushroom risotto was so good I almost cried. Lol Italian door and servers here are great. Definitely  coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball sub. 9.95

m8FzxjukemZuH9eUTyv0rg.text: This was my fourth time here, as before, good atmosphere, lovely Sinatra era music and excellent food!  Portion sizes are huge, consider splitting the entree with another soup or salad.

_btW62jU2-e99YekoC1Skg.text: This place used to be a 4-star restaurant for me, but based on the last few times I've been here unfortunately they've lost a star :(. The service our first time around was fantastic and attentive; but last time we went, it was non-existent. Being from NYC, the Italian cuisine is not the best I've had, but for being in Vegas, I suppose it's pretty good. Honestly the best part of the entire establishment is how they're set up: the entry is entertaining and the decor is also a lot of fun. It's a great place to take your friends from out of town, because it is in some ways a touristy gimmick. Here's a tip: Go on restaurant.com for a gift certificate and save $$ on your check. Make a reservation, it's safer to do so and doesn't hurt!

3l5GbJfgxUkOzLyeb-3jAA.text: We made reservations 5 days in advance for a Saturday night .  We gave the password at the door and the man just asked "you got reservations ?"  I said yes , gave him my name, and he let us in .  He immediately seated us two booths into the restaurant directly across from the bar and kitchen .  It was extremely loud with pots and pans banging , cooks shouting in Spanish , and the bar crowd socializing .  The singer was facing away from us and singing into the main dining room .  What we could hear , he sounded very good .  We had zero interaction with the mob theme .  No weapons checks , no where ya from , notta .   The service was too fast as we were only 1/4 finished with our salad before the served the main entree .  We decided to eat the entree while it was hot .  The food was delicious .  The meatball was great , my wife's shrimp was good too .   Too bad we didn't get the mob experience or ambience .  Don't accept a table by the bar or kitchen .  Maybe avoid Saturday night all together .   The food was worth giving them another try , but I will call ahead and make sure we get the dining room or we won't go .

WyEnkT6lBUAhbJEEoKjDcg.text: Awesome decor and old school gangster ambiance, just off the strip.  Excellent service, and the food wasn't bad either.  It wasn't the best, but I have certainly had worse.  A lot of fun!

I-v1fXgAgH20hzjVhPXQug.text: Capo's is always interesting and Ziggy keeps it that way.  Good food, good crew!

JFT2_aRJQF8k62HWhs3LXg.text: Great atmosphere. Enjoyed all the songs sung by the resident singer. The meatballs are delicious and large. Our waiter was average. Requested their delicious bread several times and finally, it was delivered. Had also to request for extra butter.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q6dV3R-ROLnWNVRmPD4zdA.text: Very cool Vegas Italian joint. Food was good, but our server, Santana, really made the experience for us with her awesome service!

cAcM5ipt6_BmrbWyLmL7Hw.text: Great time.  Went on Valentines Day and had a great time.  Singer like Dean Martin was good.  Waiters were exceptional and always available-perfect service.  Decor was 1920's Las Vegas emulating the gangster era.  Made reservations online and was seated exactly on time.  Had ravioli with cheese and a huge' meatball.  Cheese had plenty of flavor, I had the red sauce, good too.  Meatball was a quarter bound, but needed some more spices, more like a round burger.  My plate was cold and rather than microwave it (my request), they made all new plate.  Wife had lasagna, warning-huge portion. Easily enough for 2-3 people.  Lots of cheese and meat.  good.  Prices about $25 each.  Didn't have desert, too full.  All in, a great experience and recommend it.

l_-f209btVhFVbExqQjQCw.text: Atmosphere, & service were excellent.  We had Shotgun Sausage & Peppers for appetizer, and it wad wonderful. My husband had Lasagna,  and he said it was the best he'd had in years (including mine). I had Scarface Shrimp Scampi - light and delicate with perfectly cooked shrimp. The whole meal was perfect.

h3UHJhNipoXe9s-a5bWeXA.text: Hubby and I stopped by for lunch and the food was very good. Big shout out to Alberto for his great service!

WchrMz-dCMMg6Te8icnwXQ.text: What a great restaurant we dined there the other night for the first time. We will go back for sure. Sat at the bar had a lively young lady I think her name is Amy help me with suggestions on dinner live the choices she made for me. Check the specials as well. Industry night Monday great deal. Will be back

sUF8dzijAem0anqFiaT2CQ.text: I love this place! The food is amazing, strip quality without the strip pricing. The atmosphere is amazing and they have a very friendly staff.  My favorite meal is the chicken francaise, with the creamy garlic salad, and garlic mash potatoes. You must have the espresso martini for desert as well! The thing that keeps me coming back with new groups of friends and family is the amazing magician named "V". His jokes are hilarious, his magic is phenomenal and it's the perfect entertainment to spark up a dull dinner with the inlaws! Make sure to bring some cash to show your appreciation for this skilled act! The live music is great too.

lmmapySms4YolKRaD6icwA.text: Great service and delicious food. The lunch groupon that is available is a great deal.

w0gQEJOaizTK8utgD0T5Ww.text: From start to finish the food was amazing (life changing). The atmosphere is old Las Vegas with a flare of New York. Bobby the singer was great!! Jeremy our server was fantastic! Will definitely be coming back!

TWfoVcJNeqql9iZWbPDLaQ.text: Service and food was great and loved how dark it is, literally.  The less light, the more relaxed the atmoshere feels with the candlelight.  We especially enjoyed the entrance, which really gives it a nice "speakeasy" touch.  Then you throw in the piano player and forget about it!!!  We went before 5pm on a Monday and it was super mellow.  We ate so much that unfortunately, had no room for dessert or ordered cocktails so cannot comment on that.  I do highly recommend this place and not just for the fad.  It's very unique and worth trying it out for yourself.

C1xN_DHB0Zhpj5np3oAXLg.text: Worried that it would be too theme parky or kitschy....Well it IS kitschy but it is the right kind of kitschy.  The place is not very big with a 6 or 8 seat bar, a small area to wait for a table, a main dinning room with 8 booths or so and about 10 dining tables.  There is a small dance floor but it is more for the singer than for dancing.  There is a second room for large groups or overflow seating but it was not air conditioned the night we came.....and I can not imagine trying to dine in there with temps about 15 degrees higher than the restaurant.  My only real complaint is that the temp in the dining room was about 76 degrees and it felt a little stuffy and warm.  1.  Make a reservation. 2.  Ask for a booth 3.  Be willing to play along 4.  Have a martini or two 5.  The "Sinatra" singer is actually really good and he smelled nice too. 6.  Use your cell phone flashlight instead of the mini flash lights they give you to read the menu. 7.  A candelabra on your cell phone can be a nice touch on your table 8.  Go for it.  Dress like a gangster, grab your favorite dame, and don't forget your hat.   The food was good.  But if you come back it will be for the experience and probably not the calamari.

DJoky7p0u3TlVxXbZNl7oQ.text: Went to Capo based on recommendations from friends and we were a little disappointed. We had the pesto pasta and the carbonara and it was just ok. In fact, the best thing we had was a Caesar salad.

2k2l-LreAlFO_KkN-Ul1NA.text: Great place excellent food very friendly staff very attentive would give them 10 Stars

rISnmCuCiPWHvssyGGA37g.text: Overall 3.5 stars. Cool restaurant, friendly staff. Awesome magician. Good singer. As for the food, it was a mixed bag. There were four of us. Ordered cheese bread (good), calamari (good), Alfredo pasta (a little better than Olive Garden), veal parmigiano  (good), shrimp scampi  (good, different than I'm used to), lasagna (great), molten cake (good), tirimasu  (good), turtle cheesecake (okay). Bill a bit higher than expected, just because food wasn't awesome. Maybe we didn't order the right things. Might go back for happy hour at the bar.

TYcjIydNdM_MBTinaedmxA.text: Been here one other time and it doesn't disappoint.  Very good food each time and decor is pretty kool.  If this was on the strip they could charge twice what they do.  But that's ok I don't mind going down the road to get off the strip for awhile.  Have recommended to friends whenever they goto Vegas and they have really enjoyed the food and decor as well.  Nothing bad to say.  If you haven't been go, if your not sure go!

1CCw0I39VFbPxTJkEKn-fw.text: 3 STARS=FOOD  ..Blah, The salad was the highlight and food went down from there. Red Sauce tasted like Ragu. My carbonara was a greasy, bland, watery sauce mess. If I hadn't had a glass of wine in me, I would have not eaten more than one bite.  I think I managed about 6 or so...ugh just thinking about it.  1 STAR=SERVICE....sucked.  I joked that the female waitress must also be the cook because she seemed to vanish for very long periods.  The male waiter came buy just a bit more than 'never'.    5 STARS=ATMOSPHERE AND SINATRA TYPE PIANO GUY..Hovers a bit too much. I think he would be much better, sitting at the piano and singing.  We had fun with HOST/BOUNCER guy.    I really wanted to love this place.  The inside is so dark and VEGAS.  It would be perfect with the piano singer and drinks...but for food...FA GET ABOUT DIT.

iL50hyL_95KDfCrPxU2NWg.text: I love it !! Ravioli are good.. chicken are excellent lasagna are best  good service nice music and magician came table to do Magic thank you !! Very very nice.

-OrrowvSjgtwNKpHa9kz9g.text: Ahaha this place is awesome, and the food is super good!. How could you make a broccoli taste soo delicious?, you bite the broccoli and its burst with deliciousness . Not to mention the awesome theme, I'll be back for sure!!!!

ZNOtWH69w_UKLb8LdSzJ5w.text: Always good food here and the staff makes sure the dining experience is amazing. The waiter was knowledgeable on the menu and made excellent wine suggestions.

XpeyQDgjpL3Oj094zQ9bZw.text: I brought relatives there from out of town who were celebrating their 30th anniversary. Since our family is Italian descent, we all grew up on homemade Italian food. Capo's food is "authtic Italian", not like the Olive Garden variety. The mob/speakeasy theme makes eating there more of an experience and is really quite fun! The decor is very era appropriate. It is quite dark inside, but they provide small lights for reading the menu.  I mentioned to the manager that we were celebrating a 30th wedding anniversary. I thought maybe he would have his wait staff bring them out a piece of cake with a candle or something in recognition as other restaurants often do. He did nothing at all. That is really the only fault I have to find with my experience at Capo's.  BTW...the meatball appetizer is fantastic...a must try when you go!

dHc00Y9iBIsbyFSMlC3VFw.text: We finally made it back. Capo's has been our favorite Vegas restaurant for years. Seems like it's just a hidden gem. The environment is fun, the staff is super friendly and seem to be in character and the food...."fohgeddaboudit"Top notch all the way around. Already looking forward to next time.

9nQ3pTt9zmD7GA0_x3XcWw.text: What a wonderful dining/celebration experience!  I chose Capo's Speakeasy for proposing to my fiance b/c it looks super-cool inside (Vegas Mob-theme), they have a talented pianist/singer, and b/c I had heard the food was phenomenal.  Capos delivered above & beyond my already high expectations.  From the entrance way to the cocktails to the delicious pastas and desserts, we had a fabulous time.  An extra-special *Thank You* to Janeen for working with me while I was a nervous fiance-to-be -- you were always courteous and patient and you totally sold the cover story -- thank you!).  My fiance was totally surprised and delighted, and I owe it all to the staff and chefs, including the owner/managers who came to our table to congratulate us personally.  5+ STARS.  We can't wait to go back!

-GPCOg1a_gMpFX-QlJA4JQ.text: Love this place.  Awesome speakeasy.  Great food.  Wonderful atmosphere.  Try to hit Capo's every time we're in LV.

D9P5E_Lje-B9DGOTRpDCEQ.text: Absolutely the best Italian in town, the atmosphere and the service is excellent!! Now the food everything we are was great, we are planning our next visit already 276 miles are not an excuse not to be there again

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best food and deserts in town
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HZ6TgbPCZJj48rX0eAqGoA.text: If you love Italian food, STAY AWAY FROM THIS DIVE! Save the time, money and effort and go to Albertsons and buy a $1 Michelinas microwave dinner. That's what this stuff reminded me of. Italian food is not that difficult, yet so many places mess it up, and this place tops that list! $20 for a piece of lasagna that tasted like mush and was the size of cigarette pack. Hot ceasar salad with rock hard croutons and stale bread. The ambiance was horrible. I went with a party of six and they stuck us in a makeshift table in the isle next to the bar where everyone walking in or to the bathroom had to bump into us. The lighting is so bad that they have to put small lights on the menus. Some Sinatra wannabe singing so loud that I couldn't hear the people at my own table. The only bright spot was a well made Cherry Coke and a nice waitress who knew what a joke her work environment is. If you like the stereo typical wiseguy theme Italian restaurant, then this place is for you, right down to the secret entrance. You'll get a better bang for your buck at Fazolis so save yourself the heartache and skip this place, I wish I had...

pRkJ_n8O7o0CqioUR3jDdw.text: Had an awesome experience last night.  Went to Capo's on Sahara. Was greeted at the door by a great Maitre d'. The decor and ambiance were perfect. Janine, who I haven't seen for years welcomes me. She's wonderful. Long story short. Food was great. Service awesome. Experience was fun. So much I'll be bringing the whole family in on 2 for 1 Tuesday's. See ya Tuesday. Fuggedaboutit.!

a8GYw623X_k_Sb_qEQpAZQ.text: The food and atmosphere here is second to none in my opinion. Love the live singer, and the mob movies on a loop over the bar is a nice touch. The guy at the front door is always fun. But the service here is the worst ive ever had. After the 3rd straight bad experience i wont be going back. The last time much like the 2 times before it, the waitress was horrid. With a capitol H. forgot our appetizer, couldnt get a 2nd drink after waiting 20 min for the first one and had an attitude when i said i had capo gift cards (which i had ironically gotten cause my service sucked so bad the time before). Its a shame cause me & my girlfriend really like the atmosphere. But even with giftcards we felt we overpaid considering the service is pathetic. Unless they plan on getting real servers and overhauling the staff we will never set foot in this place again!

psAqcSkjbdfGIy4sxTgf2g.text: I desperately wanted to love this place. But the food....the food.... I don't know if they hated us, but the lasagna they served us was dry and the meatball was disgusting. My fettucine alfredo was too watery and I couldn't finish it because the butter leaked out of the sauce and went onto my fettucine. Godfather was playing so that was why I gave it 2 stars. Oh, and my server was nice. But it was pricey.

N-4L5dvzJTz_LheBzo2lLQ.text: Italians will know what I mean when I say it's almost as good as Mom's cooking. I ordered ravioli with meatballs. The marinara was delicious, the pasta perfect, and the meatballs definitely taste homemade. My friend ordered a chicken dish with garlic sauce, and afterwards I had to stand at least five feet away from her.  It was the best meal we ate in Vegas.  The ambience made it an extra-cool experience. Note to visitors going without a car: it's a hefty cab ride from the strip, but worth every penny.

uQHDVoUMj4sWc1SmKPkdbg.text: Found a Groupon online & came in for lunch to redeem it. Very cool place, atmosphere is relaxing & elegant and best of all is the service. My husband & I will definitely be coming back!

4HvcRlT6tS21nzXN96IOmg.text: I can't even begin to explain how amazing this experience was!!! The entrance is awesome and a surprise and experience on its own ( I won't say in what way). The waiters every single one of them is amazing! I went for my birthday celebration & I felt so at home and happy. The waiters made the whole dinner experience even more wonderful. Every waiter was polite, very attentive and quick. Drinks were refilled constantly, questions were answered politely & the waiters all constantly had a smile on their faces! The food was so amazing, I ate every bite. I ordered the ricotta traficante (don't recall the exact name) but it was amazing! The food was so fresh and seasoning was just right. At the end of the night the waiters brought our to go boxes and, came to the table to wish me a happy birthday and a desert on the house. I can honestly say my  expectations for this restaurant were exceeded. I want to take the time to say thank you once again to the owner, and the wonderful staff! Ps. Just know that the restaurant doesn't split checks

opeaBCD9hrtZbMPnC6GtMQ.text: I love this place!  I went here for my 21st birthday and had so much fun. I loved the Sinatra singer, I loved the atmosphere! The food was amazing! I would be willing to hop a plane to Vegas just to have those mozzerella sticks again!

yKFfY10dhRStY3XE4mvhLQ.text: This is how old schooled should be! It was a lot of Fun, Food and Service was GREAT, staff was the BEST. Thanks for a wonderful, enjoyable, dinner and overall experience. Looking forward to returning, This is a MUST for all visitors to see and enjoy. Don't change a thing, it was a lot of fun!! Don Colone would be proud! See you next time, JWP

W92vM9WtGthhHbDG6mH7WA.text: Thanks fellow yelpers!  I wouldn't have found this restaurant without you!  This place is quite an experience... Initially it felt like I was at Disneyland on the haunted house ride.  We opened the door and entered into a small room with wall to wall dark wood.  We stood there for a few minutes and then a small window opened behind us.  I was so surprised and caught off guard, I let out a loud yelp.  The side door opened, which lead us into a dark restaurant.  The place was decorated with old italian mafia type accessories.  Most of the props looked really old and it further reinforced the feeling of being at Disneyland.   We were seated on the stage area and had a good view of the live singer, who sang Dean Martin hits most of the night and it sounded really good.    The restaurant was so dark, the menus had small flashlights attached to them.   We had the egg drop soup, appetizer pizza, scallops and arrabiata pasta.  Everything was very good.  I highly recommend this restaurant.    I gave it one less star because of the aged mafia props!

TwyEOv4HZ1J6htyEC8hMig.text: Relying on yelp reviews I made an excellent choice for tonight's dinner.  First time in my life I literally cleaned up plates in Italian restaurant :) because a) I was really hungry; b) portions were just right to allow for dessert in the end.  We started (as recommended) with Stuffed Mushrooms - they were great and even though my g/f doesn't like olives in any form she ate a half of the portion :) I had lasagna - it was great and portion was not huge which is a plus because I wanted to leave room for dessert. I also had bean and pasta soup with it - excellent. My g/f ordered fetuchini alfredo with shrimp - she didn't manage to finish the pasta but she got all the shrimp out of it for sure - it was big and (what's that fancy word ..) - succulent. She also liked Italian egg drop soup.  Then we had chocolate cake with side of ice cream - plate was clean :) And finally when we were ready to go the singer came to our table and sung a serenade for my girlfriend.   Bottom line: + interior is cool + food's good + singer is great  I definitely recommend this place to anyone.

d1UCTJ9g2AaToDZ5pVIIOw.text: Fun place! Cool retro atmosphere. Good old-fashioned Italian. Dark and romantic. Good date night find.

sN7cvYZa0PSC0iT4kahFIA.text: Capo's is amazing!  All aspects...food, atmosphere, service, etc.  I had the salmon picatta with mushroom risotto and ceasar salad.  Seriously, the BEST I have ever had.  My husband had the bacon wrapped filet and said it was so good, he did not want the flavor to leave his mouth!  Coming from 2 serious Sicilians.... Capo's is the BEST and my new favorite Italian spot.  However, I did try a bite of the ravioli and I was not impressed but everything else was nothing less than amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside

Crh2LVn-r4C2GykeifGn4g.text: The front door gimmick is certainly worth talking about for the first few minutes of your meal.     Upon entering the restaurant you are greeted by a classic Italian Mob looking joint complete with the cheesy crooner singing tableside.  The setting and ambiance are perfect.  As for the meal,   The wine list is a very lacking, as it was mostly new world wines with only fifteen or so selections.  We settled on a bottle of Ruffino Gold Label ($60), all though if they had any quality Italian wines we would have been happy to spend a bit more.  On the high end side of things they only had Silver Oak and Opus One, which were priced far below normal Vegas mark-ups ($110 & $250).  I got there a bit after my friends who had already ordered appetizers.  When the apps came, they brought out the bruschetta with no cheese instead of no pancetta as my friends had claimed to order it.  My friends can be space cadets so this could have been their fault.  Regardless of who's fault it was, the waitress was very nice and brought a new one and allowed us to keep the improperly made one on the table.  I ordered the Pasta Fagioli soup which was excellent, but served luke warm, and then the Veal Piccata which was also very good, all though I thought it was a bit of a small portion.  Everybody else at the table really enjoyed their meals, and it was a pleasant experience with Dean Martin and Frankie Blue Eyes being sung five feet away from us.  Our server was very nice and attentive even though she had quite a few tables running at once.  I will come back to Capos when I am in the mood for a fun evening away from the strip.
