The food is good, but not great.  But considering that it's not that expensive, and they have to keep a guy employed just to scare the crap out of you at the front door, I'll give them a pass.  They get five stars because I did enjoy the evening very much, and I don't want to get whacked next time I come in if I only gave it four.

UtyV-4Dkw8hNEZQ9GtZ_OA.text: Went to Capo's for the first time last night with 2 friends - LOVED it!  I ordered an Italian Margarita - it was sweet and yummy!  We started dinner with 2 apps - cheesy garlic bread and mushroom caps,  The mushroom caps were the BEST!!  I decided to try the nightly special - panko chicken breast stuffed - sitting in a bed of spinach and roasted potatoes!  So GOOD!  I really wanted to try some desert - but I was too full!  If you're in the mood to try Capo's - get the mushroom caps to start for sure!  Oh, I loved watching Casino on the TV in the dining room and listening to the singer at the piano...a fun night for sure!!

wpcpbQhQK5GyqmwfBOad1w.text: We went tonight after we walked out 6 mths ago because we didn't get any service at the bar last time. I figured let's give it another try. The food you can tell is very low quality since we frequented them a few years ago. The bruschetta tasted like band aids and the salad dressings had no flavor! Just oily wilted lettuce. The chicken parm was just ok. Bland sauce and over fried low quality chicken. The chicken fettucini was good, except for the frozen grilled chicken, that looked and tasted like Tyson frozen chicken with the fake grill marks. The best part of the meal was the chocolate covered cannoli s, because the lava cake was terrible and they were out of ice cream. We definitely won't ever be returning. The place was dead for a Sunday night, now we know why.

nxpDUG9ebfMRG81X8nWm6A.text: The evening was soo much fun - singing, magic, great food and what an entry!  We will go every time we happen to be in Las Vegas and have already suggested it to friends.  Loved the spinach soup ... looking for the receipe.

MnEEvm-A2IHNzcCHnPAvhg.text: For me to be giving this place 5 stars, it's gotta be good. A) Because I don't give out 5 stars very often and B) Because I'm not the hugest Italian food fan. My friends from San Diego were in town and wanted to go here, so I obliged. So glad I did! The place is a dark, gangster like joint where they serve some amazing food. I wanted the ravioli, but they were out, so I had their special - swordfish. The best swordfish I've ever had along with the best risotto I've ever had. Red sangria packed a delicious punch, too. All of the salads were amazing as well -- how can you blow me away with a salad? All in all, a great experience, and a friendly staff as well. If you go, ake sure you go on restaurant.com first and buy a gift certificate at a discount!

DJH2065jWwmU3q_4Yi-h8w.text: I will bypass the ambiance talk since other yelpers have definitely covered all the bases from the cool entrance, to the mobster pictures on the wall, the gangster movies on in the background, and the Frank Sinatra-like singer.  My husband and I had a great time at Capo's.  We made reservations (which I highly recommend) for 7 p.m. on a Friday night.  We got there a 1/2 hour early not knowing how long the drive would take and am I glad we made reservations - the place was packed this night!  No biggie - we sat at the bar and waited.  We hit it just right because happy hour was from 5-7 p.m. and I had the best martini of my life for half off!  The Domitini (martini) was amazing and my husband said the gin and tonic was great too.  We also ordered the stuffed mushrooms at the happy hour rate and we were really pleased.  The host waited for us to finish our drinks and appetizer before coming over to seat us.  It was nice not to be rushed through or have to juggle drinks and a plate all the way to our table.  And it's not like they weren't busy and could have pushed us along, but the whole focus at Capo's was about customer service.  Probably the best service I've had in my life.  When we got to our table, we were immediately given fresh bread and butter and glasses of water.  The bread was so delicious it was hard not to fill up on just that.  The waiter was really pleasant and equally attentive.  We never had empty glasses and services never lagged.  My husband got the Uncle Pauly's Arrabiata and I got the Chef Sleeps with the Fishes.  The Arrabiata was pretty spicy, so if you like spicy make sure to tell them only medium spicy otherwise you may not enjoy it as much.  My dinner was excellent. The flavors were really amazing; the play between the sun-dried tomatoes and cream and prosciutto was pretty amazing. what made this so good was that you could tell the pasta was homemade and fresh.  It really added to the dish.  To finish we got the chocolate covered cannolis, which we delicious.  They were on par with connolis I got in Boston in Little Italy.  Freshly-made just like everything else they serve, it was the perfect ending at a great restaurant.  When we left, I told the host that the reviews didn't do the place justice and he was genuinely pleased.  I look forward to coming back to capo's on our next Vegas trip.

FKq8DKZuTwuh5P2isYVz_Q.text: Capo's Is A Real Kick.  The concept and atmosphere are great.  We were there on a Sunday and they had a Frank Sinatra era singer doing classics.  The music was a bit too loud but that was part of the fun- it was not so loud we couldn't hear each other. The food was good- all 4 in our party were pleased- and better then expected.  Those of us who ordered chicken entrees the portions were perfect.  Those who ordered pasta needed take home boxes.  A bit over the top for an every night stop- but a great choice for a fun special night out.

hr6spKZRULHCStgPakBL7g.text: We took my husband here for his SIXTIETH birthday and what a pleasant surprise.  The food was absolutely wonderful! There is nothing better than True authentic Italian food.The ambiance was great and the theme was really fun. Even though it's really dark in the restaurant they do give you a little flashlight to read the menu.  Lol Oh, and let's not forget the Frank Sinatra singer he was so cool!

AzkAOrWQkz9PrN-SaVNM4Q.text: Old style Italian American food, heavy on calories, low on veggies except for tomato paste on some dishes. Although the exceedingly dim lighting is disconcerting at first, I found it strangely relaxing. A small glass of wine with tip and tax easily runs $16-$17 which I find annoying. Kudos to our waiter for recommending a lower price entree over one twice its cost when a person in our party asked which was better. Service was excellent: wait staff did their job efficiently w/o being intrusive. The place was full on a Monday night. Customers seem to appreciate servings big enough to either promote obesity or provide the next day's breakfast or lunch. Definitely not for trendy foodies or folks looking for light cuisine.

zHJUKaqGGChTWOE9ng8SZw.text: Amazing experience will definitely go again. I just tasted the best veal in Vegas. Great customer service

3pnidKBt_s3vCHauV_C1DA.text: The service is the best I have experienced in a restaurant here in Vegas.  The food is amazing! The taste was better than I expected for off the strip and the proportions were so big everyone had to take food home.  I will be back to entertain my friends with the surprises that occur throughout the night.  It's my new favorite place!

NT0SQYZRQXxfxNOSnlvvgg.text: One of my boys told me about this spot when he visited Vegas and said to check it out but would not give me details.  I was like okayyyyyyyyy pretty strange. This place is cool and very different! It's definitely not just your typical restaurant based on theme and originality.  It super quiet on the outside of the building on a near creepy level lol . Soooo before you enter you see a sign that says "Ring the door bell for entrance". which we  did because we were hungry lol. Then a few seconds later, a small peek window behind a photo frame opened and this dudes face pokes out asking pass word questions in order to enter the business. LOL  At first i was like WTF !!! lol but It was a pretty cool way to be unique and give you that Mobster feel. (I thought I was John Gotti for a second) LOL After that he opened a hidden door and it is pretty dark in there and looks pretty old school yet comfy with nicely set tables and booths.  Customer Service was great and they made you feel at home. The food is amazing and flavorful with authentic and perfect seasoning.  I am chicken parm addict and my sandwich was made to perfection and french fries were amazing !!!!! They had some of the most unique Mob names for dishes that were really creative and funny to me. I loved it !!! I will definitely be back when visiting Vegas to try more on the menu for sure.   My only negative was that the dim setting after while was kind of rough on the eyes when sitting in it for a long period of time but other than that great experience !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DRZotZ8KjA5DddjnKjptKA.text: One of my buddys who is a Vegas local recomended this place to me as I was in town doing a Vegas vacation with my family. I knew the back story but the kids and wife didnt and long story short they loved it! The food was amazing across the board, even my moody 14 year old teenage son said it was the best he had ever had.  The Calamari was probably the best I have ever had, it was tender as opposed to chewy and just the perfect amount of breading. We also ordered the garlic cheese bread which was perfect, a blackened chicken ceaser(once again amazing-we like the shredded romain as opposed to the rough cut romaine) and also shared linquini and clams and the lasagna. Just a delicious meal across the board, and for a bit got to enjoy the piano player tinkling the ivories.   The service was fine and attentative, the food excellant-if I was a Vegas local I would love to hang at the bar and listen to the piano player. Super cool place and while it was not close to the strip-worth going to the fringes for the food and the atmosphere.

zwrIXZGeTx65rBW7vTU4pg.text: Found this place pretty randomly as we were on vacation for a week in Vegas looking for interesting places to eat at.  This place has a very speakeasy-type feel to it, from the secret entrance to the dark ambience, to the decor, to the mobster movies playing on the TVs.  What we had:  Santucci's Pasta--this hit the spot for me!  I had been craving some simple, but special, spaghetti pasta and this met and exceeded all expectations!  Got it w the meatball and it just made my day...I would go back just for this dish...simple, but special.  Big Dom's Primavera--the Mrs had this and it looked amazing :-).  Full of fresh veggies of all types tossed in a light olive oil.  By the end of the meal, there wasn't a veggie left on the plate...enough said!  Da Mob Meatball Sandwich--the little one had this and she really did a number on it.  The meatballs are awesome and when you load them up in a sandwich, it was something that just makes your mouth water :-P  Truly a hidden gem in a pretty obscure area, but a place that I would seek out next time I am back in the City!  Happy eating!

fKWkbwyzhKsZnbjqd2gQpw.text: We were here with family to celebrate a birthday. The entrance was cool. The inside is soooo dark- they give you flashlight with the menu. My grandparents had a hard time walking in the darkness because they couldn't see. The food was good, but pricey. We enjoyed our meal, but probably won't be going back.

OtSz_EV-3ksdVlBpzuMsoA.text: What a fun place, I'll start saying I love Italian food and enjoy Mob movies and everything mob related. This place hit both items.  Our group came in for a bachelor party, typically I never eat off the strip in Vegas but so glad we did.   The meatball appetizer was on point. Meatballs are about the size of a softball and packed full of flavor. According to the menu it is Al Capone's family recipe.   The bruschetta was good, not amazing but still better then average.   For dinner I ordered the  "Stuffed Chicken Anastasia" for my sides I went with the pasta fagioli and mushroom risotto. The soup was good, I would have preferred it with out beans but still a good soup. The mushroom risotto was awesome. The stuffed chicken was great, i wish I could have finished it but I was just to full.   Someone at out table ordered the rib eye and was very pleased with it. The lasagna was good ash huge, easily could be split into two meals.   I highly recommend visiting on your trip to Vegas or a fun dinner if you are a local. I'll be back for sure on my next trip to Vegas.  I'm looking forward to trying a few other things in the menu.

3kz7nbgRIFW4vqCS1udVSQ.text: Service was terrific. Pasta was ok. Meatballs were good. Overall a good place to go. Wasn't the best Italian food we've had, but it was a good night out.

rVoasMOtN8RBgFglQHS5EA.text: This is a fun and tasty place to go for yummy, homemade Italian food in a speak easy, "mob" setting with a live lounge singer, singing Sinatra (not sure if he sang others' songs because I was too busy blabbing and eating)!  The service was friendly and efficient. So, 5 stars for the whole experience. It's refreshing to do something different. We live in CA. and this seemed more like a place locals frequent than Strip tourists. The prices are more reasonable than Strip prices as well.   BEGINNINGS: I recommend Fried Ravioli as a great appetizer choice - love the pink sauce. (I did not try their famous meatballs). Heck, I would probably make the fried ravioli my main course next time by ordering two and get the (very good) dinner salad with the creamy garlic dressing for sure to start. We also gobbled up the delicious garlic cheese bread - it also came with that delectable pink sauce for dipping. Probably could have had a tad more garlic on the garlic bread but it was still soooo good!    MAIN COURSES: I did enjoy the Chicken Lucchese (sp?) as my main course. My husband thoroughly enjoyed the Chicken Marsala and my friend said the Linguini and Clams was perfect.   SIDE: The garlic mashed potatoes were not so good to me... the skins are left on and I found them to be pasty/starchy, so probably best to skip those if that doesn't sound good to you.   DESSERT: Last comment is about their cheesecake. Have to say I've had much better. Should have ordered Tiramisu.   YES: At any rate, can't wait to eat here again when we come back to Vegas!!!!! You should definitely check this place out!

-_ZWA4QxkFoP3bF7hPAsXg.text: One of The best places I ever been to, the food is tasty, excellent service I really recommend it and I will come back again

CggiG2jJ45DBvTWcUaOwGA.text: Absolutely great restaurant!!!.  I will say this if your a serious person lighten up and enjoy life before you walk in.  Probably the most unique entrance to a resturant I've been too. Service was top notch and very personable!!! They were very helpful with multiple tables in making choices in what to eat. If your looking for a popular dish to pick unfortunately your in for a long meal because there are several popular dishes even some that are not on the menu!! Tip is have an idea of what your hungry for and tell the staff so they can best guide you.  The Sugo is as good as I have ever had in the resturant setting. They spend the time to crank out an original old world Italian family recipe sauce.  We shared the meatball and peppers app. The appetizer comes with 2 huge perfectly flavored meatballs and some green peppers in the Sugo.  Be sure and have extra bread here that sauce is amazing. The big doms Primavera was delicious too and huge portion on the lunch menu. Will be back to enjoy the dinner with live lounge singer experience and more Sugo!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso to finish a great meal!!!!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Doms Primavera

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ma&#39;s Meat Balls and Peppers appetizer justice. They are bigger than a baseball and delicious.  That pic is making my mouth water again!!!

gBxlUva3nKod38O7XGxznA.text: Absolutely amazing service and friendly people!! Speakeasy feel and romantic appeal is unmatched!! Food is absolutely off the hook and to die for, thank you Capos for the amazing vacation dining experience!!

uYvMhred7TdgfaBRg3rtSA.text: We arrived without a reservation at this popular spot, yet were treated with respect and given a booth at the front of the restaurant across from the kitchen. It wasn't the best seat in the house, but we were appreciative in that we had traveled quite a ways to eat here. The dark, speak easy atmosphere was fun and the wait staff was attentive and pleasant. We ordered the chicken Marsala and a huge meatball with a side of spaghetti. We paid $10 to split the Marsala dish, but it really wasn't large enough to split. In retrospect, I would have opted to have the meatball and pasta as my dish, and given the Marsala dish to my date, which is what happened anyway. The bread and salad arrived quickly. Both were good. The bread had a pleasant garlic flavor. We waited quite a bit for our entries. The spaghetti and meatball were hot, just the way I like my food to arrive. The Chicken Marsala dish was flavorful with plenty of delicious sauce with deep wine flavors and an abundance of mushrooms. It also was lukewarm, which was a disappointment. The menu was quite extensive. We want to return to try the lasagna which received great reviews and the Chicken Parmigiana which is said to be very generous in portions. It was an overall great experience. I would recommend reservations even on at 5:00 pm on a Wednesday evening.

88SBcsBNnwDGupF0b4myfQ.text: WOW!  This place is bad a**!  From the entrance greet, to the crooner serenading the patrons, this place speaks to me as authentic Italian.  The food, ambiance, menu, and service are all first class.  I find the pricing extremely fair too.  I had the caesar salad, cheese ravioli, and tiramisu.  All were excellent, and as good as anywhere I have been.  Please check out Capo's, you will be thrilled you did.

1uSx11_CduvOzEiSZYv2yg.text: Fun little joint to come for good entertainment and great food. Customer service is so polite and sweet. The decor is a fun little mobster restaurant,drinks are really amazing as well and food is just real Italian good food. The way to get in is fun too love it!

4K9EUIHD2DEM9oXm4ODVWA.text: I will never come back here again. After eating here my wife and I got sick that same night with food poisoning. The so called famous half pound meatball must only be famous for showing back up again in your toilet after throwing up.

Y3B0j_GfjP2GSvSPUb1C0Q.text: This place is about the funniest cute place amazing really good food it's a mob feel but amazing bar super perfect for date nite they have a cute surprise at the door mob style staff is super nice and it's a very dark but fun place love it can wait to go back.

-vv3FBiA0YCP4BwwHr49ZQ.text: Love this place! It was recommended from our hotel staff at the Hilton Alara, and boy were we not disappointed! My boyfriend and I love trying new places to eat and when in Vegas we try to get off the strip if possible and try more local cuisine. We heard rumors about this place being sort of a hidden entrance and that's exactly right. I won't spoil anything but you will be blown away just by how they answer the door! We were not aware it was reservations only, however the greeter asked if we would like to sit at the bar and sat us right away. The bar was VERY roomy with great big chairs and an awesome view of the kitchen! I actually would prefer to sit there in the future.   The atmosphere was great! Very dim romantic lighting and live music (which wasn't too loud) very Frank Sanatra like, very good ambiance and a nice swanky feel. They have the leather tufted booths with candle light. The menu wasn't too overwhelming and offered your basic Italian favorites. The salad was very good and of course the bread was on point as I am always a sucker for good bread.  My boyfriend and I split the fettuccine pesto with chicken and broccoli and it was SOOO stinking good! The only thing I didn't like was they charge a $8 splitting fee because you get another salad, I would have preferred to just go without the salad next time, but none the less it was totally worth every penny! Definitely a great date night place

L9Essyfw_SaHI1ZqrJDlcA.text: Very fun atmosphere, very good food.  appetizer and drink prices are ludicrous but if you stick to the basic lunch or dinner menu it is really worth it and enjoyable.  make reservations for dinner, seemed to fill up fast by 7:30pm

maXPrUq0q7umP7cSe3Qb8Q.text: I'll keep it short and sweet.. This place might be my all time favorite, from the "secret" entry to the dimly lit, classic decor.. To the delicious and fresh food.. It's all just perfect, a step back in time. Come in the evenings when the excellent lounge singer is performing for the full experience! My only minor complaint is that their specialty drinks are WAY too sweet, I'm not sure if that's how they do it in Italy but now I just have a beer and all is well.. See Ya next time!

xHeKJsaNBQ8l8VndI1POhA.text: The hidden entry was cool.  Local friends turned us into this out of the way Restaurant and Speakeasy. The meatball appetizer and Chicken Marsala were perfect. Great drinks and reasonable prices. We had a party of 13 and everyone raved about the food.

qAihqW24ZxC7Pm1FL5MLlA.text: What a great Italian restaurant I have to eat there every time I'm in Vegas food is great the price is great just an overall wonderful dining experience and sauces are wonderful pasta and bean soup is the best.

oE92iNBbmEL9GEGDnKQccg.text: Absolutely fantastic in every way!! Came here with my girl friends straight after work on a Saturday evening very close to closing time. The staff was so accommodating, fun and welcoming even given our late dining time. Our server, Fran, was the best! Great personality and handled our wild table with ease. The food was delicious--we each got a variation of the classic pasta dish... I'd eat it every day. We also enjoyed several glasses of Pinot Noir and several loaves of bread... So good! Also, the ambiance was beautiful--loved the lighting and the chandeliers at each table. I can't wait to go back.

3Ddwknv3MBm4Cr-cSpGUiQ.text: Great concept and great food!! Being an Italian Mafia movie and book enthusiast, this restaurant was a must stop when in Vegas this past weekend. I was like a kid in a candy store with the ambiance, photos of real and fictional mobsters, perfect dim lighting, and live music. Oh, and to top it all off, the food was great (I had the chicken parm)! My wife and I were promptly greeted and seated at our reservation time. We got The Godfather themed dining area and they were even playing the godfather movie. The only reason I can't give 5 stars is because this seating area was right next to the kitchen, with only a cloth separation, and we could hear the staff talking and joking the entire dinner. It was a little distracting at first but once the music started, the chatter kind of got drowned out. Will definitely come back again next time we're in Vegas, but will request a different seating area. Highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mob boss dining!

P1E_1DN2ksF9BfbrvBwfEg.text: I went here with friends on the recommendation of a friend who lives in Las Vegas. It is set up as speakeasy and it's a fun experience. I won't go into all the details and spoil the experience, but it was a fun time. Beware that it is very dark inside the restauant, so if it is daylight when you go in, it will take a bit to adjust.   Our server was pretty attentive. I had the eggplant parmesan with steamed  veggies and it was very good. Everyone at my table was happy with their meal.   Overall good experience and I would recommend checking it out.

aQ4_ZuthHKxaH0TUS1YZOA.text: The best italian food I've had in a long time. Service was excellent. great ambiance and  fantastic live entertainment with Bobby! He croons just like Sinatra. Wife and i shared a wonderful evening with friends and could not have picked a better place! Loved everything about Capos! Would highly recommend to anyone! 5+stars in my book! Will definitely be back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect night out at a fantastic restaurant will great live entertainment!

nDz3kva1zCv6ui6-RpC6yA.text: Went for lunch. Pleasantly surprised. Some damn good classic Italiano. Caveat: had a 15 for 30$ coupon. Carbonara was damn creamy. Meatballs were damn meaty. Santucci pasta was damn spaghetti. Theme is heavy speakeasy and you'll need a password to get in. They'll still let you in if you don't know the password, because... Money. Will be back again for drinks! Nico's Caesar salad is damn good   Come here if you want: classic Italian, good service, a little fun Do not come here if: you like bright spaces, you want gluten free yoga goat feed, you want something light.

AmqAz7qaadYO57qTtC4Qng.text: The atmosphere was unique and the food was very good.  The meatball and sausage apps were excellent and my wife enjoyed the NY strip.  We were a little disappointed that the lasagne was not available for lunch, nor was the garlic mashed potatoes.  Service was good, no issues there, Tony was a great waiter.  Only issue I have is that it was a bit pricey for pasta, but I guess you pay for the ambiance.  Overall: very nice experience.

-CQRRYJ0ehj_6d_d9pEJrg.text: Hands down best Carbonara on the planet. Capo's is full of atmosphere and amazing food. Excellent!!

ihiUSVRL5P5O_Ej4yFEs9w.text: Excellent atmosphere and service. Food is mediocre. You want to love this place because of its old school Italian setting, but the food is really underwhelming. If you are not picky about your pasta then this is a place to try.

mw3q_Qml_uwGFBPS3bLMTA.text: The ambiance is like a speakeasy and they usually have a live band/singer (at least when I've gone). The meatballs are probably the best I've ever tasted. I love their pasta with more meatballs! I would highly suggest making a reservation and it helps to make it even a day or so in advance especially if it's a weekend and something is going on in Vegas.

5NE62vr_C4E-EjiBsQWBqA.text: Capo's was such a huge disappointment.  I made reservations, a week in advance.  When I made them, I requested a table near the entertainment.  I asked the person that took my reservation, if I had made the reservation enough in advance to accommodate this.  She said, oh yes, of course.  I will make sure you don't get moved.  When we got there for dinner the night of the reservation, we ended up at a table in the back next to the kitchen, no where near the entertainment and constant distractions from the kitchen and the back door where the employees where going to smoke.  When the appetizers came, the waiter forgot one of the two we ordered.  He finally came back after our salad was served.  Blaming the kitchen for forgetting instead of himself....  I thought the food was going to be amazing because of all the reviews, but to me, the food was over priced and mediocre in flavor and presentation.  As a matter of fact, my veal parmigiana was over cooked.  So disappointing...

cVmWzHO7iQuZvuc-aGG9zQ.text: What a cool place! Service and food were great. So glad we found this place, we never usually venture far from downtown but glad we did. New favorite Italian place. We had the cheese bread to start, pretty good, came with dipping sauce. I actually just told them what I wanted, a cheese ravioli with a cream pesto sauce and they did it, amazing. Pesto was so good. Husband order the Spagetti and meatball. Very good, sauce wasn't to tangy, meat was perfect, made with just a little sausage but not to much. Well done Everyone!

bPfLjxFvZ-2wJ0jUalkv7g.text: This place is amazing. I took my mom for lunch and we had great food and the staff was wonderful. Can't wait to go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Joey Burger was cooked perfect
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fa Mob Meatball Melt was to die for

BQMQkIdWLI3vq7OUqMEv2Q.text: Traveled to Vegas for 24 hours of fun and great food! A local recommended this restaurant and I will forever be thankful!   The whole experience was exciting and really surprising! Meatballs meatballs meatballs...to die for! The appetizer cheesy bread was comforting and full of flavor with just the perfect texture! The soup was hearty and made to perfection.  Rigatoni with a meatball and lasagna were incomparable and surprisingly delicious.  Service was just right. Music and entertainment good. I wish I could give this restaurant more than five stars it was so great. This is how Italian food should be done!!!!

YDFBg0n-us8jDsN79YI1Dw.text: Called to make a reservation and the asshole who answered my call abruptly hung up on me. Funny thing is the dumb bastard knew it was me calling again and never picked up the phone. This establishment should stop hiring bricks and hire people actually who care about this restaurant.

9NjFZzYS8QdrKL5dGlRFmg.text: One of the BEST Italian restaurants in Vegas, if not the best! Capo's is an old school mafia style restaurant less than 10 minute drive from the strip. I won't spoil the entrance to this place but it is a speakeasy! The restaurant has a dark ambiance that feels like you are eating with The Godfather but it is not gimmicky. They have a lounge singer which is a nice touch and he is not too in your face either. I cannot express how good the food was. I had the tortellini special with added meatball. Best pasta sauce I ever had! Service was great and everything else fantastic. I have been to all the great Italian restaurants on the strip... Scarpetta, Il Mulino, Rao's, etc and Capo's is better than all of them!

j_n1YpJEXQKBDRtBmH27Vg.text: Great Happy Hour Delicious food and awesome ambience.. the Sinatra singer can croon! Enjoyable time looking forward to next time...

if92U2Fy95sU2f63tcP9Gw.text: What an awesome dining experience! My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary and had a truly wonderful evening.  The decor is so classic Italian and mafia-esque which my boyfriend just adores. The Frank Sinatra cover singer was very talented and made for easy listening. The dark, intimate booths are very romantic and give off an old Italian vibe.   The food was very delicious and reasonably priced.   We cannot wait to return!

SAv73_0KLlCC0D4hPI3NlQ.text: Recommendations come highly for Capo's Italian, and I was definitely intrigued.  How can one not be when you hear about their mysterious greeting?  The BF (now the Big F) and I walked in without reservations on a Sunday evening.  For our party of two, we got to sit on stage.  For future reference, there are very cool romantic booths also available.  We went straight for their "Made-Man Pastas."  The Big F chose "Capo's Lasagna" for $18.50.  It's "lasagna pasta layered with Italian sausage, crushed meatballs, ricotta cheese and fresh herbs topped with Capo's special sugo and cheeses."  He also added a Homemade Italian Meatball for $6.  (Although it does say 'meatballs' on the menu, it's really one big meatball.)  I chose the "Tortellini Trafficante" for $18.50, "pasta rings stuffed with cheese served with proscuitto, peas and mushrooms in our creamy alfredo sauce."  I also paid $4 for the added Italian Sausage.  Both dinners are served with bread, butter, and a choice of Pasta Faggioli, Tony's Duck Soup, or their House Salad.  We both chose "Tony's Duck Soup" because the name sounded crazy enough.  They describe it as "Italian egg drop soup with garlic, spinach, and a touch of crushed red pepper."  The soup was simple, but a bit too salty for my tastes.  Although the Big F enjoyed his lasagna, he thought it could be better.  He did finish it all up though.  My tortellini dish was good with its creamy sauce, but definitely very heavy.  (I had leftovers.)  The added Italian sausage wasn't particularly a favorite of mine either, perhaps my tastes aren't refined enough.  As a result, we never made it to dessert.  With names like "Ma Barker's Cobbler," "Leo's Lips Lava Cake," and "Dillinger's Chocolate Covered Cannoli's," you're saddened you missed out.   For the ambiance, I'll give it a solid five stars.  The restaurant really does make you feel like you're part of this secret society.  It would be great for groups or a dinner for two.    In terms of food, I'd give it a 3.    Overall, a four star rating.  (Pics of our dinner are posted!)  Apparently they also have a happy hour from 5 to 7 pm!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tortellini Trafficante with Italian Sausage
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Capo&#39;s Lasagna with a Homemade Italian Meatball
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tony Duck&#39;s Italian Egg Drop Soup

Ze0p8gvTf3E3vPodeMHfug.text: Came in for lunch.  It was Tuesday.  Staff was busy prepping for tonight 2 for 1 special so the place was not busy, but staff was.  Fine, that was explained to me.  I expected a lunch menu pricing.  NOPE! Fugettaboutit! Nothing less than $8.95 for a burger.   I paid $10.95 for what was supposed to be meat/sausage lasagna and I expected a fairly good portion.  What I got was a small square 3x3 in of cheezy layers of noodles swimming in sauce. Very little meat, NO bread, no garlic knots... nothing.   I ordered take out, but really I felt it was way over priced for what I got.  Should have been offered bread to sop up the sauce and to stretch out the meal, cuz I sure didn't get enough food.   Won't be going back!

lqSqarulZby3LtXIrr_yHw.text: MUST READ ! MUST READ ! MUST READ!   This is my first time to sit down and write a review about anything but after tonight I can't keep quiet.  I've been going to Capos for years to starting with there first location on Tropicana. I must say the food is always great. I've celebrated birthdays, anniversary's, New Years eve and just for the hell of it lets go to Capos. But, tonight was the worst experience I had.  First we get greeted by the rudest man at the door he has no smile, no warmth, you can tell he was flustered. We're sitting with another couple waiting for a table. He calls both of us up and seats us in this "private room" next to each other. With no menus. And the room had to be hitting 85 degrees and humidity 120. After sitting for about 5 some one dropped off menus. The place is so dark you need a little flash light to read the menu MINE DIDNT work. I had to ask about the Chefs Specials for the night.  I get up and ask what i think is a host slash manager slash mater'd to either A. turn the air down in that room or B. Move us to the main dinning room where you can tell it's much cooler by like 10 degrees. He intel responds in his rude italian over worked voice "thats gonna be 20 minutes or so". I go back to my table start fanning my self and just waiting for an open table. He comes up to our table and says "you can eat at the  bar if you want". I told him i didn't make a reservation to sit at the "bar". He responds with "what do you want me to do then"? With his face in my face and body language like he wanted to pounce on me. I just tell him "TO FIX THE PROBLEM" either fix the air or move me. He storms off.  By this time one or our appetizers hits our table. So we start eating the waitress comes up to us with our second appetizer and says your other table is ready. Im like great picked up my glass and bottled water and followed her leaving our first appetizer at the original table. We get sat in a booth in the main dinning room. First relief because its much cooler. Then we realize the table had not been wiped from the  previous guest ( which by this point that did not bug me at all). The buss boy sees that and wiped the table for us and apologizes.  Well wed like to eat our salads that were dropped off with our second appetizer but we have no utensils. We tell our server that our calamari is on the table still she respond "i thought you where done with that"? I had about 4 bites. So she goes back im thinking shes retrieving our appetizer or re firing a new one. Finally we get our silver ware by the bus boy and no bread.  We ask her wheres our calamari she says " you ate most of it" so by this point now shes being rude and defensive. So i tell her " am i S.O.L on my calamari? She responds with well i can have them make a half batch because you ate half. I looked at her and i almost wanted to just over turn my table in that restaurant.  Im like i want my check im OUT OF HERE...... She gets her manager slash host slash mater'd. And hes like why are they leaving ? i did everything they wanted. He tells her to fire a calamari. By this point its to late I let him have it. Im so disgusted by the customer service theres no way to fix the situation. I told him ive been in the hospitality industry for 12 years and thats not the way you handle a situation. His last words to me where "Wheres your restaurant ill go eat there".....  I HAVE NEVER EVER SEEN SUCH DISGUSTING, VILE, HOSTILE PLACE IN MY LIFE. I dont have a restaurant THANK GOD! But let me tell you this i never made a customer that mad that he stormed out of the restaurant i was managing. Im posting this on YELP, and on my Facebook that has over 500 friends, family, and clients.   And let me tell you this i see my clients daily and we do is talk about Las Vegas food, shows, restaurants, As god as my witness i will bad mouth you and tell everyone i ever meet about this experience. When i have friends come to Vegas this is one Restaurant that i will not be taking them to.   So keep up the great work and the great customer service. Maybe thats why your first original location closed, and thats why you have 2 for 1 on Tuesdays and you are on groupon every other day. Bigger better restaurants have closed there doors you can too..............  With out us THE CUSTOMERS REMEMBER YOU ARE NOTHING !!!!!!!!  I HOPE YOU THE WORST I HOPE YOU CLOSE AND I HOPE YOU NEVER GET ANOTHER JOB IN LAS VEGAS.........  DISGUSTING ! DISGUSTING ! DISGUSTING !

LZxlUkNZ--dlDMw4oYDj5Q.text: I had a girls weekend in Vegas!! After Capo's being highly recommended by a friend of mine, we made reservations! Although we saw more bad reviews than good here on yelp, we still decided to take a chance!   I really enjoyed how you're checked in! Classic! The dark atmosphere was awesome! Everyone who came to our table to either take our order, take a picture, or bring us our drinks, were very kind.   Our food was awesome! Everyone of us (there were 5 of us) really liked our food. Our food was perfect temperature and we didn't have to wait long for it either!!   We'll definitely be back there soon!!!

QwBfmZMHpQNp_h_QCp4J_A.text: The food was so delicious!  The atmosphere was  and entertaining!  The service was excellent! I plan on going back over and over again!

xlcVAeVWKA9d8W0oH57T-g.text: For the 3rd or 4th year in a row, we have hosted a large dinner party in one their side rooms and loved our experience. A local friend of mine introduced this place to me. The food is classic Italian home style cooking. The wine list has a good selection at very reasonable prices. Love the rat pack music by the old school singer. If you want to get away from the Strip and enjoy a very good meal in an relaxing and fun environment, this is a great choice.

Gjg80ntqrBnA1L0awQdumA.text: Love this place!!!  the atmosphere is the best, and the food is great!!  I cant wait to celebrate my 30th birthday there on April 10 @ the Sahara location =)

8st7eGvmc_g-VnqIdeXVjA.text: On vacation in Vegas and heard about this place. The food is really good. I would make a reservation.

bj-DbDFXPY0_lZY_V8HkxQ.text: Visited Capo's on Sahara for dinner last Friday. We were seated toward the front where the bar area is, which was disappointing as I wanted the more formal, romantic atmosphere of the dining room. So I know in the future to request a dining room table.  We ordered the antipasto appetizer, but it arrived without cheese. HUH?! How does one NOT put cheese on an antipasto? Isn't that like Italian Cooking 101? The meats, lettuce and balsamic dressing were wonderful, but it needed the cheese for balance. After what seemed to be a communication issue with our server, to where he actually told me that the dish does not come with cheese ... I then showed him the description on the menu which clearly stated "meats AND cheeses".  Only then did he seem to get it, apologize, and offer to get us another. We both had the Pasta Fagioli soup and enjoyed it very much along with the yummy bread basket.  I enjoyed Uncle Pauly's Arrabiata Rigatoni with spicey garlic sauce. I also ordered a meatball (really good), which was initially forgotten and no doubt was off cavorting somewhere with my lost antipasto cheeses.  But our waiter fetched me a meatball and I was happy. My date enjoyed his cheesey mushroom ravioli dish, although it seemed a little overcooked and pasty to my taste.  The Tiramisu was delicious with an after-dinner espresso to kick my energy level back up to pre-pasta levels.  All in all, Capo's is a different kind of dining experience and their food is good, but I was not wow'd.  Would probably return, but not in any hurry to do so, and must remember to request the dining room next time.

-J2BTiT-QKPEKN1Ecx6Wyg.text: We have been to Capo's many times..today was the first time for lunch... still a wonderful meal.. we will be back.. lots of specials .. and as a local we love that !!

jQ_0SOKdemXnoDZ-bXQiBw.text: Thank you, fellow Yelpers, for the awesome recommendation.  Capo's was a great experience.  I love the old mafia movie feel.  I agree with other Yelpers that the food is okay but the atmosphere is what really makes it a special experience.  I had the duck soup and the angel hair pasta pomodoro.  I don't think there was any duck in the soup but it was tasty.  The singer was great.  He sounded a lot like Frank Sinatra - at least to a non-expert like me.  My boyfriend and I didn't rent a car so we took the bus and it took quite awhile to get to Capo's.  So, if you decide to take the Deuce down and then catch another bus, keep in mind it's pretty far west from the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Capo&#39;s Italian Cuisine

YZtPmp1ZieQDWwGcWMR-PQ.text: Capos- a bunch of wise guys:(  online site says happy hour 5-7 got there and ordered 6:05 $17 for a bud and a glass of red, told happy hour ends at 6:00. Made reservations a week in advanced and requested a Dining room booth- we were the only couple seated in bar. Had to watch 5 parties of 2 arrive long after us seated in dining area. We wanted to enjoy music and atmosphere but instead had a disappointing dining experience. Sign outside says Tuesday 2 for 1 but be aware it's only for locals. Our server and bus person were the highlights of Capos. our first experience a year ago left a bad taste in our mouths but gave it another chance since we live near by but Capos get outta here! Never again.

IsjdCRSmNPlEjvQdUd2_ZQ.text: Just the experience and service is amazing! Oh, and the food is great too! It has everything one would expect from an italian restaurant and yet, it's more than that!

nlGFNlI2x22Ii0_Cg1Kvxg.text: Worst Italian food ever! Ive never ate somewhere where the service and food were   equally bad. The manager was unprofessional and was trying to charge us twice as much. They also tried to charge us gratuity which was written with a pen and is illegal in the state of Nevada! They told us all the drinks we got at the bar were free and once we were moved to our table they charged us for all the drinks! I would never recommend this place to anyone that i know or that I don't. Never again will i eat here. Screw this place!

uLK1EGG_tpY4bf6w4uJ5KA.text: Fantastic. Old Vegas style dark  speakeasy, live singer doing Sinatra era songs, mob memorabilia everywhere, had basic spaghetti and a meatball. Yep one meatball but it's the size of a softball.  Food, ambiance, music, and wait staff were great. Aside from the singer, they had a magician walking around performing small tricks at the tables. He was entertaining and funny.  I highly recommend this restaurant for tourists and locals alike. Reservations a plus.

SkLya0Q_Kq5GF2aMYf3tmg.text: Not what we expected. No magician, food and service mediocre, and hard to hear music in secluded room! Word of advice cater to guests that are there and not people you are hoping to come.

G_sElAplP-atUt5-6RLvqg.text: Pretty cool set up. We loved the ambiance of this restaurant. Ordered lasagna and shrimp scampi and both were pretty good.

EQIRWGCurK5zyD7Sva10aA.text: Came here after seeing them on Mystery Diners. This place is a great experience and far exceeded my expectations. I came here with my husband on a Group On deal for lunch. Customer service was on point and food was good as well. I love the black and red decor. We had the caesar salad, lasagna and meatballs. Food tasted great and homemade

oDN6q2us4jmo8bo7W11sMA.text: This restaurant is so over rated. came here for my birthday the other night Friday night. first of all the guy that lets you and had no sarcasm at all. and when we got inside the restaurant it was very hot they want to save money on air conditioning. then they had no veal parmigiana. I came here especially for the veal parmigiana. let's get started on the food I ordered linguine and clams with red sauce. well the clams was so like rubber I had to chew each claim for 10 minutes and still ending up swallowing the whole claM that's how rubber way they were. then I also ordered shrimp scampi and I had them put prosciutto and sundried tomatoes which I seen was already in another dish but do not like the garlic cream sauce and fettuccine I wanted angel hair with the shrimp scampi sauce so that's why I added to the sun dried tomatoes and prosciutto witch cost extra actual which I had no idea it was going to cost extra since it was already on the menu but anyways the prosciutto was actually deli ham it was not prosciutto at all. but other than that the shrimp scampi was the only good thing oh almost forgot the appetizers we ordered the calamari which was also rubber very very very bad rubber and undercooked and the breading did not stay on as soon as you pick it up the breading will fall off and it was rubber and just terrible. we also got the fried mushrooms they were out of a can they were not fresh mushrooms They from a can. also got their famous meatball I did not see anything famous about it just an ordinary meatball. ask for the service I had a very bad waitress don't know her name kept giving me attitude and Service was just not what I expected very bad and did not feel welcome at all I was actually afraid for her to take a picture of me for my birthday. I seen the other waiters they have personality joking laughing suggesting menu items mine did not do any of that. as for entertainment it wasn't the regular guy in the other reviews that sings Frank Sinatra Dean Martin it was some other guy that sang like Billie Joe or things like that and mostly played piano maybe for like 2 songs and then the rest was just recording music radio. restaurant is super small and stuffy I thought it would have been a bigger nicer restaurants.so that was it they messed up my birthday had the worst birthday ever not what I expected from other reviews foods with nothing great actually pretty bad service was pretty bad also the only thing that was nice with the decorations and old mafia pictures inside the restaurant and on the building that was it not too sure if I'll come back .there's also no magic man doing tricks I did see him going to table but he did not come to ours

P7Cc9ar6DQWFKSi4dZi8Sw.text: Capos is an interesting experience. First, the entrance will set the mood, but you'll get no spoilers from me. And yes, it is as creepy as the strip mall the restaurant is located in.  We came in at about 5:30 on a Sunday and the place was pretty quiet, but we were told that there were no tables available, only spaces at the bar. No problem, we took the bar. The bartender/waitress was extremely attentive and pleasant and honestly, she was probably the high point of the experience - she was awesome.   The food is good but I have had better. We both ordered chicken parmigiana, and it was exactly what you want when looking for chicken parmigiana but priced higher. You can select your side dish from a few pre-set choices - I went safe for the spagetti on the side which was yummy, my boyfriend ordered mashed potatoes on the side (which, of course, I sampled - those were also good).   The prices are a little steep for sitting at the bar and what you get, but the vibe is cool - very old school Mob. Note the chalk outline on the floor as you walk out.

ChXDgcMOXHMrGD8djRO_Lg.text: I'm a schmuck for anything Old Vegas or mob related so obviously this was on my must visit list since moving here.  The atmosphere is great. The side door entrance and questioning through the peephole started it off right. The wooden floors, red plush vinyl booths, damask velvet wallpaper and chandeliers were all great.  The entertainment (Frank Sinatra crooner) was a nice touch. It was only slightly awkward when he came up to the table and made direct eye contact causing me to stop my conversation mid-sentence to act like I was swooning.  The food was good but not anything to write home about. Kinda standard fare for higher than standard prices. If you tell yourself you're coming for the experience and entertainment then you can convince yourself the prices are alright. If you're visiting in town you probably budgeted for paying too much for everything anyway. If you're local... come for the 2 for one entree deal they have on Tuesdays.  *If you want a nice booth near the entertainment you must request it when you make your reservation.

cmqmXt8S_J_hyWUUQr_ApQ.text: Worst manager I have ever encountered in my life! Manager was so rude! It would have been a great dining experience until the manager showed up and kicked us out for having a service dog. And it was not a big deal but she did it in a very rudely way. She screamed at us while she was on the phone and came back when she got done with her call and screamed some more. She violated my neighbor's rights for having a service dog. All the waiters and waitresses are very nice but I don't know what happened and how the heck this unprofessional, very rude person become a manager! I hope the owner sees this and make the actual great workers there the manager. She just showed how she doesn't deserve to be in that position. Then we spoke to the owner at a later time and pretty much didn't care. Would never recommend this place, definitely would not support a company like that. It's not like their food tasted fantastic. So sad for this place, we like going to tiny local restaurants but it's sad to see a company who doesn't care about their customers.

VPSL7Ivi1uR6hBIy1DT7JA.text: We had a blast at this place. The food for the decor. It's a dark and seedy looking old joint. I loved it. The food was very good. I would gladly go here again if I'm in Vegas again. If you're looking for an excellent dining experience, get off the strip and this place in in Vegas the down, not the tourist parts. Go and have fun. Enjoy the experience and for god sake dress up!

OBDjjISqGcdJTaTD0mUmHw.text: I wrote a huge review and Yelp ate it because I wasn't logged in!  Thanks so much to the lovely reservation taker for getting my party of 4 in before we headed to the strip to see Barbara! While we were in a bit of a hurry our dinner didn't feel rushed at all, the reservation lady had communicated to our waiter our situation in advance.   Service was nicely timed, Caesar salad was delicious. My penne with vodka sauce and shrimp was overpriced at $30. 4 nicely sized and perfectly cooked shrimp, still only 4. But delicious. Be aware that they cook the pasta al dente. I prefer mine more cooked, so my bad for not requesting it that way. Vodka sauce was so good I wanted to lick the plate! My niece has declared Capo's her new favorite Italian restaurant after having the clams with red sauce...a generous portion of clams, too. One of our gals had stuffed mushrooms as her entree and the portion was satisfying as well as delicious.  Singer's volume was a bit loud for our older ears, but a lovely voice and great music selection.  Thanks, Capo's, for a very nice and delicious dinner.

AVNFXodK-OgTAXGU03dT6g.text: I like it for drinks at the bar and hanging with girlfriends. I think I expected better food and more friendly service. I think the first question should always be have you ever dined with us before and may I make some suggestions that we are famous for. The wine list is also weak I could find any of those reds at Smiths. Maybe I just don't fit in with the regulars but I expected more!

Zh7z2QAfn-X8FxZNr9RJ9Q.text: My fiance and I were planning a fake gangster vegas wedding. I wore a flapper dress with homemade feather headdress, fiance wore pinstripe suit with fedora, my sister-in-law wore pinstripe suit with fedora. We were dressed to a T and ready for a gangster dinner before the big fake night.  We walked up and the building had that aura of gangster, complete with pictures of famous gangsters. The door was set up like a speak easy. You stand there and someone slides open a peep hole and asked you what you want. Then the whole wall moves, they had a pay phone on the moving wall. We were not expecting that at all!  They had a cheesy magician who's fake thumb fell off onto our table... wah wah, lame.  The singer was amazing!!! Frank Sinatra all night! We were ordering a lot of drinks, a few varieties, and they were all great. Props to the bartender!!!  "Frank" kept hitting on me knowing we were on our way to get "married". He got a great tip. ;)  Now onto the food. Oh my!!!!! Cheese bread appetizer. We all ordered different entrees. Fiance: steak and spaghetti, sissy: chicken in white wine sauce and spaghetti, me: ravioli in Alfredo sauce. OHHHH to die for!!! The food was amazing!!!! And I'm a picky eater. Very particular. But all of it was so scrumptious. We were all three trying each other's and fawning over the food.  Three foodies who were super impressed!!! I can't rave more about this place. The price is high, don't expect a $20 meal. I think our bill including drinks (we had 3 lemon drops, 7 shots, a Cosmo, a Manhattan) was around $300? But it was definitely worth the money spent. Definitely worth it!!!

naQuqem4tYBmJ9sPg6QtLA.text: Love the ambience.. food is delicious... would it be for lunch or dinner I recommend this place. They have groupon deal for lunch and 2 for 1 for locals on tuesdays. Love it!

Wtv3VhBBKR7YGJKiY7VErQ.text: There are TWO "Capo's Italian Cuisine's" on yelp so I will copy what I wrote on the other page.  I would come here again just for the experience, not for the food.  This truly is a speak-easy, and most would not expect what happens when you enter the place which makes it fun.  The outside looks like it was once a Hooters, that's because it once was ha ha ha. But you can barely tell when you get inside.  It is very dark inside, very swanky. I loved it because it was romantic. I wish they had real candles on the table, but maybe that is a city ordinance or because it would make the restaurant hotter than it already was. The kitchen is open (hooters give away number 2) so I think  that is what heats up the place.   The menu's come with cute little flashlights so you can read in the dimly lit room, which i thought was a nice touch.  I ordered a pellegrino, I was expecting the bottle to be chilled but it wasn't. I didn't complain though.   Our waitress was a sweetheart and very attentive.    I ordered the Clams and Linguini in a White Sauce - I believe it is called "The gallows with clams" - It was alright, kind of soupy with no real flavor..nothing I would write home about.  My boyfriend ordered the "Sawed off sausage" but took it back. Not really any sauce and the sausage was just a little too spicy and he already had heartburn. He then ordered the "Al Capone Carbonara" - He said it lacked flavor, but once he added a little salt to it, he enjoyed it a bit more.   So dinner was "Meh" to say the least.  We ordered the "Cannoli" for dessert and that was fantastic! SOOOO delicious.  So like I said we would come back for the experience and the Cannoli.. but thats about it. A little too expensive for the quality of food you actually get.  Have fun!

LO1ycgfCWkg1IT5-gv1lJw.text: Love this restaurant.  We live in Phoenix but occasionally visit Las Vegas. We found the restaurant on yelp and we loved it so much the first time that the next visit here we brought our very good friends (locals) to enjoy the experience with  us!  Service is outstanding & friendly.  The food is to die for!  We will be back again!! Top Notch!!!

AzT2QU5puq5CBaXQS5qO8w.text: My friend is into mobsters so I suprised him with dinner At capo's. This place did not disappoint, food was exceptionally delicious, the duck soup and garlic bread are a must try. My waiters name was Brandon he was very pleasant as were all the waiters we came across. If your in Vegas this is a must try place to judge the restaurant  youself  ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiter Brandon help make the night special

zLUes1RbVHBeLS1QqUXQfQ.text: Been here several times and never disappointed. My personal favorite is the Riggitoni, but others rave about the lasagna and ravioli. Service is top notch. Attentive but not overly intrusive. Atmosphere is so interesting.  Evenings have a singer adding to the atmosphere. Not sure why, but have found mixed drinks at the bar end up a little lighter than when I've dined at tables. Overall love going here and use it as a nice dining surprise when I get out of town visitors.

PS1Qtf5ZYbz7zvj8VNyeIw.text: Our Uber driver recommended this place and it did not disappoint! What he neglected to mention is that you should definitely make a reservation. We did not, but luckily they were able to seat us at the bar. You enter and ring a bell and a sliding window opens and you get asked for a password (you can check out their website for the password). You then enter a dimly lit space decorated with mob memorabilia. There was also someone singing Sinatra and other Italian favorites. Now the food was absolutely amazing and definitely put this place over the top. I started with a salad with Italian dressing. It was good, nothing remarkable, but good. The ravioli was perfect, with a marinara sauce that wasn't over powering and just the right amount of seasoning. Then I opted for the triple chocolate mousse cake... So good! Light and just the right amount of chocolate (ie not sickeningly sweet or chocolaty). I will definitely return if I ever come back to Vegas.

9og5LHt3NhIOHiIdpSnvyQ.text: We LOVE this place so much that we go there every time we're in Vegas.  A True old-school Vegas experience.  The food is amazing, the service is friendly and it's nice to have a live lounge singer.  We could not have enjoyed our last visit more.  Prices are lower than what you would pay on the Strip for much better food and service.  Also, if you call ahead the restaurant can arrange transportation to and from your hotel at a super-reasonable rate (less than a regular taxi).  The driver we got was amazing, and gave us some great tips for our next visit (scheduled for March-2017).  Looking for old-school fun and great food?  This is the place!

MhNjjNm4_nHo9wIFQBzqVw.text: Another wonderful dinner. This time we came later and enjoyed the intertainment as well as table side magician!

nrU1rfvKo32JG5skfBJ69w.text: Fun experience and great food! Came last week with some colleagues and returned tonight with my wife. The crooner is amazing and sounds just like Sinatra! Had the shrimp scampi and churchmen parmigiana. Both were yummy! Large portions!

T2fd5dpt4-lMHDBQZFK8mA.text: Brought some family from NYC for dinner. Everyone enjoyed every aspect of the dining experience. Old world veal parm. A packed house with smiling faces, good music and great service. My kind of place

RYDmpKXr85ezkX2AdVPdWQ.text: Food's good, but you get the shaft if you don't have a reservation!!!!!!!!!!!! Sorry the foods not worth the terribly bad service!!!!!!!!!!

ba0uikv5wJlL4KqH8hqWXA.text: Love the ambiance, great food and wonderful staff... The live music makes it even more special.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lava Cake
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Santucci&#39;s Pasta&#34; with Meatball

X0ppdlHIpkYXNkftIR6Ojw.text: I come here at least once a month, and we always park it at the bar.  Gery and her team are the best, and the food is absolutely fantastic!  Do yourself a favor and try this place out, as it beats anything on the strip.

SfMUIpP06RTaMNz8rpAOFQ.text: Tasty cuisine. Our waiter was helpful in his recommendations. My only issue is that nobody knew anything about the Yelp checkin coupon. For travelers looking for quality food and a fun atmosphere, Capo's offers both and is worth cab fare from the Strip. Our tab was less than half that of dinner last night at a pricey Strip restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The entrance is hidden, requiring patrons to ring a door bell. Then you&#39;re greeted by the man peeking through the secret door.

tWK2jaimfSf8nKReA3GEwA.text: What a fantastic experience.  You get to the door and you are let in through a "hidden" door.  Our food was just delicious. The garlic dressing for the salad is a must.  All the flavor a were well balanced.  The sandwiches were phenomenon, especially with that side of au jour sauce.  We were truly impressed that we had to let the executive chef, Nef know.  He even offered to have us come back and sit at the bar so he can cook our meal personally in front of us.  He is a definite asset to the establishment.  The busboy also made our day by moving us to a larger table, as my family are big eater ("foodies")...to accommodate all the dishes.  You have to try this place if you are visiting.  We will take Nef on that offer next time we are in town. Keep up the great work.

u7RP0hq-HFfJ8Lu1Qhp1jg.text: I found this place on a business trip years ago and have been going ever since. This time had an opportunity to take the entire family and they loved it! Not what you would consider a traditionally great place for kids but my son, nephew and niece loved the whole hidden entry/password thing, and the lounge act and "mob bosses" were very nice and accommodating, and went the extra step to keep them entertained (please, be sure to grease a few palms). I have always found the food to be great and this time everyone in a pretty decent sized party loved what  they ordered and, amazingly, got their dishes all at the same time. That was the first time this entire trip that there wasn't some issue with at least one order. Our waiter was a great kid and worked hard, and even the guys who helps him out bringing water etc was fantastic! The price for a large party was not bad at all considering we had paid almost exactly the same the night before for basic bar food. You know you had a great meal when your back at home and the family is still talking about the food at Capo's!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the stuffed chicken and mushroom risotto ...every single dish we ordered was amazing and reasonably priced for what you get

XY5Gg_a3Wt54uT3ie6BpVA.text: The first impression is always the best impression.. (Saturday night reservation for 9pm)   1st the hostess.. he was rude.. we had a reservation for 4 people.. when you come in you have to knock on the door.. while my husband boss was still talking to him (hostess) thru the little window.. he closed it on him. Oookay and when he finally opened the door.. we followed him to the back of the restaurant.. instead of him walking us to the table..  he pointed to where our seats were and he walked back to the front..  Now the place was beautiful and the entertainment was greeeaattt.. I think we sat there for a while waiting on a server to pick our table up. We didnt even have a server assigned to us..  anyway we received our drinks super late.. I was served a dirty glass of coke.. I told the busser politely excuse me, my glass is dirty can i have another coke.. he said no problem took the glass to the bar sat it down.. i dont know if he realized it.. but.. he brung me back the same coke i told him to take away.. now i use to be a dishwasher for 4 years so I pay attention to things like this. So i just didnt touch my drink.. we ordered appetizers garlic bread with cheese and calamari.. our party was passing the the food around and when it got to me i was disappointed because where you grip the plate there was dirty food stuck to the bottom of the bowl brim so you can feel it.. our plates werent washed properly.. I was grossed OUT ready to leave.. we couldnt find our server.. she disappeared some where so we were just sitting there..  my asparagus soup was old.. it had a film on top from sitting so long and the middle was cold . You could tell our food sat in the window for a long time. My shrimp was stale (dried out) We ended up being the last party on the floor.. they were closing we had to ask a busser for our check because no one knew where our server was.  Then we see her walking thru the back door like everything was okay.  And this was by far the worst service we've had in a long time..  You need to FIRE THE HOSTESS AND THE SERVER AND RETRAIN THE BUSSER.  P.s my husband got sick

Cm8NO-Wm9Gf5nSjVYS8xjg.text: Wonderful food and the best service ever with Jeremy the superstar!!! The best eggplant parmigiana every.

zNRQplFOZ01fMNAXGV-mzQ.text: We went back with our son tonight for Father's Day dinner" We had been here on 6/4 and wanted to have another great meal. Shocked as to what the Hell happened" Our Waitress was awful we waited over 10 minutes for our water and never even were acknowledged when she did arrive she was chewing gum and talking" So Gross"  My husbands shot of Jack was dirty and had to be returned" we had to ask for bread" we basically had to ask a busboy for everything. Worst service" I am really disappointed this time when I used the bathroom the mouse trap was still in there and dirty and when I was telling my husband this he said there is still a plastic bag over the men's urinal with pee on it" I know restaurant are off and have bad nights" but cold chicken parm:( dirty and bad service... Hope this changes I must say I will not be back to see if it does. Food seemed to be pre made and heated something was not right tonight :(

tZ9hBoEuHwaj9VzJdH6rSA.text: My wife and I went on a Tuesday with two of our friends who are Vegas locals so at least we got the 2-for-1 deal.  Didn't like the darkness. I like to see what I am eating.  But maybe that was better,  because I didn't have to look at my chicken marsala that was drowned in what I think was a dark brown sauce the consistency of mud.  The mushroom risotto I got with it was bland and watery.  My wife got the chicken parm and left half of it on her plate.  The salads that came with the meal were tiny.   Guess you are paying for the speakeasy theme because the prices they charge are way too high for what they give you,  plus you are forced to order way overpriced drinks to get the 2-for -1 deal.  Would have rather they had better food. The only things keeping it from a one-star review were the cheesy garlic bread,  the interesting way you enter the joint and the nice waitress.

7UHqraUrQx68BfFm1kcdIA.text: I've lived in Vegas 17 yrs on and off.... Best veal I have had outside of NY!!!!! Fried ravioli was killer. My husband's lasagna was insanely good! Keeping it short and sweet. Make a reservation and come here. Perfection! Felt like home!

IVcUWgCiWUqYbeUuA4vq4Q.text: This place is absolutely the best. The meatballs, calamari, bruschetta, ravioli - you name it, everything we had was amazing. Live music and a fun atmosphere that feels like an old school club. I'll never come to Vegas and not arrange to eat here. Real Italian food!

Dq1OaznbmrXqbvGzm9nkag.text: Best pasta we've ever had. Plus amazing service and ambiance. The singer was super cheesey but still made sure we had a good time. Highly recommend a visit!!

4zNOCrQpe5cn8CtnjWTMwQ.text: Great place for date night!   Be sure you make reservations.   Food was excellent.  All the staff were friendly and played their mobster roles. Love how you have to get In!!

KbcI_clwgBMdTFsckPLP8w.text: Being Italian I feel I have the right to say,**BEWARE** this place was very cool.  The Frank Sinatra singer and the magician were incredible!  With that being said the food was lacking.  I ordered the Chicken piccata, and literal was served one half of a butteflied chicken breast?  When it was served I was going to ask if they were having a shortage of chicken that night?!?!  On occasion my husband and I will split a dessert, this night we each ordered our own, at $10. a pop.  My husband wanted his own because he also was  hungry.  Also another big deal for us was that they will not split checks.  If this is not enough, they also will only take 2 credit cards per check, and even written on the back of the menu.  This was a big issue for us since we were a party of 8, 4 couples.  So to recap it is a fun place, but don't go if you are starving, and don't go with a big party and or bring cash, oh and when splitting a bill people, please remember about TAX, everyone always conveniently forgets about the TAX.......

VOUoOLS6lIJv4e2kIwQrpQ.text: Food was goodish. Service was BAD!!!!!  I ordered a corona and it was served with a lemon?!  There were long delays between courses, asked for chicken with my pasta(didn't get it) but was still charged. I just paid for it because I didn't want to wait for the updated check.   Cool concept but really bad service.

0Cp-0WXuLd6ACqaMK80vXQ.text: What a cool place. It's like stepping back in time to get a glimpse of how Vegas used to be. Not only is the atmosphere great, but the  food was delicious too. I had the eggplant parmigiana, my husband had the scampi, and our kids had the chicken Marsala and pasta. So yummy... Our waiter, Bruce Fiore, was very attentive and really took care of us. Kevin Dicosta sang beautifully throughout the evening. He came to our booth, chatted with us, and really made us feel like family. My daughter loved that he sang her request and dedicated it to us. The whole feel was reminiscent to the Rat Pack.   This place is truly special. My family and I had such a great time and will definitely be back the next time we're in Las Vegas!

6N5ciOBqXuonL9VO4scncg.text: I just have to give Lon L. some love for his awesome suggestions and recommendations. I found this great steal for Capo's on restaurant.com, and decided that this is where I wanted to go. Looks can be very decieving, and you certainly can't judge a book by its cover. From the outside, it looked like some crazy run down saloon. I had to convince myself to go further into the restaurant hoping for more interior possas than the outter exterior. When I entered into the restaurant, I was trapped inside a fairly small room. A small computer printed sign directed us to ring the door bell, and rang the door bell is what we did! Up pops open this small peep hole where a gentleman asks if we had reservations. Replying, "yes" the phonebooth swings open! Just like the good old days when the prohibition laws were in effect, and the booze was sure to be marvelous. A mobster looking gentleman, all suited up, guides us through this really dark restaurant, but even the darkness couldn't hide the small awesome crystal chandeliers, vintage wallpaper, and plush seats! I really felt like I was smack dab in the middle of an episode of Boardwalk Empire! I ordered the clam linuini with white wine sauce, and my partner ordered the veal marsala with angel hair pasta. My pasta was delish! If you're looking for a less filling and very light pasta dish, this would be it! I never finish my pasta, but this time I was really sad that I walked away with no takeout. The sauce was perfect. It was very light and soft, with the taste of the clams lingering in the sauce! You know that they put LEGITIMATE clams in there if the clams were tossed on your plate with the shells still on. NO CANNED CLAMS HERE! I can't really vouch for the veal marsala, but from what I heard and smelled, it is pretty good. It smelled like it had a very strong tangy taste to it. I was almost to tears when I sat watching my partner eat that poor baby cow...HE DIDN'T EVEN MAKE IT TO COW UNIVERSITY YET! Have you no humanity friend!!!!!!!!! Well, to wash those sad sorrows for the baby cow away, we had the bread pudding with vanilla icing for dessert. The bread pudding is DEVINE! Super soft, filling, light sweetness, and very nutty! I felt like it was such a small portion, but being full I couldn't complain. Its such a wonderful dessert, but BEWARE! The portions are really small. Lastly, the staf was A+! The bussers kept taking out empty plates, filling cups, and making sure that they were accomodating. Ellie our server was very helpful with suggestions, and was really nice. Overall, it was a great birthday date! I had a great time, and my partner did too! It's a great date place, but be careful, depending on what the girl date maybe in to, this might make or break the date. But, I can say that men would have a great time here!
