BOF-jQKXR6eLNq3HDFfxGw.text: Love, love, love this restaurant! The food, ambience, singer, waitresses and manager (I can keep going) are top notch. Never had a bad night here. Enjoy, i know you will!!

K-Dvfx3-rrH64KFMxp5bKg.text: Overpriced and to be honest you're really just paying for the speakeasy experience..  Made rsvp for 745 got there 5 minutes early...last one to be seated had to go tp a waitor or manager for a table..everyone else who came in way after us got to be seated first. Yay. Awesome isnt? Got seated 30 minutes after the rsvp ppl who had 8 oclock rsvp got seated regardless ... talked to a manager and we got seated but with sarcasm..great way to start a birthday dinner isnt? Douche bag manageral service.. woot. We were informed we had to make a memo for the both. HELLO. WHATS THE POINT IF THERE WAS A SMALL TABLE ALREADY AVAILABLE? AND EVERYONE WHO RSVP AT 8PM GOT IN AHEAD OF US? Still stayed since we waited 30 minutes for the oh so pompus owner/manager not to sit us and just have us waiting like sitting ducks..atleast the staff are fine.  A bit bitter please excuse my critising for the night. I may or maybe not being harsh with this review but hey being a bit liquored up with messed up rsvp. I think im allowed to.   -House bread bread was pretty fresh.. and good combo of cripsy and softness  -ceasar salad..the dressing was good but the greens werent as fresh..  An hour in we were informed our food was going to be delayed. Awesome.   Bread refill please.   Capos lasgna- no wow factor a tad bit dry..not much flavoring minus the garlic..20 for this plate beware  Chef sleeps with the fishes- once again no wow factor.. almost like a plain fettucine w shrimp...27.00   Thank you capos for making my birthday wonderful.

MKI5YuTrqkyJC-iVmwe_mQ.text: The entrance is awesome. You ring a doorbell and a guy pokes his head out n asks if u have a reservation. As soon as u walk in, a huge smell of garlic and tomatoes is in the air. There caesar salad is very good. I ordered the Vinnie alla Vodka which was very delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vinnie alla vodka

gSvwtB8T51XuO_cQVD1-Sw.text: The atmosphere is awesome.  The got a piano player, and the food it's the best Italian food in Vegas.  I have recommended to 6 friends and all say the same.

z8J41k7pS4zzB-OOFq4geA.text: The food, service, entertainment, and ambience here is fantastic.  Some of the best Italian food I've ever had. Was very impressed with everything - from the red wine and sangria to the bruschetta, soup, salad, and shrimp scampi that I ordered. Came with a group of 6 and every dish that was served looked and tasted delicious.   Looking forward to come back again on my next trip to Vegas!

3TeB_nVotnd-RYcLVCbXmQ.text: Great theme ! Awesome singing ! good Italian food ! Worth the drive off the strip ! The food and the service is great !

gDlNNlwIGpu2c9X6-ZbO4Q.text: I am not one to post reviews, but being Italian, this is one of the worst Italian restaurants I have even eaten. The meatballs are bland, and sausage and peppers were salty. The place is empty and the service is awful, slow and slower. The drinks are way overpriced for being off the strip. If you want good Italian eat at the MGM, can't go wrong.

UFcxpUXJdhMiI6iXlBoaDA.text: Love this place. I've been several times. Food is excellent. Not overpowering with too much spice. Service is awesome. Prices are fair for good sized portions.

YiDgiXJucjjRjkhulYoBtw.text: I had a great time there.  I did reservations over the website.  Kind of wish they had some kind of code word to get into the place.  It was my birthday and ordered the special.  I should of asked how much.  It was a rib-eye steak.  My girlfriend got the bill and it turned out to be an $80 dollar steak.  Well worth it, just wish I would have been warned.  Still the best steak, I've ever eaten.

Z3XQCWVVTmWOCkUivjPHiQ.text: Annoyed - my first Saturday night out in forever. I went in for date night, one of the few times I opt to sit at the table instead of the bar. Without reservations, the manager  Annoyed - my first Saturday night out in forever. I went in for date night, one of the few times I opt to sit at the table instead of the bar. Without reservations, the manager

IeeHpdnckJ5BDzGvAHOfaw.text: I won't give away too many secrets. But we really enjoyed this place. The atmosphere is why you come here! It is darker than most restaurants but your eyes will adjust. You do get a little light to read the menu by. The food was very good and the entertainment makes for an enjoyable evening. Since there was 2 couples and the guys were on a business expense account it was no problem getting separate checks and they even called a taxi for us to return to the strip. I would definitely  come back for the atmosphere alone. Give it a try, it's a really neat place.

VjsicBCUDswnITbZtQA9ag.text: I was treated here by my boyfriend on Valentines' day :)  Entering the place is very amusing! They definitely take reservations, so call ahead! It would be much better that way! I've heard that this place is actually a speakeasy restaurant, which is very interesting! Since we had a reserved table it was funny to know we had an intimidating body guard by our table the whole night. Oh, the place is really dark. It took awhile for my eyes to adjust.  Since it was valentines' day there was a menu special. Came with appetizer, entree and dessert and a coffee drink (espresso I think?)  I'm not sure if it's a common thing, but our orders took a long time. I'm wondering if it's used to promote digestion between meals. But we weren't left sitting there starving, so we had alot of time to relax and enjoy the atmosphere and each other's company.  There was music playing (godfather's theme 3 times in a row x.x) and a live singer was there for awhile, it was great.  Overall, I think the food was okay, the bill was big ($60-$70 for just two people) However I think anyone who can afford to splurge should visit. It's a good experience.

LfzX11UBsecotsffzmlNJg.text: All I need to say is...this place is definitely going to be on my "to-do list" every time I come to Vegas. THEBOMB.COM !

r3Dm67CUMcxjGB01MVO66w.text: Best Italian food I have EVER had. And the ambiance gets a high rating too. Service was also great. It was more than a $50 cab ride over here from the strip, but so so so worth it. If you are visiting Vegas, it would really be in your best interest to make it here. Oh, and you must try the cheesy garlic bread appetizer.

9QEr8hIT9FAstwQn7mHGUA.text: There food is soo good!! The staff is really nice, and the piano player/entertainer is great also. Has a great atmosphere, really kind of "old School", but in the best possible way!! I highly recommend this place.  One of the best Chicken Parms I have ever had. I really can not say enough good things about this place!! The only bad point is the darkness and the flashlights on the menus, but that is part of the atmosphere so it is not that big of deal for me.

CNbwDNUZkWsdebllSkoJgA.text: Nice atmosphere, fun sinatra singer and a good pianist! We had loads of fun here! Came in with a groupon and ended up having a very large meal for two. Only had to pay the tip and we had a vegas night out! Lots of fun and def. something you want to do when you're into the kitschy vegas kinda stuff.

USWKJ6I-I8ZEBnJl51vLag.text: After a $25 cab ride from the strip we had high, high expectations and Capo's didn't disappoint.  A speakeasy/hidden entrance (don't judge the restaurant from it's non-descript shopping mall appearance on the outside) that sets a pretty cool mood for your evening.  Bar and kitchen is right up front where you can watch everything happen -IF you can see...very dark, but again, added to the meal.  Food is excellent and service was very good.  Music is a live singer singing Frank Sinatra toons...a little heavy on the Italian gangster movie posters, but hell, it was still cool and recommended

2hQKUncA4GRNRn0N2tzVwg.text: The atmosphere was amazing! The guy who opens the "secret door" was awesome! Our waitress was very sweet. The Sinatra impersonator has an incredible voice,we thought he was lip singing at first but no all him. The food was okay not anything to rant and rave about a little to garlicky(and I love garlic). The only dish we actually enjoyed was the bruschetta.

ac5KaCQtbjDIeGFH8eqVMw.text: Been to Capos many times. They had been on a downhill slide but they are back big time!  Favorites are: - Angels with Dirty Faces - Caprese - Garlic cheese bread (OMG!)  Service attentive and accurate. My one complaint is they keep their wine a bit too warm, but everything else makes up for it.   Enjoy! Amazing ambiance and fun. A MUST VISIT when in Vegas!

fB_uj3anJoysfAfAha18Xw.text: Off the strip with good food. Gangster themed Italian food. Loved the speak easy entrance. Service was a little lacking but made up for it in good food. I had a rib eye steak wife had. A pasta dish, sorry can not remember what kind. She really enjoyed it. Steak was also very good. I would go back.

2HYfh73iMYPSD58hQUfNOA.text: We have eaten here 3 times and absolutely love the atmosphere.  The meatball with peppers was to die for the first 2 times and completely bland and mediocre the 3rd time.  The calamari is outstanding. We had rude service the first time from a bartender that clearly didn't want to be a bartender and the 3rd time had a young girl who was just as surly and knew nothing about the food and had an attitude.  I can't recommend Capo and we won't be returning.  Casa di Amore also has great atmosphere, food and fantastic friendly service so if you are looking for someplace off the strip with similar food/pricing/music this is a much better choice in my opinion.

by-2OCkd8fOfIJQBV8AE6Q.text: We booked Capos for our wedding on May 14th. Janeen was such a pleasure to deal with . Its hard to plan a wedding from across the US, but Janeen always told me everything would be just fine! This is such a cool place, from the secret entrance to the red decor and the mobster pictures on the wall.  What a great follow up after our Elvis wedding! The Sinatra singer was great!  The food was really good too!  We had family style and everything came out as it should. Great service!  So happy we picked Capos for our wedding dinner!!!

sCRAaN0FUZUfQmF5dgMlOA.text: Great atmosphere, fabulous service, beyond delicious food. Brandon, the bartender was extremely nice and helpful. We will be returning as much as possible! We found this place driving around and it caught our eye, great find! We had Gotti's  chicken Angelo with mushroom risotto and the Angel's with Dirty Faces, both dishes were delicious. The mushroom risotto was outstanding! The pasta figioli and Tony Duck's soup were equally fantastic! I highly recommend Capo's!

ycmu7ZyeTlXH8FXXo7D76Q.text: I was very disappointed in my visit to this restaurant. I had a few friends who have been here in the past and have talk so highly of this so they made a reservation for 8 of us on Saturday night at 7 p.m. I was so excited to go and try this. We arrived at 7 with our group and was seated about 10 minutes later our server finally came over took them 15 minutes just to get our drinks and about an hour after we ordered for our food to come to our table. They were busy yes, but not to the point where it should have taken that long there were plenty of open seats available and plenty of servers so not sure what took so long. When we finally got our food my boyfriend's food was wrong so he had to send it back and we even longer for his food to come out. Our friends who recommended this place to us or even disappointed in this visit and very disappointed that they talk so highly of this place just for us to be disappointed. The atmosphere was nice but the service definitely could use some help especially because our ticket ended up being about $400 definitely not worth it.

_COAoqhkowM45R_WAA-plQ.text: Horrible service. The general manager was incredibly unhelpful and rude.  We will never return. We had a large party it took 1 hour to get bread 2 hours to get drinks, and 3 hours to get food.    There was also a dead roach on the bathroom floor just to add to the atmosphere.   Do not go!

qmxIrb0kDXb1D1yg5LCJ2w.text: What fun! Heard about Capo's from a Vegas work friend. Took a group of 7 along with us. Getting in was a cool and fun experience. You need the word of the day to get through the speakeasy style doors. Once in there is a guy crooning Italian songs and an amazing card trick guy that visits your table. We were lucky enough to be placed in the "movie room" where Godfather was playing and posters of the movie adorned the walls. The food was AWESOME/ be sure to get the meatball appetizers. Our group had a variety of different items and all were excellent. Service rocked as well. Our server Janeen was fun and very attentive. Highly recommend this place for some off the strip dining!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uncle Paulys arbaitta with blackened chicken-yum!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs rocked! Specials too!

TcllB6oUPsMgi5VC3hysyQ.text: Capo's Italian Cuisine exterior has the look of a dilapidated Sizzler's. I wasn't sure it was still open. You kind of fool around near the entrance until you are vetted in. If you wanted some atmosphere before you entered, you got it. I thought I had stumbled upon a real mob joint.  The inside is much bigger than I had imagined. You get that Italian feel for the place with the distinct booth seating and the waiter's outfits. One thing I have noticed, though, is that the service in these huge restaurants can be hit or miss. It feels that there are just a few too many servers when we went. We had people sit after us get their orders taken before us. We were seated but it took a few awkward minutes of waiting to get our drinks ordered. The servers themselves were very attentive and sweet. Just a logistics issue.  As everyone knows, when you come to an Italian restaurant for lunch, the must order item is the hamburger. That wasn't a thing before? Well it might be after you eat their House Specialty, Joey's Burger. What's so special about it? Does it have bacon jam made from special Gyspys who are only found in the Western Alps? I doubt it. It's just a great burger. Meat has that charcoal grill flavor to it. The bun was sturdy and delicious. Sometimes, just eating a good burger than doesn't fall apart is what it's about.  So what's da matta with you?! Go get a burger there already!

hdj76m5uPgyPrHlwqBhucQ.text: Had a Groupon for Brunch to Capo's Italian Cuisine.  While the breakfast I had was ok,I really wish there would had been some Italian dishes to choose from.  It was just your typical standard breakfast dishes on a very limited breakfast menu.  The decor was really neat though, i enjoyed the mob articles and Memorabilia - Very interesting.

4I-FByj_hGlBsDMMIaJ49g.text: From 3/9/15 We spotted this place a week ago exploring the area and figured we need to try this restaurant asap.   This is a speakeasy style restaurant, so trying to find the entrance as a first timer was a little tricky. Once we found the right door, we rang the bell and a guy slides a little panel and asked if we have reservations. In other words, he wanted to know "Who sent us!" Hahaha.   When you enter the actual restaurant, it's a the atmosphere dark, there is a bar with a piano across from it and then dining tables and booths. We were seated, then are server came out, he was very personable and attentive. When you open your menu, there is a little flashlight strung on top of it, this helps you see what you're ordering because of the dim lighting.   Apparently, they are famous for their meatballs, but I decided to save that for next visit since I was sure we would come back just from first impression. We got a bottle of  Mascanto. The boyfriend ordered the Veal. I ordered the Eggplant parm, which comes with your choice of salad I got the garden and for your side your choice of mashed potatoes or pasta, I got the pasta.  Everything was amazing, I love the way the make their food. I have to say as someone who grew up eating Italian food their whole life I was impressed. This restaurant will be my go-to place for good Italian cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mascanto
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House salad with balsamic, and artichoke heart.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant parm and a side of delicious spaghetti.

8NSGRXgrAQPxyv2cK9YE7A.text: The best SpeakEasy I've ever been too - in fact, the best food in Vegas!! And I've tried a lot of amazing places!! The ambience was incredible and the food beyond delicious! Well worth the taxi ride off the strip for this place!  I recommend the sangria to drink!  Everyone Was so pleased with their food and still talking about it month later! Can't wait to come back!!!

8gj9btTc0XTNqOCwOgZdEA.text: This is a Chicago old-school mobster themed restaurant. They have the Frank and Dino tunes playing, it's dimly lit, and they have plenty of the red vinyl booths I love.  The food was fresh and delicious and the service was fast and friendly. I'm a soda conniseur, and theirs is top-shelf. 2-for-1 Tuesdays for locals, dinner menu only.

yQiH5Us8tykYKu61_xpMmQ.text: This place is a must try if your in Las Vegas but make sure you call ahead and make reservations. When we first got here we tried to find the entrance it's a little tricky as soon as you find the entrance you walk in this little room and you ring the doorbell and this little window slides open the guy ask if you got reservations once you tell him your name he opens up this door that you can't see its actually has a phone on the Secret door. Once we where inside the place is set in old mobster style big circle booths dim lights, picture of old mob bosses all over the wall. There is also a guy singing old Frank Sinatra songs. The food here was real good everything we order was good I had the Santucci's Pasta with Italian sausage it was very good the sausage must have be homemade it was good. Everyone else in my party enjoyed their meal as well it was a great Dining experience and service was good from the time we got there till the time we finished. If your in Las Vegas you got to try this place out you won't regret it.

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scarface shrimp scampi
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad

nrKxIuUK-9PrPnBRLU8Xrg.text: It is rarity and a luxury for my husband I to get free time to ourselves. Last Saturday our daughter was spending the afternoon with her grandparents so we jumped at the opportunity to have a proper date.   Capos was not really on our radar and it wasn't until we drove past it on our way back from doing some decorating at his office that we decided Italian sounded great. We turned around and got into the parking lot of Capos.  I have to say that I really like the feel and the ambiance of this place. Although it is very dark when you first walk in so make sure to allow time for your eyes to adjust. My husband made a comment that this was the type of place one would bring their mistress. It was dark with high red booths offering privacy and comfort.   Our server was excellent. She was knowledgable, friendly and energetic. She took our drink orders promptly after we were seated. They do have a happy hour menu mon-sat but it is only at the bar.  We opted for one cocktail each... They ranged between $12-14 per.  We started off with their fresh calamari which was lightly battered and complemented by sliced Peperoncinis for that added zest. $14,95  For my entree  I opted for "Angels a With Dirty Faces" which was angel hair pasta in pink sauce with peas and mushrooms. I added grilled chicken for an extra fee. $18.95 + $6 for the chicken to be added  My husband had "Racketeers Ravioli" which were homemade pasta pillows stuffed with ricotta cheese and he opted for Alfredo sauce as the topping sauce of choice. The ravioli tasted homemade and exactly the way my mom used to make them.  $18.95  We overheard the server explain to a booth behind us that nothing in house is frozen or pre made. She stated that they have a small freezer which houses some of the desserts. That is what I like to hear. You pay the premium for it, but that's what I like to hear.  All entrees come with a choice of soup or salad. I loved their garlic sauce that was on my salad. So delicious!!  The only con were the prices. Even with 2 for 1 entree for locals, we ended up shelling over $70 for the two of us.   Although the food and service were great, I am not thrilled with the price point enough to rush back. I can see the prices being justified because everything is made fresh and portions are fair, but Italian food ingridients generally don't warrant that kind of price unless we are adding seafood, etc.

v9RSxfBgy39cDtf5QrkKLQ.text: Place is cool, its dark inside. The food and the service is awesome.  We had the veal parmesan, calamari, rigatoni and the cheese bread.

vbAFBgWphEaTpdCHtUeJvw.text: Absolutely wonderful!!! A total hidden gem. Amazing food and atmosphere. A perfect date night.

mqtizFsd7-OIY5-AjvcRnQ.text: Great food. Super fun atmosphere. Waiter Jeremy is awesome.  Little loud music when singer is performing. But overall great experience. Thank you.

IPOqgh2uB0j2ToVDSApo9A.text: I have a Roku streaming box, which has a Las Vegas channel loaded on it, and that's where I saw a video of this restaurant, and decided that was where I wanted to go. I stayed at the Luxor hotel and didn't rent a car, so I had to put a pretty big effort getting here which was a combination bus and taxi service. I needed a bus pass for other places, but the taxi was 22.00 with tip. I could have used my bus pass for Sahara west, but wasn't sure of the stops, but was able to use the bus to get back to the strip.                When you get there you find the secret entrance and ring the bell, and the guy opens the slot and with the secret password("Auntie G sent me") opens the door and lets you in. It was just me so they save the tables for couples and groups, so I sat at the bar. Service was fast and I liked the lady bartender, who recommended the steak. I first had the meatball appetizer, which had the most amazing sauce, with a bite to it I can't really describe. Most definitely not a sweet sauce. The steak was very good, cooked medium like I requested, and a very big cut with a lot of flavor, but it just wasn't the best I've ever had. If it had just been a bit more tender, and please don't tell me I requested it overcooked at medium. I've cooked so many steaks on the grill that I know even medium well to well done can be tender with a really good cut of meat from the butcher. I keep in mind that a steak on the strip could have been double the price here, and my bill including 3 pints of beer was only 61.00 before gratuity. Not bad for a popular spot in Vegas! I just wish I trusted my instincts, and had one of their Italian dishes instead of the steak. Especially after sampling the meatball. Still a great meal, and I love the decor and ambiance of the restaurant. Very dark and the menus have tiny flashlights attached so you can read the selections. By the time I left(arrived early) the live entertainment had started! I'm happy I planned and made the effort!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge meatball, with rich sauce.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY. 14oz. strip. Just could&#39;ve been a little more tender.

RGZ6IqEV2YVTfHPn7cgZ1A.text: Visited last night with a friend, always a great experience. Last night was exceptional. When the owner of the joint is seated next you, is charming & engaging, you have a good night! As always deep friend ravioli was delightful, as was the chocolate mousse dessert. Late bday dessert & enjoyed every bite. Friend had chi - town scampi, said it was so good she wanted to take her leftover sauce home with her! 3 hours of laughter, fun & fine dining. Bar manager Gery is attentive & friendly, knows what she's doing, when to bring out espressos! Best bartender there (no surprise she's the manager behind the bar). Capo's has become a regular hang out for good reason. Will continue to come back for more, more, more!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Last nights visit with a friend. As always, exceptional &amp; decadent. Deep fried ravioli, chi - town scampi, &amp; choco mousse are to die for!

x0UhoAOJqksa069XwtcFmg.text: Awesome veal great atmosphere love all the mob memorabilia and live music strongly recommend the garlic cheese bread and shotgun sausage and peppers

vvNRAdCACkoPOquajOUKLQ.text: I tried the ravioli with meat sauce so delicious the service was great a must go too Italian restaurant! Not to mention live music.

iK1SkKui8vVWf8z3xCBpUg.text: Start off with a "secret code" to get a table and the ambiance is set. This excellent themed restaurant is packed with great service and amazing food. Don't worry if they don't have exactly what you want on the menu because they make everything "made to order". Doesn't matter what you order, the food is magnificent. Flavorful is an understatement. The live music was entertaining while we ate. Will come back for sure!

QVhWdrYJmJOtE3SsQ-7xuA.text: My husband and I really like this place, even though we're a little snobby about food sometimes and love the kind of Italian food you find in Italy, which is not quite the same as what Capo's offers.  This is an old-school Italian-American red sauce joint. I grew up with this kind of food in New Jersey and my Scottish husband has really taken a liking to it.   Been here for both lunch and dinner.   Lunch offers a more limited menu including some specials. The chicken parm (sandwich or entree) is one of the best I've ever had. The sandwich has perfectly breaded chicken, with good gooey cheese on quality bread, and the entree portion of the chicken parm is enormous and so delicious. I don't even like spaghetti and meatballs usually but the spaghetti here with one giant, perfect meatball in amazing red sauce is my exception for that.   If you can save room for dessert, have the cheesecake or cannoli.   Nice wines and cocktails, service is really friendly and good overall.   Interior is awesome with booths scattered throughout, dark and great ambiance (as long as you ignore that half the pictures on the walls are of gangsters and other violent mass killers).  Italians who are actually from Italy probably wouldn't consider this "real" Italian food. But it's Italian-American comfort food at its best, and they do it really, really well.

p5vxE0EO1VS-xggBxyWiGA.text: This place is old school Italian Dark,good food with a great vibe. Old rat pack movies playing on the tv. Excellent staff

HrVBc9MNf-7TO7Z00gNxmA.text: The good was delicious! Our waitress was not very attentive. She never asked if we wanted more wine, and it took awhile to get the check.

ZLH4p2b0xo7xHc_I9WrZNg.text: It's just a fun experience! A must do when in Vegas... it's one of those places the less you know the more fun it is. It really is Las Vegas wrapped in a package and is fun!

ITrfi8qUUznZ_4Y3X1WNpg.text: The food was great and the interior was fun. Our meals were well priced especially for the large portions....From previous posts, I assumed this was a speakeasy style restaurant. I guess I expected more theatrics to include a special knock or code to get in. I did, however, appreciate the mobile magician and the staff's attire. I'm sure the visit would have seemed more pleasant if our group wasn't forgotten about. Unfortunately we waited abnormally long periods between seeing our waitress. I would still recommend this restaurant for its Italian meals but Definitely plan ahead and make reservations early.

FtbUs3VcH4_U9l7839h1_A.text: Maaan I felt like I was in a time machine set to the 1950's when I walked into this joint. This place has an old school Italian mob feel to it from the moment you walk up. Everything from the employees to the decor to the piano player all fit the part. The menu also follows suit with the dishes being named after famous mob/Italian figures from the 1950's. Now to the food, we started with calamari which was killer deep fried and a healthy portion. We also had the mamas meat balls and peppers. Let me tell you, coming from an Italian family, their meat sauce is the TRUTH! Haven't found that real authentic sauce flavor at any of the Italian joints I've hit here in Vegas so far! Went with the chicken Lucchese for my main course which was grilled chicken topped with mozzarella and broccoli, very unique for an Italian dish and loved every bit of it! If you're looking to feel like a mobbster and eat like a mobbster this is the place to hit up!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ma &#39;s Meat Balls &amp; Peppers
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8_DadSqXTTdA6UguMqthIw.text: Enter a dark vestibule and ring the bell, then wait for permission to enter. If you are lucky, they may let you in... Like a hidden Speakeasy, this restaurant is old school cozy meets mob-cool. There's a piano player/singer. Chandeliers and textured wallpaper. A table side magician. An exposed kitchen with an amazing chef working in lightening speed.   Our server Brandon was great. He was very knowledgable on the restaurant and the menu. The risotto was unbelievable, it would be a shame not to order it as your side dish. The chicken Parmesan was to-die-for! The spaghetti and meatballs were perfection. The steak was better than a steak house.   We come here a few times a year, but each time it just gets better and better. We may have to visit more often. If you haven't been yet, out it on your to do list.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Leo&#39;s Lips&#34; dessert is the way to go! You won&#39;t be disappointed.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Birthday Anna!

f9YB7z35CF8fyDEoijwF6w.text: My review is for Sunday Brunch. Got a deal off of Travel Zoo and actually had low expectations. Typically when you go to a place with a groupon or other voucher most places treat you as second class citizens. Not the case at Caop's  This was the best dining experience we have had in a long time. The service was great and the food was all really good. But it was just the atmosphere with the live singer entertaining the room. To top it off we had the cheese cake and it was the bomb. The brunch was great and can't wait to go back for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crooner at brunch

GPd-KlZ1BzjHiUJ22wd2cA.text: I took our lunch group to Capo's for lunch. The score is low because they refused to give us separate checks. Then, they gave 2 people out of our 18 but refused the rest. What an attitude. The wait staff was great, the food was good even though some said it was below par. We will not go here again.  When I advertised that our group was going, I received 3 calls from other groups telling me not to go there because they would not give separate checks. Well, people wanted to see what it was like and we had not been there in 3 years so we went. With all the electronic cash registers, etc. in this day and age it is ridiculous for a restaurant to act like they are so much better. Consequently the tip was low. We will be advising our members (over 500) NOT to go to Capo's again.

pk_0SEr0YsmUs7KV38zJ0A.text: First and foremost, if you're looking for a great italian-style food - this is the place to go. You get what you pay for, so be prepared to pay $25 for a piece of lasagna. But, it is good! As you've probably heard, the restaurant is mob-themed. Unfortunately, this is where they miss the mark and is why I've given them four stars instead of five. The presentation of the speakeasy leaves room for improvement. The musical entertainment was weak and I think the servers and wait staff could have been more effective in character. We had a nice evening, but I was expecting more atmosphere based on the reputation. Once they raise the bar on "the show", this could be a five-star experience.

l_Gm5U7ikYF93TgL2tw-aQ.text: Food is delidicous, and the atmosphere is fun. We go on birthday as a special occasion.  The  Chef Sleeps With Fishes is sublime! I eat it, save half, and have room for dessert! The Creme Brulee is so awesome! My daughter had Tiramisu, loved it.  The drinks were so strong we asked for extra cream to add to it, still great. :)  The music isn't so insanely loud anymore, nice touch.  They say 18% gratuity added for 6 or more but they don't add it so check to ,make sure you don't stiff your server.  Make reservations, they book FAST! It isexpensive, $300 for 6 people. Still. food is fresh, and yummy, so once a year we do it.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They take good care of expectant mom&#39;s, too. Large booths, and friendly staff.

Ypiweom-Xcy4oWIeQG1kYw.text: We had the great pleasure of experiencing Capo's tonight, for the first of what will definitely be many visits. First off, the ambiance is everything you want an Italian restaurant to be. The moment we entered, we were transported back to a place and time you can only find in history books and museums. It was the dimly lit lounge of yesteryear, with the rich sounds of Dean Martin and Bobby Darin filling your ears, while the intoxicating aroma from the kitchen gets your mouth watering before you even sit down.   Francisco and Carlos took explicit care in making our evening great. Our glasses were never empty, and our every need was met immediately and with a smile. Francisco led us through the menu to select what was to be one of the finest dinners we've ever had. The meatballs... oh my god, the meatballs. I don't even have the words.   Come with a group so you can try different entrees! Tonight we enjoyed Eggplant Parmesan, Lasagne, Santucci's Pasta, and Stuffed Chicken Anastasia. Every single bite was more than delicious. We left the restaurant with full bellies and a sense of euphoria I struggle to describe.  This place will be on our agenda every time we come to Vegas, and we cannot wait for next time. Salud!

s_9W7qu4LNVWnsAmac_wOw.text: Such a nice relaxing atmosphere. The place looks and feels as if you've been transported to a mobster style club. The food was excellent. We had the meatball appetizer, the lasagna (omg, amazing) and the chicken parmigiana. All of it was so delicious and we ate it for two days because the portion sizes are generous. It wasn't cheap but it was worth it because of the quality of the food. Definitely will be returning!

R4WYwqQupP1Nz_6jd5Akmw.text: Today was actually my third visit. Every visit is as good as the last, if not better.  The restaurant is dimly lit and has that Italian movie restaurant feel to it. Well dressed servers and live music adds to the ambiance. Our server was Ed. Very friendly and professional. In fact, two other guys brought as beverage refills during our visit and they were cool also.  Food was very good. Loved the meatball sandwich, but the chicken parm was fantastic. Like straight out of an Italian grandma's kitchen!!! It's hard to order something different, but I really want too!  2 different people (I assume managers) stopped by our table to ask if everything was cool and if we needed anything.  Love this place!!!

6VqebKsCM5ETjbYWgqLZ5g.text: This was a fun experience dining at this place. My husband and I went with friends and we had a great time. From the atmosphere to the food, it was an ideal way to celebrate a friend's 30th birthday. The entrance itself has a secret entrance and was of course packed. Making a reservation is necessary and don't forget to earn yourself 5% back by using Yelp check-out!

SxP4TxTOY3EFub-gONfX9g.text: Dined here Sun evening, reservations a must, great food, large portions, and such fun ambiance!  Don't want to tell too much & ruin the surprises!   A great place to share with friends, too.  Dark inside, & although mini lights are attached to menus we couldn't really see our food.  At end of meal we asked if decaf coffee was fresh, waiter said no, it's been sitting there awhile.  No offer to brew some fresh. My only 2 complaints!  Our check averaged about $55 pp - we shared an appetizer, one entree each, only 1 of us had a glass of wine, two desserts. Best cannelloni since NYC & excellent Spinoni !  We'll return for sure.

U1Wgn9szTp1k-Cbp8q90SQ.text: This restaurant is really tight, food is good, ur classic restaurant foo, but the environment is worth every penny. I recommend going here and not looking anything up about it for the experience.

rq0YDUoYc-gEa8Obj89Q4w.text: Excellent food and unique atmosphere. My sister recommended this place. It has a mob theme and atmosphere. You arrive and enter through a plain door with just a "C" painted on it. You then have to knock on another door and someone opens a speakeasy and asks what you want. If you have the password they'll let you in. Upon entering you feel like you are sent back in time. There was a Dean Martin type singer working the crowd while crooning out birthday songs and classics.   The place was packed so we were glad to have reservations. We were sat in a side room away from the action. At first I was a bit disappointed and distracted by the noises coming from the kitchen. Once the singer started up again, the kitchen was much less distracting and I decided it was actually nice to be a bit separated. It was so packed I imagine it'd be hard to have a conversation otherwise.  We ordered Busta Cap stuffed mushrooms....EXCELLENT! My wife ordered lasagna and it was huge and incredible. I had Marsala, which was pretty good, with a side of pasta ala Vodka, very good. For desert we had chocolate mousse, which was good.  Our waiter, perhaps Franco or Frankie, was great, as was the rest of the staff. Drinks always full, always serving the dishes with an "enjoy" or "enjoy your meal". Franco would give us recommendations and when we would ask questions he would reply with, "yeah, of course," "you're gonna love it," "forget about it." He even had the right accent.  Overall a great experience. One you must have while visiting Las Vegas. It's a few minutes off the strip so if you don't have a car grab an Uber or Lift.

mgQ47JijhRKe2FyKb9dXWQ.text: This place was recommended to my husband. He left our date night a surprise. The entrance is totally awesome! The vibe of the restaurant is nice. We had Jeremy as our server. We ordered a beer and Dino's dirty martini. I love a good dirty martini.. and I mean dirty, like swampy dirty. Drinks came out, color of my martini was on point. Took a sip and it was straight olive juice. Told Jeremy about it, he came back and said "it was made by our new bartender, she said its a 6 count but you can order a side shot if you want." I gave him the drink back. Our calamari and caprese were delivered. Calamari was delicious. Caprese had a good flavor but the price is way too high for what you are served. $13.95 for 3 slices of tomatoes, 3 slices of mozzarella and 3 basil leaves is a little steep.   My husband ordered the nightly special, porter house with mashed potatoes and steamed veggies for $49.95. I ordered the "Chef swims with the fish" .. it was listed as Jumbo shrimp with sundried tomatoes, creamy garlic sauce with pasta for $26.95 ..  We were served a dinner salad with creamy garlic dressing which had a great taste to it.  At this point I was still wanting a dirty martini, I ordered another Dino's dirty but asked for the olive juice on the side. This was night and day! This was a damn good drink! Jeremy said he had another bartender make it this time.   Our entree is delivered. Porterhouse came out great. Cooked perfectly. The pasta dish had a good taste but there were only 5 shrimp in the entire dish. I was disappointed at that since the menu said Jumbo and these were about the size of a half dollar coin.   They offer a military discount, 10% off food (not alcohol) which is common. Our bill was $126.80 before tax. We had $21.00 in alcohol. He brought back our new bill, the 10% discount was $6.88 .. common math shows that does not add up. I understand that a military discount is a privilege and it's greatly appreciated but at least make sure it adds up to the amount you state.  We paid our bill and left.   Overall experience: Pretty good, few hiccups but nothing to deter us from returning.  Will we return: Probably   Satisfied with prices: Ehh.. not really, they are on the high side but I guess you are paying for the vibe too.

Sh2PTwmbynyDOqEASfYtXQ.text: Love the Veal Piccata, they called me boss here, yea, they got that right! Met and made a lot of friends here. Love the red booths. This is in old style Las Vegas and NYC. Uncle Gotti would be proud of me! Forget the Strip?! This place reminds me back when I was 24 years old during Prohibition in NYC.

_iBGWTeyuqj_UDR6d5Bb1w.text: I think we just had an off night and not a representation of normal service- I hope. Not great for a first time dining here. No special occasion, just a date night for husband and I. I made a reservation for 7pm on a locals 2-for-1 Tuesday. I were a little early and waited about 10 minutes to be seated- although walking past tables there were several empty ones. Oh well. We ended up being seated in the bar area- so although the restaurant is beautifully decorated and there was live music the view from our table was of a basketball game on TV and the kitchen. Those chefs bust their butts! I was frustrating that it took nearly 20 minutes before being acknowledged for water and drink orders. We nearly walked- should have.  We had the red Sangria- pretty good. I had the Chicken Marsala with a side of mushroom risotto. He had the Spaghetti and Meatball. He was happy, not thrilled. I was disappointed. Chicken was okay but the risotto was complete flavorless mush. I love mushroom risotto, it is one of my favorite things, make it at home frequently and this was the most disappointing I have had. Instead of arborio rice it tasted (hard to tell with sight as it was so dark) like regular rice in a cream sauce, not the traditional risotto. Management did give a free dessert because we waited so long for a server after being seated. The Cannoli was tasty.  I was excited to eat here. Through a series of frustrations and disappointments I will not come back. Dinner took about 1 1/2 hours and not even that great, I can make better at home. I am not even angry- just disappointed.

09RotcPGNhxs8PiKZ-44fg.text: Hands down best Italian sausage sandwich I've ever put in my face The service was a little slow but friendly and accommodating  Piano guy was a full in and kept trying to engage the various parties while they were eating which was awkward but he was talented when singing/playing Would definitely go back and would definitely recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frankie
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CvU57VmBo-uZTGVapgNidw.text: This place is an event, as well as a restaurant. Live music and every table around us was s birthday party. The fried ravioli is great. The meatballs good, too. Try any of the pastes. Great Italian food!

iYsWlvp5y5kyryiQnUysjg.text: What a great experience!!  From the minute you walk in the BACK door to dessert this place is  awesome!  Our server at the Las Vegas Elks cob shared this area treasure and we will share as well!  WOW!  Great Italian Food, Awesome service and great atmosphere!  I only wish my Tummy wasn't sure full so I could do it all over again!  YUM!

NBX2iUa8vwDvI9mENGhErQ.text: Food and the ambiance are good.  Its not the best Italian I've ever had before, but way better than an Italian chain.  Make sure you bring your cell phone so you can read the menu in the low lighting.  We arrived 1 hour before closing and we found the level of service attention was lacking.  That might be because i ordered a coke and my wife got water, but we were waiting a long time to order, get our food, and get the check.  We had to flag the waiter down because he only visited our table once after we got our food.  Nevertheless - definitely worth a try if you want to get away from strip and try something a little different.

wkSaZSLNTkMjtqotkxJt1Q.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my meal at Capo's.  We came on a late rainy day and weren't sure if the restaurant was open on approach.  The windows were dimly lit but we proceeded to the door.  As other newbies, we were surprised by the entrance.    We started out with a bruschetta and salad each.  The bread was really tasty.  I had the stuffed chicken Anastatia.  That dish was delicious and was a very huge portion.  It makes my mouth water just thinking about it.  I forgot what my partner had it was so good.

I8uFXbwbUQnaXxO1tKOnug.text: Dont waste your time going here! I tried this place on Friday to experience something different. It was a experience.......a horrible one. After parking I walked by the dumpster area that was a disaster and smelled horrible only to find out the entrance was right next to it. Great location for a door Capos, I was already losing my appetite from the foul rotten seafood smell. Through the secret door your welcomed by a dark place. The door man asked me to follow him, I couldn't see a thing and had to let my eyes adjust a minute. I sat at the bar because there was more light there. There is a open kitchen so you can watch the chefs cook. I was kind of let down to see everyone was Mexican cooking. I thought this was Italian but maybe they were good. Wrong. Food sucked. Cold sauce on soggy breaded chicken, over cooked noodles, and a greasy wilted salad. Two things were good here....my beer and my "Swansons" cheesecake I saw the cook taking out of the box and putting it on my plate. I guess thats why those had nothing wrong with them because they were already premade. I should have saved my money and got a frozen dinner to go along with my frozen cheesecake. The singer was ok but after each set he would swig down 2 shots of whiskey. After awhile he was just slumped over staring at the floor talking to himself. It was a little amusing. Best part of the night was the scorpion in the restroom. This place may have been good in the beginning now it's a broken down dive bar that's falling apart. Everything is filthy, smells like a old smokey casino, and the employees are either ready to quit themselves or just poorly trained. Everyone looked lost. The funny part it this place uses old family recipes from Italy.....they must have lived in the ghetto part. STAY AWAY!!

kWsaZBDzIzTpwt9hWWSCbg.text: Been here for an hour now and havent received our order yet because their is a group of 20 ahead of us.  I high recommend anyone not bother dinning here if there is a large group ahead of you.

T2UsOD5UNTMVv6GIEK6rrg.text: No way "cuisine".  All they have is atmosphere.  It's cute but no way does it make up for the poor quality food.  OMG.  The salad, what is this lettuce?  The bread, sliced and toasted what looks like thin hot dog buns.  The house cabernet, harsh and acidy on the tongue.  The pasta, sauce almost like tomato paste out of the can.  No spice, no flavor.  There are so many good Italian restaurants to choose from in LV.  Take a chance somewhere else.

nvk4ru7UE-3qlmqa_Bd2tQ.text: I loved the entrance.  We were a large party of 15 people.  We ate family style ordering and sharing appetizers and meals.  The singer was doing his thing.  We were all having a good time and unwinding.  It reminded me of a family meal as we were loud and laughing a lot.

K10eieS4VGooZCsNr-RRUA.text: Great food and awesome covert dining room. I could barely read the menu it was so dark in our little corner that the menu attached flashlights were key!  Service was attentive if not a little too perky for the place. It made the place feel more "Disneyland" than speakeasy. But that's okay. I'll buy into the crooner wandering the dining room. I'll buy into the black shirts and red ties. I'll even buy into the cheeseball mafia themed posters and artwork hanging throughout the restaurant. And of course,... it all starts from the time you enter the building and are not sure which of the walls is the actual door in.  The restaurant's appeal will span across all age groups. The food is delish and the portions are enough for leftovers. It's off-Strip so all you folks looking for something off the beaten path, you'll be happy you came here.

fWi4ANH1GSv5g8ufvdo7gA.text: The food and atmosphere were terrific but the service was pretty poor.  It really ruined the whole experience for us.  The server took a long time to even take our order, refused to split checks or even allow us to use multiple credit cards, had other people deliver our food, never refilled our drinks and was anxious to get us out of there.  The place was only about half full and this girl claimed to have worked there for a while but obviously was not interested in doing a good job.  For the money, I'd go someplace that actually wanted our business.

3JwKi-41R6GZEu13qWj4lw.text: This place was great! It is a gem in Vegas, food and atmosphere was awesome! We will definitely return...I had the Lasagna and the boyfriend had the chicken alfredo with broccoli.  Both entrees came with soup or salad we both had salad...but they dont have Ranch (which is weird!) Oh we also ordered a meatball...yummy!!!  We also had a glass of their red and white wine...total was like $60.00! A great deal for Vegas!!  Try it out!!

1WnfpCvG0zLedlrI5Kt0fw.text: Excellent place to go on a date. Food is a little pricey but well worth it. I had the Chicken Alfredo and it was the best Alfredo sauce i have ever had. Plus if you go on tues it two for one. Service was extremely slow but was made up for by good live music. Make sure you make a reservation.

Ig7f4lHb_kT0lsnMXHZa_A.text: The speak easy entrance is fun and the singer was great.  As for the rest, it was at best mediocre.  The waitress told us about the specials, which 2 in the party ordered.  She never gave the price but, we all expected it to be a "SPECIAL" not a "RIPOFF".  If was 3/4 pasta noodles and 1/4 seafood that was terrible.  When the bill came it was $49.95 per dish.  Absolutely ridiculous. We have spent much more on meals before but, the quality of the so call special was terrible then the price unacceptable.  She should have said the price since it was there was nothing on the menu that price.    Another in the party ordered the steak, which was cooked properly but for the cost of this is was a pretty small order and the potatoes were terrible.  The Shrimp in the shrimp scampi was terrible and the pasta spicy.  Ok for us but, for most I think would be way too spicy.  We also got the fettuccine alfredo which was not that good.  We have been here 3 times before and mostly go back for the entertainment but, I think this will be our last time.  The food was not good. They also add the gratuity of 19% to the bill when it came.  Then their Credit Card machine wasn't working so, we had to pay cash.  What's up with that??   I definitely felt ripped off and this was for my parents birthdays.  I don't want to be embarrassed again.   There are hundreds of restaurants in Las Vegas to choose from and this is not on my list any longer.

0RMYoBKu7_GEQWvrjFmefg.text: If you like being treated like 2nd  class citizens, then go to Capo's. We did not have reservations when we arrived at 6:00pm. We were told we would have to sit at the bar. Finally, the owner/manager/singer found a table in an area that had no air conditioning. We were the only ones at that area. Food and service was ok, not great. hen we left, there were only a few tables full. How dare he insist that all the tables were full and we really were not welcome w/o reservations.

UfflncZMzAcS-kEdX6wkIw.text: They lost our reservation, and only tried to fix the situation after we proved to them with the call log on our cell phone that we did indeed call them two weeks prior. We had to stand for 45 min to wait for our table, then once we were seated, I had to wait 25 more minutes for a glass of water. Our party of 6 was automatically charged a 19% gratuity for service that clearly didn't earn it. The food wasn't anything to write home about either. They pretty much ruined my friend's 40th birthday dinner, then did nothing to try and fix it. Nothing was comped. Avoid this place. It was the worst service I have ever experienced.

GSzoPYejU2d0p5NDC_RjLA.text: The food is okay. It's a bit pricey, but I think you're paying for the atmosphere & not the food. Portions are good, but not the best Italian food I've ever had.

eG2Ovhy2ytPyJtz1w-i3LA.text: I used love this restaurant and would always take out of town guests here. Went to the Tropicana location with my mom and boyfriend last Sunday night and was incredibly disappointed.  The service was horrible.  The restaurant wasn't crowded at all yet we had to wait 20 minutes for a table.  After 15 minutes passed and no server had come to our table we had to go up to the front of the restaurant to retrieve menus.  I love the idea of this place and maybe it's just this location that is bad but the bad service ruined our dining experience for the night.  So many good restaurants in town, we probably won't be returning here.

ikeJ_54zxS-Ffj4l3fV81w.text: Me and my bf had eaten here once before about a yr ago, and we totally loved the experience. So much so, we decided to invite my family to capos for dinner the other day, thinking it would be a pleasant change from the olive garden.   Boy, were we wrong.   First off, the restaurant was DARK. I remember it being dimly lit the last time we had dinner there, but not like that.  I couldn't even see the faces of the people surrounding me, much less my food.  Im not one to complain too much about the ambiance, but I know something is wrong when I walk out of there with tired, strained eyes.  Plus, I think there was an alterior motive for this dark lighting, aside from an energy savings technique (more on this later).      The service was crappy, or should i say our waitress was. She didn't know most of the plates offered on the menu, and she was spastic and disconnected.  We all asked for water with no ice, but they gave us the opposite. And we asked for a couple of extra things, like olive oil for bread, but they never made it to our table.   The food was... so-so. Some dishes were overly spiced.  Parents shrimp scampi had 6 shrimps each, tops.  Lasagna was okay.  Overall it was decent, but the first time we went there, the food was way better.  Or maybe it seemed that way because we had a better experience.  Or maybe seeing your food is part of the experience of enjoying it, and if you can't see it, you can't enjoy it.    Lastly, but most importantly, we are certain that they *OVERCHARGED* us. The bill came close to 300 (not including the tip we gave), and altho we thought it was too much, we didn't fight it because we were with my parents (don't wanna look bad) and we couldn't even read the bill. (again, the lighting issue... maybe that's why they keep it so dark in there.)  After tallying up the score at home, we realize that they most likely charged us an 18 to 20 percent gratuity (for a group of 6? Really?) and didn't tell us. (Lucky them, they got two tips).  But that still doesn't account for the total amount that they charged us, so we think that they probably charged us an extra plate as well.  We will never know, because we never saw the receipt properly at the restaurant (try reading a note hand written in pencil in the darkest corner you can manage, and that was our situation) and they didn't give us a receipt to take home.   So in short, poor lighting, bad service, and ridiculous pricing/charging methods will keep us away.  The food definitely isn't worth it.

CURrNKZMPADsFbtDC66BKw.text: I have been going here for years every time I'm in town for business, but I knew some changes were happening and they were trying to make it into a family restaurant. So we decided to go anyways not much could have changed. But when we got there 50% of things have changed, from the lighting it was too bright, The staff was always blaming things on other people. Our table was never cleared off of dirty dishes or food. We were never offered a second drink after an hour of being there. All this new picture taking and things are just not for this restaurant, I think they should go back to the way it was, or if they want to keep the high prices on the food for the Entertainement in the ambience to change it back the way they used to have it. Because there's no way that I'm willing to pay for a bland tasting chicken Alfredo meal for $28.  If a family wants to bring their children and friends there for a overprice meal I would say go for it but you could get a better meal someplace else for cheaper. I personally will not be going back for a while till I hear things have changed.

KTLq5sknFJO1-VCrvHTWPg.text: First off its hard for me to write a review so negative about a place I've been and have had wonderful past experiences at, unfortunately over the years Capos has gone down hill.  My 72 year old aunt from Boston and her brother and sister who not to mention are iTALIAN and know there food, figured this would be the best place to dine in.    Of course the whole "gangster mob" theme is entertaining but the lighting is way too dark! Especially since we had three people over the age of 60 and eyesight is not great to begin with. When we got inside and got to the table to order drinks the table broke. understandable that accidents happen but we didn't get our drinks until the table was fixed which was 15 min later and not to mention the table was never fixed but we were moved.  They moved us into a whole  different side of the restaurant which was secluded from the dining area  which in some cases would be nice if your on a date but not in this situation.  My grandparents were so short they could barley see over the table top. We got our Cesar salads and it was so drenched with salad dressing and soggy it was unbearable to eat. We Ordered another salad with dressing on the Side and that couldn't even be done right.  So we all ordered the veil parm and to start off  it tasted more like a flattened piece of chicken. Did not get a choice of pasta it was strictly spaghetti and extra cost if you wanted a different style. They pretty much had it pre made and under a heat lamp waiting to be served. The spaghetti was literally only 4oz.  I asked to return the dish and the waitress said no it can't be done and instead brought me a dessert.  I had told her I did not eat dessert and she had said to me sorry that's all you can get.  All I wanted was my $30 refunded off my bill.  Needles to say we had spent $60 on a groupon and our bill came out to $200 so it's not like we were getting our meal for free. So I don't think that anyone should be treated different for having a coupon.   It was sad to see such horrible service at a place with such potential, maybe it was because they were just too busy and overwhelmed.  But this visit was not enjoyable and would not recommend to any of my friends at this point.

jBJ4rpCHDcDeMUKdjUY1fA.text: My husband and I had dinner here while in town for March Madness.  We wanted to get off the strip (we went to the original one - not new one on West Sahara) for a change and I was craving hearty Italian food (it was cold outside this trip!)  We want to the original place  Words cannot describe how much I loved dinner here!  From the fun entrance, the decor, the atmosphere, and the delicious food!  And for the amount of food you get, the prices are reasonable. Especially after you have been eating on the strip/at hotels for a couple days!  I had the rigatoni in meat sauce with a GIANT meatball. It hit the spot!! Exactly as I was craving.  My husband had the lasagna and said it was very good.  We were stuffed full so didn't get to try dessert but I plan on going back!  I liked it so much that I took my leftovers back to the hotel and carefully transported them back home with me the next day - refused to let such yummy food go to waste! Italian food is my all time favorite but a lot of places are very generic/lacking in flavor - this is definitely not one of them.   Plus we got there about 20 minutes before they closed and they in no way made us feel rushed.  Very nice staff!

2TAEsQkLsLdut_Pl71kUuA.text: Place is a good idea with a mob theme however the service was pretty bad. We had a reservation at 9pm for a party of 6, and got there at 8:45 and they sat us quickly. After we got seated and we had showed our server that we had a groupon for $100 after that she only came by our table twice, the busser came by at least 10 times. Majority of the time we saw our sever doing nothing but sitting at the bar talking to another person, while our busser was busy with other tables. It took almost 15 minutes for us to pay because no one came to pick up the bill. I was so unsatisfied with their service I had asked another server to speak to their manager in charge, consequently their manager in charge was our server, which I call bull on because the other server was probably just watching out for our server's back. Definitely not going to come back here. I only gave them 2 stars because their busser was doing their job correctly.

seGIEwvLDGbE1Ba2NcZNEA.text: Dominick,  is just as rude as always and has no customer service skills   At the request of our guests, we drove across town to dine here  and it will be our last time !!!!!!!   Food quality was poor,  salad limp, bland sauces,  and NO cioppino or osso buco!!!!!!!  The wait staff were very good, but I feel bad for the staff there,   bad reviews and horrible customer service by one person effects your wallets FYI    when a guest has a  dining coupon, reward, gift certificate etc...... it would be in your best interest to honor it or or atleast  give a little discount or something  not be an asshole,  being kind goes along ways and I normally tip 25 to 30%, your staff suffers from your stupidity  We should of walked out    I will forever go to casa di amore

F5ljJGJ-VW-ix4oa5TH9gw.text: Great time!!! 12 of us went and had a really good time from the moment we walked in. Everyone loved the environment immediately. Food was really good, everyone loved what they got (meat balls and the lasagna were great). Magician came by he amazed us and and made us laugh. It was one of our guys birthday and the house singer came in and sang to him. Lots of fun, laughter and just a good time. Highly recommend the place.

sQYKYnjSRZtUgVoM6W1xnQ.text: Got here early and the fam was mpressed with the mob style decor.Me, not so much.   Building in poor repair. I spend my culinary life tring to recreate my Nona's food from the old country.   I found NONE of that here.  Tomato sauce served  lukewarm sort of undercooked and withan odd sweet taste.  It ruined sll the dishes it was served on.  Salad so I so but who can ruin a Salad?   In the end , even the cannoli to die for had too much chocolate surrounding and the pastry was stale.

dbXv6-koupp8pTgGbMO11Q.text: My boyfriend described this place in three words 'unique but bland', and that is the perfect way to describe this establishment.   Atmosphere - You enter through the back door into a small room where there is a door bell, you ring the bell and the window opens... They asked us who we were and we gave them our reservation, and then they asked us if we had any weapons (That was a bit overkill) and then they let us enter in through another door to the restaurant. It was very dark inside, so dark inside the menus have little lights in them. There was also a guy who sang and when round to all the tables. He was rather irritating... Ignore him and he'll leave. And he totally put his own money in his tip jar when he set up!  Service - Our server was very attentive and despite other reviews I read that said they are rude when you have a groupon, we used a groupon and they were great.  Food - BORING. I ordered a Caesar salad with shrimp... There weren't even croutons on it... And that was the only green salad on the menu. My boyfriend had a pasta dish. It was average. They did do a good job with the dirty martini and the blue cheese olives  Overall, I am happy I purchased the groupon and checked it out... But I would not pay full price for it. They tried... but the food, no thanks.

Xf_q9NTCqJdcmEyxOc3K6w.text: From the door, this place looks like a mobster hide-out. We go inside and its like a movie scene. The man yells at us "What do you want?" followed by us looking terrified and wondering if we are at a restaurant or in a sketchy place. Then a door opens out of nowhere and we are led inside to an old, italian, speakeasy bar. The decor is awesome! Frank Sinatra is playing, the windows are barred with mirrors, and the entire place is dark.   We begin with a nice glass of Cabernet Sauvignon. The server's recommendation is spot on! We had the Ravioli, Fettucine Alfredo, and the Lasagna. Our entrees came with fresh bread with an amazing herb butter and a generous salad. My boyfriend's ravioli were huge! They were very tasty with a ricotta cheese filling. My lasagna was really good, and the tomato sauce was sweet. My friend had the fettucine. He didn't share and he scarfed it up, down to the last noodle, before I could try it! I guess he liked it. The bar looked really cool but we sat in the red booths because I love booths! Service was excellent, however, the place was quite slow for a Friday night, perhaps because we were eating at 10pm. My friend loves mafia movies so he took a liking to this place. The prices were moderate. We'd love to return when we are in the area again to try out their bar and catch live music next time.

Fhs_luVe4fXDqD5zNcCteA.text: Love everything so far!  This is by far the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.  It is located a few miles off of the strip on West Sahara.  Starting with the hidden entrance (I won't spoil the surprise for you.  :-) ) to the ambiance, photos of mafioso's on the walls to the food, this is a great place to enjoy some excellent Italian food the way it should be prepared.    High marks are also given to the wait staff and to the host.  We had the meatballs with peppers for an appetizer, followed by lasagna for myself and my wife had the carbonara.  We followed up this wonderful dinner with a slice of cheesecake topped with chocolate sauce.  The portions were just the right size and we left filling full, but not stuffed.    I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for good Italian cuisine in Las Vegas.  Get off of The Strip and enjoy something local for a change!

8mGQUxbzDGFjbQRLKVRBHw.text: I had high hopes for this place. Considering the prices we paid for our plates I really thought it would be better. Both our plates were bland and barely warm. It was a nice experience and the service was nice but the food was average and overpriced.  Just a side note: they told us after we ordered our drinks that their credit card machine was down and they were only taking cash. We ended up being forced to use their in house ATM and got charged a nice $6 ATM fee. Annoying

0AQuFMQh__zN0U3oecXTAg.text: Entry is very cool and very old school mob like considering it's an old mob hangout. staff was great and friendly. Lounge singer was pretty good. Food was phenomenal, meatballs were great in the spicy sugo sauce. Loved it, the only downside is it is very dark for ambiance. I suggest making a reservation I can see it getting very very busy

HOAJJmGQSNviV02Cc9KAZQ.text: OMG This is my NEW GO TO SPOT!  this place is great atmosphere, great food and awesome experience.  Although I did have to explain how to make an Italian tea they made it SLAMMING!  I am NOT a RISOTTO person at all and I've had some good stuff, believe me I've tried,  but THIS PLACE HAS THE BOMB GARLIC RISOTTO.  I would totally go back and get it here. The only disappointment was I was so full that I didn't get to try dessert.  =(   The was a Piano guy there that was very good also the Magician. He did some real good illusions.  Highly recommend~

__jdYnmjkwbiqiNyKJCcqg.text: Lived in Vegas back in the 90's and of course now visit 3-5 times a year for gaming, golf some business and of course all the world class dining options this great town has to offer.  Sometimes you get way too caught up with making sure that you stay in particular hotels, or eat in big name restaurants, but every once in awhile you will find a diamond in the rough so to speak. At the recommendation of a local here 5 of us set out to Capos a speak easy type old style Italian dining experience.   From the minute you walk in the door you are no longer at the Bellagio, the Wynn but back to the days of yesteryear when old style Italian Salons ruled the Vegas Empire.  A dark type setting with booths, tables, long wooden bar is your ambience with Godfather & Goodfellas movies playing in the background and Bobby walking the room singing your old time Sinatra & Vale favorites you know you are in for something different and with hope special as well.   Prices are inexpensive here as all meals come with choice of soup or salad and several drinks at the bar were charged at Happy Hour prices even though it was almost 9PM when we got there nice touch. After sitting we ordered two orders of their meatballs and peppers with homemade spicy sauce and a Chi Town Shrimp scampi. Fresh bread with Garlic butter was fresh and excellent.  These 3 appetizers were more than enough to split for 5.  The meatballs were large not very moist but the tasty, fresh and the sauce very spicy but an excellent accoutrement to this very interesting presentation.  The Shrimp were over bread soaked in scampi sauce. Shrimp a little on the hard side, but the sauce was extremely tasty and very good.  Soups and 1 salad ordered as part of meals. Two Wedding Soups with chunks of Sirloin steak were as expected, the pasta fagoli interesting and again very tasty salads were a wet blue cheese that were very cold and fresh. Again all orders quite large and these were included in the entrees.  Dinners:  Traffacanti Rigatoni was stuffed pasta with Cheese Procusitto in a creamy Alfredo sauce. Excellent dish but there was no mention on the menu that the Rigatoni was "Spinach Rigatoni" this was fine as I like that but we were splitting up the dishes and it would have been nice to have known.  A stuffed Chicken Anastasia with Ricotta, Spinach covered in a pink sauce was as described and very tasty with a light coating of bread crumb as well.  A linguini carbarnaro with chicken was one of the best dishes on the table, but it had a tough time competing with the Linguine with fresh white clam sauce. These 4 dishes were split to 5 people & none of us could move after this.    Their Espresso, Cappuccino machine was not working so we skipped desert and coffee enjoyed another drink on the house by the owner and listened to Bobby belt out Sinatra. Tough to leave this little gem but all good things must come to an end.  Very well kept little secret that will definitely be a return trip for me next time I'm in town

05L2xKnUmsOyvyQbB6E_0Q.text: Loved the atmosphere and hidden doorway!!! Our waiter called us boss.the food was great and loved the Frank Sinatra singer. The godfather played in the background. Can't wait to go back! Very old vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved it!

TGdy42KJiQOTLSCTlBsjUA.text: Some friends were in town for a bachelorette party and wanted a nice dinner that was fun, but not all crazy penis balloons in the air (a la your typical bachelorette party, I mean). I had previous heard of Capo's but had never been there, but knowing it had a good reputation as being a little different, that's what I suggested and it's where we ended up.  The whole speak easy idea is adorable and definitely fun. The hidden entrance, the password, that whole deal. Very cool.   The food is definitely good, but certainly not the best this Italian has ever had (and not even the best in Vegas, for that matter). Still, I'd have no problem going back. Everyone in our group enjoyed their meals, plus the basil butter with bread was a nice and yummy touch. Oh, the dinner salad was also really great.  The service, however, was fantastic. Drinks were refilled promptly without us ever having to ask, food came quickly and was both fresh and hot. The staff were all incredibly friendly and they gave the place a fun, laid back but professional vibe.    So, while the food is good but nothing to write home about, I give them an extra point for great atmosphere and even better staff.

QcX5tWVTLeIKRgx7niXRFQ.text: Awesome lunch, great inviting atmosphere,  the service is top notch, and food to die for. This is a must stop for locals and visitors a like,  if you enjoy Italian joint this is your place.

L6UlydZXlty4gGS9ne-DAA.text: incredible experience from start til finish. Great stuff. The food is great and the entertainment is awesome. They played the game right....  You wanna have a real  Mob feeling, this is the right place.

H1VlMYhNEcVaSrNURc9Ssw.text: Absolutely horrible service.   After a great time at the mob museum, my date and I read some of the good reviews and decided we should check this place out. I should have looked at the bad reviews too. When we walked in, we pretty much got yelled at because they didn't open for another hour. We said okay fine, we'll be back.  We went back an hour later, same guy opened the door and asked if we had a reservation. We said no. He said he has no room for us and we can just go and sit at the bar. He did a really offensive gesture and then walked off.   Still standing there in shock, like umm did that really just happen. We decided not to sit at the bar. Especially since we didn't know where the bar was, it's so dark you can't see anything in there.  We couldn't even see how to get out, so we had to wait for him to come back. When he finally did come back, we asked him why he didn't let us know we needed a reservation when we were there an hour earlier. He said 'now you know' and left.  I'm glad I didn't eat there. Ridiculous!

cofeU31a2Y5vJv_rS2zv5w.text: Absolutely love it here the food is amazing as well as the service... Be sure to make a reservation

BwYhiLa3eNdvv9rCRC4j8Q.text: Went here for first time.     loved it !  Make sure you make a reservation.   We saw some people who couldn't even sit at bar and mentioned two hour wait.     Service was very good.  Food excellent.   The sauces on everything we're very good.   Bread and butter at each table.   Would prefer if butter was in a dish and not kind you have to unwrap.  Had stuffed mushroom app,  very tasty.  Not your normal kind.    We had stuffed pasta and meatball on side, came with soup as a choice.  Also had chicken Anastasia.   Stuffed chicken which was so flavorful and tender.  Picked salad as side.   If you are local and go on Tuesdays, if you order two drinks and two entrees, you get 20% off your bill.     Well worth it.  Very dark in restaurant, they had small flashlight for menu which was nice.    Singer present and sang throughout restaurant.   Great ambiance.   Romantic place too.    Tiramisu was very good as well.   Would definitely go back

SXpG6eoDy8BEPkc4SHX56w.text: Absolutely Horrible Service. F-    MUST READ ! MUST READ ! MUST READ!  Note to self: if you see a restaurant on a TV reality series about improving horrible restaurants, don't go to it. The service was just as awful as on tv!!! Yah don't eat here  1) Waited 20+min for  Soup and Salad... Soup Super salty  2) 40+ min for our main dish..  Surprise wrong order..  3) Happy hr only at the bar .... Really.. its Vegas man.  4) Waitress asked us once if were doing okay. Asked the group of Cash Cow next to us 15+ time if they needed anything.  5)  Only 3/7 Desert was available . They told us there was Tiramisu was available.  2 minute later None left  6) Wait time /Service horrible... Food Barely above Olive Garden. .... Seating -Dark and hot in the back.  Manager don't seem to give a Turd... I want my 2 hrs of my life back. (Seriously)

iKE9H0cZ0P3tgszrrunQCQ.text: Whaddya Here Whaddya Say... That's what came to my head as I walked in this joint. We waited to be let in, almost as it was a private social club for made men. Nervous as hell thinking I'm going to get whacked. We get access into a dim lit walkway. Bars to your right, take a seat wait for your table. Don't cause any trouble don't be a jerk off. They might show you out the back way.   Cool way you get let in, original to say the least. Bar area with a clear view of the cook line. I chose the Veal Parmigiana, come on for get about it! It's was perfect, the Dame ordered the lasagna & she loved it.    Just having fun with this one. Yes it was a great visit to Capo. Being from out of town it's always great to find a place away from all the touristy hoopla... Thank You Capo for a good dining experience.

dKpoy1XUV2vi2cQ1CE64UA.text: Average food. Nothing was spectacular. House sauce was runny. Bread is fresh. Service is ok. Decor is a mob theme so not very romantic for a date. Good to try once but not on my "wow" list.

viXaiYnDvn9mQ0jmru2eJg.text: LOVE this place! Old school, rat pack vibe.  Great menu selection; something on the menu for every appetite.  Drinks are nice and strong but the best part is entrance and the dim lighting for dinner.  Great experience, food, staff and entertainment.  Wish we had something like this in the Seattle area.

G3j7dL9Nu5bLxCd7Upwy9w.text: AMAZING!!!! Such a GREAT place! The whole "mobster" old school gangster feel is around you! The food is SUPERB AND SO AUTHENTIC! Everything is so generously showered with garlic and cheese! Just AMAZING!!!! I'll be coming back to this little gem the next time we come back! LOVE EVERYTHING AND EVERYONE working at this "joint"!!!!

FAdtn8EQ3zyGYAjhoQrw7A.text: Right off the bat, to only give Capo's one-star, this is a tough one for us because we went out of our way to make sure and have dinner here with the kids, knowing they also enjoy that old-school feel, not to mention their entertainer, Kevin DeCosta. He's very good!   In addition, regarding our uneventful night, I should point out that I did contact a Manager. I spoke to Dominic (sp?). He was very kind and apologetic. He said that the next time we're in town, let him know. He'll make sure it will be a more enjoyable moment. That's cool and I appreciate his offer. But that doesn't erase the fact of what had happened that night. What was worse - it wasn't just one bad thing. It was three consecutive mistakes, one right after the other, and all by the same person, our server, ASHLEY.   1. When a salad is included with your dinner order, the server will read off the choices. Easy, right? Most of us know this drill, simple. Done. Not exactly.
