Ashley read off the choices of salads that come with our dinner, including Caesar Salad. We ordered Caesar.   2. Cocktails. We ordered two Vodka Collins. Easy to make. A regular drink for us. Unless specified, unless we "call" the type of Vodka, the establishment will give you House Vodka.   3. The bill.  Just over $160.00. We pay with cash,  2-one hundred dollar bills. Easy math. 200 minus 160, forty dollars change. Give or take the loose change. But still, simple math, nothing hard.   But here's the thing... Although she reads off the salads as if they were our choices that come with the dinners, the Caesar salads were actually an extra charge. Not once did she say something along the lines of "Caesar is extra, is that okay?"  If she had mentioned this, I promise you we would have said "yes, that's good." Instead, she decided to keep this bit of info from us.   Our Vodka drinks. Although we did our usual ordering of "Vodka Collins", and not a "Call drink", she went ahead and used Kettle One Vodka, not a house Vodka. In other words, yes, there was an extra charge for that, too.  Our bill. Knowing we should receive approximately forty dollars back, Ashley returned with the change. She left. We opened it, double checked everything, and btw, this is when we also saw the above problems. But to top it off... she didn't short change us fifty cents, not even one dollar. We were short ten dollars!   To have these three things happen all on the same night by the same server, and they all have to do with money... I mean, it has to really make you think. In our eyes, this was not a mistake anymore. She clearly deceived us. Definitely not a good thing. You can accidentally give us ranch dressing over blue cheese. Marinara sauce over Meat sauce. But to not state that there's an extra charge for a Caesar; to assume we wanted Kettle One; and to take an additional ten dollars from OUR money?!!!!  However way you want to look at it, it comes down to this, especially since we were the ones to have the unfortunate experience... Ashley was either told by the company to do this. Or she took it upon herself to take us for our money. Big mistake.   I'll say this again - I did reach out to their Manager. Dominic did offer make things right. I don't know what that entails, but he seemed kind and professional. The experience was the worse we have ever had ANYWHERE. However, my kids like that old-school feel. So if we happen to take a trip to Vegas soon, maybe... just maybe we'll give it another shot. But after what happened, that's really a tough one. And if we do and all is 100% better, I'll revise this review, but until then, that was a terrible way to lose customers. Very deceiving. The thought is more like this, "After what had happened, can we trust them?"  To recommend this place would be wrong on my part to the reader. It's clearly spelled out for you, so this is an easy one. If you're looking for that special dinner to go to tonight or the weekend, regardless if you're a local or  visitor, I have to say it might be wise to do the extra homework and browse the many restaurants in Las Vegas and the surrounding areas. Like I said, we're not talking accidentally being served ranch over blue cheese... this is money. Money taken from us. Because of this, Capo's has lost our respect and trust.   And so now as you're deciding, you have to remember: It's your money and it's always your choice.

hQoPYluzkUn7PPb-mJsVUw.text: There are a lot of places in Vegas that don't live up to their hype. This is NOT one of them. Often restaurants that try to capture a scene or time period fall short on food quality or service. Cap's was outstanding from start to finish. The food was fantastic. Some of the best Italian I've had in Vegas. I will 110% return to capo's. Next time I want to try the steak. We had the calamari appetizer. Meatball appetizer (as a meal), chicken parm (no knife needed to cut the chicken) and the sawed off sausage pepper & onions (sauce was unreal) everything was perfect. Our server, Jeremy was great! And they kept the water coming! Never did I have an empty glass. Again. This place was a hard 10!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JFy8fFm7xQjhEmqs6pVafg.text: Great food, great ambiance and great service. Had my 17th wedding anniversary dinner here with my entire family. I could not have been more pleased with the food service and the ambience it was a fantastic meal.

18lHvgCIjMx9ZrxxiQ8dMw.text: One of the best speak-easy Italian restaurants in Vegas.  The staff was very friendly and the food was excellent!  The atmosphere and the entertainment was great!  One of the most enjoyable parts was the singer who sang Sinatra hits throughout the night.  There was individual table entertainment as we waited for our food to be cooked as well  Ours was a magician who entertained us for a portion of time until our meal was completed.    Awesome food.  We ordered two pasta plates, they were filling and delicious.  We ended up ordering the chocolate covered cannolis and those were magnificent as well.  We will definitely be visiting this hidden gem frequently.  Pro-tip - Let your server know you are a local for a discount.

g1MqgPr-Ez6_Uc6bH5rkRg.text: This place is so good. The food was delicious. The service was great my glass was never empty. Five stars straight across. They have a creamy garlic dressing that is to die for. I just found my new and favorite Italian restaurant. There is nothing bad about this place.

dUxAz5vyIOcJbguqe2C_tQ.text: Loved the ambiance, the meatballs were my favorite (still craving them) & the filet Mignon was juicy and delicious .  Our waitress was a delight and made us feel like were were family.  The piano music was playing and even serenaded our table.  We were a party of 10, which everyone knows get tricky with food coming out timely but at Capos the service was great, thank you! we will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday Celebrations! Wine selection was excellent

Hvc8O063a_QItbF6iKvldQ.text: The best hidden gem in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is spectacular. The food is great, the drinks are delicious. Ask for the "Nico" drink you won't be disappointed.  Also as a special bonus you get a lounge singer, who actually sounds like Frankie blue eyes himself.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yup pasta &amp; Capo chicken.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nico drink

E7MlVDlOB5cAvxn43vVCog.text: Weird but lots of fun! Visiting Las Vegas, we took a jaunt to Capo's (Hernando's Hideaway?). Reminiscent of a Sicilian mafia hideout, we literally stood outside the blackened windows, after ringing the doorbell, to be verified before being allowed to enter.  It's dark mood belies a jovial waitstaff and really good food.  We ordered chicken and veal parmigiana, shrimp scampi, and pasta primavera.  All were good, hearty portions and tasteful.  If you are looking for a restaurant with beautifully presented meals, don't go to Capo's.  But if you're looking for good food, a little schtick (think Carnegie Deli), and a respite from the flash and glitz of Las Vegas, then try Capo's Italian Cuisine.  It's an experience.

t9EGlF0Pa7i8NnOpeEkYHA.text: Absolutely perfect! Especially for a vampy girl like me. Super dark surroundings, a light is attached to the menu! My bf surprised me with dinner here for my bday. Perfect for romantic, friends, or family settings. Love the secret entrance, makes you excited to be there. Like you know a lil secret no one else does. My Ribeye was cooked to perfection. Can't say enough great things. Guys take your girl here she will LOVE you, and the food. Cocktail glasses are huge lol so enjoy a drink too.

SAvDTYOjZGdiqaTbBnLORA.text: My husband purchased a Group-On for this place, so we decided to have dinner here during our visit to Vegas.  The atmosphere and the service were good, however, the food is just ok.   I ordered the shrimp scampi and my husband ordered steak and spaghetti.  He says that he likes Olive Garden better. LOL.

OVx8JVoeXZN4NPbeSQ5jUA.text: My nephew and I decided to eat at Capo's. It was a cool experience. First we had to ring a bell and then a hidden door opened to admit us. The ambience was old fashioned. The food was amazing. Groupon had a $20 lunch for 2.

-0mlqvNCMFNOrq606a7SWg.text: Insanely good food and the COOLEST environment! Jen is the absolute best and sweetest bartender - she takes amazing care of us every time. We always leave Capo's with a smile on our face from the live music and fantastic service, as well as happy and full bellies! Everything they serve is just DELICIOUS and the environment is second to none.   Locals love Capo's!!!!

uk03fyE2hveNoEO3yKHO3w.text: Very sadly the service is awful!  Had reservations at 8 pm for booth, get seated at 8:20 in non booth, 8:55 still no salads or appetizers.  Truly awful and unacceptable.

XOJfMOvkHIv53NYfe5yQPw.text: Place is awsome! Good food, good environment great service, only problem is i spent 400$ dinner and they mixed up the doness of our food. Asked for medium ribeye and got med rare, asked for med rare lambchops and got medium

z-CWlRpLZ0HMFNCeVXmCNQ.text: Not in the mood for a detailed review, but great place, entertaining concept, friendly staff, and delicious food.  Had lunch there earlier this week and ordered the meatball appetizer which was Awesome!  Then the Chicken Marsala with Mushroom Risotto, again very good.  I will be back sometime for dinner to take in the old school mob/Sinatra vibe with some cocktails to enjoy the whole speakeasy experience.  But if anyone says that Olive Garden is better than THIS place truly doesn't have much of a taste for fine food.

5m82Gh2DcXYUPX_JRlgocg.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE. From the moment I walked into the restaurant and rang the doorbell to get in and the door had a slit that opened to see who was there.   Totally a mafia style and speakeasy place. Very dark lighting but there are lights on the menus. The booths were great as well as the atmosphere. Mafia stuff to Rat Pack memorabilia hanging on the walls. The Godfather was playing behind the bar and there was a singer walking around to the tables who was great and very entertaining.  Also a magician came to our table to entertain us, he was very good! Impressive and totally interactive.   The food was delicious. Being Italian, I am very picky about Italian food (my mom makes some of the best) so I know what good Italian food is. I have been to many Italian food places and this one is DEFINITELY a standout. I cant wait to go back.  HIGHLY RECOMEND!

0Zs1GLbJWnYVdP3E7pZhhA.text: Good Italian food. There is a Capos in San Fran and I was hoping this was as good as that one. The meatball is for sure on point and worth everyone trying. They're very big. I had the calamari as well which was decent but nothing special. I got the pens with a red sauce. The red sauces was not as good as what I have had in North Beach in San Fran, but still good. Restaraunt definitely has an old school mob feel, with singers and mob movies playing in the background. I would definitely go back.

R5nsXEYEy7ZywIftu5khCg.text: Janeen, our event coordinator at Capo's, did reach out to me via e-mail after seeing this Yelp review wanting to know what Capo's can do to "make it right." On 10/08/17 I suggested, since I was told our group would have much more food with the per person "family style" contract instead of ordering entrees from the menu, and we were served very small portions of food, Capo's should produce an honest calculation of the actual quantity of food that was brought out, equate that to how many full size individual servings that would equate to on Capo's menu at the entree price, and refund the difference between that amount and what we were charged. I resent that e-mail again on 10/27; still no response.

SXuBgLZHe39Kmz9JAW7VGw.text: Super fun place and the food was amazing! I was there was a large group and the staff did great and the food came out quickly. Awesome atmosphere!  Definitely try the Italian egg drop soup.

eA9_7InQXcdFZMRQ4nItYQ.text: Don't let the underwhelming exterior fool you!!!The atmosphere is very reminiscent of a timeless Italian restaurant that you would find in New York or Chicago. Very clean and non pretentious environment. I highly recommend this place to all locals and tourist. This will officially be a staple during my LV weekend getaways. I'm highly impressed. This was beyond just dinner this was a dining experience!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gyLcPvLHGyYEa6iMt-efaA.text: Best hidden Jem in Vegas.  The singer was awesome and the food was the best Italian food.  Will defiantly go back next time we are in town.

d5VaTTzkM-3HyRLj1T0a7A.text: Born and raised in Vegas not sure how we've never been here, but man this place was amazing.  Sat at the bar with the best server Liz.  She gave amazing recommendations (meatball appetizer) and was so friendly.  Can't wait for the next time!!!!

X7de88F1PtKNUTnqtHuwdQ.text: This was my second trip to Capos when in Las Vegas. The pasta is simply amazing. The place is dimly lit and the decor was pretty cool. Pics of famous mafia characters and dishes aptly named to maintain the theme. There were 3 of us that attended and we each had a different pasta dish. Pesto with blackened chicken, spaghetti with meatless meatball and my personal favorite was "chef swims with the fishes" fettuccini in a garlic cream sauce with shrimp. Portions were more than sufficient!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d0OjJB3qqaMvBe7kC3uV8g.text: The food is great! The service is amazing! It is very old school Italian. Very dark and they play Dino! The meatballs are huge! The sauce is just like Nona used to make, so good! Best deal for locals is 2 for Tuesday. Two entrees for the price of one when everyone orders a beverage and eats in the restaurant. I hope I remember this correctly. Definitely will go back.

ZSib85GgPionD5N_GgdQKA.text: The lobster raviolis were amazing, lobster tail addition was perfect to this dish. The staff is very friendly and attentive, atmosphere is perfect replica of a speakeasy if I knew one in 1920's.

0-7X6LlHwPzuDP0Lph4z5Q.text: Love love loved this place. I'm from Chicago and loved the secret door, password entry prohibition theme. They tried for the accent but I think I outdid them. The best chicken parm ever. They had a magician who blew our minds. They also had a guy playing piano and I thoroughly enjoyed myself. Keep it up.

Car0NPkSaK1bXlTt-NBvcg.text: I have dined at Capos a handful of times and each time I loved it! I recently came here on a Tuesday for an anniversary dinner. When you walk in ring the door bell and say the password. Have fun with it. When you're seated you will be given menus that have a flashlight attached to it. The inside is very dark! It's supposed to be like a speakeasy ! The music is beautiful a lot of old Vegas music and every night they have a lounge singer! He's fabulous! I always start with an Italian margarita and the bust a cap mushroom appetizer! Delicious ! Be careful with the margaritas they're so tasty you'll keep drinking without even realizing it! The appetizer was great . The bread they bring out is addicting! My boyfriend ordered a second round! We ordered our mains and couldn't have been happier. I ordered the chef sleeps with fishes pasta with shrimp and sundried tomato's. I loved it but added crushed peppers because I like a kick! The man of the night ordered the chicken luchesse, which was chicken broccoli and mushrooms with a wine sauce. Very tasty. The salads were good ! The House balsamic is my favorite. Also the chicken came with a side of mushroom risotto which was a 10! Also if you have a local ID on Tuesdays you buy two drinks and get 20 off your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gD66Ceslt2KHYbmE_3M5ow.text: We are at Capos for lunch today. Love the vibe and decor  of the restaurant - red ambience with dim lighting. All of our food was amazing including dessert and espresso. Josh was our server and he was very attentive and nice. We will be back next time we are in town.

PQHfLOmoz4nP54TJAKvrlA.text: Very cool place. Great atmosphere, great service and amazing Italian food. Authentic  "Speakeasy" atmosphere. Generous portions and very attentive servers. If dining at dinner time, make reservations as they get crowded. Very reasonable prices as well. Not expensive and worth a trip away from the strip.

7-g9PkAa5eeIBOgZnkX_ww.text: Unfortunately, treatment by management was clearly discriminating between local and non-local guests. The first thing the manager asks is if you are a local resident. If you are, he is personable, friendly, offers you a two-for-one deal, discusses wine selections, and checks back with you frequently to make small talk and to inquire if everything is to your liking. If the manager learns you are a visitor to the state, he does not make any effort to interact with you or acknowledge you in any way. It appears his time and effort are reserved for those who are more likely to return to the establishment because they live there. Although the food was good, its the disparate treatment we received that we'll always remember. It was a first visit for us as well as for the local party who arrived a few minutes after us and were seated two tables away. I'm sure they'll be returning. Despite being frequent visitors to Las Vegas, we will not. The servers were good so poor hospitality seems to be part of "the Manager's Special."

g07llkA4-Mzo933QahF5Lg.text: Skipped out on Hells Kitchen and dined at Capo's... By far the best restaurant decision since we have been here. Wow! Amazing food at amazing prices! Fantastic staff and great atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VSZSBx6kGGQLaYh2iVtHJQ.text: Capo's is an experience that takes you back to old Vegas. Provide the secret password after you've made reservations to get in (or take a look on their website). The speakeasy atmosphere starts from the moment you enter and extends to the host that seats you.   The pasta was great, but the food here was definitely overpriced. A lot of people rave about the Caesar's salad, which was overpriced and overdressed. Tony's duck soup was extremely salty and ridiculously overpriced at $7.95 for a small bowl. Capo's is known for their pastas and one of the favorites is the Scarface shrimp scampi. I admit, I loved the lemon, butter, and white wine sauce and the well-cooked angel hair pasta, but five pieces of shrimp for  $26.95 wasn't worth the price. On top of that, portion sizes are relatively small (unless you get the lasagna). I left still hungry and wishing I had instead ordered the 14 oz. boneless NY strip for $10 more.   However, people come for an off-the-Strip experience, which is what you'll get. In fact, you might even catch an act from The Magic of V, a close-up illusionist and sleight-of-hand artist. I've seen many of the tricks that he performed, but I'm always amazed anyways. Apparently there's a 9:30 show, but we were treated to a table side experience. I would probably come back if an out-of-towner was really craving pasta and a show. Just be ready to pay for on-the-Strip prices.

Ci1nuMLY9jKhBcXWnFmwZQ.text: This is the best authentic Italian spot in all of vegas. Armando did a fantastic job! Food was amazing. Got the most popular dishes on the menu. My guess is everything else must be just as perfect as our other entrees.

WX65tVbxLQgU0-opBgjCYA.text: While out in Vegas for SEMA, I was lucky enough to enjoy the experience of Capo's.     Since I'm from Michigan, I heavily rely on my co-workers from California who know of the hot spots to go to for SEMA, and I just usually go where they tell me to go.     However, when you drive 20 minutes off of the strip, and you're across the street from an Infinity dealership at a place that looks like it could have been a closed down dive bar?   You honestly start questioning yourself...   We arrived with our group and walked in the front door... and went through the fun process of getting into a speakeasy.   I won't give details... I'll leave it for someone else.  But we walked in and it completely took the expectations of the outside and put it to shame.   A place that was greatly decorated, live music, lively bartenders, and people all willing to help you find something that you're looking for.     But as our group was seated, the waitresses grabbed our drink orders, and we were told about what Capo's was known for.   We ordered some capped mushrooms, meatballs, and garlic bread.    Our nibbles were fantastic.   The meatballs that we were told about were just what they explained them to be... absolutely amazing.  Spicy yet satisfying.     Our main courses were also great.   There was a large variety of dishes that were ordered since it was a larger group, but all I could hear were the rave reviews for their ribeye steak, chicken alfredo, chicken piccata, and veal.    I could have rolled myself out of the place if I wanted to, however I didn't want to push it... the food was so good I wanted to enjoy the food and possibly take some back to the hotel.    However, there was no more left when I looked down at my plate.    Also, I have rarely ever needed to say that there was too much alcohol in my drink... but their take on a Long Island.... was out of this world.   I had one, and then the 2nd one was just way over the top.     Great service, great food, and a fantastic atmosphere... leaves me to believe that this is one of the True gems of Vegas.

TRUKOJjWDqLatVSKqUIeAQ.text: Made a reservation to take my boyfriend on Valentines. Loved the speakeasy entrance and character (went to the mob Museum prior). Ordered the 4-course holiday special with artichoke and cheese ravioli, deliciously rich! The staff was wonderful and attentive; I really appreciated how they all seemed close and worked as a team. Definitely would like to come just for the bar experience in the future. Thank you for the delicious dinner!

ovpJuQ3LHvuIu40u3p_CMw.text: Great food, be prepared for a darker atmosphere. But the food is so worth it. Suggest reservations as on a Wednesday night it was hoppin. Also Happy Hour you can only enjoy at the bar then cash out. Worth it though, great specials.

2xA2R82WDt_vkFiOMtXvYQ.text: I felt like I was a mob boss & I ate like a king. Good vibes and accurate atmosphere.

UAZdf81fzHGUsTnCXFkMiQ.text: The gangster vibe is really cool. Very dark Lounge feel. I had a Groupon for lunch. My mom got the chicken Parm and I got the carbonara. We split the cannolis. Everything was delicious and our service was top notch! I do think this place is probably better at night. I'll just have to come back:)

l-UpA5bbNOpECeRG7mWm-w.text: Don't know what everyone else is talking about.  Atmosphere was fun, food was fair, entertainment was way to loud to have a conversation, service was non existent, price was higher than expected (even with groupon).  Would not go out of my way to go back.

dJhFLgN8EPa35NU7Bo32wg.text: Was in town last week for meetings and as always I MUST have italian and Capo's is my go to place. They sat me at the bar to eat which I enjoy because you can watch all of the team working on making the amazing dishes. I had the lasagna, a side of Risotta and the busta caps. The service is always great and the food is simply amazing. I am so happy that someone told me about this place 3 years ago. Oh They also now have garlic chess bread which I really enjoyed.

OyBsgw-aQ4At6Xru1DUZgQ.text: The service was great and the atmosphere was enjoyable and my party and I had fun listening to the guy singing the whole time. However, the food was really mediocre and I wasn't impressed by it at all considering the price. This is my second time here and both times, my meal came out bland and disappointing. My first meal here was bland and pathetic looking. However, my second time eating here, not only was the food bland, it was undercooked. My scarface shrimp scampi was undercooked. It was bathing in oil and fat but without much flavor AND I COULDN'T EAT IT! I had everyone at my table sample it and everyone thought it was not cooked properly and definitely far from tasty.

8oWYYcgaklI3f_fpF4ZmUg.text: It's off the beaten path and it's an excellent find! It's dark, cozy and has an east coast feel. The Sinatra singer was great and the staff was very attentive. The food was pricey but beyond yummy, so it was worth it.   This place has an ambiance factor that you just have to experience for yourself! Go, Go, GO!

LTSoQXSXf2kAH-ho7ncrBA.text: Went for lunch today with DH. We had a Groupon which made our meals a bargain.  We  each had the house salad with garlic dressing-- garlic was mild, not pungent.  DH and I share the meatball sandwich ( 2 big size meatballs) and a plate of creamy pasta carbonara. Food was delicious. We got free refills of soda. It took awhile for the food to come but it arrived hot and with a smile. We would definitely return next time we're in Vegas.

VrC1F81_Ocwld8dXrjJU8Q.text: Loved the atmosphere and the food. A Las Vegas find. Well worth the drive off the strip. What's the password?

m-RRrXXmncmu3NEhVZlcgA.text: Atmosphere was definitely 1930's/40's and food was excellent. The entertainment was a little loud, so it was hard to carry on a dinner conversation.  Friendly staff and food was served quickly.  Reservations is a good idea to guarantee seating.

ty9SJioW6e8HAqPYydHY0A.text: My husband and I had dinner here last night and the food is outstanding.  The Alfredo is amazing..... the atmosphere is unique and I highly recommend.

955v0bWlSbS2glsL0zsi8w.text: Got a travelzoo coupon through my company. We arrived for lunch and they were a little bit slow opening the door for us (you have to ring a buzzer and they let you in through a hidden door!).  Once inside, the decor and atmosphere were pretty amazing.  It looked like what you would expect a speakeasy to look like.  We ordered from the limited menu that is made available for the coupon and the limitations were very reasonable (pick a pasta or sandwich as your entree).  My husband and I both picked a pasta dish.  He got the carbonara which he said was the best one he had ever had (high praise coming from my picky husband).  I had the basic spaghetti and marinara sauce and it was pretty amazing as well.  The salad dressing was fantastic (we both had the creamy garlic).  Like I said, they were short-staffed that day, so the service was a bit slow, but overall it was a great experience.

FI_meRNOeusS2shhuHFFtw.text: this place is the worst in the world bad everthing, no italian anything in that dirty place been closed in past due to health codes, runs like a train to hell, capos is a bad bad bad choice on any level, just close up, leave las vegas, if capos is owned by italians, they had a name change, this waste of time place sucks. you make F&B biz a joke. i hate your, joke joint, leave vegas.

D3iLdfgk-EmNQI7PgGDpZg.text: Black velvet wallpaper, red velvet chairs, dark wood bar, sparkly crystal chandeliers, live piano music, door dudes with attitudes, out-of-this-world service, reasonably priced bottles of wine...I totally fell in love with this place. I can't believe I only just now found out about Capos (thanks Yelp!).  I highly recommend Capos for a romantic date night or large groups of friends. It's also a reliable attraction for your stubborn Midwestern relatives who refuse to eat hummus and sushi.  My husband and I intended to enjoy "Fuggedaboudit Fridays," but Capos said "fuggit" to that happy hour special. But the bar honored the deal because they're cool like that.  My husband and I split the shrimp scampi appetizer, which is only about five pieces of average sized shrimp set on top of a bed of delicious bread that's soaked in butter and garlic. It was delicious but a little overpriced. Order it during happy hour instead. By the way, an interesting event happened while we sat at the bar. The mobbish door dudes fireman-carried a drunk man from the front door to the back. I don't know if the drunkard was hired to enter the restaurant that way but I thought, "Wow. That really completes the mob atmosphere."  For dinner my husband and I sat in one of the red round booths, split a chicken marsala (I think) and a bottle of old vine Zinfandel ($35). I would have eaten more if I wasn't counting calories.   Capos deserves at least 4.5 stars, based on my first visit. I haven't tried enough of the menu to give it five. Right now, though, I favor Capos over Nora's and Herbs & Rye.

pL-JInV_gWFYVDv4RiFaKA.text: Second experience  much better  than the first! Homeade pastas are delish and the creamy garlic dressing  needs to be bottled.  Definitely  deserves a 3rd try

HtDpRXAsKtlvckzi-rKI0g.text: This is a great place for dinner. It's like stepping back in time..the way Las Vegas was in the 50's & 60's.,..we have eaten their twice and the food was delicious. I had the gallows with clams and my wife had Vinny's ala vodka.  The entertainment is a gentleman singing frank Sinatra songs. A nice thing is they have a 2 for 1 on Tuesdays for locals

LVVAgSJVST9r0hTwn47a6Q.text: Went to dinner last night with my husband-made reservation and off we went.....loved the entry way (guy who poked his head out the peep hole was funny) the whole atmosphere was a cool experience- the guy who walks around singing ol town songs was good entertainment-if u give him too much eye contact he will involve u in his performance so if you want privacy its best not too:)  our waitress was HORRIBLE!! She came to our table a total 3times (got drinks-took order-brought check!!)which made for a very long dinner-1 1/2hrs.....the bus boys/real waiter is who I found at end of night and handed a tip too!!  Salad w/dinner was ok*Rigatoni Trafficante was delish I must say Husbands 14oz Ribeye I wanted to break out a scale-NO way it was more than 9oz *mad i didnt take a picture to post.....my husband looked at me and said the garlic mashed potatoes had 0% flavor....I tasted and was sooooooo disapointed:(  Coulnt believe they charged 39.95 for this steak !!! Bill came to over $80 And it was sooooo not worth the dough.... sorry this comment comes from a real italian who knows how to cook.....but its good for a one time experience if you just get the pasta.....

yUssaK_GSHZxCR4DY80Qgw.text: Recently had my elderly Aunt come for a visit along with my Cousin. I thought it would be a fun place off the strip to entertain them.  It turned out to be a disappointing disaster. We ordered 4 entries and none of them came out right from the kitchen. I ordered veal Parm. It comes with a side of spaghetti. There was no grated cheese offered. Something unheard of in a supposedly Italian restaurant. Did I say my Aunt and Cousin are from South Philly so we know Italian. My wife ordered the "signature"clams and spaghetti in Red sauce. She got clams in white sauce. My Cousin ordered shrimp scampi. Not spicey. She got extra spicey. We learned later her scami went to another table. The guest of honor, my Aunt, ordered spaghetti and sausage which she didn't get. It evidently got lost in the kitchen. The waitress was very apologetic and in fairness they did take off 2 entries from our bill. But the evening was ruined. If this was a real "speakeasy" the chef and owner would have been taken away in a car trunk. I'll be skipping anymore visits to this seudo Italian restaurant any time soon.

FhFmxXcyqV8wyA-Kjz2Sww.text: My favorite place for a date! This place is away from the chaotic strip and the staff is super friendly. Candle lights are every table making it a very romantic experience, definitely a great place for anniversary dinners for couples. Still very sad they closed down their original location. :(

OzS9V4RSG2Y6Xj6T8LirsA.text: I was a little scared at first when we entered the place, or tried to.  The door opens to a BOX.  Then a little window opens with an overbearing Italian sayin, "Ju gotta reserbation?"  We didn't but he let us in anyway since it was early.  Once inside, I was still scared.  it was DARK, like a fortune tellers den, kinda eery.   We decided to stay and try it.  The service was a little slow to start, but they comped our drinks since they forgot us for the first few minutes.  Their specialty drink menu has some GREAT drink combos that I had never seen before.   I had eggplant parmesean with risotto and wedding soup.  It was excellent.  Hubby had Spagetti and Meatballs, said it was SPICEY but good.  The prices were EXPENSIVE over $20 for pasta plates, over $30 for protein plates.   The singer was excellent.  I would have given higher reviews, but i'm not into the DARK lighting thing.  I had to take home leftovers to actually SEE what I ate. When its so dark,  maybe you don't clean so good....who knows.   Brighten it up a bit and I'll be back again and again.

dcmQFeGgA215m4wM2Sw-Tw.text: Wow what a great place! Definitely a must GO! Great place for a date night. They have someone singing live music which makes a very romantic atmosphere. Make sure to make dinner reservations and allow at least 2 hours for dinner. Money saving tip: Tuesday is 2 for 1night. You can also find a discount on restaurant.com.

q4jY1VsMBI5OlQpnLSLM8w.text: This is the one place I love to take visitors to when they want to experience "old Vegas".  The ambiance reminds you of the days when the Rat Pack could be expected to be sitting in the corner.  The entrance is speak easy style. The food is wonderful and the service is good and consistent. I have taken business relations and the best of friends here.  The "Sinatra" style singer is actually really good, taking you to a place and time that made Vegas what it was....and is now. A definite yes!

x2ZFDkgQWn48Dtgks2dp6g.text: I have been going to this place for years, and I love it! From the live music to the unique atmosphere, this restaurant is a must for a date night or even the beginning to a night on the town. The prices are equivalent to that of a certain major Italian restaurant chain but the food and atmosphere are so much better. They do old school Las Vegas in a very classy way. This is definitely one of my most favorite restaurants in the Vegas area. This place would also be suitable for bringing guests that are from out of town.

wXiYZcfsYCx_39x4NrNeYg.text: This was an interesting experience.   Made reservations 2 days out for my girlfriend and I for 7:30, but ended up waiting until nearly 8:30 to be seated. Due to the wait, the host offered to seat us at the bar with a 50% discount on our order but more on that later.   This restaurant goes all in with the speakeasy atmosphere. From the moment you step in the door you will recognize it (not to spoil anything like it was spoiled for me). It is dimly lit and there was a man playing piano and singing Frank Sinatra while we ate. Overall, I would say this restaurant nails the vibe it is going for.   On to the food. For appetizer we ordered the Bogey's Bruschetta, which was good but not the best bruschetta i've had. As an entree, I had the Uncle Pauly's Arrabiata and my girlfriend had the Vinnie's Alla Vodka. Both seemed to be drowning in watered down sauce. While I was not expecting much from an Italian restaurant in Vegas (I am from the NY/NJ area), I was disappointed.   When it came time for our check, the bartender who had been taking our orders was thoroughly confused regarding the host's offer. He asked us for proof we worked "in the industry" which confused us just as much. Things were eventually figured out when they were able to communicate.   While I am glad I tried Capo's, I would probably skip it my next time in Vegas.

Hayh3oQk1NKOWnq1kP17hg.text: OMG.  This place is EVERYTHING!!!!!! I'm so happy my nephew brought us here.  I'm not a big Italian lover. But I suggest everyone to try this place.  I had the Shrimp Scampi and the Ravioli.  So So So Good.  I will  absolutely be back.  I can't believe I didn't take any pictures.  I was hungry..... Chow for now

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Empty Plate. Lol.... Chow for now

f7pyAV-tKhqf5fySspe4Ew.text: Capo's is an experience from the time you walk in the door. Just push the button, that's all I'll say.  Food is great. I had some spicy pasta with Italian sausage. It had a good amount of garlic and I had enough for lunch the next day.  The decor is your typical 50's mobster hangout. Dark lighting, but they attach flashlights to the menus. Quite a variety of menu options too.  The price is a little expensive, but the whole package makes it worth it. I'm surprised this place isn't on the strip. They could make a killing there.

ZrTmSSzu8FW3MINtZq-I7w.text: Just left Capo's where we had drinks and appetizers. We did not  know it was happy hour. I had the Capo specialty drink for $8 and I was very pleased with it. I don't like sweet drinks and the bartender (Filomena) did a great job mixing the cranberry juice, vodka and Cointreau  & lime without  too much sweetness. We ordered 2 appetizers - the calamari and the meatball. And they were excellent- crunchy calamari and flavorful  huge meatball. Capo is more of a dinner restaurant where you can have a great meal. It is not just a  bar, which is what speakeasies are. The aroma of  food being cooked in their kitchen makes your mouth water. But they do make the place look and feel like a speakeasy- the unassuming shack that is the restaurant, dimly lit, a piano and a singer, they provide little lights for you to see the menu. And to enter you need to press the door bell and someone will ask you why you're there. You just need to give a standard answer - like "vinny sent me" . Be original. Go there and enjoy the meal and order your wine and cocktails. And soak in the ambience. And also- they're open for lunch and the price is very reasonable

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mob pictures on the wall
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance to Capo&#39;s

wI96cpYxohWGHAo5JuLUNA.text: Ahh-mazing!!! I am literally obsessed with the Italian Mafia.. like.. its borderline concerning.. anyway.. from the "password" needed to get in, the surprise entry and escorted walk to your table, you actually really feel like you're "connected"! So much fantastic news clippings and pictures from the 5 families.. and of course the HUGE picture of Al Capone! The food was fantastic and the portions are so big. We all took leftovers back to the hotel. I had the Calamari and it was HEAVEN! I cannot wait to go back! Its a definite MUST while you're in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak with potatoes
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My other booo,  Frank
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jootuxu_O8SfvmY6wODlsQ.text: The vibe is cool here, except for the loud, mansplainy ginger bartender, breaking the vibe of everyone within 15 feet pontificating about an Aperol Spritz like it's something new.  The food is solid, but not exceptional at its price point.   I really enjoyed the pasta dishes we had, but the steak was a bit over-cooked and under-seasoned.

zejQVe7ZBtTDrIlztEYFEA.text: Great food and atmosphere, we really enjoyed the singing. The server was very inattentive.

Ll9E3p0yROPIyQA5QMvXUQ.text: This place would be more appropriate on the Strip. They attempt the allure of a Rat Pack era Italian dinner club, but with less class. For me, it didn't go over well. The guests in the place look similar to a 2 am crowd down at Fremont Street Experience. I know the establishment can't help this, but that's just the kinda crowd it seems to attract.  The whole speakeasy entrance thing was lost on me. I ended up standing in the entrance for at least 5 minutes before someone finally opened the window and did the whole hassling/heckling thing. It was our friend's birthday, so we had to go through the whole ordeal again to go get presents out of our cars. They should have a secondary entrance for this to save people time.  The bar is nice, except you are seated right in front of the stove, not even 15 feet in front of you, and it's hot mess. It's hot because of the giant flames from the burners, and it's just a mess from all the food. The bathrooms were also a mess; I'm not sure anyone was attending them throughout the night. Also, be wary of the floor. Parts of it seemed to be uneven. It felt like they put construction grade carpeting over old flooring that needed repairs.   The service was meh. We were seated at 8 pm. Didn't have orders taken till about 8.45. The weird "We're gonna give you a hard time cause we're Italian" thing seemed to unintentionally extend to our waiter, who seemed all too cool to meet our questions with any helpful answers.   I lived in Italy for just under a decade. And there's a fine line with Italian food trying too hard or not trying enough. This place didn't try enough. My linguini with clams and white sauce had little flavor, although the pasta was cooked very well. Their salad was the best thing I had here. I would consider coming back just for that.   Oh, and they don't split checks. So don't bother asking. Again, everything about this place belongs on the Strip with places like Dick's Last Resort and Tournament of Kings. There's far better Italian food in this city without all the strings attached. I'll stick with Bootlegger or the Italian American Club. Same price, better service, classy joints.

XiOLa0JD9kpW5beM1BLclg.text: Had the meatball and spaghetti and it was great. Italian margarita was perfect. Great service but be careful if you don't like garlic (that's your problem ). It is very dark at first but after awhile it's only just dark. Great atmosphere we loved it and will be back again.

-pTHG85NiALq-kH8EV9n7w.text: I really wanted to like this place-especially because we went for my birthday. Hmm.   Setting: My boyfriend surprised me with this place and upon entering it did not disappoint. Really cool speakeasy entrance and when you actually walk in it's very dark and you can see the main dining room within the distance, pianist and singer up front, a walkway towards it with booths to the left and kitchen to the right.   Seating: Unfortunately they were so busy that night that we got the literal first booth by the entrance. Horrible. I could barely make out the music or song being sung up front and you can't see anything beyond the large booth other than the kitchen grill/the the dining bar area (think old school diner with chairs up front and the food cooked in the kitchen you can see), and the restroom sign. *see photos*  SO many people passing by, massive groups next to us waiting for their table, barely could hear and see the entertainment in the main room( I literally walked to it to figure out what was happening), constantly hearing the kitchen pans clanking and chefs yelling to each other, and unappetizing looking up to the restroom sign glaring at me.  Food and drink: super hard to see the menu because of the darkness, but luckily each menu comes with a small super bright light if needed.  I enjoyed their wine and beverage menu. Lots to offer in terms of cocktails and wines. (Went with a Riesling) .  Appetizer-fried ravioli was delicious! Paired with the sauce and salad was on par. Also got the duck egg drop soup and that was delicious as well!  Entrees- my boyfriend got the pesto linguine and we both enjoyed that. I got the scarred shrimp scampi with angel hair pasta, and I wasn't impressed. The sauce was definitely butter/wine which was flavorful, but I hoped it would be creamier and stick to the pasta. The shrimps were over cooked and the pasta seemed bland after the sauce would slide right off.   Service: our server was definitely nice and helpful. I cannot complain about service from our server. Refilled waters, noticed when we finished courses, etc. (However, we were still midway eating and another server came and offered us to go boxes in the middle of dinner...)  Overall, my first experience was mediocre mainly based on our unfortunate seating and my choice of entree. $83 before tip spent on my birthday for a mediocre night. I may come back if I can request a different area and with friends for cocktails and different food.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My view from our booth -_-
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rat Pack Pesto linguine with added chicken
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My view from our booth -_-

CF40rIRcV5nDoYvi1p27NQ.text: Great dood! Doesn't look like much from the outside but very classy indoors and amazing food!!!! My favorite speakeasy I've been to! Chicken parm is life!!! We will be back for sure!!!

bplcggu1w55lQT0gYTM39Q.text: The Enforcer was the best server ever! So nice and always checking to make sure everything was good. Which it was. Such a fun atmosphere and great food.

bq0j0QHxjrQSSzkbcUucwA.text: This was by far the best Italian restaurant Ive been to in my life. It's cute also. This restaurant takes on the "Mob theme" with an expecting (because most of you read all the reviews) Speakeasy style. My dish was fantastic. I had the Shrimp with Arbiatta sauce. The shrimp wasn't overcooked like most restaurants and the sauce.....  The sauce is worth buying which I believe they sell.  Our waiter was fantastic as well even through the blackout (which we though was part of the theme

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One word. GREAT

QPhgSzkum6qo6--6zoaQ3g.text: Best meatballs ever. Better than my Pops when I was a kid and my favorite quiet speakeasy type atmosphere. Great staff and owners. Even the line chefs were cool.

oFeBI-r1NkI2b-0IYwxB-A.text: I was a bit disappointed on my last visit on Sunday August 25th around 5 pm. We think they lost our kitchen ticket due to the excessive amount of time it took for our food to come. They brought us bread 5 times. People who were there after us got their meals before us. There was only 4 of us. Our waitress was great when she was there but disappeared for lengthy amount of time. We asked for to go boxes and the guy went behind the bar and socialized. We had to ask again, someone else if we could have to go boxes. I really don't see us going back, sorry.

fuwohAhONb8gvgoTTr4pDA.text: Great food, great experience!  Found this gem on my last visit to Las Vegas and I'll definitely be back.   I don't know what Vegas felt like in the 60's but I imagine this is pretty close and the food is awesome!  Be sure to leave room for the canoli!

CEyiHcvdhxnDRpMbW8LvUQ.text: We had a very large party with us. The idea for the party was the roaring 1920s and what better way to celebrate than to go to a speakeasy. The idea of this restaurant amazing . Standing in the room, saying the password, being granted access from behind a different door fabulous.   However the service was not. We only had one server and possibly this was to much due to how large the party was. Our drinks lagged being refilled, the salads took awhile before being presented, then the entrees took even longer. We didn't order appetizers as we were on a time frame. Thank goodness we didn't.   There were many dishes ordered, from raviolis, alfredo, meatball, and such.   The food was fair, mine nor the person sitting beside me was hot.   I wish this experience would have been different especially because it was a birthday party and I heard great things about this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raviolis
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alfredo
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian vinaigrette salad

YebG_2V01G20J3zRdjjMKA.text: The best spaghetti I've ever had in a restaurant!! Their sauce is fantastic, garlicky...but not too much, spicy but not too hot...absolutely perfect.  I added a meatball to my spaghetti thinking it may need a bit of extra flavor and it didn't. That sauce....I couldn't get enough of it!!  You know how you get instant gratification from delicious-food...but you're too full to take another bite....but darn it it tastes so good!!?? It was one of those moments.    The servers were nice and efficient too.  We loved the theme...monster meets old Vegas.  Dark, crystal chandeliers, candle lit tables/semi circle booths...in red of course. Comfortable and fun.    We loved it and will be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch portion spaghetti $10...added meatball $5.

OX9AFAQc0AC3UBQneZJiyA.text: Capo's   A group of us traveled out to Capos Italian Restaurant and Speakeasy for the Old Vegas experience! Once you arrive you will enter the restaurants foyer and you will need to knock to get in..  The restaurant is very dark but that was part of the theme!  There was six of us.... The service was so-so.  Drinks were slow and we had to ask four times for bread.... they brought butter the first time but no bread.  The food was magnificent! We started with the recommendation of the Meatballs! Yup I and now I'm recommending it to you! It was delicious!  For the main course I had the chicken piccata with a side of fettuccine Alfredo and a few glasses of probably one of the best moscato I've ever had. Finished it up with the lave cake!   My wife had the stuffed rigatoni. I had a few bites of hers and it too was delicious. The only thing about her dish was it had too much sauce. For the record you will never here me say to much sauce, dressing or gravy... but this had too much.  Over all:  -1 Star for having to ask to many times for bread.  yes I would recommend Capos   yes I will be back.

0rHCmXMEtdXb_CVatC-_mg.text: What a Fun atmosphere!  Takes me back to the days of Frank,Sammie, Judy, and Dino!  Great food! Fantastic service!   Please do the manhattans!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Martinis
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CCH0wrJVFA55yU2eZyN2sg.text: Amazing food, staff, music and environment   I loved the staff so sweet and kind. The doorman is hilarious and just add to the environment. Love the dark and hints of red in the restaurant.  Will definitely be coming back

_P1uYUG2rZ_k9lBCeCrc_A.text: My best friend showed me this for dinner one night... so good! We rented the movie room and it was a blast.   Went there last night, I got sangria & husband got a whiskey drink. Both were delicious and our server started out great. Unfortunately toward the end my food came out cold and our server didn't come back until around dessert time. When we asked to speak with a manager, no one came so we ended up leaving after paying our bill  Based on my first visit I'll more than likely be back but I was a little disappointed.

8fmYE3O0vJNjnzabjBA4jg.text: Really neat restaurant. The food is always amazing and the service is typically great as well.

UV6bpzFv14hwK8fWlbtI7Q.text: Delish!! A fun experience from the entry to desert.  Has to be my favorite Italian spot in Vegas.  Service was prompt and attentive.  The food does not disappoint and the cocktails are just as refined.   A must when in Vegas!

0DSW8vGHxBI9wwIJeoEjoQ.text: Way to expensive $200  and more for 4 people 2 of which we're kids. I had no idea going into a large party that their calamari salad and pasta would be this outrageous. And on top of that after eating there I got sick. Vomited. And still starved after spending $200 and more not suggesting it's a ripoff they treat you like trash
