pdATf_ZQ6hxG_V8setn4jA.text: On groupon deal...is good but very limited on the burger $1 FOR CHESSE 2$ less than a strip of bacon .... pasta is a good portion and the 5$ for chicken is a good deal Oh salad is inclueded. Service almost perfect.!!! And of curse The ambience is very classic Italian With the mob twist

pHd70PAG_8KDNmjcvZygUg.text: Great place for a group. Family style food and decent Italian.  Super loud, so it's hard to do business.  Prices are reasonable and the cannoli is a must have.

GoRr3-1SMDxT-XyEJ2fTxw.text: Ate here about a week ago. Loved the food and for locals, make sure you ask for the $40 off on Tuesdays. Saved us a load of money on double date night. The bread is amazing and so is the piano player. Only thing I didn't like is he expected us to pay him, just by coming over to our table to sing a song (that we didn't request).

hdK-0opUiU3YofmKQD2kTA.text: The tiramisu was so delicious for two!!  I loved being serenaded to and the duck soup is delightful.  Thank you Ramiro for the experience

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tPQkhmGgo0un44Prijv1UA.text: This is a very unique place it's one of a kind type of place. The food it's good, my favorite it's the meat balls!  I recommend this place to anyone looking for a good Italian place.

hC1-yXW7tCJq-v0rMOmitQ.text: I dined there on the evening of the seventh. After standing in a freezing room for ten minutes to get in the building I told the person at the front that we were waiting for one more person. Please get a table ready and we will be at the bar. Great. Sat at the bar and watched my friend ringing your bell standing outside AGAIN. Tried to let her in tried to find someone. Nothing. After ten minutes of her standing in the cold someone finally walked over. I just paid the bar tab and wanted to sit down. Well I was told it will be about 15 minutes..... I said thirty minutes ago we needed a table!! Ok 15 minutes later we sit down and the waitress ERIN told us she would take it nice and slow to let us catch up. Awesome thank you! That was her way of saying she will check on us once a hour.  As we ordered drinks she would drop off one drink for the whole table then come back 20 minutes later with another. The people were disrespectful! The food was horrible! I asked to talk to a manager when I stepped away from the table trying to not embarrass everyone, nothing. I'd think you would do something as a server when everyone at the table takes one bite of their entree and says "let's go". But no. Now best of all walking out looking at your "open kitchen" as a passing glance seeing the cooks cleaning up you literally see one of them shoe a rodent away with their foot!!! That was it! I've called many times asking to speak to a manager and after the third time with no response I think a few online reviews should know about your rodent problem and your disgusting food. Now we can let AMEX deal with them and the health department.

kCh8kuYOKhIkvKkBRlnObQ.text: Had a great night and Armondo served us well!  The magician and classical music singer were the icing on the cake!

VB74GQ4Nzvnp9t7fDPyTVA.text: We have been wanting to eat here for a long time and finally did.  Everything I expected and then some.  First off, the ambience....super groovy and cool.  Second, the staff...very friendly and helpful. Third, the food....all I can say is wow.  The meatballs took my breath away. What a fantastic recipe and execution.   My wife's salad was awe inspiring and her entree lived up to the hype.  I myself had a secret off menu item that I learned about from a tv show.   Needless to say...off the chart.     The singer crooning all night was fantastic and went out of his way to ensure we were having fun. What a sweetheart.  We tipped him on the way out (no one else had up to that point ...cmon people he is not there because he has nothing else to do).  Overall...an A+   Kudos to the team at Capo's....everyone was working towards a great customer experience and that is exactly what we had!!!!  See you again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The secret menu item that lives up to the hype.

5MBk5oRwToau4i_mGRFxMA.text: Love the ambiance and the food. One of my favorite places to eat while I am in Las Vegas.

H1PviejDFRFJIapHDywSXA.text: What a fun place to come and eat! Make reservations and get the secret password ;) It has a speak easy kinda feel to it. Dark & red lighting on the inside. Menus come with a little tiny flashlight. We had dinner on a Friday night. So I'm not sure if the entertainment is there every night. Service was great. Our waitress was on top of keeping everyone happy. My only little hiccup was because of my clam dish, I hate to have little pieces of sand in them, maybe they just weren't cleaned enough but I have been to places where I never had that issue. That's my only reason for 4 stars. Had a great time. I would come back but I would order something different.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious!! Totally worth coming to. Don&#39;t forget the password!

BIjpN8qOCLr5QkvZpXq-Qg.text: One of my new favorite restaurants in las Vegas! The atmosphere was amazing, food was amazing and the service was on pointtttttt. Came here with 5 of my friends everyone was extremely satisfied. Will definitely be back!!!

oYJAt0AOFZLtjZXWlQEjSg.text: No way dude. So over-rated. I am soooo pissed!   Not sure if everyone giving this place rave reviews is from Iowa or something, but as someone who knows REAL Italian cooking and what to expect... skip this place. We were all so excited to try Capo's. Over 700 amazing reviews? Have we finally found our new place?  The food sucks. Bad. Extremely garlic-y, yet sauce is still bland and tasteless. Meatballs were nothing special. Cheeses don't taste fresh. Soup was weak, served in a tiny ass bowl with no gusto. The veal was horrible. Just horrible.  At one point I looked to my father, typical wise-guy type, and said "tourist trap?"- he laughed and shrugged it off.    Our waitress moved at a glacial pace and the bussers were awkward and brought food out COLD. We actually had to send it back to the kitchen. That's mortifying. I could feel myself getting angrier and angrier as dinner wore on.   You would think for over $200 for 4 people (one of them being 7 yrs old), the food would be fantastic.  Not so much.  At the end of the meal, dad looked over at me and said "tourist trap."  Guess the search continues.

RnohdSnX1XDA9GU2ZP2xJw.text: Great service, great atmosphere and great food. Super attentive. Always checking on us, grabbing our plates, filling our drinks. Really just all around great experience. I have been here at least 5 times and it's never disappointed.

bW-wuaLOi1Sbc9xpwtsUgA.text: Atmosphere, waiter and ambiance were awesome but my lasagna was subpar. I'd probably go back to try something else only because the experience was awesome.

hZoG0XjiQ3Q5fmm0pnl-cA.text: Best authentic Italian food!! The place itself says it all..  My family & I first time here & will definitely be back when we're in town.... I highly recorecommend it..

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lWv3ca25Cn8hdvlwtQSkbQ.text: I found this gem while searching for Italian food surrounding my job.  My work wife and I decided to try it out for lunch last week and we're super excited that we did.  The entry and the decor for the entire restaurant is 100% on point for the era and the theme they are trying to portray.  Without giving away too many secrets, the hidden door and the speakeasy theme was awesome!  The lunch menu was a little slim, and although great, I would have loved to have more pasta options.  I ended up getting the meatball sandwich and my friend got the chicken parm sandwich.  It was fantastic!!  I wish they would offer a regular salad as a side for the sandwich instead of pasta salad or French friends, but overall the meal and the ambiance was amazing!  I sneaked a peak at the dinner menu and the dinner price point is a little on the high side, with most plates being 20+ dollars.

ts7RvSudSppOeDrlgKqj7Q.text: Overall VG The gimmick is old timey speakeasy, mob chic.  although they didn't  put too much effort into playing that.  Dimly lit with an abundance of red leather/vinyl semi circle banquettes, plus tables for dining.  Chandeliers over the tables were for effect not a light source.  Singer was going through the motions but his voice could not be discerned from his accompanying music track, he stood behind the piano but never did play while we were there. Magician doing table magic was entertaining and capable. We had four diners and four different entrees from Angels with dirty faces, sleeps with the fishes, Vinnys ala vodka with an added meatball (+5$)and the lasagna.  All diners were very pleased with the food, flavorful and ample servings.  Tiramisu and choc covered cannolis were better than average, cappuccino was very small and not as hot as it should have been--- needed to have the cup prewarmend. Cocktails are spendy, but alas we are in Vegas. Worth a visit

w5GVZxf0eTvtf8i0D9m1bQ.text: This place was fantastic! The service was great, staff is playful, friendly and go out of their way to make sure you are taken care of. We were the last diners of the night on a Tuesday and never once felt rushed to finish. Normally I would think that theme restaurants can be a little cheesy but not the case here, it was just good fun. And I loved the food. Both the italian and ceasar dressing on the salads were great. We had the mushroom caps appetizer-yum! Then the lasagna and spaghetti with meatballs - cooked to all dente perfection! I will recommend this place to everyone headed to Vegas. It's off strip but take an uber instead of a cab and it's much cheaper. Definitely worth the fare!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a-ydrU6zqSQmaVpPIVkorg.text: On vacation with friends we Yelp this amazing place and WOW!!!! This place is the best Italian food I have ever had. The service is incredible! The music, the lighting and the smell from the kitchen melts my heart. The meatballs are a fight to the death at the table :) please please come and have dinner here!!!

_3OjBqOGIkIuGb_BQIq8uw.text: Wow.  What a cool place to go.  If you are in vegas...capos is vegas.  Service service service.  Food was fantastic.  It's like you are going back in history and feasting with trouble...very fun.  Had the chicken parm...was a hit.  Get it.

B58_fkZj7h-Qp9P_2vw0EQ.text: I honestly try to shy away from reviewing if I am not happy about service or food but this time I just can't. My friends and I have raved about this place to friends from London and since I had a Groupon for lunch we brought them in. What a mistake. I'm not sure if it was the fact that we had a Groupon or what the issue was but our experience was terrible. Have been here many times for dinner before and it's been amazing. All I can say is today was the exact opposite. Management should figure something out for their lunch specials and service during lunch otherwise it will be as slow and as terrible as it was today for us. My friends and I don't mind paying for good service and good food but today we paid for only good food. We plan to bring our friends back for dinner to show them exactly what we raved about and hopefully it will be so much better the next time.

dqm4L_gTVdGYfnFQu6GU-g.text: About 6 months back at a concierge event for work, I won a $50 gift card to Capo's. I had dined here once previously so I was pretty stoked to have a chance to go again. Also I enjoy when local places are willing to donate meals to other local establishments or events.  The first time I came here, the secret door threw me way off. I won't say too much and ruin in. I will say enjoy it, and play along. This time, I had my 16 year old step son and he was confused and thought we took him to a closed gangster establishment. His reaction was worth it alone.  The lighting is dim, and your menus come with small lights for those who may not be able to see the menu in the dark. (ie: me) There is live entertainment, and a cheesy mob boss who is kind of hanging out and running things. Although he is very involved and I don't believe he sees himself as cheesy one bit. The godfather is playing in the background. (Last time it was Casino) There is even a man selling roses. They go all out with the old school speakeasy type of vibe.  The service was mediocre, don't get me wrong our waitress was pleasant. But slow, and un-attentive. Our drinks went empty and the bread basket was out, often.  The food however made up for it. Meatballs and peppers appetizer is a must. The meatballs are a good quality meat that melt in your mouth the way they should. Just the right amount of spice lingers on your tongue leaving you hungrier than when you arrived. The pasta in all the dishes seemed like they were made in house. The bread and cheeses were fresh and authentic, and the salad came with a great house dressing. I didn't like the cheesecake, but unless its straight from NY or Cheesecake Factory, I usually don't.  Overall, its high priced, but the atmosphere helps out and easily makes this a great place for a date night or special occasion.

gutLw41cr2i5ubXdt2epVw.text: Just got home from dinner at Capo's. My first time there. Wow! Blown away! Easily one of my new favorite restaurants. What an amazing experience. A+

5rhG0mRmHnE7RdkR1DGEJw.text: Excellent food and atmosphere. The entrance is a trip with the fake door and hidden window. Service is a bit slow but the food was delicious. Had the chicken piccata with mushroom risotto and would order it again. The rest of the table loves their meal too. Dessert....equally good. Go!

SB4LrpoJKRb5ufUPpklE3g.text: This place was great! We had never been there before but we're meeting friends for dinner and I absolutely enjoyed the experience. From the atmosphere to the food everything was fantastic.

Snxb1tUTZhfg-gLaYwMuPQ.text: Food was amazing!!!! Service was great!!went for lunch can't wait to try dinner..I love how dramatic d entrance was ^_^

yFaMHIqUA5Nh-2z-2FF6NQ.text: The exterior wasnt impressive. So i was surprised when we got in! I must say that it wasnt bad but not great either. We werent gonna come here if we didnt have the groupon. Its just that, i find it a bit pricey and theres nothing really special about the food.  I agree with other yelpers that the place is too dark. You do not want to be eating in the dark. Good thing, we were seated next to the television!  There are other nice restos in the area. The strip isnt too far from this place either. But its ok to try if you have the groupon.

ZjTIoos8f_MzMq68H3_p7w.text: We loved everything about Capo's. From the legit Italian mobster vibe they establish through the secret entrance and suited staff calling us boss, to the mouthwatering mozzarella bread with tomato bisque, to the hearty homemade pasta dishes with meatballs the size of baseballs, to the discount they gave us for our anniversary usually reserved for Las Vegas locals on Tuesday nights - it couldn't have been better. We hope to return soon!

KKOt8r7jfItAPOO98yiiVg.text: Food is always great here. My fave is the traditional spaghetti with meat sauce. Only disappointment came during our last visit. We made a dinner res for 3 and showed up right on time. It was pretty upsetting when 3 other tables who came in after us got sat before us when they had the same amount of people (2 or 3) and also same res time???  Not sure if this was discrimination or host just forgot about us?? I also noted when making a reservation that we were celebrating at birthday, but nothing was done.

tQIkD0U2f4ZlpW50slltJg.text: Delicious food, but horrible service! 30 min behind on our reservation, slow service, managerial staff unprofessional and aggressive, and we had to argue to have the 2:1 Tuesday special honored! Will NOT be back!

OUqnIeF7bFFp8bpMLmeTMA.text: After all the reviews I thought I was going to be in for a good time. Sadly it was just ok, I guess the door guy wasn't in the mood to bad I was looking forward to that.    I understand the darkness is part of the feel and fun of this place but I couldn't even read my menu the little light attached to my menu was broken.  :(  Made it extremely hard to order.  I got the lasagna when it came it was burnt so bad around the edges I couldn't cut it so I had to return it and wait for a new one.  By the time it arrived I was starving, the taste was good no complaints.  Our group had a group on, when we went to pay we felt like we received attitude.  Don't sell them if you don't want people to use them.  Our waitress claimed the system was down and we couldn't use it, we refused to not use it and suddenly it was working again.  The whole time the manager who could have smoothed some feathers was sitting at the bar drinking.  So the food was ok service sucked, oh well...

2ak9QNOFN7_WeIqM8PQnxA.text: From the moment you walk in till the end of your meal the experience is fantastic. Make sure you have the have the password to get into this incredible Mob themed restaurant. Try the fried ravioli and the meatballs, main dish hands down, swim with the fishes shrimp pasta is the best you'l have! Make a full mobster day by visiting the Mob Museum first.

UX3lHFwe4MqnkEp2rIejow.text: Great service!  Great staff!  Large portions!  Great atmosphere.  Love the entrance with the peep hole welcome!  Old school memorabilia gangster vibe.

ai6OUNEsFuHzX6rNDpv4Bg.text: What an awesome place!  Vegas trip for husbands bday! There are a gazillion amazing places to eat at in Vegas but decided to surprise my hubby and take him somewhere we'd never get that chance to go to back home. Sure, we could've had amazing steak or delicious burgers down the strip, but fugetaboutit! We needed some mob in our lives. #yolo right? We had such a great time here. Sure it's kind of far from the strip. Yes it looks a little run down. And ya ok, the food isn't amazing. But the experience is the best! From the doorman, to "GAngsta" our waitress, to the magician that sat at our table, to the piano singer that we were sat next to. We had a great time and this will be something we will always remember. Thanks Capos!

ux-5BZDWoj58Dp57nbfTXA.text: Food was above average but the experience and ambiance are awesome!  Went for lunch and had the italian beef sandwhich....just ok...my friend had the pasta...better...i brought it home and warmed it up with some grilled chicken i made...yum! So you dont come here for the food you come for the experience of being at a speakeasy during prohibition.  In the evening they have live music which i bet is pretty cool

K2LH3o42eOKEXF_qY9J14w.text: Found this place from a Travel Channel Show and glad we ventured out. It is further away from The Strip, but I supposed it keeps it a little more "locals" style which I like.    I did make reservations, and I do believe they are highly recommended, if not required. You go in through a side entrance and ring the doorbell. All the sudden a peep hole on the other side of the room opens and in True "speakeasy" fashion you are asked why you're here and I played along with the passcode from the website.  Then you're lead in through a door behind a payphone.  Very dark inside so it does take a bit to adjust, but the menus come with flashlights if you need it.  The drinks we ordered were very good although I forget the names. We decided to forgo appetizers since we weren't starving. You do get bread and I had the soup with my meal.  The pasta and food was very high quality Italian. Sometimes you go to "theme restaurants' and they skimp on the food, but that was NOT the case here.  I loved the vibe, they had a singer doing Sinatra and a magician wandering around performing for the tables. It was amazing to see magic that close to you.   I only wish we had a fridge at our hotel so I could continue snacking the rest of the night on this. Very filling. Very good. And worth the short drive from The Strip!

EOv03j4ZbqRwoLpILfFvlA.text: Jeremy was great!  The steak was good and the ambience was so fun and authentic. Loved the dirty martini... extra dirty lol and the veal was DELISH!!

zmJCtiOS9B5BZ49Qw7sWog.text: They say all the best things about Las Vegas are off the strip and this is no exception. From the minute I walked through the door I was charmed. The staff were all friendly and accommodating, the ambiance was just what you would want from this type of restaurant and the food was amazing. We had calamari, stuffed mushrooms and spaghetti.  All three I would fly two thousand miles to eat again.

wrH7xsNXnbR5Ik5y98t9Qw.text: Capo's is freakin' awesome! I was hooked when I walked in the place. I'm not going to spoil it, but those that have been there know what I'm talking about. If you haven't been there yet, your first time will be memorable. Once your in you feel like Al Capone or Bugsy Siegel could walk in at any moment. The crooner serenading everyone with a few people dancing was classic. We had two entrees; the rib eye crusted with artichoke/Gorgonzola, veggies and taters and classic spaghetti and meatballs. Huge portions and everything was amazing!

mrm6pkLMpLBiJ34mX2eNjQ.text: I was struggling to find a place that wasn't your typical chain eatery and this is what we chose off of a recommendation.  This place had a great mix of authenticity and fun.  The wait staff was knowledgeable, prompt and courteous.  In our party of 4, not a single one of us had a bad entree and finally, it had that old school Italian speakeasy vibe that it strives for.  I'd definitely recommend this place.

KLryH-OvaYwTE_9iDwVCLw.text: This place was the highlight of our trip, The atmosphere was very genuine. and Very Italian. From the matre-d, to the Piano Lounge singer, to the booth, and finally the Food. The Drinks outstanding, Best Long Island Iced Tea. every plate had a unique taste and flavor. Will add to a Highly Recommend added to our next trip...

BM5yXYtkQTZhetjtuCgliw.text: Ive been here once. It was during lunch. Great place for a cup of coffee, sandwich and friends! Service was great and the busser from panama was very attentative and friendly. My wife raved about the carbonara pasta. We will definatly go back soon.

xDjKQN6evKa3tUeRsKU1RA.text: Good Food!  Love the pink sauce!  The singer is a cool cat...it's just way way way to loud!  Fun times though..if your local you got to go on a Tuesday buy one get one free it can't be that if you're on a diet avoid this restaurant at all cost if you're not on a diet because your phone it may become addictive especially with the Tuesday special buy one get one free I recommend the racketeers ravioli with pink sauce!

RrZ6eVFeQMNYssJnolprMg.text: Had a fun afternoon with good food and better ambiance. Definitely worth coming back! The Old Fashioned was delicious

ls3xcx6KjssUl2YIxf_tHg.text: Great atmosphere, not great food. Entrees must have been sitting awhile. Food was barely warm. Pricey for plate portions and delivery service .

jhEf7f_lDC2adM7FeKfkLA.text: Saw Capos on Man Finds Food and had to try it.  Off the hook. Must try the LeftOvers dish. The bomb. Great service, frank Sinatra singer and old school atmosphere.

JEF9uIdCAmwFFjPJZXr4tQ.text: Everybody at Capos was extremely nice and very helpful. Talked to Auntie G via email for a res to celebrate my niece's 21st bday...got that taken care of no problem, very accommodating. Table was ready when we arrived. Our server, Jeremy (?) was very attentive,  polite and funny. The entertainment was great as well.  Now for the best part: The food was fantastic! Cheesy garlic bread and mushroom caps for apps. Everybody had something different for an entree and not one person had a bad word to say. The bday girl asked for a particular dish not on the menu and got exactly what she was hoping for with no trouble at all.  I like getting off the strip at least one night each trip and this is by far my new found favorite. Definitely check this place out the next time you're looking for a fun night, with really nice people and great food!

F8YtKDpHySgJi3iZjSs2hg.text: We were on our way to Vegas and I happened to catch an episode of Mystery Diners or something like that, on Food Network. I really appreciated that they were trying to figure out a way to manage the experience of table side and live entertainment without the added drama of expecting patrons to tip. The place looked nice on the show, so we made a reservation and drove over there during our vacation.  We were kind of confused by the entrance and the vestibule to get in was uncomfortably hot as we tried to figure out if we were at the right place or some kind of mob front... So I guess they have it going on there.   The server was friendly. My husband had an Italian Margarita. It was delicious. I don't care for drinking much, but yum! The cheesy bread was great, as everyone describes. I loved the orange sauce.  I was excited about the table side magician--even though it was a different guy than was featured on the show. The singer was singing along "dedicating" songs to everyone in the house. It was kind of annoying because he kept talking to us directly and calling us my name.  As we ate our appetizer, we noted that the table side magician was finishing up with another table--and very directly solicited a tip. This annoyed me because I had taken the show on faith as an infomercial for good, honest service without this pressure.  We passed, very firmly, on the table side entertainment.  After three times of insisting that we would rather engage in intimate conversation, he finally moved along.  Our entrees--ravioli and stuffed rigatoni-- were delicious. We passed on dessert. Had we not been driving back to the strip, my husband would have definitely had another drink--it was that good.  All in all, the food was good.  If you're into mob stuff, you'll probably love it: There are streaming gangster movies in the background.  If you're looking at reviews because you learned about this establishment from the show they were on--it is no longer their policy to refuse tips, and I think that's pretty dishonest to perform, then pretty much demand a tip.

dRtov2zsq_eHQY4Z28B2Xg.text: Capo's was awesome. We loved our welcome when we got there. The food was incredible. The ravioli's are the best I've ever had. The spaghetti and meatballs were great! Cannolis were awesome. The staff was the best. On top of everything. Live entertainment, there was this magician guy doing tricks for us at our table and a guy singing. The place is nice and dark so I didn't feel uncomfortable eating spaghetti. If it was all over my face, nobody would even see it. lol This place is not on the strip but so worth the drive. Just wish they'd do separate checks.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. total awesomeness!

9_bIiPvNScivVz-2JLI0wQ.text: Was really excited to try this place.  Atmosphere is cool, service was great, but everything else was mediocre at best.  Maybe since I am Italian I am biased.  My meal was good, not great, I ordered the lunch special meatball sandwich...many other places in town much better.  The other meal ordered was a pasta dish.....22 bucks and was very small in portion size.  For dessert the lava cake....ok but mediocre at best and expected better quality for 10 bucks.  Overall nothing to rave about and rather disappointing consider what I've heard.  If it were not for the good service and atmosphere I would have given a 2 Star.

TwdVc3KYa-KqJNcVEs4-2w.text: Great great great place!! Old school Vegas. Atmosphere was excellent along with service. Food was authentic Italian. Meatballs were the best!! Will be back

wsMgxp-8dgVDous9stmGpQ.text: This place was 10/10!! -- It's supposed to be like an old speakeasy and it delivers!! You don't even have to settle on the food being terrible in exchange for the novelty of that experience, it's some of the best Italian food I've ever had! Definitely go! Great service at that!

m9shxqG2c6-EESydO-XoeA.text: The only reason this place get 3stars from me is because of the environment. From entering to exiting the music and atmosphere is amazing. As far as the food I was not expressed at all order the bruschetta and it was so small the amount of bread to tomatoes was horrible. A small little saucer my 1 year old would not be satisfied.  We ordered pastas my husbands sauce was decent but pasta and shrimp were both way under cooked.  My pasta was meant to have an Alfredo sauce and it was just oil. I ordered a side of Alfredo and it was so watery I didn't eat it.  2bartender behind the bar and very slow service.  Although the girl with the red shirt was helpful when u could get her attention as she was busy and taking care of everyone while the other girl was doing nothing.  I was very disappoint I have heard so many good things about this place. Will not be coming back.

TRK-MEsos3BRsL6x1pQY1g.text: I've been here a few times and have been happy every time. The first was with a large group. We didn't have a reservation, but they graciously accommodated our group of 12. To get in is a bit gimmicky, but goes with the speakeasy theme.   The second time I went with my girlfriend for a romantic dinner. We sat by the mic, and the singer serenaded us with a love song. While the singing isn't exactly my thing, I love a place that is queer friendly!   The food was good. It was pretty standard Italian fare. I had the chicken parmigiana, which I recommend. Overall, it's a cute place that's different from the average place. I recommend.

cQGqyLi-QY_rJz9R22UgEg.text: The atmosphere was great, the Illusionist was fantastic, the calamari was the best I've ever had and our main dishes were delicious.

5fi1Tw1dkoPR_1RPr-30Hg.text: The perfect location for a speakeasy restaurant. In the outskirts of town, remotely located hideout for a meeting in secret. Everyone is in character, offering piano music and the old american standard music as well. The drink selection is great bit the food is amazing. It don't get better than this!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-x2l7kf1B0fJpYAVdLEzTQ.text: My husband and I were recommended here from a salesman at car max after our browsing. It was close to the car lot and we were starving. As soon as we knocked on the fake door, we knew we would enjoy the place. It's a type of speak easy restaurant, and everyone plays the part. The lighting helps set the mood. We ordered meatballs and each of us a pasta (that I can't remember now) but we thoroughly enjoyed every bite. The staff, food, and drinks were all delightful. It's a place we plan to bring family when they visit since we have just moved here. We loved everything!

Zip674h9-CNyhHsV8VUa0Q.text: The atmosphere is very cool and definitely different from a lot of other places in Vegas. We went here for my mother's birthday per her request and we loved it. The entrance is cool, the love singing is AMAZING and I liked how dark and intimate it seemed.  Not a place for kids for sure.  The only downside is our waiter seemed very busy and had us waiting a bit of time for a lot of different things. Maybe they were short staffed, I don't know, but I would still come back over and over.  The food is very flavorful and the plate names are very unique and just added the cherry on top. This is a MUST in Vegas!

7xzSrz4RYNbyd8uk39h5bQ.text: Capo's Italian Cuisine reminds me of the saying- "Don't Judge a Book By Its Cover" Once you drive to this restaurant, my impression of the outside, very ghetto. It does look it but it really is not. Its a really unique and cool experience dining here. Besides the look when you enter it will be very gangster, very mafia, mobster feel. Don't let it bother you, me & my other half really enjoyed our lunch. It was our 2oth anniversary lunch. Our Las Vegas trip was for our 20th anniversary celebration and on our special day we dined here. We both had no complaints.   As a FYI- be prepare to eat in the dark, look at your menu in the dark, once you enter and once you get to the table, it is very dark. Guess its a great way to hide from the mobster!! haha. If you don't mind the dark.  My opinion, this is much more romantic. I had a hard time finding the bathroom in the dark and I had to go with my other half. It was really hard taking photos, you will need to use the flash on your phone.   We were in the area stopping at The California hotel and I recalled driving by this place,so I checked Yelp and the ratings and food photos looked awesome so Capo's we will go for lunch. They have a great lunch special so we opt for the special.   OH my!!, Our meals were really delicious except for the salads were mediocre. Our pasta were so authentic. You would be surprised that this place has such amazing food. Our lunch entrees were Capones Carbonara - the fettuccine pasta were al dente, the carbonara sauce was just right, not too rich. Big Dom's Primavera- Penne pasta tossed with fresh vegtables- really loved that the penne was al dente and loved the vegtables sauteed perfect together. Me and the other half tried each other's entree and we enjoyed them both. The entree has interesting names but the description sure matches its name.   Amazing food, great service, and Unique Mobster experience, you have to come check it out for yourself.  Next visit I want to try the calamari, a different entree, and the cannoli.   I can't wait to be back and I will definitely be back @ Capo's during my next Las Vegas vacation!!  #6/100 for 2017

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tank @ front entrance.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is Capo&#39;s.!!

v4L6c0LFd9IS_uaLRi2Vrw.text: Okay, I get the theme, but it was way too dark in there for me. I just like to see what I'm eating. We had a party of seven. No one liked the food because it lacked flavor and was over cooked. Eggplant parmigiana had too much crunchy batter. Veal was tough. And enough spaghetti to feed an army. For those kinds of prices I expected better.

uESgjNyKdTTMmVQwoKlRLQ.text: We had a great experience here!  It is very unique; they really play up the speakeasy theme.  Our server was a lot of fun and did an excellent job.  Fransisco was friendly and helpful.   The ambience was dark and intimate, as you might expect, but the menus each had a flashlight in case you need it.  They had live music, too.   Our food was reasonably priced and good.  I thought the sawed off sausage was a bit heavy on the olive oil, but I still enjoyed it.

rn-PbJBiwjtipEnN-_y_BQ.text: I heard about Capo's by a Vegas bartender last time I was in town and am so glad I listened to his recommendation. My mom and I were there April 9 for dinner and everything was great. Joey made us some tasty drinks (two thumbs up on the extra dirty martinis for me) while we waited for our table to be ready, which took a matter of minutes. As for the dinner, everything was spot on. The pasta fagioli soup with the hot bread was just awesome; it's honestly the best pasta fagioli soup I've ever had. My mom had the dinner salad, which she also liked. For entrees, my mom had the spaghetti and gigantic meatball, which were excellent. I had the lasagna and it was delicious; it's going to be difficult for me to return and try something different because the lasagna was so, so, good.  My mom and I are Italian and fussy about food, so it's not often I'm this impressed with an Italian restaurant. However, the cool mafia themed atmosphere, great service, and awesome food all combined for a fabulous experience. We will be back for sure!!

yBKZfWmqpw1662EvJZUmgg.text: This restaurant is AWESOME!  The food is delicious, every bite was spot on.    The atmosphere is totally worth the price of admission-with its private club vibe, and dark clubby tables.  Tip-Make a reservation for the best seats  Sarah was our server and she couldn't have been nicer or more helpful.  Ask for her!  Just all in all a complete occasion experience.

0LHxh8_o7raMeB14xI3ghg.text: Went here with my bf for our anniversary. Everything was themed- made the experience so fun! The host was funny and nice, and all our servers were accommodating and friendly. The food was delicious, and the portions were generous. Would love to come here again and would recommend to anyone! Thanks Capo's for the great dining experience!

eaYp_1fkMoNAfok8p6uQ0w.text: I started with the fried ravioli and the mafioso caprese salad. Both were a good size to share. I had the spaghetti and meatballs as my main dish. I couldn't finish it because I was so full. Everything I've tried here was delicious! I suggest wearing loose pants lol

CTvcqsgrMA01EB-s0rLvAA.text: Just a head's up for anyone who plans on talking with their dinner companions, the restaurant is so loud that if you want the person sitting across from you to hear you, you need to shout like you are at a concert and even then it's annoying. The food and service was amazing and we all overdid it because we didn't want to leave anything behind. I won't be going back because of the noise level but would definitely go back for a takeout order.

-izxgbcqS2D_Wj81LXwURw.text: Great food and really nice mob themed restaurant. I will be going again when I'm in Vegas!

7xraWEfbDo_kbTwwFzlNUQ.text: Great place for Italian dining.  Happy hour for 12 to 6 pm with drink specials and discounts on appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restroom art

JYQLLfqpGCnCWbIdiQ2xsw.text: Awesome food and service  A must dining experience , you will love this place  Meatballs are huge and tasty

7UgUkjDBdy1Fivc3koE_nQ.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant. I don't normally eat food with dairy but this place is definitely an exception. Such a fun atmosphere with exceptional service!  Appetizers, cheesy garlic bread, calamari and bust a cap mushrooms are all a must order. The calamari was recommended by our service and our table of five loved it. Wasn't chewy at all and the marinara sauce it came with was delicious. My entree was the gallo clams dish with angel hair. I'll probably order this every time!  Perfect amount of garlic, pasta was cooked just right. The boyfriend ordered shrimp scampi he loved it. Lips were glistening with butter lol

qOCaPhAhh1gdVzdlOsSE7w.text: Very very dark, and the music is loud.  Not like a quality loud either - just fuzzy and loud.  The service was sub-par.  Cold soup.  Their house wine is $12 a glass, which I think is very over priced.  Not a good atmosphere, not good service, and not good prices.  The only decent part is the "speakeasy" entrance, but the experience falls apart from there.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aTOYLcVbN31fs4xnJYiNTw.text: GANGSTA YO!  Mark H brought me here because he thought I'd have a fun time...he was right!  Capo's is kind of a mobster throwback when there was an A+ Italian restaurant on every block in Vegas.  When you enter the place, you don't enter from the front, but instead from a small, Semi-unmarked door in the back of the building!  Fkn awesome...LOL.  Once through the door, you're in a small entry space and need to ring a doorbell and talk through a speaker to gain access to the restaurant...even more awesome! :)  Once in, the place is dark with red diamond tufted banquets.  It feels like in any booth you might see people from the likes of Al Capone to Ol' Blue eyes, Frank Sinatra or Dean Martin.  All the servers are dressed in tuxedos and are extremely attentive from the moment you walk in.    Once seated, we were happy they had Hendricks gin and each got a Hendricks and tonic.  Mark H knew that they have large portions so we passed apps and just ordered entrees.  They have some fun sounding dishes with things like Uncle Pauly's Arrabiata and Vinnie's alla vodka. :)  I opted for Da Don's Lasagna and Mark H ordered a special, the Clams in red sauce with linguini.  Both dishes were healthy portions and tasty.  Shamefully I actually finished my monstrous piece of lasagna and was stuffed.  Mark H said his pasta dish was good finished it but did have quite a bit of red sauce left.  That's when I realized we didn't get any bread which should have come with our meal.  No biggie since we were already stuffed and didn't want anything else to eat.    We obviously passed on dessert.  A pretty cool place to eat at in a town FULL of good restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna

EEP3cbXQctbjQDL20hKIgg.text: First timers from Cali on a date night in Fabulous LV. So very happy i followed up on the recommendation and decided to check Capo's out. The two plates we had were the Santucci's Pasta with a side sausage and the Da don's Lasagna. For our appetizers we decided on the Tony Duck's Soup and Nikos Caeser. Couldn't be happier with the food choices we made! The Pasta has a great authentic tasting sauce that truly made the dish, The added sausage kicks it up a notch. Now the Lasagna, one of the best tasting Lasagna dishes I've had in a while. The smashed meatballs the Ricotta you can taste throughout the dish. A big Thanks To Capo's Staff for providing a memorable evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret entrance
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Da dons Lasagna and Santucci &#39;s Pasta
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Capo&#39;s Cosmopolitan and a beer

awn9fEL2naHU45UTMSA0wg.text: Ok, so I juat moved to Vegas, and I'm looking for the restaurants that don't cater to tourists. This is not one of those places. If you want a quiet meal, do not come here. First off, you have to ring a bell to be let in. We waited in the hot vestibule for 8 minutes, and had to ring the bell 4 times before someone opened the sliding door. Next, the waiter took our order but none of the dishes contained meat. Oh, yes, that was an extra $10 FOR 2 SAUSAGES. The waiter disappeared. He only had 3 tables, you see. So, we had to ASK for drink refills. The arabitta is a spicy red sauce. Theirs was not. In fact, it tasted like Ragu spaghetti sauce. I use jars of sauce sometimes but this was not even a good premade sauce. The tea tastes like Lipton instant. For some reason, this seems to be a popular restaurant. I would recommend Roma Deli 1 if you are looking for good Italian food.

tOXyIfi_5hDG36PCFL1ISg.text: I love Capo's. Not that this place NEEDS another 5 star review... but I enjoy eating here so much I'm giving it to them anyways. If you love classic, homestyle Italian, this is the place for you. Forget all the fancy, modern, trendy, weirdo twists restaurants have been using to draw you to their establishment and then promptly disappoint you. Capo's keeps it classic and quality. Do not get me wrong, this place is not casual, cheap or lack creativity of dishes. They have the classic chicken parm, all the while including their own spins on pasta dishes and entree's. Some of my favorite dishes to order here are, chicken parmesan (of course), chicken marsala (the best I've ever had), mushroom risotto, Caesar salad, plain ol' spaghetti and meatballs (I should really say spaghetti and meat boulder, either way, it's bomb.com). The live music, and old school Vegas vibe along with the fantastic food and service will keep me coming back for as long as I am able to lift a fork to my mouth. Who am I kidding? I would totally stick my face in a plate of their Marsala.

kytAdAim_iH0AyIINibgWw.text: So last night, September 20, I was taken to Capo's for my birthday dinner. We made reservations, in which when we got there, there was no wait. Not because it was not busy, but they kept their word that a table would be ready. I walked into the foyer to find some good old photographs and a payphone. I rang the bell as instructed and the doorman came to the window. The atmosphere was dark, but they used small lights to to let us see the menu. This is typical of a speakeasy.  So we were seated, and I hope I have the server name right, Gery, came right over. She gave us the specials, and as my date was not Italian friendly, Gery, went though the menu with her. The food came out, and oh my what a great serving for the price. I ordered the Chicken Parm, and it was as close as my family home made recipe. Two people, with one glass of wine, 82.00. This was not bad for this type of eatery.  Defiantly a must see place if you're visiting, or just a local looking for a great place to eat.  Side note, if you bring your significant other, do not be surprised if she gets flirted with by the staff (normal Italian behavior)

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed chicken Anastasia
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Capo &#39;s Parmigiana

IB5PDW-xnZRs0BjzFJreKg.text: Fun place to go to and experience! My husband is part Italian and we love Italian food! We also love listening and seeing stories about mafias, mobs and  movies. The ambiance and entrance was the best we've seen in Italian restaurants.   The food was very good and authentic. We were recommended by a good friend of this restaurant which she is local Vegas resident. We brought a big group too from NorCal, So Cal and from the UK visiting for the first time. Also another local friend who came for the first time says she'd come back and bring her family in to try. Definitely try if you haven't!

oN-gj80e0JWmNZPBE3SeIg.text: All I can say after our visit to Capo's is meh. My boyfriend comes from an Italian family and all their food is made from scratch. I probably have too high of expectations. Even with a reservation we had to wait 15 minutes. The gentlemen that greeted us to ask for the password wasn't even Italian! Smh My hangry boyfriend was not pleased at all with the wait. The Italian Chianti left much to be desired. It tasted cheap. The infamous meatballs were nothing special - just a huge hunk of beef rolled in a ball. The one saving grace of this restaurant was their pink sauce, which was a mixture of marinara and alfredo sauces.  My boyfriend and I both agreed that this was one of the evenings this week that was wasted on mediocre food (followed by Diablos Cantina at Luxor). We will skip this establishment on next year's trip

iom0Y5mB3etrIa0hPj3VOQ.text: The best Italian in Vegas! It is off the strip but worth the drive. We had to make reservations and only could get in with a secret code. It is very, very dark inside just as a warning. So dark in fact you can't even find the restrooms without help. Menus are to be read with a flashlight. The live singer was fantastic! Just a recommendation that he needs to walk around to more tables. Our waitress was terrible and practically non existent but we weren't going to let her ruin our fun night out. The food is absolutely delicious! The chicken Parmesan is the best I ever had and the spaghetti sauce is out of this world!! Hands down our new favorite Italian restaurant and will be visiting again when we are in town. Already have been recommending this place to all our family and friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

clB9l1TKEARzI-6t1law3A.text: The restaurant is an experience... From outside you don't know what to expect!  We couldn't find the door at first LOL When you enter the restaurant it reminded me those French old night club where you had to show your ID and wallet to enter LOL The restaurant is very dark you almost need a flashlight to see. Great place for blind date I guess. The menu offers many option, it's little expensive ... I ordered a caprese salad and an Alfredo pasta. I would enjoy my meal if only it wasn't that dark. The service is good and they will come often refill your water or drinks. I believe certain days you have some entertainment while dinning. I am glad I experienced this place at least once :)

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Second door Ring the bell to get in lol
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4PKalrI5cDNbtv3KupjJJg.text: Situated very inconspicuously in a quiet plaza. This place can be found with it's illuminated sign. The entrance is a bit hidden in the back, but gets even more confusing as you enter. Be sure to find out the password before entering, AND make a reservation.   I won't give up exactly how the entrance works, but just follow the instructions when you enter and you're good from there.  The restaurant is covered with red and black, spanning the entire place. It is very dimly lit, perfect for a romantic evening out. Date night recommended! Our host was a older Italian gentlemen that I swore jumped out from the prohibition days.   The menus come with small illumination to help you read the words. Our dinner started off with bread. It wasn't as warm as we'd like, but still yummy.  Our combo dinners came with soup or salad, so we both chose Pasta Fagioli and Tony Duck's Soup. Both hit the spot. For our entree's we got Fredo's Wise Guy Alfredo and Racketeers Ravioli. Both ridiculously good and creamy. Would definitely have loved to box up leftovers for the fam at home to try, but sadly, everything ended in our bellys. Oh well. More of a reason to visit again.   The mood, servers and even the restaurant singer set everything up. The decorations had all mob faces on it and really set the pace. We will certainly come back--and with more people.

i-vgGAiIDzXanW_wBG4CkQ.text: The experience at Capo's is definitely entertaining, from the mob boss dining room decor,  to the Frank Sinatra impersonator, you'll totally love it. I've gone the last few times I've been in Vegas and I'll definitely continue to bring friends and family to enjoy the experience as well. The menu has a nice variety, the portions are decent,  and there's a full bar available. It's pricey, so be prepared to spend.   The service has always been spot on and the servers are all friendly. I would advise making a reservation, if not you may end up getting turned away (or stuck at the bar, we did last time and it just wasn't as fun being in a dark corner at the end of the bar).   Lastly, the food. As far as Italian goes, it's good, I enjoy it but I wouldn't say it's the best out there. The meal and the experience compliment each other, they go hand in hand.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The garlic cheese dippers, half portion size. I don&#39;t think they bring bread to the table otherwise. At least I&#39;ve never gotten any.

7C1AdmT1qIBIy3rXwBpcLQ.text: Yelp - you let me down on this one. However, it does take a lot to impress me when it comes to Italian food.   Made a reservation and had to wait 30 minutes. There were empty tables, but I suppose the kitchen may have been packed up? Eventually they sat us at the bar which I guess was because we were waiting so long. From the bar, you can see pretty much the whole kitchen - kind of cool because you can see your food being made. But what's annoying is having to hear the arguing and language used by the chefs in the kitchen.  Both me and my boyfriend ordered pasta. The sauce on my pasta was supposed to be "creamy," but creamy it was not. Very watery and plain tasting. Got bruschetta as an appetizer, which was also disappointing and tasted like it came out of a jar. Maybe it's personal preference, but to me this wasn't real homemade Italian food, but merely an impostor of such.  I think the gimmick of this whole place is what is appealing to so many. It's very very dark, mafia themed and does a great job of following such theme. It's so dark you can't even see your food that well. There's live music every night. The night we went was a Frank Sinatra cover singer, he sounded really great.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uh oh ! Crime scene photos

0818HwgKQ77BZND3U8ADcA.text: We have been wanting to try Capo's for a while as friends have highly recommended Capo's. We ended up making reservations as it was Mother's Day and I will say we were not disappointed.  So the entrance is a cool experience. You enter and wait in small area and the host opens a small door asking your business, if you have a password and who sent you. Please note, the entrance into the bar and dining area was not what I expected.  As we were seated you definitely feel like your in a old school, old world restaurant with the walls adorn with pictures of famous gangsters and Vegas entertainers. There was even live entertainment with the singer playing songs from the days of the rat pack.  The food was amazing and plentiful, please be prepared to bring home leftovers. My wife had the meatball sandwich and I had the chicken parmesan.   The service was attentive and amazing. Our wait staff never skipped a beat from drinks to the flow of dishes.   On this day, there was a lounge singer busting out all of our favorite songs from the Rat Pack and others that made their way thru early Vegas.   This restaurant is the great combo of food, service and entertainment, I would recommend Capo's if your looking for great food with service to boot.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fSK66qJ_1OEQ3lMhXHqR8Q.text: What an interesting and fun restaurant! Who doesn't like mobsters? When you go to the front entrance, there's a little surprise there for you. I won't ruin it. After we got in, we got seated. We sat in the main room across from the singer. I don't know what his name is, but he's a wonderful singer. He sings Frank Sinatra hits. And, I think a couple others. (I tipped him five dollars and he was very happy.)  We started off with the stuffed mushrooms. They were pretty good and a little spicy. We also got some lightly toasted bread with butter. I really loved my Tiramisu martini. For my second martini, an orange Creamsicle was recommended. But, I did not like it at all. Luckily for me, the waitress took it away and brought me a 2nd Tiramisu martini. (It tastes just like the dessert!)   For the entrees, I got the "wise guy" Alfredo with shrimp and he got the New York steak with pasta on the side. The steak was surprisingly delicious. Capo's is a steakhouse in addition to Italian food. The Alfredo sauce was perfect. It was creamy and it wasn't too greasy like sometimes Alfredo can be. Plus, we did ask for Parmesan cheese. They don't grate it at the table for you, but I do believe that it is freshly grated every day. For dessert, we got the Tiramisu. It was very delicious. Overall, it is a really entertaining and wonderful restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The delicious calamari and bust a cap mushrooms!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I got the Scarface shrimp scampi and he got the chicken Anastasia. With mushroom risotto. I liked his better!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu!! &#34;Jimmy two Times!&#34;

eHJDYpjSbnl0wXpVUn1nXA.text: Came here for a family dinner. Its a speakeasy so it's kind of fun because you need to know the password to get it. You walk into a small room with a phone and a doorbell and you press the doorbell and then this little window opens and you have to tell the guy the right password for entry. It's a very dark restaurant so you have to get used to the lighting. We were seated at a nice booth in the back. The menus have little flashlights inside so you can read them in the darkness. That's a nice idea. They had an extensive gluten free menu which was good because two members of the party are gluten free. The only problem was one of our menus seemed to be missing a page which was kind of strange. We had to share menus to get that figured out. I was very thirsty and drank my water quickly and luckily there was a decanter of water at the table. I also ordered a Diet Coke and asked the server for another. She said she'd bring a decanter of Diet Coke since another member of the party was drinking it too. After waiting about 5 minutes and not getting it and having no sign of the server we asked another busboy who was walking by about it and then the server appeared and said it was coming. Eventually we got it. I wasn't crazy about the service because of this. The server wasn't as attentive as she should have been. The other two members of our party also had to wait a long time before getting their wine refilled. However the food was delicious. We had the gluten free shrimp scampi which that member of our party said was very good. Another member had the gluten free chicken piccata. She said that the meal appeared a bit brown since the chicken looked brown and she had it with the mushroom risotto but she said everything tasted very good. I had the cioppino and it was supposed to come spicy but I asked for it to be milder. It was good but could have used a little more seafood. It did come with a lobster tail which was nice but it only had sliced calamari, a good amount of shrimp, and a small amount of salmon, and some mussels and clams. The broth was good. There was a lot of linguini in it. We also had the salmon piccata. It was a grilled piece of salmon with asparagus and came with risotto. He was happy with his dish. Overall I would say good food but service could have been better. Could have been more attentive. I would come back to try the steak. I want to try the filet.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner salad
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gluten free shrimp scampi

dsYKrF73fTnH06u0x6pGpg.text: Off the hook and worth the Uber drive! The experience alone was fun, starting with having to knock on the door to get in! (Yes, make reservations!) The Speakeasy vibe was a blast. The music was live (rat pack standards) and the singer wandered the tables and would strike up conversations with the guests. The service was phenomenal and the servers' food recommendations were spot on!  We had several different crew members walk up to our table to say hi and check on our food. LOVE how personal it all was.   The portions of all our plates were big enough to share but we really didn't want to. Needless to say, we all walked out with food babies and it was well worth it! Noodles were homemade and everything tasted super fresh and authentic. Definitely start with the meatball appetizer!   YES- there were amazing GF/DF options!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes!!! Piping hot (you can see the steam in the pic). NOT GF but worth a bite. These are not your momma&#39;s meatballs. You gotta try...

LtGcZeWhZEYoUDXI7-CZ5A.text: We had the BEST night on our first visit to Capos for a 70th Birthday party.  The mob themed atmosphere was so much fun. The service was great and the Italian food was so good.  I had the vegetable Penne pasta with Vodka sauce, so yummy . Several people had lasagna and chicken piccata  and nothing but good feedback.  The mushroom risotto was amazing.  We ended the night with cannolis and some of our Italian friends that are "cannoli snobs" loved them.   The only thing that I would change is I would suggest investing in lighted menus .  Although I love the dark, romantic atmosphere it was hard to read the menu.  We went to a restaurant at Casa Blanca called Catherine's. That was the first time that I saw lighted menus.  Great idea!
