Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

42wYf9HydRQg7qB5dxvU1g.text: 3.23.19: Forget-about-it was our secret password to this Speakeasy Italian Restaurant away from the Las Vegas strip.    Table for 9 please as we made our way in. The host was very nice, funny and welcoming.  We sat and admired the ambiance of a Mob life with live music and singing by the piano.   Our server, which I forgot his name, was reallly nice and witty at the same time.   TIP:  When I asked if we could split the bill the server said no he could only do 2 cards. Perfect! We gave 2 cards but he charged me $2. Hmmm... I said whatever I won't flip out since they accommodated our large party with no reservation.   Food: Calamari  Carbonara  Caprese Angel Hair Spaghetti   My friends ordered a lot more dishes but this is what I ate.  The carbonara was just ok. I've had better. The Spaghetti was much better in flavor.  Now,  the Calamari was delightful.  Best I've ever had. Lightly battered and tender. Not chewy.   Overall, a great experience.  I would definitely return back. The ambiance is dark and older looking that does make you feel like you're in the old days of the speakeasy era.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ym7PVBBGJ6zmB15Qpa8fOQ.text: My brother asked to come here while he was in town for his birthday so I made reservations 4 days in advance and it was pretty booked so we ended up with a 5pm reservation on a Saturday evening.  So glad we got an early reservation because we were here for 2.5hrs!! Not sure how all that time passed but it sure didn't feel that long. At no time did we feel rushed or anything. The spacing between the appetizers and our salads and dinner was perfect!! We were not in a rush and just enjoyed the atmosphere so if you're in a hurry this probably won't work for you.   The whole old school mafia theme was so much fun!!  Walk in and ring the doorbell for a guy to poke his head out and ask if you have reservations.  We were seated within 3min or so. As other reviews stated this place is very dark but once your eye adjust it didn't bother me at all.   After seated we were quickly greeted by the best server I could have wanted Janeen!! She seriously was awesome. Super friendly, very attentive even when the restaurant quickly filled up and was very busy. She kept our drinks full and made sure we were content and satisfied with everything. I even have to give props to our busser Alex. He was on it!! Cleared out our empty plates quickly without us feeling rushed. LOVE IT!! I'm sorry to those other reviews who got crappy service, if Janeen is working when you come here I hope you get her!!  Ordered drinks, I got the Nico and others got wine and Captain Morgan shots and beer. The Nico was sweet but not overly sweet and delicious. Have no clue what wine the girls ordered but they had zero complaints.   Appetizers we got the fried ravioli and calamari.  The ravioli I definitely recommend because it was DELISH!! Calamari, Ive had better and it was good but i wouldn't suggest it.   Entree wise my brother and his gf got the specials and I forgot what they were and didn't get a pic but, I couldn't decide between the Cioppino or the special which was some kind of scampi so the awesome Janeen said why choose? Let's put the scampi in the cioppino!! What a great freakin idea! My friend got the eggplant parmesan. I love cioppino so I had really high expectations for this dish and holy shit did Capo's deliver!! It was sooooo damn good and the added noodles from the scampi were awesome because I really wanted pasta but had to try their cioppino.   Oh dang, I almost forgot out the awesome Cesar salad I got before dinner!! Not sure how I almost forgot about that but it was DELISH too!! Every piece of lettuce had dressing on it and it was very flavorful!!  My brother got Tiramisu for dessert and we all took a bite, or three. Another winner!!   We will be back in September for my brother's gf birthday we loved it so much!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant parmesan
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino with scampi
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

d9-w8Q5TkwBwu-nr3w4MiQ.text: My husband and I came here for the first time tonight as it was recommended by friends. We absolutely loved it! You definitely come for the experience, and it didn't disappoint.   My husband had the veal and I had fettuccine Alfredo and both were phenomenal! We were warned about the expensive prices in advance. But overall, you get your money's worth with endless bread, soup or salad, plus your main course!   We do however wish there could've been slightly more light in the room! We know the dark room plays into the experience, however it's really hard on the eyes. Not to mention how blinding the small lights are on the menus when you use them. Plus, trying to find your way around to the bathroom, your chair, or to the exit is a real pain.   Other than that, we loved Capo's! We'll definitely be coming back more!!

A73aXFm1m2R97j-UbTt4iQ.text: I had work colleagues in-town from Virginia and we decided to stop by Capo's Italian Cuisine for lunch.  The restaurant is located near Sahara/Jones.   This restaurant is a experience! Upon entering, you will need to knock to get into the restaurant (no spoilers in this review!). If you're visiting from out-of-town, this is a must see restaurant that is off-strip!  We had arrived around 1:00 P.M and the restaurant was fairly empty. Our party consisted of 6 guests and we were immediately seated.   We were provided their lunch menu and full menu.The restaurant is extremely dark inside. You'll need to use their provided flash-light to review the menu.   The customer service was exceptional! I had ordered their meatball sub from the lunch menu. It consisted of two very large meatballs on a white-sub sandwich. The side was french fries. For desert, I had the Salted Caramel Cheesecake. The food was amazing! The meatballs were well seasoned, not overcooked. The french fries had a touch of garlic to them, which was unique and refreshing twist on french fries. The salted caramel cheesecake with nuts was decadent.   The lunch was delicious. I would come back here and try their dinner menu. Supposedly there is a live singer in the evening hours, which sounds super romantic!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ir0vjCVA37jBbzR7EAZ8Ww.text: Here for lunch on a Saturday June 1st 12 pm . Some young girl behind the bar every other word out of her mouth was s F..ck. Only 2 tables here so everything very clear. Staff is very loud behind the counter which is the kitchen. This very much started the experience off not so well. The environment is set in a classic speak easy , however the bell did not work to get in so could have been there a long time if we did not phone them to let them know we had arrived.  Our server is very friendly and attentive his name Brendyn   Food was great both pasta with  sausage and the carbonara

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta with sausage

emM9whyiqqPAyjUcY-M7iw.text: Amazing food!  Huge portions. Fabulous wait staff. Great live music. What a real speakeasy should look like. Such a great experience!

EzdABJVqttrlK0uo23tRYg.text: I personally loved this restaurant.  I was all about the vibe and the food they provide.  When I looked at the menu it took me a good minute to decide what I wanted to eat.  Luckily I brought someone who we agreed on multiple entrees I wanted to try. Each one delicious.  Definitely recommend, definitely would go back multiple times.

PaBZqe22Bp_bCgli5jBVLw.text: Sorry but I don't know what people were thinking, this was by far the worst Italian food ever. I always trust Yelp but this time it failed me.  The salad and bread were manageable, the cuisine was fun, the Dean Martin Singer was enjoyable but in the end the main course just sucked.

Mj2MwPI5lkO9dDsdc7G1GQ.text: There are so many good choices for Italian food in Vegas that a restaurant has to have something to set them apart from the rest.  Capo's has come up with a way to distinguish their "mobster" theme.  Guests arrive to an empty foyer with little besides a pay phone and a few framed pictures on the wall.  What is this?  You follow the directions and ring a bell, whereupon a secret hatch opens up and a Jersey-accented thug asks what we want.  After a little back-and-forth the wall holding the pay phone opens to a dimly-lit wonderland of mobster memorabilia.  It's lots of fun!  Walking past the kitchen you see the staff busily preparing the food.  This is pretty much the last you will see of the food at Capo's.  The atmosphere is super fun and the food was tasty too.  I would probably have given them more stars if I could have been able to see what I was eating.  The menus arrive with tiny lights attached to aid in actually reading them.  All around the dining room other patrons are using their cell-phones to catch a glimpse of what they are eating.  There is no reason for this place to be so dark.  Part of the culinary experience for me is to look at the presentation and I completely missed out on it at Capo's.    The food and the concept are great!  Just shed a little light on it all and I think they'd have a five-star restaurant.

ZfRHDuueNmWWHPz53rctWg.text: It was difficult to give this restaurant stars because important things about a meal:  the food, atmosphere and service were above average.  Unfortunately, there were surprises on the bill at the end of the meal that put a damper on the whole experience.  The menu stated that there was a $5 charge for splitting.  We understood that but when the food came to the table it was not split up so we asked for another plate and I split it myself.  We thought--that's good, we won't be charged the $5 now.  Not only were we charged for the split, we were charged $3 more ($8) for it, because "they recently raised the price" (but didn't update the menu?).  On top of that we ordered the spaghetti Santucci which was good, but we thought the meatballs were included as one of the choices in the dish.  They added another $5 on for the meatballs too.  Our waiter got the manager when we complained.  He just apologized as did the waiter and said it was a management decision.    So--I can't recommend the restaurant due to their billing practices.

UK9UUstBkgWFsM_TrX0crg.text: Absolutely worst service in yelp history! Its a damn shame because I really love their bruchetta gahhhhh!  Waited 15 minutes before my bf had to finally grab the bartenders attention to get our order .. Information passed to us when we called in was inaccurate as to when we arrived .. They told us 2 for 1 tuesday was for anything over the phone and when we arrived they said its only got entrees .. I guess that's one way to get people to your restaurant.. Such a shame. Maybe old vegas had terrible service too .. That would make sense.

d1exLE7xikHrqPLB2Dy9Sg.text: My partner and I came here because of the high reviews in Yelp. We were vacationing in Las Vegas and felt like Italian. What a huge surprise! When we got dropped off by the cab, we weren't so sure of our choice just based on the exterior of the building, and when we walked in the entrance, we were even less so. This is designed just like an old speakeasy. When you enter the door, it appears to be a dark closet with a keypad to punch in a secret code to enter. As we were puzzling over the keypad, a little hidden look-through panel popped open and the host greeted us (to our startled surprise!). He then opened a hidden door. When we stepped into the door, we walked into the 1920s!  It was amazing!  The atmosphere felt authentic with the exception of the large screen LCD where "Good Fellas" was playing. The walls were decorated with old gangsters and a very good singer was strolling the restaurant singing old Rat Pack songs.  The food was just as good as the atmosphere! Everything from the bread and salad, right down to the entree and dessert were delicious!  The staff was attentive while staying in role for the theme of Capo's. We highly recommend you check out this little gem off the strip of Vegas. It is well worth the trip!

BIwzVLK-qle30UALTctyEQ.text: Atmosphere and service are a 10 if we could go that high.  Food was a 4 and that's why we rated at a 4 star.  Live music 7 nights a week and was also very good.  If you're looking for an old school Italian restaurant this would be on top of the list.

H9Jx9hWVaGLgYOTGVrKr7A.text: Capo's is awesome! I always get VIP service here. Ziggy at the door giving that great greeting and Kevin's amazing singing once you get in(takes requests). Gregg and Geneva are phenomenal bartenders and take great care of my friends and family whenever we come in. The kick in the head and sucker punch are great cocktails and the food is killer. Meatballs, cheesy garlic bread, calamari apps are great. But the mushroom risotto is crazy good! The steak dinners are always a good choice. Definitely go to Capos they have groupons and specials throughout the week. Sit at the bar or grab a table just go experience this place.

UckAm2JfpPSKL_jJL5Ohaw.text: Food was amazing! I had the chicken Marsala and mushroom risotto which I couldn't finish because it was sooo much good. I totally recommend place.

OTdFyfUI_SHyxTNqgrzsGQ.text: Came in with my boyfriend for a dinner date . Upon arrival , they open a secret window and you need to say the passcode to get in . The place was really nice and decorated with black and white pictures of the real men whom were in the mob . It looked very old school all in black and red . I really enjoyed this place . For a shared app we got "Ma's Meat" , two huge meatballs in a spicy sauce , it was soooo good . For entrees i had the "Dirty Angel Hair" or something and it was good . My boyfriend had a chicken dish that had cheese on it and it was great as well . Service was good , our wAiter Tal knew a lot about the menu and was very friendly . For our entrees they forgot to bring us forks which was the only flaw in service but besides that everything was great

fQbQm1jPZAVktwMoe0f0YA.text: This is an interesting alternative for people who don't want to go to Maggianos or Buca. I liked the atmosphere, but it was really hot since there aren't any windows and the kitchen is open.   I had the Caesar Salad which I gobbled and the meatball appetizer which was very good, as well. Will I purposely go out of my way to go my next trip to Vegas? Maybe not. But i'd definitely return if I was in the area or had a mad craving for Italian and a mob night :)  Oh and the bread was great, the garlic butter even better nom nom nom

C7h20sfoOx2JzBX8dypwRA.text: It was hard to decide between 3 stars and 4 stars on this one.  I'd love it if Yelp had half stars because I think our experience was actually a 3.5.  The ambiance of the restaurant cannot be beat.  I've been to the Flamingo location many times and have always loved it.  I was happy to see that the decor and general atmosphere of the restaurant was very similar.  After being seated, our server took a while to take our order, but she was super friendly.  We ordered the antipasto appetizer, which is basically a salad, but an AMAZING salad!!  It was delicious.  Only problem was that salad came with our entrees as well.  Anyway, the antipasto salad was awesome.  Then our dinner salads came, both with blue cheese dressing, and they were pretty disappointing.  They lettuce was completely swimming in dressing and I didn't have more than a couple bites.  Maybe next time I will ask for dressing on the side.  My date ordered the ravioli trafficanti, and I ordered the rigatoni with arrabiatta and a meatball.  His dish was delicious!!!  Unfortunately, we were super full already at that point from bread and salad, we only ate one of the giant ricotta stuffed raviolis.  My dish was...just ok.  It wasn't bad, but there was absolutely NO wow factor.  The meatball was not GREAT, but definitely good.  The dish just looked and tasted like something I could make at home with boxed rigatoni and Prego sauce, and throw in some chili peppers.  Voila!  Next time, I will have to remember to order something more complicated.  I would say over all, the food was a 4.  Service.  The restaurant was not that crowded, but our server seemed to be running around like she was completely swamped.  She may have checked on us only once throughout our entire meal.  Before our entrees came, we ordered wine so that we could have it with dinner, but our entrees came and we ate them and our server finally came back and said the bar was backed up and our drinks would be coming soon.  We just told her to cancel them because we were done eating!  I looked at the bar and there were 3 people sitting at it and the bartender just putting glasses away and chatting with the barback.  Then she took forever to bring us our check, and to take it after we put our credit card in it.  Overall, the service kind of sucked.  That would be a 3.  So I'd give the restaurant in general a 3.5, but since we can't, sorry Capo's, I have to round down because it definitely was not a 4-star experience.  I've always loved this restaurant because of it's unique experience with the entry way, the Sinatra-like singer, and the ambiance, but this time was mildly disappointing.  I'd go back, but not anytime soon and it won't be on the top of my list.

ex8UgbD8SmaBCC7YgXsKVg.text: The Food and atmosphere  is amazing and Portions  are very generous. I  Love this place! ! The Staff  is also very nice and provides great customer  service.

SHq-pTRePZ7-27A6XFbL6g.text: best italian food ever. seriously. stop messing around and get to capos.

NU3ry-Kbv8BQeF9k3P05Ow.text: Want to feel like a mobster for a night?  Then this place is for you!  The entrance rocks!!!  The food was good!  The lighting is so dark they give you a flashlight with dinner (not great for your elders if they are annoyed by this kind of thing).  The man sings all night and it can get to be a bit much with him singing at your table all night if you are trying to have a conversation.  The whole table liked the meatball appetizer as well as the scampi app.  My scampi dinner dish was good however I wish all of my noodles had been cooked thoroughly (some were a bit hard).  Super fun place to bring your out-of-town guests!

dvUPHw9PAJcOFdFxNgEuIA.text: First time here, and we will definitely come back. It's a neat gimmick; you need the secret code to get in. The food was delicious. The meatball and pepper appetizer had the right amount of spice. I had the chicken Marsala entree and the sauce had the perfect consistency. My wife had the chicken piccata. The sauce needed to have the wine reduced a bit more but she used the butter with the breadsticks to even it out. The risotto sides were so rich and creamy. The creme brulee dessert was one of the best we've ever had. It was so light and fluffy. The atmosphere is very romantic; we would've preferred to sit where we can see the entertainment instead of the corner, but that might have been because we were a bit under-dressed. Overall, we enjoyed Capo's and look forward to returning!

ti9KBFOmZYnRQtrvfXS79g.text: Great friendly service.  Out of veal when we were there, but they explained to us the chef looked at it from their supplier and sent it back. Settled for Chicken parm and wasn't disappointed!  Great desserts as well. A great experience for all including kids!  Yelp said it was 2 miles from the strip, but it was more like 12 miles. It was worth the extra millage and cab fare. We will return

GLAz0csFuXOCpKB9ysWPjQ.text: Dined on a significant discount coupon (Restaurants.com). OK, the Mafioso atmosphere was kind of cool and the entertainment was fun. The service was so undertrained it was almost as comical as it was annoying. Asked server (maybe battlefield-promoted busboy) about some of the wines and he said "I don't know, I just drink Jack n' stuff". Didn't offer to bring someone over more knowledgeable. Pulled menus away before we ordered, tried to pull plates away at odd times. Just really unpolished service...not rude, just disconnected. In any case, Caesar salad was institutional tasting. House salad was better. Lasagna was very tasty, although portion was small. New York Steak was actually very good. Overall, was satisfied based on the discounted cost. Would have been appreciably less satisfied at full cost and there would certainly be better options at comparable cost.

JFZ2oB9qzuiNoqjGS4zUaQ.text: From the moment we entered until the time we left it was a great experience! The decor was beautiful, damask style wallpaper, chandeliers and even the booths. I really enjoyed the gentleman singing Frank Sinatra covers during our meal as well as the servers. The food was quite good, I felt that my dish was lacking a bit of salt, but the drinks were generous! The ambiance was lovely, ideal for a romantic date or a nice dinner with the girls. I hope to return!

J9IRJYL8uJ4__-dDrgZESA.text: Start by saying it was quite the experience. Dimly lit restaurant, waiters in suspenders and all black clothing, reminding me of the 1920's "Hidden Speakeasys". Next the service, Valentine's Day dinner, the joint was very busy and the waitress took pretty good care of us. Finally the food.....the prices were very reasonable, the helpings were more than adequate, and the food was awesome. I definately would recommend this restaurant to anyone with this one comment. Do not let them put you in the back of the restaurant near the kitchen. Waiters going in and out constantly and very loudly calling out that they are entering, this was a bit distracting while I was with my love for dinner.

dkCl9WyElJE8vVY5qlvXyg.text: The food alone is worthy of 5 stars! The decor and ambiance is a bonus. I've been out to eat with my husband loads more than I care to admit. I've had my share of pasta dishes that are mediocre at best. Then there's Capo's, and I mean knock my socks off flavor that even our picky eater of a son loves. We've been here multiple times and it's been great every time. Lunch, or dinner and it's always friendly, fun and absolutely delicious. The deals on Groupon for lunch are a steal and we always get dessert.

OJJ1wqB4VtarxujBuHhv1A.text: Thanks Nico Santucci  for the old school Italian hospitality at your iconic Vegas institution. Capo's is such a local treasure. The meatball is delectable and the Marsala sauce was tops along with that mushroom risotto and pesto. Finished with a decadent chocolate cannoli, we can't say enough. Grazie Mille. Attentive and upbeat service in a cozy, romantic setting.

ile7HHNmFs6SCnHIA_6oAw.text: This is a cool mob themed restaurant in Vegas. It is very dark with chandeliers, a live crooner singing Sinatra tunes and a greeter who asks you if you have a weapon.   The food is good but pricey. The spaghetti and meatballs were excellent and my son's steak was cooked just right.  I recommend starting here and ending up at the Bing. Eat somehere else? Fuhgett about it !

0pD3f4LMSqpkA5p6WWq-bA.text: Had this on my bookmark list for 1+ years. I really liked the speakeasy entrance & it really got me good. I thought I was standing at the door but wasn't. That was super fun. The decor is vintage lounge for sure & well done. The pics on the wall were entertaining ambiance as well.  The food was unfortunately disappointing. I ordered the Caesar Salad lunch & Chicago Beef. The salad dressing was very tasty but completely drenched in it. I do tend to go easy on dressing so I'd order the dressing on the side & you'll be good to go. The Chicago Beef from a place that is supposed to be Capone should excel at Chicago classics. That's why I ordered the Chicago Beef. Such a bum-mer. The sandwich one wasn't dipped in the au jus. The au jus was very salty, heavy handed rosemary & not enough beef for the cost of the lunch special even. The fries were a luke warm soggy snooze fest. Just so disappointing. The service was good, attentive & the food came out promptly. Again the ambiance was fun, fun. I didn't get to see the entertainment which may have helped with an extra star but this was lunch & based on food.

nIdOjb4m8d6ef3FkLu-GXw.text: Great service - fun atmosphere. Music is superb. Food was great but not epic. Don't have to spend a huge amount of money here for a decent meal.

g-9ibetvQPxRshIA731zCw.text: Overall highest quality experience. Excellent (Italian) food. Good pace of the meal. We first came with a Groupon, but after the meal we're more glad about having found the place. We have been 2 times, a couple years apart and it's the best. I have recommended this place to  friends, and they enjoyed it as well. This place is for anyone looking for a good time, great food, and high quality experience.  Period.

vku1jKokdTAAbEsfbjZkAg.text: The food... AMAZING... the waitress Angela was as TERRIBLE as they come! The last 2 times I've been here I've crossed paths with her... the first time was a to go order and she ignored me for 20mins before taking my order, and then barely even acknowledged me the whole time.... the second time was today, August 6; I came in with my girlfriend for lunch because I wanted good Italian with my girlfriend. She ended up being our waitress where with only 5 tables including ours were being active and she touched everyone else and waited 25 mins before even getting our drinks and another 30 mins before taking our food order! The only things she did were the above and bring us the first drinks, never even brought refills or even our food! Just that and the check! It's ridiculous; the buss boy did everything else for us and was attentive to our needs without us asking; I can't remember his name but I remember he said he was from Germany; he deserves to be a waiter, unlike Angela! Because HE took care of us I gave him $20 for a tip and Angela $0 because she obviously didn't care. She even sat other tables down after us, took their orders and even got their food before even taking care of us.   I LOVE the food at this place but with the service I've gotten from her it makes me less wanting to come back and spend my hard earned money here. To your management who hopefully reads this; you need to make sure your waiters and waitresses in check, outside of the guy who DID help us the service was worse than I've gotten at McDonalds! And you guys aren't on the cheap side. You're a fine dining authentic Italian restaurant and your staff needs to understand that and project that to your customers.

GuJ010NS60avByA7X6V67g.text: The ambiance in this place can't be beat if you're looking for a classic Vegas speakeasy-type of old-world Italian charm. The food - as long as you stick to what they do best - is pretty darn good too, making this place worth the trip up Sahara.  The service was really spot-on too.  We had early 5:00pm reservations on a Saturday night for six people and there were plenty of attentive staff members to attend to our every need.  There were unfortunately a few shortfalls.  One was with the Chilean Sea Bass which was a special of the evening.  Ordering seafood at an Italian restaurant with no fish at all on the menu probably isn't a good idea, and this proved to be the case here.  Luckily I wasn't the one who ordered it and the person in our group who did wasn't as familiar with the plate.  She didn't seem to mind the fishy smell and taste which ordinarily wouldn't accompany a fresh version of this dish, but the bite I had was not good.  Wasn't prepared poorly, just wasn't fresh or of high quality, particularly for the price.  Minus one star.  The rest of the food, though also somewhat pricy, was delicious.  Pasta, a signature chicken dish and even a Ribeye steak were all wonderful.  The meatball appetizer consisting of two baseball-sized meatballs in a spicy pepper sauce was a real star of the show.  Stuffed mushrooms were good too, but also a bit on the spicy side.  If you're not a lover of zing, watch for things on the menu noted as spicy - they're not lying.  For larger parties of six or more, they are supposed to include an 18% gratuity as explained on the menu.  Parties of either 8 or 10 or more (can't recall which) have a 20% gratuity tacked on.  I don't have a problem with this and it's clearly noted on the back of the menu, but it seems the staff does have a problem with it.  When our check came there was a 20% gratuity added onto it, even though we only had 6 people at the table.  To add insult to injury, they figured the 20% gratuity on the POST-TAX amount.  Those two screw-jobs added up to quite a bit since the pre-tax total was already over $300.00, so minus another star.  We were in a rush and truthfully I would have added more onto the pre-tax 18% I was expecting anyway because the service was truly fantastic, but I would have rather done so myself.  Instead, our nice meal ended with me feeling as if I'd just been screwed because they can't follow their own rules.  C'mon Capo's - do the right thing.  Figure the percentages properly and apply them appropriately to the pre-tax amount.  The extra couple of dollars isn't worth the bad taste left in the mouth of any diner paying for a party of six or more who can do basic math.    And if you're reading this and going there with a party of six or more, keep the calculator handy and make sure you're treated fairly.  Maybe it was just our server using these kinds of underhanded, deceitful methods of figuring out gratuities, but I'll never know because next time I have six or more in our party, I'll go somewhere else.

-Y7V-8_bZtehGySmWfTnyQ.text: Came here while visting Vegas with my husband.  I loved the entryway and how you were "greeted" by the host.  The inside is very old school looking but it has a certain charm to it.  We sat in a huuuuge oversized booth but it was so nice for just the two of us.  There was some Frank-Sinatra sounding guy crooning & singing to everyone but not in an "in your face, I'm annoying" type of way.  It was lovely!  Our waiter, and actually all of the staff, was great.  I think his name was Francisco.  We usually tell our waitstaff we are vegetarian from the get-go that way they don't waste their breath with the specials and he immediately made some great suggestions for us.  They have a veggie meatball they offer instead of their traditional one, we were so impressed!  My husband had the spaghetti and meatball, and I had the penne vodka...  so. damn. good.  We also shared a caesar salad and a bowl of pasta fagiole (I'm convinced no one makes it better than my Mom, but damn this place gives her a run for her money).  Pricing is very reasonable for the quality of food and the overall experience.  I didn't care for Las Vegas in general but if I ever go back, I will be returning for sure!

rVfzfu714bjTqrosb71idg.text: I had my doubts. But holy hell. From the service to the food to the music it was a night to remember.   This is now my go-to spot in Vegas. I had the best Lasagna ever. I tasted what others in our party were having too. It was amazing.   The lounge singer added a great deal to the ambiance of the evening.   When in Vegas. You must go here.

8vTtqkQlHlCyIIndoI_KAw.text: Decided to try capo's for my son's 10th bday and glad we did. It was awesome from the minute we walked through the door! The ambiance, decor, and retro vibe were so cool and the food was delicious!!!!! You have to try the mushroom risotto!  Our waitress, Ashley, was an absolute sweetheart, the host was awesome, and the entertainment was great...nothing but good things to say about this place! It's a little way off the strip, but worth it! We'll be coming again the next time we're in town  ...and try the canoli. You'll thank me later!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome! Amazing!  Delicious! From the host, to the singer, and our awesome waitress Ashley-everything and everyone was super friendly.

Kcf9QI0dPFBnHRnFh2vP8w.text: Fun old school Italian ambiance! Best Caesar salad!! Great lunch specials with sandwiches and the pasta everything is nicely proportioned great flavor really friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Caesar salad!!!!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fun spot for old school Italian
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball Sandwhich in house made Pasta salad- delish, and huge!!!

1IljHiYCZf6HQpuUNzHPyQ.text: This is a great place and I highly recommend. Vacationing in Vegas, wanted to try something different. I read about the Mob theme and thought it'd be interesting to check out. Fun place, but more importantly...Fantastic FOOD!! I'm from New York and love Italian food and I have to say, their lasagna is the best I've ever eaten! Besides the fact that I could only eat half of it because it was so big, the taste was fantastic. They have a homemade marinara sauce called Sugo i believe that was amazing. My wife had a NY strip steak that was also amazing. We've already booked our next trip to Vegas and I plan on visiting Capos again to try something else.

3zU1XnnnAclKIvEiZl2OgA.text: Awesome service, great food, unbelievable value, super atmosphere. Will be back every week. This place is super legit.

zYLq_Z0pra7kIY-jk1atQw.text: Everything we ordered came to the table cold; appetizers and main course. When I sent back my steak the waitress blamed me, the customer, for the entire meal being cold because I order my steak medium rare. And we all know that is baloney.

wmTh_M2kWJ-vCi_Vq3pzGQ.text: Everything I had heard about and more! Great old world Italian vibe from the minute you walk through the door. The entrance sets the tone for a fun night.  Service was prompt, helpful and a lot of fun!   The food was delicious. Those meatballs...ummmmm. Everything we had was fantastic.  Will make this a regular stop now when I am in Vegas.  A++++

P6qETOReHxQsavNnEBy_SQ.text: Fun place with a great sense of humor and old Italian ambiance. You ring a bell for the speakeasy-style entrance and you get greeted through a tiny window to make sure you know the password. Take a step back in time with red leather booths, dimly lit dining room and cheesy singer with a tuxedo jacket- all in a great way. Reasonable prices and amazing food. Had the Mafioso caprese, ravioli with meatball, chicken Parmesan and linguini with clams. Everything was homemade quality and yummy. Would go back any time.

b00IHaOC151ZU-uaGuybxw.text: Cool spot to take visiting friends or family for a unique off-Strip dinner: Italian food in a speakeasy-theme joint with a dark interior and a one-of-a-kind entrance. I'd say this is more for adults than kids, though. Dinner prices are a bit on the high side, but they occasionally come up on Groupon.  CAPO'S HOUSE  SALAD or NICO'S CAESAR SALAD ($7): Overpriced and overdressed, they use tons of dressing, but do taste good. Opt for the garlic version on the House, splurge the extra $3 to add chicken to the Caesar. AUNTIE G'S ANTIPASTO SANDWICH ($12): Chicken breast and various antipasto meats and cheeses layered on a tasty focaccia with roasted red peppers, spinach, and a delightful lemon-pesto aioli. Side choice of pasta salad or fries, topped with additional aioli. Large portion, very fresh. SANTUCCI'S PASTA ($10): classic spaghetti with "Capone family secret sauce", add a giant meatball for $5 to make it a real meal. Pasta was a bit mushy but the 'ball was pretty good, BF said he'd get this again.  Food quality for lunch was probably a 3/5 but attentive service and atmosphere kicks the overall rating up to a 4 for me. Would come back in the evening for the Frank Sinatra singer, or to catch HH at the bar (3-6PM, M-Sat). They have a private dining room for larger parties. Look for the chalk body outline on your way out the door.

hIDKX2PA7VZ5CjlPyGKeSA.text: We wanted something off the Strip that was more of a local's place. My father was celebrating a special occasion and I wanted something special.   The "speakeasy" atmosphere is well documented as is the "Sinatra" singer. It really was a great atmosphere.   The food is pretty traditional. Ingredients are high quality.   I had the Chicken Anastasia ... it was good, but not as flavorful as I would have hoped. The side of penne was again good, but nothing special.   Other dishes seemed to be better received. Both the spaghetti and meatballs as well as a chicken Milanese type dish were excellent.   Overall the meal was good ... just not memorable. The four stars was given due to the cool atmosphere and overall value.   Also, they have plenty of parking so don't pay the high price of taxis!  It will cost about $30 each way!

jpugL_N5o73HC2ckpNR3fw.text: My type of place!  This place is truly fantastic- a hidden Vegas gem. Dark and intimate with a ton of history. Went with a few friends and enjoyed excellent Italian cuisine along with great service, and table-side entertainment.  Although they do have a bar I would recommend making a reservation to really take this place in and do the full dining experience.   One issue was that the music (a great old-style live singer) was a little too loud, we could barley hear each other talk but it wasn't like that the whole time and I still give them 5 stars because we had fun and I was impressed.

yLtkR-Ku9rsJkzc6AHggJg.text: Came here for lunch on a Groupon and it was absolutely amazing going for second time for dinner and to see what excitement we will have service was great food was great it is a must-see place

YNBdtvl4FQvVTtXLa5DyyA.text: Went here last night with a group of 9 guys.  It has an awesome atmosphere.  They were totally accommodating to us including a couple of weird diet restrictions and even made special dishes without being asked. The entire staff was great, especially our waitress.  I can't imagine the person who gave the  angry sounding 1 star review below went to the same place we did.  The food was fresh and tasted great.  It's a bit of a hike if you are staying on the strip but we found it well worth it.

yCtTXQ7J_a3oZJnMpdkhTg.text: Awesome ambiance! Had a great magician entertain us at our table and had a wonderful server...Francisco. you'll love the way you have to check in for your reservation.

IPBGU4c0rck5FLU5IXcGWg.text: We go to Vegas often and have driven by this place a million times.  It's located across the street on Sahara Ave across from the car dealerships. I had purchased a Groupon so we could give it a try and we are very happy that we did. The Groupon offered was for 2 house salads ($6.95) that had this amazing creamy garlic dressing that we had on the side.  2 entrees and we had the meatball sandwich ($9.95) with a choice of pasta salad or fries. I had the pasta and it wS delicious with marinated artichokes. The sandwich was not bad. The meatball had good flavor but was a bit tough.  My husband had the Capone's carbonara ($10.95) that was delicious!  It came with 2 beverages. He had coffee and I had iced tea and both were good.  The service was great. The waitress was warm and friendly and so was the busboy.  It had an old school mobster vibe with red leather booths and a piano that they said they have entertainment at night.  We really enjoyed it. We are going to try it for dinner next time.  Sorry we don't have pictures my phone died when we sat down.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House salad with delicious creamy garlic dressing
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta carbonara
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball sandwich

CEadUIJDNXbourLP-IM_8A.text: Upon arriving I thought this place was closed. You enter and wait for staff to open a secret door to get inside. Very cool! The inside is old authentic italian mob themed decor. They have a good selection and pricing for lunch. I had a work lunch here and was able to try the meatballs and carbonara. The sauce was amazing and the staff was really attentive. Finished off with beautiful canolis.

f9AothLnrHmHMPY3Wn6pSg.text: I was blown away... the food was amazing and service was excellent.. they are going see more of me

XXJjaBm6mnpffKyQ3ZdKyA.text: Amazing Place.   Great customer service, cool atmosphere and a nice place to go after visiting the Mob Museum. Their 'Kick in the Head' drink is ferocious! Their breads and entrees were on point too. I had a chicken parmigiana-type of meal and it was CRAZY good! Please make a reservation. They fill up pretty fast after 5pm. Just an FYI.  I also like how all of the staff are in character. They talk like the stereotypical mob figures we see in the movies! Lol!

viD_YtSQ5a9JJ4BBQ-CxiQ.text: Very nice place and good food but the gentleman who answered the phone has ZERO customer service skills, was rude and hang upon me!

XOfQrpX7b_TwmTAvimObog.text: This is my new Italian favorite place! World famous meatballs! Totally delicious chicken marsala and the staff rocks! We will go back for the awesome food the fun environment and the super staff!

0wzfuN_E__NO2buwkSHYDw.text: Capo's is hands down the BEST Italian restaurant I've ever been too. My mother in law is from Italy and she refuses to eat anywhere but here, that's how amazing this place is!! The theme, ambiance, food, people, music, everything is amazing. I love this place!

PWd5KE6WeL3WKrsWH9gkRA.text: Awesome place.  From service to food to desert.  An absolute must!  Definately do not miss.

zO8fi0ZKV3czeXK497DK6A.text: My fiance and I are Locals here in Vegas. We have been here 2 times since living here. The 1st time my fiance took me here was a complete surprise. He found Capos on Google. He was looking for something special because I had just gotten a promotion at work. So he found you..made reservations and we went. We loved the entire experience we had. The ambiance, the service and the food!!!  Must try the Meatball...so good...I am not a huge fan of meatballs but this one was said to be the best and it was. The names of dishes are quite funny...I had swimming with the fishes...a great shrimp pasta meal...which you could tell the pasta was homemade! My fiance had Lasagna which was so big he couldn't finish it...he said it was the best he ever had. The Sauce was delicious. Probably the best sauce I've had in a restaurant. Now for the service... better than 5 stars both times we have been! Never were our drinks empty, very friendly, very attentive. The 2nd time we came we had told another local couple that are friends of ours to come with us. They had said that they wanted Italian food...so we said we have to go here...we sat in the main dining room this time, had a magician who was amazingly funny and had us stumped on how he was doing his tricks, the lounge performer really set the mood for old school vegas, and once again, food and service did not disappoint.  This is truly an experience not to be missed!!! We will definitely be going back again and again!

7I6UKvyEuFflOszKq5JpKw.text: This place was a blast! Loved how the guy answered through the picture. The east coast accent too. I'm from South Philly and I felt like I was home. Food was good service was great also. We will go back.

CQ7FQv_7oePQxq8yMaxsOQ.text: Gimme a name...and a kick in the head. From the moment I called to make reservations, to the minute I left the joint - I was smiling. I called to make sure we wouldn't be turned away and the mobster that answered replied with a heavily Italian, "Gimme a name..."  We arrived on a Thursday for lunch. We found the secret entrance, gave the eyes in the doorway the code and were granted admission. The entire place is dimly lit and mob like. Red lights flash to alert them of new visitors and creaky wood floors keep people honest. We were seated right away, in a comfy booth adorned with a portrait of Al Capone.   All the waiters wear white pressed long sleeve shirts and black trousers with suspenders. I selected the meatball sandwich, which came with a side salad. The sandwich was amazing. The best Italian I have ever had in my life. The creamy garlic dressing is so good, you will wish you could take a bottle home with you. From the drink list, I chose "Kick in the Head". We visited a nearby tiki bar a bit later and let me tell you -Capo's crafts a much better cocktail. It was delicious and carried just the right punch.   My man selected the chipped Italian beef sandwich and again, we were blown away. It's as if they have taken good home cooking and elevated it to off the charts good. Their Chianti selection is also excellent. Service was great.   We were there too early in the day for the piano player. I am already planning a return dinner trip, so that we can experience that. I have heard nothing but great things about him.

vfTcxtwco3abJe85C9Ud8A.text: I have been here several times and have never been disappointed. I always get the spaghetti and meatball, which has the best marinara sauce I have tasted. I heard it was the Capone family's secret recipe... The bread is great and always comes out hot and fresh. My family has tried other dishes and are never disappointed. My son loves the alfredo with shrimp. We stop everytime when visiting Las Vegas.

JHb-yQiBK0YHflJeihxobw.text: Walked in no reservation, was told very busy we are welcome to sit at bar. Worked out great, food was excellent, drinks were well made, overall 10 out of 10. Also requested a song from the singer and he sang it to my girl at the bar, perfect experience. Highly recommend, just make a reservation or do like we did and sit at bar!

gdjyS8gXL0Olk2TLUuRReA.text: Birthday Party of 15.... they gave us our own room.... loved it... let's see, loved the staff, thank you so much!! Mushroom risotto suggested by jeanine.... freaking delicious! Meatball app... thumbs up! We had everything from steak, to chicken parm, shrimp, veal, and lobster... everyone loved everything.... we had a wonderful time.

WntD5L91sw7o9BFtuBcXMw.text: This place is a must hit when in Vegas. Well off the strip, but well worth it. Take Uber from the strip; like   $10.   The people running it and our waitress were absolutely amazing. The man singing and playing the piano was fantastic. The magician that came to our table amazed us with slight of hand that we could not figure out.   But most importantly, the food was delicious. We had spaghetti, lasagna & shrimp pasta, and all were great. Huge portions, with great prices. Drinks were awesome.   You must go here.

PWg3eXJfilYrLk-jtsOKFA.text: Went with a Groupon and was treated like very well, just like everyone else. We did go during off hours because we'd heard it gets crowded. Lasagna and meatballs were amazing. I probably shouldn't have eaten all that bread, though. But it's like crack and I couldn't stop.  Cool interior makes you feel like you're in an old school speak easy. Love the chalk outline of the body by the door, lol.

vlGFWp_SMBqaUzd3vJt34g.text: Best old school Italian food in Vegas!!! Absolutely amazing!!! You will here Jerrys name mentioned often!!! Lol
