eO_BS8MZ8XQxzvfu6ZJxZA.text: So I spend $25 dollars for Spaghetti with meat sauce and a small Ceasers salad and I mean small the lettuce could fit in the palm of one hand not only that but it's shredded as if it was going on a taco. The spaghetti sauce looks like they didn't take the time to drain the noodles fully before adding sauce. Really surprised at how bad the food is now it's been a while since I have eaten there and will be the last time I go back. The unique style is not worth the price and bad food.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You get better looking sauce from Olive Garden and with less water.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiny shredded Caesar salad not worth it.

wTf5DrdkYgUMKSS9mlcSJA.text: "Who knew that, after 30 years, I'd find my favorite Italian restaurant on a random street corner in Las Vegas."  My friend actually said that, and he was only kind of joking.  I based my first trip to Capo's on its Yelp star rating alone, and I am really glad I did so.  Had I actually read any reviews (which I did later, after eating a very satisfying meal and no longer wishing to devour the phone from which I was Yelping), my experience would not have been as cool.  I took my friend to Capo's last night, and I didn't tell him anything about it, other than to let him know that I really like the food.  From the moment the little window-hole opened in the entry-way, he had a smile on his face.  Capo's really knows how to deliver on ambience.  Everything from the decor to the dark to the hard New York Italian accents on the waiters screams Goodfellas.  I can't imagine anyone not liking the environment here.  The food is really good as well.  Be warned that the chef at Capo's LOVES garlic.  It is in absolutely everything, in copious amounts, and it is delicious.  Don't miss the Mafioso Caprese from the "Temptations" list.  As for entrees, I have tried Uncle Pauly's Arrabiata, Vinny's Ala Vodka, and a Cioppino that was offered one night as a special.  Everything was great and garlic-laden.  If you want to speak to anyone after you eat at Capo's, make sure that you take them with you.  If you order Uncle Pauly's, make sure that you feed them some.  I'm being absolutely serious here.  Be prepared to leave extremely full.  Bread, butter, and Parmesan cheese arrive the moment you sit down.  Go ahead and try to resist bread that is still steaming from the oven.  They'll bring your temptation order before they bring the soup or salad that comes with your meal.  You'll love whatever you get.  Then your soup (try the Pasta Faggioli) or salad (Ceasar!) will arrive.  About halfway through that, you'll remember that you have an entree coming, but you won't be able to stop.  If you order a pasta entree, the sauce will be among the most amazing things you've ever tried, so you'll definitely need to take home your leftovers.  As you might imagine, I have never gotten around to dessert.  It's good to have a goal for next time.

2VRiPn9cC2SQECjdqg2z0Q.text: Had a Travelzoo voucher to try this restaurant.  Went with my friend for lunch.  Wasn't crazy about the secret door since I rang 3 times before someone came to open it.  But we were pleasantly surprised!  The service was very good.  The Capo's house salad with its creamy garlic dressing was very tasty.  I also ordered the Big Dom's Primavera, penne pasta and vegetables with olive oil garlic sauce.  The meal was great!  If you love Italian food you should try this place out.

o3EVYw-5aO9zGeVmrEEbzw.text: Cool idea, poorly executed. Guy that seated us was standoffish and left us without menus for almost 10 minutes. Were never offered water. Ordered wine and received one glass that was almost 2x the other one, when pointed out to waitress she told me (I got the bigger glass) that I must have gotten lucky. Hubby's glass was no more than 3 oz - ridiculous. Food would have been tasty if it was hot! Good flavors but lukewarm at best. Same thing for my starter, the spinach egg soup. I wish it was served hot! Also, $20 spaghetti and meatballs featured one meatball. IT SAYS MEATBALLS ON THE MENU. And I have never seen a smaller portion of lasagna. As I mentioned, could have overlooked the small pricey portions if they food was served hot, or at least warm. I will not return here, totally not worth it. And the live singer was just awful. What a tourist trap!

1-VSX-PMRHACnSPzMI86og.text: This place is awesome!!! The mob secret entrance was one of a kind absolutely hilarious!! They have live entertainment that just made the experience even better. They also take requests and sang my cousin Happy Birthday.The food was amazing entire party of 8 had a great time the server was very attentive. I will definitely come back the next time we are in Vegas!!

BwanoCTEKOGV0_fHZRAzBQ.text: Tried Capo's with my boyfriend for the first time last night and had a blast! The whole Vegas mob vibe is alive and strong here with the secret entrance, password act, and dark setting. The live entertainer was great, he even sang a song we requested!  Service was amazing. Our glasses of water and wine never went below 1/2 full. We ordered the bruschetta (above average) as an appetizer. The house bread basket with garlic butter was yummy too. For entrees, he had the shrimp scampi and I had the Chicken Angelo. Both were amazing! I had the house italian salad and he had the caesar...very good as well.   For dessert we got the Italian coffee with amaretto...HIGHLIGHT of the meal by far! My pinot noir was fantastic too.  Overall, the experience was phenomenal and I would recommend the restaurant to anyone any day. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 was because of the heat. We were sitting by an AC monitor that read the current temperature at 86 degrees. It was a little uncomfortable even for small people who love being in the warm outdoors! If the restaurant steps up their AC offering, they will be 5 stars for sure! Otherwise, I'll be back when the weather cools down ;)

pPzuAB-G_ssA2N3eOzwPxQ.text: Sandwiches are good.  However, the choice of the two sides available leaves much to be desired.  With the sandwiches, which were all about $10, one side is offered from only two selections....pasta salad or fries.  No choices of substitution are allowed; someone in our group with dietary restrictions asked if she could substitute anything else....broccoli, a side salad, cottage cheese, coleslaw.  No substitutions are available.  She was told she could just not get the side if she wanted.  Same price.  The pasta salad was awful, as were the fries.  The fries come with some kind of weird sauce on them.....a mayonnaise based sauce that wrecked the fries.  One person ordered the fries without the sauce.  They were average at best. I feel this restaurant should expand the selection of the two sides that no one in our group of 5 liked at all. The house salad was basically lettuce that was not good.  There were a few microscopic pieces of tomato...not bigger than 1/2 of a square centimeter.  With so many choices in Las Vegas, Capo's needs to serve better side dishes.

g6dzDyGxKW8X-etghZZPqQ.text: I've only been once but it was enough for me to form my opinion.  I'm not one for kitsch and this place is full of it.  I should have turned around and left when they pulled the door stunt, but I didn't.  Watch your step as you enter too.  This place is so dark you need a flash light to see anything.  Again, I shoulda ran.  Finally got seated and was greated by a server that was gorgeous but i'm am sure was mentally challenged.  Wonder how she got the job?  Because it was too dark to see the menus, my companion asked her if he could have vodka sauce in his capellini (not my choice but hey.....).   She had no idea what vodka sauce was and didn't know capellini was a pasta.  Finally, after a very painful experience trying to order our food came.  It was ok but I couldn't wait to get out of there.

iXrfSfze_ooy9SMDFV5mPQ.text: Fun, themed atmosphere! Great food! The bruschetta was unique, but tasty. I had the chicken anasazi (sp?), it was delicious. The risotto was just okay though. Excellent customer service.

5Xz6tlErxuqZmORXscb17w.text: The food and service were both good, and the mob theme made the experience more interesting.  The live music and low-level lighting created a nice ambiance.  I was really impressed with the singer and thought he sounded just like Tony Bennett.  Will definitely go back.

VhZf1BwD6ADTNg9REmoDIQ.text: What's to say that hasn't already been said?! This is as good as it gets for Italian food AND atmosphere in Las Vegas.  Needing an excellent date place? You can't go wrong with Grade-A Italian food and a friendly guy in a suit singing Frank Sinatra!  My only food-specific recommendation is the bruschetta appetizer. It's a must-order, and I could easily make an entire meal out of it.  Two final thoughts...warnings, really.  1) Yes, it's dark inside. It's very dimly lit, but I personally felt it added to the ambiance.  2) You're going to overeat on this amazing food and need to roll yourself out the door!

Ot1DS6Y2AT7DNvEL2uvCzg.text: Loved it all the way. I'm proud to say I've never been to an Olive Garden or any mainstream chain. Capos is on another level and out of the main drag for restaurants.   It's dark when you go in but go with it. Make sure you are hungry or else you won't enjoy anything. The meatball appetizer satisfied my meat craving and then some. The Caprese was also just what I expected, just like my friend's mama's recipe. I had the linguini with clams and I made a mess, scarfing down everything and quaffing down some decent wine.  All I needed was a cigar and some strippers.

mrqKyagYM5JPuNImze8-Pg.text: My husband and I were told by our brother in law what to expect, but the people that we brought with us were SO surprised!!!  It was such an amazing experience, from the ambiance to the "True to character" guys hosting and our fabulous waitress, the entire night was wonderful!   We ordered mushroom caps, calamari and meatballs for appetizers, all of which were outstanding!  Our group ordered pastas, steaks, seafood, veal, etc.  NOT ONE complaint!!!  All of this, cocktails, neverending wine and it was less that $100 per person...  Where I come from, this is unheard of! I would highly recommend Capo's to any adult group.  We will definitely be back for more!

rUV9KWWy1z7vAs6xA9-4IA.text: We discovered the place thanks to Travel Channel's new show with Adam Richman.  A group of six of us enjoyed all aspects of the place except for the volume of the singing.  Don't get me wrong, he was fantastic, but we couldn't carry on a conversation until we had to move into another room. We started out with some great apps.  The fried ravioli, meatballs and the "off the menu" leftovers dish that our waitress (Janine) cut into 8 portions since it is normally served as a healthy sized entree.  It was fantastic.  The fried ravioli was pretty good, but would have preferred a meat filling vs. ricotta cheese.  The meatballs were as good as they get.  Everyone commented for days about how good they were. My wife kept it light and just got a chicken Caesar salad and loved it.  I had the veal parmesan and loved it.  Everyone was so impressed with each of their entrees, we were sharing bites from across the table for an hour. Our entire group is from Chicago and an Al Capone Speakeasy was of interest to all of us.  We know our Italian food and I've been traveling to Vegas for nearly 40 years and had some of the best Italian food in the world while visiting there.  We've been to dozens of places including Piero's and have to say this meal was as good as it gets in that town, if not better in many ways including very fair prices.  It was only a 15 minute ride from the strip and we WILL be going back. Janine (our waitress), if you're reading this, thank you for the superior service.  You really made the evening that much more special for us.

HR4v7MuxZZSuLW37yEXkKQ.text: They have MEATBALL SALADS!!!!! Oh my goodness! This is a great place for groups. They have friendly staff and they even have their own driver when the taxi service is bad. Thank you for a delicious meal. Make a reservation before going.

iyRX6vdXTHfm5Jsehud8eg.text: Peek a boo.....whats the password. Ok very mafia style.When you enter the establishment you enter into a small room. You ring the bell and a little peek a boo door opens. Just as you would imagine in the movies, that is what happened.  Once you enter its a grand space of old style furniture and dark feeling. The food was good and they even had live music with a guy singing to his piano.

Cy3zwczqJggYsux7NeG7lg.text: Over-priced but delicious. For an off-the-strip restaurant I thought they were a bit pricey on certain items and they even charged more for an item then it was listed on the menu. The staff was overall friendly and they even had a guy singing a few songs throughout the night. There were four of us and everyone really enjoyed their meals. "The Gallows With Clams" - had been craving fresh pasta with some red clam sauce for a long time and this absolutely satisfied that craving. A bit pricey at $23 but it was a nice size portion with a good amount of clams. (similar dish at Maggianos which is on the strip is only $16) "Mad Dog Marsala" w/Chicken + mushroom risotto - Kacey ordered and enjoyed but way, way, way overpriced at $28. The meal is listed at $24 and the waitress listed off the sides available. However she failed to mention that the risotto was going to add another $4 as a substitute. Way overpriced for one piece of chicken and a little side of risotto. "The Mob's Meatball Salad" - friend that ordered it loved it. I tried Meatball and it was delicious. "Capo's Lasagna" - friend loved it.  Be careful if you order drinks as they are pricey and add up quick.

bETdCJbJrxLgo40hejpN0g.text: 2 for 1 Tuesday, I was wondering why it was soooo busy.  I was hoping for a nice romantic dinner with my boyfriend for his birthday but it was crazy busy.  I've been here before so I'll definitely attribute the crowd to the 2 for 1 Tuesday special.  This was not my best experience, it took forever to get anything... The waitress would take our requests (refills, butter) and after she would return to the table, forgetting to bring our request, she would then ask the bus-boy who was very good at picking up her slack.  The food is okay but the only reason to come here is definitely for the experience.

2mf6e0VnQMvF2fkuCvN-Dg.text: I met some friends at Capo's with no reservations around 7:00 pm on a Saturday night.  I expected to wait some time for a table which just made for more conversation time with friends.  We made our way to the bar and ordered a couple of drinks that were well made and just strong enough.  The ambience was evocative of what I think a "speakeasy" would have  been in the 20s or 30s.  There are pictures on the walls of various notorious pre-WWII gangsters.  There was a gentleman performing karaoke to classic Sinatra, Martin, Bennett and other crooners.  He was, for the most part, right on.    Eventually, we made our way to a booth to eat.  In our group we ordered Veal, salmon, lasagna and arrabiata pasta.  We started with an appetizer of caprese which was very good.  A large section of mozzarella, thick slice of tomato and a good dose of balsamic vinegar.  I would have preferred more basil, but I'm really partial to basil.  Our meals were delicious.  The protions were good, but not overwhelming.  With our appetizer, bread, and soup or salad before the meal there was enough to take home after eating sensibly.    The server was attentive without being overbearing.  Our waters were consistently refilled without request.  All in all a great evening of food, service and ambience.  I look forward to going back.

-cWPahoOCgeridubRPM4Ow.text: Horrible. The bread has changed. Bread sticks cut in half, stale. The salads are a third of the size and the dressing is out of a bottle. Waited 45 minutes for our entrees and my chicken Parmesan was cold, my dads lasagna was so burnt you couldn't even cut it with a knife, brothers penne alla vodka was mushy and over cooked and the meatball on the spaghetti tasted like dog food. It was so in edible we all spit it out. The best thing of the night was my glass of chianti. I felt bad for out poor server who was extremely friendly but had no control over the disgusting food. We all got home and had stomach aches even though we just had salad and bread! VOID AT ALL COST!

CbbiPcioaVW6Te77ErDY8A.text: Eaten here twice before, food was delicious, but I hadn't received what I had ordered.  The other night my friend and I had the ceasar salad and tiramisu and were sick in the bathroom for 24 hours... up and out :((

hem0V5eoJvn3Gjt_Z_beDQ.text: This place is phenomenal!! The atmosphere the service the food the entertainment all top notch! The only downside is I will never be able to eat the crap they call Italian cuisine in Washington where I live. If you are in Las Vegas this place is a must!

wGniHxy8IAbwo-AakxwIYw.text: This restaurant is so cool. It has the whole mobster theme going. The entrance to the restaurant is a wall with the telephone. You ring a bell and the maitre d opens a little window to talk to you. A wall then opens into the restaurant. Genuis!  The inside of the restaurant is dimly lit and has little red candle holders on each table. It totally gives off a "Goodfellas" feel. There's also a hidden back room where large parties can eat around a poker table.  I've been here three times and always have pasta with Italian sausage. It's super good. "Tony's Duck" soup and the bruchetta are really good too.   I recommend coming here not just for good food but a unique eating experience. You'll feel like you're in "GoodFellas" or even what living in Vegas in the 70's was like.

c3IsC3a5WSKz8zNTiowlhw.text: Yuck! This place sucks. The decor is cool and total mob scene but the food is so nasty! Not even close to being authentic Italian food. I got 4 small frozen ravioli for 30 bucks...really? The service sucked as well. Stay away and try Parma or Roma instead.

_psLp8P6X4UhYYKQj3byWA.text: Way too expensive for the poor service and food quality.  Waited 15 min for someone to come to the table.  Was halfway thru dinner before I was offered water.

kplH6x-mV03bnpaYOOkJnQ.text: I Freaking Love this Place!  I've been here a few times and the food is always great, but the ambiance is ridiculously cool.  You feel like you're in a prohibition era speak easy.  The walls are covered in mobster memorabilia.  Last time I took my family here everybody thought there was a Frank Sinatra album playing until I pointed out the singer.  Ridiculous

yyGi-WnPV4ZV4FhHpFjg_A.text: Everything has been upgraded here compared to the Tropicana location.  The atmosphere is one of a kind in town.  My wife certainly appreciates the indoor smoking area they have there too.  We usually just eat at the bar and bs w/ the cooks.  Meatball salad is probably my favorite thing on the menu.  Anything w/ their meatballs in it actually....

0EML-vmP6i08ZDV2QggY4g.text: The ambience alone gets this place 5 stars.  From the unique entry to the Frank Sinatra-esque singer this place was so much fun.  The food was fantastic, we stuffed ourselves! Definitely worth taking a cab there.

uDaJmVvcrJfSxDb_4kmO8Q.text: Nice atmosphere but our waitress was very inattentive and our order was wrong. We ordered an appetizer, it never came, I added shrimp to my Alfredo pasta and it was missing. For an additional $10 you'd thought it would not have been forgotten! By the time it came I only had a couple bites of pasta left! Very disappointed in our  1st experience but I will give it 1 more try before I completely "X" them off my list.

t6NcRGmnZtwqBthpGDgapQ.text: Very cute throwback restaurant, I love the decor. I had raviolis and meatballs, all and all everything was very good. I will come back again.

JWcOEbQpkcMNkfRP6yaEZA.text: Easily my favorite casual dining restaurant in Las Vegas!   This place came highly recommended from a colleague, someone I didn't trust much, but she raved about the secret entrance, wonderful atmosphere and fantastic food and she looked like she knew a thing or two about food (if you know what I mean).   My fiance and I decided to check it out on one of our date nights and were immediately confused as to which entrance to go through, the (free) valet kid helped us out, it's all part of the atmosphere. Why they have valet, I'll never understand, especially since the restaurant is the only thing occupying a majority of spaces in this small shopping center.   Once inside, we were rudely asked, "Can I help you?" by a pair of eyes peaking through a secret sliding peep hole. Nervously, we told him of our reservation and to our enjoyment he opened the "secret" door, revealing a dark, noisy bar, chalk outlines on the floor, dim lighting, ornate chandeliers and wallpaper. A cheesy piano man was hitting the keys and singing Bobby Darin, a tip jar was perched at the edge of his mini grand while old mob movies played on flat screen TVs. Immediately, we fell in love with the place and still hadn't seen a menu.   Anyone who knocks the atmosphere must be crazy, or simply prefers a quiet, intimate restaurant. Don't get me wrong, those kinds of places are fun, too, but this place is noisy, dark and heavily themed, I can't stress that enough and this is coming from someone who hates Rain Forest Cafe because of the atmosphere and theme.  Our waiter was wonderful, he had a thick Italian accent, I believe fake, but still hilarious and he told us about the menu and gave us time to look over the menu after taking our drink orders. Cocktails are a bit expensive, but there aren't many quality bars in Vegas that serve cheap cocktails, so the price was mostly forgiven.   We each ordered a pasta dish, her the Lasagna and me the "Angels with Dirty Faces," which is a bit heavy, but for a pepperoni fan like me, was extremely flavorful and delicious. Now, let me be honest about the food, this is in no way the best food in Las Vegas (so far, that belongs to Carne Vino at Palazzo, but that's another Yelp). This place is wonderful for its combination of theme, atmosphere and food, not one thing or the other. Remember Chuck E. Cheese's when you were a kid? That karma of arcade games, ball pit and mediocre pizza? Remember how fun that was? Now, improve the pizza, replace arcade games and ball pit with atmosphere and cocktails and you've got the kind of harmonious perfection that makes Capos such a fun, memorable place.   We've been here too many times to count and bring our out-of-town friends all the time and they love it. We've never had a bad experience.   Please give this place a try, if you're not a food snob, you will love it.

Rrdghgb6CgqtXUrZgZuVYg.text: Great restaurant!  Enjoyed with 4 of our grand kids that are in their early 20's.  The Mob atmosphere added to a great experience.  The staff were very friendly; the service remarkable; the food was a delight and the dessert a mouth watering experience.  We were entertained by a young man who performed his magic tricks at our table and musically entertained by the piano musician.

M9EccvmrVw37zH3qhy-arQ.text: Great service and atmosphere. Food was really good, but they might have cooked it with a time machine. It came out so fast it was like it was waiting for us.

q9W0KxxVAcGJDbfDslU21g.text: Fantastic!!  My husband and I decided to check it out for our 20th anniversary as he had heard good things about it....and boy was what he had heard correct!  The service was impeccable and the food was amazing! He had lasagna and I had chicken marsala with a side of mushroom risotto. The chicken was so tender I barely needed a butter knife. Everything was wonderful and the dark restaurant with the half moon red leather booths with the chandeliers above them really set a romantic mood.  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who asks.

enBe7x2WCDW6muISjr9o2A.text: Are you freakin' kidding me?  Being a regular, I can say that this is, hands & feet down one of the coolest Vegas flair restaurants, unique in its kind & kick a$$ at the same time.  Capo's is the only speakeasy in Las Vegas.  Call for reservations & prepare to go back in time when Alphonse Gabriel aka: "Al" Capone hung out in an underground bar during the prohibition era of the 1920's & 1930's.  Food is pretty decent for Italian cuisine, not the best I've ever had.  But you don't necessarily go to Capo's for the food, ha, you go for the environment.  Most servers come fully equipped with some sort of East Coast accent.  But provide attentive and hospitable service.  Most nights a live lounge singer will serenade you table-side to good ole favs from Ol' Blue Eyes.  Don't make direct eye-contact if you don't want him to embarrass the sheeze outta ya.  Once he sang me, "that ladies a tramp" ha, thanks!   Corner location, not many people know of this little treasure, good for me, I bring all my out of town guests here.  They eat it up.  The decor is awesome, dimly lite & romantic-ish, and the bar almost always plays the movie Godfather.....or a mafia gangster movie.  There's also a hidden cigar bar upstairs, ask your server for details. It's super small & quite ventilation retard, but cool nonetheless.  GO, go at least once a week!

uOjszmoC-eY1x8Tr4QqUYA.text: My family and I, from Brooklyn, NYC, enjoyed a delicious and authentic Italian dinner at Capo's last night. This is the ONLY restaurant in Vegas where you will find the most delicious Italian specialties, like eating at Gramma's, for a very affordable price. Their meatballs rival Rao's and come out on top without a doubt. The macaroni dishes are overflowing and are topped with the most delicious specialty gravies.   Not to mention, the very refreshing, old world speak-easy charm, very efficient staff (with pleasant personalities), and the entertainment truly is a time machine back to the Sinatra days that make this whole dining experience a worthwhile destination to say the least.  So put this one on the top five list, and enjoy a unique dining experience. Bobby Liguori, the Frank Sinatra - of the night, should not be missed!  His performance is Sinatra - close your eyes and let his voice  take you back.  He is a Brooklyn boy as well!!  He performs on the weekends only and he definitely the frosting on top of this mouthwatering cake! Try Capo's - YOU WILL NOT REGRET THE TRIP!

R8vgGcUYsXh2IOfYR8_kZg.text: The food was really good but the service was super slow.  The atmosphere was cool. I didnt think it was cheesy or over the top. They had this whole mafia theme going.

qF90LDqfRCOMlz9XcsKoHQ.text: I absolutely love the atmosphere and decor. Dice dark lighting, red and black colors, chandeliers, good Sinatra type music, very old Vegas feel.  However... Im sorry to say that I did not enjoy the vegetarian options.  We ordered the caprese salad and the eggplant parmigiana. The caprese salad was ok.... but it was drenched in an overpowering pesto. Pricey! $15!!!  The eggplant parm ($21!!!) came out soggy and oily. Way too much cheese! The best thing about the dish was it came with a side of grilled asparagus. All 3 of us at the table agreed that the plain asparagus was the most appetizing.  My friend ordered the vodka pasta and the other just plain marinara pasta. They were not impressed either.  Too bad... Too expensive. Im sad I wont be back since I really liked the vibe of the place.

iB4JWE3d_c5Enl1p096U5g.text: I absolutely loved this restaurant. Amazing food, awesome ambience and great personalized service.   I had the spicy bananna pepper appetizer stuffed with italian sausage and cheese. topped with sauce and served with a side of toasted italian bread. Very good. a little spicy but really good.  for dinner had the tortellini and loved it. best i've ever had. i'm going to try to recreate this dish . so good.  overall very good place and i'd recommend to anyone visiting vegas and willing to drive off the strip a bit.

rmEKAKLKEKyl4BE24XNHSg.text: I too had the opportunity to try this place out thanks to a last minute opening in Poly's meetup group.  Thanks for organizing!  The atmosphere is terrific, complete with a live singer who comes right up to each table and serenades each and every woman.  Dim lighting also adds to the romance factor, though it's a little hard to gauge since we were there with a large group.  It does seem like the kind of place that would make a terrific date, though.  The food was delicious, and because we ordered family style I had the chance to try a bunch of different dishes.  The desserts were especially tasty, and I was surprised to find that the chocolate cake was by far the best (over the cheesecake and canoles, usually my favorites!).

G3nNguqPaCMuJ7LYdr5qnw.text: Fabulous in every way! The restaurant definitely sets the mood and the food even better! If you want a dining experience off the strip without the hassle of Viva Las Vegas but want the style and presence of Vegas, sit here for two or the whole familia! It has a very close family feel to it and the service is exceptional. They are welcoming and treat you like you're part of the family. Anything you order is going to be a winner. Italian food will never get this good in this area for its price... No joke!

msPrS-4I613ReEM9ZCq5VA.text: Food was great fun atmosphere a little pricey for a casual thing better suited for date night. Really enjoyed the meal "chef sleeping with the fish"

vesLNDv7TbbeyTroxGM9oA.text: So when you first get here it's pretty scary you have to ring the bell to get in the miller dude it's somewhat resembles John Gotti slide to slide door open gives you the once over and see if you're worthy. Then a wall that has a phone booth attached to it opens and you enter the darkness of a 1920s speakeasy with red candle tables it's as dark as the total eclipse and the aroma takes you back to Nona's kitchen food is excellent service is as well. I would highly recommend. Definitely will be back

_F5Xc-Zg1DWN7cNwZhcw7w.text: Tried this Italian restaurant with my husband for the first time. Found it by chance while servicing our MINI down the street & absolutely loved it! The warm welcome at the window & the secret door entrance was hilarious & totally unexpected! Food was absolutely amazing. We started off with cheesy garlic bread & downed that before our meal arrived. It was delicious! I had the Chicken Parmisian & my husband had the Alfredo with chicken. Everything was absolutely wonderful. I wanted to make sure I wrote this review before leaving so I never forget it. When in Las Vegas, this restaurant is a must! Call for reservations & a password before coming.

KKkf-xM3GcwnfVfO0-MrQQ.text: A friend who is local recommended Capos. We had 6 people celebrating my son's Birthday. I don't want to give anything away, but suffice it to say, your experience will be mind blowing. The food is superb. The staff is exceptional. And the magician? Well, that was insane. I have been coming to Vegas monthly for 20 years and can't believe I hadn't discovered this gem before now. We will definitely be back! Sooner rather than later.

eXYAAXpESAof3b77YjYU6w.text: I had lunch at Capo's.  My bill was $37 (eggplant and beverage).  I wanted to use a Groupon coupon for $25.  I was told I could not use the coupon because it is for two people.  I could not order two entrees and take one home either.  TWO PEOPLE ONLY. I spent more than two average lunches and beverage. Confused about the TWO PEOPLE COUPON ONLY. It is not about your total bill.  It is about TWO PEOPLE. Since I spent more than two people would have spent, WHY NOT HONOR COUPON??????

k2esi1f2Lu5dKKtQTkPoag.text: I drive by this place a lot. So when the family wanted to try some place different to eat lunch, I suggested this place. The decor is set in the roaring 20s. Like a speakeasy the lighting is very dim. The service was good. They were pretty busy. I would say the food item that really stands out to me is the meatballs: I had the beef and my daughter had the veggie meatballs. Both are great! Also, their red sauce is very special. I will need to try this place out for dinner next time!

Wx8mOEm304PmWenNmUrf8Q.text: The atmosphere is amazing. Friendly and attentive employees. The food was absolutely delicious. We even had a mini magic show right at our table. Can't wait to return next time I'm in Vegas.

JyqGlWb6-WcqfCvlsbuaiA.text: First time here.  Dined with some friends.  Was greeted at door by mobster guy.  Inside is really dimly lit.  Place was kinda full for a Sunday night.  Server was pleasant enough in the beginning of the meal, barely saw her during meal, didn't check on meals, appeared with check.  There were others refilling drinks for us. Started with bruschetta which was just ok.  I had fettuccine with blackened chicken which was rich and tasty.  Johan had chicken masala which was lovely.  There was a great live singer and a magician going around the tables.  Atmosphere was great, loud though which was ok.

pDiziNJhwPTSEe_iBEr32g.text: Took my best friend to lunch this week on a whim after hearing about this place from social media and gave it a try and was blown away by the food. Everything was fresh and had amazing flavor. Our waitress Leslie was awesome. I would highly recommend Capos and will be back soon.

R3rJTE1FNJA1S2qs6Dj7_w.text: Amazing! Great service and food! Definitely try the meatballs, its to die for. Love the atmosphere, really makes you feel like you're in the prohibition era. The outside is completely different than what it looks like inside. So glad we decided to try a restaurant outside the strip!

OZfhTPCcfKG4pa-alrsiLA.text: An Italian restaurant that feels like an old speakeasy. The ambience is unique with a secret entrance & a live Sinatra like performer who will sing at your table. There is the occasional magician or lady selling roses too.   The service follows the old speakeasy feel. Reservations are recommended, otherwise try to grab a seat at the bar (which can be hard to come by). When you call to make a reservation you'll get an abrupt "yeah, " making it feel like you're part of a secret Italian meeting. You'll get the same "what do you want attitude" when you come in the front door. It's all part of the appeal to the restaurant. Once you get your table, the servers are attentive & the food arrives in a timely fashion. There is a view of the kitchen from some of the seating at the bar and booths. Further inside, you get a view of the Sinatra-like performer. There's also room room for larger parties.   The food quality here is great. I'm not a huge fan of Italian food, but everything here is really good. Ma's meatballs is two huge meatballs served with sauce and peppers that add a nice spice. The lasagna portion is gigantic & my fave. The chicken parmigiana and chicken Marsala are tasty traditional choices, but I would recommend trying something more original like the chicken Anastasia. For dessert the turtle cheesecake hits the spot.   The prices are $20-$30 for dinner, but the portions are huge so you'll likely have leftovers. If you get an appetizer, consider sharing an entree. They also have 2for1 Tuesdays to offset cost. I haven't been for lunch, but it looks like you can get a sandwich for $10, so not bad. I'd like to try the meatball sandwich someday!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad w house Italian. Yum!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the bar of the chefs doing their thing
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poor lighting...but here is the chicken Anastasia with pasta. Breaded chicken with spinach and ricotta. Yummy!

DVGGx5mNYbT6LMlN0T6wvg.text: Amazing food, amazing staff. We had a group of six and they handled our table like it was nothing. The food was satisfying and filling. I will be back to Capo's!

4ylHQkTI55WzY3j5q5CbIQ.text: Best Italian food. Everyone was very nice and food was excellent. Server was very attentive. We had the chicken parm and chicken marsala. Caesar salads very good, house sangria was amazing. Topped it off with tiramisu for dessert. Definitely going back, but make sure you have reservations!

ApEX44j0l4hkdl3CxTPBQg.text: Not worth the hype. It's kinda cute how they stick to the mob/speakeasy vibe. Also the staff is very kind. That's where the positives end, unfortunately.   The decor is old school, but not in a good way. Instead of looking like a place that was inspired by decades past, it just looks like the decor hasn't been updated in decades.   The food is nothing to write home about, especially for the price. I started with the "bust a cap" stuffed mushrooms, and was not impressed. I was expecting to have my mind blown, but was instantly disappointed instead. Bland and flavorless from the first bite. For my main course, I had a "chef sleeps with the fishes". This was better without a doubt, but still only slightly above average.   I felt gypped. I honestly could have had better "Italian" food at an Olive Garden for less than half the price. Or, alternatively, I could have gotten far superior Italian food on the Strip for a similar price point.   Also, I think it's worth mentioning that they charge $8 to split a dish. No extra soup, no extra salad and the exact same serving size for a single person. Just an $8 up charge to split something. That was super disappointing, because my boyfriend and I almost always split an appetizer and a main course wherever we go. Restaurant portions are huge, we don't ever end up eating leftovers and it's cheaper, so it just makes sense. So to be charged an additional $8 and receive nothing extra return is kinda ridiculous.  I don't ever see myself returning.

hZxgg2nxlvNzmA0bzFgzrA.text: The atmosphere is amazing! It's dimly lit with great music and excellent service! Very classy and romantic and a perfect spot for a date or family gathering! The food is phenomenal and in giant portions and the waiters are all extremely friendly and charming.

GY08sLki3EvZMfxs87IF8w.text: Great experience. We went in the secret back door, it's a fun experience if you have the password which you can get from their website. It has a fun mob/mafia vibe to it. It is reminiscent of old Vegas, with the low lights and booth seating. The also have tables that easily pull out. If you have a mobility concern or visual concern, use the front door, they are very accommodating. There aren't any steps you need to worry about. The wait staff was very nice, good recommendations. The food was excellent, we tried the calamari, meatballs, penne vodka and cannolis, all of it fantastic. The only irritating thing was toward the end, some lady started yelling loudly about not getting her way. I guess she used the Groupon for 4 people, but she was the only one there so the staff were explaining to her that it's for 4 people. I know about her problems because she was shouting swear words 3 feet from the back of my head. But other than her, it was a great experience! Take the family!

XSrkckpvxYexamdh6YGxug.text: Really good Italian food, and the old school "gangster" ambiance is pretty cool.  Always ask what they recommend, cause the Rigatoni and meatball was among the best I've had!   Can get a little pricey, but worth it if you're in the mood for some OG mafia...

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni and meatball delight!

kadRBVBb9RjsZ3IqHlrNMw.text: I've seen this pace on tv and I've always wanted to come. And I was not let down at all. The food was delicious. Everything was cooked to perfection. The service was great.   I would total recommend this place if ur in Vegas. Not to far from the strip either.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pasta with clams was amazing
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So delicious

EwPiF4aJhP3LtvYPAaAlWg.text: Amazing!! I've never had Italian food this good! The spaghetti with meat sauce is amazing, creamy and perfect blend if garlic and spices. The meatball was just plain fantastic! Service was fantastic, as was the environment! Definitely going back!

CJLMlhcSpJPQwvGVXpWAhA.text: Was in town and was recommended by a local. We went to the Mob museum and then went here as a surprise for dinner. I don't think people understand the act, and if they don't, fuggedaboutit.  The maitre de played his party superbly. They actually set up a table for us in front of the piano a'la Good Fellas, like they put it into place as we were walking to it.   Our waiter, Brandon played the part and his suggestions on drinks did not disappoint. Blood orange martini... Nuff said. Bust a cap appetizer was incredible. Couldn't decide between Fredos Alfredo (I love Alfredo) or the Gottis chicken Angelo. Brandon said it comes with a side of pasta, I can have em do an Alfredo for you. That is a stand up guy...  Kevin, the singer, set the mood, asked us for any requests and didn't disappoint. Really appreciate the interaction a made the whole experience. The people who said the food was not good, no flavor either have this place confused or wouldn't know good food if it introduced itself. The food was BOMB! The sauce on the Gottis chicken Angelo...omg! Rest of the family was equally satisfied. We couldn't eat any more, got cannolis to go, Brandon hooked it up. The entire staff was great, attentive and played the part. Made our evening! I would drive to Vegas from Cali every weekend just to eat here. We come to Vegas a few times a year and this is definitely on our list EVERY trip. To the owner and staff, you are all Aces in our book!

UN9IkorFMojH0Ko9Q3_6_g.text: One of the best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas generous portions and very reasonably priced

xMxNsSWrjoTQ4STBJc_7Rg.text: I'd heard about this place for a couple of years and finally decided to check it out. Probably my new favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. My parents were visiting from abroad and agreed! We tried a few different dishes, including the clams in white sauce and the chicken Anastasia, which I will definitely order again when I bring the other half of my family in! The creme brulee was one of the best I've ever had and we enjoyed the tiramisu as well (yes we eat a lot!). I will definitely be back later this month!

xipIKdyPgn4nxWhWHLubRw.text: Wow what a fantastic place Food was FANTASTAC Service was great my wife had veal piccata Angels with dirty faces, it was amazing my wife tried it and said that is what I am getting next time. Francisco our waiter was terrific and everyone made us feel important. This is now our favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.

dq9CejSefk9Gi7zfZY8h4g.text: Best Italian food by far!!! My favorite thing on the menu is the santuccis spaghetti with both meatball and sausage since I can't pick just one and there garlic dressing salad is my favorite ever!! Been here a few times and never been disappointed I even ordered Togo and it was a great experience!! 5 stars all the way!!!

yfYf_LGEZXdqMosqxcANDA.text: Cool, fun atmosphere - fun for a date.  Best part of the experience was watching the cooks and the bread.  Food left a lot to be desired.  "Special" Caesar salad was boring, and no dressing, and the house was drowning and so pungent it was inedible.  The main courses were fine, but cold potatoes and veggies.  Server was noticeably absent, and we were seated more than 30 mins after reservation time.  Won't be back.

QJqnklPlSvDR3XT13CcF6Q.text: "BEWARE" of this restaurant! Purchase this deal through Groupon and went there for lunch with my daughter and the Mgr came to our table and told us the Groupon doesn't apply towards the bill. What a SCAM!!! Wasted my time and energy. Will NOT go back!

jwg2hl15SdFjplomtWGBPw.text: Bad fucking service.  Sat for 20 min and no drinks were served. Ruined my fiancee birthday dinner.  Waited all day for us to walk out unhappy.  Bad bad service.  Don't go.  Rude ass people.

xpOf-wQFhnlVVJe3HVqkHg.text: This is a great place! We went out for a date night and all expectations were met or exceeded. From the password that was required for entry to the dessert at the end of the meal. Brandon our server took great care of us. He was polite and checked in on us just enough so that we never wanted for anything. I had the pasta arrabiatta , the Mrs. had the eggplant parmigiana. Both excellent. The starter, garlic cheese bread and Caesar salad were great! We had a couple of cocktails and a bottle of Chianti for dinner and all was well. Check this place out. It's worth the drive if you're a tourist staying on the strip.

sjoyxj7oF0S7zn6WzNjoew.text: I absolutely can't say enough good things about this place. Warning... Spoilers ahead so if you're here to just figure out if you should go, just go. If you love Italian, go. Go now. Don't wait.  Alight - so when you walk in, you're met with a closed room and a note to ring the buzzer. You do so and are surprised by someone opening a small door and getting kind of rough with you (words). I won't reveal more secrets but that should set the tone well enough.   You walk in and they have a crooner serenading the crowd and he's good. He sounds like a classic. The whole ambiance gives off this vibe of an Italian mob speakeasy. The staff is in on it, but it's never over the top or too gimmicky.   We sat at the bar because we didn't have a reservation, but that was the best spot. You get to watch the super focused cooks and chef run though orders with extreme focus and precision. A great spot for someone to gain insight into the dance and acrobatics that comes with the art of preparing food.  Then the meal came. The pasta fagioli was superb. Freshly prepared and just as light and balanced as it is supposed to be.  I ordered Uncle Pauly's arrabbiata (sans protein) and it was AMAZING! The heat, the garlic, and that authentic sauce was a wonderful balance. The penne was cooked a perfect al dante. Seriously, so many places get it too soft, but these pros know how to do it.   If you hit up Vegas, make this a must-do. Totally worth the price.

6qbYRc5hVRPKtFhQJb4qvA.text: I could sit here and tell you how awesome the food is. Authentic, quality. I could write about the profound atmosphere. Appointed, perfection, charming. Or, about the service. Expeditious precision. You could then read my words, as well as others. Instead, just get your rear over here and experience the magic.

KC5J_u8xCfqH5NJtfXTS3w.text: This place was amazing! Everything was top notch from the salads to the entrees. We really liked the mobster atmosphere..it looks like a restaurant straight out of Goodfellas haha. The "chef sleeps with the fishes" is fantastic. The lasagna is huge and the best lasagna my uncle ever tasted. And my mom who doesn't usually like Italian food loved the "mobs meatball salad"! The best authentic Italian food you can get. We'll definitely be back. 5 stars only cuz I couldn't give it 10!

25U40aKakl2f2JYLHlSCpQ.text: The food was delicious, the atmosphere was a feeling of being in the mafia style diner of the old days. The host was pleasant and welcoming, and they had The Godfather playing on of the flat screens behind the bar while a talented singer played Sinatra and Tony Bennett songs. We ordered the Bust-A-Cap appetizer which is mushroom caps stuff with ham and cheese. For the entrees, our food came with a choice of soup or salad, now on the menu it says no additional charge for the salad, my only discrepancy is that they charged an additional $2 for the salad on my bill for some reason, but my date enjoyed it very much so I didn't complain about it, just wish I knew why they snuck that charge in there. I ordered the Santucci's Pasta, spaghetti noodles in homemade pasta sauce and homemade meatball which was massive and very tasty even the sauce was really good compared to the store bought stuff. My date ordered the lasagna which was a HUGE chunk in a bowl and she enjoyed it immensely but needed a to-go box to take 3/4 of it home. Overall the experience was great but the only thing i'll have to keep an eye on next time is the reason there is a unsuspecting surcharge to the salad that says on the menu that it comes with the entree.
