NlAn1Ply89HLbU4t2zX1rg.text: Oh how disappointed I am. It started out with promise and ended with a slap in the face. The apps were good and the wine decent. But when it came to the pasta ( this is where they should shine ) oh no good. Twice they gave me pasta that was not al dented but was gummy bear done. I was so hungry, the flavor was good but the pasta said, "warning! Not good!" My assessment of the second go round was dismissed. We waited for an extremely long time for the bill and I had to go up to the bar to pay and waitress magically appeared with 20% on our bill. Bullshit, we had no option to reflect service and quality. So attend this establishment with steeled gut and good luck.

09TMBnBNYqve58N51RWtIQ.text: Best Italian in all of Vegas. Totally worth the money. Servings are large. Best meatballs and creamy garlic dressing.

TrTAmW-g4PQhdylCbU3gkw.text: Armando was great, excellent service and food! Highly recommended :) the chicken Marsala is incredible as well as the chicken Parmesan!

9d6lw_16JF1OWE1r_QbNtA.text: I love everything about this place! From the entrance, the live singer, the ambiance, the staff, to the food. It's always so difficult to decide on my regular favorites, or try new things. The appetizer of meatballs with peppers is outstanding, as is Uncle Pauly's Arrabbiata. We came in for the prix lunch but being Sunday, we opted for brunch instead. The French toast is delicious, and we also enjoyed the salmon salad. Joel and Rachel are a fantastic asset to the team!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now that&#39;s a meatball! So delicious!

wa2a3uySDBaPSj6EYD40Vw.text: Four of my friends and myself went to Capos for dinner last night and I would say  the food was decent but overpriced. The atmosphere was annoying, way to dark inside for me and the piano player was way to loud making it hard to have a conversation with anyone but the person sitting next to you. The floor must be made of wood because every time someone walked behind me the floor flexed and my chair moved up and down. There was 3 feet between my chair and the chair at the next table but somehow every time a staff member walked by they would hit my chair which was so annoying.  The service was generally good, but the man handing out menus reached around in front of my face to hand out the next menu and had the menu inches away from my face. Two of our party ordered the same dish but only one came out of the kitchen. It was a full 5 minutes before the other entre came out. My last complaint is about cleanliness of the mens rest room. Behind the sink faucet there was a large amount of scum and buildup. It makes me wonder what the rest of the place looks like with the lights on.

8if0jM8XbiMIwfT_VdJsYw.text: This place is great. The entrance is amazing just like what you'd think it'd be. It's the real life good fellas, God father etc. and the food is great! The red pastas are my favorite. Definitely would recommend this to everyone. And the live music when I went on Saturday was amazing.

MOWM3gCJHHiu2gZ5TpYv_A.text: I ordered take out a few days ago. Had the carbonara and my friend had the spaghetti and meatball. The carbonara was good but nothing to rave about. I had a taste of my friend's meatball and it was good, but again I've had better....sorry to say, but I've had better tasting pasta dishes at Olive Garden for cheaper.

yOMIZ1CFOCA0Tg9QraQIZA.text: Had to give it a try because of all the hype. I do like the interior very much, classy mobster like, which is cool. Even getting into the "joint" you have to have a password. Kinda neat.  Nico's Caesar salad was very good, I like the way the lettuce is cut really thin. I had Capone's Carbonara with chicken. For me, this isn't Carbonara. Too wet and I have to say, bland. Wife had Santucci's pasta. This was pretty good, sauce taste fresh and homemade. Had to ask for parmesan cheese. Been nice if it was fresh at the table. Also had garlic cheese bread, good but I couldn't taste garlic. Overall, I'll give it another try but I'll probably stay conventional, pasta and a meat ball.

RUr3ln0iZeUmA1RcGNWGCw.text: Thought I was lost coz there's a sign that says entrance but the door was locked.  Then I saw the sign that says "ring the doorbell".  Love the mystery and ambiance of this place!  We walked in and it was pretty dark but I noticed the beautiful chandeliers and the live Frank Sinatra music.  Oh I love this place already.  I am a young person with an old soul so I like this kind of shit.  We got seated promptly and ordered our meal from the brunch menu.  I had the steak & eggs, husband got the egg frittata and my mom got the traditional spaghetti with meatballs.  I also ordered a Bloody Mary - to complete the appeal.  Enjoyed my food and devoured all of it.  Husband loved his frittata.  Our server Kate was very accommodating.  We wanted our eggs cooked in real butter instead of oil and she said no problem.  My husband spilled his baileys for his Irish coffee and they replaced it promptly.  I have no complaints.  The next come to Vegas with my friends, this is going to be our first stop.  If you haven't been, check this place out so you know how glamorous old Vegas was.  I love this place.  Oh did I say that already?!

XuJc8hGhM3HwdhC-QP20Ew.text: Great Italian ambiance with live music for entertainment & real Italian cuisine!  They even had an excellent magician when we were there.  Recommend this off the beaten path Vegas restaurant.  About 10 minutes from the strip.

HtKdpA3hcteYhNJl_5slQQ.text: Making a memory with a meal is all what its cracked up to be.  Friday night was the second time I had been to this place and it was just as great as I remember.  I scored a groupon $60 for $30 and decided to take some friends who were Capo-virgins.  I do recommend reservations as it does book up.  It took us a few minutes to find the door as it kind of gives you an "alley way" entrance to the place.  This is the first time at this location and I actually thought it was more amazing than the last one (on Trop) that I had been to.  Upon entry there is a little mobster suprise experience that you just have to see for yourself.  I don't want to spoil the fun even though I have seen others spill the beans reviews on here. Once you find yourself in the joint, and you are shown your table you will find yourself thinking what century am I in??  The place is dimly lit.  Probably the darkest restaurant I have ever been to but ya know its all about the secretive down low. lol  As we were seated, the 1970s round red leather booths are to die for (but don't say that out loud) along with velvet wallpaper and these amazing chandelliers above the tables....loved them!  They hand you the menus which accompany a little flash light so you can actually see it.  Nice idea.  For our meal I ordered the Stuffed Chicken Anastasia-lightly breaded and stuffed with ricotta and spinach.  The menu says its topped with pink sauce but it was topped with red sauce and a dab of pink sauce.  I just ordered some more pink sauce and I was good to go.  It came with some angel hair pasta with red sauce.  It was alooot of food to eat but it was so good.  I shared with the table some of the chicken.  I just couldnt eat even half of it.  The BF ordered the Capones Cabanara and he devoured that.  I'm not a fan of peas so I only tried a small bite but it was great.  My friend ordered the spaghetti with meatball (and it was huge).  She said the meatball was full of flavor and the best she ever had.  Her husband ordered the Mad Dog Marsala....which seemed not so big of a plate full but he loved every bite. On a side note I must say that this isnt the "best" Italian we've had but it was good and the experience makes it great!  The wine, bread and salads were a perfect addition.  We all ordered 2 drinks and our drinks were at least half the bill.   No joke.  Thanks for the drinks Groupon! haha  Actually I think the drinks were more than the Groupon but who is counting.  The service was awsome-very attentive and friendly with a Italian mobster edge. lol  Don't forget about the live music "thats amore".  Very special touch!  I must say I highly recommend this place.  It is very romantic-great for a date, fun to take some peeps to, and just to stop by and have a drink with the pin striped suits.  My friends loved the experience and the food so a good pat on the back to us for taking them.  Now who can I take next? ;)

-n8sx_LWOaHp1g0kAfaaqw.text: THIS PLACE IS FANTASTIC!!   Everything about it, especially the food!!  It is a must try!!  I can't wait to go back and take all my friends there!!  It's hard to even get a reservation there, it is so busy there!  That should tell you something!!   You need to know the password to get in too....it was "meatballs" when I went. Maybe because they have the best meatballs in the city, hands down!!!!  Love this place, I am making it my Sunday tradition!!

9R6Gv5nbJRcD99K6fhL4OQ.text: Wow this place has gone way downhill. I came here before and it seemed really good. Went last night and it was horrible. The building doesn't even have AC!! It was miserable in there this is las vegas you need ac when its 110+ outside. The steak was pretty good, but not amazing by any means, I've had way better. The chef burnt the asparagus so bad we just sent it back and didn't pay for it. We finished really quick and got out of there, we won't be back.

tHNXYyHYqF5yk2YiclCNYw.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!    DO NOT GO! -  First had to flag someone down for drink order and then later someone else to get our waitress to FINALLY take our food order. The busser (who was too new to be on his own) actually went twice to the bar to get my parents a new beverage because our waitress was lost again.   Two out of four food dishes were INCORRECT. When we attempted to let her know the mistakes she argued with us, saying the items didnt come with what we thought they did. Since I STILL HAD A MENU I pointed out that we were right. So, she says to my mom she must have grabbed the wrong plate but tells my bf  "oh we don't serve mashed potatoes with the $40 steak anymore cause no one likes them". Ummm something she failed to mention when he placed the order and, also, NOT what the menu said, to which I proved, again, SINCE I HAD A MENU STILL.  She leaves with my mothers dish to replace the incorrect pasta with the roasted potatoes and brings back the same plate with the pasta still on it, and half a spoonful of what the side should have originally been!!???    Let me also not forget to mention the stacked dishes on the edge of the crumb filled table that neither her or the busser ever picked up yet we stacked to make room for our dinner. Let me also point out that my mother, father and I SHARED two butter knifes for our meals.   Our waitress FINALLY checked on us after we had been sitting with nothing in front of us for quite some time (everything stacked on the edge of the table) and asked if we wanted dessert, which we declined. Not sure why it took her sooooo long to drop the bill, but when I finally started keeping track, two full songs by the piano player had cycled thru....again, that was AFTER I started keeping track.   When we left I almost took a picture of the table with stacked dishes, a MENU a couple empty bread plates and butter container (when we didn't even have bread since BEFORE we placed our food order.)  So, I called today to speak with the manager....... I immediately let her know I was unhappy and calling to let her know about our experience to let them rectify it instead of blasting it all over fb or yelp, which she was thankful for, then asked me to hold a moment.   Toni, (the GM) put the phone down and had a conversation with someone else on another phone...that I could hear every word of!!!!!! "Whatcha doing? ......Oh yeah, I accidentally put myself on the schedule and working so now I'm short staffed........ Yeah, I'm hoping so and so calls me back too...... yeah, I can't believe i did either. Blah blah blah" for almost four full minutes!!! Are you fng kidding me?   So when she gets back on the phone she goes so what happened? And I told her to hold on cause I'm really annoyed she just held that whole conversation with an upset customer on the phone waiting who could hear every word. Her response? "She called first"... And I said that's awesome, but you should have let her go as soon as you found out she wasn't available instead of carrying on a conversation that I could hear!!!!! That's when she told me not to tell her how to run her business.  I hung up ...  Not going to have much of a business if she treats customers like that.  So, basically  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AT THIS ESTABLISHMENT!!  The food is great (if you get the correct order) BUT THE SERVICE FROM BUSSER TO UPPER MANAGEMENT IS TERRIBLE!!!!!

xHH3R-fiEeefEmGGIcURTQ.text: This is a great restaurant with fantastic ambiance. It's a Vegas landmark and everyone should eat there at least once. It's worth the cab fare from the strip to eat here.  I love the unique entrance and the singer while we're dining. The food is also fantastic. This is a must visit restaurant.

otlFPjOCMlAL7c6aIRdoEA.text: I was willing to give this place a second chance...Last time I go there!!.. I read a couple of yelp reviews..kind of the same experiences..the host shouldn't of had us wait to be seated while he talked to the couple behind us,, they should've had another waitress(especially it being a Sunday night),,food was too salty,,,,and they should tell the customers the prices of the specials, especially if there the most expensive dishes on the menu.. Oh well live and learn :( For the price, we should've went to Flemings. Lol..

su3hdAMfaiJNIvG9bNYwtg.text: I LOVE Capo's!  And specifically, the service at the Tropicana location (not to say the service at the Sahara location is poor or anything--have been there too, and definitely enjoyed it.  Jeanine is the gal who makes the difference at the Tropicana location...she is one of the most personable, courteous, on-the-ball servers I have ever met!    I have dined here many times, whether just with a local friend or two, a larger dinner party, or out-of-town guests.  Anyone I have introduced to the restaurant has absolutely loved it!  The dimly lit atmosphere is very relaxing, and the Italian mobster/mafia-themed decor is unique and different.    The food is delicious and the portion-sizes are generous.  I completely agree with anyone else's recommendation of the bruschetta...once you start eating it, you won't want to stop.  Just be sure you have a few breath mints with you if you are planning to go out afterwards, as the garlic in the bruschetta will definitely stick with you for a few hours. ;)  Is this the finest Italian restaurant out there? No.  But compared to other Italian restaurants in the same class (i.e. smaller, local, semi-casual, mid-priced), it is definitely among the best!

cfelsX9U0DaLRd3uxaEZJw.text: Let me start of by saying that I have been coming to this place for years. The second location and now there only location, well, this was my first visit. The place was larger and decades newer, but I still loved the old location better. On to the goods...  Food: Was great! had a few different courses first, and yummy. Dinner, went into veal, chicken, and different pastas and all were fantastic and prepared perfect. Great work!!  Service: Not good. the waiter was not taking care of us. Water went empty 4 times ( they only had a small size bottle of water ) and he would not seem to think enough about bringing out 2 at a time? Hello? We were there to eat, and drink, but I had to ask for a second glass of wine, and I would usually go through at least 4 during a 2 hour dinner... not to mention the others at the table? did not offer to take any used plates or glasses and I had to wave over a busboy when the table had 2 empty water bottles, salad plates and appetizer plates. Another issue is that 3 people at the table got their salads, but mine never came. When he brought out the dinner service, I asked him to cancel my salad that never came. His response...... sure. WTF? Really?  I will for sure come back again, as I know they are capable of great service.

OE1RGYZWFkt7RdAWTAasBw.text: They had the best Chicken Parmesan I've ever had, entertaining theme throughout the restaurant, and the crew was really involved.

G3_jZmsEDdoxJq66Mvcmew.text: Went here for dinner last night with some friends from out of town.  Very dark, which is fine unless you want a good look at your food before you eat it.  The only air conditioning they had were 2 portables, which weren't doing the job.  It was very hot in the restaurant -- we were all sweaty by the time we got our food.  Uncomfortable.  I was expecting somewhat of a speakeasy experience -- didn't get it.  Except for the lighting and the entrance (you walk into a lobby then ring a bell to get seated), there were no dramatics here.  Maybe the staff was too hot to do their spiel.  Food was ok, nothing spectacular.  They claimed the lasagna was full of sausage and hamburger meat -- there was about 3 small chunks of sausage, the rest was ricotta cheese and sauce.  Not enough to have any leftovers, which I thought was cheap for the prices they charge.  Overall, it was a little below average.  I won't be back.

-qbDQO9Pp9_ohUlBVvUYzQ.text: My husband and I absolutely loved our visit to Capos. The speakeasy vibe complete with ringing the bell to enter was really fun. The ambiance was really nice and we loved the entertainment - the lounge singers made it such a cool experience. The highlight was definitely the food. We were blown away by everything we ordered. My husband said it was by far the best eggplant parmasean he had ever had. He meatballs were delicious. We couldn't think of a better meal we've had in years... We will definitely be back!

1yvufjIvtOQy9VIcnrdKJg.text: I really like Capo's, the service was good, the atmosphere is fun but I need just a little more light...  lol.  The first time we went sat at the bar, and the food and service was great, the second time in the smaller back room, I ordered the stuffed chicken breast, it was huge!  dinner and two lunches!! and delicious!  My husband had the shrimp scampi which he loved but mentioned was more lemon"ey" than usual but he still  liked it a great deal since it disappeared fast!  Oh and their homemade salad dressings are great too!  Never any room for dessert but maybe one day...

ZCB7_ZltO_D_V4dm1ghPdw.text: Great atmosphere....a lot of fun. Food and service were both outstanding. Jeremy, our waiter, was great....very attentive and, again fun. There's a theme here....the food and service are great, but this place is just plain fun.  From the moment you enter (btw...there's a surprise), prepare to have a good time!   We'l be back.

mmjHw7jUYO_jisF7CT7e5Q.text: Stay away from the W. Sahara location No drink specials as advertised during football!!! Service was terrible!!!! Food was way over priced!!!! Overcharged us and two other tables on our bill by $20. Cool atmosphere if the management and service staff cared... So many other great Italian places in Vegas. Won't be open much Longer at this rate if they keep screwing over customers and continue to have really bad, slow,  Incompetent service with way overpriced semi-decent italian food.

7QYNUf7S86xcT3ygs9cCPQ.text: This place is 5 STARS all the way around! * Great Value * Great Food * Great Service * Great Atmosphere * Best Restaurant in Las Vegas  I live out of town and found out about this place from a Bellagio employee.  I told him I was tired of overpaying for ok food on the strip and wanted to go to someplace off the strip that wasn't expensive but nice.   Capos is my new favorite restaurant to go to.  I have been back 3 times since my first trip and taken clients and friends there and they all walk out talking about what a cool experience it was.  If you want great food with a cool / different experience then go to CAPOS!

MVLogcA9yxQm_kNAAbgY4w.text: It was our first time dining there. We Really enjoyed the food and the service was excellent.  Our host that night even remembered my name when we didn't know which way the exit was and tried to go out the way we came in through the secured entrance.  Very impressed by that.  We will definitely make Capo's one of our go to favorite dining restaurant.  Next time when me and my wife go there,we will try to get a table by the live music area where there is more light. We sat at the tables located across by the bar and cooking stations which was a little bit dark for us to read the menu.  But still, we had a great time.

WslcHIunZ17Eq6rVKRoS_g.text: Went in for Happy Hour and this place was great! If you're looking for HH prices on appetizers then request the HH menu from the bartender, HH is only served at the bar. Friendly staff, good portions. I had the bruschetta, jumbo shrimp scampi and pizza from the appetizer menu but only the bruschetta was half price. No biggie for me as I wanted to try some other items instead of just the HH apps.    HH is everyday 5-7pm, give this place a try!

EWu2Ah0JhXIIeDvlRSPANA.text: I went with a group of people for a Birthday. Fantastic Service, Fabulous food everyone loved their food from lasagna, meatball, chicken alfredo, pasta...Piano Player was great & the magician who came to the table was Awesome! Highly recommend for a fun dinner experience..

ni2PuVoTV3LoL8dklxEnIw.text: This is a gem!! I actually wanted to go to the mob museum and their speakeasy, but found this when researching it. We had so fun much here, the atmosphere is very authentic and the food is unmatched! Go with the theme, play along and ask for the password in advance. It's also a good idea to make reservations in advance. We will definitely come back next time. And bring our friends :)

A7zToaa0AM1swFjYwrFikw.text: Capo's? How about Crapo's.  The meatballs were disgusting. It's a giant meat-wad filled with chewy fat morsels, not tender at all, and nothing like our Italian Mother's, Grandmother's, or Father's made for us. Carrabba's has better meatballs. They weren't even completely cooked and were room temperature, borderline cold in the middle.   The ambiance is cool, and nice. The dark red lighting, the Al Capone and Frank Sinatra themes, the mob feel because of the dark speakeasy decor. That's worthy of 1 star.   But it stops at the ambiance. This place is highly highly over rated. With so many Italian restaurants and choices on and off the strip, why anyone would go here more than once is beyond me.  When you first walk in and ring a bell, you are greeted and questioned by someone through a hole in the wall. Which is cool. Then a hidden door opens which is cool. Again, the ambiance & theme is cool, you get a little hyped up...  But after all that, it's all downhill. There's no Italians working here. Call me a racist, I don't give a f**k. But I don't go for Mexican food and expect to see Asian's cooking and serving. I don't go get Chinese food and expect to see African Americans cooking and serving. I don't walk into a Soul Food restaurant and see Italians cooking and serving. Why when I walk into an Italian restaurant do I see Latino's everywhere and Asians cooking and serving? It's dumb. Maybe that's why Crapo's food is not good at all.  I spoke Italian briefly (4-5 words) to the host and the food runner and they both clearly had no idea what I was saying (hello and good evening pretty basic).  When I spoke English and ordered the Stuffed Rigatoni for dinner, I was served Raviolis 30 minutes later! Are you kidding me? The server doesn't know the difference between Rigatoni and Ravioli either? I specifically ordered Stuffed Rigatoni because it's an item not many restaurants carry. I get raviolis. Get me the hell out of here is all I was thinking. The raviolis were nothing special. Basic.  I Paid the bill and proceeded to get the hell out of this joint. But the kicker was that inside there's 2 exits. One by the Piano, and a sign by the restrooms. We passed by the piano exit because we were busy chatting unaware as we walked, only to be told by the host as we opened the door to leave by the restrooms (where we entered the restaurant), that we had to turn around and exit by the piano (despite the exit sign above, and the door we already 1/2 opened). Caught off guard by this chuckle heads demeanor and words, we actually played to his ego, turned around, and went out the "proper" exit. Back East in NY NJ PA, I would have laughed out loud, and told him to kiss my d**k after the negative overall experience as I peace out.   Crapo's is a Total tourist trap off the strip. Average food at best. The Italian mob theme is cool but the employees wouldn't know an Italian mobster or Italian culture if it smacked them upside the head. They open your wine with a gun bottle opener. Wow, Big deal. They can't even take your order properly. 1 star for ambiance with Al Capone and Frank Sinatra on the walls. But they need to work on their food quality, and train their staff properly about Italian cuisine.

wSD9uZDvAYtKegu-dUJQPg.text: Capo's was excellent. It was recommended by numerous locals and did not disappoint.  Usually restaurants with gimmicks fall short in the quality department. Not Capo's. Came in for lunch and the meatball parm hero was excellent. Water was refilled numerous times without having to flag someone down. Excellent service.  Love this place. Looks cool. The food is awesome.  Definitely stop in if you're in town.  This comes from a True New Yorker who loves Italian, so it carries a lot of weight.

n0qp-hq0Zmyt93tLucA6bQ.text: Place was dark and fun, food and wine was great. I like the secret entrance, live music was cool. Will go back again.

VuMmMVKUkErLhBmT9iH-Lw.text: This place is very neat inside.  Very different from other places. Very noise. Waitess wear cool name tag. Food was just ok for me.  Everything is too sweet.  Not the kind of Italian food I expected.

8ozvNRY7Vk1jWNm3SS5YOg.text: Wow! My coworkers took me here to celebrate my birthday and I have to say this was an awesome choice. From the secret entrance to the food and service. i was really impressed.   We arrived and went through the secret entrance. i don''t want to spoil it for future patrons, but be prepared to be surprised and be careful where you stand. The host brought us in to a very dimly lit restaurant. it took my eyes a minute to adjust. The feel inside is very old school, mobster atmosphere with the big, vinyl padded booths. Our server was a young lady with tatts and she was very impressive. She was very knowledgeable about the menu and drinks (wine in particular). She prompted us on things like the size of the meatballs which are half a lb so be careful with how many you order. They are their famous meatballs. I didn't order it but everyone in the party that did was blown away. I had the grilled chicken carbonara and it was so scrumptious. There was no negative feedback from anyone, only praises on the food and how good it was and how big the serving was for lunch.   Our server was very attentive and so were the rest of the staff. They asked if we wanted refills as soon as they saw the glass was at halfway. We had other staff members besides our server asked how everything was and if we were ok. Now that's teamwork! I definitely have to come for dinner and try it out then.

svzKIS8tCwjh7fsWIxPElw.text: On a Monday night walked in at about 8:30 pm. After ringing bell a guy opened a little black box and rudely said no reservation. No walk ins. I couldnt believe it. He was rude and was a complete turn off . They might think that it's a cute concept but based off of that experience i would never make a reservation to come back. Im a local and not a tourist, i have never been so angry, turned off and appalled at an establishments behavior.

IgubFVyCUnbd4mm-Vgtx2w.text: While scrolling through Groupon, I noticed this restaurant that had an old school, prohibition era style restaurant. I am in love with that era (devoted my junior year project to that era) with all the organized crime, underground speakeasies, and Flapper Girls! Of course seeing this I had to purchase and am I glad I did and took my mom along with me!  On the Groupon voucher it states to call and make an appointment. When I called, the guy said not to worry for the afternoon, the evening is when it's "really, really, really, really busy." I actually lost count of how many times he said "busy."   "Speakeasy" is highly played upon. If you don't know, you will once you arrive.   After we got in, I couldn't help but notice the extremely low lighting and red booths. Red chairs lined the fully stocked bar and there was an area for live music. The place isn't that big, and I can see how they get packed so quickly. There seemed to be a really intimate room where 1 party could be seated, and another room for a large party.   Now on to the food! With the Groupon we were able to order a soft drink, salad and main entree. We both ordered the salad with the garlic sauce (I knew I'd be fighting off vampires all day, but I didn't care and ordered the garlic sauce), and Santucci's Pasta, which they are known for. First came the salad and that in itself was delicious. I don't think I've had a garlic sauce before, but it was so good. Then came the pasta. My mom and I ordered it with the meatball, mine was veggie ball, which was at an additional cost, but we wanted the full experience. The veggie ball was a soy meat with bread crumbs and herbs. The sauce is home made and was just perfect. A little sweet and covered my pasta without drowning it. My palette enjoyed the whole dish. I had to stop myself. My stomach was telling me no, but my taste buds were telling me yes. Needless to say I took some home.   I forgot our servers name, but on the receipt it says Santana. She was great! All of the people there were on top of it. When you finished, someone was there to take your plate. Drinks were never low and they always checked on you. They have a sense of humor, too which I love.   My mom kept saying she wanted to come back. I would love to as well, of course.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Santucci&#39;s Pasta with a veggie ball
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad with garlic dressing
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brulee

J_Bj3uITVjSE6wYD1zfIdA.text: Interior is very dark and gloomy. Bathrooms were not too clean. Went on a busy night, and the only seats were at the bar. Service was very slow. However the food was delicious and reasonably priced.

PLk4Byw13mEcQJF5JQjOcg.text: The best Italian restaurant by far in by book! Old school Italian mob experience.  Great ambiance inside along with awesome customer service! They're known for the meatballs and I have to say the best meatballs, I've ever had. Definitely a must! Meatballs were moist and very flavorful and covered in signature secret sauce. Devine!! As far as our entree's my boyfriend had the lasagna which I had to taste and was delectable and delicious and I had the Seafood Cioppino which was also mouthwatering. And to top off the night we had to try the inviting dessert chocolate covered ice cream along with tiramisu which satisfied all tastebuds.  Thank you Capo's for a great experience.  WE will definitely be back agian!

TM5IAKuea_lvcPstos-a5Q.text: I love this place!  The place from the outside is very unassuming but once you get in (you have to know the password or they razz you) the atmosphere is so cool. It is a speakeasy theme with amazing Italian food. You must get a meatball which you can add to you meal. We got the bruschetta and mushroom caps as an appetizer. SO GOOD!  The creamy garlic salad is so good too. The mad dog Marsala with mushroom risotto is to die for. This is a place we will come back to every time we visit Vegas!

9AsK6J8JcDtNr9GnoxiXbQ.text: Don't order the chicken piccata or angel hair pasta with marinara worst I have ever had. The bread that you get was very boring did not even eat. Had a Caesar salad that was very bad. Husband ordered a great shrimp dish with a cream sauce that was the only awesome thing served so disappointed

yteGqzEwZOCSNnr0GqS82w.text: Chris had wanted to check this place out for ages and I'm glad we did. Very cool ambiance. The service is great and the food is yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken piccata for me and marsala for Chris. Both yummy!

PuBHuR-V75iSWZS0u0YwkQ.text: We were craving for Italian food, and we definitely find real one! Coming to this place is a real whole experience (mob inspired).  The food is delicious, sauces with authentic Italian flavors, fresh bread, and variety of dishes.  Here is and advice: listen to their recommendations (as mixing sauces and so on) they know what they are doing!!! The service is really nice, we will definitely come back everything we visita Las Vegas!

gbGjuQl1DT9Xxdb00y2Q8g.text: Great Italian Food!  Great atmosphere.  Can't beat 2 for 1 Tuesday for locals.    SUMMERLIN APPROVED!

TmHeoGucUkRLk-4juReHtA.text: Must place to go in Las Vegas!! Came for lunch...try the meatball or chicken parmigiana sandwiches!! Calamari perfectly done no oily residue. What atmosphere and service WOW

QcPOGSH10ClqdujXqIU7AA.text: Authentic place. Been in Vegas since the original Mafia Bosses opened the city up and began developments of the casinos. Gotta check this place out when ever you come to Vegas! So good! Sauce A1! One of THE BEST PLACES TO EAT IN LAS VEGAS!!!

K5FzucA8ORAuxWtq94VoUQ.text: Really cool entrance. Service was great. Started with chi-town scampi and bust a cap stuffed mushrooms. The soup and the nico Caesar was fantastic. Our table had the Alfredo chicken piccata, and veal Parmesan. Everything was perfect. They had a piano bar and a singer. Very old school but fun and delicious. We will be back next Vegas trip.

eNJi5sSizm6OblTdjt5y7w.text: I can never come here enough. This is as good as Italian food gets! My buddy had meatballs, in that awesome spicy sauce, for appetizer, dinner, and dessert.  Their singer feels like the real Blue Eyes!

qge83W8IBKg_O8VXR7PzeA.text: I have been in Las Vegas for over 10 years and been to a lot of places, but there is nothing that feels as authentic to Las Vegas and Las Vegas mob days as this place. The entry is a first sign that the place is a little different and when you walk in...the staff provides first class service, the ambience sets the mood for a cozy private dinner, and the food comes out hot as can be like it's directly out of the kitchen the second it's done. If you have been in Las Vegas and haven't been here, you owe it to yourself to come visit.

mWPPxsTKdi8RtoHfpEOzJA.text: I came here looking for good Italian food.   It was real good and our party of 8 received first class service.  There was a magician and Sinatra impersonator.   It was more than we expected.   Food was reasonable with the entertainment.  The staff hustled to get the food out.   We will be back for sure.  The atmosphere was so amazing.

lZXSzt8TaIujWNFuvITFGA.text: The ambiance, the food...it's all simply the best!  If you get tired of the Strip, do yourself a favor and catch a cab out to Capo's.  I discovered this place on a business trip years ago and it's a must-do on every single trip now.  You won't find anything like it elsewhere!

0k9BtVEqY4MiJ0EFhvp_2w.text: So, today i saw it was industry night 50% off on the website for industry workers, a group in which I've. Been a part of for 18+ years, both east and west coast.  Upon arrival myself and my date provided the bartender with our industry cards to further confirm the online discount. The bartender then proceeded to entice us with the specials which by the way were incredible but neglected to tell us, very conveniently that those were not included. When the check came i asked her about it and she simply replied to me " Oh yeah the specials are not included in industry night. Im sorry." so now the bill is about double it should be which is MISLEADING and UNACCEPTABLE.   At this point, as inconsolable as i was i was told by the manager that i had a $50 gift card waiting. For me in the register. And. I dont even think. I need to delve but we are happy and well fed but not not in the position to take a $200 check when it was advertised as a $100 check. All i can say in finality is that i am WELL prepared to pay for what i am expected of minus the "suggested information"....whether it be from the source or the customer."..

5nUbAyHd3M4NoV7zBiMgkw.text: What a great experience! The outside does not reflect the inside at all and it had a hilarious secret entrance that took me by surprise. The whole environment was very unique. It was dark, very cozy and had lighting in the right places. The waitress was very attentive and was always checking in with us. There was a man singing who had an amazing baritone voice and sang Frank Sinatra songs throughout our dinner. The appetizers were cooked perfectly and the entrees were delicious. I wasn't even done with my dinner and was completely full, didn't know what to do with myself when they brought the dessert menu. I went ahead and ordered the creme brulee  and it was delicious. The prices are fair compared to other Italian restaurants and much better in my opinion. I will definitely be returning to try other dishes. There were a few negatives that caught our attention. The host was very friendly to me but never directed a word to my boyfriend. He wasn't mean or rude but he didn't seem to acknowledge his presence. I noticed this with other groups as well. Another was that they didn't have a beer list or menu. The waitress didn't really know all the available beers to choose from. The last one is in regards to space. There was a party of 8 that were seated in front of us and it was quite awkward trying to maneuver our way to the exit. We had to ask a few people to move their chair so we could get out. All minor negatives compared to the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Things aren&#39;t always as they appear;)
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lighting was perfect
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rpspjxI6bUWTEXqFiqDZuw.text: O M G!!  Dined here last night with another couple.  My girlfriend Victoria and I were celebrating the end of our first (and last) fight.  What a great experience (Capo's, not the fight).    We had a reservation and were seated quickly after arrival, once we made past the door keeper.  That, in and of itself, is a trip!  We were given menus and water promptly.  The menus were thoughtfully provided with small flashlights to make reading them easier in the subdued lighting.  Overall the ambiance  is pleasant and the staff knowledgable, personable, and attuned to the needs of their guests.  The place does tend to get a bit noisy what with a vocalist performing and dozens of tables filled with happy diners so if you are looking for a quiet, intimate dinner you would be disappointed.  However, if you are looking for exceptional service, exceptional food, and exceptional entertainment, you won't find any better in Southern Nevada.  My girlfriend's husband had Shrimp Scampi, she had Chicken Picata with Garlic Risotto, my wife had Spaghetti with Meatball (it's a HUGE meatball), and I had Lasagna with Crumbled Meatball.  Every dish we were served was abundant and fabulous.    As for the entertainment, the vocalist is a nice touch.  He performed well and visited several tables while singing.  And the magician, well he is an absolute WOW!  He performs table side and mystifies.  I named a playing card at random (the eight of diamonds) and it magically appeared out of the deck.  He handed it to me along with a Sharpie (which we all sniffed) and I signed it.  He then proceeded to amaze us all by having the card move through the deck, apparently at his will.  He also did things with coins and table settings that had the four of us just shaking our heads in wonder.    So here is the bottom line on this place; if you are looking for a fine dining experience with peaceful, calm surroundings, pass this place by.  However, if what you are seeking is a dining experience encompassing great Italian food prepared like mama would fix it and served by attentive staff, an atmosphere where everyone is enjoying life and entertainment that by far exceeds the price paid for the meal alone, then you best get to Capo's sooner rather than later!

7rHG0IQVDVhgIN99inIrjA.text: Nice atmosphere, except we had a table by the kitchen so I watched the waiters come in and out the whole time. Disappointing since it was my boyfriend's birthday dinner. Food was good, big portions. We also had the speak-easy element ruined by people exiting the restaurant, so they should mark the exit more clearly. We knew not to go out the entrance, but wandered a bit trying to find the actual exit.

aBLjmG02eOzUZTJ10rruzw.text: Food was excellent.  We got all appetizers, 8 for four of us.  Food was superb especially their shrimp cocktail (Napoli).  Very pleased with the food. It is NOT overpriced as one rater stated at all.  Food is Excellent, Service was as well and we enjoyed all very much. We will be back!

rMEHeggkEh0pbckvq_ywhQ.text: Capo's was fun at first when you walk in and it looks like a bad place but it is cool inside. The food was the same story, delicious and fun it was dark but that made it exiting and there was also a magician at our table and he performed free tricks and there was live music overall and amazing place
