TAuY22-N3J0cuo6VkL7aLQ.text: The service is amazing. The food is incredible. The potions are gigantic. The price is fair.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs the size of your fist.

IRDAMx_lRnwe36Uh0n8ZnA.text: I love this place! I haven't even eaten here yet and my mind is blown! I love the decor and the the service. I have the a feeling the food is going to be amazing. My friend suggested this place and he's a chef...need I say more?

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy soup

zWDKcizRhigScACIAihQlw.text: I would give 5 stars but the only knock on this place is the price. Everything is really expensive. But this place does it from the ambiance to the service and the food is awesome. Great lasagna and Alfredo they have signing which felt real try it out but be prepared to drop $100 for 2 people if u want Ferrera and drinks

LzBo3E27PhFuc5-a5_668A.text: Dined 1/22/15. The greeting was unwelcoming. Came in around 5:15 pm. We had no reservations. He told us if we're to eat we had to be gone before 7 because it was going to be packed around that time. The service wasn't speedy but were friendly.  Now the most important part. The food. The meatball i had a lot of flavor. The gravy was meh. I love garlic but they don't know how to use it. Way too much. The garlic butter tasted of raw garlic. Especially the salad with the creamy garlic. It had that very intrusive raw garlic taste even though the waitress said it wasn't going to be like that cause they use garlic seasoning instead. The cooks need to taste the food for better seasoning.

YB2z4rMPBR_OgsRsT9SWTw.text: Excellent : service (Jeremy- five stars and thank you for the smile, sir!!), Food, drinks, decor, live music, & ambiance! Highly recommend coming here if you're visiting ~ or if you're local.  This was my and my BFs first time to Vegas and to Capos. We had a great time!!  On a personal note , I would have paid someone to turn off the TVs.  We are All guilty of looking at flashing screens and it would have been perfect if when my BF and I sat at the bar he wasn't tempted to check the score (which he did... And then forgot to converse with me ). Just a preference! It seems we can't escape screens in this day and age and I was just so looking forward to a night of just his full attention haha.  Overall - when Rob and I come back to Vegas we will definitely be visiting you all again and enjoying every bit! Thank you!

UVVsfUeNxp0TCy6MJMAflQ.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas! I always thing I'm ready to try a new dish but I can't help it. I LOVE the Vinnie Alla Vodka. The best Vodka Sauce in Town.   If by any chance you save room for dessert (don't be afraid to pack your meal to go) I prefer the Creme Brulee. Although the lady fingers in the Tiramisu have the best hot of rum.   Oh and for an appetizer the Ravioli is Amazing!    I just love bringing new friends here. The live entertainment is also the best. Enjoy!

4QpRQou0ciuI6KDWOcDrHQ.text: Capo's is a great experience. The atmosphere at this restaurant is fantastic. As soon as you enter you are transported to a Chicago speakeasy. They have live music in the classic crooner style. I've come several times and I've yet to have a dish I didn't enjoy. The service here is fantastic and extremely helpful. Our waiter  suggested a great wine that paired perfectly with everyone's meal. I highly suggest checking this place out.

mOJfel0gEK72wFk-hkVWCg.text: My boyfriend bought a TravelZoo coupon for a bottom mimosa/belinis and brunch. We pulled up and i instantly was not excited as the exterior is a little less than appealing in my opinion but that's what makes this place a hidden gem. We walked in and i was finally informed it was a speakeasy (i dont read reviews or look up places before i go places i like to go in open minded) we went with the  theatrics and were seated in a booth right in front of live entertainment. It was a Frank Sinatra impersonator and my did the music really set the tone. The service was pretty fast and they accepted out coupon with no hassel. I ordered the  mobsters fritata and my boyfriend the steak and eggs. The portions were more than generous and so i ended up taking a little home. We both also had a few peach belinis that were just on the mark of sweet. I really enjoyed this place and will definitely be back with some of my family.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mobster meat fritata
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach belini and mango belini on the right.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs

Sqwo6zdLISdQPB02_HJHlg.text: Food is OK. But the dining rules are contrary to the theme of freedom. 8$ to split a dish. 45 dollars for a 15$ bottle of wine. All must pay on one bill.....no splitting the check. Terrible server manners when you question their ridiculous rules. Entrance is temporarily fun.....but soon wears off when the seat attendant says he hates his job. Never going to recommend.....

J0Rr2ytjdQD9rBZQLLk_Zw.text: This restaurant is a fun experience with unique ambiance. I ordered the special which was 2 of the most gorgeous pork chops I've ever seen and the presentation was beautiful! The food was very good, including the stuffed mushroom appetizer.

FHkytdjK2ixDApKmJcA_qg.text: Service was terrible. Never got drinks ordered. No sever while sitting at table over 20min and then some. Only reason stayed is because we used Groupon. The 2 stars are because a family of 4 had to go to the bar and order our food. Bartender great the rest terrible. Never coming back and never seen server even after meal. Don't not come. 10/21/17 2:00pm.

BEAgboJc9lxOjhfrQd-ZXg.text: Alright people.  My mother is Sicilian, so I have some street cred.  I've lived in various cities across the United States and I can attest this place has some of the best Italian food period.  End of story.  Like legit home style Italian meatballs, great pink sauce, even good steaks.  I was blown away!   The decor is awesome and the secret entrance door has a great novelty factor to it.  Highly recommended from a legit Italian.  You won't be disappointed.

TfieMdWbVecR6hXnk4zk8Q.text: The place is very dark which adds to the charm but makes it hard to read the menu. There's a flashlight on every menu but it didn't cut it and we used our cell phone lights. The pasta dishes have all been good. Ive never had a bad meal here but I've never had one I'd say was awesome either. The theme is fun so I often take out of town guests when I don't want to battle the strip. Don't sit too close to the piano or it's difficult to have a conversation. Overall the food is consistently good but priced as if it were great.

eapmEsxJLo6Saro9PZLD5w.text: Ok guys you have been in business how long??? The best part of this experience was the live music I ordered spaghetti and white clam sauce it was at best lemon water with those poor clams that never had a chance... My date had " swimming with the fish" not quite as bad but nothing I would wanna put my name on and serve the wine list is a joke save your money folks this was a bomb now for just a mix drink at the bar... Good music very talented guy performing and  cool atmosphere

Jfyo8mZjGCcPaDOwCSrAPg.text: A lot of reviews complained about the price but if you come on a Tuesday they have 2 for 1 Tuesdays so our bill was only around $40 for two people! The food was good I def wouldn't spend full price on it though. The live singer was great dinner and a show for a discount!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love Sinatra singer was great

WHenbx1N6q3pjhweIV8Cog.text: This place is amazing!!  Great food and environment. I highly recommend it. It will be an experience you can only have here. Staff is great and priced right for what you get. Love it

2qrnYTtNTDF3maxS9ZM-Rg.text: Took my family here after church. Nice atmosphere. BUT as I was browsing through the menu and turned to the back. There is a $8.00 charge IF you split your dish. We are a family of 6 with three kids. Long story short. We left. This place is only great for a date period. 2 stars for their atmosphere.

AqOgYrWQYdqf1zXTty_t6Q.text: Came here for my bachelorette party before checking into the Chippendales show. This place is off the strip but worth a visit. I loved the ambiance of this place. We sat in a private room which was really nice but kind of a bummer because we could not see the Frank Sinatra performer on stage. He made our exit by stopping into our private room and singing a little bit for us which was pretty cool. This restaurant is very dark and speakeasy. Drinks are really good and the food, even better. The meatballs are HUGE and delicious! I ordered the pesto. No one complained about their dish, only that they were full. The only thing we didn't think of was he leftovers and portions. Since we were catching a show, we were unable to take any leftovers with us which was kind of a bummer since the portions are pretty family style. I would love to take more people here to experience it. The servers were really nice and helpful to our big party.   My only negative comment is the flooring. I nearly broke my neck on the way to the private room. I hadn't even had a drink yet lol so it wasn't the booze. I was wearing very short heels and I stepped on a slippery section of wood taking me for a slip and slide. I caught myself so I didn't fall, but I skated past a table having dinner which was pretty embarrassing. My friend had the same thing happen to her but she was able to side-step it before sliding. It was just a really awkward piece of floor.  Other than that, I totally had a great time!

q5i834bSxflW5W_tL14YuA.text: Went on Mother's Day I've been here for 5 year's and this by far was best place I've been. Am a very picky eater everyone was so nice Janeen are server was awesome.

t9nLu1dboP8gVhDAFa9pvA.text: When I saw this place on a recent TV show, I knew we had to try it.  If you are into MOB movies and gangster flicks like we are, what better way to experience firsthand at something similar (well kind of) to how the Vegas MOB lived, where they dined and how they had a good time. This is not the fanciest restaurant but it's totally old school. The red leather booths, the stage for performance, the piano guy and all the attitude that comes with the people. That's their thing. Upon arriving, you knock on a door and some really cool bigh honcho looking guy opens a window like thing and says "yea, what do you want" in this New Yorker, heavy, mean voice. Um...we have resos at 8 please and with not okay, thanks, welcome, he opens the door and says to follow him. Again.....this is their thing. This is the image of the restaurant. In no way were we offended because I had reviewed their restaurant prior to going.   We sat down and the amazing service immediately started. Since the restaurant was very dark inside (image), they had these little cute lights hanging from their menus. The names of all their drinks and dishes were so COOL. I ordered the dirty martini (their special) and it was so delicious. My husband ordered this drink called "kick in the head". Ha! The waitress said "you will see why it's called that in the morning".   Check out their menu for all the cool names they have for their dishes.   We split the following:  Dinner salad Beef spaghetti Bolognese- off the menu  Chocolate dipped Cannoli's.   The check was VERY reasonable   Definitely going back and taking everyone I know.

x0h-e0e4kb64Et6t3NUMzg.text: I made reservations 2 months ahead of time for my BF's bday. We arrived and they seated us in a back room which had one other table occupied. I noticed when we walked in that there was live entertainment and nice booth seating in the main dining area. We asked if we could be moved to that room and were quickly told that he spoke to mgr and those tables where reserved. hmmmm, I saw about 7 available booths!!! I asked to speak to manager. He came to our table and said he's see what he could do. He then sat us in a nice booth. Throughout the night I noticed not one other table was seated after us? Why would they lie about those booths being reserved? Weird.  The food was OK and entertainment was great.

eQa56OGRstIYWwe9M754kg.text: Disappointed they would not accept 2 gift certificates we had citing "new management".  Doesn't make sense as most ownership changes make allowances for that, and new owners should welcome return customers knowing that a good customer spends quite a bit more over time, than might be lost on a single visit.

60uWokdStGWUMxflM0PuOg.text: Probably 3.5 stars. We went for lunch and it was pretty good. The entrance is a cool little starting touch. It was very quiet in there, maybe 5-6 tables total. The service was good albeit not exceptional. Still, no complaints there.  We had the house and Caesar salads and both were good but nothing really special.  My wife had the chicken parm which she enjoyed.  My pasta was decent enough and you can tell they make it on the spot which is nice. I was disappointed with the sauce though. For all the hype I heard from the servers about it I found it to be rather boring. Too bad. They also didn't have any pasta salad available for a side dish which I found odd at a pasta place. On a positive note the meatballs themselves were delicious. It's certainly not a bad place and we may try for dinner one night and hope for a little better.

ypgdH0PuTMPJlTudsgZ7AA.text: Fantastic from the beginning to end! What an experience, when you first walk in the super cool entrance and then the ambience of the mobster feel is spot on. Extremely poorly lit and that's the point so I thought that was kind of neat (especially that they were smart enough to put a little light on each menu). The food though is absolutely to die for! The waitress was super nice to me and my date and her suggestions were perfect. I've never had a meatball that amazing and those noodles were so perfectly cooked it was almost scary. They even had a Sinatra singer in there (though the music was a bit loud by him) who was actually really great. All around not a single complaint! Oh and it was 2 for 1 Tuesday so we got $20 off (that was almost my entire entree, $22)! Fantastic, just fantastic.

XdWtYRvoYdymXusCdU0_EA.text: A Chicago-based mob speakeasy, in Vegas? I was so there last Saturday night for one of my very sporadic date nights with the husband. Located in the old Hooters (yeah, I'm from Vegas, I know these things), I saw that they turned that titty-tastic 80's chicken wing place into a dark, somewhat intimate but very entertaining restaurant and lounge which adorns pictures of mafia legends of long ago. Yup, this place definitely did not resemble the raucous orange splattered nipple nightmare of years before. I was impressed. We had 8:45 pm reservations and so upon entering, you must ring the bell and low and behold, the host greets you from a small cut out in the wall above the payphone, to the right of the door and doorbell. Woo, so speakeasy. And since we had those reservations, dude had no problem letting us in. Don't know if a password is required without reservations, but one need only to check their website for more info. But I think reservations would be most advisable.   Anyway, it's a good thing we had a reservation because the place was packed. We had to wait a few minutes past our reservation time. The host even admitted to us that he'd tell us to go to the bar, but considering how packed it was that night, there was no way we were getting a seat at the bar. Once we were finally seated in a booth, not far from the entrance, we waited a little bit for a server. We weren't in a hurry, we didn't have any other plans or anywhere else to be that evening, so to speak. But we were quite hungry and thirsty.   Having sorta kinda studied the menu before arriving, I chose the eggplant parm and my husband tried the lasagna. We decided against any apps that night, knowing that the entrees would be more than enough. The bread basket came and there were just 5 little slices of what looked like baguette bread with cold individual foil wrapped pads of butter. I was not really impressed with that. If you're an Italian place, offer up warm breads and butter, not this airline bread and butter service! But hey, it's always been said, best not to fill up on bread. So with that, we waited for the cocktails. And because it was a speakeasy and I knew any bar hopping that we may do that night would not offer good red wine, I opted for a dirty martini with blue cheese olives and it was fabulous! The olives were perfect apps for me. The husband had his usual fancy outing drink: a Manhattan. And although dirty martinis go better with steak, I still enjoyed my eggplant parm with my drink. My husband raved about the lasagna, especially the sauce. We each took half of our food home for the next day and it warmed up beautifully.   So I give it three stars only because of the pokey service and the bread basket. I'd like to give this place another go, possibly take my mom here so that she can check it out. I might even entertain having a steak with my dirty martini next time I visit.

XVnRt9OR2znTjX-5Qo6hcg.text: Took three of my friends there last night for dinner Found the food very mediocre  Had chicken Marcelo - horrible  Friend had lasagna small portion dry  Salad not real tasty Bread good Entertainment way to loud  All the great restaurants in Vegas pass on this one  Bill was 148.00 I fell like I got ripped off And the waitress was not excited about the food what a turnoff But desserts were ok  Joan s Seattle

qJxvTig1xM9u8XFPwYCovw.text: I really enjoyed this place. The theme was great and they played it the entire night. They had live music and some guy came around showed us a few magic tricks. The food was great! We got the meatballs for our appetizer and it was so full of flavor. But it is expensive!! We had a table of 4 and our bill was $200. They don't let you split the check and if you share a plate, it's $8 charge.

NqoHqcqnM8uXRvvOMT3k9g.text: The atmosphere is sorta gimmicky but the food was great. We were there later in the evening  and the lounge entertainment wasn't great. If you like trying somewhere different than normal strip restaurants then defiantly worth a visit.

n37MZCKwqLaJ-HH29YfsLA.text: Food was real good. The aura was real nice and also the employees was real attentive which is always a plus. Brought the kids along which may not have been a great idea, kids are welcomed but not as kid friendly as they didn't have kids cups or kids menus but LOVED everything else about this restaurant as a first timer here. When in town will be coming back to!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I got the Chi-Town Scampi and it was delicious!!!!!

k7VgZTcorg-BlWwxPWn0Dw.text: i came to use my groupon which was expiring the next day. i thought they were closed coz when i rang the bell no one came then as i was leaving someone knocked on my car window & said he couldn't come right away coz he was in the kitchen. i thought maybe it was juz him who was serving but turned out there was a lot of people there. i said i had a groupon but it said for 2 people so if maybe i could just take home the one for the second person. he said it doesn't work that way but he guessed it could be done. i was sat at one of the booths & i waited for a long, i'm guessing about 10 minutes. i wasn't even offered a drink or given a menu. finally the waitress came, she said she thought i was waiting for someone that's why she didn't come right away. someone in her position should not assume coz first impression is important. i told her about my groupon but she said she could only serve me for one person. she said i could come back tomorrow & bring someone but i didn't want to come back besides being hungry already so i agreed to be served only for one instead of 2 like my groupon called for. the food itself wasn't so good, too salty for my taste. i had to ask for bread 2 times coz i guess she told her busboy but he didn't give me any. he brought me parmesan cheese without asking if i needed anything else. at the same time, they were all singing a happy birthday to the customers next table. i felt like i didn't matter coz maybe i was only dressed up in my jogging suit, not wearing any jewelry, using my groupon. i didn't know what it was but i felt like i was ignored. so i ordered dessert that's supposed to be baked right there in their which wasn't spectacular but okay coz i have sweet tooth anyway. i wasn't really happy with the service & the place but i gave a tip that was more than my bill of 9.00 for the expensive dessert coz i wanted to make a point & for them to realize that they shouldn't judge anybody based on what they look like on the outside. i sure would never come back to this restaurant.

XGIL9iR0cRoSKzl49ls7Ig.text: I absolutely loved this place.  I honestly don't recall how I found out about it, but when I did I looked it up in Yelp and began reading.  Yes... Some mixed reviews but honestly I am always up to try new things and I M sure glad I did!! First.. Read the previous reviews.  You will have a better understanding of what to expect.  Yes it is off the strip and takes about 20 mins to get there.  Google directions ppl if driving too far is a problem.  Next, the entrance is unconventional.  It is somewhat hidden and that is part of the "theme".  Keep in mind, everything this place does seems intentional to me.  From the stuffy host, the gimmick about being too full, all of it.  Part of why I loved it so much.  We made reservations for a Saturday night and all that was available was 9pm. My husband and I decided on a whim to go early and see if we could get in.  We got a little push back but they gave us a great seat and the rest was wonderful.  Again I wasn't offended... All part of the act.  Food was great but the meatballs were AMAZING! So glad we decided to add those on.  Great service, we were serenaded to and the food was fabulous.  Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside of the restaurant.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best chocolate dipped cannolies ever!

WAqZD9__y3H728BZLLjyvQ.text: Dinner in the dark. On the recommendation from some friends and it did not disappoint. We were a group of seven, with no reservation and had a little bit of a wait. Time moved quickly as we watched people coming in get surprised (I will not spoil that for you.) Once we had a table, we were treated to live music from a fella who was attentive (and fairly sneaky) to our table. It was very dark, but luckily the menus came with little flashlights. The food was great and the pastas noodles were homemade. Though it was a bit tricky to avoid dropping food on myself.

73FMLvw6E8fMZkSmGnXTlQ.text: Visited with a group on. Do not get turned off by the bldg. It has a nice welcome skit that will get you in the mood. Great music. Our salad was nice (cold,crisp,clean). The pasta dishes al dente (we both had our pasta for the week) were excellent. Highly recommend it. Our server Melissa was extremely helpful. We grew up on an Italian household with fantastic cooks on both sides, so we enjoy our nice dinner. Also on Tuesday's they have a special $20 off your dinner. Did I mentioned the bread?  Anyway, please go out there and give it a try. We did visit this restaurant after reading the various reviews on yelp and groupon. We will be going back.

CfSqosa8y56rH_yNgwzV9Q.text: Loved it. Made a reservation for 13 (work function) and got the banquet room in the back. Atmosphere was fantastic. They had The Godfather playing on a tv with the subtitles on. The entertainment was on point with a solo crooner performing with a digital band...he was outstanding. They also had a roaming magician working off of tips. I hate to say it but he was incredible lol. Thought he was going to be annoying but I was pleasantly surprised. The only thing I would have changed would be the chairs in the banquet room. Way to low and not very comfortable. The food? Off the charts good. I had the Chicken Anastasia and grilled veggies. SO on point. Everyone is se enjoyed their dishes as well to the point that everyone was talking about it the next day. I brought my wife here a couple of nights later and it was just as amazing. Highly recommended for tourists and locals alike..

mTeqKkn58NFISjomx9ar0w.text: My wife and I ate here last night. Had to be the best Italian food we have ever had. Our waitress was the best I've had too she made experience even better. I had lasagna and my wife had spaghetti and a half pound meatball. Their cheese bread we were told was their most popular appetizer, she was right about that. The atmosphere of the place is perfect for an Italian restaurant, the Sinatra style singer was the caper for it. Love this place can't wait to go back.

Lvmle4Htq-LdZnMqCwxRAg.text: Awesome meatballs, must have!!!! We had them as an appetizer and ate them all. Everything else was great. Service a little slower at times, but the food makes up for it. Coming back next time we're in Vegas.

kn1q6gQydN2F3B9J-Qh9LA.text: I'm Italian, so I've had the best Italian food at home. However, Capo's is one of my all time favorite Italian food restaurants anywhere, not just Vegas. AND the atmosphere is awesome. The piano player sounds just like Frank Sinatra, and I know, because he and Dean were friends of my Grandfather. You see, My Grandfather worked for Al Capone in the 1930's and I used to hear the stories about the numbers rackets and Speakeasies he ran and visited , so to experience Capo's homage to the old Mob Speakeasies of that era is just a treat for me. Capo's Restaurant & Speakeasy is more than a great Italian restaurant and Steakhouse , it's an "experience" worth leaving the Strip for. I promise, you won't be disappointed.

mU1h1OnUrcz4iAkY5raWXA.text: Las Vegas best kept secret. Its like a time warp back to a 1940's speakeasy. You knock on the door and go into a secret doorway to the restaurant to see a frank sinatra look alike singing  music behind a piano and walking around the restaurant. All the staff play the part of True Italian staff especially Jeremy his customer service was outstanding, the food was fabulous and the atmosphere was intoxicating. Best place for dinner and a canoli for sure! A must do in Vegas.

EvXVSRk_S5ygdAGcU5bpRQ.text: Great Italian restaurant! My husband and I have been here a few times-it's one of our favorites when we are in town.  You have to ring the bell and they slide the door open like the prohibition days! So cool! The host was amazing and the live entertainment was a gentleman singing Frank Sinatra songs. The food was exceptional! I highly recommend the creamy garlic dressing on the salad. I also had the ravioli with a pink sauce that was incredible and the meatballs were equally delicious. The Anastasia chicken is a must-one of the best items on the menu.  I also had an Italian Margarita.  OH my!  It was the most delicious drink!  The wait staff is extremely attentive. It was a little dark, but I think that's the idea as part of the ambiance because the menus come with little flashlights attached. We will definitely be back!

MiA-hdRzwPsYJr21mniztg.text: The food was decent but the service lacked for the price point.  When each course was delivered the runner just auctioned off the food which is tacky.  Most good restaurants use a pivot position so when the food is delivered they know which guest gets which item without calling them out.  When they served the plates to us they just stood in one position and served the plates over the other guests.  This isn't even done at Low end places like Cheesecake Factory.  We all had to ask several times for water and iced tea refills while the servers/bussers were all standing around.  Everyone was nice but need more server training.  The magician came around and he was cool.  I eat out a lot and expect much better service when I'm spending more than $70/ a person.

sJ8NIGpyHqXZF8grNMvKlA.text: I went at lunch on Tuesday and wanted to use the 2 for one dinning experience they offer. The waitress said I could only use it on set menu. I also informed her that I was able to use it on dinner menu and it would give me 20 dollars of bill but also had two order 2 drinks.  My wife and I proceeded to order the chicken piccata and aside and was brought out 1 chicken breast and a side of risotto. It looked more like a lunch portion.  I had eaten here before and were brought out 2 chicken breast out.  The pan sauce was really runny but risotto was really good.      The service was not good  server seemed lost and didn't know menu .  When a person orders from dinner menu, that means they want dinner size portions especially when your paying dinner prices. I will not return here again  and will inform my foodie friend here in the valley  and family about my experience. I give one star for risotto 2 stars for old gangster feel to the restaurant

yCLE1Rh-O4Mw5agfXOD0QQ.text: Wow!  Went out for dinner but got more.   The food, traditional Italian, was excellent.  Our party of three had Lasagna, Chicken Parmesan, and Scaloppini and each dish was excellent.  The service was outstanding and our waiter had a pleasant personality.  The Stuffed Mushroom appetizer was also fantastic.  In addition to the great food, we were entertained by a Sinatra style singer and when he took a break the background music was out of the Bronx Tale - just fantastic atmosphere.  We were also entertained by a magician at our table while we waited for our meal.  The feel of old Vegas is here and alive.  This is a fun place with excellent food, a must visit when you have out of town guests.  My only "ding" would be that it is very dark in this speak-easy atmosphere so bring a flashlight.

NSWCXjeXjwN-QdyWlj5JYA.text: Everything was just great till we got our bill.  The food was amazing, the girl who waited us was great, I thought...  We went in for 2 in 1 for locals and the bill was fully charged, so I asked the girl if I need to show my ID.  She looked at it and took the bill with my credit card, but she didn't took anything off from our bill.  I said, "I thought you explained to us if we are locals tonight, we get $20 off?"  She said, "Oh, my bad!" then she went to speak to her manager.  She came back and said, "So sorry, we can't do anything about it, but whenever you come back, we will give you $20 back."  I couldn't understand it because every Tuesday is 2 for 1 day for locals.  I said, "You can't even give us $20 cash back?"  She said, "No, sorry!"  We went there tonight only because they were having the deal.  Since food was amazing, we'd go back, but this doesn't make sense to me.  The manager should have came to our table and apologized, at least.  I guess since their price is not $$$$, the service is $$.

fAcOt6dDjAH1JwquFjnb7Q.text: What a surprise! I have driven by Capo's over a thousand times and finally on a whim, decided to try it out.  The ambiance and food were out of this world.  We sat off the main dining room but still could enjoy the action in the other room. Service was fantastic and the food...THE BEST! The meatballs were HUGE and melted in my mouth! The garlic salad dressing was perfect: not too much garlic but enough to fend off those vampires that might be lurking in Vegas at night! We will be back.

dBvI9vRBY8YVu7vkpVr7aQ.text: One of my husband and my most favorite dining spots!!! A GEM in Las Vegas. The food, the ambiance, the staff... on point! You would never guess from the outside. Definitely returning.

XL8vjjXzNhczk17Q-ypBuw.text: Overall I had a great experience with this place. I think your experience will be decided on where you are seated. We were seated in a good spot. Not too close to the band and not tucked away. I ordered the New York steak and I thought It was really good. My wife got some pasta dish that she thought was "ok'.   The only thing that I was not pleased with is that they did not bring our bread out until the food had already arrived. The server, Brandon, took one of my drinks off of my tab because of the bread incident.  I would come back again; however, I would try to come when it is not so busy.

1jMtNqGKSzh-JQmk25R1fg.text: What a fun and quaint place... this was my first visit and I'm sure I will be back again.  The food was great, the atmosphere was wonderful, and the staff was very attentive.  Getting in was interesting but adds to the mystery of the old vegas mob days theme.  There was live music and s magician roaming amongst the guest.  It was a little pricey, but what steakhouse isn't?  All I can say is if you're looking for a quirky and interesting place to dine you need to try this place out!

BqqiK-B97EmuYjiEWIY_kw.text: I've been coming to Las Vegas 25+ years I have to say tonight was the best experience I  ever had at a restaurant in Las Vegas the service food maitre d's  and the singer who is doing nothing but Frank Sinatra was amazing thank you capos for wonderful evening and the finish to a  great weekend hope to be back soon I'm glad this place is not sleeping with the fishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The family .
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Capo don the butcher deluna

bxiWtlzRLXvmKKOUrKqkMA.text: So this is a Speakeasy joint.  I came for the 1st time in 2012 & returned again last week.  This joint has not changed much.  I like the ambiance & feel of the place.  The food is about the same as I can remember, but the live entertainment is a plus & service was pretty good.  The cocktails were nice and at reasonable prices.  The wine list was decent for this caliber eatery.  There was a magician walking around the tables performing tricks for tips.  That was a bit distracting, but hey, we all have to earn a living so hustle away man...

mS5hKRNIAmBL5Q280tfFvw.text: Ugh, not agreeing with the haters on this one.  I've always had great experiences here.  I've traveled to many a destination and I have to say Capo's in Vegas is one of the great Off-Strip dinning opportunities.  I've also been here more than once so I can base this review on a long-standing patronage rather than a one-time, in passing frivolous complaint.   Food is great, reasonable for the quality, dark and secretive atmosphere, wonderful lounge style singers (that can actually sing), and if you behave as an adult aiming for a pleasurable dinning experience, this will be a perfect environment for you.  No complaints from me.

7t06ctrpAlyJyVEpR15TQg.text: Bubba and his team were excellent.  Chicken Lucchese  was excellent!. Scar face shrimp scampi was good too

s_9VgVNz8Dbn_PoNh5pq9A.text: Always a fun and fantastic experience. Capo's is one of my favorite places to dine in Vegas. This time I brought my Boss and he loved it!!!!

-Ins40xJoNG4neZouWjIuw.text: Delicious, awesome service and fun atmosphere!! If you're looking for amazing Italian food in a memorable atmosphere while visiting Vegas go to Capos!!  Make sure to make a reservation they stay super busy!! #CapoDeiCapi

FuidvEDGbXRLO2cW736mfA.text: Great Great drinks !! I had the shrimp scampi! It was  great !! And the music made it a great experience!! Would return any day!!

lHxAgvjJe27RD9Ab88gVEQ.text: God, I wish I could give this place a better review! The atmosphere and the idea of it is so fun and unique and I was so excited to be going to a place featured on the show Man Finds Food. The first time I went here was 8/30/15 with a small group and I had so much fun! The Frank Sinatra singer was fun, the magician that came around to each table was entertaining and the eggplant parmesan was the best I had tried in Vegas.  WHAT WENT WRONG: Visit on 12/10/15  My parents were visiting from MI and I couldn't wait to take them to Capo's as part of an early Christmas gift. This would be my second time there. We made reservations on a Thursday night around 7:30 p.m. thinking it wouldn't be too busy. We arrived 10 mins late due to traffic and when we got there they still didn't have our table ready. The inside of the restaurant was uncomfortably hot inside and there are no windows to let in the air. We had to wait 15 mins standing by the bar because there were no seats available at the bar and I felt like I might melt from the temperature. There were a couple tables open and I'm not sure why they weren't offered to us. When they had our seats ready, we had to wait another 15 mins for our waitress Ashley to arrive. It was really strange we were waiting so long when we had reservations.   We ordered our food and I made it really clear to Ashley that my mom was vegetarian (I even told her she had been a vegetarian for 40 years) and wanted the VEGETARIAN meatball. Our entrees came and my mom started eating her food and said, "this tastes like beef." I tried a bite of it and felt sick the rest of the night. We couldn't find our waitress anywhere to alert her of the mistake. My mom said, "it really seems like we're not getting any attention at our table tonight." My dad ended up flagging down a busser to tell him about the mistake. The order was sent back to the kitchen and the meatball was corrected and we finally saw our waitress again. We told her about the meatball and I also had to ask for a basket of their complimentary bread because she hadn't brought any out when we were seated. By the time my mom's meatball and the bread basket arrived at the table my dad and I were finished eating and my mom had to eat alone - we didn't get to enjoy Christmas dinner together :/ I've never received a bread basket at the end of my meal before at any other restaurant. My mom also felt sick from eating the beef and we didn't get our waters refilled once. I felt awful.  The only reason I didn't give this place one star is because the guy singing the Frank Sinatra hits was attentive to us and made my mom smile. We left him a big tip. I really wouldn't recommend this place at this point. I work at a local hospital  in Vegas and I see firsthand the damage food poisoning/food allergies can wreck, plus the wait service was REALLY poor.  This place is too far from the heart of Vegas to make it worth venturing out to for the low quality and the price. I don't recommend this place to anyone any more, esp. if you're a vegetarian or have a special diet. For good, quality Italian food/better service, I recommend Ventanos. It is where I will take my parents the next time they are in town. I really regret having a Christmas dinner at Capo's.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My first experience at Capo&#39;s was so fun! My second experience was so poor :/
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Props this guy! He made our night singing Frank Sinatra hits to us when our order/service was really poor!

O1xj20DOoR9sKJXYYjSQtw.text: Love bringing my out of town guests here to give them a taste of Old Vegas, Rat Pack style. Food is amazing! I had the linguini & clams..hubby had the chicken piccata with risotto. Friends we very pleased with the their lobster & shrimp risotto & the NY steak w asparagus & garlic mash.

BEqOX7HsoIc4WR71h-5EfA.text: Such a fun first restaurant to hit after driving 2.5 days! What a way to get introduced to our new life in Vegas! We are huge foodies and boy did this place deliver. My fave? The ridiculous meatball salad...yup, u heard me. Start with their Nekos Ceasar salad, add rigatoni and provolone cheese PLUS one gigantic homemade meatball topped with their secret red sauce. Wow.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hYcyc5DG8ZBioKXs81mzrg.text: I could not possibly say enough great things about this restaurant. I questioned our choice when we arrived, but I was quickly reassured. The atmosphere is crazy cool, and the food is absolutely amazing. My boyfriend said the meatballs were the best he's ever had. I was not expecting the creamy garlic dressing to be spicy, but I don't care-- I am painfully full from the chicken parm and fried ravioli!

DEQ9Egv5hN1Srn6GceohTQ.text: Awful. No dress code   Old Las Vegas Vibe? Speakeasy? Nice Italian? Not with losers wearing shorts and baseball caps? Great idea poorly executed. Think they keeps the lights off so you can't see how awful it is. Yea it's almost pitch black in there. Have to use lights to see menu. If Olive Garden was the McDonald's of Italian this place is like the 7-11 of Italian. Ventano's or mezzos or Maggianos, Or even brio's blows this place out of the water

39Ntg8gDNomAdcAqLTB0qA.text: I love the idea of what Capos is supposed to be except there is no dress code!!!! We started off with a Cesar salad which was really good. My husband ordered linguine and clams that tasted like a can of spaghettios and I ordered chicken Marsala which looked and tasted like chicken mole. I'm no chef but I make chicken Marsala with more flavor and I don't think it's supposed to me almost black and I'm going to add that I got one medium size piece of chicken. The risotto was really good though. When the bill arrived I realized they gave my young son an adult spaghetti and when I asked about that he said children meals are upon request which I feel should have been asked. We have been here before a while back and was really good then but just not even close to the same I honestly would rather have gone to Maggianos.

1iqaqbFIgktriVKD0-KXrA.text: Capo's is TOP NOTCH! Great EVERYTHING! Food, ambience, service, vibe! all of it! It's such a fun fun spot. From the speakeasy door- (you'll see) to the piano, to the roaming magician. I do not have a single negative thing to even hint at. Every time I eat here I want to go back the next day! May sound odd but given a chance order the sandwich for lunch! OMG- best thing ever. You can sit in here for hours and gossip with your crew and be transported back to the day when you were an OG! heheheh  All while having the yummiest OG's mama's kinda Italian food served to you in your red leather booth, and best lady night out chandelier putting a sparkle in your eye! Or heck, you can even cozy up to an inviting bar if that's more your style.Tuesdays I believe are still buy one get one for locals! I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. May have to get dressed and head on over yet again.

l-h1WSb5z0hbPFA_OGQL0w.text: We love this place, it is great in every way but one: there were 7 of us. Three couples and one single. The waitress refused to split up the bill. So after a wonderful evening, we had three of us trying to figure out who owes what. AWKWARD!!! of course one or two mistakes and someone gets screwed. It took us 20 minutes to do the bill the way it was. So we won't be back nor will we recommend this wonderful place until they can get it together on that.  Kind of put a bad ending to a great evening.

Juk-qsH656DbV0UJsKnnDw.text: Family of 4 2 adults 2 Kids $200 before drinks. For pasta. Don't do it.  Not worth it. Go to Morton's instead. And back at the hotel room and still hungry.  So spending more.

cybqJO55Yz4lpv3GdzcDmA.text: Favorite dinner while in Vegas. Had a table of 10 and we all tried each other's. All the meals were great.  Loved the piano man and the speakeasy vibe. Great wine as well.

kL5-OZZpUll_qF5irvUBJw.text: We visited Capo's as a group on Valentine's day.  All in all it was amazing food.  My partner and I opted for the Valentine's lobster and steak preset menu.  It came with so many sides that I literally got scared if I could finish it.   We started off with the meatballs and fried ravioli, and I can honestly say I would eat that all day long.  I didn't need anything else.  Then out came the salad with the garlic dressing and I was in heaven.   The steak and lobster meal was great but in most cases you cant really F that up, most of the time.  I ordered the stuffed mushrooms, garlic mash, and the risotto.  I will say the highlight of the meal was the side of risotto.  I was absolutely stuffed by the time I got to the side of risotto and I couldn't stop once I had a taste of it.    The only reason I am not giving this place 5 stars is because I had to ask for water 5 times.  Not 5 different occasions, but 5 times until my glass was actually filled.  It may seem petty but with as many amazing flavors as Capo's has going on water was needed throughout the whole meal.  Also with the preset there was a glass of wine or champagne that was never brought to our table.    I will come back again regardless, the food and atmosphere was great!

HjFrjjvUKGhz9TCR0tDK4g.text: Very unpleasant experience at Capo's today.  Decided to try them out and bought a lunch Groupon, which stays that it's good for 11am to 3pm.  Gathered my small family and two tiny kids and got there about 2:50 pm (still before 3pm obviously).  By the time they answered the door bell and got us in and were ready to take our order it was about 2:58 pm.  Once we showed our Groupon, the server basically turned as away.  His argument - we can not accommodate you because it is too late (and that's when the restaurant was almost completely empty  - only one small table occupied! ).      When I argued  - well it's not even 3pm yet and I cam here with two little kids and the 3 year old was very excited about going to this restaurant, his response was:  nothing I can do, we stop serving lunch at 2:45pm even though our papers may say 3pm.  And, then, he just showed us the door we used to come in and said, "you can use that door to come back out".  So, that's how we were "customer-handled".     We were certainly absolutely dismayed and just left.    I have my own small businesses and certainly make sure that my employees go out of their way to accommodate our customers regardless of when they come and where they come from!

LD1XvEp8FGd7LKBRKU5N3w.text: Excellent food, ambiance and live entertainment.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Live singer

t0XxKxEM11LFgLbJRjCvvg.text: You have to be kidding me with this place. We call Monday afternoon and told we did not need a reservation we show up and some loser wannna be Italian jackass says it ain't happening no way are you getting in. And when we told him we called and they said no reservations needed. He again said not happening. No respectful real True blooded Italian would talk to customers like that. I would not eat here if you paid me. I already heard the food sucked  and now I know the staff sucks too I wish I could give no stars. I don't need to pay money too get insulted before I walk through the door.

zLaoeSTXCRPN7htaLVzHwg.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant....the whole experience looks like the one you see in a movie from ringing the door bell and hostess opening a small window to pick and asking you if you have a reservation and letting you in to darker room ....and the food is amazing

6fqG3nP4MqYoC2LnX_YYSg.text: A definite fun experience in November. Great food GREAT entertainment. I believe reservations are a must.  Can't wait to return.

ZZF2RNGf48IC86hjO0FkwQ.text: Wish I could give more stars! Dined here last night for my husbands birthday, our first time in and definitely not last. Food was sooooo good, service was awesome. Our Server Cindy was super busy, but she still made sure to take great care of us! I had the porter house with lobster tail, highly recommend!!!! Can't wait to go back and try something else

ELrJMrBuZNbmxeZT7qJHxw.text: Excellent experience. Food and service were top notch, great live entertainment and ambiance. Lasagna portion was large and tasty, chicken piccata and mushroom risotto were rich and satisfying. We'll be back for sure!

eo6TEgWWmqA5wM_7pYJdMg.text: I had high hopes for Capo's Italian Cuisine. Two stars is all I can come up with for this place. Somethings are on me. Like not really mapping out how far this place was from mid-strip. We paid $27.50 + a $5.00 tip for a taxi from the Monte Carlo. So figure you're into roughly a $65.00 round trip cab fare just to get here and back to your hotel. That was on me. It was 100 degrees outside in the early evening. The secret door was kinda of fun. We gave the password to my GF's daughter to get us in. First impression, it's hot in here. 77 degrees inside. The host seats us at the first booth we come to in the bar area facing the bar, a TV showing the The Shawshank Redemption, and the open kitchen. Heat from the kitchen is coming right at us. Not good. I got up and asked the host now sitting at the bar if we can be seated in the main dinning room which is pretty much empty. One booth out of five is occupied. There's a big table set in the middle for maybe a party of ten? I don't know. The host says- Well, you know here's the thing........we have a big party coming in and....we gotta lot of reservations.....and let me see what I can do....and I'm not to sure.....and let me check on something.....and so on and so on. My inner monolog is saying to me- This guy wants me to break out some cash for a better table in this empty hot and stuffy restaurant. Are you fucking kidding me guy? I just shelled out over $30.00 bucks just to get here! Really? I'll stand my ground. The host continues- Yeah, you know we got this big party coming in and we are really busy and, and, and.........Okay, okay, okay, I'll get a booth setup for you. For the record, only one other couple came in while we were there and the big table got broken down and put away half way through our dinner cause no one ever showed up. Now, I have no real proof he was shaking me down, but I think he was. Not cool. We got the temp down to 72 degrees and things were looking up. Martini time. I had two and they were good. Our waitress was very nice to us. Oh yeah, as others have mentioned it's pitch black in here. 99 Cent store mini flashlights that weren't working very well are attached to the menus. It was a struggle reading the menu. Food- Fried Calamari- Not bad. No tentacles. Boo. Me- Salad- Over dressed and limp. Veal Parmesan- Surprisingly good. I always give credit when due. Pasta- Under cooked. Queen of Reseda's Daughter- Soup- Bland. Racketeers Ravioli- She liked it. Queen of Reseda- Soup- Bland. Veal Marsala- Chewy, she did not like. Pasta- Under cooked. Entertainment- The live Frank Sinatra type singer was cool at first. The Queen of Reseda's daughter was the only single looking female in the place as far as I could see. He serenaded her once, she liked it. "Return to me. Please come back bella mia" He serenaded her twice, okay fine. Move on Broheim. He serenaded her a third time and it started to get really old, really fast. We laughed about it later, but it was borderline uncomfortable for a while there. After dinner we asked if they would call us a cab. They have there own driver which they offered to take us back to our hotel. It was a flat $25.00 plus I gave him a $5.00 tip. We took them up on their offer, the driver was very nice and got us home safe. IMO these guys have figured out how to stack the deck with the Yelp reviews. Soon after I posted this review, four new five star reviews mushroom up pushing this one down. Take notice how most of these reviews are pretty short and sweet by people with not a lot of friends. Some guy wrote how it was packed on a Monday night? BS. We were there on a Sunday night and it was dead. I wish I would have checked out the 166 other reviews that are not currently recommended before coming here. 166! Check them out for some very interesting reading. I regret coming here. I felt like I wasted a dinner in Vegas. You'd be better off at Casa di Amore. We had a great time earlier this year. yelp.com/biz/casa-di-amo...

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Parmesan with pasta.  Didn&#39;t love the restaurant, but I will say this was pretty good.

y1l6Wuhef9QDysqJx-jyDA.text: My wife called yesterday to make reservations for my birthday and the gentleman who answered told her to call back tomorrow (today).  When I called the same guy told me he had nothing available and I mentioned my wife called yesterday but they couldn't take reservations and to call back the next day.  He told me the computer was down and that it wasn't their problem.  Super rude.  Being locals, we've been here before but will not return in the future.  The food is average at best and it was just a stop with our friends for drinks but they're doing us a favor.  They are rude, overpriced, and the food is nothing special.  Good job Capo's! We'll spend our money elsewhere.

HrjpJTkT6WlTAJvBRQi8lQ.text: Another great meal at Capo's!! We took my brother and his wife, and they loved it!! We enjoy the atmosphere, and the staff was amazing.  Jeanine, our waitress was wonderful!! She knew her menu and helped us narrow down our choice.   We always look forward to a meal at Capo's when were in town.

50slwIGsXPFmps7M2y4ovA.text: This is one of the most amazing restaurants that i have ever been to! The food is outragiously amazing! The service couldn't get any better! If you are looking for a nice relaxing lunch/dinner my recommendation to you would be capo's! You will never be disappointed Brandon is the waiter to have also!! If you decide to come enjoy!!

TYHg53OL8QZFtLUyxHpalw.text: Such an amazing experience. This place is cool & a must do when in Vegas. We celebrated our 12th wedding anniversary here with friends. The ambiance is fabulous, the food delicious & huge servings. They are famous for meatballs & they are huge & delicious.. You only need one!! We had great service, everyone enjoyed their authentic Italian food & seafood!!

GYEloW3RpIRay3NORuselA.text: My favorite experience our whole week in Las Vegas! Make reservations! We had to wait a few days to go as we didnt have reservations the first night we had available to go, but very glad we had another opportunity. Love the concept of the speakeasy restaurant, starting as you enter the door and the host opens his special window, plays his role well and of course the ladies with me enjoyed the compliments. We were a little late for our reservation so had to wait about 15 minutes but enjoyed watching the interactions of the host and bar staff with other customers while waiting. The Chicago mobster decor was probably my wife's favorite as they are originally from Chicago and Italian, nough said. The Italian cuisine is excellent. I had veal parmesan & opted for the upgraded sides of mushroom risotto which was wonderful and the Italian egg drop soup which is now my favorite. Wife had the spaghetti and meatballs, we both think they were the best meatballs in Vegas!That compliment after having eaten at Lavo, Batista's,  Bucca, no name, and a few other much more expensive places.  Enjoyed  the great cocktails before and after dinner and the deserts were the perfect ending.  They also had a live singer / old school Vegas crooner who did all the old rat pack songs and was very enjoyable.  One thing I noticed and appreciated was that several of the staff and customers greeted each other with the typical Italian family hand shake hug and kiss on the cheek. Just adding that extra family touch to the place. We will definitely be back everytime we are in Vegas.

ERGQ34c11wceyedvo5MJ8Q.text: We went to Capo's for something different than the strip.  Capo's was a perfect evening;  the best meat sauce (spicy) that I've ever had.  Easy Uber ride there and back fro the Strip.  Hands down the right choice so go enjoy!

VfVpdXo_AuK3KpoLHNNaOg.text: This place is fantastic.. my sister and I were looking for a restaurant for dinner. I stumbled upon this gem while browsing yelp.. this is a must try place with exceptional service and the food is amazing as well.   When I come back to Vegas, I am coming back

p9SG-ZfUfaBjOHBVa8RQDQ.text: Best place for Italian in any part of Vegas!! Service is as awesome as the food!! Capos is the place to go for not only good food, but a good experience. Especially if you're a fan of the "mob"  lifestyle.

9J1AeU99YF97TikvbIl3AA.text: Everything about this restaurant made for an amazing wedding rehearsal dinner. I made reservations a month ago and unfortunately wasn't able to get a private room. Somehow, between then and now, things changed because we ended up in a private room. It was very dark at first, almost too dark to see much of anything, but everyone's eyes adjusted and we were able to see everything fine. The wait staff was attentive and very kind. The food was fantastic and I couldn't have asked for a better experience. If you're looking for a restaurant off the strip and away from the Las Vegas craziness, this is it.

Bc2lTbxyOvKkKbGKhBAr7A.text: This place is gettin added to our date night rotation!  Super fun and super good food (homemade and big portions).  It's a speakeasy style so you have to have a password to get in; but have fun with it.  I had the vegetarian meatball- delicious.  They even have gluten free options.

O_CzaVirdqXf98oDHMCOVg.text: Best entrance in Las Vegas and best meatballs.  And spaghetti.  And well everything.  It's a fun hot spot but mostly it's s great place for dinner.   I wish it wasn't so popular  Desert is great and they always have entertainment A great family restaurant .

NeZiCx1aRFPojnsyunVN7Q.text: Went to Capo's while on business.  Saw on "Man Finds Food."  Mob theme Italian restaurant.  Meatballs and the Al Capone secret sauce are a must order.  Best sauce I've ever tasted.  Our waiter, "The Enforcer" was great and very funny.  When asking for ground pepper, he responded "How about I drop the pepper on the floor, sweep it up and you've got your ground pepper."  Love this place.

7Bqxkwe0_PqzH-69n-x9aQ.text: OMG, the mushroom risotto was to die for!!!!! Will definitely make this a usual stop when in Vegas! Thanks Lau and Shan for the recommendation!!!!!

5Hsaf4VkLMrl7psOD1acRw.text: This place had a great atmosphere. Our server was nice. Food was the best part of it all. We had the chicken parmesan and chicken carbonara, which were flavorful. The mango martini was alright. Overall, this place was great. I would definitely go back

DPT3F9iIH2FkPY553CncUw.text: Capo's has a very cool vibe. It is one of the few restaurants in town that is truly old Vegas. (Others include Piero's, Bootlegger, Hugo's Cellar - all of which I also provided a review of!) Thus Capo's charm makes it a not-to-miss restaurant. The service is stellar every time and you just can't beat the decor combined with the live music playing Sinatra . The food receives 3 stars from me because I'm a total foodie. I judge a restaurant on everything from its bread & butter to the component of every dish. The bread & butter are nothing to shout about here ;) but the dishes are great, meat, sauces, risotto, etc. but they miss out on key components like the vegetables. We both commented we would have preferred fresher less cooked vegetables with our entrees, you can see this in the photos. But all-in-all the food is good and it's a great experience restaurant.
