twYE5gpkEABQZQuMoT3jLQ.text: Fun environment and great service is what gets the 4 stars. Locals get two for one entrees as well which is nice! Love that!  It would have been 5 stars had my pasta been right.  I ordered arriabata penne and it was tasty but clearly sat under a heat lamp or something because the top has sauce on it but it was hardened and dry.  ( we also waited an hour for our food so idk what happened there...)   I'll be back again though for sure to give it another go!

s9nXQjXcOrbdAloXgQzT0Q.text: Have you ever wished you could have been in the movie " Goodfella's?"  Stepping into Capo's it first seems like an old school speak easy.  Upon being seating you feel like Henry Hill!  Recieving tons of attention.   This place is welcoming, warm and quiet enchanting. Live music with singing included  adds to the ambiance! My husband invited the gentleman singer to come over to the table to serenade me, which was very romantic. He has a great table side presence.    The staff is attentive and the food was great with healthy sized portions.    We will definatly return to enjoy another entertaining evening.

VyQMJZ4dS78_QNBF6sRgUA.text: Food was ok, service was extremely slow, and they could not/would not split the bill. This place is not good for groups at all even though the info on Yelp says that it is. On top of that we were required to tip 20% even though the service was horrible. The only plus was our water glasses were always full.

U915xqxazdr4yCjaGQejNw.text: I went to this restaurant for a socializing dinner event. The service was friendly. To enter the restaurant you must ring a doorbell and provide a sarcastic answer to whoever opens the peephole door.  Keep in my this place will not split the check so bring cash or get ready to use Venmo or Cash app with your party.  The food was great. It is a little pricey. Overall, I had good time.

nCc7P40x-xUSkILybI7EHw.text: My hubby took me to Capos for a date night! The Service and food are excellent. I have no complaints, everything couldn't have been more perfect! Just to experience the restaurants environment is already a plus. The moment you walk in, you have no idea what your getting yourself into. Since its a mob theme you walk into a small room with a phone booth and pictures, and when you ring the door bell a man greets you behind a framed picture and a secret door opens up to a beautiful dark romantic room! As your seated a menu with a flashlight is given to you and the atmosphere has a romantic yet mob feeling to it. The Caesar Salad was to die for it was the best Caesar Salad I have ever eaten!! My husband had the "Scarface Shrimp Scampi'" and I Had the Don's Spaghetti." my hubby's was just alright but the Spaghetti was scrumptious! I had the chocolate Martini it was strong, decadent and Delicious! You should make reservations cause this place gets packed!  They also have live entertainment with a piano player and a guy who sings old school songs! Good place to take Baby Boomer Parents! The experience alone is well worth it! We definitely will return!

JVD5Blzj7zCfpChZemJd7w.text: So...it's been almost a month since my most recent visit and my anger is finally starting to subside long enough for me to update my past review for this place. I should also note that I have eaten at Capo's (both locations) many times since my first review. It had become a place we take out of town guests, celebrate birthdays, and basically go for our "favorites" on "just because nights". I have also recommended this restaurant to everyone I encounter that is looking for a great experience and great meal. Well, that is now in the past.  When Valentines Day started to approach this year Capos was the front runner for our night out. We made reservations two weeks in advance and then about a week before we called to add another couple to our guest count. We were all so excited and looking forward to it!! Both people on the phone were very nice and we added to our reservation with ease. We always order the same things when we go and we were looking forward to sharing the evening with good friends.  When we arrived we were quickly led to our table. As we settled into our table we realized that a paper menu had been placed in front of us as opposed to the regular one. When the back server came to the table first to fill our water glasses we told him that we were not given menus. He began to tell us that the regular menu was not available that evening and the paper menu was the one that was. I quickly glanced at the menu noticing that our favorite dishes were no where to be found. It was clear that this was a special "set menu" with of course, inflated prices. When the server approached our table we asked politely if we could speak to a manager. Several minutes later a woman approached our table, presumably the manager. I began to explain that we had come to enjoy their wonderful regular menu and were disappointed that in the two phone conversations I had making the reservations NO ONE had told us that a limited menu would be served that night.  Ok...breathe....  The woman responded not with an apology or an offer of a solution, but rather, with insult to myself and my guests. She said that "we" should have just expected that because of the holiday there would be a set menu. She continued to explain that they had called many other restaurants in the area and that "80% of them were offering the same thing". To add further insult, she then pointed around the room at the other tables and said, "no one else seems to have a problem with it". That was it. That was the moment when Capo's went from my favorite restaurant in the city to one I will never eat at again. My party and I got up and left of course and ended up at another great family owned, Italian restaurant in town where we enjoyed a wonderful four course meal with great wine, fantastic homemade food, and great friends.  I have been in the food and beverage industry for 13 years and I was completely shocked by how a manager could treat guests. Also, if you are going to have a "set menu" on a particular night, then fine, but inform your guests. To be quite honest, had we been told during the reservation process of the limited menu would would have just made a reservation for the following night (we were all off from work the next night too and the chance to order all of the stuff we come back for would have been worth waiting a day)

2ihZlgWOUqzbTMAnlW2fkQ.text: I love Capo's for there food and atmosphere. The place is a little pricey for your everyday eating habits, but great for a special occasion. The set up is cool too. I do however like the one on Tropicana better.

eXinPz6p7-j8KSEFcC7rcw.text: Came here on Saturday night for my mom's birthday. It was our first time here as we were visiting from out of town and it was such an awesome experience. You have to ring a doorbell before you walk in and once you enter there is dim lighting, a guy singing, and an overall fun atmosphere. The staff was really friendly and attentive. The dark lighting makes it hard to read the menus but good thing they have flashlights inside. Definitely try the salad with the garlic dressing it is so delicious. I got the arrabiata pasta and added a meatball and was so disappointed our hotel didn't have a fridge because I would have loved to eat the left overs. This is a great place to go for a date or as a group. Even though it is a little off the strip it is totally worth it for the great experience. Capo's is definitely a place I will be returning to next time I am in Vegas. We also made reservations..not sure if it is required but I would definitely recommend it. We arrived about 15 minutes before our reservation time and were immediately seated.

xQnlR-hsNRCHVtZM8-QNAA.text: the best tiramisu i have had outside of italy, but the service was horrible! our waitress couldnt be bothered and then we were over charged. we waited to talk to her about out the bill, but she never came back. if i lived in vegas i would have gone back to talk to the manager.

X3_uyB_rfHRn_MLLFn0mtQ.text: i have been going to CAPOS for 7 years {was there last night} and can honestly say its the best authentic mob themed restaurant in Las Vegas. From the moment you ring the buzzer "its a speakeasy entry" you are transported to the glamourous days when the mob ran things. The food is excellent and tastes even better with a professional crooner singing Sinatra and Martin table side. if your looking for a taste of "Old Vegas" this place is a must! That simple

JRYeky4A4NRkWvvv_oavyg.text: Had a wonderful time on a Saturday Evening! I reserved a booth about 24 hours prior to our visit on opentable.com website and we got right in. I was surprised I got the booth I requested and had no waiting. My group dressed up for the mob look and played along with the door man and staff. We told the doorman we were with the Chicago outfit and wanted to feed our appetites, NOW! Since we did have reservations, we got right in and were treated with kind respect. We had wonderful service and no complaints. The menu lights were fine but I brought my own lights just for fun. The food was above average and the desserts were to die for so save room. I had the Lasagna and enjoyed the heart of it but I moved the marinara sauce to one side. It was too garlic tasting for my liking but the Lasagna was great. For dessert we had a chocolate mud cake, canoli and cheesecake. All were fantastic in that order. The singer was good and friendly and will take requests within the line of Sinatra songs. Have him sing one for your sweetheart. You have to try this dining experience but please people, dress up and play along with them for ultimate enjoyment. The more you are prepared for this place the more fun it will be. Let your hair down and enjoy the Italian speakeasy atmospere. I feel like they improved thier food and service since some of the past negitive surveys listed some issues at that time. Try it, you'll like it.

J6isdWbJEraQBPb_BKT4mA.text: Excellent restaurant which serves fresh food with authentic imported Italian pasta. The atmosphere was great, food fresh and delicious. I ordered a glass of Chianti which turned out of a pretty generous size. I swear they pour half of the bottle! Nice surprise! Our server was friendly and laid back. I travel to Italy every year and consider myself a good judge of authentic Italian cuisine. Capos did not disappoint my expectations. Highly recommend

_dncCJm2oR61EPqr349TEg.text: DO NOT GO HERE. The service is beyond terrible, they will literally screw you if you're not a local. 2 for 1 Tuesday's?  Not unless you're local, or a party of 6 or less, and THEY DON'T TELL YOU THIS UNTIL YOU GET THE BILL. Not to mention the fact that the food takes over an hour to get to the table. The ambience is cute. The food is decent.  But they not only don't give a shit about their customers, they will absolutely take advantage of them. Please don't give this establishment your business.

tDvQNgTxhQESyyDBPALWcw.text: I really wanted to give Capo's a better rating, but I just couldn't.  The lobby and greeting were very unique and fun.  The ambiance in the restaurant was fun and interesting. Yes it was dark , but that was ok. Bathrooms are one person only and small , but again that's ok.  The meal.  First , we were on time for our reservation and our table was open , but we had to sit at the bar for 10 minutes, just enough time to order a drink which the tab had to be closed out before going to the table. My GF order one of their specialty cocktails, it was good. I asked for a glass of the house Chianti, the barmaid said they did not have one. Ok, I will wait and order something at the table.  Once seated we were give the menu's with the flashlights, well one of the two had flashlights, and a wine list. Sure enough on the first page was a list of wine's by the glass and there was a Chianti.......sigh.... It was tasty and I had two of them.  The menu was creative with all of the mob names. The bread was great , hot and fresh, but then you had to struggle with the butter in the little foil packets.  Both of our salads had potential, but ended up being a little watery. She likes Ranch, not on the Capo's list.  The calamari was very tasty, fried with some hot peppers and dipping sauce like Outbacks Bloomin Onion sauce.  For dinner we went with the basics  Her Lasagna was ok , very cheesy , and a bit over cooked.  My spaghetti was cooked fine, it was just smother in red sauce and the kitchen sprinkled Parmesan cheese on it for me... I did not ask for it and I do not normally put it on my pasta.  On the upside the Italian sausage I added to the dish was pretty good.  We did not have dessert.  Service throughout the dinner was good  They called a cab for us and let me know when it arrived.  The bill for two drinks each and dinner was $86.00 plus tip  So the rating was more for the food then the rest of the dining experience.  I do not see myself going back, to many other places to try

6DNi_VQorZoGUvc_b5Fnlw.text: Great food, service and amazing atmosphere.  Not to mention the 2 for 1 cocktails on Fridays.  It is dark inside, but that adds to the atmosphere.  It was very Goodfellas.

zKKSdgz0UlH5hNXYSwyVEg.text: Always good, always unique. Veal Marsala tonight with the mushroom risotto is amazing.

Tp16jFeW6QohRY625ft5jw.text: Went here after a wedding with about 27 guests and they for sure have the "we don't really care if you like us or not" vibe. The theme was pretty neat but it was so dark you had to use a flashlight to see the menu which they do have attached but only about 25% of them work so make sure your phone is charged. We came during happy hour and they told all of us it did not apply to us because we were too big of a party. Needless to say, I think 2 people ordered a $8 beer but they could have made much more money off us if they allowed the happy hour for the last 30 minutes there was left to encourage more drinking during the meal. Food was super overpriced for what you get. Don't get me wrong, it tasted good but I can make a pasta meal at home that's just as good for $20 for 5 people as opposed to $20-$30/plate. They don't split checks, so come with cash and if you want to split a meal with someone expect to pay $6 more.

xcN8xFwximF6T_iiXGHTfw.text: Driving up to this place I thought that I was in for a typcial 'mom and pop' type of dining experience. Once inside the first door I was a little disturbed... Let's just say that it was a good type of disturbed. Chicago Mafia-Style all the way. You get screened prior to entering in a rather fun kind of way. Once seated it was hard to admire the appointments. I'm telling you it was so dark that they literally have flashlights tied to the menus so that you can read them. That was kind of cool and romantic since I was trying to be all cuddly with my sweetie (for the night anyway). LOL Back to the review. I ordered the pecan crusted Chilean Sea Bass. It was the best that I've ever had. Who'd of thought that that far away from the ocean would be the best cut of bass one can find? It was LARGE too. The service was spectacular. The entertainment had a old school Italian feel as the singer was walking around engaging the customers while dining. It was a very cool experience. So, if you're in Vegas and want to get off of the beaten path and away from the colon locking buffets.. Try this place out and be amazed!

4PLWteV7vAkL4usRCu9POA.text: the food was really good and the atmosphere was very mob like overall it was a nice experience, the chicken piccata and parmesan along with the meatballs was worth ordering again

cFXUAjgz7D7Q6lB63WcsEw.text: I thought long and hard before I left this review, because I was conflicted....I had probably the worst service I've ever had in my life at Capo's, We had a large party (15 people) and were completely ignored for most of the night.  With that said, I still had to love the place.  The atmosphere here is incredible, I felt like I had stepped into time when the mob ran Vegas.  The food was great and so were the drinks.  The manager ended up taking 50% off of our bill, so they redeemed themselves with that.  I will go back to Capo's and I'm actually looking forward to it!

yrd4hwenQd4Vzud4cGk2qg.text: Let's say no stars whatsoever, shall we? "Capo's is a must"? A must to avoid!  This qualifies as the all-time-worst restaurant or entertainment experience -- and this in more than  35 years of fine-dining experiences all over the world. In fact, it has a unique distinction: it is the first time a party of which I was a member was given the bum's rush. We were as good as ordered out of the restaurant (no weapons in evidence, however). This, for having the temerity to criticize the food when asked!  Here's the rundown. We were three, out for a night on the town and straight from the (soon-to-be landmark) Don Rickles show at the Orleans. We had determined to have dinner at Capo's since a member of the group recommended it. We arrived at about 10 p.m. on March 21, were seated promptly, and ordered enough food and drink to account for a check of more than $200 (we hadn't ordered dessert yet).  After a wait of more than 25 minutes between the first and second courses, we received our entrees: chicken parmigiana, manicotti with eggplant, and veal piccata. The unifying factor among three disparate plates was that all were overcooked. We each took a few bites of our dishes, discussed our disappointment, and then the server arrived. It was as if he heard us, which was unlikely, given the ambient din. We made our complaints known. The one of us who had ordered the manicotti then told him: "Look, I know how this was prepared, and it wasn't prepared properly. It was made and served in the same sizzle-tray, so the cheese is now burned onto the bottom of the metal plate!"  (For what it is worth, the diner with this specific criticism is a chef at a well-known kitchen in a Las Vegas fine-dining restaurant a few cuts above this red-sauce Italian place.)  Two waiters who heard our complaints seemed sympathetic but somewhat disbelieving, saying, "Whatever, we want to make it right, OK?  How about some beverages and dessert on us?" We agreed; they took our orders and had the table cleared. I had eaten three bites of the toughest veal on record, covered in a gelatinous, objectionably flavored piccata sauce.  As we settled back, there was another figure at our table, questioning us excitedly, a minion at his side moving the table. The questioner, incongruously dressed in the distressed jeans and screen-printed,  long-sleeved T-shirt of an aging hipster, demanded to know why we were still sitting there if nothing had  met with our approval. "I don't want you in  this place if you're unhappy! Why don't you leave!"  So we did. We were met at the door by the maitre d', who was perplexed at our abrupt departure. He claimed not to recognize from our description who might have demanded our ouster.  However, no one was more surprised, perplexed, feeling ill-used -- to say nothing of hungry -- than we were. Not only won't we be back, but we doubt anyone each of the three of us knows will cast shadows on these dark doorsteps.

HRT_iLkGxcaCw6YVIjObtA.text: Boyfriend and I were trying to figure out what to eat all night, so we decided to use yelp to assist us. We found this place and decided to give it a shot. When we first entered the restaurant, it felt like as if I was in the twilight zone ride in Disney California adventure (the elevator). we were pretty much boxed in in a really dim room with posters hanging off each wall. We did not know where the door was. Long story short I got scared but the environment was great! Old fashion Italian style restaurant I'm assuming with all the dim lights and wonderful Frank Sinatra type music playing. THEY EVEN HAD A LIVE SINGER SINGING!! That's a plus.       The servers and managers were phenomenal!! **If you expect to be in a restaurant where everything is perfect, please don't come here. The employees and managers do talk and hang around and watch tv..going back to the "more old fashion Italian" style? But nonetheless I LOVEDDD it there. The food was great, everyone had a sense of humor. We left the restaurant laughing which was a great way to end our night.

kBQh5lWqLR_9WkYfOwfIow.text: Heard good things about this place. My first impressions of the cool entrance and atmosphere inside were great. Then for the most important parts of a reataurant, the food and service...it took about 45 minutes for our 2 dishes to come out and we had to flag down someone each time we needed refills on our waters. Then the food finally came out...lasagna and shrimp scampi...2 of the most recommended dishes from the staff. The scampi had clearly been sitting under the lamp for a long time and was hard and crusty on top and the shrimp was rubbery and dry. It looked nothing at all like all the delicious pictures in reviews on yelp. It was simply a pile of butter with hard angel hair and over done shrimp with a touch of spiciness. No lemon or garlic flavor at all like the menu said. The lasagna was also very dry. The server was nice but was very busy and kind of forced to  neglect us as we were only a party of 2 and he had a huge party of 14 come in right after us. The manager was hanging out at the bar sipping wine the whole night while our server who seemed to be the only one working was running his ass off. Then we had to wait about 10 minutes after our plates we're cleared just to get our bill. $56 for 2 dishes and no alcohol. Waaaaaay overpriced for such bad food. Won't be going back. Great atmosphere and all but horrible food and service and way overpriced. They nailed everything except the 2 most important parts of a restaurant, the food and service. 2 stars just because I loved the entrance and atmosphere. If there were separate categories to rate I would give this 5 stars and the food and service 0 stars.

IR4fCdAbIMdIg4IEjHuHpQ.text: FYI   I went to the Tropicana location but it was closed.  I spoke with someone who was cleaning there and he told me that the owner had closed it and was re-opening it as a Mexican restaurant called Baja Cantina, after some renovations.   I went  to the Sahara location it was very good, it was my first time and the experience was great.  The restaurant has the same speakeasy entrance and the restaurant inside is beautiful. The bar was full and the dining area busy.  I had a drink and the meatball app, it was even better than at Tropicana!  I will  miss the Tropicana location, but I will certainly enjoy this place as well!

N63B2DjWS9RxZYJ52r0tmA.text: A good example of a restaurant that has so much potential, so many positives that it should have no problem sitting comfortably at 5 stars ...but, apparently the whole place, from management to staff, doesn't care one lick what you think about their place.  The food is great - five star for sure - but sloppily prepared, way overpriced and presented with an air of arrogance and intimidation.  As if the whole place was saying " Don't you know who we are, were Capo's you ungrateful little punk. Now, sit down, shut up and eat your dinner or we're gonna come over here and make you."  Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to get ready for some thick necked guys in really nice silk suits that are going to be paying me a visit real soon.

eAb7bsJH7H5shJuHEn0sEw.text: This will probably be the new date night place for me and the hubs.  I had the chicken Marsala with mushroom risotto and it was delicious.  I also really liked the salad with creamy garlic dressing. They don't have a kids meal which was fine because they will do half orders for them or they can split a meal.  Will for sure be going back!

gxl9t7ZlMYnrhmpG1iabiQ.text: This is easily the best experience I've ever had at a restaurant.  Before you go in, you should make a reservation...and you'll find out why (is fun).  The food was all homemade including the pasta. A huge variety, including their secret sauce, appetizers, and a great wine list.   Simply awesome!

U8n6XlgkT-aKPSTJeqGOVw.text: FINALLY SOME REAL ITALIAN FOOD IN VEGAS :D Believe me we have had everything from $-$$$$ Italian here in Vegas. Call ahead and make reservations. It's an experience just walking through the door :) I will not post a spoiler :)  Sit back and relax, everything is very carefully made to order and extremely fresh.  Yes it has very low lighting and yes it has a piano playing man singing karaoke machine microphone songs but his voice is very good, so no worries. It is True about there being small LED lights attached to the menu so you can use them if needed.  Every dish we had was spot on and the house Merlot was really amazing. Our waitress was smiley and nice and she did not come to the table much, only when needed, I like that!  We started after being greeted with water as we still had our Merlot from the bar area. (Bartenders are pretty ladies in black tiny corsets. Very nice and complimented me!)  Started with house loaf of fresh baked sourdough/Italian/French type of bread. Firm on outside and airy on inside (my fav kind) the butter that came with it was flavored with garlic, chive and possibly sage.  We ordered everything at once, we knew what we wanted :)  We started with Bruschetta and yummmmmm it was a treat! Fresh and chilled it seemed like a fresh Italian salsa almost! It was the perfect blend of garlic, fresh tomatoes, basil, EVOO, balsamic and a tiny bit of parm maybe. The bread was the same only toasted and looked brushed prior to toast with butter? Hubby had a Caeser salad which was perfect (not too much anchovies) and fresh with just the right amount of dressing! Our friend he had a house with Blue Cheese and it was gone before I could try (my fav thing is BC) and he said it was perfect :) When I ordered a really always do salad but the soup was calling my name, thank goodness I asked her what it was and if she likes it, she said "it's very popular and very good" sold! The soup is a creamy tomato base soup with white bean and small pene like noodles, if I had a grilled cheese......it would be heaven on earth. Not too many beans, not too many noodles a dash of fine grated cheese on top. Perfect.   Between courses it's very relaxed and the dim lighting is sooooo nice. We sat in a booth straight across from the entrance area (the place is large) and hubby sat in the middle inside the booth.  He mentioned "a real boss knows to always have your back, as in you sit against the wall :)" as he said that I noticed all the mirrors above the booth :)  You just feel Goodfellas. Even the door guy is a "tough guy" and comes out of the back "slapping shut" the check holders about once every half hour :)  After ordering another glass of wine and enjoying each others company here come our entrees :)  Our friend had chicken parm with the side of pasta spaghetti and gravy it usually comes with. He said it was wonderful.  Hubby had the veal parm a beautiful cutlet smothered with gravy and mozzarella and instead of the pasta he got garlic mash. We are garlic lovers and warning IN EVERYTHING THERE IS A LOT :) not too much for us. (yes there is a toooo much)  The garlic mash was a fresh skin on garlic, butter, a dash of cream, thick mash. It was how I make mine and it was delish.  I ordered veal picatta. It was a thin cutlet not coated but very very tender in a heavenly picatta. A perfect blend of white wine, butter, EVOO, capers and just a dash of parsley. For my sub out of pasta I had mushroom risotto, it was EXTREMELY rich and creamy, on the firm side and full of fresh parm. The side dish dipped in my buttery dish wow................just wow.  Slowly but gracefully we tried each others yumm'd and ahhhh'd......and at the end we forgot we were told to "try the chocolate cannolis"   She came by and we were all stuffed and happy but I asked anyway "how big and how many are in an order lol". She said "just two and about like this" (maybe 4") Cannolis were divine!!!!!! Perfect, rich crispy, creamy.  That was our experience! We were told about this place from Brian (owner of Wing King) who had his birthday dinner there the other night.  That's our experience! PS when I say gravy I mean tomato sauce :) Portions are large so I would split if you get an app. But always save room for a bite of cannoli!!!!!  I'm so glad we came. I LOVE THIS PLACE! Next time I want to order a vegetarian dish that I saw and try a different app.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chocolate cannoli we already already started to torture lol
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. veal parm with a side of garlic mash
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. veal picatta with side of mushroom risotto

McO-2leHletf48nDtXTVyw.text: Atmosphere: (0-5) 5; being in a mob movie scene; hidden entrance, dark dining floor, even staff put an accent to add a bit more taste to the environment. Service: (0-5) 5; super friendly Taste: (0-5) 5 Price: $$ + 1/2 of $; if I did not have 'groupon' deal, it would have been a bit more than I expected.  If someone were to ask me where would you go; olive garden or capo's?  My answer would be capo's. The pasta was cooked al dante. Sauce was integrated so nicely. Staff was super friendly. Even iced tea seemed to be brewed as needed bases. Bread was fresh. Nothing but good comments here.

9uGqwGuiUMaFaJHsklFEyw.text: Service at the bar was a bit shaky to say the least. Bartender was new and was not on her game. I am getting a bit tired of people being put into service when they are not trained properly or are not knowledgable on all aspects of the menu. Food was standard Italian fare. Good Sugo. Nice wine list. (A bit pricy).  Definitely take advantage of the two for one Tuesday dinners. It's actually just a $20 discount off your bill. So a bit misleading. But still it got me in the door.

keg-telp3jKLyYr_wsQzfQ.text: When I arrived at Capos I was shocked to see that the entrance was sort of hidden in the back of the building. But once inside, the experience immediately started. Wow! I will not tell you how the entrance is but you must go to find out! After we entered, we had to wait 10 minutes for a reservation we were 5 minutes early too. Not a big deal but was a little annoying. Once seated, the atmosphere was very pleasant. Live Italian entertainment, friendly service, romantic design. They even had a very good magician going table to table performing incredible Magic tricks. That was the highlight of the night for me. The guy was phenomenal. After we were entertained to a magic show, our food had arrived. I ordered the Chicken Parm & it was absolutely fantastic. My date and I split some calamari as a starter which was top of the line as well. Overall, this place was awesome. I highly recommend checking it out for a date or a group dinner.

IpZrR2zw7qwc8cMG6ftN1g.text: Excellent food and atmosphere! Pasta was al dente, great taste, and a light sauce. Desserts were excellent and the wine as well without being ridiculously expensive.

sfzHeRNxHGGeuUXOZNfSDA.text: This is by far my favorite restaurant in Vegas. It's set up like a speak easy. The lighting is very dim and romantical. The cheesy lounge singer is hilarious... walking around acting like a drunk Dean Martin. The food is out of this world good!! And their sangria is bomb!! I love love love this restaurant.

_oiI6fhSTCvYRhH6DKtJ4Q.text: I finally checked out all the hype about Capos and had the time of my life with our group. My boyfriend's from Chicago and he really loved the Speakeasy vibe. Truly old school.   We started with the CALAMARI which was golden brown with a nice crisp yet tender in the center. The marinara was tangy and in perfect combo with the calamari. Then after hearing so much about the MEATBALLS, our group got 3 orders and I must say they were the best meatballs anyone's ever tasted!! A little pricey at $12 but worth every penny!!  Service was rushed but the place was packed so we enjoyed the live entertainment while we waited a bit for our entrees. My boyfriend's STEAK was awesome and perfectly cooked. My SAUSAGE and PEPPERS was as I remembered from my last trip to Chicago... Delicious!!!  Overall I would have given Capos 5 stars if the service wasn't so rushed but this was by far the best dinner our group had over a weeks stay in Las Vegas.   I definitely will be returning and sending friends!!

QCFLDbx_WZpSvbeyHqtouQ.text: This place has the best meatball ever!!! Host was a bit moody, but beyond that the food was excellent. Not a big fan of their salad, it was very boring and dressing wasn't good, but soup was delicious! My husband and I shared the meatball appetizer. Two huge meatballs, but still wanted more! My husband had the steak, he said it was so-so.. I had the penne with arrabiata sauce, it was spicy and flavorful, Yum!!!

9feeB5tYo8NEs8BA90NVRw.text: We were promptly seated as we entered for a dinner reservation at 6:30. Service was exceptional as well as the food. Our waiter, Jeremy, remained attentive throughout our entire meal. The steak was cooked a perfect medium rare. The veal, chicken and pasta dishes were fabulous as well. The cannoli for dessert was excellent!  Would definitely return.

8IT9MvNpMz3fjiP3zDppFw.text: First time at Capo's tonight.  Two year residents :)  LOVE this place.  Love the dark room/booths/singer/host/server - all of it.  The food is great.  We are East Coasters - (NJ) so we know a little about NY and good Italian.  The meatballs are GREAT!  The Angels with Dirty Faces - angel hair, peas, mushrooms and pepperoni is fantastic!  Husband had the lasagna and LOVED it.  Cocktails were on the money - not watered down.  Had a Banango (banana/mango) martini made by "B".  Was delicious!!! Service was spectacular.  Was my birthday and they all made me feel like famiglia!!  Ask for B as your server - he was so welcoming, attentive - just a great guy!!!  They surprised me with free cannoli for desert - dipped in chocolate and a custard filling - ON THE MONEY!  We will be back - love being locals!  Thank you for such a wonderful night!!

xk9_fPcnmE6xWtUtyfY3UQ.text: This place was an absolute good find. I ordered their house special meat balls and the lasagna. Expect Live singing and piano playing with Frank Sinatra songs. Ambience of the mafia. Have an open mind, go outside the box. Take yourself out of the Las Vegas strip and visit this place. Use Yelp check in for $10 discount.

GnL9FLHp7SMXbOCKR-bDEw.text: You will be in for a treat. This place is a must go to. Food is fantastic. Live music is great. Atmosphere and Ambiance is very nice but be prepared because so will be the bill. I enjoyed the evening and will be back.

zdFNOPRrBwJsfRauvM2BSw.text: This restaurant now is on my "must visit" list for Vegas aficionados. I went as part of a group of 5 this past weekend and was thrilled by the experience. From the time you knock on the door to enter the restaurant, you feel like you have been transported back to someone's dream of old Vegas, complete with dark lighting and a Frank Sinatra-style crooner. The food is much better than it needs to be for a theme restaurant like this one. (I would give the food 3.5 stars by itself.) Everyone enjoyed their meal, and the enormous meatballs were a big hit. The singer engaged the audience in his performance and even invited a couple members of our party to sing along with one of the songs. He also took the time to talk with people at various tables in between songs. If you haven't been to Capo's, I highly suggest that you check it out. I plan on bringing all future out-of-town visitors to this gem of a restaurant. The prices seemed reasonable, too. If you go Sunday-Thursday, you also can buy a certificate on restaurant.com and get $50 worth of food for $25.

Lxx44MwkAclO5ZNXyClYjQ.text: Recently attended a Chicagoans in the Desert holiday dinner there- Wow! From the moment I stepped in the cozy place, I felt like I was back home in my Italian neighborhood in ChiTown. Once the food came, I didn't want to leave...the freshness of the salad & tasty dressing, the thick perfectly seasoned pasta sauce & the highlight for me was the meatballs- it was like my Mom came down from heaven & was in the kitchen preparing dinner for us- PRICELESS!!! Add to that a phenomenal table side Magician and a live singer, who I thought was a Dean Martin soundtrack playing and the friendliest staff in town & you have a night spent back in the old neighborhood!

8T64cm56U-gyZ6JDTIHblA.text: Jen was very a die hard Habs fan and being a hockey fan myself, it was an incredible experience. The food was amazing. Service was unreal. Angels with dirty faces Hit the spot and I had to get bread to scoop the leftover sauce with. Will definitely be returning next time I'm in LV

pmMwLL5oSFBTsnf3PFHSsw.text: It's pretty dark inside the atmosphere was great mob style and the food was delicious....I will be back

U_x1cR5NFmtZrPKgMXkIVA.text: Food is always awesome and love having the live music. Makes for a romantic night any time!

0ty9Hh7SAL2PCtDA4NGblw.text: I went here for my daughter's birthday because she was in the mood for some Italian food. All I have to say is, why had I never heard of this place before? From the moment we walked in what a great experience. The restaurant has a speakeasy mobster feel. The had a guy singing and another one doing magic tricks. Not to mention the food was amazing. We all added the meatballs to our dish at the advice of our waiter yummm!

i2aicnFoyV8hChT79UErRA.text: My sister recommended this restaurant and insisted that not only was the food delicious but the atmosphere and vibe were very relaxed. I went for my birthday and was serenaded by the singer who made all of the patrons feel special.  The menu had dishes named after mobsters and there were old mob movies playing on the tv screens. The food was absolutely delicious. I ordered Dino's deep fried ravioli as an appetizer and then I ordered Fredo's Alfredo (w/shrimp) for my entree. The shrimp were huge and well cooked. The Alfredo sauce livened up after I added the fresh Parmesan that I was given. I don't have a refined palette so I'm used to jarred Alfredo lol  Absolutely amazing and I would definitely frequent this establishment again.

sROApiMCdhL4aCVtU2lt8w.text: Interesting place to say the least. I enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. It wasn't the nicest place as far as cleanliness. But it was a good experience. And it's all about how the place makes you feel.

U_YPLBkwgzTilcthE9yKyg.text: This is the real deal.  The food is delicious along with a waiter playing the mobster part. There was also a piano bar with a Frank Sinatra Style singer. I was really impressed. The best part was the ambiance. It felt like we were at a real speakeasy. It will not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simply amazing spaghetti

rMQjBShDU3PmRCXULBxw1A.text: This is my all time favorite place to eat!!!!! My husband and i went here during one of our many trips to Vegas.  From the outside it doesn't look like anything too special but that almost adds to its charm.  You enter though a secret door like the old school mob movies. It has a very intimate feeling when you walk in. Seating is private and comfortable,Live music that was AMAZING.. walks up to the table to sing to you but not too much. So for me the atmosphere and service was already giving them major points in my book.  Now the food ... WOWWWW We started with the meatballs as an appetizer,best meatballs I have ever had, and I even loved the red sauce it was in( i'm super picky because my family makes our own) The pasta we ordered tasted homemade and fresh, so  amazing. we each got a diff pasta and we both loved each.The pricing is great!!  service is top notch reminded me of eating at Mortins Steakhouse but a much for nostalgic experience. We had such a great time dining we didn't want to leave so moved over to the bar area where we continued to listed to songs we loved from our fav Frank Sinatra and others from that era. Since going the first time we have made this a MUSt stop on each of our other Vegas vacations we have taken and will continue to keep coming back.

0EOUwzSGmyUImvr7ylZjsA.text: First time at Capos tonight and it was amazing! It's an old school mob themed restaurant which was super cool. I would recommend making reservations before going. When you first walk in your in a small room and you have to ring a bell which after the host opens a secret window to ask who sent you! We had reservations for 6:15PM and were able to sit down within 10 mins. There is a small bar to sit at also which if you sit there your able to see the chefs cook in front of you. Our server was so polite and gave us awesome recommendations. I ended up getting the spaghetti with meat sauce (huge portion) and a side salad. It was definitely the best spaghetti I've ever had. No dessert for us this time due to be over full from the bread they bring out before your meal arrives. Most definitely will be returning to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meat sauce
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side salad that came with my meal

XHV1vQr-1pD05fruBzCF9Q.text: Vinnie allla vodka is deeeelish!     Can't wait to come back!!   Plus ladies drink for free on Thursdays!

YVTlOn6GpQn0sUgoszmzbg.text: We had seen the episode of 'Man Finds Food' on the Travel Channel in which Adam Richman visited Capo's and so we had to try it for ourselves.  We can NOT say enough about how good the food and service was!  We shared the meatballs appetizer, the Eggplant Parmesan with Risotto and the infamous "Leftovers" which is not on the menu so you have to ask for it. Each item was truly delicious and prepared perfectly.  We have never had better Italian food ANYWHERE!  And the family red sauce that is featured on several items?  We were left speechless it was so good...We have never tasted a red sauce so good.  The service was top-notch with warm and friendly (an VERY attentive) employees.  This will now be on our list of "Must visits" from now on whenever we are in the area!

sCWnRjNfd7ehkOx0BBZOSQ.text: Excellent. Came here for the hubby's bday. Great food. I got chicken parm. He got chicken Anastasia. Both if us really enjoyed our food. Got the mushroom risotto and side of pasta. Very impressive. Make sure you have the password to get in.

BDP4M7HiZpRN94nxlqy2TA.text: Atmosphere was unique, we enjoyed it - from the secret door to the piano player. Service was good, attentive and personable. That's where it ends.  Went with my son for a special evening out, very bad decision.  Ceasar salads were drab, over garlicky. They must have been prepared for a while - very limp and lifeless. I had about 3 bites of mine.  The veal parmesan was completely over cooked, over-breaded, drowning in sauce and cheese -terrible. Raviolis were chewy, salty in a watery red sauce.  Plus side - cheesy garlic bread was good.  Maybe it's because I travel, dine frequently in SF, Chicago, NYC - very much enjoy good. Definitely not here, will not come back or recommend.  Left hungry and unsatisfied, home to a bowl of cereal and bed.

__1QnVEBT7rS3NXLYt9u-w.text: Deliciosa and such fun. A fantastic start to our groups "mob" /rock n roll themed vacay. We'd never tried pasta fazul which is a fabulous soup. I had the marvelous Gotta artichoke chicken dish, the mashed potatoes were perfect. My husband stuffed himself on lasagna and our guests loved the steaks. Servings plentiful.  Atmosphere gangsta fantasy. The Sinatra singer and magician frequented our table making us feel special and part of the family.  We were headed to the Vegas mob museum which is a don't miss the next morning so this was the perfect way to take us back in culinary time.  Food perfect.  Staff helpful, friendly while the greeter was in thuggery mode to set the tone.  Every dish exquisite.  Diet? Fuhgedabowdit. Order the cannoli. ..even if you gotta take it to go.

lfEisAW7LeqUWgS_6Ob9zQ.text: If you're craving for a fancy italian comfort food, then this is your perfect place! My boyfriend's dad took me and my bf to this place for dinner, and it was def a lot of fun. It started with finding the main entrance or the real one i must say and getting greeted by a scary host at the front.   They have delicious food and great wine list! I love the live music and the magic tricks that will def blow your mind away! I definitely recommend this to everyone! Not only this restaurant is very historic, it also serves delicious food and great entertainment. It's 3 in 1 so i must say very worth the visit!   (Just dont be fooled on how it looks outside, you'll be surprise once you're inside!!!)

Wg_KPAMu1GRziiNJ1g8d-w.text: Really great spot with excellent food and ambiance.  Service was and everyone had a new york accent.  Old school Italian steakhouse with big leather clamshell booths.  Definitely worth the 10 minute trip off the strip!

KvQrnPHaeu8TALJj8nBgPg.text: Our first time here, without a reservation, but ok, anyways, here's the scoop. The food here is dynamite! The service is top notch and the atmosphere is well, mafia. It's nice in a you're a part of the family kinda way. No problem. We sat at the bar, because, no reservation. Next time, we're going to bring friends. This is going to be our Italian place from now on. It's that good.

Z1cR2qFTYXly3tVkkDvp0w.text: Everything we got was bomb: bread, Caesar salad, cheese garlic bread, veggie meatball, scarface shrimp scampi and the eggplant Parmesan. A lot of food.  Live singer during dinner. Speak easy dark venue feel. A lot of fun.  I would definitely go back.

xj1ykgSTP8DIvguEcIKedA.text: Went here for a first date on Memorial Day. There was a live singer playing the piano while we ate our meal. The service was EXECELLENT. This restaurant reminded me of my days living in Brooklyn. It's got that "New York" feel about it. AND the food was great! 5 stars!

QyecR1wuVQFoFpLIRUNY3g.text: The food here is just amazing!! I had the tortellini special with Diablo sauce. The tortellini was so soft and delicious I couldn't stop eating. My son had the steak and it was superb. It was perfectly cooked and seasoned. As always, the garlic bread with cheese is a must have! The ambiance is great for a date night, with a musician playing a piano and low lighting.

IYnC3pu_4FhsA6_NlnXZRQ.text: This place is fun, love the concept. The front door experience is the best, got to try it. The drink pours are not great but hey it's all about margins right! The Caesar salad was made with shredded lettuce really good. My rib eye steak was cooked to the correct temp but the meat quality was average.   The roving entertainment was a little awkward but all in good fun, playing classic rat pack songs. I will head back here sometime in the near future, I'm a local but if your on the strip and growing tired of getting fleeced by the high prices jump a Uber and try this spot you'll dig it

n3bvMjyUeIp6hVhcwWCvfg.text: So this place kinda looks sketchy on the outside. I almost didn't even want to go inside. When you first walk through the door it's a black room and they greet you with the little sliding door compartment like in a mafia movie. First thing I hear "how many?! You got a reservation?!" I was really taken back because you're in this dark room and there's just someone screaming at you. Also, I didn't not know this place was mobster themed beforehand.  The only option we had was to sit at the bar, which is fine with us. They had live music and an extensive menu. I ended up getting a dish with linguine and clams with white sauce. Let me tell you, this is my favorite Italian dish in general....and it was amazing here! The turtle cheesecake wasn't that great. But I would definitely come back here for the pasta!

YEQgfeYCtIO6ixWw9VlFhw.text: Fantastic authentic best Italian in Vegas! Atmosphere like an old speakeasy. You'll love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

54XzoNnfPotzkm2E99mpgA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE it! Authentic Italian decor Service was amazing and food delicious. Our waiter and his help were friendly & attentive

2DzAsGH9jDKfa6MZpQ7vOw.text: My favorite place in Las Vegas.  Excellent meatballs with a delicious sugo sauce.  Pasta dishes are delectable.  Service is top shelf and the people are very nice.  Live music most nights.  you can't go wronng.

ic8ViusIdEVBDSog7YBg0w.text: I really love the ambiance of this place. The secret entrance is really cute and "if your lucky" the guy will ask you what the password is. He decided to skip us on that but ask the group after us. The service was friendly and fun. The live music was a plus, but where they sat us I couldn't see the piano or singer and there were free booths available near. The bread was fresh and delicious.   The calamari we ordered as our appetizer was hot and delicious and plentiful. The marinara was some of the best I have ever had! My Husband ordered the Scarface and his portions were huge and the sauce was AMAZING!! They loaded it full of shrimp and homemade lemon butter white wine garlic sauce over angel hair pasta YUM!! I ordered the Sleeps with Fishes which was jumbo shrimp sauteed with sun dried tomatoes and prosciutto in a garlic cream sauce over fettuccini so delicious but honestly I preferred my Husbands (I always do!)  I definitely suggest you try this place out for Authentic amazing Italian and fun experience..

XrgVofP-4p-9b4h_Tb0WXA.text: Don't let the outside fool you. This place is so cool inside! It's classy and really gives you the mobster vibes. They have a piano and play music like Frank Sinatra. They had goodfellas playing on the screen. The service was really good. Everyone was super friendly. I really enjoyed the place so much! Omg the salad dressing was so good. I forgot the name of the salad but it's the one with artichoke in it. The pasta was delicious too.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-QJet-xcfHlOOZiMDEHxCA.text: Out of the three days and two nights spent in this city... The food/atmosphere @ Capo's was more fun enjoyable than any of the high end skyline views of any restaurant I ate at near/on the strip!!!  So glad we tried this spot out ... Being Sicilian/Italian I love the mafia decor in this place!  The house salads were fresh, good quality lettuce, and quite tasty too!!  My mom ordered the burger and I got the Italian beef both were very good!!  Honestly, the Italian beef here was one of the best I've ever had ... I loved the fact that the beef was very lean and thinly sliced!!!   The service was great and I love the speakeasy concept of having to ring the bell and give a password to get in ... Fun times!! I will be back for sure as the food was well priced, good service, and most important it was a fun very cool experience!!

ss1Eq9qvhQuzfcKaKWJDuA.text: Excellent food and service the grotto chicken Angelo and tiramisu as the desert Sara was an excellent server and very knowledgeable

r4z35KnE9me2OWhcz19oFw.text: The atmosphere here is great. Good spot for a birthday or get together with friends. Authentic Italian feel. They have Italian singers from time to time. The bar is very nice here. The food is good but not as good as the Italian Roma Deli on spring mountain. Still a good place though.

A8cxhl6bwIkreZMYmsWWGw.text: This was so amazing. I love the secret entrance. A True speak easy. So dark coming from outside. Takes a minute to adjust. Service was 120 percent. We sat at the bar and Dominque and Gerry did an amazing job taking care of us.  Food was truly one of the best Italian food in Vegas hands down. Great suggestions from the staff on what to order. Will return for sure.

mTIkH8ywYPhS-tzXyMpEYw.text: I love the Old Las Vegas atmosphere Capos had!  We were seated immediately during lunch time, our server maybe checked on us once after we put in our order. I ordered a glass of red wine sangria & primavera with grilled chicken, as for my boyfriend he ordered the cabonara. I absolutely disliked my primavera because of how sour it was, when I asked why it was that sour I was told because the lime juice that is added to the dish. No matter what, no amount of lime should overpower of the actual dish itself, capos primavera was highly disappointing. My boyfriend enjoyed his pasta very much, which was awesome but I just packed my order to-go and downed my glass of sangria. The sangria was delicious!

OOo3yneFjmeYrkvU3aY-Pw.text: brought my one year old son with us for Saturday brunch. bought a gruopon for $5 worth of $25 in food. Our waitress was very patient and kind, kind of talkative but it was a slow day for her. I got the alfredo and my other half got the spaghetti and meat ball while my son got some hash browns and French toast. My little family and I enjoyed ourselves.

7YZifzpeHRSL_PVEcwGAvg.text: Birthday.  My friend loved everything!!  the bread calamari and shrimp scampi. the risotto is fantastic i had chicken lucchese substituted asparagus for the broccoli. and turtle cheesecake   love love love

tLBKyor97n4tkZxtDLTvYw.text: Francisco was amazing! We got here and had no idea what we were in for as we came here for dinner on a whim. What an amazing experience from start to finish. Food was delicious and the customer service is literally one of the best I've experienced in life - period. I love how on top of their service game they are. And the vibe you get from the atmosphere is an exciting experience. I so wanna dish the details but don't wanna ruin it for anyone. Just be ready for a great time. Definitely have to bring my bf to this place. Many thanks and you'll be seeing me very soon!

6T9REesPm3FL8Tn5OISTmw.text: You have to go! Getting in is half the fun!  We didn't know that reservations are HIGHLY recommended, but after we found the entrance, "Vito" (not his real name but definitely looked like him from the Godfather), made room for us.  The waitstaff is on-point.  The food was on point.  The guy "singing" at the piano, well, he was a character for sure and added to the vibe.  This place it mob city fun, but everything was fabulous.  Plus with YELP check-in, it's $10 off $75, which is not hard to do with most meals stating at $20.  The creamy garlic dressing we yummy, and the fettuccine Alfredo was divine.  Hubby had GINORMOUS lasagna and the meatballs are the bomb!

Ndsmup8IVTGnvYZmy_vqrw.text: This place is so good! I had it twice last week. The food is so flavorful! Everyone I was with enjoyed everything. It has a NY mob style and the waiters play along. They have excellent customer service. They also make it feel like a lounge with a person singing and playing music. It's quiet enough to still be able to have a conversation. I wouldn't bring my kids here though. To me, it has a more mature feel.

YfcyLNPWXL9ihdnLIsX_Yg.text: We've been wanting to try this restaurant for sometime now and I thought Valentines Day would be the perfect day to give it a try.  Unfortunately I didn't think of reserving it until about 4 days before Valentines. The only time they had left was 9:45 PM. I reserved it anyway.  I was a little concerned they'd be rushing us to finish our meal, so we arrived about 40 minutes early. I figured we could have a couple of drinks at the bar if they weren't able to seat us. Fortunately they were able to seat us right away.  Our waitress, Mettia, was awesome! Attentive and professional and friendly.  The ambiance was great.  The food was mediocre and we waited over an hour from when we placed our order for the food to arrive.  The staff and ambiance are reason enough for a return visit. I just hope they can improve the quality of their food and the speed of delivery.  Overall we really enjoyed ourselves and would recommend it to others.

Tu1V-Gq4ZIr3-6TceRrw9Q.text: Thank you Sara & the entire Capo's staff for the incredible evening! You all made my Mother's Birthday so special & this will definitely be a night she'll never forget! The food was absolutely delectable, mouth watering PERFECTION!!! I will continue to bring all my out-of-town guests here for an extraordinary experience & ambiance!!

kvsUaFuhLHmD7heB_JnQ8Q.text: This is by far my favorite place in town. I've done plenty of dinner dates, a group birthday dinner, and it's especially a hit with my out of town guests that haven't experienced something like this (the speak easy vibe & delicious Italian food). Be prepared to splurge if you're planning on the whole 3 course meal with cocktails.

l5ZOlgiOtp9eblFDdeDgvQ.text: Amazing food, great service, and such a fun concept with it being a Speakeasy.  The entrance alone set the tone for what a fun meal we would have.  You'll understand what that means once you actually go here, and you need to go here!  I loved the mobster throwback feel once inside.  From the pictures and some mug shots of gangsters on the wall to the low-dimmed lighting, it really set the mood of feeling like I was in a restaurant from years past.  Our group of 6 were quickly seated and attended to, and I said service was very good.   Now for the food--all very good!  We went with their lunch specials, and for the most part everyone in the party ordered either the meatball sub or the Italian beef.  I had the meatball sub, and boy are they some good tasting (and good sized) meatballs.  However, the Italian beef was EXCELLENT.  I would definitely get this next time.  Great flavor, great texture, the bread was delicious (as was the hoagie the meatball sub came on).    Sandwiches came with a choice of side: either french fries or a pasta salad.  My parents had been to this restaurant before and said neither side was that great.  Their complaint was the french fries came with some sauce of some kind already on them, and they were not a fan.  The waitress said they could do the sauce on the side, which I went with--I have no idea what this sauce was, but it was delicious!  So delicious that I definitely could have been looking the little bowl it came in clean with my finger.  I'm very excited to go back and try it again with the sauce actually on the fries.  Morale of the story: Don't listen to my parents (That's why they aren't Yelp Elite!).   Definitely try this restaurant.  All employees were very friendly, prices were super reasonable, and it was just a fun overall experience.

5elXSWBV9Y4eZN2xNe3Vmw.text: So good I wanted to come back the next day!!!!    So my date didn't plan shit for this trip he invited me on. Why invite a lady on your first trip together and not make definite plans on where to eat!!!??? Especially a foodie like myself. BUT man was I happy we came here!!!!!! We took a cab (one of the nicest cabbies ever,) He dropped us off in this 1980s looking center and I was like Hmmmmmm OKKKKKKKKK. But that all changed. Rang the bell and we look forward and all of a sudden to the right of us the host with heavy mob accent asked us if we made rsvps and yes we did. Who knows if we didn't.      We were seated in a nice big booth. The service was great. Our waitress was so nice and a former resident of Irvine so that was lovely. We started with some martinis and they were made so good and refreshing. We started with Tony's "Duck" soup and an order of meatballs. I don't know what's in the Duck soup but it was so good. The meatballs are what they're known for and OMG one of the best meatballs I've ever had. So moist and very flavorful. I remember watching their segment on Man vs. Food and I recall drooling over that scene and now I had the chance to be like Adam and indulge. This should be ordered EVERY TIME!!!!  For our entrees I ordered the veal parm and my side was mushroom risotto. He ordered the Lasagna. The portions are HUGE. I told him I was happy to share an entree because I didn't know if our hotel fridge was big enough. Some how it fit :p I guess my date was in no mood to share. I'm usually not a veal parm person but this chicken parm was addicting. I couldn't stop eating it and If I took one more bite, I'd get sick. The risotto was good but it was all about the parm. I've been thinking about it every time I crave Italian food. I tried his Lasagna and it was very good. Even he couldn't eat it all. Very satisfying meal.          Overall I had a great time here and the gentleman that sung Frank sinatra was awesome, I thought they were just playing music til I looked back and it was live. He was spot on. The food was so good, I wanted to come back just to take leftovers back to Cali LOL. I can't wait to come back!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biggest veal parm and best parm I&#39;ve ever had!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna HUGE
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonys duck soup DAMN good

wfIodhHvqje1WG31s-OG6A.text: I was really looking forward to this experience based on the food reviews and the descriptions of the theme-styled atmosphere. As someone who grew up on Italian food, overall the food was just ok. The chicken parmigiana was a bit overdone and the sauce on the pasta was fair. As far as the theme, it was nonexistent for us. They seated us in a back room and we had no exposure to any theme (just a dark room) and we could barely hear the music in the main room. The customer service was decent, but nothing special. Overall we were disappointed.

VXXGy6jnwRBhCPvme8qf0w.text: I wish I could recommend this place but I can't. Our waiter was rude and lazy. We were seated after being there as the first ones with an 8 pm reservation, we get to our table in the dark. No menus had to ask for them. Waited forever to have our order taken, then almost an hour to get our food. I can see if they were super busy, which they weren't. The food is way overpriced and not that good.  If you just want the experience of being in an old "Speakeasy" this is the place. Otherwise find another good Italian restaurant where you get better service and food.

JKDidvXpHhqLg5ddOx6AsQ.text: My new favorite restaurant in Vegas. Absolutely love everything about this place, the atmosphere, the service and most importantly the food. It is always delicious. If you are in the are you should definitely check this place out. We always try to bring our out of town guest here.

9Pm4-w_WYGhdk1_857B7DQ.text: Food was fantastic and waiters were great. Order the cap a gun appetizer, simply delicious. Steak was out of this world. Will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These bust a cap mushrooms are delicious!

Un_DbgwivDTcviR8bUAvEg.text: The meat sauce my  Granddaughter ordered was excellent, carbonara was good  but pretty soupy, my husband ordered the brown sauce with sausage which was good but very spicy (which he liked).  I thought the pasta was pricy but may be due to being in a big city.  Atmosphere and staff were both good .

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mHqwblhMnDDCH4hnpRQbxA.text: This is a little place that is worth a try. The atmosphere is low key and nice. The singer is good and engages with the Audience.  Food was absolutely delicious. Had the Bust a cap mushrooms and spaghetti.  Meatballs are a must try. Soooo good. I gave this place 3 stars because everyone else was in character but our waitress and the service wasn't very good. Our waitress barely checked on us and dissapeared once we paid. I heard the waiter and waitress next to us and heard them welcome their guests and make some recommendations but not ours. Service is key in a place like this. All else set aside. I will be coming back again. Hoping we get better service.

rmZvOw0jSREoxAc6ZUtdJg.text: Capo's is my favorite spot in Las Vegas. Great atmosphere and fantastic food as always! I always get the red sangria which I could drink all day! The cheese bread comes with this amazing pink sauce that is to die for! My go to is ravioli and this place knocks it out of the park Everytime!

CinF_LI0VtYXCZl-QaZV1Q.text: I'm so sad & heartbroken over tonight's experience. 10 of my best friends & I reserved our table for my dear friends Birthday & it ended in disaster! All I need to say is the wait staff was amazing, but management, not so much! It would have been so easy to appease this crowd, but unfortunately we will NEVER go back & neither will the other 8 people who had never been before. Super bummed :(

iOpu1lbkgbb_gFr9HM2eyw.text: Went there for my birthday. The staff was really friendly. The food was great! The pianist who sang was the touch to a great themed restaurant. If you like al Capone would definitely say try this place out

C7jOQWW4Bw9JDdocMVOy8g.text: Incredible!  Treat yourself to this amazing restuarant.   Don't bother with the hassle on the strip Capos has better food and atmosphere.  This will be a family tradition when we visit Vegas.

ONkoQ3TNTZWDfZynyEOFug.text: We stopped in on a Tuesday during their locals two for one entree special.  Capo's is a fun step back to the 50's/60's with darkened interior, traditional dishes, and a lounge singer crooner to complete the atmosphere. I had the fried ravioli appetizer and spaghetti with their (large) signature meatball.  My wife had a delicious Chicken Parmigiana. Dinners included salad as well.  I will not hesitate to go back, the menu is very comprehensive with several dishes begging me to try.  Make reservations!

uytlLLI3qqx7CdKnyFmDPg.text: My wife & I ate dinner last night at Capo's for the first time. We shall return. It's one of the few restaurants where you can hear yourself talk over the table. Loud places always only get 1 star from me. Capo's gets 5 for the ambience, service. And the food? Fuhgettaboutit!!

VSycF3Qt3ecjR_1QJYVkVQ.text: Loved loved loved This Place!!! I can't believe I've lived here for 10 years and haven't discovered this sooner. From the very minute we got there the experience left us smiling ear to ear.   The ambiance is indescribable.  Def threw us back in time as if we were dining with the Italians who graced their walls of the dining area. Our waiter Francisco was absolutely fabulous, attentive and delivered with a smile.  The manager (I regret not getting her name) was so wonderful and gracious and made it a point to check in on us.   We started with two glasses of Cabernet and their calamari.  We ordered the Shrimp Scampi and Chef slept with Fishes. Not to mention we had to try their Famous meatball..... It..... was...... so....... DELICIOUS. We def went home with full bellies and a lot to go. I can't wait to go back!   ps.... don't forget the "password" CAPISH!

hHpOdqdaHDTxy0wcKG8bsA.text: If you care about your health, please do not eat here! I walked out after seeing the health inspector behind the kitchen/bar. Also heard some employees discussing a rat issue.  This is horrifying!!  I'm just glad I noticed what was going on before sitting down to eat.

EpW_ZrYQl-R73hwmFCdvQw.text: Absolutely love Capo's by far my favorite Italian restaurant in the city. I love the speak easy atmosphere! You have to ring the bell to access the secret door. The lights are low but they provide you a little light for the menu. I've never had a dish that disappointed me from the meatballs, stuffed chicken Anastasia, chicken parm, lasagna it's all delicious! You won't be disappointed!

bjtg1WQezIOKP6IzBrJcag.text: Disappointed on Anniversary night. Husband called to make reservations and they told him one were needed. We showed up cool entrance however we were informed that only bar seating was available. We took it and sat down and noticed that almost all tables were empty. We left as we didn't want to eat our anniversary dinner at a bar. We left to a nearby restaurant instead. Local Las Vegan won't return!

S2HMcXKaSL8IDkGyRsV68Q.text: How did I never check this place out before?  I've been in Vegas since 2001 and I finally made it here this past weekend for a late lunch/early dinner.    Upon arrival, it looks like any other restaurant, but the surprise is yet to come.  I won't spoil it, but this is a Chicago mob-themed restaurant.  You'll see.  This is a great place to take someone from out of town.  Tourists, you must check Capo's out.  Just like the other reviews, the place is dark, so allow your eyes to adjust.  The atmosphere is fantastic, the music is fantastic, and the service is phenomenal.  Although our waiter was Paul (who is excellent), everyone that walked by checked on us.  The food!  WOW!!!  The house bread, amazing!  We had the cheesy garlic bread for an app....5 stars.  The creamy garlic side salad....5 stars.  The drinks.....The Kick in the Head, the Espresso Martini, (had a few more but forget the names) were top notch....5 stars.  Our dinner, Vinnie's Alla Vodka with blackened chicken.....this is knock your socks off good!  Try it.  You will not be disappointed.    What an awesome place, and I can't wait to go back.  Someone asked if this was my new favorite Italian restaurant....and since Italian dishes vary by region, and are often prepared differently, I don't have a "favorite," however, this will be one of my regular spots!

nLH-95jNtyyWAWftY-O8BA.text: It is a great throw back from the classic  "old school" Italian restaurant experience I remember from my childhood. (I was an only child and went everywhere with my parents in the 60's)  The service was outstanding, the live music was an amazing surprise, the dark and "mob" like sultry atmosphere, made for a sexy date night BUT the FOOD, is why I will come back! The best carbonara I have ever had... seriously! The meatball appetizer and garlic cheese bread was fantastic. Even the salads were deliciously... clearly, in house made dressing!  It is also cool that you need a secret password to get in... in the secret entrance. Call... tell them I sent you... ask for the password of the day.... then, go and have your best night in Vegas. (So much better than Sinatra... a tourist trap... seriously, don't waste your money)

vhP4uX12dmA0soT5mEGJog.text: This place was awesome!!!! I've been wanting to take my wife here for a long time. The experience is cool and different, the host was helpful and friendly. The food was great!!!! Get the lasagna and get the sausage and peppers.

yQroQXSiLT1QK8NpmyccTQ.text: What a nicely hidden gem away from the hustle and bustle of the strip! I loved this place. You're sucked in with the ambience of old Harlem meets every mob movie aired circa 1960s. As a black 20 something from Miami, I have no clue of whether or not the food is authentically Italian but it's tasty! Way better than Olive Garden and more delectable than Maggianos which I love! There were plenty reviews about the wait staff being horrid but our service was farther from this revelation. Our waiter Jeremy was amazingly friendly, knowledgeable and quick. His partner (sadly didn't catch the name) was also ensuring our waters remained full and a smile on our face. The host was amazing and made me feel right at home...if home was a backdoor restaurant with mob deals in the back and card games up front! This was a Thursday night and although crowded, they fit us in with a reservation 3 hours before. There was a love pianist signing his rendition of Sinatra mixed with some r&b. I have never heard a Sinatra voice sing Stevie Wonder but ummmmmmmm let's just say the food was delish lol!!!!!!! Lovely date night, will be back. Oh, and order the Kick in the Head!

dWDcJBJbxwK7sU8yVnprfw.text: I went to Capo's for a Valentine's Day dinner with some friends last night. We had a party of 8, the maximum number reservation they allow via Opentable. This was my 2nd visit to Capo's, my first being April 2018 (also a party of 8). So the following is my low down on this "joint."  Pros: Capo's is definitely worth visiting for the atmosphere itself. It's not a huge place but rather cozy and the faux Mafia "speakeasy" theme, with the fake front door with password entry, Sinatra posters on the walls, and dark low lighting decor, is always fun--although it would be even more fun if they did more with it. The food is quite good-to-excellent depending on what you order and follows the usual old school Italian fare one would find at this type of restaurant. Service was generally good on both visits. Last night they had a singer crooning Sinatra hits to background tracks, which was nice.  Cons: along with the Mafia-theme comes the "you do what we tell you" attitude from management. If you have any requests slightly out of the ordinary (party bigger than 8, separate checks), they are NOT very accommodating or flexible...it's "too hard"..."too much trouble." They do have a couple of separate rooms for bigger parties but you have to email someone who might or might not reply to you (the "not" happened to me) and you have to order from a banquet menu. I called to follow up and the host who answered acted like he was too busy to talk to me and I was bothering him and was no help. Last night they had a special Valentine's Day menu; cheapest meal package was $50 and you could NOT order off the regular menu. They didn't inform me of that before I got there.  Bottomline: Capo's is ideal for romantic dinners for 2 or a friendly dinner amongst no more than up to 6 friends after payday when you want to splurge. Not the cheapest place but not the most expensive either. They don't do separate checks but allow up to 4 credit cards. They have a happy hour but the bar is tiny. Waitstaff/bartenders are generally friendly. Only thing is that the vibe I feel from management is more what the customers can do for "them" rather than the other way around.   If you want more flexibility with a larger party but with better live entertainment, check out Casa di Amore. It's a bit more spacious, bigger portions (good for take home), and management is easier to deal with.

CUQ6tWZ2Ttq6X8YdxHEUrg.text: I liked it.  The dark ambience and the party like atmosphere make it a cool place to go with friends.  Their lobster was great.  You get to pick out your own live  lobster out of the tank.  It was well prepared.  Its a loud environment though.  You at times had to shout to be able to hear each other.

S9nuPCUZqlPq7vR33AiEng.text: Amazing experience all around! Great menu selection and prices. Highly recommend you make reservations. You can also sit at the bar and have dinner. The ambiance is very romantic and it does take you back to an older Vegas.   Also the secret entrance is very well thought out and totally catches you off guard. The menus come with their own little flashlights, because it is quite dark. Overall it was a very great experience. We will definitely be back for more.

WRZzM4L-AvmGMurz4jEMzQ.text: Awesome atmosphere, great hidden gem. Food was delicious and the entertainment wonderful. The staff was very attentive.

fnO7UduJOt1kpf5b-owx4Q.text: Capo's Speakeasy is not only an amazing restaurant, it's an incredible overall experience! We just celebrated my mom's 80th birthday with a party of 18. Janeen provided top notch customer service in helping me plan the menu and set us up in a private space, "The Godfather Room."  She was so generous with the offerings and the kitchen did an exceptional job prepping our large feast with top notch quality! The food was just as delicious as when I dined there as a party of two.  We told our guests to dress in Roaring 20s attire, and surprised them with a last minute location reveal. Everyone kept raving about the decor, food and entertainment. My oldest daughter got to sing with her grandma and the pianist. My mom was moved to tears by the entire evening and said she would cherish these memories for the rest of her life. THANK YOU, JANEEN!!!
