W1zyl4IeHSLweN4RHAvxEg.text: Wonderful Old Vegas ambiance and all around great time to be had at this mob-themed speakeasy. The fun begins when you have to work to discover the password needed (call and ask) to enter through the secret entrance. Once you gain entry, you are transported to a classic Italian eatery with the feel of the type of places that hosted famous mobsters in the late 1960s, including red decor, white tables clothes and a piano to accompany the deep-voiced crooning of the live singer.   Now onto the service... You will taken care of by servers donned in bow ties and suspenders with thick Italian accents. They'll tell you the specials for the day, make recommendations and attend to your every need throughout your visit.   And then there's the food! The warm bread basket sets the mood for comfort food. I went straight for Tony's duck soup and spaghetti with Mamas meatballs, and washed it down with a glass of delicious Moscato wine. My table mate tried to penne ala Vodka and loved the pink sauce. We were both too full for dessert thought there was a good selection of age old favorites.   We heard there were other secret adventures to be had at capos, like a rumored secret poker room located behind a huge portrait of Al Capone, but we decided to save a few things to discover on our next visit. We will be going back!

KlT0y2NNE8YMpvD663M7Fg.text: We chose Capo's for my brother's 60th birthday dinner while we were vacationing in Las Vegas because the Speakeasy aspect looked fun and it received good reviews. Unfortunately, our experience was completely opposite of our expectations. We were a party of four and my husband has a small, extremely well behaved (and hypoallergenic-more on that later) fully documented service dog. After going through the door, we were immediately met by two floor managers that said they had three servers that were allergic to dogs and might not be able to seat us. They asked us to wait at the bar. We ordered drinks and waited a good 15 minutes or more. I noted that the restaurant was not full, in fact when I made the Open Table reservation there was ample availability, and there were many servers on the floor.  We saw them carry in what amounted to a card table into a side room away from the entire Speakeasy/restaurant. They ushered us into this empty room and had us sit at this makeshift table that they tried for several minutes to shim it so it would not wobble. Needless to say, there was zero experience. Also, to say that the property is a bit tired, is an understatement. I did not make a big deal out of it because I did not want to further ruin my brother's celebration. Service was terrible, food was ok, but most importantly, we all felt like unwelcome pariahs.   If I could give this "establishment" negative stars, I would. Not only did they break the law by discriminating against us by not treating us like any other customer because of our service dog (who by the way, lies under the table and no one ever even knows he is there) they went out of their way to make us feel unwelcome. We will also be filing an ADA complaint against them.

eVGqlA8HaXcJMbn7gxa-qA.text: Went here on a recommendation from a local. Great atmosphere and delicious food.  We had to wait a little while even though we had a reservation.  It wasn't a problem because of the good music and they comped our drinks.  We are definitely coming here again when we are in town!

_jBSlfULCKgU-ZmT2flqAw.text: Don't buy the Groupon for here. I accidentally bought the lunch Groupon for 2 for Capo's while browsing deals so I figured might as well use it. The service which we were given by our waiter instantly changed. He became less attentive and less sincere after telling him we had a Groupon. Thing is, I've been here multiple times. I have no problem paying full price but I wasn't going to let my money go to waste on the Groupon I can't get my money back for. We received less food and I felt uncomfortable the waiter changed his level of service. It was disappointing.

1WtKhmSoq_a6LlKlEvXlsw.text: Their meatball salad is amazing!!!! The ambience is wonderful. Will be back very soon.

2L72ruPT2_JDk0eFMDBAZw.text: My dad wanted Italian for father's day and I asked around to get recommendations for the best place to go. Capos was on the top of the list so we thought we'd try it. The food was delicious. Everything tasted amazing. With your meal, you get bread as well as a choice of soup or salad and you alsofet tochoose a side of either spaghetti, risotto, mashed potatoes or vegetables. It's a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for...good food. My one complaint, is the time it took for our food to come out. I wish it would've come out a lot quicker. The atmosphere is relaxing. It's pretty dark inside and they have calming Frank Sinatra type music playing. I'd definitely recommend trying the place out.

5m6C-glH_4ncBymLMTmMMQ.text: Never a bad decision to come to CAPOs.. Awesome experience.. Exciting atmosphere.. Food to die for.. Excellent staff.. If your  looking for a unforgettable dining experience Capo's is your destination.

x_V8jTFA6FTKGNdrScDFww.text: My family came here on recommendation, it is now our favorite place. The food was fantastic, the drinks were awesome, the atmosphere was the best.

LBbykZmH8CQo2CiSLr-C5w.text: This place is amazing! It's not just your typical restaurant, it's a restaurant with a twist! It looks very quiet on the outside of the building but as soon as we were admitted inside, it showed a lot of live patrons and busy busslings of staff members.  Before our entrance to the establishment, we were in an area that had a sign that said "Ring the door bell for entrance". We did. Then a few seconds later, a small peek window behind a photo frame opened and out came a gentleman's face asking us questions and passwords before entrance. It was a pleasant surprise. He then opened a hidden door behind a mounted phone booth and that's where we entered!  We were sat immediately and our hostess, Marlea was very pleasant, friendly, helpful, & gracious. It was our first time at at Cop's and we are pleased with our experience. Marlea was patient wit us and gave us great recommendations. I recommend siting where she hosts when you visit because she will take good care of you.  I recommend this establishment to everyone. Food is amazing and flavorful with authentic Italian food.  I am not a big Spaghetti person compared to my love of white sauce pasta or Seafoods pasta but their Spaghetti sauce is really great! One of the few places where I will eat Spaghetti. The meals are made with fresh ingredients and, I'm sure, is also made fresh daily.   GO TO THIS PLACE, IT WILL NOT DISAPPOINT!

9HCUJ4BVoOqxXHOocG8FqA.text: Valentine's Day dinner. Last night I had reservations to Campos Italian Speakeasy restaurant. First of all they couldn't find my reservations, I emailed them specifically requested a booth for a special occasion, because they couldn't find my reservation they put me in a little table in the middle not very romantic at all. I had the spaghetti and meatballs the spaghetti was lukewarm the meatball was burnt on one side and hard. My girlfriend had the lasagna which was hard on the sides overcooked, during our second glass of wine they kept trying to rush us out before and after I pay the bill. I've been here before but after last night service and food quality I don't think I'll be back. When I feel like having  Italian food again I'll go to the Italian American Club where I know the quality is good

rH_hl29D7FX0xBVrfa9edA.text: Lunch at the Don's...  Well, that's what it felt like as hubby and I had lunch at this speakeasy. The restaurant opened for lunch at 11:00a but we got there a little early and couldn't really tell where the entrance was. We parked and looked like the place was boarded up... turns out the front entrance was not so obvious. In fact, we entered in this wooden door to find another closed door that was a waiting room (no seats). We had to ring the doorbell and wait until someone opened a little peep window to let us in. This little waiting place had photos of wanted mafia members and dons. We were let inside the restaurant by a host who looked like he portrayed an associate dressed as a gangster, suspenders and all, and led us past the bar to the back section of the restaurant.   The quiet, casual elegant setting had a mob theme with the red leather seats, the glass chandeliers, the black wallpapered walls, and more photos of mafia dons and gangsters hung on the walls. It was like a scene from The Godfather, the movie. It is dark inside. The wait staff catered to our needs as we were served green salad w/ garlic dressing, bread/butter and our orders. I had the "Capones Carbonara" (pancetta, tomatoes, peas, red onions, shallots & fettuccini tossed in garlic egg cream sauce). Eccelente! Mangia!!! Hubby had the  "Vinnie's Chicken Parmesan Melt" (chicken breast, breaded, fried, topped with mozzarella cheese and their secret sauce). If reading that description didn't make your mouth water, well, there are lots more from their menu to choose from and cleverly named with mafia themes. Our food and the atmosphere was great!  The restaurant looked like it can accommodate large groups and banquets as well as intimate dinners for two . There is a private room and it had a booth that can seat two, it also had a screen like you can watch a movie or something. This room had a door and it is in between the bar and the restroom away from the rest of the dining area.   Located less than 15 minutes from the Strip this made our dining experience unforgettable! Thought that we would get a visit from the don himself... after all, Las Vegas had a history of mafia crime lords.  Review #0459

utZzf0Qfljf9t0KvKbPAtA.text: Took Randy here for dinner. Ring the doorbell and tell them the password.   It feels like i entered a goodfellas type restaurant. Capone, sinatra pics line the wall. They have a live singer who takes requests and sang sinatra. Lovely old school and ambience  They sang to Randy and it was a great experience

00vzirhnEmwiZWpDt2nYww.text: This place is so cool.......dark and mysterious! It's a speakeasy and has an unexpected entrance to which I will not reveal! I wouldn't want to ruin it for other first timers! It's a full mafia atmosphere!   I chose the Scarface Shrimp Scampi. Let me tell you..........it was freakin' delicious! HOWEVER........it was lacking in shrimp. And for a plate that costs almost $27, I really expected a main dish to have more than just 4 little shrimps!! When I mentioned it to the waiter, he just laughed and brushed my comment off. Gave no explanation and made no effort to make things right. If the owner ever reads this, I'd love to know if only 4 shrimp is common practice!? But, it was still yummy!  I was there with a group of 9. We had all used different modes of transportation to get to the restaurant from our hotel. Upon leaving, the restaurant arranged for a party bus to pick us up and take us to our next destination!  As you exit the restaurant, you'll find evidence left behind on the floor. The outline of a body! Quite comical!  I'd eat there again, but if I ordered the same thing, I would definitely ask about the quantity of shrimp I can expect!!

YCVPSMOUaU4DLJWpdLWDAA.text: What a find !! My wife May went to look for some good deals through groupon and she found one.  Prior to our departure, we had a little bit of time to eat lunch.  We planned this or so my wife had it planned prior to leaving Vegas to check this place.  This was unusually old school 20's style , mafia theme restaurant.  We got there when it opened at 11 am and have ring the doorbell ... It's funny the waiter would open a peep window and look and let us in.  Just like how the mafias back in the 20's were.  Lol it was kind of dark inside, lots of poster of former Mafiosos and big bosses such as Capone, lucky Luciano and so on.  All these time i was there I was expecting to be gun downed by a rival mafia lol.  It was really an original setting with a touch of Italy !!!! Or should I say Sicily .,,,  The waiter and waitress were dressed non black... The make attendants wore white suspenders.... Just like what machine gun kelly would look back then.  Any way we got our food, it was a full lunch meal with salad as starter and bread, I had me a "vinny" chicken Parmesan.  It was pretty good.  Hey if you ever be in Vegas and want to feel like the mafia is around you ... Come to this place ...

mQchxEC05w-gQMOTrZzQxg.text: AMAZING FOOD AND ATMOSPHERE!!!!!!!  So we didn't make reservations but the bar was open to sit and eat. It was different but also a GREAT experience to eat at the bar.   We've never done so before due to being with the kids all of the time.   Well, it's the full menu and drinks so not that much of a difference. Our waitress was amazing and timely cautious and attending to us right on que.   The food was Simply AMAZING. Real ingredients, fresh, tasteful, delightful, filling and the Turtle cheesecake was phenomenal!   All of the meats that we had were Blackened Chicken, Shrimp and Ma's Meat Balls and ALL were cooked to perfection! Noodles were cooked to the right point and the presentation of these portions were also AMAZING!   I will definitely be going back. The live entertainment was also sweet, sensuous, and welcoming. Excellent you guys.   Excellent!!!!

PIGfI5VuXTVXWzlMabqcLQ.text: We had our yearly company employee party at Capo's we wanted something different this year. Well we defiantly got something different. This place was recommend by one of our employee .I will be honest I was little concern regarding the price and service fee we would be paying for 35 people! BUT IT WAS WORTH EVERY PENNY! Food was delicious service was excellent JANEEN made sure everything went as plan she had an awesome attitude she was smiling all the time she was a top of everything! I could not of ask for anything else. Employee at the company are still talking about the party!.  Now I will have a new place to invite my family and friends that come from out town looking for a good place to eat and have fun!. THANK YOU JANEEN ONCE AGAIN FOR ALL THE GREAT SERVICE AND YOUR STAFF WAS AMAZING!

_eqeLOwL8vFlZTjJH_7bLw.text: This place is amazing. So much fun from the minute you walk up to the door. Secret password. Secret entrance. Very private, very dark so you don't know who is in the building. No snitches. Lol. Excellent food. The porterhouse steak is the best I have ever had. Sausage bread appetizer was delicious. Ambiance with dim lights. Flashlight menus. Music and live singer were all amazing. Gotta check this place out. It's a must. Staff is friendly and fantastic service.

aAMhHTiD2OjeSFg3WiswKA.text: Capo's was ok. We experienced less than good service and the food was slightly above average. We had higher expectations given other reviews and word of mouth. Love the theme, live music, and overall atmosphere. Will definitely give it another chance.

kAulGpq1mF90U2Vd6pq6PQ.text: Went to dinner with two other couples. Service was good & singer was excellent. While waiting for dinner to be served a magician came to the table & he was fabulous!  Dinner was ok. Got the check & because they do not do separate checks we all calculated our portion of the bill. I ordered a $45 bottle of wine but when the bill was presented it showed $75. Brought it to the attention of the waitress & she said "I presented the bottle to you". I am sorry but if I order a bottle of wine I assume she is presenting the one I ordered! We asked for the wine list & pointed to the one we ordered. The one she presented to us was three selections down. She took our complaint to her boss & she referred it to the top boss. His response was " well that table over there could say the same thing & they would be out $30 dollars." They took $15 off the check but it wasn't enough. Wine is marked up 100%, management would have broken even but they ruined the evening. There are too many great restaurants in Las Vegas to spend your  money here!

AJVh0TY27ENORSfrC5bocg.text: Great food, really cool atmosphere & staff.  I had the house salad, and the meatball sandwich. Salad was good, with good dressing. Meatball sandwich was great- good meatballs and sauce.   I tried the pasta and house gravy (tomato sauce) and while it was good, it wasn't my style. While I enjoy spicy and hot food, I like my pasta sauce sweeter- so it's not that the sauce isn't good, it is just not my style. It was more like an arrabiata, or fra diavolo IMO.   Our waitress was really great. She was fun and did a good job. Cute too. ;-).   Atmosphere was neat. Kind of like a speakeasy. Red vinyl booths, dark ambiance with music like Sinatra and the like.   When you enter, they first talk to you through a little portal in the wall---- there is a surprise- so spoiler warning - don't scroll down if you don't want to know-  ----  ----  ----  ----  ----  ----  ----  ----  Spoiler Alert!  ----  The door is fake! They open a hidden door where the pay phone is to let you in!   Overall, I liked the place and would definitely come back.

9l9dYsS6JWMG6fiMmZaFqg.text: Neat atmosphere with live entertainment. Horrible shrimp cocktail, great Cioppino and excellent Martinis! It's pricey and fun.

lmn1bqXaywBEh78rc-dFRA.text: Great ambiance and service. We ordered lasagna, meatballs, fettuccini Alfredo and spaghetti. The garlic cheese bread was great.  live entertainment singing Frank Sinatra- was definitely a plus.

MwDVZyWUKGOLhIbctHJyPA.text: First time here but definitely not my last. It may not lok like much on the outside but looks are quite deceiving. It was absolutely an amazing experience. It was like being in an old school speakeasy complete with a secret entrance and piano bar. Perfect atmosphere for a date night. The lighting is a little dim but there are little lights attached to the menus. All of the staff are incredibly friendly. The singer was superb. The food and drinks were absolutely out of this world! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

2CQ5bAQWXnWlBQKFkcNj2g.text: We tried this place out because my friend told me the food was good and it was offered on groupon.  I told the waitress we had a groupon in the beginning (do not tell them until the end as some other yelpers have mentioned) because our waitress made us wait throughout the whole time since we were sat.  We were in a party of 6.  The busser are way more attentive and I actually just wanted to tip them instead.  At the end of our meal we waited 10 mins. to get the check and 20 mins. for her to even pick it up since she was too busy sitting at the bar talking to Mr. Grumpy doorman.     Waitress disappeared again, we asked for another waitress to get a manager for us to speak to.  I guess she told our waitress, because she came out claiming she was the manager herself.  Fine, I told her that it all makes some sense now since you are the manager, probably have other responsibilities other than checking on your tables.    I wouldn't come here again even if the meal was going to be given to me free.  The service was just terrible.  Worst of the worst.

3atlgYvIliLD2fu0Ezn0DA.text: If you like Italian, you must come here! Brought my Godson for his 21st birthday and we all loved the theme, decor and all the dishes we ordered were delicious. Great customer service! You must try it next time you are in Vegas.

XO9JxYLlE9acuxaVJ4NIsA.text: Unique lunch experience. Came in with a Groupon for half off but would gladly pay full price anyday. Service was great. Pasta dishes were delicious. Salad was a little limp but house garlic dressing was very tasty. Will revisit when in Vegas in the future

H0_J_YLWZOu681bj04w1dg.text: Dined at Capo's on Tuesday night because I have always heard about this place and saw that on Tuesday nights they have a Locals deal.  First off, the place is really cool even from the moment you walk inside. Totally 1920's dark ambiance, mobster themed and it was really different and fun. They have a gentleman singing live music from the 1920's and a magician going around to the tables. It was a fun and unique dining experience. The only downside was having to wait almost 20 minutes for a table we had a reservation for.  As for the food, the table bread sucked which you would expect it to be at least warm and tasty from an Italian restaurant. Our server was very nice and I ordered a glass of wine which he forgot to put in and gave me two glasses for the price of one (Ill take a late drink any day for that). All entrees come with a soup or salad. Our server recommended the Cesar salad which I thought was sub-par and my entree actually came with an additional cesar salad on the plate with it so I would have preferred if he told me that and I would have gone with a soup as a starter instead.   I had just watched a food network or travel channel show on off-menu special items in Las Vegas. Capo's has a secret menu item called "Leftovers" and it looked amazing on the show. So I ordered it. It was a really interesting dish and I can see why it is called the Leftovers. Its a grilled chabbata and cheese bread on the bottom with a mountain of sausage and sauce covering the bread with two fried eggs on top. I thought it was delicious. My husband ordered the chicken parm and it was so yummy I will probably get that next time.  Overall, very cool place with good food. We will definitely be back, but most likely on Tuesday night because its a good deal.

o8pirlv99hfturYu7ASQEw.text: We had a blast. The entertainment was amazing. The singer came to our table and serenaded us. Fabulous voice.  The server, Brandon, was very accommodating and friendly. The other wait staff was extremely friendly- so much that my son even noticed.  The food was excellent, especially the meatballs. Reasonably priced and a lot of food for the money.  We needed a cab back to the hotel and the maitre'd was so helpful in getting us one immediately.  The decor was over the top!  We loved it.  Will definitely be back.

lRS45h_6pS8EzAaXGpnJkg.text: Went here for my brothers birthday after going to the Mob museum. Loved everything about the restaurant. I got he ravioli and it was amazing. Also got the brulee for dessert. Going back again when every I have time in Vegas

K6wQhuHOWmRIpTE0BOKDOA.text: Excellent service, Francisco was our waiter, and delicious food! No wait at lunch. Very authentic food and vibe. Reasonably priced. Highly recommend!

eM1k9i40LcM4KEQdBbdbdw.text: After seeing the show Mystery Diner on the Food Network my wife and I made the decision to eat there on our upcoming trip to Las Vegas.  With three days to go before the vacation I purchased a Groupon that was 30 dollars for 60 dollars worth of food.  We made a reservation for 6:00 on Sunday because we wanted to eat early before we went out.    We showed up about 10 minutes after 6 because the valet was a little behind at our hotel.  After pushing the button and waiting a minute or two the little window was opened and we were asked if we had a reservation.  I told him my name and he let us in.    After we got inside, the restaurant itself was extremely dark and the gentlemen who opened the door said we were late and we would be punished by having to wait longer.  "Whatever" we didn't care, we were just hungry.  It was kind of funny when we sat down and I looked at the menu on the back it said that reservations would be held for 15 minutes.    When we sat down we were given two menus with little lights attached to help us read them.  After a couple of minutes the server came and told us about the specials.  I was very interested in the meatball and shrimp special and my wife was going to get another shrimp dish that was on the menu.  After we told the server that we were using a Groupon she said we had to spend the full sixty dollars which we didn't think would be a problem.  We needed another minute to decide so the waitress left and came back a minute later.    I was excited about my shrimp and meatball special especially after reading all the review on Yelp about how good their meatballs were.    When the waitress returned the first thing she said was "sorry we are all out of shrimp," this meant I couldn't get my special and my wife couldn't get her selection.   Now how is it that you have a special and that consists of shrimp and you somehow run out of it by 6:15 at night.    I think that since we were using a Groupon they didn't want to sell us the shrimp , I have no proof but I think it was bullshit.    So we had to take another couple of minutes to look over the menu which had mostly dishes that contained shrimp.  I decided on spaghetti Alfredo with a meatball side, and my wife went with a clam dish in a red sauce.  When I the meal came my Spaghetti Alfredo had absolutely no flavor at all.  It was horrible.  The meatball on the other hand was really good.  My wife's clam dish was also very good and there was quite a bit of clams in the dish, which was exactly what she wanted.    After we finished and asked for our check the waitress came back and said we were a few dollars short of sixty and we were going to have to get something else.  My wife decided to get a dessert and she chose a tiramisu which ended up also being pretty good.  It tasted like they used real lady fingers and the whipped cream was also dynamite.  Overall our experience was not what we expected and we will not be going back here next time we were in Vegas.  The atmosphere was neat but I just can't fathom a restaurant that runs out of shrimp that is their special for the night by 6:15 in the evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti Alfredo with a meatball
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheese salad

kssEf9ULpPDPYNhcCOBB7g.text: Enjoyed the atmosphere along with the quality of the food. We never received our complimentary bread (not knowing they served any) so we ordered the garlic bread appetizer. It was decent, but next time we will try another appetizer and opt for the complimentary bread. For dinner, I ordered the chicken parmigiana with garlic mashed potatoes. The entrees may seem pricey until see the generous portions (without compromising the quality of the food). Overall, we had a great experience. We will be returning again.

THm3Bx4ydCUDFn7NoVhnxQ.text: It's far from the Vegas strip  The theme is cool the live music and magician were cool. Definitely not a kids place. The food was good Wasn't the best food I have ever had   If you are staying on the downtown area it's a closer drive

dDb8KxP1_mna2I7e3fxnWw.text: This place is amazing. It takes you back right into old Vegas. The entire deco  is like the 1940s and 50s. Mobsters in some movie stars are celebrated in the space Dim lighting all around with a very unique menu light to see items on the menu is a scene  set for a nice romantic dinner Our server was outstanding, very knowledgeable , courteous and helpful with the menu.  Food was ok but the service n ambience with the Magician  deserves a five star.  Recommended highly  Only issue the yelp offer was not accepted  ???? Wonder why it's still on Yelp Mgt needs to take it down That is the only reason to lose a star

-cbr-LWFUTC7LU737nwohw.text: We had heard about Capo's on the TV show Man Finds Food before our trip to Vegas and it looked like a lot of fun (and the food reviews were very good). Capo's did not disappoint!  One note: it's a $50 cab ride from the Strip ($25 each way), but it was worth it, as the cost for a full dinner and drinks was about half what you'd pay in Strip restaurants.  This place is a hoot -- you have to ring a bell and then you're asked for a password to be let in (like the old Speakeasy's - very fun) The restaurant is VERY dark, especially coming from the Vegas sun -- it's dark and very cozy with lots of half-booths. The decor is fun, photos of gangsters and Sinatra's mugshot.  There is a singer doing lounge songs, and he's pretty good! Our waiter, Bruce, was great -- his personality fit the place perfectly. He gave us recommendations for dinner and wine.  For appetizer, we went with the bruschetta, which was very good. The bread was thin and toasty/crunchy and absorbed the yummy tomato topping, it was very light.  For dinner, hubby got the shrimp scampi with angel hair pasta -- the sauce was tasty, but the shrimp were over-cooked which was sad because the pasta was perfect.  I went with the recommendation of the chicken marsala with mushroom risotto -- it was just excellent and so delicious, a great combo together. The chicken was so tender you could cut with a fork and the marsala was thick and full of flavor. The risotto was a perfect match.  I am an Italian from Boston and I have not had a better Italian meal in the North End.  As we had ordered our apps, Hubby said "I know that waiter, we have seen him before" and then we realized that he had served us at the Range at Harrah's a few years back -- he had a personality that leaves a positive impression. We asked him and sure enough it was the same guy! He was thrilled that we had remembered him, he spent a few minutes telling us about what happened with the Range and how he ended up at Capo's. What a sweet guy, so genuine - he said he was so happy that we remembered him and you could tell he really meant it.  What a great experience - we will be back.  The only reason it's not 5 star is because of the over-cooked shrimp, other than that it was spot-on perfect!

UxGBJ4MDYWNHrOvh69q4iQ.text: I really wanted to like this place, but the poor service, long delay of our food, and overall neglect of my table made for a disappointing experience.   I think the secret door is a cool idea in theory and I love the entire Italian mob theme of this restaurant but I think asking if people have reservations and then making it seem like an inconvenience to seat you if you don't isn't smart business. We showed up before 4 pm and the host staff innocently argued in front of us about being unsure if they could seat us in the restaurant that had one table with people sitting at it.   My partners beer showed up ten minutes after we ordered it and we waited a solid thirty minutes for my eggplant parmigiana and his sausage and peppers. My dish was good, and a very large portion which I was happy to see for the hefty $21 price, but the sausage and peppers were overly salty for my taste.  We didn't see our server too much, she was busy tending to a larger party that was seated after us. Our water lacked refills, we weren't checked on after our dinner was dropped off, and when we asked for a dessert menu she dropped off a closed book but when we opened it there was no menu inside. She didn't come back for 10 minutes so we decided to not even order anything because it would have taken even longer.   I would like to come back for the live music, but it will probably be later then sooner.

2ESIDgwgj4l3Hd-RUheDcg.text: I saw this restaurant on a reality tv show and was dying to try it while in Vegas. We made a reservation and grabbed a taxi from the strip (approximately $28 cab fare plus tip).  We had read about the entrance to the restaurant on yelp so knew what to expect. No disappointment there!  Once inside the VERY dark restaurant the host pointed to a booth and said "sit over there".  We found him quite humorous.   The food was great and the restaurant provides mini flashlights inside the menu so you can read it in the dark. Took us a while to realize this so we were using our phones at first. We had lasagna and cheese ravioli. My husband thought it was possibly the best lasagna he had eaten... And we eat out a lot.  The portions are large and served with soup or salad and bread. They have a man singing Frank tunes who comes to your table and sings and a magician who also comes to your table and does magic tricks (he didn't make it to our table. We enjoyed the musician very much.   When we were ready to leave the mob-like host/manager/owner (not exactly sure who he was) said his driver would take us back for a flat fee of $25. The driver was a very nice Russian (I think) man who my husband enjoyed talking to (I couldn't understand a word he said). Total cost for the dinner for my husband and I (including 1 glass of wine and desert), taxi fare, and generous tip was $150. Defiantly worth it!

C6RWhxr7YRb7oBUfO-sqsw.text: GREAT CONCEPT; BAD EXECUTION  The idea of the Speakeasy style restaurant dining is great. The dining experience itself: not so much.  I had to laugh when reading "Steakhouse" on the menu because there just weren't that many steak options. Shrimp caught my eye in a few dishes, and the clams did also. We'd heard great things about the meatballs but I wanted seafood. It's an Italian place, right? Seafood and pasta sound easy enough.  Unfortunately, by 6 in the evening they were out of shrimp.  Choice number 2 wasn't a bad one though. I had the "Gallows with clams" in a red sauce. It was good and had a lot of clams. The sauce was tasty. Would have been good if I'd shared it over my husband's alfredo, because that was terrible. Flavorless sauce.  His meatball however was excellent. And very large; and tender! Exploding with flavor inside! I doubt we'll return here but it was fun to check out! I'd go with my clams again and he'd probably throw a meatball on top and share.  :)  A salad with a red sauce preceeded dinner and was very good. (Husband disliked the sauce). A tiramisu dessert finished up the evening and it was great too!  We had a Groupon but it still wasn't an inexpensive dinner, for what it was. You're partly paying for the experience though. It was fun dining in the dark. Service has room for improvement! We first heard about the place from a fake reality show that supposedly took place there. I wish Food Network would stop airing that crap, but I'm glad we had a chance to check out one of the places it supposedly featured!   If this restaurant fails I highly suggest the owner start a meatball production factory - freeze 'em and ship out! You have a guaranteed customer in California waiting for this day!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu for dessert. Big piece. Glad I only had to share one bite cuz it was great!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. all the clams that were in my dinner! Very good amount
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gallow&#39;s with clams and red sauce - very good

76F7xB3ozXcOjZaeZSh3ug.text: Had dinner here for New Years, staff was fun and great for our stay.  My friend and I both had the ribeye steaks which were pretty big even for a guy and probably one of the best I've had, I'd rank theirs up there with some of the top steak houses in Vegas, Chicago, etc.  Ordered house drink called 'a kick to the head', and highly recommend that.  Also split their cheesecake which was awesome, fresh daily and never frozen. You've got to try it at least with s friend if your willing to even share it.

s2cPxqf1-g3L6OB0Xzw7zg.text: I thought the food here was great.  We came at lunch, and ya, the whole "speakeasy" entrance they have is a little gimmicky, but whatever, to each their own. We had pizza and pastas, and they were definitely good, the main problem we had was that it was so dark in the restaurant. Like insanely dark, like you need a light to read the menu. I guess it's their motif, but stil, it put a bit of a damper not quite being able to see everyone at the table.

2xeJolzRmfvRwXonmmahbg.text: Making a reservation for my prom I went through all the necessary and proper steps of making the reservation. With a table of 14 I understand the difficulties of hosting a large party. Although I made the reservation 2 weeks before prom, I was called a week before my prom in order to confirm. In which I learned that they could not provide the number of checks needed even though within my 6 email correspondence with the "reservationists" I was told that all would be fine and taken care of. My main problem was with the miscommunication of the staff, but when I went to the general manager/owner, Dominic, he suffered a lack of communication as well. And even told me that even though I made the reservation a week ago, that he had not entered it into the computer and therefore my reservation, made two weeks before the date was not made at all. As a young teenage girl I was appalled by the way he raised his voice at me over the phone verbally attacking me. When I expressed that I felt he was being rude, he further screamed at me and dropped our reservation.   A previous customer of Capos I throughly enjoyed the atmosphere which is why I wanted to share the experience with my friends on my prom night. But unfortunately I was screamed at by a man twice my age over the phone. The atmosphere sadly doesn't feel welcoming anymore.

fh0WT-41i2QHF_mAytf5bg.text: This place is excellent! Very old fashioned with great old fashioned's. Live much every night which a treat and some of the best pasta I've ever had. Try the leftovers.

VrT1IfVH1ryriTYaC5kGhA.text: Capo's was an interesting experience. It was difficult to find the door to enter, and when you do your greeted with who's there in pure wiseguy fashion. A secret door is opened. The place is dark, you get mini flashlights to look at the menu. The menu online was not the same as what we were given.   Service was so slow, maybe the service staff congregating. Thanks to the busser/ service assistant for at least refilling our drinks and replenishing our bread. The kitchen that is in sight of the tables lack a sense of urgency needed to provide a speed of service to turn the tables, maybe that explains the manager/host seemingly stressed out whisking in the dining room and out again with no purpose but to see we were all hungry staring about and doing little about correcting it.  Food was enjoyable portion size smaller than that of most Italian restaurants I have visited. It stopped me from over eating and feeling stuffed, so I was okay with it. Service was slow to pay, watching your server having drama with staff, the bartender going off about something, I now understand why it  is kept so dark.   I would go again, but not for a dressed up celebration dinner. Maybe take out because service was so slow.

VVJquCOackJKZwtsA-cEMg.text: I think Capo's deserves a 2.5 because of originality, but since the stars won't allow, and due to a big-time let down and poor quality, I'll round down.  My Dad was in town for his 60th Birthday and he wanted Italian food for a less than outrageous price.  We can be pretty picky with Italian food considering we are Italian, and the fact that we come from where Italian food is actually good (NY,Philly,NJ).  He suggested Maggiano's because we know to expect good quality.  I didn't want to take him to a chain though, I wanted him to have something he could only get in Vegas, so I did my homework on Yelp, and Capo's seemed like the right choice.  A choice I ended up regretting.  No horror stories here, but as you will read, the service and food quality just weren't there, the only thing good was the atmosphere.  Upon arrival the entry and speakeasy theme was pretty cool.  Would have been cooler without a sign that said credit cards were currently not accepted, cash only.  But still pretty cool. Inside, the very dark environment with mafia decor and old Italian Resaurante style kept me looking around.  And an the old Vegas style lounge singer was belting out the Sinatra hits in a voice slightly better than my own (this is not a compliment to my voice).  From here it just goes down hill.  There was a half hour wait even though an entire room of tables was wide open, not being used.  I didn't realize we'd need a reso being it was a Tues night during the off-season and the place being in a hole in the wall off the beaten path.  Perhaps this was still my fault.  The service was bad.  Friendly enough, sure.  But we didn't get the water we asked for, and even after ordering we never got a basket of bread until such a long time went by that we waved down the waitress and begged for bread and water.  Then the bread came, and had I not been starving, I would have tossed it in the garbage.  This was possibly the worst bread I have ever tasted.  Is it possible for bread to be that bad?  Apparently it is.  Not just bad, but terribly stale.  I gobbled up the chewy, stale loaf anyway because I was so hungry from waiting, nearly ripping out teeth in the process.  The main course eventually came and it was all sub-par.  Edible, yes.  In an Olive Garden quality kind of way, maybe a bit worse.  The fettuccine alfredo seemed like it was straight outta the TV dinner box.  The added shrimp were a nice size.  My Dad got ravioli's in a red sauce with meatballs.  Again, just edible.  Especially since we were starving.  But a very generic taste all around.  I honestly felt embarrassed that I brought my Pop to eat this.  This is not a True Italian place.  It is a gimmicky eatery that makes it on its speakeasy theme atmosphere.  If you have ever had real Italian food, the taste of this food will be a total let down.

GQWQHOlwjNnqmf7Y4d2RAg.text: My husband and I have been dying to try this place for years. We are so glad we finally did! It was a little skeptical at first, but that's their vibe. The food was amazing! Best calamari I have ever had. Both of our pasta dishes were excellent as well. I would recommend making a reservation! We will definitely be returning!!

1JrPajHd9vT6cI9m4oJNnA.text: Walking in was a great surprise!  The staff were great and very informative.  The menu was so good!  Hard to choose.  Kaitlyn the bartender was great!  We are definitely coming back VeRy soon!

TCG1_VFw0dTOvMCdnbBD6A.text: We came for lunch with a groupon. The service was prompt and friendly. We had a house salad with Italian dressing, chicken Parmesan sandwich, Italian beef sandwich and tiramisu. The salad dressing was nice with oregano and vinegar as the prominent flavors; the marinara, chicken and bread on the Parm sandwich was nice AND the Italian Beef sandwich was the best I've had outside Chicago. The tiramisu was ok, not the best I've had but pretty good and homemade.

MF66RnZhMef3rJJOAnmKkA.text: If you look at the right of the information screen where it lists more business info, it says not good for kids.  I beg to differ.  We were welcomed with open arms and couldn't have been more comfortable and taken care of.  I made reservations for a Sunday, last November for 5 adults, a toddler in a high chair and a baby in a stroller.  We arrived at 5 o'clock and were seated promptly.  All that being said, I think that with little kids, the earlier, the better for the restaurant, parents and customers.  We had a perfect time.  I wish I could remember what we all had, but too much time has gone.  What I do remember is that EVERYTHING my family ate was wonderful.  It's almost as if we hadn't ever been to an Italian restaurant before and were just discovering how delicious it could be.  Drinks, appetizers and entrees were all very tasty and plentiful.  No one had room for desert, darn it.    My adult kids drink tons of iced tea, and their glasses were never empty.  The service was some of the best I have experienced without being obtrusive.  This place is top notch and I look forward to going back.  Also, 2 for 1 Tuesdays?  Wow!  How nice for locals, which my kids are.

tzxqgok99b6BikQyhbK8-g.text: WARNING: WORST CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE IN MY LIFE!  My bf & I bought a Groupon for here & it was out first time dining at this spot. The workers were extremely rude & then we asked to speak to the manager. He would not accept the groupon because it said it was for four ppl but the other couple canceled last minute. The groupon for 2 people cost less money but we wanted to spend a lot more than the 2 person deal but the manger refused.  So let me get this straight.....you're telling me you don't want our business? Especially since we told you we'd like to spend a lot more than the 2 person deal? Why does it matter how many ppl are dining if we just told you we'd like to spend so much more money?  RIDICULOUS  On top of that he tried to swindle us into paying waaaay more if we wanted to stay & dine. He was the rudest manager I've ever met in my life. He had an attitude the entire time & was extremely unfriendly. He basically said its our fault that we can't follow the rules.  It's ironic that I'm writing such a negative review because we initially decided to eat here after reading the positive reviews on yelp....but this was by far an awful experience.  After we left we went to Craftsteak in MGM GRAND & spent 3 times as much because we knew we'd get better service & the best food guaranteed.

UdFsDhH2tOC0B-Mda1ORtA.text: Wow I am so happy with the food and staff. We had a group of 6 girls, and everyone was 100% satisfied with their meals.  I only wish we lived closer so I can enjoy the best Italian food in Las Vegas!

AK5muTio4n0UCF0RK_LTCg.text: We arrived about 5 minutes after 5 the maitre d said he could seat us but we would have to leave by 7 o'clock service was extremely poor my glass of tea stayed empty for 15 minutes I had to get the attention have someone to bring me more tea between the appetizer and the salad must have been another 30 minutes then our dinner comes out and we aren't even done with our salads yet its funny how bad service can ruin a good meal the entertainment was great but I can't say much for the wait staff don't know if I can suggest it to any of my friends I paid and as we left no one said thank you come again and lastly my wife wanted another glass of wine but no one came by to ask her

-qumM7kZICcqszX-0Qap5A.text: The part of the charm of this place is the decor and lay out.  As others have said before, you have to ring a door bell in order to be let in.  Its really sets the mood for a fun and unique dining experience.  I found Capo's through yelp and was not let down.  The service was outstanding and the food was delicious.  This place is dimly lit with the old school red leather booths.  It offers a lot of privacy and has a very intimate feeling.  My wife and I decided to share a dish as I read that portions are large and plus our eating schedule was waaaay off because we were in Vegas.  We cam here on a Wednesday night around 10:15 and ordered the mushroom caps and the ravioli with a side of meat ball.  The meat ball was very flavorful and tender, the ravioli was huge and had tons of diced Italian sausage in the sauce.  The mush room caps were good as well.  Over all great dining experience and is worth the drive off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chandelier over each booth.  This place is dimly lit!

oS9o104C5IvrWAOxu07L7g.text: Great foog and fun atmosphere! Gotta try the meatballs.

xNkzltJD_xAjbYbIirMVZA.text: We've been coming here for a few years when family comes in to visit. We love the dark (comical) mobster-style dining experience and we've always left there in good spirits. The singer is entertaining with a great voice and the food is DELICIOUS. I love the cheese bread and the Ravioli topped with Alfredo sauce. My Dad and step mom still talk about how much they love it, 2 years later. The ambiance is unique and quite "Sinatra", especially for out of town, southern guests:)

iphsbG1Q2oLYyykooIfv2g.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I fully expected this restaurant to ride on its gimmick, but the food was great! It looks like a dump on the outside, but that's part of the shtick. Even the managers play full part. Inside this place is really a throwback, and the service was great! We went on a Monday and had the industry happy hour, the bartender was really attentive and she made us feel extremely welcomed. I had this Caesar salad pasta marinara sauce thing, it sounded odd but I was delicious! The sauce at this place is ON POINT.

HwIsBt1JOWpjN2zTRzFh5g.text: I was pretty impressed with Capos. I took my Mom there on a sunday night at about 7pm. There was no wait. The place is cool, its very dark and it is kind of like a old speak easy. Definitely a good idea for a restaurant.  We started with the "Bust a Cap" Mushrooms. They we're really good. Definitely unique flavor. For my entree I had lasagna with a meatball on the side. Definitely some of the better lasagna I've had. The marinara is clearly homemade. It had really good flavor. The meat ball was good to. Mom had some kind of chicken dish with a side of risotto. The risotto was unreal. It was so good. It had a strong flavor or garlic and cheese. It was awesome.  Overall it was a very good experience. The service is top notch, but it is slower than a chain restaurant. They give you a little bit of time to take in the experience. I definitely will be back.

_yN_pzmyZI4mIfSVIvOS9g.text: This review is mainly due to their group policies.  We have enjoyed the restaurant many times and have brought friends.  This week the group was for 12.  Upon arrival, we asked about separate tickets because most of the 12 were on expense accounts and needed receipts.  We were told their policy was a maximum of two cards.  When the issue was brought up, they agreed to accept 4 cards, all others needed to pay cash.  I won't speculate on reasons for this policy but we didn't have cash and we weren't one of the ones needing a receipt, so we left. We are very disappointed as we have introduced a significant number of people to this restaurant.  We can no longer recommend them based on their inability to accommodate business needs. We are searching for a new Italian restaurant that we can recommend to out of town diners.

ChbSHT5Kxt9xGroTFmoUcA.text: First, the main reasons they didn't get 4 stars... it was so dark in there, we couldn't see where we were walking nor did their tiny flashlight work well on my menu, its battery was dying and it wouldn't stay lit.  Also, we were seated right next to the singer and, while he was good, it was rather intrusive to be so close to him.  Lastly, while the food was good.. it wasn't stupendous.  Now, for what we liked.. the ambiance (other than the lighting) was good.  Service was great.  Food was good.  Prices seemed reasonable.  And.. the singer was staying in key most of the time.  We ordered the antipasto - rather excellent.  Our salads (with italian dressing) were boring afterwards, a bit too much lettuce since the antipasto was a salad also.  The bread was good, but they were stingy with the butter.  My entree was "The Chef Sleeps with the Fishes", a shrimp fettucine that I liked.  Hubby's entree was "Angels with Dirty Faces", angel hair pasta with pepperoni, peas, mushrooms & pink sauce.. also good.  We had enough leftovers for a couple more meals also.  Would we return?  Sure.  Would we get all quivery with anticipation for returning?  Nah.

IOH2HupuMxEAXo5zasoeWQ.text: Went last night for my boyfriends birthday dinner. Food was excellent, I had the Chicken Anastasia and my boyfriend had the New York steak. The cannoli was to die for! Not to be missed! The service was perfect and the experience really made it the whole package. Highly recommend.

FUahOwuVEn2endJtpdU5nA.text: As Las Vegas locals, we've heard about Capo's but had never been. We decided to try it out for my mother in laws birthday on Friday night. We will definitely bring visitors back here, it was fun, something different. Loved the way they greet you at the entrance. The light transition was a little hard to take, it took about 15 minutes for our eyes to adjust. We also weren't attended right away, but once we said something, we had great service from then on. Loved the old Las Vegas feel and the live singing. The wine list was decent. We had the meatball appetizer which was the best I've ever had. Our salads were all really good. The entrees were very generous and tasty. Lisa was our server and very friendly and helpful. Try it, you'll like it!

3Y2xNdaMu1iXE0wDw1o5iQ.text: This place has been haunting me forever. Driving past it all the time and teasing me with it's sign and red awning. This place is kinda a hole in the wall. I don't really wanna give away the experience. But you should make reservations if you go on a weekend. It definitely is a possibility it may be crowded - It opens at 5pm till late night.  Ok so here's the deal without giving away the experience. You walk in and .............. We'll skip ahead to eating there - it definitely is worth it though. Funny thing is that I was reading over some past reviews and either people had a great time here or it REALLY Sucked. Sometimes restaurants go through staffing issues...But definitely had a good time here. Just remember to "speak easy" if you know what I mean! The ambiance is dark and romantic. With an old Vegas feel to it. It's got these private booths and family tables. We got the Bugsy Segal Booth. There's a guy walking around singing old Rat Pack/Chicago -Italian style songs from "That's Amore" - "Ain't that a kick in the head.  The service was friendly from EVERYONE! The decor is kinda Mob-like. The food was pretty good almost home cooked. The pasta I had was "Swim with Fishes" or something like that had a light cheese cream sauce with garlic and sundried tomatoes swimming in al dente fettucinni and shrimp.  "Bust a cap" stuffed mushrooms were fantastic - sure they were little mushrooms but they did pack it with flavor. The italian egg drop soup was good. Very garlicky but a little salty for me. When they say garlic mashed potatoes...they don't mess around. GARLIC!!!! They had this chicken too kinda with picatta sauce and capers but it had broccoli. This thing was packed with flavor. Ok so great ambiance,  great date place, friendly staff, good food. Definitely wanna come back!

r9hPqD40dvQV4r-yCBKn_A.text: All I can really say is "Leave the gun, take the Cannoli". After seeing Cap's on Man Finds Food, we were hopeful that both the experience and food would be good. Unfortunately, upon arrival I had my doubts simply based on the outside appearance, but my Mom always told me never to judge a book by its cover. I should have trusted my instict. I ordered the stuffed rigatoni. Although I cannot be positive, I suspect they were frozen and mass produced. They tasted a lot like a bland frozen dinner. My husband ordered the Sausage and Peppers. There was nearly no sausage and very minimal peppers. After Not finishing our food, I decided we would give the establishment a chance to redeem itself with dessert. We ordered the Cannoli. I was pleasantly surprised. The shells were crisp, the filling was smooth and sweet but not overly sweet. For the price and review on the Food Network I was expecting a much better experience. We will not be returning.

D_hHJeX34zEOh6enwMuYkg.text: this is a great place to try while you're in vegas and sick of buffets! i found this on yelp, got there, at 10pm too. wasn't sure if they were open, but i went in, and had to press a doorbell, and got the surprise that everyone got!   the feel is pretty cool, music in the background, very dim lights, cabanas, they even have a flashlight for the menu!  the bread was perfect. best bread i've had! it was so perfect, warm, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside with melted butter. i couldn't eaten the whole loaf!  i got their signature pasta with meatballs in tomato sauce in angel hair. pretty good! though i shouldn't have gotten angel hair. portions were pretty huge too!  i went late so there weren't that many people, and they weren't that slow.   favourites: the breadddd  do not want: the prices are actually more on the higher $$ end, $18-$20 for a pasta  last words: great feel, good food, great bread!

TWZVkrmJWA0BTzz3tsxVGw.text: I went there for dinner last night on the recommendation of a friend.  It was cool.  The decor is the way you would imagine Las Vegas in the 1950's minus the cigarette smoke.  The service was average as was the food, but the experience was fun.  The guy singing was OK, but he added a lot to the atmosphere.

NtZrqnM65ENzDDMlBklEdA.text: We really enjoyed the atmosphere and it's a nice change from eating on the strip. Caesar salad was very good. I had the Eggplant Parmigiana for my main meal, delicious! I also tried the Mushroom Risotto, excellent!

Ue53yuv5qZcnS2Kx1MSlJQ.text: Ok, I read all of your blogs and comments before taking on this experience. Overall I have seen mixed reviews about this restaurant ranging from as high as 4 stars to as low as 1 star. My wife and I went here on Monday 25 Apr 2011 as a pre-celebration to my 42nd birthday. We had a 6:00 pm reservation and valet parked at the location. The reservation was honored and my vehicle was parked right in the front of establishment.  We have lived within Las Vegas since 2003 and have roots to the Midwest. I am from Chicago (truly a city kid, Southside, and White Sox fan) and my wife is from St. Louis. Service was fantastic, the hostess was very prompt with our meals, checked just enough to see if we required any additional service however, allowed us to hold a conversation with each other. Ziggy was the manager that night and ran a classy shift. Service is a 9.5 out 10 because there is always room for improvement. We were allowed to choose our seat and the crowd was about moderate size. Bummer that night no live piano, that would have made for a perfect night. Instead we had to listen to various big band, R&B, and top 40 dinner music.  I had the meatballs with spaghetti for dinner and my wife had the steak, she likes her steak overcooked. The meatballs were ok, not the best that I have ever had coming from a Black, Irish, Italian, and Germany neighborhood on the Southside of Chicago however, merited a 7 out 10. The sauce with the meatballs was the bomb, 9 out 10. I make my sauce from scratch and my wife and I almost did not get together because the first time that she cooked spaghetti with red sauce she tried using that crap in the jar and I asked her if she was making spaghetti for the dog. Lol now, but was not funny then. The steak was ok, I like my steak with pink inside so to me the steak lacked flavor, but as I said in the beginning my wife likes her steak overcooked. For desert we shared a generous serving of the tiramisu on the patio, I would go back just for the tiramisu. This was better than any tiramisu that I have had in Chicago or New York, I went to college within Saratoga Springs and Albany with many weekend trips to New York City. Overall, the food is a 6.5 out 10.  The lighting in the restaurant is dark, which I enjoyed very much. After 10 minutes or so your night vision will set in and you can easily see your meal and the person sitting across from you. Until then use the mini flash lights or the light from you cell phone. The dim light avoids rubber necking at the patrons around you and eyeballing their man, girl, and food. You have to actually look at, talk, and listen to the person that you came to the restaurant with, what a concept. Do not bring a grenade to this affair as you will be hurting. This dime eye candy action. You can barely see the people sitting at the tables around you, all you see are shadows. The True purpose and setting of a speakeasy duh............. This is not some entertainment ride or want to be speakeasy, as my wife said this is the True deal.  I found the place very romantic with a little bit of curiosity and mystery. My wife was very surprised by the door hide at the entrance. This made for a fun evening and met my expectations. Though the price is moderate $100 for two (includes one alcohol drink for each, meals for two, and one shared desert) the location, food, and ambience is not equivalent. However, you are paying to be in a speakeasy (private club) therefore, you should expect a higher price for everything in order to keep out the riff raff. If I had to explain that to you before you understood how a speakeasy works this place is not for you. Stick with olive garden or some other franchise Italian restaurant.   My wife and I will definitely return to this restaurant with adult friends and look forward to our next trip there. I hope that this helps all and has some street cred for those of you that can read between the lines. This is not the place to bring anyone that is under the age of 15. Even then I believe that company here is best to keep at the age of 21 and older. Oh not sure about the place on Trop but location on Sahara is good to go.

JkgTYQqbBAUyQCVhq8wlXw.text: The food is not bad, and the portions are sizable, but this has to be the worst and slowest service I have ever received in a restaurant in my life.  As a former waitress, I cut a lot of slack, because I know how busy they can get, but this was so ridiculous it was almost comical!

8Gwt1L5UstesNoj4wSLehw.text: I was really excited to go here after reading all the reviews but was VERRRRY disappointed.    First of all, we had made reservations but when we got there, they were not ready for us- the front door was open so we didn't get to experience the BIG entrance everyone talks about.  Then, it took the hostess forever to find us a seat even though the restaurant was pretty empty.    The ambience of the restaurant which people say are "in keeping with the theme" I feel is kind of an excuse for it being so...... let's just say it's DEFINITELY old vegas.  The food is really heavy and unsettling- there's nothing special about it and it's definitely over-priced for its quality.  To top it all off, our waiter was an a$$.... I really think he was intoxicated, he couldn't pay attention to us when we were ordering and kept forgetting things...   SOOOOO not worth the drive from the strip...

5UVuf_2qSNPNloddo780yA.text: Went there for birthday celebration -- party of eight.  All of us are locals and qualified for the Tuesday night buy one get one free promotion.  Getting in was fun with the speakeasy entrance but then...  Being steered to our table in a very dark place we were seated and began ordering drinks.  It was so dark that mini flashlights were attached to menus.  Food was average, service not so much.  We asked for an extra bread basket and, reluctantly, they placed an empty breadbasket on the table.  The price was not as advertised; instead they took $10 off each meal.  After carefully calculating the receipt the next day (because it was way too dark to read it at Capo's), I discovered we overpaid $19.70.  Also, I asked the waiter to include the tip and he kindly awarded himself 20% -- a little high for the service received.  Sadly, I will not return.  The idea is terrific and it could be fun, except for what I have mentioned above.  Also, I guess I am concerned about what it looks like when the lights are on.

AwsVQRqlcrVXNaSAWIN1aQ.text: Went to Capos on 5/5/11.   Had absolutely terrible service.  There were not many customers at the time.  Had to ask several times to get the basics.  We will not go back  Contacted the owner, didnt get anywhere.

2Tp9Syqdejae_ppkoPPgug.text: Capo's has always been one of my favorites until my last visit.  I was disappointed to find that when we got our check that pasta no longer comes with entrees that used to be a part of the meal (which I thought was weird at an Italian restaurant).  We felt like the server scammed us into purchasing $5 sides of pasta with our meal by asking us what we wanted as is if it came with the dish.  I told the manager that this was upsetting, and all he said was "sorry"... and I'm upset that I will not return to my favorite Italian joint.

-8zB8Zt80AStJYiT4b4dFg.text: The service definitely good.I have to go for an second time. Just an good place with good food. hands down.Off the street of Tropicana.

vIyr5tYcIBL4NbVfsLEc0w.text: If you have no class and enjoy the Olive Garden, then this place is up your alley.  But if you know anything about True Italian food, this place will make you want to shoot yourself with one of the faux-Godfather props on the wall.  Capos Italian restaurant makes me never want to come back to Las Vegas.  Nonsense, overpriced, mafia - themed chicken parmesan.  It's no more italian than the Italy section of Epcot in Disneyworld.  Also, I get that the old speakeasy's had dim lighting... but when I have to use a flashlight to read my menu... COME ON.  Lame.  There is NOTHING authentic about this place, and the food is way overpriced.   AVOID THIS PLACE

-lFVNrbSh9PToS7qstYesQ.text: This was one of our most fun dinner experiences in Vegas. We took a cab from the Bellagio and the restaurant seems to be off the beaten path. When we arrived (slightly on the early side for dinner bc we had a Cirque show to catch) the lot was empty and not a soul in site. When we entered, it was dark and the front door was locked so we rang the buzzer. Quickly a speak easy opened to our right and an Italian chap said, "state your business"...fumbling over our words we managed to spit out "we would like to have dinner if you're open". He slams the window shut and minutes later the front door opens and he says, "follow me". We had no idea this was part of their shtick. It was so dark inside that our eyes were having a hard time adjusting. Once they did, we immediately felt like we were tossed back into the good ole brat pack days. There was a gentleman singing Sinatra and Martin songs. The good was great. We ordered Caesar Salad, carbonara, and their meatballs which were the best we've had. Ask about the cooking process and you'll understand why. Great sangria too. The service was incredibly attentive. We've sent many people here and they too all love the shtick at the door as well as the food and ambiance. Well worth the cab ride over.

cnI9Em_hngK4prMO4cz4Qw.text: The boy took me here on our 2nd date. I loved the atmosphere. From the moment you walk in the door till the moment you leave the place gives you a feel like you are in the middle of an Italian mob movie. I liked how it was dark in there it really set the mood, and the little lights connected to your menu to see it better. I loved it. We got there a bit late and were the only ones in the place which was fine. The service was exceptional. He ordered a captain and coke which tasted like a glass of captain and a drop of coke (always good). First came the bread and the garlic butter that came with it was what made the bread awesome, it would have been nothing special with out it. Then the salads, I got the house salad with Italian dressing. It was honestly the best house salad ever, it had marinated tomatoes and artichoke hearts on it and the dressing was incredible. I ordered Uncle Pauly's Arrabiata, just the right amount of spicy for a pasta dish. I loved it. He ordered the Alfredo and bragged about how awesome it was all night.

DxnJm-ngMQ0KYzv4D_Z_DQ.text: My friend and I booked this place for our boyfriend's birthdays. It was funny being greeted from a different door than we thought. We got a semi-private table away from the main floor. The food was amazingly reasonable for what I thought it would be. And super delicious. Fantastic ambiance with the singer walking around singing Sinatra all night. The staff was top shelf, not stuck up, not pushy, and friendly even when we were a little tipsy and being silly. The lighting is low and romantic. I highly recommend this place!!

v0Rn3LMRrNMxtArDbOlcgg.text: Great experience.  Everybody should at least visit this place once.  A reservation is a must as we went on Christmas Eve and they were very busy but able to work us in with only a short wait.  We had an excellent waitress.  The food was great. The meatballs are a must.  We really enjoyed the singer and atmosphere.  Will definitely be back.

KHc56zNTP7K5XSNJtJuKdw.text: Great food, Great concept. Very friendly staff. Tops my list of best italian restaurants in town. I've never had anything that I didnt enjoy. A great place to take friends or family.

kNHbt4Nfv3QgoIH7uf_gLg.text: Normally, this place would get 5 stars from me. But I have to give less because of the service and my dish. I took out of town family here after raving about it. I tried calling several times for reservations only to be HUNG UP ON TWICE. When we get to the restaurant without reservations on a Saturday at 5pm, we were treated like crap and was recommended to sit at the bar instead. (My sister made sure he knew we tried to call ahead.) We gladly sat at the bar since we were starving, but had to wait forever for our food. It was not crowded yet, but I think our server forgot to put in our entire order. One dish out of three was ready and served. We could see our possible lasagna dish ready from where we sat, but the third dish wasn't. When one of the cooks looked at a ticket, he said "f***" out loud and then we heard him say chicken Parmesan which was our third dish. By the time I got my dish, my pasta was cold and undercooked. I didn't not return my food because 1) it had already taken FOREVER to get the dish and  2) I was hungry and didn't want to wait any longer. I just didn't eat the pasta, but I let our server know of my displeasure. She just said "okay" and walked off.  Not pleased at all.

S5iAYZTBgNW72wOqem8JRg.text: Ask for Jeanine!! She was so sweet. Gave us first timers great recommendations. My husband said it was the best Italian cooking after his own Nonna.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tortellini special with sausage
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lamb &amp; mushroom risotto..Delicious
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6r3M-oUdmCmRREyLVLzViQ.text: This is one of the best places I've been to. From the beginning,  the waitress, the food was amazing, the wine, and dessert. Definitely will go back!! If you haven't tried it you're missing out!

GpNCkiGStQyVPogIAANs9Q.text: What an amazing find off The Strip! I can't believe I have not been here before. I was looking for a unique dining experience for a special birthday and Capo's delivered. From the outside it may look unassuming and in a strip mall across the street from a bunch of dealerships. Inside though, is a speak easy joint reminiscent of the mob days in Vegas. Secret passwords, secret doors, and a guy with a heavy Italian accent-I love it! You walk in and it is dark, but like intimate and cozy kind of dark. Fresh lobster tank in the front after the secret door when you walk in, bar with a full staff making drinks to the right, and escorted to my table by a wonderful gentleman who was professional and was a no frills kind of guy. Was very efficient in getting the groups and couples coming in for dinner right away. We sat in a cozy black velvet booth and there was a piano man singing Dean Martin's, "Luck Be a Lady". Wonderful singing. He said hello to the crowd and got to my table and dedicated a song once he found out it was for a birthday. Sang "Unforgettable". Classy.   The servers were absolutely friendly, knowledgeable, and prompt. Ordered the cheese bread and calamari for appetizers. The cheese bread comes in 4 or 8 pieces. Server recommended the 8 pieces, so we went for it. The cheese bread comes out piping hot with a thick layer of melty cheese on a well seasoned thick bread. Served with a side of marinara sauce. So good! The calamari was tender, lightly breaded and served with lemon slices and a red dipping sauce. Not greasy and really tasty. For the main entree, ordered the spaghetti and meatball and Fettecini Alfredo with chicken. The chicken costs extra, but was worth it. It was grilled and was a good size in proportion to the dish itself. I also had the Faggoli soup which was light and tasty.  Portions are great. Sharable really, but it's so good you may not to or you could take the rest to go. You get one very big meatball for the spaghetti dish and it was vey moist, flavorful, and delicious. The fettuccine Alfredo with chicken was rich, creamy, and buttery. Went well with the glass of wine. There was even a magician that performed some magic at our table too! Was very talented and engaging. Heard about a magician at the restaurant, but did not believe it. So we got a dinner and a show-loved it!  Overall, this place is a hit! Service is exceptional, food is solid Italian classic, and the whole experience is just outstanding. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front sign.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side sign.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatball.

dcZKgYNsTd0KZ91H69RW5g.text: We went there last month for our anniversary.  We had gone there last year and the food was great so we decided to go back again.  The food has changed and is not as good as it was.  We ordered garlic bread and found it came in slices with melted cheese on it.  I had ordered eggplant Parmesan.  Eggplant Parmesan is typically made in thin slices of eggplant, with sauce and cheese on top - this came rolled up with a dollop of sauce and then cheese.  I didn't finish my meal and ended up leaving it.  The next day we went to Roma Deli II on Spring Mountain.  it was wonderful!  We won't be going back to Capo's.

kDdCWYCBe68iTeJ-CsPEtA.text: Honestly one of the best experience I had in awhile. The ambience was great, the service was adequate, and the food was superb.   At first you're kind of confused as to how to enter but as soon as you press the door bell you are greeted by someone through a secret window and enter through a secret door. Already started off with a bang! Our server was Brandon. Highly suggest asking for him, he was super funny and very attentive. The food came out within perfect times. Didn't feel overwhelmed whatsoever.   Highly suggest trying their calamari, it melts in your mouth and the sauce isn't overwhelming. I ordered there spaghetti and meatballs, which is what their known for. Their tomato sauce is truly one of a kind. Though I wasn't fond of the meatball because of the rosemary, everyone else at my table thought it was fantastic.   We came for my step dad's birthday. I told the host earlier in the evening we have a celebrant. At the end we ordered the dessert and the live singer sung happy birthday which really topped it off. The homemade cannoli's are to die for!!!!! As soon as I finished I wanted more. Overall the experience was great and everyone there is so welcoming. For sure coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zvGdFh5xNijkmFlPqAQusQ.text: Wonderful atmosphere and delicious Italian food.  The experience was so much fun.  The meatballs are delicious and the mushroom risotto was the best I've ever had.  Highly recommended! The staff are also very fun. Can't wait to return next time I'm in Vegas.

dobIqZCJev545zckWDnJvg.text: I love the ambiance of this place so much. From the decor to the sinatra lounge singer, it's everything I would want to experience in vegas! The food is good, and portions are generous. Our favorite was the meatballs! Service was great and attentive. We had a magician come by who wowed the table too!  My only gripe was being served wine in a warm wine glass fresh out of the machine. I also think that the wine list could use a little improvement...there are better wines to compliment the good food!   All in all though, this is still one of my favorite places to visit when I come into town!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Humongous, delicious meatballs!

iCRver0PpLWN5aVhjHLjHA.text: Was FINALLY able to give this Vegas favorite a try. Had heard nothing but rave reviews from friends and family alike. There for a friend's Roaring Twenties themed birthday celebration, the whole secret entrance element made it feel that much more authentic. Being a girl who loves her high heels, it was a bit difficult to adjust to the darkness of the space *whilst* walking to my table. I pretty much had to go on faith that the floor was even and no table or chair legs were sticking out. I wasn't entirely lucky, as I twisted my ankle slightly when there was a change in the floor right as we were entering our private room. This may need to be addressed. Perhaps the host can provide a small light as we follow them?   Aside from that mishap, I adored the restaurant. The atmosphere was lovely. I enjoyed the added movie entertainment in our room. The food was DELICOUS! I ordered the Nico Caesar with chicken. It was good. The chicken was cooked perfectly. Not something that happens all the time in salads. I also sampled the fried ravioli. Amazing! As well as the lava cake which was divine!  Our server was very pleasant. A bit disheveled at times, but he made it work.  I thoroughly enjoyed my overall experience. I look forward to returning to try more!

NU-zdxOk2D54jORozzskZw.text: Good concept, and really wonderful ambience. Really enjoyed the Frank Sinatra-esk singer during our meal and the service was excellent. I will say the food was just so so. My chicken piccata was VERY lemony. All in all the food tastes a bit like olive garden and it was a bit too pricey for that. But I did however really enjoy the red sauce. Nice place to go if looking for a unique experience off the strip.

9uB5zfRdjn3wJiW_H3aTyQ.text: Met friends visiting from Washington State at Capo's Speakeasy restaurant on Sahara for dinner and since they were traveling with another couple they wanted to have a fun, unique evening. As we had been there previously with them and had a wonderful meal and a great time we thought sharing the experience would be fun, and we knew what to expect, or so we thought. You enter the establishment thru a "hidden" door and the experience begins. The atmosphere is very Rat Pack, "mob themed" and is kitschy, but not kitschy in a tacky way. The decor is very dark and moody, and there are several booths if you are looking for a romantic mood. Everyone in our group ordered drinks, wine and appetizers and we sat back enjoying each other's company and listening to a live piano player playing Rat Pack songs. (There had been no live entertainment the first time we went here, so we were very happy). After our soup & salad were served, the most charming young man came up to the table and performed close up magic tricks! He goes by the name of "The Magic of V", and using cards, coins and simple rubber bands he amazed us while waiting for our entrees.  I had the "Angels with Dirty Faces", which is Angel hair pasta with peas, mushrooms & pepperoni,  tossed with Capo's pink sauce, and I added an Homemade Italian "Meatless" Meatball, that you couldn't tell the difference. Ed had the "Gotti's Chicken Angelo" Chicken breast sauteed with artichoke hearts, roasted red potatoes & mushrooms in a lemon white wine sauce. It was fantastic! We did take home a "Jimmy Two Times" Tiramisu, as we're so full...Tonight with coffee after dinner Ed & I will share it. All the dinner portions were so generous, that none of us really felt like desert, but who turns down homemade Tiramisu! Capo's is a can't miss spot for taking visitors, and a for a romantic night out with your favorite someone. Worth making reservations, worth every penny we spent!

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Angels with Dirty Faces&#34;, with an added Capo&#39;s Homemade Italian &#34;Meatless&#34; Meatball and the &#34;Gotti&#39;s Chicken Angelo&#34;.
