VV2n_pR4kRI15qedPQPFjA.text: This place is the greatest!  Being Italian and finding something that compares to home cooking... this is the place. I take all my family and friends here that come to Vegas. Being a local myself when you need to entertain and not cook Homemade Italian food, this this the place.  BTW. ALL NEED TO MAKE RESERVATIONS! And at least a few days in advance. Or they may turn you away. Not because 'they are rude" but because they want to treat you in the manner you are accustomed to. This place is ALWAYS packed. You will nor regret it.   Manga!$

sQUNucft6zX7GwGDhtGW5Q.text: AMAZING food. Authentic Italian. Dark and intimate ambience.  Truly plays the speakeasy theme.  Service is on point, staff is knowledgeable their food menu and wine list. Engaging staff. Overall a great fun spot. Would recommend and will be back.

Ypo_J2MjVgrBecuMJYZ8LQ.text: I love the interior here and foods amazing! I didn't really like the service at all...  When I came in for lunch, they sat only my me and my granny at a table for 6 in the center of the dinning. Which I thought was weird since everyone else were sat at the booths.   Before I even sat down, the guy asked me if I'm here on a voucher. No? So he made us feel like we we couldn't afford eating here without a voucher. Whatever I still looked up that voucher though and bought it since he mentioned it hehe! Then servers were only attending the people around us and we felt like we were being ignored. I had to give them a pissed off eye to order from them. My grandmas visiting from Shanghai and she asked me if they were being rude to us because we're Chinese! That made me furious.   I ordered the spaghetti and carbonara and both were amazing! The garlic salad also was good and had a nice cream dressing. After we starting eating, I noticed we didn't get a bread basket? Everyone else did but not us.   I asked the guy if we had to buy a bread basket or something and he told me it's by request. IVE NEVER HEARD OF THIS BEFORE. Especially from an Italian restaurant. I've been to $$$$ Italian places and never have I ever had to ask for a bread basket. It's like going to a Korean restaurant and requesting banchan.   I honestly love the food here but the service really made it a bad time for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic salad
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with meatball. So good!
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara lunch special

XWcsMSKnqF_IN0PxWf0z-A.text: Went to Las Vegas this last weekend and was craving some Italian food. My husband and I began searching for some Italian food restaurants nearby and Capos Italian cuisine stood out because of its good ratings. Let me tell you the ratings should be higher! The restaurant gives you a whole experience. It was like an Italian gangsta type of scene lol and we loved it! The servers were great and had an awesome accent, there was live music, and the food was just amazing. I got the Scarface pasta which was one of the best pastas that I have ever had. It was so rich in flavor! And the Cesar salad was also great. I will definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who is visiting Vegas!

4ooB-y5ZQRrvsk5x6wmddQ.text: This place is great! Very similar to The Safe House in Milwaukee, WI. You enter in the back of the building and have to ring a doorbell. You need a password to get in the building through a secret door. Everyone inside can see you on the TV. Very Old Italian Mafia atmosphere. The staff was fantastic. The lasagna and sausage and peppers were amazing. The meatballs are a must and so worth it! There was live music. And you leave through a side door. This place is a drive from the strip and an awesome local hideaway.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna

SuD1SK5Ze2ZeiAPQcRz53A.text: Venture off the strip for this unique Vegas experience!  Capo's was such a fun and unique restaurant; I can't say enough good things about it. You need reservations and you also need a password to get in. We emailed about a reservation and got a response within hours to 'text AuntieG, she'll hook you up.'  Not going to lie - I was intimidated!  But I did it and that's where the amazing service and experience began. AuntieG texted me to confirm a time and to give me my password  We arrived and were greeted by a little sliding window. We stated our name, gave our password and we were welcomed in like family. We waited a few minutes to get our seat (AuntieG told us to arrive a little later than our original time to ensure a great seat.) We were seated with a fantastic server and amazing food followed. They are known for their meatballs - order them!!  The pasta fagioli soup - delicious. The live music was inviting and added to the ambiance. As far as dress, some folks were super dressy, some were casual - it's whatever you are feeling.  Do I suggest flip flops?  Probably not. We were texted a few days after our visit to ensure we had a great time. Go here. Go out on a ledge and experience the mob/speakeasy style!  You won't be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6J7ddv_HiHpyNVMrfewX1A.text: Had the New York strip, huge portions and the best steak I had on our trip. The atmosphere is what makes the place great for me!

hJshNnC-nZgfpridkEan2w.text: Capo's is such a treat from the food to the ambiance it's a must visit in Las Vegas!  I have been told of Capo's by several friends and family so when I finally moved here it was one of my first restaurants to try.  It gets quite busy here on any given night so reservations are a great idea! Don't forget to ask for the password. The entrance is on the back side of the restaurant right by the parking lot. Once you enter be prepared to share the password! Once inside it was like stepping into a different world. The restaurant is dimly lit with live entertainment (jazz singer) and smells deliciously of authentic Italian food.  My party of 3 did not have a reservation, so we had a seat at the bar. The bartender was very prompt and friendly. She made great drinks as well.   I started with the house salad with homemade Italian dressing, it was great! The dressing was very obviously homemade. On a future visit I would love to try a dinner/entree salad.  We were served warm bread with butter... yummy and great starter to the saucy meals.  My party and I were for warned that the portions are huge. With that advice I split Da Don's lasagna with my fiance and we still left with 1/2 of the lasagna. Which by the way was great reheated at home the next day. The lasagna was simply delicious! Great sauce, lots of cheese and nuggets of Italian sausage in between really satisfied our Italian craving!  We enjoyed the sauce so much we purchased some to take home. They have two varieties traditional and spicy. We purchased both and they run $7 a jar.  I am looking forward to visiting capo's again and trying more of their delicious food!

BkMS3WAudU4Es8NZZNbL8A.text: Great fun atmosphere, great food and great service. What more could you want from a restaurant ? Whether you sit at a table and listen to the live lounge singers do the classics or sit at the bar and watch the kitchen create the dishes it's always entertaining and lively there.

SfGhpiOvOYUhZw0LbWVjiw.text: Food = good  Service = fine  Ambience  = great.   Why 2 star?  I spend $243 and they charges me an $8 sharing charge after appetizers and drinks.   What the Hell is that?

LV98d66zUBz2K2YS4Ztx2g.text: After reading the reviews, I had to give Capo's a try. When you arrive you're greeted "speak easy" style. The place was very dimly lit and had a real mob atmosphere. Like stepping back in time. The hosts were wearing shiny Italian suits which really added to the mystique. Since I didn't have reservations I sat at the bar which was right next to the grill so I got to watch the meals being prepared. Great show. The food was some of the best Italian I've had. I ordered chicken piccata and it was delicious. Two breasts perfectly cooked and the sauce was freshly made. I know. I was watching. If you get a chance, try it. Capo's doesn't disappoint.

BLX3YVF-8BZik0Otyut5ew.text: This is probably the best Italian food in Vegas!  Food, music, service and ambiance all excellent.  Speakeasy feel and old Vegas charm.  Our waitress went out of her way to make our experience out of this work!  Don't miss out!

U_wsUjGiBcwvS2OduJaJHA.text: This place is dark and mysterious:-)Its a speakeasy and has an unexpected entrance. I ordered the veal parm and it was on point with just the right amount of food. Service was great and they had excellent wine recommendations. We went as a group but this place is the perfect spot for couples.

B0GiUSBtTmyiQ0D7Mj_WVg.text: The food was amazing. We had reservations for 6 people but at the last minute ended up with eight people. Capo's had no problem whatsoever with giving us a larger table. Service was excellent and the food was even better. Would definitely recommend Capo's to anyone who visits Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye and chicken marsala
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So much good food to choose from. Tough to decide.
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect dinner. Perfect evening.

cqofC8zZMG8uXwF303D4IQ.text: I will never recommend any other Italian restaurant in Vegas.  Amazing atmosphere, better food!  Simply amazing.

KX5Bfj6oOhd_qOMW04nzVA.text: Got the Racketeers Ravioli with pesto sauce ALL the food was absolutely amazing. A little pricey but you definitely get what you pay for. I'll be dining here every time I'm in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o5j2z7cj3cOqWePrPdJo2g.text: I was here a few months ago with a Groupon lunch special it was just okay. The atmosphere was great and so was the service it was just too dark for me. Also it's cool that they have a peep hole going on but not cool when my guests from the UK came and wanted to to try the place but they got turned down???

YjZA3cmAzaXG8uEjr_JfAQ.text: Best ravioli with meat sauce!  Cool vibe with dark ambiance. Friendly waitress.  Even the homemade salad dressing was a 10!

fDD5XVQ1eNQVQlvdZNqcng.text: Yep the best new hidden gem I've found. Seen someone post about this place on FB. Worth every penny. Ring the door bell to the entrance. Environment is classy old school LV. Food is delicious. Like I said worth every penny. Our server was awesome to. We didn't have a reservation and sat at the bar. Great time! Judith is the best! Very attentive!

_SHFpKrMLd4l7cYTpsQjbQ.text: Our party of 6 thoroughly enjoyed the food, atmosphere and service at Capo's. We were never rushed, although it was a busy night there. All servers were extremely knowledgeable and a pleasure. My only critique would be to place floor lights in the walkways. Although Capo's has very low lighting, they do have lights on the menu's. Restaurants like Capo's Restaurant and Speakeasy are what make Vegas a popular destination.

EG1TCwqf1ZPtiXFXYFdyHg.text: Poor response time to the door. The waitress did great but was understaffed. The food was less than average and bland. The environment was very sexy and casual. Too bad the food wasn't better because the venue has real potential.

photos.caption: Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Capo's Italian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great atmosphere

Y3otCb7G39aM7vwiEKLaEg.text: Love love love! Great food, wonderful service, and beautiful setting. You can taste that each meal is made with love and is truly authentic (to me at least). Doesn't taste anything like your regular chain Italian restaurant. The service is by far the absolute best. Everyone is very professional and friendly. My water glass was never empty for more than five minutes. Constantly checking up on you just to see how you like your food. Setting wise, it's great. It's dark inside, but that's the whole point. If you can't see the menu, use the flashlight that comes with it. There's a gentleman by the piano singing at dinner time. I thought he was lip syncing because it sounded so lovely. He's actually singing though. I go every time I'm in Vegas.   Tip: It is better to make reservations online because they get very busy at dinner time.

7CYGCkTUKEoAxiuLeRKb8w.text: We had our wedding reception here last spring.  We had the best time!  Janeen was amazing getting everything ready.  Great food & drinks & Bobby our singer was outstanding!  Great music to dance to.  Very old Vegas vibe.  No other place like it.  Our favorite spot in Vegas!  We're planning on having our 1st year anniversary dinner there soon.

-jd1i4Afis1g6GU1L6XDlA.text: Absolutely loved it!  Enter through the back door and then ring the bell. Someone will come to the window and you need to give the password and you will be let in through the secret entrance. The inside is very dark (flashlights are provided to read the menu) and the decor is reminiscent of an old speakeasy used by Wise Guys. A friend recommended this place and we came here to celebrate my son's birthday.  The singer sang a song just for him. This place is definitely not afraid of garlic or butter! The food was oh so amazing! Come hungry because the portions are huge.  Would be a great place for a date night or a celebration with friends and family. Make reservations ahead of time so you won't be disappointed.

O8qd65QK_VT6hPm25SlFCw.text: Great food. Terrible service. I have been to this restaurant a few times... this is my first review. The food and ambiance is great. The service and welcome you receive here is just sad. I tried calling to make reservations here earlier the same day. I was greeted with "Capos." After I inquired about reservations the gentleman who answered the phone said "We're all booked up." Then just hung up the phone. No apology or offering another day or time. Just straight up hung up on me. I love the food here... but they need to replace or re-train their staff. Sadly disappointed

nWWBck0o4j9aZ6pLxeR2uA.text: Food was Amazing!! Service was 5 star. Great atmosphere. Highly recommend! Best Calamari & Lasagna I've ever had!! We'll definitely make it a regular stop when were in town.

T8c3h3O4vHyXmiWixn96YQ.text: They should change their name to CRAPO'S!  If it was possible to give this place 0 Stars to negative stars, I would!  To start with, we were really excited for this place.  Especially me!  It was my birthday.  We get greeted at the door and it was really cool. Very speak easy style which was the only good thing that happened.  We get sat right in front.  At 705.  We didn't receive menus till 20 minutes of sitting there.  Right after she hands us the menu, she wanted us to right then order our drink without looking at the menu.  We said give us a minute to look over the menu.  A minute doesnt mean 15 minutes.  At this point we almost walked out.  As we were about to get up she comes over and asks if we are ready to order.  We decided that maybe we will stay.  We saved our glasses of wine for our dinner.  When we get our dinner, we asked for pepper flakes from our waitress.  We didn't see her for another 10 minutes.  At this point we were done!!!  I go to the maiter'd to have a manager come to our table.  Our waitress comes over to see us and says they didn't bring you pepper flakes, I'll be right back. She brings the pepper flakes and then 2 minutes later a "manager" (You are no manager). A guy dressed in a server outfit comes to our table.  He apologizes and does nothing to help the situation.  All he did was comp off the glasses of wine we didn't touch because we wanted to drink it while we ate... Which we never did.  They boxed our food and we left.  Our waitress only got 10% tip due to the fact that I know she has to probably tip out other people.  They don't need to suffer for her lack of work.  As for the so called manager... You sir, if you are a manger, needs to figure out how to make this restaurant work.  I think your lack of customer service is a problem.  I believe re-training people and Truely understand how to make your guest feel special is key.  Especially on special occasions.

Ai7_jAbleIKVVWmf68Gm8Q.text: My son came here with a group of friends for Homecoming. He has food allergies and the staff was very understanding and helpful. When I picked him up from the dance he went into great detail about his meal here. Thank you for giving my son a great experience Capo's!!

WWXX9Tj9pCnL5zG4c0As5A.text: Great food and an amazing experience. The only thing that was a bit annoying was that we had to wait a while to get our check. Our server was no where to be found when the dinner was ending. Luckily the experience was so amazing it didn't take away from the night and out server was apologetic and hold us she was helping in the kitchen. When with my family and each is us got something  different. Everyone's plate was amazing!  High recommend!

36BbGy_KKalLlOa5B04AAw.text: My favorite place to bring visitors from out of town! From the entrance to the atmosphere, to the desert, it is a unique experience. Big portions and great food..! The Tiramisu is the best I have ever had and I have tried it all over the county. Warning, they usually sell out of it sometime during the evening so you might want to put a hold on some when you get there! For locals that are doing the "tour guide" experience for friends or family, this is a must go on your list..!!

laOKAFqjpKxR29JgNVKAOA.text: This place was amazing!  Totally lives up the hype! Love the secret door, the Frank Sinatra singer and the awesome magician that came around made our night!  OUR FOOD WAS AMAZING!  The steak was off the hook and the creamy italian dressing was unreal! I can't wait to come back to Vegas and eat here again!  Thanks Capo's you guys rock!

J3uG5DYZKSmtAgJc3_oyrQ.text: Amazing!  Trying something new!   The atmosphere is super fun. The food is delish the staff is fun and playful. New favorite Italian restaurant in town. Brandon was awesome!

YsJDulKTw4sM_hwJRH4q1w.text: This is such a cool joint with old time vibe. As you enter you have to have a password to get in and the place is dark!  So dark that the menus have flashlights attached. The night we were there they had live singing, lots of Frank and Dean. Our food and drinks were fantastic. I had the Nico, two of my party had the Sucker Punch, and another had Mad Dog Manhattan. Everyone was happy with these. Our server recommended the meatball appetizer as they are "known" for them; you get two large meatballs served in their sugo sauce with peppers. These were flavorful and large enough for a party of four to share.  Entrees for the table included Eggplant Parmesan, the Alfredo, and the sausage and peppers (appetizer). All came with a salad (dressings were good). I loved the fact that with the eggplant you could order a side of risotto instead of pasta. The eggplant was good, but the risotto was amazing. Throw in some shrimp and I would want it for an entree!  Fun place, will definitely visit again.

n1PO7egPT0xZGRyiCWzYyg.text: I want to start off with the bad here and work my way up to the better stuff so this review ends on a good note. When you walk in there is this smell thay you just can't get passed I don't know if they are having some sort of plumming issues or what but there was a foul smell of body odor or urine and it was very unappealing and a bit hard to get out of my head. The singer has a great voice but the music is fairly loud and makes it difficult to carry on a conversation. It's dark and I understand that goes to the allure of the speakeasy theme but the lights on the menu are so bright that it really blinds you and makes it hard to read anything on the menu. The magician that came to the table put on a nice show but being that I was on a first date and he was a little sexual with my date made her feel uneasy and I think ruined the mood setting which wasn't very fun but he did do some cool illusions I will give him that. The food was great I really have no complaints in that regard I had the chicken anastasia which I would recommend to anyone that visits. I loved how They played off the mob theme at the door with the password and peephole and again the singer was great but just much to loud for a romantic setting the ambiance is nice and the decor is very fitting. I do not think I will be coming back I just can't get over that smell it was really awful but for the food alone I will give at least the two stars.

rAqZ8cA7pgrc9ajHEbj2qQ.text: Absolutely amazing! We bought a Groupon and it was only valid at lunch, so we stayed for dinner anyway. It was 2 for 1 Tuesday,  so glad we did! Will return soon.

jOUTnxnFD1VQs0xpvdrlrQ.text: I have been in Las Vegas a little over a week and this was the best meal I had so far. I like the atmosphere here and our waiter was exactly on point. I had the pasta Primavera and it was delicious. Will return, if only or the service.

Mf6XA1uM-QxiC2oeerTgOQ.text: This was one of our stops on a girls weekend and we had the most amazing time here! The staff was awesome and beyond friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is one of a kind. Now, the food exceeded my expectations. The stuffed mushrooms are to die for! I ordered a penne dish that was absolutely delicious and the portion was huge! I will definitely be returning when I'm back in town.

Mba6srQMhdITl-zSaBP7kw.text: I ate here a second time today. The food was even better. My favorite Italian food I've had in the city. I went with someone else going for the first time, and they agreed with that assessment as well.

RfeDIXuHyFfTF5QYpjK7CA.text: My brother and his girlfriend picked this place to celebrate my birthday and I was so happy they did! I love the Mob history and delicious pasta, which is exactly what they have! We were a table of 5 and were seated at the booth, with a lot of room area. The food was so good. We got fried calamari and a spicy sausage as our appetizers and then each got their own plate. I got the Vinnie's al vodka w/ a meatball and it was just so so so good! I love a meatball that cuts so easily and soft. The pasta had so much flavor. Our server, Jeanie was attentive and sweet. We had a great time and will definitely be back for the 2 for 1 Tuesdays! =)

v6CRFDrPngB4QTo9t6lASw.text: The food was AMAZING!!! Seriously - I am a Chef so I can Be critical- we had the Scampi and Caprese appetizers-excellent- then the wine list was nice and affordable-We had The Chicken Marsla which was outstanding and my wife loved her Cheese Raviolis- the Creme Brule was fantastic as well!

ruIrbXuvVoRxmfPS6EOCDw.text: Great place to check out when your in Vegas!  It is a few min. off the strip but fun and different.  The food was amazing True Italian flavor!  The service was great with a cool look and feel to the restaurant.

xD6jJiJR4X3o_uLJHMv3jg.text: I loved the ambience of this place.  Walking up, I thought my boyfriend was trying to take me to a strip joint because there are no windows on the building. Who doesn't love being greeted with "you got any weapons on you?" When walking into a restaurant?  The food was decent, but the real draw of the place is the ambience and the nightly entertainment.  I didn't care much for sitting next to a couple of rude drunks insulting their "dates" culture all night, but Capo's can't be blamed for that. I will definitely return the next time I'm in Vegas.

YDC9tpKuqAzsM9mSPnnZ_w.text: Have been to Capos a few times now, and have always thoroughly enjoyed the visit. If you cannot find your way in, it's the door with the big C on round back. Love the speakeasy entrance, host and all. The mob theme is a little overdone. Love the singer and the ambiance. Service was excellent, except he never did come back with the Parmesan cheese. The food won't win any awards but it was filling and tasty. I did enjoy my mushroom risotto. Everyone enjoyed the food, just perhaps didn't love it. It's great for locals with the twoferone Tuesdays, and great to bring visitors for a fantasy prohibition era Vegas night out.

3bId04qAOhZbKJfhU9dskg.text: I. LOVE. THIS. PLACE! The food and service are incredible! I especially love their deal for locals on Tuesdays!

HFmXQvQHn5ykHRQsjpsG4A.text: Dinner was amazing!! We came for restaurant week- $30 for a 3 course dinner! Started with the stuffed mushrooms, then the spaghetti and meatball, and a cannoli for dessert. I've never ordered spaghetti at a restaurant and I am so glad I changed it up, because the meatball and sauce were to die for. We sat at the bar and our server/bartender was great. At the end of the meal the GM Dominic bought us a round of drinks to top it off. Between the ambiance, hospitality, and amazing food and drinks you would be crazy to not come back!

7W_61QFiyS9K5t-8jjIpeA.text: I was concerned about food quality given the kitschy theme & location but everything was really delicious.  We will definitely go back.  I loved the added entertainment value for the 21st birthday we were celebrating but it left me wanting more.  If the waitresses were in character similar to the host that would be the icing on the cake.    Great choice for a celebration, fun Vegas restaurant or honestly for a great meal. We were really glad we went.  The 21 somethings at our table thought it was a cool choice as well. Just 10 min from our hotel at the Mirage.   I recommend asking for an extra sauce on the side.  The alfredo, creamy garlic & marinara were awesome & the bread dips very well indeed.

pquvcmh_oYZW7nlDyJu_JQ.text: Now Ive never been to this location, but the original venue closed down. It disappointed me because the very first location was entertaining & classic. I know this place has live music too though. This fun mob italian place has huge portions! The people are nice & seem to know their menu. My pasta was delicious with lots of different italian toppings. Calamari plate itself would be good for 4 people. My boyfriend & I's bill was also good enough for 4 people (or more) LOL. The bread's butter is the best butter ever. It's like a honey butter. Also, beware of strong alcoholic drinks! I recommend this place if its anything like the old venue (Tropicana & Jones). It's a nice get-away from your stereotypical, Italian , mainstream restaurant.

1NM-kof5aQSk-H1_gy1dSQ.text: We were in town for the weekend and went to dinner on a Saturday night. The whole experience was fantastic!   If you don't enjoy themed experiences, or have no sense of humor, you might not enjoy yourself here. It's a little bit irreverent, but totally fun, and very Vegas!  We were taken good care of by all the staff, we had great wine, great service and amazing food.   Their sugo is amazing, I can't stop thinking about it. Order the meatballs and peppers, OMG, I'm drooling just thinking about it!   They had great entertainers, and the personality of everyone there really added to our great time.   Would definitely recommend to friends!

FWLLC9WugGUOFmNXnVndcg.text: I absolutely loved this place! They have great deals on weekdays, especially for locals or ladies. The service is great and everybody jokes around while still being professional. The food is to die for and the portions are huge as well. The atmosphere is one of my favorite things about this place..great date night restaurant! I will definitely suggest this place to my friends and go back myself.
